title: An Act to amend the Penal Code (Corporal Punishment) (Chapter 19)
decision_details: - It has been scientifically proven that physical and psychological abuse caused to a child by corporal punishment is extensive. Therefore, approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-04-29 to amend the Penal Code (Chapter 19) to prohibit the corporal punishment in all spheres and to make provisions for the imposition of punishment for physical abuse. Although the Cabinet of Ministers has previously granted approval to publish the Penal Code (Amendment) Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman for the relevant purpose, in the Government Gazette and present the same in Parliament, it has not been possible to act accordingly. The need for the expeditious enactment of the said Bill has been identified. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter to submit the same to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979 (Corporal Punishment)
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-04-29 to  amend the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No. 15 of 1979 to make provisions for the prohibition of Corporal Punishment in all spheres. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to grant policy approval of the present Cabinet to prepare an amending Bill for the relevant purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparation of the 'Promotion of Breastfeeding' Bill
decision_details: - Sri Lanka ranks among the highest in the world in terms of breastfeeding indicators and has become the first country to be awarded ‘Green Status’ by the World Breastfeeding Trends initiative (WBTi). Approval has been granted by the Cabinet of Ministers on 2018-10-16 to introduce legal provisions through an Act to promote breastfeeding, with the aim of protecting the health and nutrition of children by protecting children from the unethical and harmful effects of the milk powder industry on children for commercial purposes,, protecting breastfeeding as a key intervention that is scientifically proven, and ensuring that the country continues to be recognized as a global leader in breastfeeding. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to grant policy approval of the present Cabinet for the preparation of the relevant Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Formulation of an Act for the establishment of the Matara Cultural and Development Board
decision_details: - Matara has been identified as a city with significant historical, cultural and natural and tourist potential which needs to be conserved and developed for economic and employment benefits of Sri Lankan citizens. Nevertheless, it is observed that these potentials remain underutilized. Accordingly, it has been identified that it is essential to formulate an Act pertaining to the Matara heritage  and development to achieve the expectations of developing the Matara City, sustainably conserving its heritage and modernizing the city. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism; Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing; and the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, to prepare a Bill related to Matara Heritage and Development for Matara city, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Sri Lanka Institute of Architects (SLIA) Law No.1 of 1976
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Institute of Architects, the sole body established in Sri Lanka for the profession of Architecture, its practice and education of Architecture has been incorporated by the provisions of the Sri Lanka Institute of Architects Law, No. 1 of 1976, amended by the Sri Lanka Institute of Architects (Amendment) Act, No. 14 of 1996. In order to cope with the current context of professional practices, the Sri Lanka Institute of Architects has proposed to amend the relevant sections of the Principal Act, “Practice in Architecture and Membership and Use of Titles”. Accordingly, approval has been granted by the Cabinet of Ministers on 2023-04-17 to prepare a Bill for the relevant purpose. As per the said approval, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to grant policy approval of the present Cabinet of Ministers to complete the preparation of the Sri Lanka Institute of Architects (Amendment) Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a new residential building at the Treatment and Rehabilitation Centre for young people with drug addiction
decision_details: - The National Dangerous Drugs Control Board conducts treatment and rehabilitation services for people with drug addiction, under residential and    non-residential community-based models. Under this, a dedicated treatment centre for children and young people below 21 years of age with disabilities arising from drug use disorders is being maintained at Mampitiya Watta, Handessa, Peradeniya. It has been identified that separate treatment services and adequate separate space are essential for the treatment of the relevant persons, paying attention to the psycho-social characteristics of the persons belonging to that age group and their drug use related behaviors. Since the current residential capacity of the relevant Centre is only for 35 persons, it is necessary to maintain a waiting list for admissions. Therefore, the  proposal made by the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs to construct a new residential building in the premises of the Peradeniya Treatment Centre, spending Rs.110 million from the provisions allocated under the Clean Sri Lanka Programme, enabling to expand and expedite treatment opportunities for children and young people with drug addiction, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of Waste Compactor Vehicles for regularizing transport of Waste in Local Authorities
decision_details: - Like many developing countries, solid waste management in Sri Lanka is currently facing many challenges and difficulties. Accordingly, the need to improve the infrastructure required for municipal waste management has been identified. The existing garbage compactors and tractors are used to transport the collected municipal waste in an environmental friendly manner to the treatment sites so as to minimize public impact, and 100 compactors were purchased in the year 2017 using domestic funds for the said purpose. However, it has been observed that the number of such vehicles and the number of vehicles including tractors owned by the Local Authorities are not adequate to manage the amount of waste currently generated. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government to purchase 16 waste compactor vehicles to streamline the collection and transportation of waste in the selected Local Authorities, utilizing the budgetary provisions of Rs. 500 million allocated for the year 2025 under the Clean Sri Lanka Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improving and maintaining the broadcasting activities of the Independent Television Network
decision_details: - The Independent Television Network, which was started as the first television channel in the country, operates as a company with 100% share rights owned by the General Treasury. However, due to the fact that programmes have to be produced using computer accessories and outdated software that are several years old, it has become problematic to broadcast high-quality, attractive programmes while competing in the field. Therefore, taking into account a proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media, the Cabinet decided to allocate the required provisions through the 2026 Budget on a priority basis to secure several essential  accessories for the Independent Television Network, enabling to enhance subscriber attraction and continue telecasting activities without interruption.

title: Allocation of provisions for the projects identified in the industrial and enterprise development sectors
decision_details: - Policy and other decisions required to uplift the existing status of the Small Enterprises Development Division, Industrial Development Board, Lanka Salusala Ltd, Ceylon Ceramics Corporation and the Export Development Board are being implemented with the intervention of those Institutions/divisions and the Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development utilizing the staff, natural resources, machinery and other physical resources of those institutions/divisions. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development to allocate Rs. 100 million from the provisions allocated for the year 2025 under the Sectoral Development Programme of the Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development for the following projects was approved by the Cabinet.* Reality Show Programme organized by the Small Enterprises Development Division.* Industry Expo Exhibition organized by Industrial Development Board.* Pilot project to establish a revolving fund to provide raw materials required for local textile production at subsidized prices.* Providing working capital to the Ceylon Ceramics Corporation.* Purchase of scanners to introduce Advanced Scanner Technology to the inspection yard (Security Checkpoint at Cargo Village) maintained  by the Industrial Development Board at the premises of Bandaranaike International Airport, Katunayake.

title: Preparation of the Master Plan for the Bandaranaike International Airport
decision_details: - Proposals have been invited through the International Competitive Bidding Procedure to select a consultancy firm to prepare the master plan for the Bandaranaike International Airport. After evaluating the said proposals,  Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited has cancelled the relevant contract due to non-adherence to the conditions of the contract by the company that was awarded the contract and resumed the procurement process on the approval of the Cabinet. For the procurement newly invited, only M/s Haskoning DHV Netherland B.V., operating as Netherlands Airport Consultants, has submitted a single proposal. The Cabinet Appointed Consultants Procurement Committee, having evaluated the said proposal has recommended that the relevant consultancy contract be awarded to the above firm. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to award the said procurement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Section IV (from Kurunegala to Dambulla) of the Central 	Expressway
decision_details: - Approval was granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023-03-20 to pay the remaining compensation for land plots acquired for Section IV of the Central Expressway Project (Kurunegala - Dambulla) and for which partial compensation had been paid and to divest land plots for which compensation had not been paid in accordance with the Land Acquisition Act. The physical progress of the land acquisition process for Section IV of the Central Expressway Project is 73.2%. It has been identified that completion of  Section IV of the  Central Expressway is essential to meet the need for a quantitative and qualitative road system to access to the Northern, North Central, Eastern and Central Provinces, and to obtain the expected full benefits of the entire Central Expressway. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to resume the currently suspended land acquisition activities for the future construction work related to the Kurunegala to Dambulla Section of the Central Expressway Project - Section IV, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Faculty of Medicine of the Uva Wellassa University
decision_details: - The Faculty of Medicine of the Uva Wellassa University has been established in accordance with a budget proposal for the year 2023. Accordingly, 80 students have been enrolled so far having utilized and modernized the buildings within the university by using the provisions of Rs. 200 million allocated in that year, and the first and second academic years are under way. However, proper functioning of the said Faculty of Medicine has been hindered due to the fact that the necessary lecture halls, administrative buildings and pre-clinical buildings have not yet been constructed. The cost required to construct the pre-clinical building and the essential administrative building, including the lecture halls, within the Uva Wellassa University premises has been calculated as Rs. 2,149 million. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister, in her capacity as the Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education, to initiate procurement activities within this year and secure  relevant facilities by allocating necessary provisions within the budgetary framework  2026-2028, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Australian Federal Police and the Sri Lanka Police on Combating Transnational Crime and Police Cooperation
decision_details: - Sri Lanka and Australia share common interests in addressing the growing challenges posed by transnational crime including terrorism, cybercrime, drug trafficking, human trafficking, human smuggling and other forms of organized crimes. Therefore, it has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Australian Federal Police and the Sri Lanka Police with the objective of facilitating cooperation in the prevention, investigation, and prosecution of transnational organized crime, promoting coordinated law enforcement operations, strengthening existing cooperation frameworks, enhancing information and intelligence exchange and supporting capacity building and professional development initiatives. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding on Combating Transnational Crime and Police Cooperation between both parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Ratification of the First Phase of the Agreement on Fisheries Subsidies 	of 	the World Trade Organization
decision_details: - The need for a global agreement on regulating fisheries subsidies was affirmed at the 11th Ministerial Conference of the World Trade Organization held in Buenos Aires, Argentina in 2017. Accordingly, the World Trade Organization has concluded the work on the Agreement on Fisheries Subsidies of World Trade Organization at the 12th Ministerial Conference held in 2022. The said Agreement covers three (03) key pillars: the prohibition of subsidies contributing to illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing, prohibition of subsidies for overfished stocks, and the prohibition of subsidies that contribute to overcapacity and overfishing. Member countries of the World Trade Organization has initiated the ratification of Phase I of the Agreement on Fisheries Subsidies, which has been prepared including the first two (02) pillars mentioned above, since 2023. The Cabinet approved the joint proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources and the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development to ratify Phase I of the Agreement on Fisheries Subsidies, enabling to strengthen Sri Lanka's leadership in ocean sustainability, strengthen Sri Lanka's trading position in key markets, build the necessary capacity to modernize Sri Lanka's fisheries sector, and gain benefits from the World Trade Organization's dedicated fisheries fund through technical assistance.

title: Operating the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation and the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation as separate public enterprises with their own distinct identities
decision_details: - The Cabinet, at its meeting held on 2023‑11‑27, granted approval in principle to  establish a single Public Company by merging the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation and the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation. Accordingly, the then State-Owned Enterprises Restructuring Unit has submitted its recommendations on how the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation and the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation should be merged to establish a Public Company under the Companies Act. However, action has not yet been pursued in that regard. Nevertheless, it has now been identified that the desired outcomes could not be accrued from merging these institutions due to reasons such as the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation and Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation using technologies different from each other, the studios of the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation requiring more space than those of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation, and the difficulty of integration due to their transmission towers being located in different locations. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of  Health and Mass Media to continue operations of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation and Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation as separate State enterprises with their own distinct identities, by improving operational efficiency and revenue status through a formal strategic business plan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation of standardized maize required for Thriposha production
decision_details: - The Ministry of Health and Mass Media provides Thriposha as a nutritional supplement to all pregnant women, lactating mothers (up to six months postpartum) and malnourished infants above 06 months and children under 5 years of age. Maize and soybeans are used as the main raw materials for the production of Thriposha. The annual requirement of Maize for Sri Lanka Thriposha Limited is 18,000 metric tons and the monthly requirement is 1,500 metric tons. The proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to issue an import cóntrol license to Sri Lanka Thriposha Limited, for the said Company to import a quantity of maize with proper standard required for a year to sustain the Thriposha production, taking into consideration the prevailing difficulties in obtaining maize with the required standard locally, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of a Task Force to restore the Swine Industry severely impacted by the African Swine Fever Viral Disease
decision_details: - African Swine Fever, a highly pathogenic epidemic disease reported in October 2024, first began in the Western Province in Sri Lanka, has now spread to all Provinces. This disease has the potential to raise the mortality rate of animals in an infected farm up to 100%. According to data reported so far, the disease has been reported in 1,594 swine farms and 61,695 pigs have died. Also, the Department of Wildlife Conservation has reported that this disease has infected wild boars in forest areas as well, resulting in the deaths of large numbers of wild boars. Due to the continued spread of the disease, circulation of the pathogenic virus in the environment, and the lack of accurate scientific information regarding disease transmission, restarting swine farms has become a high-risk situation. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land & Irrigation to appoint a Task Force under the Co-Chairmanship of the Secretary to the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Land & Irrigation and the Senior Additional Secretary to the President (Development Administration) and comprising of representations of other relevant parties, to take necessary measures to restore the Swine Industry, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of District Secretary/Government Agent in the Administrative District of Matale
decision_details: - Mrs. Thejani Thilakaratne, presently serving in the Post of District Secretary/Government Agent of the Administrative District of Matale, is due to retire on 2025-06-02, and Mr. L.P. Madanayake, a Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as the Secretary to the North Central Provincial Ministry of Transport, Sports & Youth Affairs, Cooperatives, Trade and Food and Industries Development, has been identified as suitable to be appointed to the relevant Post which falls vacant from that date. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government to appoint Mr. L.P. Madanayake to the Post of District Secretary/Government Agent of the Administrative District of Matale, with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of Director General of the Department of Buildings
decision_details: - Since Mrs. K.G. Sandhya Kumudini, presently serving as the Director General of the Department of Buildings, is due to retire on 2025-06-02, Mrs. W.R.N.R. Premachandra, a Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Engineering Service, presently serving in the Post of Additional Secretary (Technical) of the Ministry of Defence, has been identified as suitable to be appointed to the said Post which falls vacant from that date. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to appoint Mrs. W.R.N.R. Premachandra to the Post of Director General of the Department of Buildings, with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Sign Language Bill
decision_details: - Establishing Sign Language as a recognized language will enable the hearing impaired individuals to access information and fully participate in all aspects of the society and achieve equal opportunities without barriers. The Cabinet has granted policy approval on 2010‑09‑08 to establish the Sign Language as a recognized language. Accordingly, as per the Cabinet decisions taken on 2017‑09‑12 and 2021‑01‑18, the Legal Draftsman has been instructed to prepare a Bill to recognize the Sign Language as a formal communication medium. The proposal made by Minister of the Rural Development, Social Security and Community Empowerment to obtain policy approval of the new Cabinet to finalize the preparation of the relevant Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Mediation (Civil and Commercial Disputes) Bill
decision_details: - The Commercial Mediation Centre Act, No.44 of 2000, which was specifically prepared to establish a Centre for Commercial Mediation, has not been able to be implemented due to several technical reasons and limitations. Therefore, approval has been granted by the Cabinet on 2022-12-05 to prepare a new Bill with the objectives of repealing the relevant Act, setting out minimum standards for the conduct of commercial mediation and making necessary provisions for the enforcement of mediation settlements through the judicial system subject to the fulfillment of the relevant requirements. The present Cabinet of Ministers also has granted its policy approval in that regard on 2025-02-09. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to publish the Mediation (Civil and Commercial Disputes) Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman in the Government Gazette and thereafter, submit the same for approval of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Agreement for the Transfer of Sentenced Persons between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Republic of Latvia
decision_details: - The Transfer of Offenders Act, No.5 of 1995, has been introduced to provide provisions for the transfer to a specified country of a citizen of such country convicted of an offence in Sri Lanka and for the transfer to Sri Lanka of any citizen of Sri Lanka convicted of an offence in a specified country. However, the two countries concerned need to enter into an Agreement to make applicable the provisions of the said Act. The Cabinet has granted its approval on 2023‑12‑05 to enter into an Agreement on the transfer of sentenced persons, in accordance with the agreement reached in conformity to the laws existing in both countries, Sri Lanka and Latvia. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration for obtaining the policy approval of the present Cabinet, to sign the relevant Agreement and thereafter ratify the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a new Apartment Ownership (Special Provisions) Act
decision_details: - The documents required for the registration of a condominium plan in condominium properties owned by the Government or Government agencies are specified by the Apartment Ownership Act, No.11 of 1973 amended by the Apartment Ownership (Amendment) Acts No.39 of 2003 and No.45 of 1982. In order to overcome the challenges encountered due to the difficulty in completing the said documents, steps have been taken to provide a grace period for registration through an easy and simple procedure through the new Apartment Ownership (Special Provisions) Acts No.4 of 1999, No.27 of 2002 and No.23 of 2018. Accordingly, the validity period of the Condominium Ownership (Special Provisions) Act, No.23 of 2018, which was finally enforced, has expired on 2023-08-14. Therefore, approval in principle has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2025-03-03 to prepare a new Act incorporating the provisions of the said Act. The proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to obtain the policy approval of the present Cabinet to proceed with the preparation of the said Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of a committee to review the drafted Employment Bill
decision_details: - There are about 50 Labour Laws that have been approved by the Legislature since 1923, and the need to update the provisions contained in many of them to suit the current social, economic conditions and the world of work has been identified. Accordingly, the Legal Draftsman has prepared a draft Bill to prepare a single Employment Act by studying 13 existing Acts. The proposal made by the Minister of Labour to appoint a committee representing all relevant parties under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the Ministry of Labour to further consider the said draft Bill in accordance with the new Government policy and to obtain the views of the employer and employee Trade Unions and identify further amendments to be made, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the supply of 270,000 Vials of Meropenem Injection 1g vial
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-12-30 to award the procurement for the supply of 900,000 vials of Meropenem Injection 1g, a vaccine used to treat severe bacterial infections, to M/s. Genix Pharma (Pvt) Ltd., Pakistan. Taking into consideration the increasing demand for the said vaccine, the Medical Supplies Division has submitted a request for a re-order of 30% of the previous order, i.e. an increase of 270,000 vials. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to procure 270,000 vials of 1 g of Meropenem Injection from the previous supplier, M/s. Genix Pharma (Pvt) Ltd., Pakistan, based on the recommendations of the High-Level Standing Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project to construct permanent houses for families displaced by conflict in the Northern and Eastern Provinces
decision_details: - Due to the conflict situation that prevailed in the Northern and Eastern Provinces for 30 years, a large number of houses belonging to families residing in those areas were damaged. Since the year 2009, 914,722 people belonging to 274,728 families have been resettled in the Northern and Eastern Provinces and 150,488 houses have been constructed for them in 08 districts of the Northern and Eastern Provinces by the end of the year 2024. Funds were provided for the construction of these houses by the Government of Sri Lanka, the Government of India, Non-Governmental Organizations and other institutions including International Organizations. It has been identified that about 16,759 more houses need to be constructed in the 08 districts of the Northern and Eastern Provinces for the core families displaced before the year 2009. At the inception of this project, the estimated cost for the construction of a 550 sq. ft. house has been determined as Rs. 1,100,000/- and Rs. 650,000/- for the construction of a 340 sq. ft. house. However, based on the current prices of building materials, the estimated cost for the construction of a 550 sq. ft. house has been estimated as Rs. 1,600,000/- and Rs. 950,000/- for the construction of a 340 sq. ft. house. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to increase the amount of assistance provided by the Government for the permanent housing construction project on the basis of construction by the beneficiary, effective from the year 2025 as follows, was approved by the Cabinet:* To increase the amount of assistance provided from Government funds for the construction of a 550 sq. ft. house up to Rs. 1,500,000/-.* To increase the amount of assistance provided for the construction of a 340 sq. ft. house up to Rs. 900,000/-.

title: Development of the Myliddy Fishery Harbour - Phase III
decision_details: - Phases I and II of the development of the Myliddy Fishery Harbour, Jaffna have been completed. The remaining development work of the harbour is planned to be implemented under Phase III. Under that phase, it is expected to provide main and essential facilities such as water, electricity, fuel to the fishing community of the Northern Province as well as fishing boats coming from the Eastern and Southern Provinces and to provide essential net mending hall facilities, auction hall facilities and radio transmission facilities (radio rooms) to the fishing community. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources to carry out the land-based constructions planned under Phase III of the development of the Myliddy Fishery Harbour and to extend the project period up to the year 2027, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Hosting the Seventh Meeting of the SAARC Inter-Governmental Group on Transport
decision_details: - It had been decided at the 32nd Session of the Standing Committee held in the year 2006 to establish the SAARC Inter-Governmental Group on Transport at the Secretarial level of the Ministries. Through this, it is expected to strengthen diplomatic relations within the region and enhance regional cooperation. The 7th meeting of the Group is proposed to be held in Colombo on 20, 21-06-2025. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation for Sri Lanka to host the 7th Meeting of the SAARC Inter-Governmental Group on Transport, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Metro Bus Unit for Urban Transportation
decision_details: - It has been proposed through the Budget 2025 to introduce a comfortable bus fleet with state-of-the-art technology as a pilot project under the Sri Lanka Transport Board, for modernization of the public transport service. Under this, it is planned to deploy 100 low entry comfortable buses for passenger transportation along several major road corridors including Colombo, Makumbura (Kottawa), Kaduwela, Kadawatha and Moratuwa in the Western Province. Accordingly, taking into consideration a proposal submitted by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, the Cabinet granted its approval to establish a subsidiary Company of the Sri Lanka Transport Board under the Companies Act No.07 of 2007 and implement the proposed project.

title: Declaration of a portion of the Nikkandupola Stream, a natural habitat of the rare Bandula Pethiya Fish as a Sanctuary under the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance
decision_details: - The Bandula Pethiya, which was identified in 1991, is a rare and critically endangered fish species endemic to this country. According to current calculations, these fish are thought to number 300 or fewer. It has been identified that this fish lives only within a stretch of approximately 2.5 kilometers of the stream, flowing from Rabbidigala to Hapugoda, in the Galapitamada area of Warakapola Divisional Secretariat Division, Kegalle District. Since there are paddy fields adjacent to the stream that use chemical fertilizers and agrochemicals, it has been observed that living in a stream where high level of human activities are prevalent is a serious threat to the survival of this fish, which is included in the Red Data List. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to declare a sanctuary named the Nikkandupola Sanctuary, covering an identified area approximately 2.5 kilometers of the stream in length and 15 meters on either side of the stream's center line from Rabbidigala to Hapugoda in the Galapitamada area of ​​the Warakapola Divisional Secretariat Division to conserve these limited fish, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Calling for Expressions of Interest to set apart the old Bogambara Prison Land located in Kandy, on 50 year lease basis
decision_details: - The old Bogambara Prison land, which has been vested with the Urban Development Authority, is located within the Utility Service Zone of the Kandy Municipal Council Area Development Plan, which has been prepared for the Kandy Municipal Council area covering the period 2021-2030. The Bogambara Prison Premises and prison buildings have been identified under the World Heritage Building Conservation, and there is a potential to carry out cultural and tourism promotion activities in those premises. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to call for investment proposals for the disposal of the relevant land on a 50-year lease basis, in order to implement a development project with financial, environmental and social potential in accordance with the preliminary plan of the Urban Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing underutilized lands/properties to suitable investors for optimal use
decision_details: - A sum of Rs. 250 million has been allocated from the Budget 2025 to identify State owned underutilized lands and their suitability and to direct them towards private investments, including small and medium-scale enterprises. Accordingly, a project proposal has been prepared jointly by the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation and the Ministry of Plantation and Community Infrastructure. According to the proposal, the clear,  underutilized lands/properties belonging to the institutions under the purview of those two ministries, are expected to be provided for investment opportunities in the fields of plantation and agriculture, plantation-related tourism promotion, livestock development, hydropower generation, solar energy generation, factory-related manufacturing, freshwater fisheries, and other plantation-related economic innovations. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantations and Community Infrastructure to proceed with the proposed project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Ingiriya Industrial Estate and implementation of the Second Phase of the Raigama, Millaniya Industrial Estate
decision_details: - At present, there are 33 Industrial Estates operating throughout the country, of which 08 are operating in the Western Province. The number of requests made by local and foreign industrialists to obtain lands to establish industries in the Western Province, targeting the developed physical infrastructure and human resources in comparison to other provinces, is at a high level. Taking into account these facts, the Cabinet granted its approval for the implementation of the following proposals submitted by the Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development:* Establishment of a new Industrial Estate by developing relevant infrastructure facilities and with an investment of Rs.2,500 million, on a block of land in extent of 350 acres to be allocated from the Government-owned 'St. Peter's Estate' located in the Ingiriya Divisional Secretariat Division of the Kalutara District, with industrial zones for automobile and related spare parts manufacturing industries, rubber and rubber-related industries, pharmaceutical manufacturing industries and mixed industries.* Commencement of development work of the Second Phase of the Raigama Millaniya Industrial Estate with an investment of Rs. 500 million, covering 24 acres of land from the land in extent of 200 acres allocated from the 'New Chatalwatte' land to establish the Raigama Industrial and Technological Development High Zone.

title: Memorandum of Understanding on the Establishment of a Political Consultations Mechanism between Guatemala and 	Sri Lanka
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Guatemala and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism of Sri Lanka on the Establishment of a Political Consultations Mechanism. The proposed Agreement aims to promote, strengthen and expánd bilateral relations including political, economic, consular, cultural, scientific and technological cooperation. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism to sign the proposed MoU between the two countries for an initial period of five (05) years.

title: Implementation of the Country Strategic Plan for Sri Lanka of the World 	Food Programme
decision_details: - The Country Strategic Plan for Sri Lanka of the World Food Programme has been prepared as a key planning instrument for a period of 04 years from 2023-2027, including strategic priorities and programmes. Under the said plan, a provision amounting to US$ 74.87 million has been allocated for Sri Lanka. The said strategy is implemented through a mutual commitment formalized by signing a Letter of Understanding between the two parties. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to sign the Letter of Understanding between the Government of Sri Lanka and the United Nations World Food Programme with the aim of facilitating the successful implementation of the said Strategic Plan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Task Force on Digital Transformation of Education
decision_details: - Sri Lanka has made a commendable progress in achieving a high rate of school enrollment and quality education. However, the education sector is currently under a severe stress due to the shortage of over 42,000 teachers and growing inequities across rural and undeserved areas. In this backdrop, the need to introduce a systemic transformation in the education sector has arisen. Many countries effectively utilize digital dividend to bring about a revolutionary change in their education systems. Even though Sri Lanka has launched various digital education initiatives, desired outcomes could not be achieved due to their uncoordinated nature. Therefore, it has become essential to implement an unified strategic digital approach which is aligned with the current education reforms. The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education to establish a Task Force on Digital Transformation of Education chaired by the Secretary to the Prime Minister with the membership of the Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education and the Secretary to the Ministry of Digital Economy, comprising of representatives of other relevant parties, to take necessary action for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a New Unit for Public - Private Partnership
decision_details: - In the Budget Speech 2025, the Hon. President stated that steps will be taken to introduce a new Act on Public-Private Partnership with the aim of facilitating investment promotion. Accordingly, the Cabinet granted policy approval to the proposal made by the Hon. President to prepare a Bill to establish a new unit based on a formal legal mechanism,  in lieu of the currently operating National Agency for Public Private Partnership and to establish a Public Private Partnership Unit in the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, headed by the Senior Additional Secretary to the President (Finance and Economic Affairs), to coordinate the initial tasks until the said Unit is legally established.

title: Establishment of the Revenue Administration Reform and Modernization Bureau
decision_details: - The key responsibility of the Government revenue collection mechanism in Sri Lanka is held by the three institutions; the Inland Revenue Department, the Sri Lanka Customs and the Excise Department of Sri Lanka. At present, these three Departments are facing challenges such as fragmented operations, inefficiencies due to outdated processes and legal systems, revenue leakages, digitization-oriented insufficiency, lack of inter-agency coordination in policy implementation and integrity issues. It has been proposed under the macroeconomic stabilization fiscal policies mentioned in the manifesto 'A Thriving Nation - A Beautiful Life', to establish a new unit to plan and implement tax policies with a special section to deal with international transactions. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to establish a special Bureau in the name of 'Revenue Administration Reform and Modernization Bureau' under the Presidential Secretariat in line with international best practices to strengthen the government revenue administration mechanism by overcoming the existing challenges, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Online Safety Act No.9 of 2024
decision_details: - The Cabinet, at its meeting held on 2025 02 09, granted approval to amend the Online Safety Act No.9 of 2024. Accordingly, taking into consideration the joint Note to the Cabinet submitted by the Minister of Health and Mass Media, Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs and the Minister of Justice and National Integration, the Cabinet granted its concurrence to appoint a Committee under the Chairmanship of an Hon. Judge of the Supreme Court representing all relevant sectors to submit recommendations to amend the said Bill by incorporating already identified amendments and those to be identified after public consultation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Strengthening Economic 	Cooperation in Industrial and Supply Chains between the Ministry of 	Industry and Entrepreneurship Development and the Ministry of 	Commerce of the People's Republic of China
decision_details: - 	It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and the People's Republic of China to strengthen and facilitate cooperation among the entrepreneurs in industrial and supply chains with the aim of achieving mutual benefits such as common development, economic growth and employment opportunities. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development to sign the proposed Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China and the Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Term contract for the Procurement of 05 shipments of Gas Oil  (0.05% M.S.) during the period from 2025.06.01 to 2025.11.30
decision_details: - Bids have been invited from the registered suppliers of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to purchase 05 shipments of Gas Oil (0.05% M.S.) during the period from 2025 06 01 to 2025 11 30. Seven (07) bids have been submitted for the purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Energy, to award the relevant procurement to M/s Trafigura Pte Ltd., Singapore, based on the recommendation of the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved 	by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding to establish a Working Group for the promotion of smooth bilateral trade between Sri Lanka and China
decision_details: - It has been proposed to establish a working group to promote smooth bilateral trade between Sri Lanka and China. This aims to unlock the untapped potential of bilateral trade, address trade-related challenges and enhance the volume and quality of trade between Sri Lanka and China. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Co-operative Development to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China and the Ministry of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Co-operative Development of Sri Lanka to establish the working group as proposed, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the recommendations of the Committee appointed to review the recruitment process and cadre management in the Public Service
decision_details: - Two (02) Reports submitted by the Officials' Committee appointed under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the Prime Minister to review the recruitment process and cadre management in the Public Service, have recommended recruitment for 15,073 vacant posts in 18 Line Ministries, 04 Provincial Councils and 02 Special Spending Units. Accordingly, the approval of the Cabinet was granted to make the recruitments recommended in the above reports.

title: Appointment to the Post of Director General of Agriculture
decision_details: - Dr. (Mrs.) E.R.S.P. Edirimanna, who served in the Post of Director General of Agriculture has retired from the service on 2025-05-18. The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation to appoint  Dr. W.A.R.T. Wickramaarachchi, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Agriculture Service, presently serving in a Post of Additional Secretary of the Ministry of  Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation, to the Post of  Director General of Agriculture fallen vacant accordingly with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Regulations made under the Convention against Doping in Sport Act No.33 of 2013 to Parliament
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Anti-Doping Agency has been established as per the provisions of the Convention against Doping in Sport Act No.33 of 2013 and operates under the standards of the World Anti-Doping Agency. The Prohibited List, which is a mandatory international standard of the said Agency, should be enforced by ratified countries within their countries by updating the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports to submit the Anti-Doping (Prohibited List) Regulations No.10 of 2024 published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2430/24 dated 2025 04 03, made in terms of the Convention against Doping in Sport Act No.33 of 2013, by declaring prohibited substances for athletes as well as equestrian sports and horse racing pertaining to the year 2025, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Order made under the Reciprocal Recognition, Registration and Enforcement of Foreign Judgments Act, No.49 of 2024, for approval of Parliament
decision_details: - The Reciprocal Recognition, Registration and Enforcement of Foreign Judgments Act, No. 49 of 2024 makes provisions for the recognition, registration and enforcement of judgments of Courts of other countries in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, an Order made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration in accordance with the provisions of the relevant Act and published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2429/51 dated 2025 03 28, specifies the foreign countries which should have recognition, registration and enforcement of judgments. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to submit the said Order for approval of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Regulations made under the Anti-Dumping and Countervailing Duties Act, No.2 of 2018, for approval of Parliament
decision_details: - The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval on 2025-03-03 for the promulgation of Regulations on the 'Application for initiating an investigation on imposition of Anti-Dumping and Countervailing Duty Regulations 2025' and the 'Procedure for Price Undertakings Regulations 2025' in accordance with the provisions of the Anti-Dumping and Countervailing Duty Act, No.2 of 2018 to safeguard local industries and entrepreneurs from dumping of the imported goods as well as subsidized goods from foreign countries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Co-operative Development to submit the ''Application for Initiating an Investigation on Imposition of Anti-Dumping and Countervailing Duty Regulations 2025, made under the provisions of the said Act and published by the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2429/32 dated 2025 03 27, for approval of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introducing an effective legal framework for Countering Foreign 	Terrorist Fighters
decision_details: - Sri Lanka, as a member of the Asia-Pacific Group on Money Laundering, is committed to effectively implement and enforce the internationally accepted standards against money laundering, financing of terrorism and proliferation financing developed by the Financial Action Task Force. Further, in accordance with the membership rules of the Asia-Pacific Group on Money Laundering, Sri Lanka is subjected to a mutual peer review process called as "Mutual Evaluations" every 6 years to determine the level of compliance with the standards of the Financial Action Task Force. As per the Action Plan prepared for the 3rd Evaluation relating to Sri Lanka, the Ministry in charge of the subject of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Defence are required to promptly promulgate the United Nations Security Council Resolution 2178 (2014) on Foreign Terrorist Fighters and to enforce the provisions of the said Resolution by way of domestic legislation. Accordingly, Sri Lanka is obligated to make legislation on Foreign Terrorist Fighters before March 2026. Therefore, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation to counter Foreign Terrorist Fighters based on the UN Security Council Resolution 2178 (2014), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the term contract for the Procurement of four (04) shipments of Murban Crude Oil during the period from 2025.09.01 to 2025.12.31
decision_details: - Bids have been invited to procure 04 shipments of Murban Crude Oil for the period from 2025 09 01 to 2025 12 31. Seven (07) bids have been submitted for the purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the 	Minister of Energy, to award the relevant procurement to M/s BB Energy Asia Pte Ltd., Singapore, based on the recommendation of the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for organizing and empowering dairy farmers to enhance 	their productivity and improve the Dairy Value Chain
decision_details: - The Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation has proposed to implement a project for "Improving the Diary Value Chain by Enhancing the Dairy Farm Productivity" utilizing the US$ 10 million allocated for the development of the agriculture sector under the Inclusive Connectivity Development Project financed by the World Bank. The recommendation of the Department of National Planning has been received for the purpose. The proposed project is planned to be implemented in the 12 districts of Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa, Kurunegala, Puttalam, Matale, Kandy, Nuwara Eliya, Gampaha, Ampara, Badulla, Galle and Hambantota with potential for dairy production. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation to implement the project of Improving the Dairy Value Chain by Enhancing the Productivity of Dairy Farms in those Districts, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of 15,000 MT of Urea by State Fertilizer Company Limited
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the cabinet meeting held on 2023 07 17 to import and sell fertilizer to farmers by State Fertilizer Company Limited since Maha season 2023/24, competing with the companies in the private sector. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation to import 15,000 MT of Urea by State Fertilizer Company Limited, following the international competitive bidding procedure, for sale in the form of straight and mixed fertilizer in the open market during the coming season, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Stage 2 of the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2015-04-22 to implement the Stage 1 of the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme which consists of 02 stages under the Multi-Tranche Financing Facility of the Asian Development Bank. However, due to the reasons such as exceeding the estimated quantities and costs of the contract packages, Covid-19 pandemic prevailed in the country and the economic crisis, the relevant programme could not be completed as expected. Therefore, the Asian Development Bank has granted its concurrence to restructure and implement the remaining components of this programme in several phases according to a prioritized sequence. Accordingly, it has been planned to implement Stage 2 of the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme which includes activities of the completion of irrigation infrastructure facilities of the North Central Province Canal and the establishment of a commercial agriculture development programme with improved water distribution systems in the areas connected to the North Central Province Canal. Under that Stage, it is expected to achieve the benefits of increasing the cropping intensity rate across major irrigation systems of Hurulu Wewa, Manankattiya, Eruwewa, Mahakanadarawa, Nachchaduwa, Nuwara Wewa and Thisa Wewa, providing 40 million cubic meters of water annually for the drinking water needs of the North Central Province and improving the livelihoods of farmers. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation to hold discussions with the Asian Development Bank and co-financing institutions to secure the necessary funds to implement the Stage 2 Project of the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishing a multi-sectoral mechanism with an integrated approach to protect children from abuse
decision_details:
- Protecting children from abuse and all forms of violence against them has been identified as a key principle of the policy commitment 'A Safe World for Children - A Creative Future Generation' of the National Policy Framework of the new Government for which approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2025 03 03. There are several parties operating within the state machinery that intervene in various aspects in protecting children.  The Ministry of Women and Child Affairs, the Ministry of Health and Mass Media, the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education, the Ministry of Justice and National Integration and the Sri Lanka Police perform a key role among them. The National Child Protection Authority has provided facilities round the clock to receive complaints about abuse and all forms of violence against children. However, it has been observed that there are also frequent cases where complaints are not submitted in a proper manner. The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Women and Child Affairs to take the following measures enabling to intervene in such cases promptly:

*	to appoint a Standing National Committee under the Chairmanship of the Secretary, Ministry of Women and Child Affairs and comprised with the representations of other relevant institutions.

*	to introduce amendments to the Penal Code and the Code of Criminal Procedure expeditiously, so that corporal punishment against children could be eliminated.

*	to expeditiously publish the media code of ethics currently being drafted, incorporating appropriate provisions to prevent child victims from becoming repeat victims in the reporting of such crimes and all forms of violence against children. 

*	to obtain immediate intervention of the National Authority for the Protection of Victims of Crime and Witnesses, the Secretariat for Non Governmental Organizations and the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka, to regulate the activities carried out by media institutions and social media communicators in a manner that harms the identity of child victims.

title: Incorporation of a Limited Liability Company to manage the Dedicated Economic Centers
decision_details: - Eighteen (18) Dedicated Economic Centers have been established by now to provide the necessary market infrastructure to sell, buy, store and distribute farm or agricultural products. Out of these, 14 Economic Centers, other than Vavuniya, Kilinochchi, Jaffna and Batticaloa, are currently in operation.  These Dedicated Economic Centers are managed by a Management Trust headed by the District Secretary/Government Agent of the relevant District, comprising of Ex-officio members from the Government institutions and traders' associations, as per the Cabinet decision dated 2006 01 10. The need to establish a centralized, legally acceptable and accountable institutional arrangement has been identified to carry out business activities in these Dedicated Economic Centers viably and sustainably. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Co-operative Development to establish a limited liability company to develop, expandd and manage the Dedicated Economic Centers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: “Marine Nights :Awakening Colombo” Project
decision_details: - The need for a structured approach has been identified to enhance the nighttime tourist activities thereby boosting the domestic economy, revitalizing tourism industry and enriching tourist experiences available in the Colombo City. Accordingly, it has been planned to implement a project to develop the Colombo Marine Drive spanning approximately 7.4 kilometers from Kollupitiya Railway Station to Dehiwala under the theme 'Marine Nights: Awakening Colombo'. There, it is expected to focus on the area of approximately 400 meters from Galle Face end to St. Thomas' Preparatory College. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism to implement the proposed project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Divestiture of Canwill Holdings (Pvt) Ltd.
decision_details: - Canwill Holdings (Pvt) Ltd. has been incorporated in December 2011, to invest in the Tourism/Hospitality sector. SinoLanka Hotels & Spa (Pvt) Ltd. has been established to implement the 'Grand Hyatt, Colombo' project, which is an investment of Canwill Holdings (Pvt) Ltd. The approval has been granted by the then Cabinet for the divestiture of Canwill Holdings (Pvt) Ltd. under the 'State Owned Enterprise Restructuring Programme' and to select M/s Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu India LLP as the Transaction Advisor for the said purpose. However, no further steps have been taken accordingly. It is currently estimated, that approximately USD 120 million (approximately Rs. 36 billion) will be required further to complete the 'Grand Hyatt, Colombo' project. Taking into consideration the difficulty in obtaining further funds from the shareholders of the said company or through debt financing to complete the construction of the project, the most appropriate option that has been identified is raising the necessary funds through a process of selling shares of the company and completing the construction of the project and thereafter commencing the commercial operations. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to resume the divestiture process of Canwill Holdings (Pvt) Ltd. and to further obtain the service of M/s Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu India LLP as the Transaction Advisor for the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Institutional Framework for acceleration of digital transformation and digital economy development in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2025-01-27, to prepare a Bill to liquidate the existing Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka (ICTA) and establish the Digital Economy Authority. In order to accelerate digital transformation and establish an institutional framework for digital economic development in Sri Lanka in parallel to the same, the experiences of implementing the existing digital strategies in Sri Lanka and other countries have been studied. Accordingly, the necessity of a stable and well-defined institutional structure to achieve the desired objectives of the National Digital Strategies has been identified. Taking these matters into consideration, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Digital Economy, to establish a State-Owned company named 'GovTech (Pvt) Limited' as an independent institution with the necessary authorities, enabling the smooth implementation of digital transformation projects that have already been initiated and to be initiated in the future, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of a Technical Evaluation Committee for evaluation of Project Proposals submitted to the National Initiative for Research and Development Commercialization
decision_details: - Currently, the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka and the Colombo Port City Economic Commission operate to provide necessary facilities for investors in Sri Lanka. However, taking into consideration the fact that a proper and investor-friendly research and development mechanism has not been formally established for identification of projects related to research and development commercialization and evaluation and empowerment of its technical and economic potential, the "National Initiative for Research and Development Commercialization (NIRDC)" has been established under the Presidential Secretariat. The main objective of establishing this Initiative is to provide facilities for investors who wish to introduce the projects where researches have already been completed or nearly completed to the market as value added vendible products or Service. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to appoint a Technical Evaluation Committee comprising of experts with expertise in technology, education, science, health, environment, food and sustainability, social development, wellbeing and other disciplines to evaluate the project proposals forwarded to the National Initiative for Research and Development Commercialization for commercialization and refer the same to suitable investors, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Inland Revenue Act, No.24 of 2017
decision_details: - The Inland Revenue (Amendment) Act, No. 2 of 2025, has introduced legal provisions to increase the Withholding Tax rate from 5% to 10%, with effect from 2025-04-01. It has been observed that due to the imposition of Withholding Tax even on individuals with income not exceeding the annual taxable income limit of Rs.1.8 million, such depositors and low-income individuals are facing inconveniences. As a solution to the said problem, it has been proposed to introduce a system for submitting a self-declaration for individuals with income below the tax-free threshold. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to amend the Inland Revenue Act, No.24 of 2017, incorporating the appropriate amendments to introduce a self-declaration for all resident individuals whose assessable income does not exceed Rs. 1.8 million per annum to relieve from the deduction of Withholding Tax on interest and to make it mandatory to furnish the Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) for opening all types of bank accounts, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of Director General of Commerce
decision_details: - The Post of Director General of the Department of Commerce, which functions under the Ministry of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Co-operative Development, is currently vacant. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and    Co-operative Development to appoint Ms. Ameina Shafi Mohin, the senior‑most Officer holding the Post of Director of Commerce in the said Department, to act as the Director General of Commerce on full-time basis, with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979 	(Conduct of Inquest of Death)
decision_details: - At the meeting held on 2022‑10‑25, Cabinet has decided to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill, enabling to improve the existing legal framework and prevailing procedures and practices about the conduct of Inquests into Death of the Code of Criminal Procedure Act. Accordingly, the Legal Draftsman has prepared a preliminary draft for that purpose. As per the proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration for granting policy approval of the new Cabinet to finalize the preparation of the said Bill, it was decided to grant the policy approval of the Cabinet to prepare the said Bill.

title: Implementation of the "Take Care - Surekemu Magathota" Project
decision_details: - A school-based awareness project under the theme of "Take Care - Surekemu Magathota" has been planned to be implemented centering school children in order to make the road a safe place for all by preventing the daily increasing road accidents.  The project has been scheduled to be implemented by Independent Television Network Limited jointly with the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education, the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, the Sri Lanka Police and the Department of Motor Traffic. The project is expected to be implemented in 100 Education Zones in coordination with school traffic pilot teams and student prefects. It is planned to get a total of 50,000 students with 500 students from each zone, directly involved in this programme. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to implement the proposed Project through Independent Television Network Limited, with the association of relevant institutions, under the supervision of the Ministry of Health and Mass Media, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the service of a Consulting Company for improvement of infrastructure facilities of the Head Office and Regional Centres of the Meteorology Department under the Climatic Resilience Multi-Phase Programme Approach
decision_details: - The Climatic Resilience Multi-Phase Programmatic Approach is being implemented by the Government of Sri Lanka since October 2021 with the assistance of the World Bank. It is an initiation of 09 years which runs until 2030, and a loan amounting to US$92 million has been obtained from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and the World Bank for the implementation of its first phase (2021-2026). Improving the infrastructure facilities of the Headquarters and Regional Centers of the Department of Meteorology by improving the forecasting and early warning systems of high-impact weather, floods and landslides has been identified as one of the components of the first phase of the project.  Competitive bids have been invited to select a Consulting Company to obtain necessary consultancy servìces for the implementation of the said component. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation, to award the contract for the provision of the said consultancy servìce, to M/s Green Tech Consultants (Pvt) Ltd., based on the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Consultative Procurement Committee on the received bids, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of a Memorandum of Understanding between the Chongqing Broadcasting Group of the People's Republic of China and the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Chongqing Broadcasting Group of the People's Republic of China and the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation with a view to promoting long-standing friendship and mutual understanding between the two countries, strengthening the corporation and exchanging training opportunities in the field of media. The proposed Memorandum of Understanding will provide the opportunity for the exchange of programmes between the People's Republic of China and Sri Lanka, promotion of learning and training opportunities, joint production of television programmes and obtaining publicity needed for the tourism industry. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to sign the proposed Memorandum of Understanding between the Chongqing Broadcasting Group of the People's Republic of China and the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation between the 	Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute and the Rio 	Branco Institute of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Federative 	Republic of 	Brazil
decision_details: - Although approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑09‑02 to sign a Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism and the Rio Branco Institute under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Federative Republic of Brazil, the said Agreement has not yet been signed. The Rio Branco Institute, as an internationally renowned diplomatic academy, has contributed to the training of diplomats in about 57 countries of the world for 08 decades and has entered into cooperation agreements with more than 70 countries. Through the proposed Memorandum of Understanding, it envisages the training of diplomats and facilitating them for training programmes, exchanging information and experiences concerning their respective programmes of study and research, exchanging information on tools related to e-learning and information on national as well as international publications and promoting closer cooperation, especially in the areas of mutual interest. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism to sign the proposed MoU, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Budgetary Relief Allowance of Workers Acts, No. 36 of 2005 and No. 4 of 2016, and the National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No. 3 of 2016
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet was granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2025‑04‑07 to amend the Budgetary Relief Allowance of Workers Act, No.36 of 2005, the Budgetary Relief Allowance of Workers Act, No.4 of 2016 and the National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No.3 of 2016 in relation to the increase in the national minimum monthly and daily wages of private sector employees in parallel with the increase in the salaries of public employees. Accordingly, the Legal Draftsman has prepared amending Bills to amend the said Bills, and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the same. The proposal made by the Minister of Labour to publish the said amending Bills in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of Surveyor General
decision_details: - Mr. U.K.S.P. Wijesinghe, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Surveyors Service, who served as the Surveyor General, has retired from the Public Service with effect from 2025‑01‑22, upon the completion of 60 years of age. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation to appoint Mr. Y.G. Gnanathilaka, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Surveyors Service, to the vacant Post of Surveyor General with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of Commissioner General of Examinations
decision_details: - The service period of Mr. H.J.M.C.A Jayasundara, who served in the post of Commissioner General of Examination, expired on 2025‑05‑06. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education to appoint Mrs. A.K. Subhashini Indika Kumari Liyanage, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service, presently serving in a Post of Commissioner of Examinations in the Department of Examinations, Sri Lanka, to the vacant Post of Commissioner General of Examinations with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making the Samurdhi Community based Banks and Samurdhi 	Community based Banking Societies subject to the Government 	Audit
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2024‑12‑30, to amend the Samurdhi Act No. 1 of 2013, as amended by the Divi Neguma (Amendment) Act No. 2 of 2017, to include an amendment for making Samurdhi Community based Banks and Samurdhi Community based Banking Societies subject to the Government Audit. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Rural Development, Social Security and Community Empowerment to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette, and thereafter submit the same to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Act of Parliament for the Establishment of the Institute of Food Science and Technology Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Institute of Food Science and Technology Sri Lanka, comprising of food technology practitioners and scientists, which is maintained voluntarily was established in 2004 and is currently registered as a company limited by guarantee. The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2016‑09‑27 granted approval to legalize it by an Act of Parliament as a form of Government support receiving for maintaining the said Institute at national and international level and to strengthen the activities thereof. Accordingly, approval of the Cabinet was granted on 2024-06-11 to prepare the final Bill incorporating the amendments submitted by the Attorney General pertaining to the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. However, the said Bill has not yet been submitted to Parliament. Taking into consideration the aforesaid matters, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation to obtain policy approval of the Cabinet to expedite the preparation of the said Bill, was approved by the Cabinet of Ministers.

title: Amending the Control of Pesticides Act, No.33 of 1980
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑08‑07 for the amendment of the Cóntrol of Pesticides Act, No. 33 of 1980. It has been pointed out that the policy approval of the present Cabinet should be obtained in order to complete the preparation of the said Bill by the Legal Draftsman. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation, to grant policy approval of the Cabinet to proceed with the preparation of the Bill to amend the Cóntrol of Pesticides Act, No. 33 of 1980, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Bills of Exchange Ordinance
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2024‑01‑24 to amend or delete the obsolete provisions of the Exchange Ordinance No.25 of 1927 (Chapter 82). Accordingly, the Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024‑07‑15 has granted approval to publish the Bills of Exchange Ordinance (Amendment) Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter to Parliament. Nevertheless, the said Bill could not be submitted to Parliament due to the dissolution of Parliament on 2024‑09‑24. As such, taking into consideration the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development and the Minister of Justice and National Integration, the Cabinet decided to grant policy approval for the Bills of Exchange Ordinance (Amendment) Bill and re-publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter to Parliament.

title: Calling for investment proposals for exploration and production of petroleum and natural gas in four (04) blocks 	within the Mannar Basin and obtaining the service of a Marketing Consultant
decision_details: - According to the exploration and drilling carried out by Cairn Lanka (Pvt) Ltd in 2011, 02 natural gas deposits have been discovered in the M2 exploration block in the Mannar Basin, which has proven the existence of a viable hydrocarbon system in the Mannar Basin. As per the provisions of the Petroleum Resources Act, No.21 of 2021, the Petroleum Development Authority of Sri Lanka is authorized to invite investment proposals for offshore petroleum and natural gas exploration blocks in keeping with the procedure approved by the Cabinet and prescribed by regulations. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Energy, to conduct a licensing round to call for investment proposals for the exploration and production of petroleum and natural gas in the 04 exploration blocks in the Mannar Basin, and to obtain the servìces of a suitable marketing consultant to implement an effective marketing program for that purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of High Priority Transmission Development Projects under Full Mutual Reliance Framework of the World Bank and the Asian Development Bank
decision_details: - The World Bank and the Asian Development Bank have expressed their willingness to provide financial assistance under the Full Mutual Reliance Framework for the implementation of a series of High Priority Transmission Development projects identified under the Long-Term Transmission Plan 2023 - 2032 prepared by the Ceylon Electricity Board. Ten (10) projects have been identified for implementation under the proposed Full Mutual Reliance Framework. The World Bank plans to invest US$ 40 million with a guarantee facility of US$ 10 million to be provided by the International Development Association and the Asian Development Bank US$ 30 million. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Energy, to pursue action pertaining to obtaining an investment package of US$ 60 million for the development of the proposed grid substation under the Full Mutual Reliance Framework jointly offered by the World Bank and the Asian Development Bank, and to obtain the De - risking Guarantee Facility of US$ 10 million sponsored by the International Development Association.

title: Procurement for the supply of 3000 sets of TKR Implant Component for the Total Knee Replacement (TKR) System
