- As per a proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism, approval of the Cabinet was granted to make the following appointments:
* to appoint Mr.H.C.D.L Silva, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Accountants' Service, presently serving as the Director General of the Department of Treasury Operations, as a Deputy Secretary to the Treasury.
* to appoint Mr.D.A.P Abeysekara, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Planning Service, presently serving as the Director General of the Department of External Resources, to a post of Deputy Secretary to the Treasury which falls vacant on 2024‑11‑06, after the retirement of Mr.R.M.P Ratnayake, presently serving in the said post.
* to appoint Mr.A.N Hapugala, a Special Grade Officer of the  Sri Lanka Accountants' Service, presently serving as the Additional Director General of the Department of Public Finance, to the post of Director General of the Department of Treasury Operations which falls vacant due to the appointment of Mr. H.C.D.L Silva as a Deputy Secretary to the Treasury.
* to appoint Mr. N.S.M.P Ranjith, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Planning Service, presently serving as the Acting Director General of the Department of Project Management and Monitoring, as the Director General of the said Department.
* to appoint Mrs. J.M.S.D Ratnayake, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Planning Service, presently serving as the Additional Director General of the Department of National Planning to the currently vacant post of Director General of the said Department.

title: Appointment to the Post of Director General of the Department of Coast Guard
decision_details: - Rear Admiral P. Withana who was serving as the Director General of the Department of Coast Guard has retired upon the completion of 55 years of age. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to appoint Rear Admiral Y.R. Serasinghe presently serving as the Deputy Director General of the Department of Coast Guard, to the above vacant post, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Ekgaloya Circuit Bungalow, Ampara and the Riverstone  Circuit Bungalow (Dumbara Forest Resort)
decision_details: - The Department of Forest Conservation has identified 09 circuit bungalows that need to be renovated based on the recommendations of the Committee appointed to recommend a suitable methodology for the effective use of state-owned holiday resorts and circuit bungalows.  The estimated provisions of Rs.166.93 million has been received for the same and the projects should be completed within this year. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment, Wildlife, Forest Resources, Water Supply, Plantation and Community Infrastructure to get the renovation activities of the Ekgaloya and Riverstone Circuit Bungalows carried out by Central Engineering Services (Pvt.) Ltd, under the supervision of the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Communication Towers in Mirihana, Kikiliyamana and Vavuniya owned by the Sri Lanka Police
decision_details: - In order to maintain the communication network of the Sri Lanka Police, communication towers have been established covering the entire island. Among them, the communication towers in Mirihana, Kikiliyamana and Vavuniya need to be repaired urgently. Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security, approval of the Cabinet was granted to award the consultancy services contract for the renovation of  relevant communication towers to the State Engineering Corporation of Sri Lanka, by securing required provisions within the medium term budgetary framework 2024-2026 and to award the contract for the renovation of said communication towers to an agency which is selected by following the open competitive bidding procedure.

title: Cooperative Development of Operational Safety and Continuing Airworthiness Programme
decision_details: - "Cooperative Development of Operational Safety and Continuing Airworthiness Programme - South Asia" has been started in the year 1997 with the cooperation of the South Asian countries namely, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka under the aegis of the International Civil Aviation Organization. The respective States must grant the annual cost contribution for the said programme and Sri Lanka has paid the contributions up to Phase V as of now. In order to achieve 08 objectives under Phase VI of the said programme, a programme has been planned for a period of 05 years. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to pay annual contributions of US$ 95,848 each for the next five 05 years of the said programme and to provide the necessary support to the International Civil Aviation Organization for the implementation of relevant programmes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Declaration of East Container Terminal Project as a Specified Project
decision_details: - The Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2021-02-01 to develop the East Container Terminal by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority in a phased out manner and to operate the same as a fully owned container terminal of the said Authority.  Accordingly, the contract for the relevant civil works has been awarded already and the construction is being carried out. Similarly, the procurement for the purchase of cranes required for the said container terminal has also been awarded. The private terminal operators and the service providers of the Port of Colombo have been provided various Tax concessions under the Strategic Development Act and the Board of Investment Law. Taking these matters also into consideration, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to declare the East Container Terminal as a “Specified Project” by the Minister in-charge of Finance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Disposal of scrap metals available in the Department of Sri Lanka Railways and the Sri Lanka Transport Board
decision_details: - A large amount of scrap metals are annually accumulated in the Department of Sri Lanka Railways and the Sri Lanka Transport Board and the Cabinet approval has been granted at the meeting held on 2024‑06‑11 to dispose the currently accumulated scrap metals following the International Competitive Bidding procedure. However, it has been found appropriate to follow the National Competitive Bidding procedure, enabling the local industrialists to offer prices on competitive basis and purchase scrap metal materials, as a solution to the current shortage of raw materials. The proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to pursue action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Mahanayaka Charikaramaya managed under the Department of Buddhist Affairs
decision_details: - The Charikarama building located at Wijerama Mawatha, Colombo 07, belonging to the Department of Buddhist Affairs, is used for the accommodation of the Mahanayake Theros when they visit Colombo. Due to the inadequacy of the common facilities of this monastery, the renovation works have been started in the year 2021 under the labor contribution of the Navy. The initial cost estimate has to be revised due to the increase in the price of raw materials in the market and the inclusion of identified additional works. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security and Mass Media to revise the estimate for the relevant renovation works as Rs. 86.97 million and to obtain additional provisions of Rs. 31.86 million required for the year 2024 to the Department of Buddhist Affairs, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM)
decision_details: - The Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting is scheduled to be held from 24th to 26th October 2024 in Apia, Samoa under the theme "One Resilient Common Future: Transforming Our Common Wealth". For the purpose, Cabinet decided to grant the concurrence for the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to make a delegation representing Sri Lanka comprised with the Senior Officials from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Sri Lankan High Commission in London, participate in the Meeting.

title: Issuance of Commemorative Stamps to celebrate Pakistan-Sri Lanka Diplomatic Relations
decision_details: - Sri Lanka and Pakistan have completed 75 years since the establishment of diplomatic relations in 2022. An agreement has been reached between the two parties to issue 02 commemorative stamps, marking the long-standing diplomatic relationship between the two countries. The proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security, and Mass Media to sign a Memorandum of Understanding for this purpose between the Department of Posts, Sri Lanka and the Pakistan Post, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief to pensioners, paddy farmers and fishermen
decision_details: - Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism to manage, as appropriate, the provisions required to implement the Cabinet decisions taken to provide a monthly interim allowance of Rs.3,000/- for all pensioners, to increase the fertilizer subsidy up to Rs.25,000/- per hectare to a maximum of 2 hectares for farmers cultivating paddy in the Maha Season 2024/25, and to provide a financial assistance to fishing vessel owners, through the provisions allocated under the Development Programme of the Department of National Budget.

title: Food Policy Committee - Meeting No.01
decision_details:
- The proposal made by the Hon. President to re-establish the Food Policy Committee with the composition of the following officials which has been established in terms of the Cabinet decision dated 2022-10-03, so as to enter into appropriate decisions by following a coordination access with all the parties to ensure that the essential goods including food are supplied to market without scarcity and to take necessary steps to control the rising of the cost of living up to a possible extent, was approved by the Cabinet:

(i) 	Secretary to the President (Chairperson)
(ii)	Secretary to the Prime Minister
(iii) 	Secretary, Ministry of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism
(iv)	Secretary, Ministry of Energy
(v) 	Secretary, Ministry of Agriculture, Lands, Livestock, Irrigation, Fisheries and Aquatic Resources
(vi) 	Secretary, Ministry of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour
(vii)	Secretary, Ministry of Trade, Commerce, Food Security, Cooperative  Development, Industry and Entrepreneurship Development
(viii)	Secretary, Ministry of Health
(ix)	Secretary, Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation
(x)	Secretary, Ministry of Environment, Wildlife, Forest Resources, Water  Supply, Plantation and Community Infrastructure

title: Programme for the revival of the fishery sector by mitigating the impact caused to the fishery industry due to the economic crisis
decision_details:
- Although the approval had been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑08‑21 to address the adverse impact caused to the fishery industry due to the significant increase of fuel price, the said decision has not been implemented as of now. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Agriculture, lands, Livestock, Irrigation, Fisheries and Aquatic Resources to provide the following concessions for a period of 06 months effective from 2024‑10‑01, with a view to uplifting the economic condition of fishermen, was approved by the Cabinet. 

*	To grant “an allowance for the revival of the fishery industry” for the vessel owners who use diesel as fuel in such a way as to receive a sum of R.25/- per liter of diesel they purchase, subject to a maximum of Rs. 300,000/- per month.

*	To grant “an allowance for the revival of the fishery industry” for the vessel owners who use kerosene as a fuel in such a way as to receive a sum of R.25/- per each liter they purchase, subject to a maximum of 15 liters per day and for a maximum period of 25 days in a month, limiting it only for working days.

*	To maintain this programme so that fishermen receive a maximum concession of 7.5% for diesel from market price and a maximum concession of 12.5% for kerosene from market price for a maximum period of 6 months, subject to the limit of maximum concessionary price of Rs. 150 for kerosene and a maximum concessionary price of Rs. 250 for diesel, whenever the prices of diesel and kerosene are revised.

title: Purchase of a Debt Management Software System required for the Public Debt Management in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - According to the Public Debt Management Act, No.33 of 2024, a Public Debt Management Office should be established. As per the provisions of section 23 of the said Act, timely, comprehensive and accurate data and information on public debt should be maintained in an appropriate data base. The Government is currently using the Commonwealth Secretariat Debt Recording and Management System (CS-DRMS) provided by the Commonwealth Secretariat to record and manage foreign debt, and it is established and maintained in the Department of External Resources. At present, the Commonwealth Secretariat has stopped updating the system and extending the annual license. Discussions regarding the establishment of Public Debt Management Office have been held with the Technical Missions of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank and it has been recommended that it is appropriate to use the Commonwealth Meridian software provided by the Commonwealth Secretariat or the DMFAS software provided by the United Nations Trade and Development Organization. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism, to obtain a proposal for the purchase of Commonwealth Meridian software from the Commonwealth Secretariat based on the reasons that the cost-effective, the ease of data migration, the maintenance of data integrity and the integrity between the systems can be confirmed, and to refer the said proposal to obtain the recommendations of a Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment for the post of District Secretary/Government Agent in the	Administrative District of Hambantota
decision_details: - Taking into consideration a request made by the Election Commission, the Cabinet decided to attach Mr. H.P. Sumanasekera who is currently serving in the post of District Secretary/Government Agent in the Administrative District of Hambantota, to the Ministry of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour with immediate effect and to appoint Mr. A.B.I. De Silva who is currently serving as the Secretary to the Ministry of Sports and Youth Affairs, Rural Development, Cultural and Arts Affairs, Social Welfare, Probation and Child Care Services, Women's Affairs and Home Economic Enhancement, Housing and Construction and Manpower and Employment in the Southern Province, for the said post.

title: Appointment to the post of Government Analyst
decision_details: - Mrs. Deepika Senevirathne, who served in the post of Government Analyst, has retired on 2024-10-11. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour to appoint Mrs. Pathirage Sandhya Kumuduni Rajapakshe, a Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Scientific Service, the next most Senior Officer as per the Seniority list of the Special Grade Officers in the Sri Lanka Scientific Service and currently serving in the post of Additional Government Analyst, for the said vacant post, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Resignation from the Post of Secretary to the Leader of the Opposition of 	Parliament
decision_details: - Mr. Thisath Dewapriya Banadara Wijayagunawardana who served as Secretary to the Leader of the Opposition of Parliament has submitted a letter to resign from the said post, serving until 2024‑10‑09. As such, the Cabinet granted its concurrence for the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister to accept his resignation.

title: Completion of the remaining work of the construction project of quarters complex for married personnel of the Special Task Force at Kalapaluwawa
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet had been granted at the meeting held on 2016‑08‑23 for the construction of 36 quarters in the Kalapaluwa area, including 15 quarters for married Sub Inspectors of the Special Task Force and 21 quarters for married Police Sergeants and Police Constables. Accordingly, the relevant contract has been awarded to Construction Managers & Planners (Pvt) Ltd, to a sum of Rs.289.59 million (without VAT). The project duration has been extended several times, and as of now, about 95% of the construction work has been completed. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security, to extend the project duration up to 2024‑12‑31 and to revise the project cost as Rs.460.58 million, taking into account the drastic increase of raw materials and the impact caused by the tax revisions introduced by the Government, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enhancing the productivity of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation by 	utilizing the finance received from transferring the land in Ekala	Transmission Station of the said Corporation
decision_details: - The land where the Ekala Transmission Station is located which is owned by the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation has been transferred to Urban Development Authority for a sum of Rs.1,286 million. It has been decided at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023-02-27 that the said amount should be utilized for the restructuring of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation as a self financing entity. As of now, Rs.525 million from that amount has been received by the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation and Rs.205 million out of that has been spent for the Voluntary Retirement Scheme implemented for the employees of the Corporation. The proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security, and Mass Media to execute 25 functions relevant for the refurbishment of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation by using Rs.145.72 million from the balalnce amount, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the supply of Security Service for Hospitals/Institutions falling under the purview the Ministry of Health for the years 2024/25
decision_details: - Bids have been invited from Rakna Arakshaka Lanka Ltd., LRDC Services (Pvt) Ltd., and the Civil Security Department for Hospitals and other Institutions falling under the purview the Ministry of Health and from the Regional Economic Development Agency functioning under the Central Provincial Council and the Wayamba Human Resources Development Authority functioning under the North-Western Provincial Council for Hospitals/Institutions located in the relevant Provinces, falling under the purview of the Ministry of Health by following the Limited Competitive Bidding Process. Accordingly, bids have been submitted by LRDC Services (Pvt) Ltd., for all Hospitals whereas the Regional Economic Development Agency functioning under the Central Provincial Council has submitted bids for Hospitals located in the said Province, falling under the Ministry of Health. As such, taking into consideration the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee and the proposal submitted by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Health, the Cabinet granted its approval to award the relevant Contract for the supply of security service to M/s LRDC Services (Pvt) Ltd., for a period of 06 Months with effect from 2024‑10‑01.

title: Procurement of Medical Supplies from Local Manufacturers
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet had been granted at the meeting held on 2013‑11‑29 to purchase locally manufactured pharmaceuticals under the Buy Back Agreement, in order to encourage local pharmaceutical manufacturers while giving priority to the functions of the State Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Corporation of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, approval of the Cabinet had been granted on 2018‑10‑02 to be in Buy Back Agreements for a period of 15 years for the productions of local manufacturing companies which are in agreement with the State Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Corporation of Sri Lanka, to purchase such pharmaceuticals giving priority to the State Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Corporation of Sri Lanka and to extend the Buy Back Agreements which have been entered into by the Ministry of Health with the local pharmaceutical manufacturers for a period of 10 years. A Pricing Committee has also been appointed to determine the prices of pharmaceuticals so supplied. As per the said procurement process, approximately 20% of the country's medical supply requirement is currently met and it has been recognized that there is a possibility of increasing that amount up to 40%. Accordingly, the Medical Supply Division of the Ministry has identified 49 local pharmaceutical manufacturing companies that have the ability to supply 454 medical supplies, including medicines. The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Health to enter into Buy Back Agreements to procure medicinal supplies including locally manufactured pharmaceuticals from the identified companies for a period of one year, without causing an injustice to the pharmaceutical manufacturing process of the State Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Corporation of Sri Lanka as well as to the local pharmaceutical manufacturing companies which have already been contracted, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Grant awarded from the International Council on Archives to the National	Archives
decision_details: - The Fund for the International Development of Archives of the International Council on Archives has agreed to provide a Grant of Euro 7000 for the “Establishment of Atom (Access to memory) and Archivematica software platforms at the National Archives of Sri Lanka” engaging specialists in open-source softwares Atom and Archivematica for archives description (Metadata) and digital Conservation. The International Council on Archives has agreed to utilize the said Grant to cover a part of the costs for Stage-1 of the Project that has been initiated already for the establishment of a trusted Digital Repository at the National Archives. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security, and Mass Media to sign the Project Charter with the International Council on Archives for obtaining the said Grant and to take other relevant steps in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transferring a plot of land belonging to the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation to the Ceylon Electricity Board for the construction of the proposed grid substation at Ekala
decision_details: - According to the high demand for electricity in Ekala and its surrounding areas, it has been proposed to build a grid substation in the Ekala industrial park with the aim of supplying electricity continuously as well as increasing the quality of the existing electricity system. It has been recognized that it is appropriate to construct the said grid substation by using a land portion of 02 acres and 02 roods from the 10 acres of land owned by the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation, which is located adjacent to Ekala Sandcrop Estate. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security and Mass Media to vest the said land with the Ceylon Electricity Board, having received Rs.320 million, the value which is the assessed by the Chief Government Valuer, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 77th Independence Day Ceremony
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour to appoint a Cabinet Committee under the chairmanship of the Hon. President and with the participation of the Hon. Prime Minister and the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security and Mass Media to provide necessary guidance and supervision pertaining to the conduct of the 77th Independence Day Ceremony falling on 2025‑02‑04 and to appoint a Steering Committee with the participation of all Heads of Institutions including all relevant Ministries, Departments, Tri Forces and Police, enabling to organize the Independence Day Ceremony in a splendid manner, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of Commissioner General of Excise
decision_details: - The Excise Department of Sri Lanka is one of the main revenue collecting agencies of the Government, and its efficiency and good governance directly affects the State revenue. The said Department should be given a leadership that can achieve the future challenges and objectives while maintaining the progress of achieving the revenue targets of the Department. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism to terminate with immediate effect, the service of Mr. J.M. Gunasiri, presently serving in the Post of Commissioner General of Excise on contract basis and appoint Mr. U.D.N. Jayaweera, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Inland Revenue Service, presently serving as the Additional Secretary to the President (Agency Coordination II), in the Presidential Secretariat, to act in the Post of Commissioner General of Excise, with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to act in the Post of Commissioner General for Registration of Persons
decision_details: - The Post of Commissioner General for Registration of Persons has become vacant from 2024‑09‑24. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to appoint Mrs. M.S.P. Suriyapperuma, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as an Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Public Security, to act in the Post of Commissioner General for Registration of Persons with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the service of the Director General of the Civil Security Department
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted to appoint Air Vice Marshal R.S Biyanwila to the Post of Director General of the Civil Security Department with effect from 2023‑09‑14. The duration of the said appointment has expired on 2024‑09‑13. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to continue to employ him in the Post of Director General of the Civil Security Department up to 2024‑12‑31, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Cancellation of Appointments made on the approval of the Cabinet of Ministers
decision_details: - Action has been taken to establish 'the Office for Overseas Sri Lankans Affairs', 'Jathika Jana Sabha Secretariat in order to establish the Jana Sabha System to Strengthen Participatory Democracy' and to implement the 'Agriculture Modernization Programme' under the Presidential Secretariat as per the approval of the Cabinet and officers/instructors have been appointed for the same on contract basis. Accordingly, the Hon. President informed the Cabinet that action has been taken to terminate the service of Officials/Instructors recruited on contract basis for the above offices and programmes, with effect from 2024‑09‑30, since the relevant Ministries have the capacity to implement the functions expected through the said offices and programmes and the Cabinet granted its concurrence for the same.

title: Digitization of Terrestrial Television Broadcasting Project to be implemented under the Japanese Loan Facility
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted in the year 2009 to convert the Sri Lanka Television Broadcasting to a broadcasting with Digital technology in place of the existing Analog technology, in line with the global trends. Due to various reasons, the implementation of the said work has been delayed and approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022‑07‑27 to implement the Digitization of Terrestrial Television Broadcasting Project under the ISDB-T Japanese technology. Since the Japan International Cooperation Agency has agreed to provide the necessary funds for the project as of now, it has been possible to start the work of the project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security and Mass Media to appoint a Special Committee with the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the Ministry in charge of the subject of Mass Media and comprising of representatives from other relevant institutions to examine the present day requirements and technical matters so as to ensure the implementation Digitization of Terrestrial Television Broadcasting Project in a way that will benefit the citizens of Sri Lanka and submit a Report with the observations and recommendations to the Cabinet, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Installation of Exhibition Stall representing Sri Lanka at the TTG - 2024 Tourism Exhibition to be held in Milan, Italy from 9th to 11th October 2024
decision_details: - 25 travel agents and hoteliers from the tourism industry will be participating in the TTG - 2024 Tourism Exhibition to be held in Milan, Italy from 09th to 11th October 2024. Accordingly, the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau has arranged to allocate 100 square meters of the exhibition area to provide facilities for them. Although, the said Bureau has invited bids under the limited international competitive bidding procedure for the construction of the exhibition stalls, no any bid has been received. Accordingly, it was decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet for the facts submitted by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism stating that the arrangements have been made to procure relevant services from Prostand S.r.l, the official construction company of the event organizers, considering the limited time period.

title: Awarding the Procurement for the supply, installation, commissioning and 	maintenance of Core Banking Solution for the Merchant Bank of Sri Lanka & 	Finance PLC (MBSL)
decision_details: - Bids have been invited following the National Competitive Procurement Procedure for the procurement for the supply, installation, commissioning and maintenance of Core Banking Solution for the Merchant Bank of Sri Lanka & Finance PLC. 04 institutions have submitted bids for the same. After evaluating the technical proposals and financial proposals submitted by the bidders, the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee have recommended the awarding of the relevant procurement to Scienter Technologies (PTE) Ltd. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism to award the said procurement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Regional Project on strengthening resilience of vulnerable	communications in Sri Lanka and India to increased impacts of climate	change
decision_details: - The Ministry of Environment, Wildlife, Forest Resources, Water Supply, Plantation and Community Infrastructure in-collaboration with the United Nations World Food Programme has submitted a proposal for a regional project on Strengthening resilience of vulnerable communications in Sri Lanka and India to increased impacts of climate change to the Adaptation Fund and it has been approved by the Adaptation Fund Board. The proposed project will be implemented within a period of 05 years and a Financial Grant of around USD13 million will be provided to Sri Lanka and India for the project. The project is scheduled to be implemented in the districts of Monaragala, Trincomalee, Mannar, Mullaitivu, Vavuniya and Kurunegala in Sri Lanka. The proposal made by the Minister of Environment, Wildlife, Forest Resources, Water Supply, Plantation and Community Infrastructure to sign the Memorandum of Understanding to implement the said project between Sri Lanka and the World Food Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 57th Session of the United Nations Human Rights Council
decision_details:
- Taking into account the matters submitted by the Minister of Foreign Affairs regarding the 57th Session of the United Nations Human Rights Council to be held in Geneva from 2024-09-09 to 2024-10-11, the concurrence of the Cabinet was granted to submit the stand of the Government of Sri Lanka as follows. 

* That Sri Lanka strongly rejects the draft Resolution proposed in the current session of the United Nations Human Rights Council and that Sri Lanka continues to oppose the Human Rights Council Resolution 51/1 and does not agree with any Resolution which extends the mandate of the external evidence gathering mechanism.

* 	That, although the Resolution was rejected, Sri Lanka is firmly determined to deal with major human rights issues including reconciliation through domestic processes.

* 	That Sri Lanka engages in cooperation and constructive dialogue with the Human Rights Council and regular human rights mechanisms.

title: Agreement on Cooperation and Mutual Administrative Assistance related to 	Custom Matters between Sri Lanka and Russia
decision_details: - Followed by a series of bilateral discussions held between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Russia, approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2021-11-15 to sign a bilateral Agreement to facilitate legitimate trade affairs through a transparent and predictable Customs procedure, however, the Agreement has not been signed yet. Taking into consideration the benefits gained from the existing trade relations between the two countries and the emerging trends of the bilateral Customs cooperation, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism to sign the said Agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Cabinet Spokesman
decision_details: - The Cabinet decided to appoint Hon. Vijitha Herath, Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security and Mass Media, as the Cabinet Spokesman.

title: Appointment to act in the Post of Controller General of Immigration and Emigration
decision_details: - Since Mr. I.S.H.J. Ilukpitiya who served as the Controller General of Immigration and Emigration has been remanded from 2024‑09‑25 on an Order at the Supreme Court, a suitable officer has to be appointed immediately to attend to the duties in the said post. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to appoint Mrs. B.M.D Nilusha Balasooriya, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as an Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Public Security, to act in the the Post of Controller General of Immigration and Emigration, with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of Director General of Government Information
decision_details: - The Post of Director General of Government Information has become vacant at present, since Mr. Dinith Chinthaka who served as the Director General of Government Information resigned from the said post. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security and Mass Media to appoint Mr. H.S.K.J. Bandara, Grade I Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as the Director (Administration) of the Department of Government Information, to act full time in the Post of Director General of Government Information, with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of Senior Advisors to the President
decision_details: - In terms of paragraph (1) of Article 41 of the Constitution, the President is vested with the power to appoint his staff in consultation with the Cabinet of Ministers. Accordingly, it was decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet to appoint Mr. Duminda Hulangamuwa and Dr. A.A.J.Fernando as Senior Advisors to the President on Economic Affairs and Finance on honorary service basis, with effect from 2024-09-24.

title: Removal of existing restrictions on release of imprest
decision_details: - It has been decided at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023-02-13 that the approval of the Minister in-charge of Finance should be obtained when releasing imprest to the relevant ministries by the General Treasury for certain expenses, based on the priority of such expenses. However, since it has been observed that it is not necessary to use a priority basis in the release of imprest further, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism to authorize the Secretary to the Ministry in-charge of Finance for the release of imprest for incurring essential expenses without obtaining the special approval of the Minister in-charge of Finance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revisiting the Entitlements, Allowances and Privileges of the Members of Parliament, Ministers and Former Presidents
Making Provisions for the General Election 2024
decision_details: - By the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2403/13 dated 2024‑09‑24, the 09th Parliament was dissolved and 2024‑11‑14 has been fixed as the date for the Parliamentary General Election. However, provisions required to conduct a Parliamentary General Election have not been allocated within the budget estimates 2024. In such case, it was decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet for the action taken by the Hon. President to issue Rs.05 billion from the Consolidated Fund for the year 2024, in terms of the powers vested with the President by paragraph (4) of Article 150 of the Constitution for the issuance of funds from the Consolidated Fund to conduct a Parliamentary General Election. Further, approval of the Cabinet was also granted to allocate Rs.06 billion for the expenses to be settled in the year 2025 for conducting the General Election, from the Vote on Account to be submitted to Parliament for the year 2025.

title: Granting Pardon to Mr. Diyunuge Edward Henry Pedris who was executed 109 years ago by an unjustifiable judgment of the Colonial Court Martial
decision_details: - Mr. Diyunuge Edward Henry Pedris who was then 27 years old, had been sentenced to death on 1915‑07‑07 without considering any appeal by the Colonial Administration of Sri Lanka, being convicted for the offence of treason, having court‑martialed him, allegedly accusing him of inciting riots and treason against the Government. The remains of Mr. Diyunuge Edward Henry Pedris had been cremated in an undisclosed location by adopting the procedure prescribed for cremating a criminal convicted under the martial law. It had been revealed later that his assassination had been executed as a plan of the senior officials who ruled the country then. Accordingly, upon the submission of the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2401/23 dated 2024‑09‑12 issued by the Hon. President, on the posthumous Presidential Pardon granted to the Late Mr. Diyunuge Edward Henry Pedris who had been unlawfully executed on 1915‑07‑07 after an unjust trial, it was decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet for the action taken by the Hon. President.

title: Amending the Proposed Personal Income Tax Structure
decision_details:
- As a measure to increase the Government tax revenue, a method of taxation on personal income was introduced from 2023‑01‑01 with the annual income tax exemption limit of Rs.1.2 million and the marginal tax rate from 6% to 36%. As a result, although the tax revenue of the Government was increased, the Government initiated discussions with the International Monetary Fund regarding the requests received to the fact that the middle-income earning group, who were more affected by the personal income tax, should receive some relief. The facts that the revenue targets of the Government are being met by the mid 2024 and certain fiscal targets have been over performed, were brought to the attention at those discussions. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to take necessary action to amend the Inland Revenue Act, No.24 of 2017, enabling to pursue action as follows from 2025‑04‑01 and impose legal provisions required for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

*	Maintaining the Tax free threshold as the same value of Rs. 1.2 million.

*	Increasing the first tax bracket of which the taxable income is determined from 	Rs. 500,000 to Rs. 720,000.

*	Thereafter, increasing each tax bracket up to the fifth tax bracket by Rs.220,000 each.

*	Maintaining the existing tax tares ranging from 6% to 36% unchanged.

title: Penal Code (Amendment) Act
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2024‑04‑29 to amend the Penal Code to prohibit corporal punishment in any sphere and to make appropriate legislation for the same. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter present the same in Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Removal of the temporary suspension on the importation of Motor Vehicles
decision_details:
- As a measure to reduce the increasing pressure on the country's foreign exchange market and to ensure the distribution of available foreign exchange for the importation of essential goods including medicine, fuel and food, the importation of non-essential goods has been temporarily suspended from March 2020. In view of the recovery of the economy with the reform measures agreed under the Extended Fund Facility Programme of the International Monetary Fund, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to lift the temporary import suspension related to the importation of motor vehicles and non-motorized goods classified under 304 HS Codes, was approved by the Cabinet.

*	Granting permission to import vehicles used for public passenger transportation, vehicles used for special purposes and other non‑motorized goods to be effective from 2024‑10‑01.

*	Granting permission to import vehicles used for commercial or goods transportation to be effective from 2024‑12‑01.

*	Granting permission to import motor vehicles used for personal purpose (Cars, Vans, Sport Utility Vehicles, Pickups etc.) to be effective from 2025‑02‑01.

title: Implementation of Floating Solar Projects on Reservoirs belonging to the Mahaweli Authority of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Government has given priority to the development of floating solar projects on the existing water bodies in order to increase the generation of renewable energy. Accordingly, the Sri Lanka Mahaweli Authority of Sri Lanka has identified 03 main reservoirs namely Randenigala, Moragahakanda and Kalawewa for the development of floating solar projects. Feasibility studies have been conducted regarding the aforesaid places. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to authorize the Ceylon Electricity Board to select investors under the competitive procurement procedure for the development of floating solar projects in the Randenigala, Moragahakanda and Kalawewa reservoirs, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of 165MW, AC Ground Mounted Solar PV Power Plants in 1-5 MW, AC capacity
decision_details:
- Bids have been invited for the development of projects up to 165MW for 20 grid substations, and the approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑09‑02 to award the contracts for other locations except for Anuradhapura, Galle and Deniyaya grid substations. The appeals submitted by the unsuccessful bidders for the Anuradhapura, Galle and Deniyaya grid substations have been rejected by the Procurement Appeal Board. Accordingly, based on the recommendations of the Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the relevant contracts as mentioned below, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing uniforms for Dhamma school teachers
decision_details: - An annual teachers' allowance of Rs.5,000/- is currently paid to encourage the Buddhist, Hindu, Islamic, Christian and Catholic Dhamma school teachers in appreciation of their service. In addition to the above allowance, a uniform	has been provided for the Dhamma school teachers till the year 2022, and the	programme of providing uniforms is currently not being implemented. In consideration of a proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs regarding the provision of uniforms for Dhamma school teachers, the approval of the Cabinet has been granted to provide an allowance of Rs.7,500/- annually as an incentive 	teacher allowance of Rs.5,000/- and the uniform allowance of Rs.2,500/- for the Dhamma school teachers representing all the religions in year 2025.

title: Selection of a Handling Agent for SriLankan Airlines Connecting Point	Services
decision_details: - Bids have been invited to select a Handling Agent for SriLankan Airlines connecting Point Services by following the National Competitive Bidding Procedure. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the relevant Contract to Lanka Sportreizen, the sole substancially responsive bidder as per the recommedations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Setting apart of the plot of land located at the Assessment No.135, Perahera Mawatha, Kollupitiya, Colombo 03 belonging to the Urban Development Authority for a mixed development projection a  99-year lease  basis
decision_details: - Proposals have been invited from the interested investors to set apart a plot of land of 35.95 perches at Perahera Mawatha, Kollupitiya, Colombo 03 belonging to the Urban Development Authority for a mixed development project on a 99-year lease basis. Accordingly, M/S GLOBAL LEASING LTD, which has been selected, has received the approval of the Board of Management of the Urban Development Authority and the Standing Cabinet appointed Negotiation Committee to set apart the relevant plot of land on a long-term lease basis.The proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to provide the said plot of land to the said Company on a 99-year lease basis to implement a mixed development project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting a study to improve Tuberculosis preventive therapy among the infected individuals
decision_details: - Tuberculosis is the second leading infectious disease in Sri Lanka and the leading cause of death among infectious diseases. In the year 2021, a guideline has been created for Sri Lanka also in line with the World Health Organization guidelines on TB Preventive Therapy. Accordingly, it is expected to conduct a study in Galle District to monitor the effectiveness of the care model proposed to be implemented under the National Programme for Tuberculosis Control and Chest Diseases, for which the International Union against Tuberculosis and Lung Disease has agreed to provide a financial grant of USD 387,280. The said study will be conducted jointly with the Faculty of Medicine of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura and the National Programme for Tuberculosis Control and Chest Diseases of the Ministry of Health. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Education and the Minister of Health to sign the Memorandum of Understanding among the International Union against Tuberculosis and Lung Disease, the Ministry of Health and the University of Sri Jayewardenepura to conduct the Study, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Designating the IFC Colombo 1 and Gateway International Campus as Primary Businesses of Strategic Importance
decision_details: - It has been stipulated under the provisions of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No. 11 of 2021 that the approval of the Cabinet must be obtained in order to designate a business as a business of strategic importance and to grant exemptions or incentives to that business. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to designate IFC Colombo 1 (PVT) LTD and Gateway International Campus (PVT) LTD which have been approved as authorized persons under the said provisions, as primary businesses of strategic importance and to grant proposed exemptions or incentives to those businesses, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing the Memorandum of Understanding between the Sri Lanka Export Development Board and the International Trade Centre (ITC) to launch the ITC SheTrades Hub in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Export Development Board of Sri Lanka has proposed to sign a non-financial MoU with the International Trade Centre (ITC) to launch an "ITC SheTrades Hub in Sri Lanka", to increase the participation and competitiveness of Women-Led Businesses (WLBs) in Sri Lanka in international trade. Through this the women entrepreneurs will get training opportunities on topics related to international trade such as markets and investment opportunities and get the required technical assistance. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to sign the proposed Memorandum of Understanding between the Sri Lanka Export Development Board and the International Trade Centre, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Trade Facilitation Roadmap for Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Approval of the cabinet has been granted in 2016 to establish a National Trade Facilitation Committee to enforce the Trade Facilitation Agreement of the World Trade Organization and coordinate the inter agency activities associated with the implementation of 36 commitments in the said Agreement. Under that, Sri Lanka is committed to implement the plan for the implementation of trade facilities within the period of 2017 - 2030. Countries in the Region have met a high percentage of the overall commitments of the said plan, but Sri Lanka has fulfilled only 37.4% of the total commitments. Considering the said situation, technical assistance has been requested from the Japan International Cooperation Agency with the technical expertise of the International Trade Center to conduct a complete assessment of the trade facilitation measures and to make independent recommendations so that the priority measures could be implemented on a fast-track basis. Accordingly, the "Trade Facilitation Roadmap for Sri Lanka" and the "Trade Facilitation Action Plan 2025‑ 2028" have been prepared with the participation of about 200 public and private stakeholders. The proposal made by the Hon. President to adopt the said Road Map and implement the action plan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion of Benefits under the Agrahara Medical Insurance Scheme
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024‑08‑12 has granted approval to introduce a Medical Insurance Scheme delivering more facilities to the employees in the Public Sector and all pensioners with more attractive benefits from January 2025. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to charge a monthly subscription of Rs.1,000/- from the pension of all pensioners and the salary of all employees in Public Sector and credit the said amount to the National Insurance Trust Fund thereby implementing the Medical Insurance Scheme with proposed more facilities with effect from 2025, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Potential for Sri Lanka's Accession to BRICS
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024‑01‑24 has decided to appoint an Officials' Committee to examine matters on Sri Lanka's Accession to BRICS and submit appropriate recommendations. The Officials' Committee appointed accordingly has submitted its Report having examined the pros and cons of Sri Lanka in accession to the BRICS and the New Development Bank to be established under the same. All stakeholders who attended to that have positively responded in obtaining membership of BRICS. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to apply for the membership of the BRICS and the New Development Bank to be established under the same by following the relevant diplomatic procedures, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of an integrated electronic solution for implementation of the system of collecting fines charged for the offenses not taken to the courts on the occasions of violation of road traffic rules and the driver demerit point system
decision_details: - Proposals have been invited under the double cover system to select a suitable supplier for introducing an integrated electronic solution for the implementation of a system of collecting fines charged for the offenses not taken to the courts on the occasions of violation of road traffic rules and the driver demerit point system. 09 bidders have submitted proposals for the same. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to award the relevant procurement to Millenium I.T.E.S.P (Pvt) Ltd. and Metropolitan Technologies (Pvt) Ltd. Joint Venture, based on the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Railway Station Buildings as Commercial Centres
decision_details: - Expressions of Interest have been invited to identify the investors interested in the development of railway stations in Kolpetty, Bambalapitiya, Wellawatta, Compannavidiya, Dehiwala and Mount Lavinia located in Colombo city under the Public‑Private Partnership Methodology. Since Expressions of Interest have been submitted for the development of Railway Stations located at various places in Sri Lanka, it has been found that there is a capacity to develop  railway stations located island wide. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minster of Transport and Highways to invite proposals on competitive basis to develop other railway stations as well under the Public‑Private Partnership Methodology and to select suitable investors, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Information Technology Strategic Plan for the Inland Revenue	Department
decision_details: - Information Technology Strategic Plan to support the digitization of the Inland Revenue Department as a structural benchmark under the IMF supported Extended Fund Facility Programme is required to be prepared by the Inland Revenue Department and approved by the Cabinet by the end of August 2024. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement the Information Technology Strategic Plan for the Inland Revenue Department prepared for the period of 2025-2027, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increasing Mahapola and Bursaries of University Students
decision_details: - Since the Mahapola and Bursary installments granted for university students have not been increased from 2015 to date, the necessity of revising the said installment amount had been brought to the notice of the Cabinet through a joint Memorandum submitted by the Minister of Education and the Minister Trade, Commerce and Food Security. Taking into consideration the said proposal, the Cabinet granted approval to increase the Mahapola installment up to Rs.7,500/- and the Bursary installment up to Rs.6,500/- with effect from April 2025.

title: Submission of Imports Control Regulations on Payment Terms No.11 of 2024 issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 for approval of Parliament (Open Account for Colombo Port City)
decision_details: - The Imports Control Regulations on Payment Terms No.11 of 2024 imposed under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 have been published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2398/18 dated 2024-08-21. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to present the said Regulations for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of the Import Duties levied on importation of goods
decision_details:
- The necessity of taking measures as the following has been identified, upon the requests of the stakeholders of the local industries and the trade sector, to be implemented in principle and presented in time in respect of the Customs Import Duty, CESS Levy, Special Commodity Levy and Ports and Airports Development Levy, which are the types of duties levied on importation of goods to the country.

* 	Exemption of certain imported goods which are subject to Special Commodity Levy and to include in the general import tax structure including the Customs Import Duty.

*	Revision of Customs Import Duty for importation of brown sugar.

* 	Revision of Import Duties on footwear, packaging, electrical equipment,	raw materials of plastic and rubber related industry and intermediate	goods under 	225 HS codes based on the recommendations of the 	Ministry of Industry to empower local industries.

* 	Reduction of import duties on infants and adult diapers and its raw materials.

* 	Introducing tax amendments as applicable for minimizing the usage of plastic and recycling in Sri Lanka.

* 	Elimination of existing import tax anomalies in respect of the importation of domestic bicycles and accessories industry, printing and printing ink industry, industries for local manufacturing of washing machines and liters and children's ready-made garments.

* 	Promotion of the export of Palmyra and Palmyra products, introduction of new HS Codes National sub-division customs codes to differentiate electrically operated toys and tippili varieties used for the production of local medicine manufacturing purposes and simplification of the procedure for exemption of CESS Levies on importation of raw materials used in the production of local medicines.

The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to take the following steps to implement the import revisions as stated above, was approved by the Cabinet.

*	Issuance of an Order under the Revenue Conservation Act, No.19 of 1962 and the amendment of the Customs Import Duties.

* 	Amendment of CESS Levy under the Export Development Act, No.40 of 1979.

*	 Imposition of Orders under the Special Commodity Levy Act, No.48 of 2007.

* 	Taking necessary measures concurrently under the Ports and Airports Development Levy Act, No.18 of 2011 and the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969, relevant to the tax revisions.

title: Establishment of a Financial Stability Fund
decision_details: - The Central Bank of Sri Lanka has identified the Strengthening the bank resolution framework under the crisis management framework in financial institutions regulated by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka as an urgent priority. A Financial Stability Fund should be established to ensure the achievement of the objectives of resolution and the effective implementation of the resolution measures provided for in the Act, under Section 15 of the Banking (Special Provisions) Act, No.17 of 2023. In terms of the Section 15(2) of the Banking (Special Provisions) Act, No.17 of 2023, the Financial Stability Fund should be managed separately from the other assets of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and the assets managed by the Central Bank as an independent fund. By 2024-07-31, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka has included the establishment of the Financial Stability Fund using the initial corpus provided by the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies and operationalizing the Financial Stability Fund with comprehensive guidelines to ensure an effective resolution framework as an indicative policy action of the 2nd Sub-Programme of the Financial Sector Stability and Reforms Programme. For that purpose, it is expected to obtain a loan of USD 200 million this year under the Financial Sector Stability and Reforms programme funded by the Asian Development Bank. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to establish the Financial Stability Fund with a nominal amount of Rs.1,000 million provided by the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies and to gradually build the fund by providing provisions from the Annual Budget subject to the prevailing fiscal constraints, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: International Interests in Mobile Equipment (Cape Town Convention) Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023-01-02 has granted approval to introduce the necessary legal provisions to access the International Interests in Mobile Equipment (Cape Town Convention) and the Protocol of the International Interests in Mobile Equipment on matters specific to Aircraft Equipment. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposal to dredge the sand deposits in the fishery harbour basins	managed by the Ceylon Fishery Harbour Corporation
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024-02-05 has granted approval to call for Expressions of Interest for the purpose of removing sand deposits in 22 Harbours of the Ceylon Fishery Harbour Corporation. Accordingly, the Ceylon Fishery Harbour Corporation has called Expressions of Interest for the project proposals to carry out dredging services in the fishery harbour basins managed by the said Corporation free of charge and for the commercial utilization of dredged raw materials in Kirinda, Chilaw and Valachchenai fishery harbours. For that purpose, 03 companies have submitted proposals and the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries to award the Contract for dredging at Kirinda, Chilaw and Valachchenai fishery harbours free of charge to the Supreme Global Holdings (Pvt) Ltd, based on the recommendations of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of New Regulator for the Petroleum Sector
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2024‑04‑25, to appoint a Committee to examine matters and make recommendations on the establishment of a regulatory mechanism for the Petroleum, Liquefied Petroleum Gas, Liquefied Natural Gas and Lubricant Sectors in Sri Lanka. The Committee appointed accordingly has submitted recommendations to introduce a new regulator for the petroleum sector. The proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to implement the said Committee recommendations and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill to regulate the Petroleum Industry, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Ratification of the UNESCO Convention on the Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions (2005) by Sri Lanka
decision_details: - In 2005, the UNESCO Organization has adopted a convention aimed at protecting and promoting the diversity of cultural expressions created in its member states. So far, 156 member states have accepted the said Convention, and Sri Lanka has not yet ratified the convention. A Committee consisting of Experts has been appointed to consider the ratification of the UNESCO Convention, and the concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the clearance of the Attorney General have been received for the recommendations of the said Committee. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to ratify the UNESCO Convention on the Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions (2005) by Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for the Protocol of exporting Wheat Bran Pellets from Sri Lanka to the Chinese Market
decision_details: - Approximately 20% of the wheat seeds imported into Sri Lanka are removed as bran pellets during the processing of wheat flour. There is a possibility of earning a large amount of foreign exchange by exporting the bran so removed as wheat bran pellets, to China. For that purpose, the necessity to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the two parties to follow a specific procedure has been identified. The concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has been received for the drafted Memorandum of Understanding. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to sign the said Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Agriculture and Plantation Industries and the General Administration of Customs of the People's Republic of China, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining a loan from the Asian Development Bank to implement the Water Supply and Sanitation Reform Programme
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka is planning to obtain 02 credit facilities worth USD 200 million from the Asian Development Bank for the implementation of the Water Supply and Sanitation Reform Programme. Under the said programme, it has been proposed to implement 02 sub-programmes each amounting to USD 100 million by the Government of Sri Lanka. The discussions relating to obtaining the loan amount of USD 100 million for its first programme “Strengthening climate resilience, inclusion, and environmental sustainability of water supply operation”, have been completed. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies pertaining to obtaining the said credit facility, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Securing funds from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) for the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Program (MWSIP)
decision_details: - The Mahaweli Water Security Investment Program has been implementing under the Multi-tranche Financing Facility of the Asian Development Bank since 2015 and under the said programme 03 major projects are being implemented. The original estimated cost of the said programme is USD 675, of which USD 453 was agreed to be provided by the Asian Development Bank.  Its first installment has been granted in the year 2015 whereas the second installment has been granted in 2017. Negotiations with the Asian Development Bank to obtain US$ 93 million of the remaining loan amount have been completed, and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the relevant loan Agreement. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to enter into a loan Agreement with the Asian Development Bank in order to obtain USD 93 million from the Regular Ordinary Capital Resources of the Asian Development Bank, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining a loan facility from the Asian Development Bank for the Financial Sector Stability and Reform Programme of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑09‑25 to  obtain a Policy-Based Loan amounting to USD 400 million from the Asian Development Bank, under 02 sub‑programmes, in order to implement the Financial Sector Stability and Reform Programme of Sri lanka. Accordingly, a loan amounting to USD 200 million has been granted for the first sub‑programme by December 2023. In order to obtain USD 200 million under its second sub-program, 12 pre-policy activities have to be completed and as of now, most of the said policy activities have already been completed or are in the final stages of their completion. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to obtain a loan amount of USD 200 million from the Asian Development Bank under the second sub‑programme of the Financial Sector Stability and Reform Programme of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making necessary provisions to re-call of nominations for protecting the Fundamental Rights of Voters who have been deprived of the Right to Vote and the Election Candidature at the Local Authorities Elections
Burial and Cremation Rights Act
decision_details: - Clarence of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman to make provisions to confer the right to every person to make a decision on the manner of disposing the body of such person after death and in case of death of a person who has not expressed the consent as to the manner of disposal of his body after death, to confer the next of kin of such person the right to decide whether the body of such person shall be buried or cremated, giving due consideration to the known preferences and religious, cultural or personal beliefs of the deceased. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the Bill prepared accordingly in the Government Gazette and to submit the same thereafter to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Registration of Persons (Amendment) Bill to Parliament
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2020‑11‑16 has instructed the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill to amend the Registration of Persons Act No. 32 of 1968 in order to facilitate the implementation of the Unified Digital Identity Framework in Sri Lanka. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. The proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and to submit the same, thereafter to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka and the Rio Branco Institute of the Ministry of the Foreign Affairs of the Fedarative Republic of Brazil
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka and the Rio Branco Institute of the Ministry of the Foreign Affairs of the Fedarative Republic of Brazil on the cooperation in the areas of mutual interest such as promoting close collaboration in training of diplomats, facilitating them for short and mid-term training programmes, exchange of information and experiences concerning their respective programmes of study and research and exchange of information and views related to international trends. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to sign the proposed Cooperation Agreement between two parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Orders made under the Colombo Port City Economic Commission 	Act, No. 11 of 2021 to Parliament
Rescue, Rehabilitation and Insolvency Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023-05-22 has granted approval to introduce a new law incorporating the required legal provisions on Rescue, Rehabilitation and Insolvency. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney	General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. The joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of 165MW, AC Ground Mounted Solar PV Power Plants in	(1-5)MW, AC capacity
decision_details:
- Competitive proposals have been invited for the development of Projects of	165 MW substations for grid substations of Ampara, Anuradhapura, Athurugiriya, Beliatta, Deniyaya, Galle, Habarana, Horana, Kosgama, Kurunegala, Madampe, Mahiyanganaya, Mahawa, Matara, Mathugama, Pannala, Polonnaruwa, Trincomalee, Vavunathivu and Veyangoda. After evaluating the proposals submitted by the bidders for each location, recommendations  have been submitted by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee. The proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the relevant contracts to the substantially responsive successful bidders, based on the said recommendations, was approved by the Cabinet.
