*	Contracts relating to obtain 02 aircraft to a lease rent of USD 365,000 from Aergo Capital Limited for a period of 08 years.

title: Submission of Orders published in the Gazettes for approval of Parliament
Presentation of Regulations made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs under section 34(1) of the Convention Against Doping in Sport Act, No.33 of 2013, in Parliament
decision_details: - As per the provisions of the Convention Against Doping in Sport Act, No.33 of 2013, the Prohibited List should be annually published in the Gazette. Since, it has been reported that prohibited substances are given to athletes as well as animals used in sports, related Prohibited List for Equestrian Sports and Horse Racing has also been published from this year. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs to present the Anti-Doping (Prohibited List) Regulations No.09 of 2023 published in the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2373/14 dated 2024‑02‑27 under the provisions of the Convention Against Doping in Sport Act, No.33 of 2013, for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Gazette Notifications for approval of Parliament
Establishment of 09MW solar PV Power Plants with 1-5 MW capacity in 	Pallekele
decision_details: - Cabinet has granted approval on 2023‑05‑22 to call for proposals for the establishment of solar PV power plants with 07 MW capacity. Accordingly, after evaluating the proposals so received, 04 successful project proponents have been identified by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee. Further, after evaluating the proposal of another investor based on the recommendations of the Procurement Appeal Board, the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee has recommended the said investor also as a suitable investor for the implementation of a 05 MW capacity solar PV power plant project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the contracts to build and operate solar PV power plants with a total capacity of 09 MW, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Permission to import Black gram
decision_details: - The annual black gram requirement in Sri Lanka is about 20,000 MT, but due to the	time durations of the product reaching the market, a shortage of black gram in the	market is observed during the festive months of April and December every year. Accordingly, measures should be taken to prevent the shortage of black gram in the market and control the price increase in black gram during the coming festive	season. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to lift the temporary ban imposed currently on the importation of black gram and import 2,000 MT of black gram according to the local requirement only through Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation Ltd, the National Food Promotion Board and the Sri Lanka Hadabima Authority, subject to the Special Commodity Levy imposed as per the Special Commodity Levy Act, No.48 of 2007, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Energy Efficiency Testing Laboratory for Air Conditioners in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Government of Korea has agreed to support the establishment of a laboratory in Sri Lanka to test the energy efficiency of air conditioners under the Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Reduction Project. The establishment of the laboratory and the training of the necessary human resources of the project which is financed through the Korea Energy Agency are planned to be completed in the year 2024. The concurrence 	of the	Department of External Resources, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Attorney General's Department has been received for the Record of Discussion to be 	signed by the Government of South Korea and the Government of Sri Lanka expressing their agreement for the implementation of the proposed project and the Terms of Reference. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to sign the Record of Discussion and the Terms of Reference between the two countries so that the proposed project can be implemented, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: State Vesak Celebration of B.E. 2568
decision_details: - The State Vesak Celebration of B.E.2568 (2024) is scheduled to be conducted centering the Matale District with the theme of 'Aththanowa Awekkheyya Kathani Akathani Cha (Let's be inquisitive for what we have done, not what others have done)' declaring the period from 2024-05-21 to 2024-05-27 as the Vesak Week. The opening ceremony and the closing ceremony of the State Vesak Celebration are to be held at Dharmaraja Piriwen Premises in Matale and the Sri Sunandarama Vihara premises in Millawana of Pallepola Divisional Secretariat Division respectively. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to implement the series of programmes planned for the State Vesak Celebration and close the animal slaughter houses, meat shops and drug selling places including liquor stores on 22, 23 and 24 May 2024, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Ocean University of Sri Lanka	and the University of Notre Dame, United States of America
decision_details: - It has been proposed to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ocean University of Sri Lanka and the University of Notre Dame, United States of America to implement a Research Project on Ocean and Atmospheric Science in the Bay of Bengal for a validity period of 05 years from 2024 to 2028. It is aimed to facilitate the skills development of the academics, researchers, undergraduates and postgraduate students at the Ocean University of Sri Lanka and other National Universities and Higher Education Institutes in Sri Lanka through this project. The total cost of the proposed project is USD 62,000 and the University of Notre Dame and the University of Washington, United States of America have agreed to grant USD 60,000 from that amount. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ocean University of Sri Lanka and the University of Notre Dame, United States of America to implement the proposed project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting the Ehelepola Walawwa with the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic
decision_details: - The Secretary to the President had been informed to discuss with all the relevant parties and submit a Report with recommendations to the Cabinet in respect of the vesting of the Ehelepola Walawwa with the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic, in terms of a Cabinet decision made at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-02-19. Accordingly, through the Report submitted, a project with related to Ehelepola Walawwa has been set up by the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic to establish a Wax Sculpture Museum in this building reflecting the glory and the environmental background of the Kandyan Kingdom that existed hundreds of years ago, leading the Ehelepola Family and with the aim of presenting the information on that history to the modern society in a more attractive manner and creating local and foreign tourist attraction thereby. Therefore, it has been recommended that it would be appropriate to vest the respective Building with the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to vest the Ehelepola Walawwa and the land belonging to the same with the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic by a Temporality Deed, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Economic Transformation Bill
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2024-03-04 to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare the Economic Transformation Bill. The Initial Draft for the Economic Transformation Act has been prepared including the main objectives of the National Policy on Economic Transformation and incorporating necessary provisions enabling the establishment of the key Institutions namely Economic Commission, Investment Zone Sri Lanka, Office for International Trade, Sri Lanka Institute of Economics and International Trade and National Productivity Commission, to support the Government to achieve those objectives.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare the Bill and submit expeditiously, incorporating the amendments submitted by the Attorney General, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Digital Economy Strategy for Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The necessity of National Digital Economy Strategies and implementation plan for the same has been identified in order to achieve the country's vision of becoming a high income economy by 2048 and reach anticipated results. Accordingly, the  “National Digital Economy Strategy for Sri Lanka - 2030” has been prepared with the participation of experts in the field and consultation of the professional bodies and chambers. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology to implement the said strategy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the National Minimum Wage of Workers Act
decision_details: - As per the provisions of the National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No.3 of 2016, the National Minimum Wage has been set as Rs.12,500/-. A triparte subcommittee consisting of trade unions and employees representing Small and Medium Entrepreneurs appointed on the recommendations of the National Labour Advisory Council, has recommended to increase the National Minimum Wage up to Rs.17,500/-. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment to amend the National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No.3 of 2016, enabling to increase the National Minimum Wage by Rs.5000/- from Rs.12,500/- to Rs.17,500/- and National Minimum Daily Wage by Rs.200/- from Rs.500/- to Rs.700/-, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Repeal of the Prevention of Domestic Violence Act, No.34 of 2005
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2023-06-12 to publish the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman to amend the Prevention of Domestic Violence Act, No.34 of 2005 catering to the current needs in the Government Gazette and submit the same in Parliament for approval. However, since the amendments have to be made to a large number of sections in the Act, it deemed appropriate to repeal the current Act in effect and to formulate a new Act under the same title including all the relevant amendments, for the easy understanding of the public. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a new Act enabling to pursue action in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Repealing the Special Commodity Levy Act, No.48 of 2007
decision_details: - Special Commodity Levy has been imposed under the Special Commodity Levy Act, No.48 of 2007 to charge a single composite levy to facilitate the importation of 64 goods classified under 210 HS Codes. Due to various issues arised during the implementation of the Levy, the necessity of repealing the said Levy Act has been identified. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to repeal the said Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of an Order to Parliament for approval as per the provisions of the Revenue Protection Act No.19 of 1962
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑05‑29 has granted approval to resume the Sri Lanka's Tariff Liberalization Programme under the Sri Lanka - Singapore Free Trade Agreement. Accordingly, an Order has been published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification dated 2023‑06‑30 as per the provisions of the Revenue Protection Act No.19 of 1962 in order to eliminate the first annual installment of the Customs Import Duty imposed on 1,116 HS Codes classified with regard to Category 6 of the Tariff Liberalization Programme of the Sri Lanka - Singapore Free Trade Agreement, with effect from 2023‑07‑01. Approval of Parliament has also been received for the said Order on 2023‑10‑04. An Order has been published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification dated 2024‑01‑04 as per the provisions of the Revenue Protection Act No.19 of 1962 in order to remove the Customs Import Duty applicable for 1,222 HS Codes classified under the Category 6 of the Tariff Liberalization Programme for the implementation of the second phase of the said Programme. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the said Order to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the establishment 70 MW, AC ground mounted solar PV power 	plants in 1 to 5 MW, AC capacity
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑10‑02 has granted approval to award 	the relevant contracts for the supply of 51MW to establish Solar PV Power 	Plants at 5 Grid Substations on Build, Own and Operate basis with 20 years 	operational period under the Project for establishment of 70MW, AC ground 	mounted Solar PV Power Plants in 1-5 MW AC capacity at 11 Grid 	Substations. Proposals have been re-invited for the supply of 19 MW for the 	remaining 06 Grid Substations. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister 	of Power and Energy to award the contracts for the establishment of  Solar PV 	Power Plants at Ampara, Habarana, Kosgama, Kurunegala, Pannala and 	Weyangoda Grid Substations, to the relevant investors, as recommended by the 	Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee taking into consideration the 	proposals submitted, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Hosting the International Conference conducted annually by the	International Pepper Community, in Sri Lanka in the year 2024
decision_details: - The International Organization called the International Pepper Community has been established in the year 1972 jointly by the major pepper producing  countries in the world under the United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia. Sri Lanka, India, Indonesia, Malaysia and Vietnam function as the major and permanent members of this Organization. Sri Lanka has obtained the permanent membership of the  International Pepper Community in the year 2002 and its annual International Conferences have been held in Sri Lanka in the years 1999, 2006, 2012 and 2017. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to host the 52nd International Conference of the International Pepper Community in Sri Lanka in this year, with a view to reaching agreements pertaining to the fields of sharing the results of technological and economic research relating to the pepper production among the member countries, formulating and promoting programmes for traditional and new markets and building up collaboration for relaxing tariff and non tariff barriers in the international market, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conferring the Expressways being in operation under the Road Development Authority to Sahasya Investments Ltd. (SIL)
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2024‑02‑05 to separate the expressway network, expressway lands, expressway loans(local) and the staff from the Road Development Authority and assign them with Sahasya Investments Ltd., in order to be able to manage them in a more commercial manner and approval has been given for the Action Plan related thereto at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑02‑05. Accordingly, Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to transfer the day-to-day operations and management of the existing expressways to Sahasya Investments Ltd., under a formalized Management Agreement, to be effective from 2024‑04‑01 and to transfer all relevant assets to Sahasya Investments Ltd., within a period of 06 months after conducting a legal and a financial feasibility study which will be jointly carried out by the Road Development Authority and Sahasya Investments Ltd.

title: Improvement of training courses and other facilities of the Korea National Vocational Training Institute (K-TEC)
decision_details: - Sri Lanka - Korean National Vocational Training Institute, Orugudawatta  was established under a financial assistance of Rs.2,900 million provided by the Export Import Bank of Korea. The Export Import Bank of Korea has agreed to grant a financial support of USD 1.5 million to further improve the courses conducted by the Institute and the existing facilities in the Institute. This project, which is proposed to be implemented within a period of 16 months, will facilitate the common requirements of all courses including Automobile Technology, CNC Manufacturing Technology, Welding Technology, Electrical Technology, Electronic Technology, Automation and Robotic Technology, Fluid Power Technology and Mechatronics Technology. The clearance of the Attorney General and the concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Department of External Resources have been received for the draft Memorandum of Understanding to be signed between the two parties in order to implement the proposed project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to sign the relevant  Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Promotion of registration of vessels under the Flag of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Registration of vessels is a major source of a large amount of foreign exchange inflow to the local economy and there is a potential to generate many direct and indirect employment opportunities. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to call for Expressions of Interest from eligible local and foreign institutions for promotion of the registration of vessels under the Flag of Sri Lanka, and to evaluate such proposals by a Technical Evaluation Committee and select the most suitable institution based on the recommendations of a Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Designate CODEGEN INNOVATIONS (PRIVATE) LIMITED as a Secondary Business of Strategic Importance
decision_details: - CODEGEN INNOVATIONS (PRIVATE) LIMITED is a company registered in Sri Lanka as a division of the CodeGen Group which specialises in technology solutions encompassing software, data science, design and hardware. The  Company has been approved as an authorized person by the Colombo Port City Economic Commission and the said Company has made a request to designate it as a Secondary Business of Strategic Importance. The Company has planned to make an initial investment of USD 500,000 and generate approximately USD 15 million within a period of 05 years and create approximately 400 job opportunities during that period. Therefore, as per the provisions of the Colombo Port City (Guidelines on the Grant of Exemptions or Incentives to Businesses of Strategic Importance) Regulations, No.02 of 2023, the said Company is eligible to be granted exemptions or incentives. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion for granting exemptions or incentives to CODEGEN INNOVATIONS (PRIVATE) LIMITED as per the provisions of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act and  publish an Order for the same, in the Government Gazette, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importing eggs required for providing eggs to the consumers at a reasonable	price
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2023-12-18 to import eggs upto 2024-04-30 in order to maintain a stable price for eggs in the local market. Accordingly, approximately 18 million eggs have been imported so far and it has been calculated that another 42 million eggs should be imported for the needs during the festive season. Bids have been invited from the Indian companies recommended by the Department of Animal Production and Health to import the required quantity of eggs and the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to award the relevant procurements as per the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Approved Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief to Low-income families
decision_details: - At the beginning of the year 2023, arrangements were made by the Government to provide Nadu rice 10 kg for each family per month for a period of two months covering approximately 2.74 million families in 25 districts including Samurdhi beneficiaries. It has been observed that it is appropriate to implement the said programme in this year as well as	a support to maintain the nutrition level of identified low-income families. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to implement the programme of providing 10 kgs of rice for one family per month for a period of two months covering approximately 2.74 million low-income families identified through District Secretaries/Government Agents with the involvement of Small and Medium Scale paddy millers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Procurement for the implementation of Rooftop Solar Power	projects implemented in Religious places under Indian Government Funds
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2024-01-08 to install Rooftop Solar Power systems in religious places, under a loan facility of US$ 1,000 million granted by the State Bank of India, subject to a credit limit of US$ 17 million. Accordingly, bids have been invited to select a suitable institution to implement this project and 06 bids have been received. Taking into consideration the recommendation made by the Procurement Appeal Board on the recommendation submitted by the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Approved Procurement Committee, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the procurement of Implementation of  Rooftop Solar Power systems for a contract price of US$ 17 million to M/s Premier Energies Ltd, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Acceleration of Rural Development Programmes
decision_details: - Many development projects which were initiated at rural level had to be halted, due to the economic issues prevailed in the past few years. However, since the Government has already made a considerable investment for these projects, the said projects should be completed expeditiously and provide the anticipated benefits of the same to the rural community. It has been observed that the amount of provisions allocated under the Decentralized Budget Programme are not sufficient to carry forward the Rural Development Programmes which have already been halted midway in the relevant areas. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to provide allocation of another Rs. 2000 million under the Decentralized Budget Programme to re-implement the Development Projects that had to be halted in the midway at rural level and increase the provisions allocated for Special Development Initiatives of implemented under the supervision of the Presidential Secretariat by another Rs.1000 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing Fertilizer Subsidy to the farmers for Yala Season 2024
decision_details:
- The National Fertilizer Secretariat has estimated that 110,298.1 MT, 27,711.1 MT and 33,412.4 MT of Urea, TSP and MOP chemical fertilizers respectively are required for paddy cultivation in Yala season 2024. Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposals submitted by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries, the Cabinet decided the following:

    • Importation of fertilizer for Yala season 2024 by the Ceylon Fertilizer Company Ltd. and Colombo Commercial Fertilizer Company Ltd. and sell them to the farmers at a concessionary price competitively with the Private sector. 
      
    • Provision of an amount of Rs.15,000/- as a Financial subsidy per hectare for maximum of 2 hectares cultivated per farmer for paddy cultivation in Yala season 2024, by the Department of Agrarian Development.

    • Direct remittance of the relevant financial subsidy to the bank accounts of the farmers.

title: Establishment of an Inter-Ministerial Tourism Committee
decision_details: - Since it has been identified that the present resurgence of Sri Lanka's Tourism industry plays a vital role towards the country's economic recovery and growth, it has been proposed through the Budget 2024, a number of steps including the implementation of a long term programme for the promotion of tourism sector and targeting at least 05 million tourists to the country per year. Owing to the multi‑faceted nature of the tourism industry and the distribution of various assets, laws and responsibilities among several Government institutions, It is essential to maintain an efficient coordination and collaboration among the relevant institutions to reap the expected benefits. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to establish an Inter-Ministerial Tourism Committee headed by the Secretary to the President with  the representations of the relevant Government institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Civil Procedure Code (Amendment) Bill (Issue and Service of summons)
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meetings held on 2021‑10‑11 and 2023‑07‑31 to amend the Civil Procedure Code incorporating necessary provisions to improve the procedure for issuance and service of summons in relation to a civil proceeding by including the mode of service of summons via courier service and electronic mail as ordinary services and also another several amendments to suit with the present day needs. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received to the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Primary Courts Procedure Act
decision_details: - A Primary Court, in respect of a dispute affecting land, take only preventive or provisional action pending the final adjudication on title or right to possession which is the function of a civil court. Since a Primary Court order prevails until a final decision is made by a District Court in determining rights and District Court action is subject to two appeals, inevitable delays occur and in this context, even a trespasser or a squatter would be able to remain in possession of the relevant land for an inequitable period of time. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the  Primary Courts Procedure Act enabling to fulfill the objectives expected through section 66 of the Primary Courts Procedure Act, No. 44 of 1979  as amended by the Act No. 49 of 1980 more effectively, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparing a Bill to amend the Constitution
decision_details: - It has been found necessary to change the existing electoral system to achieve the objectives of the Regulations of Election Expenditure Act No. 3 of 2023 and to ensure full realization of a democratic election. A Cabinet Sub‑Committee has been appointed to submit a Report with recommendations to the Cabinet after obtaining the views of all Party leaders representing Parliament and other relevant Parties for that purpose. They have expressed their views to the Committee to elect 160 out of the 225 Members of Parliament by the voters directly in the respective constituency and to elect the rest of 65 Members of Parliament at national or provincial level as per the proportional representation and the majority of participants have expressed their concurrence for that. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft necessary legislation to amend the Electoral system, taking also into consideration the recommendations submitted by the Committee appointed under the Chairmanship of Prime Minister, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Sri Lanka Foundation Act, No.31 of 1973
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Foundation established under the Sri Lanka Foundation Act, No.31 of 1973 functions as a centre for training and awareness services related to sustainable development, social integrity, socio-economic development, good governance, entrepreneurship and democracy. As of now, the Sri Lanka Foundation conducts different courses from certificate level to higher national diploma level and the need has arisen to revise the aims and objectives as well as the powers and functions of the said Foundation so as to suit to the present day requirements. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Mass Media to amend the  Sri Lanka Foundation Act, so as to be able to take action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Sapugaskanda Oil Refinery as a State-owned Enterprise separated from the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC)
decision_details: - The Sapugaskanda Oil Refinery, the only oil refinery in Sri Lanka, was established in 1969 and supplies about 25% of the domestic demand for refined petroleum products. The need to make a critical investment has been identified in order to update the relevant refinery and use it for another 25 years and it has been observed that it is appropriate to establish the Sapugaskanda Oil Refinery as a separate State-owned enterprise enabling to secure required investments for that purpose through both local and foreign private sectors. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Ministry of Power and Energy to establish the Sapugaskanda Oil Refinery as a State-owned enterprise separated from the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The island-wide programme of collecting information relevant to the issuance of Free Grants with absolute ownership under the "Urumaya" Programme and information relevant to young entrepreneurs under the programme of raising a million young entrepreneurs nationwide
decision_details: - As of now, nearly 2 million families in the country have been given Grants/Permits for the lands they enjoy. Under the 'Urumaya' Programme, it has been planned to grant the absolute ownership of State lands to the grantees and permit holders, in the year 2024. Further, It has been planned to implement a programme to raise a million young entrepreneurs in the entire island. It is expected to collect information required to implement theses two programmes with the assistance of Grama Niladharies of respective Divisions by deploying the youth force of the National Youth Services Council so as to cover the all 14,022 Grama Niladhari Divisions in the Island. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism and Lands to expeditiously implement the 'Urumaya' Programme and  the programme to raise a million young entrepreneurs, having collected required information by utilizing the existing mechanism at Divisional Secretariat level, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of Hungary for Sports and Sports Education
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of Hungary in order to develop and strengthen the cooperation between the two parties by promoting  the fields of sports and sports education. The clearance of the Attorney General for that purpose has been received for the draft MoU. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs to sign the said MoU, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Meeting National Obligations to Montreal Protocol in Consistent with the Kigali Amendment on Phase-Down of Hydrofluorocarbon
decision_details: - Sri Lanka has ratified the Kigali Amendment of the Montreal Protocol on phasing-down of hydrofluorocarbon in 2018. Accordingly, Sri lanka is legally bound to phase down import-export trade and consumption of hydrofluorocarbon from 2024‑01‑01. Cabinet approved the proposal made by the  the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Environment to phase down the import hydrofluorocarbon virgin chemicals and all mixtures containing such chemicals to Sri Lanka and consumption of such chemicals in consistent with the national obligations of the Kigali Amendment of the Montreal Protocol, while adhering to the said legal bond and to implement hydrofluorocarbon import trade through an annual quota system without causing adverse impacts to the sectors that use hydrofluorocarbon such as agriculture, fisheries, health, tourism, transport, industries, housing and construction.

title: The Recovery of Loans by Banks (Special Provisions) No.4 of 1990	(Amendment) Bill
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2024-02-26 to temporary suspend taking action by the Banks up to 2024.12.15, pertaining to the sale by public auction of any property mortgaged to recover any loans defaulted by the borrowers and amend the Recovery of Loans by Banks (Special Provisions) Act, No.4 of 1990 to provide provisions for that purpose. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Recovery of Loans by Banks (Special Provisions (Amendment) Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman and the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present it in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Glocal Fair District Mobile Service Programme Series 2024 - Jayagamu	Sri 	Lanka
decision_details: - Arrangements have been made to conduct a series of Glocal Fair Mobile Service Programmes across 25 districts as a comprehensive programme designed with an aim of recreating the country's labour market to cater to the global requirements, enabling the easy accessibility to the general public at one place in their residential areas all the services delivered by the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment, Department of Manpower and Employment, Department of Labour, Sharma Vasana Fund and other institutions coming under the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment. Through this programme, it is expected to introduce facilities and opportunities to migrant workers and their children in youth whom are to be joined the future labour market to improve their educational and vocational skills and provide opportunities for the further upgrading of the quality of life of the migrant workers and to get their issues resolved.  Accordingly, as per the proposal made by the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment, it was decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet for the actions taken relating to the conduct of Glocal Fair Mobile Service Programme Series in all the districts through the institutions coming under the purview of the Ministry.

title: Gender Equality Bill
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022-09-05 to prepare the Gender Equality Bill. Clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Gender Equality Bill prepared accordingly and the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present it in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Donation of Japanese Yen One Thousand and Six Hundred Million (JPY1600 million) by the Government of Japan under the Japanese Economic and Social Development Programme
decision_details:
- During the present economic crisis in Sri Lanka, the Government of Japan has extended its cooperation by providing instant humanitarian assistance for the affected community and empowering the public sector. Accordingly, the  Government of Japan has agreed to award Japanese Yen One Thousand and Six Hundred Million (approximately LKR 3.3 billion) in order to implement the following projects under the Japanese Economic and Social Development Programme.

		i.	The project for improving oil spill response and management of 		the Sri Lanka coast guard

		ii.	The project for the provision of supportive equipment for 			maternal and pediatric care at major hospitals in the Northern 		Province and equipping dressmaker courses at vocational training 		centres in the Northern Province.

		iii.	The project for the provision of supportive equipment for the 		safety of fishermen in the Northern and Eastern Provinces.

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to sign the Exchange of Notes and other related documents with the Government of Japan to obtain grant assistance under the Japanese Economic and Social Development Programme. for the implementation of the above projects, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Publication of Standardization and Quality Control Regulations Under the Imports and Exports Control Act, No. 1 of 1969
decision_details: - Imports and Exports Control (Standardization and Quality Control) Regulation 2017 have been imposed under the provisions of the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969 in order to establish Standards and Quality on importation of 122 categories of goods classified under 217 HS Codes, aiming to safeguard the national economy, public health and environment. It has been found to be required to revise the existing standards and quality parameters in the Standards Regulation 2017 in order to facilitate expeditious, safer and effective trade flows as well as to ensure a level playing field for domestic products and imported products. Under this backdrop, the Sri Lanka Standards Institution, in consultation with key stakeholders including the Government Institutions, Business Associations and Chambers has revised and updated  the existing standards and quality parameters. Accordingy, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to impose Imports and Exports Control (Standardization and Quality Control) Regulations of 2024 under the  provisions of the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969 by rescinding the Imports and Exports Control (Standardization and Quality Control) Regulations 2017 without prejudice, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of 100MW, Oddamawadi, Baticaloa Solar Power Project on 	Build, Own and Operate basis
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2021‑08-30 to call for Expressions of Interest for the renewable energy development with a capacity of 50 MW or above of various renewable energy technologies. Accordingly, taking into consideration the Expressions of Interest received,  the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the  project for the establishment of a Solar Power Project of 100MW at Oddamawadi, Baticaloa on Build, Own and Operate basis, with an operational period of 20 years, to Solar Forge Batticaloa, as per the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of ground mounted/floating solar PV power plants on Build, Own and Operate basis
decision_details: - International competitive bids have been invited for the supply of electricity from PV solar power plants for the grid substations of Matara (10 MW) and Vavunathiv (08 MW). Accordingly, based on the project proposals received, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the contract for the  establishment of ground mounted solar PV power plant in the Matara grid substation to Mahawa Solar (Pvt)Ltd and Hayleys Power (Pvt.) Ltd and the contract for the establishment in the Vavunathiv grid substation to Capital City Holdings (Pvt) Ltd., on Build, Own and Operate basis, as per the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Disposition of a block of land belonging to the Urban Development Authority for a health and related activities development project
decision_details: - Investment proposals have been invited on competitive basis for the disposition of a block of land located at Kirimandala Mawatha, Narahenpita belonging to the Urban Development Authority for a health and related activities development project for a period of 50 years. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing for the disposition of a block of land in extent of 0.1929 hectares to M/s N W Reality (Pvt.) Ltd incorporated amalgamating M/s Ninewells Hospitals (Pvt) Ltd. and M/s Access International (Pvt) Ltd., on lease basis for a period of 50 years, based on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee made after the evaluation of the proposals received in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Sri Lanka Standards 	Institution and the Standardization Administration of China
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Sri Lanka Standards Institution and the Standardization Administration of China to ease non-tariff trade barriers between Sri Lanka and China. Clearance of the Attorney General and the concurrence of the Minister of Foreign Affairs have been received to the relevant draft MoU. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology to sign the said MoU, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme for empowering families receiving benefits under the Aswesuma Social Welfare Benefit Scheme
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑04‑17 has granted approval to prepare and implement a Welfare Benefit Payment Scheme in terms of the provisions of the Social Welfare Benefits Act No. 24 of 2002. Accordingly, it has been planned to implement a programme with a view to empowering benefited families under the Aswesuma Social Welfare Benefit Scheme economically, socially and psychologically within 03 years. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment to initiate a Pilot Project through the financial assistance of the Asian Development Bank and the World Bank and local funds targeting 16,000 beneficiary families in the selected Divisional Secretariat Divisions covering all 25 District as the First Phase of the said Programme and based on the outcome of the said Pilot Project, to implement the relevant Programme to empower the identified beneficiary families in all Divisional Secretariats, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Faculty of Medicine at the National School of Business 	Management (NSBM)
decision_details: - It has been proposed to establish a Faculty of Medicine and offer the MBBS  Degree by the National School of Business Management (NSBM), being a fully self-financed institute owned by the Government, under the direct supervision and monitoring of the  Ministry of Education, the Ministry of Health and the Sri Lanka Medical Council. It is expected to enroll 500 local and foreign students annually for the said Degree programme. The  NSBM has sought the approval to designate the Homagama Base Hospital as a suitable Government hospital to provide clinical training for those medical students. It has been proposed to formulate a mechanism for allocating the Homagama Base Hospital for the clinical training of the medical students of the NSBM as well as for the Professorial Unit facilities on resources sharing basis, without disrupting to the clinical training of medical students of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura, since the approval of the Cabinet has already been granted to utilize the Homagama Base Hospital for the clinical training of the Medical Students of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura. The NSBM is in agreement to grant necessary funds to develop the  Homagama Base Hospital in conformity with the Standards of the Medical Education published by the Sri Lanka Medical Council. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to take the Homagama Base Hospital under the purview of the Ministry of Health and upgrade the same as a Teaching Hospital, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Developing the main railway station buildings in the city of Colombo as	Commercial Centres
decision_details: - It has been identified at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023-11-06 that there's a high potentiality to develop the lands and buildings where Wellawatta, Bambalapitiya, Kollupitiya and Kompanna Veediya Railway Stations are located, as Commercial Centres. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways; and the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to develop the said railway stations and the railway stations in Dehiwala and Mount Lavinia in addition to the above railway stations on Build, Operate and Transfer method under the Public-Private Partnership and call for Expressions of Interest from the interested investors, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the “School Meals Programme” for the students from Grade	1 - 5 in Government Schools
decision_details: - The “School Meals Programme” is implemented in 7902 schools belonging to 100 Educational Zones in the Island covering 1.08 million of the entire student population and a sum of Rs. 85/- has been allocated for each student for one day meal. The Officials Committee appointed in this regard had reported that at least Rs.110/-amount is spent for one meal according to the price fluctuations of goods and services in the market. Also, “Save the Children” Organization has agreed to provide 03 food items for 2 lakhs of students in 917 selected schools for the year 2024 for the “School Meals Programme”. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to increase the allocation for one student per one meal uptoRs.110/- and implement the “School Meals Programme” for Primary Section students for 170 days during the year 2024, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Port of Galle as a commercial and leisure harbour by an	investor
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2023-08-14 to call for Expressions of Interest to select a suitable investor under Public-Private Partnership for developing the infrastructure facilities related to Galle Port Development Project and leisure related infrastructure facilities. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to call for Expressions of Interest to select a suitable investor for the proposed Galle Port Development project on Finance, Build, Operate and Transfer basis for construction of breakwater, wharf, revetment, seawall, channel dredging and reclamation of land, associated marine structures and subsequent mixed development, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No. 02 of 2024, 	issued	under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969, for 	approval of	Parliament
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022-08-08 to implement a scheme for granting permits to import fully electric vehicles for Sri Lankans employed abroad on the transfer of foreign remittance to the licensed banks in Sri Lanka through the formal banking channel and has decided to extend the validity period of the scheme upto 2024-06-30 at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-01-08. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No. 02 of 2024 issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 making provisions for that, for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a museum in the historical Seethawaka area
decision_details: - Even though the rise of the Seethawaka Kingdom in year 1521 is a unique milestone in the history of Kingdoms in Sri Lanka, a suitable venue to exhibit regional identities in the Kingdom has not yet been established. Therefore, it has been planned to establish a museum to exhibit formally to the public the artifacts including sinhala guns, war equipment including sinhala swards and the equipment used for weighing, measuring and excavations which were manufactured during the era of the Kingdom as well as the stone tools belonging to the prehistoric era, information of equipment and food used by the past human beings and the animal and plant residues identified through the excavations carried out in the area belonging to the Seethawaka Kingdom and among the things in the possession of public. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister and the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government; Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs and the Minister of Transport and Highways to establish the said museum in the office quarters belonging to the Sri Lanka Railways which is currently underutilized, situated adjacent to the Main Post Office, Seethawaka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Agriculture Modernization Programme
decision_details: - Attention has been focused on modernizing the agricultural sector in Sri Lanka based on the models of other countries in the world that have modernized and largely transformed the agricultural sector using modern technology and novel knowledge. Accordingly, it has been planned to establish Agriculture Modernization Hubs by utilizing  the amount of 2.5 billion Rupees allocated for the strengthening of the Agriculture and Fisheries Modernization Boards through the Budget for the year 2024 and implement the Agriculture Modernization Programme island-wide as per short-term, mid-term and long-term plans. In the first phase of this programme, it is expected to implement pilot projects in 26 Divisional Secretariat Divisions selected from 25 Districts and in the second phase, to implement Agricultural Modernization Projects in 75 Divisional Secretariat Divisions island-wide covering 03 Divisional Secretariat Divisions selected from each District. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to implement the Agriculture Modernization Programme by allocating Rs. 650 million; Rs. 25 million for each Agriculture Modernization Hub in each of the Divisional Secretariat Divisions selected for the implementation of the pilot project in the first phase and allocating Rs. 175 million; Rs. 35 million each for the Department of Agriculture, the Department of Export Agriculture, the Department of Animal Production and Health, the Department of Cinnamon Development and the National Aquaculture Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Justices of the Peace (Appointment, Suspension, Cancellation and Code of Conduct) Regulations No. 3 of 2023
decision_details: - The Minister in charge of the subject of Justice, has published the Justices of the Peace (Appointment, Suspension, Cancellation and Code of Conduct) Regulations No. 3 of 2023 and the subsequent amendments made thereto, in the Gazette Extraordinary Notifications dated 2023‑11‑27 and 2024‑02‑13 respectively by virtue of powers vested with him by section 45(6) of the Judicature Act, No. 2 of 1978 for making Regulations to suspend, cancel and terminate the Office of the Justice of the Peace. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of  Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to submit the said Regulations to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renewal of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute (BIDTI) of Sri Lanka and the Institute of Foreign  Affairs (IFA) of Nepal
decision_details: - A Memorandum of Understanding has been signed between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute of Sri Lanka and the Institute of Foreign Affairs of Nepal with the aim of enhancing cooperation and exchange of training so as to be valid for a period of 04 years from 2018‑09‑01 and the term of the said MoU has expired in the year 2022. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to sign a new MoU by amending the provisions enabling to extend the implementing period of the said MoU each five year upon the consent of both parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Initiation of two floating solar power generation pilot projects with a 	capacity of 1 MW each on the surface of Chandrika Wewa Reservoir and 	Kiriibban Wewa Reservoir
decision_details: - It has been decided to implement two (02) floating solar power pilot projects with a capacity of 1 MW each on the surface of the Chandrika Wewa Reservoir and the Kiriibban Wewa Reservoir as per the Record of Discussion signed between the Korea Institute for Advancement of Technology and the Ministry of Power and Energy in Sri Lanka. A request has been submitted seeking each of plots in extent of 0.99 hectares on the water surface of the Chandrika Wewa reservoir located at Embilipitiya Divisional Secretariat and Kiriibban Wewa Reservoir located at Sevanagala Divisional Secretariat and blocks of land in extent of 0.1 hectares each from land reserves of those reservoirs for the activities such as construction of power plants, transmission stations, training of maintenance workers and maintenance of solar panels in relation to those two (02) pilot Projects. The implementation of the proposed Project will enable  a feeding of about 03GWh annual electricity generation into the National Grid. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation to grant the aforesaid plots on the water surfaces and block of lands to the Sustainable Energy Authority of Sri Lanka on annual lease permits in order to maintain the relevant solar power generation pilot projects, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: International Counter Ransomware Initiative Summit
decision_details: - 	Sri Lanka has also been invited to join the International Counter Ransomware Initiative, which the United States started in 2021 with a group of other countries as a forum to discuss international coordination to combat ransomware. As of now, 48 countries around the world, the European Union as well as the Interpol have joined the said initiative. Since Sri Lanka too has recently faced with negative experiences with  ransomware, it has been recognized that joining the international initiative against ransomware could accrue benefits. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology; and the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to join with the international Counter Ransomware Initiative and take further steps in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Approval for Policy Framework for appointing  Public Customs Bonded Warehouses -  (Chapter 235)
decision_details: - A Customs Bonded Warehouse is a storage facility used to ensure the safety and quality of goods prior to payment of applicable duties on imported goods and transportation of goods. Under the provisions of section 69 of the Customs Ordinance (Chapter 235), the Minister in charge of the subject of Finance on the recommendation of the Director General of Customs can appoint Customs Bonded Warehouses. Taking into account the development of warehousing technologies and the need to create competitive advantage in the supply chain process, it has been recognized that the mandatory minimum floor area of a public customs bonded warehouse should be revised. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies for the implementation of the "Revised and Updated Policy Framework for appointing Public Customs Bonded Warehouses" prepared under section 69 of the Customs Ordinance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of the Telecommunications Industry through Advancement of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Education
decision_details: - In line with Sri Lanka's Digital Economy Strategy, the need to develop the Telecommunications Industry through the improvement of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) education has been identified to foster economic growth and innovation, thereby enabling to create skilled professionals required for the sustainable development of the Telecommunications Industry. The Telecommunication Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka is empowered to utilize or disburse 50% of the Telecommunication Development Charge collected from the licensees for the development of the telecommunications industry. Accordingly, Cabinet approved the joint proposal made by Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology; and the Minister of Education to implement the “Smart School Project” enabling to provide required equipment for 1000 schools where Information Communication Technology is taught as a subject for the GCE (Advanced Level), from the provisions of the Telecommunication Development Charge Fund; and to initiate a scholarship programme to provide financial assistance to 5,000 students from low-income earning families studying ICT as a subject.

title: Establishment of the Land Management Trust for regulation of the disposition of lands owned by the State and Government Statutory Institutions for investment purposes
decision_details: - The State owns around 82% of the total land extent of the country and safeguarding and controlling those lands is entrusted with a number of government institutions. It has been observed that various issues have arisen in  releasing State lands for investment purposes due to these institutions are not following an integrated approach. Therefore, in order to encourage opening up of new industries and services and investment opportunities that can create new employment opportunities, it is essential to establish a duly empowered mechanism from the point of identification of lands with suitable potentials to that of properly releasing lands to investors following a transparent procedure. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to establish the Land Management Trust comprising of the representatives of all relevant Ministries and Institutions under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the President to submit appropriate recommendations pertaining to the release of lands owned by the State and Government Statutory Institutions, to investors, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Recovery of Loans by Banks (Special Provisions) Act, No.4 of 1990
decision_details: - Due to the economic downturn prevailing over last 3 years, large scale, medium scale and small scale local businessmen have to encounter severe difficulties in running their businesses. Currently, the economy is getting stronger again to some extent and the necessary initial steps for that are being taken by the General Treasury. Nevertheless, various parties have pointed out that there are issues with regard to paying off the loans obtained by the small and medium scale businessmen from the banks in the past for their business activities. In this backdrop, banks are taking action to take over and auction the properties of a significant number of businessmen following the existing legal provisions, due to the default of loans by them. It has been observed that it would be appropriate to provide some grace period for the payment of the relevant loans alleviating the crisis situation that may arise in the business sector so as not to prejudice the banking system. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to temporarily suspend the methodology adopted by banks to take over the properties of debtors due to the default of loans up to 2024‑12‑15 and to amend section 4 of the Recovery of Loans by Banks (Special Provisions) Act, No.4 of 1990 to impose necessary legal provisions in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Drafting the Public Financial Management Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑05‑08 has granted approval to draft a new Fiscal Rules Framework and to incorporate the same to the proposed Public Financial Management Act. Accordingly, a preliminary draft has been prepared under the consultancy and the policy guidance of a Supervisory Committee appointed by the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies under the Co-Chairmanship of two Deputy Secretaries to the Treasury and including other Treasury Departments. As such the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare the Public Financial Management Bill based on the said preliminary draft and to authorize the Secretary to the Treasury to appoint a Committee of Experts to initiate the formulation of Financial Regulations until the proposed Bill is prepared by the Legal Draftsman, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Rubber Control Act No.11 of 1956
decision_details: - Approval has been granted to amend the Rubber Control Act No. 11 of 1956 in terms of the Cabinet decision dated 2022‑06‑06. Accordingly, the Legal Draftsman has prepared the the Rubber Control (Amendment) Bill and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for that. The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Setting apart of two portions of lands located in the premises of Waters Edge,	Battaramulla to Sri Lanka Navy and Asoka Vidyalaya, Colombo - 10 on lease basis
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to provide a land portion with the extent of 2 Roods 30.89 Perches to Sri Lanka Navy for training their boat rides and lifesaving camps and a land portion with the extent of 4 Acres 2 Roods 1.60 Perches to Asoka Vidyalaya, Colombo - 10 to be used as a playground, on lease basis through the Commissioner General of Lands, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing the Work Plan for the year 2024-2026 under the Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and Vietnam for Cooperation in the field of Agriculture
decision_details: - A Memorandum of Understanding has been signed between Sri Lanka and Vietnam on 2006‑11‑27 for cooperation in the field of agriculture. In terms of the provisions of the said Memorandum of Understanding, Work Plans for the years 2010-2011, 2017-2019 and 2022-2024 have been implemented to develop the agriculture sector and promote cooperation based on the agreement of both parties and a new Work Plan has been prepared for the period of 2024-2026. This Work Plan is to be implemented by the International Cooperation Department of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam and the Sri Lanka Council for Agricultural Research Policy. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to sign the said Work Plan between the two parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enhancement of Border Health Capacities at the Bandaranaike International Airport and the Port of Colombo
decision_details: - Since the economy in Sri Lanka mainly rely on the income generated through the international tourism and business travel, it has been identified the necessity of preparing Points of Entry (PoE) through the cross border in compliance with the International Health Regulations in relation to uninterrupted PoE operation, building the confidence of the travellers and travelling. Accordingly, the Government of Japan has awarded a grant of Yen 1,170 Mn through the International Organization for Migration to further strengthen as a whole, the boarder health preparedness at PoE and directly contribute to infectious disease control and for the safety of all the passengers, crew and the PoE staff from various health emergencies. With this, it has been planned to improve the facilities of Bandaranaike International Airport, the Port of Colombo and the International Airports in Maldives in accordance with the International practices, recommendations and standards. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to facilitate the implementation of the relevant project in co-ordination with the Ministry of Health, Department of Immigration and Emigration, Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Ltd and Sri Lanka Ports Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The National Tourism Policy
decision_details: - The Draft National Tourism Policy was taken into consideration at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2023‑09‑04 and it was decided that the said Draft should be further reviewed by a committee consisting of experts in the field of tourism. Accordingly, a Committee appointed by the Secretary to the President has drafted the proposed National Tourism Policy in accordance with the recommendations of the Department of National Planing, identifying the issues and potentials of the tourism industry and taking into account the local and global contexts. Accordingly, the proposal made Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement the said Policy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Stimulating Loan Scheme for Re-energize the Micro, Small and Medium-sized Enterprise Sector
decision_details: - As a result of the prevailing economic downturn and due to the impact of external factors beyond their control, a significant number of small and medium scale entrepreneurs associated with manufacturing, imports, exports, tourism, apparel, and a variety of other commercial operations have found it very difficult to sustain their enterprises. As a relief for that, the Asian Development Bank has agreed to provide working capital support for small and medium scale enterprise sector. Through the proposed program it is expected to grant loan facilities on concessional interest rates to small and medium scale enterprises in order to further expand and recover their businesses, through Licensed Commercial Banks and Licensed Specialized Banks. Rs.20 billion is expected to allocate for the said project which is comprised of two components and out of which, Rs.15 billion will be utilized to strengthen existing and new enterprises whereas remaining Rs.5 billion will be utilized to support businesses under the non-performing loan category. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement the proposed loan scheme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Drafting the Rights of Child Compact Act
decision_details: - Ensuring the children's protection and well-being is a challenge owing to the recent changes in the entire society. Especially, many cases have been reported regarding the children being the victims of various abuses, making them engaged in various abusive activities and losing the opportunities to enjoy their rights. Therefore, it has been proposed to formulate a Compact Act to secure all the rights mentioned in the Convention on the Rights of the Child in addition to the existing legal provisions which are to ensure the protection and safety of the children in Sri Lanka. The approval of the Cabinet has already been granted to introduce a new Act named, “ Child Care Act” by the Cabinet decision dated 2023-01-09 titled as “Next 25 Years”. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare the Rights of Child Compact Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introducing an Act to establish a Public Performance Classification Board by repealing the Public Performance Ordinance No.7 of 1912
decision_details: - The Public Performance Ordinance No.7 of 1912 is currently in force regarding the public performance and the need to introduce a new Act has been identified to introduce rules and regulations as appropriate for the Sri Lankan society aligning with the global trends and standards, while ensuring the complete freedom of art. An initial draft has been prepared to be used as the basis for the new Act, by a committee appointed under the Chairmanship of Mr. Saman Athaudahetti, the former Chairman of the Public Performance Board. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Mass media to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill incorporating the relevant provisions enabling to repeal the Public Performance Ordinance No.7 of 1912 and to introduce a new Act named Public Performances Classification Board Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Current status of negotiations on the proposed India-Sri Lanka Economic 	and Technology Cooperation Agreement (ETCA)
decision_details: - The 13th Round of Negotiations on the proposed India-Sri Lanka Economic and Technology Cooperation Agreement has been held in New Delhi from 8th to 10th January 2024. There, nine Sub‑Committees; namely "Trade in Goods", "Preamble, General Provisions and General Exceptions", "Trade in Services", "Rules of Origin", "Customs Procedures and Trade Facilitation", "Sanitary and Phytosanitary Measures", "Technical Barriers to Trade" ", "Trade Remedies" and "Economic and Technology Cooperation" have conducted negotiations., The Sub-Committee on Dispute Settlement and Final Provisions is scheduled to hold discussions on the relevant chapter in New Delhi in late February 2024. Also, it has been planned to conduct the 14th Round of Negotiations of the proposed Cooperation Agreement in the first week of March, 2024. Cabinet considered the information submitted by the Hon. President on the  Current status of the proposed India-Sri Lanka Economic and Technology Cooperation Agreement.

title: Obtaining approval of the Cabinet of Ministers for the Ayurveda Code
decision_details: - Regulations have to be made prescribing an  Ayurveda Code as per section 77 of the Ayurveda Act No. 31 of 1961 as amended by the Ayurveda (Amendment) Act No. 19 of 2023. Accordingly, the Ayurveda Code has been drafted subject to the provisions of the Act for the advancement of the indigenous medical sector to meet the sustainable development goals and timely requirements while achieving the objectives of the Act. The Legal Draftsman having examined the said draft has confirmed that the matters contained therein are accurate except the technical contents. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to declare the draft Ayurveda Code, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Maintaining Records and conducting Proceedings in certain Courts in English Language
decision_details: - Legal literature in the area of commerce is predominantly available in English and translating such materials into Sinhala is costly and time consuming. As a result, it takes a long period of time to settle commercial disputes thereby adversely affecting the attraction of investors. This situation has caused Sri lanka to be at  a lower position in the ranking of the Ease of Doing Business. As a remedy to this situation, it has been identified that it would be appropriate to issue a directive by the Minister in charge of the subject of Justice permitting to use the English Language for all purposes in or in relation to the records and proceedings in the identified courts specified, as per the provisions of the Article 24(4) of the Constitution and upon the approval of the Cabinet. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to take necessary action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for supplying uniforms for Police Inspectors and Junior Grade Officers and supplying shoes for Police Sergeant / Police Constables of the Sri Lanka Police
decision_details: - It has been estimated that 732,000 meters of fabric are required for issuing uniforms for officers in Police Inspector Grades and those in Junior Grades whereas 70,000 pairs of leather shoes are required to provide the Police Sergeants / Police Constables of the Sri Lanka Police, for the year 2024. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to procure the said stock of fabric and the stock of shoes by following the National Competitive Bidding Procedure, utilizing the provisions allocated for the Sri Lanka Police for the year 2024, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commemoration of IORA Day 2024 of the Indian Ocean Rim Association 	(IORA)
decision_details: - Cabinet noted the information submitted by the Minister of Foreign Affairs stating that the IORA Day 2024 of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) has been planned to hold at the Galle Face on 2024‑03‑10 under the theme of “Sustainable Indian Ocean for future Generations” and under the chairmanship of Sri Lanka, and measures are taken to hold that function with the participation of the Diplomatic Missions of IORA Member States, Dialogue Partner States, UN agencies based in Colombo as well as a large number of school children representing all the provinces of the Island.

title: Harnessing of offshore wind potential of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Recently, the World Bank consultants have conducted a feasibility study on offshore wind development and based on the results of the said study, the North, West and South-East areas have been identified as areas with high potential for energy production through large-scale offshore wind farms. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to take necessary action to develop Sri Lanka's offshore wind potentials in phases through private sector investments by increasing the contribution of large-scale renewable energy in the country and developing economies of scale, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing a block of land on long term lease basis to construct an 	Ashram for the Hundredth Anniversary of Sree Narayana Guru
decision_details: - The Sree Narayana Dharma Sangam Colombo Trust has made a request for a plot of land from the Nuwara Eliya district for the construction of an Ashram with the Indian grant assistance for the hundredth anniversary of Sree Narayan Guru. Accordingly, a plot of land of about 06 acres and 2 roods from the land called Ramboda Watta in the Kothmale Divisional Secretariat Division of Nuwara Eliya District belonging to the Land Reform Commission has been identified for this purpose. The proposal made by the Minister of Tourism and Lands to provide the said plot of land to Sri Narayana Dharma Sangam Colombo Trust on  long-term lease basis for a period of 30 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Promotion of Maritime Passenger Transport between Sri Lanka and 	India
decision_details: - It has been identified that it is possible to promote tourism; and cultural exchange through improved connectivity, and encourage cooperation in the fields of education, religious, cultural activities, arts, sports, etc. by providing more access to the tourists in Sri Lanka and India with the promotion of maritime passenger transport between the two countries. For the purpose, it is essential to introduce a lower traveling and transportation cost system, accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to reduce the embarkation levy being charged from the passengers who are leaving from Sri Lanka by ferries or cruises to US$ 05 and US$ 20 respectively and to grant a free baggage allowance up to 60 kg to a passenger traveling by ferries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Online Safety Act No. 9 of 2024
decision_details: - The Online Safety Act No. 9 of 2024 was passed by Parliament and the provisions thereof is in force at present. Since the amendments moved at the Committee Stage of the said Bill in Parliament should be made in keeping with the determination of the Supreme Court, it has not been able to introduce amendments submitted by the experts in the field to the said Bill. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the Online Safety Act based on the amendments identified by having further discussions with the experts in the field who had submitted the relevant amendments, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making applicable the 'Urumaya Programme' which endows Land Permits and Grant Holders the Absolute Ownership of State lands, for the lands granted to the public by the Sri Lanka Mahaweli Authority
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑12‑11, has granted approval to implement the "Urumaya Programme"  which endows Land Permits and Grant Holders the Absolute Ownership of State lands. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation to implement the "Urumaya Programme" pertinent to the lands granted to the general public by the the Sri Lanka Mahaweli Authority as well in keeping with the programme being implemented by the Ministry of Tourism and Lands, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Cooperative Trade Centre named 'Coop Square'
decision_details: - The Cabinet having taken up for discussion the proposal submitted pertaining to the establishment of Cooperative Trade Centre named 'Coop Square' at the meeting held on 2023‑11‑27, has decided to refer the same to the National Development Committee to obtain recommendations on the proposed project. Accordingly, the National Development Committee has recommended the implementation of the said project. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to implement the proposed Project as a Public, Private and Cooperative Partnership Project based on the said recommendations, identifying a suitable investor by calling Expressions of Interest, without causing a burden to the Consolidated Fund, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Housing Programme for the Sri Lankan Migrant Employees
decision_details: - Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment, in collaboration with the National Housing Development Authority and licensed banks, has planned to implement a housing programme for migrant workers. Under the said programme, it is expected to provide a loan facility of a maximum of Rs. 10 million and to bear a part of interest cost for that by the  Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment.
