The recommendation of the Department of National Planning has been received for the implementation of the said pilot project. The estimated cost of the project is Rs.526.20 million and a provision of Rs.310 million has been allocated for the year 2024. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development to enter into an Agreement between the High Commission of India and the Ministry of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development for the implementation of the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishing Training/Migration Resource Centres in Jaffna, Homagama and Ampara areas for Overseas Job Seekers
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment conducts accelerated, host‑country specific training programmes for overseas job seekers. Currently, these training programmes are conducted under minimum facilities at rented out buildings in islandwide. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Labor and Foreign Employment to establish Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment's training centres in the areas of Jaffna, Homagama and Ampara to provide necessary training for overseas job seekers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting compensation to the selected families who were deprived of lands owing to construction of Yan Oya Reservoir and the Left Bank Canal, in place of alternative paddy lands to be granted
decision_details:
- During the construction of the Yan Oya Reservoir, lands belonging to the Divisional Secretariat Divisions of Horowpathana and Gomarankadawala have been acquired and the lands belonging to the Divisional Secretariat Divisions of Horowpathana, Padaviya and Sri-pura have been acquired during the construction of Left Bank Canal. Alternative paddy lands have been granted to a part of the families who have deprived their lands and owing to the non availability of lands in the surrounding area to develop as paddy lands, approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑03‑20 to grant an additional compensation to the land owners whose lands have been acquired. Accordingly, approval of the Cabinet was granted to implement the following proposals made by the Minister of Irrigation.

* 	Since it is not possible to get released sufficient lands to be granted as alternative paddy lands for the selected families who lost their houses owing to the construction of the Yan Oya Reservoir, for development purposes, payment of a compensation of Rs.1.8 million each, in place of lands for the families to whom alternative paddy lands have not been given so far and who are residing in other areas and whose livelihood is not farming. 

*	Since it is not possible to get released sufficient lands to be granted a alternative paddy lands for the selected families who lost their house owing to the construction of the Left Bank Canal, for development purposes, payment of compensation of 1.8 million rupees in lieu of a 1 1/2 acre paddy field.

title: Importation of Maize and Essential Food Commodities by Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation Limited
decision_details: - Due to the absence of sufficient stocks of maize in the open market, there is a shortage of raw materials required for the production of poultry feed. As a temporary measure, the Department of Animal Production and Health has issued the required license to Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation Limited to import 15,000 Metric Tons of maize. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Development to procure maize from registered foreign suppliers by the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation Limited, subject to a maximum of 15,000 Metric Tons, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the periods of the Governance for Growth Programme and the Market Development Facility Programme, implemented under the Grant Assistance of the Government of Australia
decision_details: - An Agreement has been reached in 2017 between the Government of Australia and the Government of Sri Lanka to implement the Governance for Growth Programme and the Market Development Facility Programme. The Government of Australia has agreed to provide an additional grant of 42.1 million Australian Dollars for the said two programs. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Development to enter into Subsidiary Arrangements with the Government of Australia to obtain that grant and continue the said two projects, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation and processing of selected spices and re-exportation in the forms of oil extracts, oleoresins and spent
decision_details: - There is a potential to earn higher revenue by exporting Sri Lankan spices as value added products other than exporting them in raw form. Requests have been made by several leading companies with the approval of the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka to import certain raw spice varieties enabling them to manufacture high value added products as a complete new product for the international market. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to implement the procedure for importation and processing of selected spices and re‑exportation in the forms of oil extracts, oleoresins and spent, in order to provide the opportunity to the said manufactures to expand their market opportunities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Segregation of Insurance Business of the Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑03‑13 has granted approval to take necessary action to operate the life and general insurance businesses of the Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation as separate legal entities in compliance with the provisions of the Regulation of Insurance Industry (Amendment) Act No. 3 of 2011 under the State enterprises restructuring. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to segregate the life and general insurance businesses of Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation Limited to the fully owned subsidiaries of the said Corporation, Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation Life Limited and Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation General Limited, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into an Agreement with the British Council for a Pilot Project of training English Teachers in the Sabaragamuwa Province
decision_details: - It has been planned to implement a capacity development program together with the British Council to provide formal training for English teachers in the Sabaragamuwa province and enhance their language knowledge and teaching skills. Under the said programme, it is expected to select 700 teachers and provide them with a formal training through the Teaching Knowledge Test (TKT) course affiliated with the Cambridge University. The proposed training program is to be implemented with the funds of the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council, and a sum of Rs.51 million has been estimated for the purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Council and Local Government to enter into an Agreement between the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council and the British Council for the implementation of the said programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Issuance of a New Order under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act,	No.12 of 2017
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted to issue an Order under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act No.12 of 2017 enabling to temporarily suspend/limit certain outward remittances related to certain capital transactions and current transfers commencing from April 2020. After that, measures have been taken to extend the validity period of the said Order on several occasions, and the validity period of the current Order is due to expire on 2023‑12‑27. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to issue a new Order for a further period of 06 months to be effective from 2023‑12‑28 removing the existing suspension on making investment in Employee Share Ownership Plans or Employee Share Option Schemes by individual residents through Outward Investment Accounts while maintaining the suspensions/limitations stipulated in the prevailing Order, and to present the said Order for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contracts for Supplying aviation fuel for SriLankan	Airlines Limited at 09 Airports worldwide
decision_details: - The contracts for the supply of aviation fuel to Sri Lankan Airlines Limited at the airports of Bangkok, Beijing, Dubai, Hyderabad, Karachi, Male and Riyadh are to be expired on 2024‑02‑29, and the contracts for the supply of aviation fuel at the airports of Kuala Lumpur and Jakarta are due to expire on 2024‑03‑31. International competitive bids have been invited for the supply of fuel at those airports. Eleven (11) aviation fuel supply companies have submitted bids and one bid for Karachi airport and 02 or more bids for the remaining 8 airports. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the relevant contracts to the lowest evaluated substantially responsive bidders, as per the recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the contract for the supply of Aviation Fuel for SriLankan 	Airlines Limited at Dammam (DMM) Airport
decision_details: - The contract for the supply of aviation fuel at the Dammam Airport for the aircraft of SriLankan Airlines Limited is due to expire on 2023‑12‑31. Quotations have been called from Modern Consortium for Refueling Aircraft Co. Ltd., the only aviation fuel supplier there at present. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the relevant contract as a direct contract, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Value Added Tax Act, No.14 of 2002
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑10‑30 to amend the Value Added Tax Act, No.14 of 2002, making provisions to reduce the Value Added Tax registration threshold, the total value of the supplies that tax can be charged per year from Rs.80 million to Rs.60 million and to increase the VAT rate from 15% to 18%, with effect from 2024‑01‑01. The Legal Draftsman has drafted the amending Bill having incorporated relevant amendments and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the said amending Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 700MW Solar Power Project proposed to be installed on the surface of the Poonakary Tank
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑09‑11 has granted approval to accept in principle the proposal submitted by M/s United Solar Energy SL (Pvt) Ltd,. to develop 700MW solar power plant with 100% Battery Energy Storage System including the construction of necessary transmission lines from the Poonakary tank to new Kilinochchi Grid Substation and to appoint a Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee in order to evaluate the project proposal and to submit recommendations to the Cabinet to determine the power purchasing charges. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to implement the proposed project with M/s United Solar Energy SL (Pvt) Ltd,. based on the recommendations submitted by the Negotiating Committee and to sign a power purchasing agreement related to that, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Hybrid Renewable Energy Systems in Jaffna Small Islands
decision_details: - The Government of India has expressed its consent to provide a partial grant of US$ 11 million to provide electricity supply for occupants in the islands of Delft, Nainathivu and Analathivu in the Jaffna Peninsula. Accordingly, bids have been invited only from Indian Contractors to implement the said project as per the conditions of the Agreement entered into. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the said Contract to M/s U-Solar Clean Energy Solutions (Pvt) Ltd., based on the recommendations submitted by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee by evaluating the proposal submitted for that, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The 'Urumaya Programme' which endows Land Permit and Grant Holders the Absolute Ownership of State Lands
decision_details: - The General Public mainly the farmer community who have been given permits and grants under the Land Development Ordinance, have to encounter various issues in using the relevant land for human and development needs due to the absence of absolute ownership for the said land they possess or have developed. Therefore, the Hon. President, in the Budget Speech 2024, proposed to implement a programme called 'Urumaya Programme', enabling to take necessary action within the existing legal framework to grant the absolute ownerships of such lands to the general public mainly consisting of farmer community in order to minimize those issues and to commence the said arrangements at the beginning of the year 2024 and fully complete the same within few years. The said programme is planned to be implemented under three stages whereby the absolute ownership of residential and agricultural lands are expected to be given for two million families. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism & Lands to issue a Grant with the absolute ownership under section 2 of the Land Development Ordinance for blocks of land for which Permits and Grants have been provided under the Land Development Ordinance by following the relevant steps, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Order published in the Gazette under the Special Commodity Levy Act No.48 of 2007 to Parliament for approval
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑10‑30 has granted approval to increase the Special Commodity Levy on importation of sugar from 25 cents to Rs.50/- per Kg. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the Order imposed through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2356/20 dated 2023‑11‑01 under the provisions of section 2 of the Special Commodity Levy Act No.48 of 2007 to Parliament for approval in order to give effect the said decision, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introducing legal provisions to house arrest as an alternative to remand
decision_details: - Overcrowding in prisons in Sri Lanka has been identified as a long-standing problem. As a remedy to that problem, a Committee headed by a Judge of the Supreme Court has been appointed to make suitable recommendations to introduce legal provisions to detain in appropriate cases suspects and convicts under House Arrest as an alternative to remand/imprisonment. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to introduce appropriate laws, based on the Report submitted by the said Official's Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Partition Act
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑09‑25 has granted approval to introduce appropriate amendments to the Partition Act in order to conclude the partition cases expeditiously. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Schedule VIII of the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance No.2 of 1937
decision_details: - More than 680 plant species belonging to 121 genera have been declared as protected plants in accordance with the plant classification systems coming under the Schedule VIII of the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance No.2 of 1937 as was last amended by the Fauna and Flora Protection (Amendment) Act No.7 of 2022. However, the necessity to amend the said Schedule to suit the current day needs has been identified. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Resources Conservation to appoint a Committee consisting of experts in the fields of plant taxonomy and nomenclature, ecology, wildlife conservation and ethanobotany and to amend the Schedule VIII of the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance as per the recommendations of the said Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting an investigation over the assassination of Mr. Edward Henry	Pedris 108 years ago by a judgment of the Colonial Military Court
decision_details: - Mr. Edward Henry Pedris who was 27 years at the time, has been brought before a Court Martial on charges of inciting riots and treason against the Government by the colonial administration of Sri Lanka and convicted of treason and executed on 1915‑07‑07 without considering any appeal. The body of the late Mr. Henry Pedris has been cremated in an undisclosed premise following the procedure prescribed for the cremation of a convicted criminal under the Martial Law. His assassination has been later identified as a result of a plan carried out by the senior officers who administered the country at that time. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President to appoint a committee comprising of three members which is chaired by retired Supreme Court Judge Mr. Anil Goonaratne, to disclose actual information related to the said execution, study relevant information and submit a Report with recommendations to the Cabinet in order to bring justice to him.

title: Procurement for the purchase of oil and lubricant for the Sri Lanka	Transport Board
decision_details: - National competitive bids have been invited for the procurement of purchasing oil and lubricants for the Sri Lanka Transport Board. The Cabinet Appointed Standing Procurement Committee has recommended the purchase of respective oils and lubricants from Lanka IOC PLC and Chevron Lubricant Lanka PLC, based on each item. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to award the relevant procurements to those two companies, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the contract for the design and construction of Railway Diesel	Multiple Units (DMU) Workshop at Ratmalana under the Railway	Efficiency Improvement Project (REIP)
decision_details: - International bids have been invited for awarding the contract for the design and construction of the Diesel Multiple Units Workshop at Ratmalana under the Railway Efficiency Improvement Project which is being implemented under the Asian Development Bank funds. Accordingly, 09 bids have been submitted and 02 bids have been rejected. The proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to award the said contract to China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation, the lowest responsive bidder, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Standing Procurement Committee after evaluating the remaining 07 bids, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Acquisition of a land plot to the Sri Lanka Police for the establishment of 	the Rangala Police Station
decision_details: - Currently, the Rangala Police Station, which is run on rental basis in a building belonging to the Getagahawela Plantation Company, has found it difficult for the officers on duty to carry out their duties properly since it is not spacious enough. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to acquire a land plot of 02 acres from the Duckwariya Estate belonging to the Udapussellawa Plantation company to the Sri Lanka Police for the establishment of the Rangala Police Station, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of an Authorized Representative to submit online Visa	applications of foreigners who visit Sri Lanka
decision_details: - At the Cabinet Meeting held on 2023‑09‑11, it was decided to appoint an Evaluation Committee to evaluate the proposal submitted by GBS Technology Services & IVS Global - FZCO and VFS VF Worldwide Holdings Ltd., to act as an authorized representative for the online submission of visa applications for foreigners who visit Sri Lanka. The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to pursue action as per the recommendations of the Report submitted by the Evaluation Committee appointed accordingly and to sign the relevant Agreement drafted as per the observations submitted by the Attorney General.

title: Establishment of a mechanism for expeditious decision making for the	implementation of Renewable Energy Projects
decision_details:
- In order to meet the nationally determined contribution targets by the year 2030, the need to accelerate the implementation of renewable energy projects has been identified. At the Cabinet Meeting held on 2023‑11‑20, it was decided that a new mechanism should be introduced for the speedy implementation of renewable energy projects, taking into account the time it takes to implement such projects following the existing processes, as well as the inconveniences faced by the interested investors while working in accordance with such processes. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to appoint a Joint Standing Committee representing the following institutions to take decisions regarding renewable energy projects and to monitor the efficient and prompt implementation of those decisions by the relevant institutions:

*	Presidential Secretariat- (Chairman)

*	Prime Minister's Office

*	Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies

*	Ministry of Investment Promotions

*	Ministry of Wildlife and Forest Resources Conservation

*	Ministry of Environment

*	Ministry of Tourism and Lands

*	Ministry of Industries

*	Ministry of Power and Energy
*	Ministry of Irrigation 

*	Ministry of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development

*	Sri Lanka Sustainable Energy Authority

*	Ceylon Electricity Board

title: Establishment of an Inter-Ministerial Standing Committee on Human	Rights
decision_details: - The necessity of appointing an Inter-Ministerial Standing Committee on Human Rights has been identified, enabling to act as a Standing National Framework for an effective domestic process of follow-up and reporting on Sri Lanka's undertakings on human rights and reconciliation. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to establish an Inter-Ministerial Standing Committee on Human Rights with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs acting as the coordinating/lead agency, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Record of Discussion (RoD) for the full implementation of the	Community-Based Tourism Development Project focusing on the Central,	Northern and Eastern Provinces
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Meeting held on 2023‑01‑09 to enter into a Record of Discussion between the Korea Tourism Organization and the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority for the implementation of a pilot project related to the implementation of a community-based tourism development project focusing on the Central, Northern and Eastern Provinces of Sri Lanka under a grant of 2.172 billion Korean Won.  Although, it had been planned to implement the entire project based on the success of the pilot project, after its implementation, the representatives of the Korea Tourism Organization after visiting the relevant provinces have agreed to implement the entire project as scheduled instead of a pilot project. Accordingly, the Cabinet having considered the matters submitted by the Minister of Tourism and Lands on the measures taken to enter into a revised Agreement between two parties enabling to implement the project, decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet to pursue action accordingly.

title: Entering into a Treaty on Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters 	between the Republic of Korea and Sri Lanka
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Treaty between the Republic of Korea and the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka on Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters. Accordingly, a draft Treaty has been prepared jointly by a group of representatives consisting of senior officials of the Ministry of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Attorney General's Department and a group of representatives of relevant institutions of the Republic of Korea. It is expected to improve the effectiveness of crime prevention, investigation, prosecution and suppression of crime in both States. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to sign the said Treaty between the two parties and then ratify the same by respective Diplomatic Missions of the two countries,was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Delegation of powers to District Secretaries to carry out the functions of the National Disaster Relief Services Centre more effectively and efficiently
decision_details: - The National Disaster Management Center has been established in 1996, under the then Ministry of Social Services and Social Welfare, in order to plan and implement relief, rehabilitation and reconstruction activities, and the said Centre has been renamed as the National Disaster Relief Service Center from 2007‑01‑01 and so far it has been functioning as a Government institution. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Ministry of Defense to delegate the necessary powers to the District Secretaries/Government Agents so that the functions of the said Center can be carried out more effectively and efficiently, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the National Evaluation Policy in the Public Sector from 2024
decision_details: - The Department of Project Management and Monitoring of the General Treasury has already initiated the foundation measures required for the implementation of the National Evaluation Policy in the Public Sector from 2024. It has been recognized that it is appropriate to create an institutional structure within the existing institutional set-up without establishing a new institution in order to implement the said Evaluation Policy. Further, the need of establishing a permanent National Evaluation Steering Committee has been recognized, enabling to submit the recommendations of the evaluations made, to the Cabinet annually and submit the same thereafter to Parliament as appropriate and to reach independent decisions at various occasions during the evaluation process. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to take necessary action to appoint a National Evaluation Steering Committee under the chairmanship of the Secretary, Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies and to submit information on matters revealed in evaluation process of the said Committee and its recommendations to the Cabinet, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Negotiations of the 12th Round of the Proposed India - Sri Lanka Economic	and Technology Cooperation Agreement (ETCA)
decision_details: - Negotiations of the 12th Round pertaining to the proposed India - Sri Lanka 	Economic and Technology Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) has been held in 	Colombo from 2023‑10‑30 to 2023‑11‑01 and in this instance, working groups 	of both parties have reached a consensus pertaining to several fields concerned. 	Both parties have agreed to hold the 13th Round of Negotiations pertaining to the 	proposed Agreement in India from 2024‑01‑08 to 2024‑01‑10 and to finalize the 	technical level negotiations by March 2024. The Cabinet noted the information 	furnished by the Hon. President pertaining to the 12th Round of Negotiations.

title: Amendment to the Penal Code (Chapter 19) - Increase of Fines
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2022‑12‑12 has granted approval to 	prepare a Bill to amend the fines referred to in the Penal Code in line with the 	current monetary value. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has 	been received to the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. As such, the 	proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional 	Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same 	thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2021‑09‑27 has granted approval to amend the 	Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No. 15 of 1979 to make legal provisions 	enabling a criminal court to decide whether the requirement of personal 	attendance of suspect/accused persons in courts under certain identified 	circumstances could 	be dispensed with even during the trial. Several 	interested	parties have submitted further matters for the Bill prepared accordingly, prior to 	the submission of the same to Parliament. As such, the proposal made by the 	Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to instruct the 	Legal Draftsman to draft a new Bill to amend the Code of Criminal Procedure 	Act, No. 15 of 1979 	by further developing the Bill already drafted, taking also 	into consideration the aforesaid matters, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurements for securing 1,450,000 of Enoxaparin Sodium used to treat 	for patients with heart diseases
decision_details:
- International bids have been invited under two 02 procurements to procure 	1,450,000 Prefilled Syringe of Enoxaparin Sodium Injection, 6,000IU in 0.6ml 	used to treat for patients with heart diseases. Accordingly, the proposals made by 	the Minister of Health to award the procurements as follows, based on the 	recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, 	was approved by the Cabinet.

*	To award the procurement for the purchase of 450,000 of Enoxaparin Sodium Injection to M/s Gulf Pharma (Pvt.) Limited.

*	To award the procurement for the purchase of 1,000,000 of Enoxaparin Sodium Injection to M/s Slim Pharmaceuticals (Pvt.) Ltd.

title: Implementation of High Impact Sustainable Educational Programme for	Transfusion Medicine Professionals and Clinical Staff
decision_details: - The European Union has agreed to provide Rs. 41.28 million to plan and implement an educational programme in view of upgrading the knowledge on Transfusion Medicine for Transfusion Medicine Professionals and Clinical Staff. It has been decided to conduct the proposed programme by a consortium consisting of partners from Universities in Europe, India and Sri Lanka and National Blood Transfusion Services, Colombo and the Asian Association of Transfusion Medicine. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to sign a Consortium Agreement among the relevant parties to implement this project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Agreement entered into between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Latvia	pertaining to the Transfer of Sentenced Persons
decision_details: - The Transfer of Offenders Act, No.5 of 1995 contains provisions to enable a citizen of another country convicted and sentenced to imprisonment by a court in Sri lanka to serve his sentence in the country of which he claims to be a citizen. Likewise the said Act also includes provisions for a Sri Lanka citizen who is convicted to imprisonment in a specified country to serve his balance period of imprisonment in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, it has been proposed to sign an Agreement on the Transfer of Sentenced Persons between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Latvia. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to sign the said Agreement where consensus has been reached having negotiated by the Department of Attorney General and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and to ratify the same thereafter, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Treaty on Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters between Sri Lanka 	and Maldives
decision_details: - Although the Cabinet approval has been granted at its meeting held on 	2022‑09‑22 to enter into the Treaty on mutual legal assistance in criminal 	matters between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Republic 	of Maldives, the said Treaty was not signed due to suggesting few amendments 	subsequently 	for the proposed Treaty by the Maldives party. Thereafter, a new 	amended draft has been prepared upon the concurrence of both parties and the 	clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the that. Accordingly, the 	proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional 	Reforms to sign the 	said Treaty and thereafter ratify the same by Diplomatic 	Missions of both countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Financial Sector Safety Net Strengthening Project funded by the World	Bank
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑04‑24 has granted approval in principle to implement the Financial Sector Safety Net Strengthening Project under the World Bank funds. At the loan negotiations held as per the said approval, the World Bank has agreed to grant a loan amounting to US$ 150 million under the components of capitalization of Sri Lanka Deposit Insurance Scheme, institutional capacity building of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and project implementation and monitoring. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to enter into the relevant Agreements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of Colombo Security Conclave (CSC), Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) and Agreement of Headquarters
decision_details: - The Colombo Security Conclave (CSC) has been established as a Convention which operates respecting the value system of member countries while confronting the common security threats and challenges to Member States including maritime security in the region of Indian ocean. Currently, this Conclave operates as a regional organization wherein India, Maldives, Mauritius and Sri Lanka function as Member States while Bangladesh and Seychelles function as observer countries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to sign a Charter to further streamline the activities of the said Conclave, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding among the member countries relating to the Secretariat of the of the said organization to be established in the Colombo city and to sign a Headquarters Agreement pertaining to the activities of the Secretariat between Sri Lanka and the General of the Secretariat, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Policy on Climate Change
decision_details: - Sri Lanka is a country that is constantly affected by climate changes thereby causing multiple impacts on local economic growth. The Government has recognized the need to implement measures to minimize the impact caused by climate change with a focus on sustainable development. It has been further recognized that it needs a significant update of the National Policy on Climate Change prepared in the year 2012 in order to address climate vulnerability, national priorities, new and emerging global developments and obtain benefits from climate-related programme, mechanisms and funding. Accordingly, the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies having submitted the Cabinet, the National Policy on Climate Change updated by the Ministry of Environment in accordance with the Nationally Determined Contributions, the National Adaptation Plan for Climate Change Impacts, the obligations of the Paris Agreement as well as the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, also in consultation with the relevant parties, it was decided decided to grant approval to the said Policy.

title: Agreement for Cooperation on Climate Change between Sri Lanka and 	the Republic of Korea
decision_details: - An agreement has been reached between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Korea to sign an Agreement for Cooperation on Climate Change. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to sign the proposed Agreement and to establish a Joint Committee on Climate Change to facilitate and coordinate the implementation of the said Agreement.

title: Submission of Colombo Port City Regulations No.3 of 2023( Guidelines on 	the Grant of Exemptions or Incentives to Businesses of Strategic 	Importance - Duty Free Operations) in Parliament for approval
decision_details: - Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion has published Colombo Port City Regulations No.3 of 2023 (Guidelines on the Grant of Exemptions or Incentives to Businesses of Strategic Importance - Duty Free Operations) under the provisions of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act No. 11 of 2021, through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2355/30 dated 2023‑10‑25. The proposal made by the  Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to present the said Regulations for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Medical Ordinance
decision_details: - The proposal made by the then Minister of Health to amend the Medical Ordinance No. 26 of 1927 to revise the provisions relating to the registration of specialist doctors was taken up for consideration at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2023‑08‑07 and it was decided to refer the said proposal to an Official's Committee headed by the Secretary to the Prime Minister to further study  the amendments proposed at the aforesaid discussion and submit appropriate recommendations for the same. As such, based on the recommendations stated in the Report submitted by the said Committee, Cabinet decided to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill to amend the Medical Ordinance.

title: Amendment to the Act, No.21 of 1969 by which the Institute of Surveying 	and Mapping was established
decision_details: - It has been recognized the appropriateness to amend Act No. 21 of 1969, by which the Institute of Surveying and Mapping was established, enabling to function it as an institution that provides higher education facilities in the field of surveying and mapping. Accordingly, by the proposed amendments, it is expected to create higher education needs in the field of surveying and mapping for students who do not have the opportunity to enter into the university having followed A/L education in the mathematics stream as well as other streams and generate graduates with practical training who can cater to the local as well as and foreign job market. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism and Lands to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill to amend the Institute of Surveying and Mapping Act No.21 of 1969, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Alienation of a plot of land from the land called Maduwanwela Nindagama Watta owned by the Land Reform Commission to Ceylon Tobacco Company PLC on lease basis for forestation
decision_details: - A request has been made by Ceylon Tobacco Company PLC seeking a plot of the land called Maduwanwela Nindagama Watta in the Grama Niladhari Division of Pnamura in the Embilipitiya Divisional Secretariat Division in Ratnapura District belonging to the Land Reform Commission for a forestation project. The project Report submitted by the said company has been evaluated and accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism and Lands to grant a land in extent of 87 acres, 3 roods and 25 perches to Ceylon Tobacco Company PLC for a long term lease basis of 30 years to carry out a forestation project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Calling proposals for the implementation of a QR based deposit refund system for Polyethylene Terephthalate (PET) and High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS) plastic packaging
decision_details: - Polyethylene Terephthalate (PET) bottles and High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS) cups and other plastic containers used as other plastic packaging are often used only once and disposed to the environment. The irresponsible practice of disposing such items by consumers and non availability of an efficient waste disposal system have resulted in causing the accumulation of such items to the external environment including the sensitive eco‑systems. In order to control the said situation, the Central Environmental Authority has implemented 02 pilot projects to manage plastic waste management in Sri Lanka. Based on the results of the two pilot projects, it has been recognized that the method of refunding the temporary deposit when returning the empty containers, is appropriate. Under the said system, the seller takes a temporary cash deposit when the consumer  buys the relevant product and return the temporary deposit to the consumer when the empty bottle/packaging is returned. In order to further improve this system, it has been recognized that it is appropriate to introduce a QR code system. The proposal made by the Minister of Environment to call for proposals from suitable institutions and implement a QR code based deposit refund system by the selected institution, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Carbon Net Zero 2050 Roadmap and Strategic Plan
decision_details: - Sri Lanka, as a party to the Paris Agreement, has agreed to achieve the net zero carbon status by 2050 through the updated Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) submitted to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). Accordingly, enabling to reach the said target, the Carbon Net Zero 2050 Roadmap and Strategic Plan has been formulated by a team of experts through wider stakeholder consultations identifying actions with potential strategies for reducing green house gas emissions and increasing carbon sequestration to become carbon neutral country by 2050. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to implement the said  Roadmap and Strategic Plan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Endorsement of South Asia Qualification Reference Framework in Sri 	Lanka
decision_details: - The 18th meeting of the SAARC Heads of State held in Kathmandu, Nepal in 2014 had a primary focus on expanding cooperation among regional countries wherein the basic foundation has laid for the emergence of this South Asia Qualification Reference Framework. As a result, the drafting of the South Asia Qualification Reference  Framework to identify competencies in the education sector as well as in the workforce has been initiated in the year 2020 with the involvement of the International Labor Organization. Sri Lanka has participated in the Technical Committee Meetings for that purpose and the concurrence has been granted for the South Asia Qualifications Framework drafted by the Ministries in charge of subject of education in the Member States including Sri Lanka. This South Asia Qualification Reference  Framework does not create any legal obligation for the qualification frameworks of each member country, and serves as a link to the qualification frameworks of other countries in the region. The recommendation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and clearance of the Attorney General have been given pertaining to the enforcement of the South Asian Qualification Reference Framework in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to enforce the  South Asian Qualifications Reference  Framework in Sri Lanka jointly by the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into an Agreement on Cooperation in the Field of Higher Education, between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Nepal
decision_details: - It has been proposed to enter into an Agreement on  Cooperation in the Field of Higher Education with a view to strengthening and expanding mutual cooperation in the field of higher education between Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of Nepal and further developing the relationship among higher educational institutes of both countries. By this Agreement, the opportunity is provided to exchange training programmes conducted between two countries and also curricula and scientific and educational methods relating to higher education system for the continued advancement of the higher education sector in Sri Lanka and to attend the higher educational conferences and seminars conducted by both parties. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to sign  the proposed Agreement between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of Nepal, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Framework of Cooperation (FoC) between the Sri Lanka Export Development Board and the International Fair Trade Networks
decision_details: - International Fair Trade Network is a global network which shares benefits more equally through standards, certification, producer support programmes and advocacy. A number of organizations engaged in international trade work as partners of  the said International Fair Trade Network. It has the capacity to advocate for policies which support the 'Fair Trade' and 'Trade Justice' and to interact with  the European Union institutions and maintain a continuous dialogue with them. The Sri Lanka Export Development Board has proposed to formulate an Action Plan in association with the partners of  International Fair Trade Network in order to promote the 'Fair Trade Concept' in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to sign a  'Framework of Cooperation' with a view to enhancing the cooperation between the International Fair Trade Networks and Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Securing funds from the Asian Development Bank to wrap-up the Integrated Road Investment Programme (iRoad Programme)
decision_details: - Certain Road Development Projects which were under the iRoad Programme implemented upon the loans of the Asian Development Bank have been suspended due to the non receipt of funds. The Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies has discussed with the Asian Development Bank in this regard and the  Asian Development Bank has agreed to grant US$ 60 million to finalize the components required to be completed expeditiously under the said Project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of  Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to enter into the relevant Loan Agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting approval under section 17 of Board of Investment of Sri lanka Law No.4 of 1978 for existing Non - BOI Companies/Companies approved under section 16 of Board of Investment of Sri lanka Law No.4 of 1978
decision_details: - It has appeared that there is a tendency of investors to invest in existing Non BOI companies after bringing the said companies under the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka. Foreign investors are interested in entering into agreements with BOI owing to the recognition and the protection receiving to their businesses in particular. By virtue of powers vested with the Minister in charge of the subject of investment promotion under section 24 of the Board of Investment of Sri lanka Law, an Order has been published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification dated 2023‑06‑01 by introducing provisions enabling the BOI to pursue action accordingly. As such, the proposal made the Hon. President in his capacity as the the Minister of Investment Promotion to submit the said Order to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Negotiations on the Proposed Sri Lanka - Thailand Free Trade Agreement 	(SLTFTA)
decision_details: - It is expected to complete the negotiations conducted pertaining to the proposed Sri Lanka - Thailand Free Trade Agreement by December 2023 and sign the relevant Agreement on 2024‑02‑03. The Hon. President presented the prepared Tariff Liberalization Programme of Sri Lanka prepared, enabling to liberalize 80% of the HS Codes within a period of 15 years and to partially liberalize 5% of HS Codes during the period of 15-18 years and include the remaining 15% of HS Codes in the Negative Schedule, based on the HS Codes 2022 version, as per the concurrences reached at 06th and 07th rounds of said negotiations and the Cabinet decided to grant its approval for the same.

title: Sri Lanka Electricity Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet of Ministers has previously granted approval for the introduction of a new Electricity Act to meet the current economic, social and governance needs of the country by introducing institutional reforms for the electricity sector. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a Broadcasting Regulatory Commission Act for Electronic Media
decision_details: - The proposal submitted by the Minister of Mass Media to prepare a Bill to introduce a Broadcasting Regulatory Commission Act for electronic media with a view to ensuring a media with high standard securing the freedom of speech and expression to the maximum, was taken up for consideration at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022‑09‑22. In that instance, a Cabinet Sub‑Committee was appointed under the Chairmanship of the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to submit recommendations on policy matters which need the attention in preparing the proposed Bill and the said Committee has prepared an initial draft with suitable provisions to be used as basis for preparing the proposed Broadcasting Regulatory Commission Bill. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Mass Media to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill based on the said initial draft, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation Arrangement of the Agreement between the Republic of Sri Lanka and the State of Israel on Employment of Sri-Lankan Workers
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2020.02.05 has granted approval to enter into an Agreement with the Government of Israel on employment of Sri-Lankans in specific labour market sectors in the State of Israel and to sign a Protocol between the two parties in that regard. The Population, Immigration and Border Authority of Israel is expected to recruit employees for agricultural work in Israel pertaining to said Agreement. As such, The Cabinet noted the information furnished by the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment stating that relevant Implementation Arrangement has been signed between the two parties on 2023‑11‑06.

title: Development and maintenance of “Old Cey-Bank building and land”  located at Queen Elizabeth Mawatha, Nuwara Eliya
decision_details: - Competitive investment proposals have been called from private sector investors to redevelop and maintain the old Cey-Bank Rest building and the land located at Queen Elizabeth Mawatha, Nuwara Eliya, which is belonging to the Urban Development Authority. After evaluating the proposals submitted, based on the recommendation made by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to lease out the relevant property to Colonial Properties Private Limited., for a period of 50 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revising the cutoff levels of Aflatoxin for food supplement programmes including Thriposha which are intended to be given for children aged six months to three years
decision_details: - Under the Maternal and Child Health Programme implemented by the Ministry of Health, 'Thriposha' is provided as a supplementary food for under nourished children aged 06 months to 05 years and as an additional nutrient for pregnant and lactating mothers. However, owing to the stringent cut-off levels for total Aflatoxin specified in the existing Regulations under the Food Act No. 26 of 1980, it has been difficult to obtain the maize required for thriposha production. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to apply the cut-off levels of 5 ppb for type B1 which is the level of Alatoxin present in internationally recognized food supplements and the cut-off level of 10 ppb for the total Aflatoxin level, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Cooperation between the Press Council of Sri Lanka and the Press Council of India
decision_details: - A Memorandum of Understanding has been signed between the Press Council of Sri Lanka and the Press Council of India on 2018‑11‑16 for a period of 05 years in order to create cooperation between the two parties in relation to areas such as developing the knowledge and skills of journalists by conducting subject related workshops and conferences, implementing resource exchange programmes between the two parties, activities related to the development of media ethics and promoting media freedom and dissemination of orderly use of media. Since the said period of time has been expired as of now, it has been proposed to sign a new Memorandum of Understanding for another 5 years. Concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has been received for the proposed draft Agreement. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Mass Media, to sign the proposed Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Partnership Agreement between the Rajarata University of Sri Lanka and the Michigan State University of the United States of America
decision_details: - An agreement has been reached between the two parties to enter into a Partnership Agreement between the Rajarata University of Sri Lanka and the Michigan State University of the United States of America aiming to develop capacity building, research collaboration and for the development of Innovations and Downstream Applications relevant to smart Agriculture. The clearance of the Attorney General and the concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs have been received for the proposed draft Agreement. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to sign the proposed Agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a Dispute Prevention and Resolution Mechanism to the Public Service
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2020‑11‑16 to implement a pilot project on a mechanism for dispute prevention and dispute resolution based on the concepts of social dialogue, conciliation, mediation and arbitration aiming to introduce a mechanism similar to the private sector to resolve disputes in the public service. Accordingly, the relevant pilot project has been implemented in 04 workplaces in the healthcare and transportation sectors, and the technical and financial assistance has been received from the International Labour Organization for that purpose. Under the said pilot project, Pilot workplace forums have been established, and owing to their functioning, it has been confirmed that it enhances cooperation between the relevant parties and paves the way for dispute prevention and dispute resolution. Based on the success achieved by the implementation of the said pilot project, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government to proceed as follows:

* 	Establishment of Workplace Forums in the Government Institutions.

* 	Establishment of Sectoral Forums consisting of representatives of trade unions and management for sectors of health, transport, ports and shipping, power and Energy, education and other sectors.

* 	Establishment of the National State Dialogue Forum consisting of representatives of trade unions, relevant ministries/sectoral forums,Director General of Establishments, the Department of Management Services and the Department and 	National Budget.

* 	Establishment of 09 Provincial Mediation Boards at provincial level.

* 	Establishment of a National Arbitration Panel under the Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government.

title: Obtaining approval for submission of Orders published in the Gazettes for approval in Parliament
Establishment of the Sri Lanka Economic Commission and drafting of the new Investment Bill of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Considering the necessity of having a strong mechanism to create a more favorable environment for investment and export promotion, approval was granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023‑01‑16 to establish a new institution by amalgamating the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka and the Sri Lanka Export Development Board. Accordingly, in order to take necessary action for this purpose, an Oversight Committee on Exports and Investment was established under the Presidential Secretariat consisting of individuals with expertise knowledge in the relevant fields. The said committee has studied all the relevant matters and submitted proposals for establishing a new institutional structure and based on the said proposals, the proposal made by the Hon. President to introduce a new investment and export promotion institutional architecture and to initiate the establishment of the Sri Lanka Economic Commission and associated units under the said architecture, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Prevention of Frauds Ordinance
decision_details: - The Prevention of Frauds Ordinance has been amended by Act No.30 of 2022 in accordance with the amendments introduced to the Wills (Amendment) Act No.29 of 2022 and the Notaries (Amendment) Act No.31 of 2022. Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑05‑08 to further amend the Notaries (Amendment) Act No.31 of 2022 in order to avoid the uncertain interpretations/complications that have arisen in the said Act and also to simultaneously amend the relevant provisions of the Prevention of Frauds Ordinance. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman to amend the Prevention of Frauds Ordinance. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Notaries Ordinance
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Meeting held on 2023‑05‑08 to  amend the Notaries (Amendment) Act, No.31 of 2022 in order to address certain ambiguities/confusions existing in the said Act. Clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman incorporating relevant amendments. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Amendments to the Customs Ordinance (Chapter 235)
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2022‑10‑03 has granted approval to the proposal submitted by the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to amend sections 47, 57 and 153 of the Customs Ordinance (Chapter 235) pertaining to the matters such as revenue collection, transparency, trade facilitation and compliance requirements. Further, taking into consideration the recommendations submitted by the Ministerial Committee appointed under the chairmanship of the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to examine and report the existing issues pertaining to the release of goods retained by the Sri lanka Customs, the Cabinet approval has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑09‑04 to amend the relevant provisions in the Customs Ordinance. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the Customs Ordinance with regard to the proposed amendments, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Calling for Requests for Proposals for the Mixed Development Project at	Kirimandala Mawatha under the Public Private Partnership
decision_details: - There is a land in extent of 05 acres at Kirimandala Mawatha, Nawala developed by the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation and it has been identified that said land is suitable for the implementation of a mixed development project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to take necessary action to invite Requests for Proposals from the interested investors to implement mixed development projects under the Public-Private Partnership in a land area from the said land in extent of 2.67 acres at the first phase and in the remaining land area in extent of 2.33 acres at its second phase, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reconstruction of Pedestrian Bridges across the Marine Drive Road near the Bambalapitiya and Wellawatta Railway Stations
decision_details: - Taking into consideration the risky situation of the pedestrian bridges built across the Marine Drive Road to access the Bambalapitiya and Wellawatta Railway Stations, it has been found the necessity of constructing temporary staircases and immediate reconstruction of pedestrian bridges. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport & Highways to award the contract for the reconstruction of the said bridges which is an urgent and essential construction, to the State Development and Construction Company, subject to the condition of completing the said contract within a period of six (06) months, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing alternative lands for families who lost houses due to the land acquisition and vesting under the Greater Hambanthota Development Project
decision_details: - Since 97 families have lost their houses due to the Greater Hambanthota Development Project, they should be provided with alternative houses. A State land in extent of 10.11 hectares located at Siribopura, Hambanthota has been identified for that purpose. 126 blocks of land in the said land have been identified for the residential use and at present 84 families out of 97 families who have lost houses have been allocated blocks of land. Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposal submitted by the Minister of Urban Development and housing, the Cabinet decided to allocate blocks of land from the state land in extent of 10.11 hectares located at Siribopura, Hambanthota to the families who have lost houses due to the Greater Hambanthota Development Project and provide legal Grants for the said blocks of Land under the guidance of the Commissioner General of Lands.

title: The Salary revisions intended to be carry out by the Budget for the year 2024
decision_details: - The Cabinet held discussions pertaining to increasing the salaries of public service and the private sector by the Budget for the year 2024. At the ensued discussion, the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, apprised the Cabinet that he intends to present proposals in Parliament pertaining to the revision of salaries of the public service and in the private sector through the forthcoming budget.

title: The revision of the existing General Policy Guidlines in respect of the supply of electricity
decision_details: - The Minister in-charge of Electricity has been vested with the power to prepare General Policy Guidelines on supply of electricity subject to the approval of the Cabinet as per the provisions of the Electricity Act, No. 20 of 2009. Accordingly, as per the existing General Policy Guidelines, the tariff review period has been determined as six (06) months. The joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies and the Minister of Power and Energy to revise the tariff review period as three (03) months taking into consideration the difficulties faced by the general public due to pursuing action accordingly and to revise the existing General Policy Guidelines, enabling to conduct Energy Dispatch Audit of the Ceylon Electricity Board and to improve the predictions of electricity with the assistance of the Department of Meteorology, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tax Policy Reforms to strengthen Revenue-based Fiscal Consolidation
decision_details: - A number of progressive and broad‑based tax policy proposals have been implemented since June 2022 to achieve revenue-based fiscal consolidation with view to ensuring debt sustainability and as a result of that tax revenue has increased by 51% within the first 9 months in the year 2023 compared to the year 2022. Nevertheless, it has not yet been able to meet the tax collection targets agreed with the International Monetary Fund. Accordingly, the Cabinet granted approval to amend the relevant laws to increase the existing Value Added Tax (VAT) rate up to 18% with effect from 2024‑01‑01 and to implement new tax proposals including the imposition of VAT for certain goods and services to which VAT is not applicable at present, in order to meet tax revenue and primary balance targets as agreed with the International Monetary Fund.

title: Submission of the National Education Policy Framework to Parliament
decision_details: - A Cabinet Sub‑Committee chaired by the Hon. President and a Committee of Experts chaired by the Secretary to the Prime Minister and comprising of 25 members to assist the said Sub-Committee have been appointed to take necessary action to prepare a National Education Policy Framework and submit the same to Parliament and the said Committee of Experts paying attention to the relevant specific areas and subject matters, has drafted the National Education Policy Framework. The "National Education Policy Framework - 2023-2033" has been prepared by further developing the said draft incorporating the observations and recommendations presented by the Cabinet Sub‑Committee to the said Bill. Accordingly, the proposal made by the the Hon. President to refer the said National Education Policy Framework to the Parliamentary Sectoral Oversight Committee on Education and to table the same thereafter, in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting a Series of Programmes for the full integration of Upcountry Tamils into the Sri Lankan Society
decision_details: - The Government has planned to implement a national programme to mark 200 years for the Sri Lankan Plantation Community and several other programmes in the future for the betterment of the said community. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to appoint a Cabinet Sub‑Committee chaired by the Hon. Prime Minister to provide necessary guidance and monitor the effective and efficient implementation of the relevant programmes in collaboration with the Ministry of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development and other relevant Government and Non‑Government Institutions, enabling to develop educational and health facilities, create economic and vocational opportunities and provide a high living standard with permanent residence, towards the betterment of plantation community who are Sri Lankan citizens, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Term Contract for the procurement of 03 shipments of Crude Oil on the basis of payment in 30 days during the period from 2024-01-15 to 2024-06-14
decision_details: - Bids have been invited to award the term contract for the purchase of 03 shipments of crude oil within the period from 2024‑01‑15 to 2024‑06‑14 on the basis of payment in 30 days and 03 bids have been received for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the relevant procurement to M/s. Coral Energy DMCC, UAE, based on the recommendation of the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Procurement Committee on the said bids, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Term Contract for the procurement of 03 shipments of Crude Oil during the period from 2024-01-15 to 2024-06-14
decision_details: - Bids have been invited to award a term contract for the purchase of 03 shipments of Crude Oil during the period from 2024.01.15 to 2024.06.14 under the 100% Ex. Storage Modality payment and two bids have been received for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the relevant procurement to M/s. Vitol Asia Pte. Ltd., Singapore, based on the recommendation of the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee on the said bids, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Sri Lanka Institute of Economics and International Trade Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet has granted approval previously to prepare a Bill to establish Sri Lanka	Institute of Economics and International Trade with the objectives of being a platform 	for research and policy formulation related to economics, international finance and	international trade, providing cutting edge research and studies in the said fields, contribution of ideas for invigorating policy and concepts relating to economics, finance and	international trade and the effective promotion of international trade 	and	regional trade integration policies. Accordingly, the proposal made by the	Hon. President to publish the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman in the Government Gazette and thereafter, submit it to Parliament for approval, was 	approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Regulations issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969 to Parliament for approval
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon.President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations Act No.14 of 2023 made under the provisions of the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 and published by the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2353/16 dated 2003‑10‑09 to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Placement of Social Security Schemes in Sri Lanka under a Formal Organizational Structure
decision_details:
- According to the Reports of Census and Statistics, it is visible that out of a total of 8.1 million employed workers in Sri Lanka
about 1.2 million are employed in the public sector whereas 3.4 million people in the private sector and 58.4% of the total workforce is employed in the informal sector. However, social security schemes such as the Employees' Provident Fund and the Employees' Trust Fund cover less than 2.5 million workers. In addition, various social security schemes such as Farmer Insurance and Fisheries Insurance are implemented by various Government institutions for the informal sector, and the cost that may incur for the purpose is borne by the Government. Since, the effectiveness and efficiency of these social security systems have been challenged due to the difficulties caused by the implementation of social security schemes by different institutions under different methodologies and the cost burden should be borne by the Government or the Employer and it has been found the appropriateness of operating all social security schemes under single institution. Taking into account the proposal made by the Minister of Labor and Foreign Employment, it was decided to grant the approval of the Cabinet to appoint a committee representing all relevant parties to submit recommendations to introduce a mechanism , in order to introduce a system that will enable all the social security schemes currently in operation to be implemented under single institution also studying the international experiences in this regard.

title: National Arts Festival - Sri Lanka Abhiman
decision_details: - It has been proposed to hold the 'National Arts Festival - Sri Lanka Abhiman' on 30th, 31st December 2023 and 01st January 2024 by bringing various cultural elements together for the enhancement of enjoyment and entertainment of the general public. Accordingly, it has been designed to hold the proposed Arts Festival centering around Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Colombo 07 and the adjacent premises of Nelum Pokuna Theatre, National Art Gallery, John De Silva Memorial Theatre, Vihara Mahadevi Park, New town Hall and the National Museum. The proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to hold the 'National Arts Festival - Sri Lanka Abhiman' as a joint program of the Ministry of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs and its affiliated institutions and other public and private institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Joint Statement on the establishment of the International Mediation Organization
decision_details: - The Government of China has submitted a proposal for the establishment of a treaty-based International Mediation Organization to resolve disputes between States and commercial entities. Accordingly, the Government of China has negotiated with interested countries and Sri Lanka also has participated in some of those preliminary discussions. The preliminary Joint Statement for the establishment of the proposed organization had been issued in July 2022, and the said Joint Statement has been endorsed by about 10 countries, including China. Views have been obtained from other Government institutions including the Ministry of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms and the Attorney General's Department regarding the endorsement of the said Joint Statement by Sri Lanka, and it has been observed that any impact is not caused to the Sri Lanka's international commitments by endorsing the said Statement. Accordingly, it was decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet for the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to endorse the Joint Statement regarding the establishment of the International Mediation Organization.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Room to Read Organization and the Ministry of Education to increase the Literacy
decision_details: - According to the Constitution, the Government of Sri Lanka is obliged to 'assure all persons' right to universal and equal access to education at all levels to eradicate the illiteracy'. Since providing all the facilities by the Government for the said task is practically difficult, the support of the other parties is also obtained for that. Accordingly, since the year 2005, the Ministry of Education has been implementing the Reading Development Programme and Girls' Education Programme together with the Room to Read organization. As of now, it has been planned to further expand the said programme and implement within a period of five (05) years to be effective from 2023‑12‑01, and for that purpose, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to enter into a new Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Education and the Room to Read organization, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into Agreements by the Open University of Sri Lanka on highe education cooperation and on the establishment of the Chinese Language Centre
decision_details: - It has been agreed to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Shanghai Open University of China and the Open University of Sri Lanka for higher education cooperation aiming to promote international cooperation, scholarly collaboration and cultural interaction and friendship and to sign a tripartite agreement among the Open University of Sri Lanka, Shanghai Open University and the Bank of China Ltd., pertaining to the establishment of a Chinese Language Centre under the fields of collaboration under the said MoU. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to enter into relevant agreements to be valid for a period of five (05) years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Drafting a new Employment Act
decision_details: - The Concept Paper prepared by the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment having discussed with the Trade unions, Employers and relevant stakeholders in order to draft a new Employment Act so as to suit to the current requirements, was taken up for discussion at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2023‑08‑07. At the said Cabinet Meeting, it was decided to refer the said Concept Paper to the Trilateral Committee which is functioning under the Prime Minister's Office representing Employers, Employees and the Government, to further discuss in that regard with all relevant stakeholders and submit recommendations. Accordingly, the said Committee chaired by the Hon. Prime Minister submitted a Report with recommendations regarding the matters that need the attention of the Cabinet having studied the Concept Paper, to the attention of the Cabinet and thereafter, it was decided to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill based on the said recommendations and the Concept Paper submitted by the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment pertaining to this matter.

title: Construction of a floating solar photovoltaic (PV) power plant in the water	surface of Samanala Wewa Reservoir
decision_details: - Generation of solar power energy on the surface of reservoirs through the construction of floating solar power plants deemed as a better alternative for land limited countries. Accordingly, it has been identified that there is a good potential on the surface of the reservoirs that are under the purview of Ceylon Electricity Board and the Mahaweli Authority of Sri Lanka, to implement solar energy generation projects and have confirmed that there is a possibility of utilizing approximately 100 Hectares of the water surface of Samanala Wewa Reservoir under Ceylon Electricity Board for the construction of a floating solar photovoltaic (PV) power plant of 150-200 MW.  Accordingly,  the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to call requests for proposals from the interested proponents to construct and implement the proposed solar power plant adhering to National Procurement Guidelines applicable for the implementation of infrastructure projects, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Grant assistance provided by the Government of Japan for the development of the	Fisheries Industry
