decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2020‑10‑19 to call for investment proposals from the investors of the private sector on competitive basis to develop the lands belonging to the Urban Development Authority.  As per a proposal so received, the Standing Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee of the Ministry of Urban Development and Housing has approved to grant a land in extent of 03 Roods and 17.75 perches at the Dambulla divisional secretariat division belonging to the Urban Development Authority on lease basis, to implement an Agro-Based Logistics and Industry Project. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to grant the said land on lease basis, to Dambulla Agro Cool Holdings (Pvt) Ltd., for a period of 30 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting deeds to the doctors in the Wedagama Village of Indigenous medical practitioners
decision_details: - The Wedagama model village has been set up in the Dompe Divisional Secretariat Division in order to appreciate services of Indigenous Medical Practitioners, promote indigenous medicine and enable to obtain the services of Indigenous Medical Practitioners skilled in different areas at the same location. In the said village, 25 Indigenous Medical Practitioners each have been allocated approximately one acre of land, but so far, the Titles of such lands have not been transferred to them. The availability of a freehold deed for these lands in the name of the Secretary, Ministry of Health and Indigenous Medicine has become a major impediment to transfer the ownership of such lands to Indigenous Medicinal Practitioners. The Attorney General has given instructions on the steps to be taken regarding the transfer of the respective lands to the Indigenous Medicinal Practitioners, and accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Health to take necessary action to offer formal grants for such lands, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for Supplying of Aviation Fuel for SriLankan Airlines at the Hamad International Airport Doha, Qatar and the Kuwait International Airport
decision_details: - Existing Aviation Fuel Supply Contracts for SriLankan Airlines Limited at the Hamad International Airport Doha, Qatar and the Kuwait International Airport are due to expire on 2023‑10‑31.  Bids have been invited from Qatar Fuel Company and Kuwait Aviation Fueling Company, sole aviation fuel suppliers at the said 02 Airports, in accordance with the Government Procurement Guidelines. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the contracts for fuel suppliers for aircraft of SriLankan Airlines Limited at the Hamad International Airport Doha, Qatar and and the Kuwait International Airport for a period of 24 months as direct contracts, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting of the Public Pilgrimage Hall constructed under the Kataragama Pooja Bhoomi Planning Scheme with the Kiri Vehera Raja Maha Viharaya
decision_details: - Public Pilgrimage Hall constructed under the Kataragama Pooja Bhoomi Planning Scheme has been vested with the Kiri Vehera Raja Maha Viharaya for a period of 05 years for maintenance and continuance and it returned to the National Physical Planning Department after the expiry of the said time period. The Chief Incumbent Thero of the Kataragama Raja Maha Viharaya has made a request to vest the said Pilgrimage Hall again with the Kiri Vehera Raja Maha Viharaya. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to vest the said Pilgrimage Hall with the  Kataragama Raja Maha Viharaya for a period 05 years upon a Memorandum of Understanding, subject to carrying out the maintenance, renovations and settlement of bills relating to contractual services of the building by the said Viharaya, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Regulations issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969 for approval in Parliament
decision_details: - An agreement has been reached during the discussions held with the relevant parties to lift import restrictions on number of other goods where importation has been temporarily suspended through the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No. 02 of 2023 through which import restrictions were imposed, while further continuing import restrictions on passenger motor vehicles and certain selected goods.  The Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No. 11 of 2023 have been published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2341/38 dated 2023‑07‑20 by making provisions for the above purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to present the said Regulations to Parliament for approval as per the provisions of the the Imports and Exports (Control) Act No. 1 of 1969, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a new Department for Cinnamon Development
decision_details: - Taking into consideration the contribution of cinnamon to foreign exchange earnings as a minor export crop, the Hon. President has pointed out the necessity of promoting the said crop as a commercial crop, through a Budget proposal for the year 2023. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Plantation Industries to establish a new Department named as the Cinnamon Development Department to provide the necessary facilities for the production and exportation of cinnamon, improvement of the quality of cinnamon products, value addition, diversification of products and facilitate  cinnamon growers, processors and exporters, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the National Productivity Commission
decision_details: - It is necessary to develop the productivity of all sectors of the economy in order to bring the benefits achieved by the reforms implemented with the aim to mitigate the impact of the current economic crisis to a maximum level and to ensure the medium and long-term sustainability of those reforms. However, there is no legally responsible institution in this country to address the issues related to productivity. Therefore, it has been identified the necessity of the establishment of the National Productivity Commission as an independent body to look into the issues related to productivity and recommend to the government on policy directions based on research-based evidence and data. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to appoint an Experts Committee to determine the organizational structure of the proposed National Productivity Commission, compilation of required legislation for the establishment of the said Commission and to study the other matters that need to be addressed in relation to the establishment of the said Commission, and submit a Report to the Cabinet, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enforcement of Bilateral and Multilateral Agreements
decision_details: - It has been decided at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023-05-22, that after entering into bilateral and multilateral agreements which are determined to be essential for national development, laws should be enacted incorporating the provisions, so as not to deviate from those agreements without the consent of the parties concerned. The proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill based on the preliminary draft that has been prepared accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Guidelines prepared as per the provisions of the Office on the Missing 	Persons Act
decision_details: - In terms of the provisions mentioned in section 11(c) of the Office on the Missing Persons (Establishment, Administration and Discharge of Functions) Act No.14 of 2016, the rules and guidelines should be issued from time to time incorporating the policies to be followed relating to excise and discharge of powers, duties and functions of the that Office. Accordingly,  the relevant Guidelines have been prepared considering the observations and recommendations of the Attorney General and it was decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet to the said Guidelines submitted by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms.

title: Amendments to the Civil Procedure Code (Chapter 101) (Pre-Trial 	Conference)
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2021‑09‑27 to amend the Civil Procedure Code, enabling to make remedies for the issues and challenges that have arisen after implementing new provisions on pre-trial proceedings which were introduced by the Civil Procedure Code (Amendment) Act, No.8 of 2017 and to expedite legal proceedings and reduce the time consumed in adjudication. Accordingly, relevant Bill has been prepared by the Legal Draftsman. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the said Bill. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Consolidated strategic communication programme for the promotion of 	national aspirations and international image of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - It has been identified the necessity of implementing a strategic communication programme to upgrade the international image of Sri Lanka and to manage a correct foreign policy in a balanced manner by strengthening international relations enabling to face global and regional challenges. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Mass Media and the Minister of Foreign Affairs to implement a  communication programme for the promotion of national aspirations and the international image of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a 33kV Double Circuit Zebra Tower Line from 	Kerawalapitiya Grid Substation to Nugape Junction
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2022‑12‑19 to authorize the Minister in charge of the subject of Environment to amend the Gazette Notification No.1466/26 dated 2006‑10‑13 presently in force and issue a new Gazette Notification to enable to declare the Construction of a 33kv Double Circuit Zebra Tower Line to Nugape Junction from Kerawalapitiya Grid Substation in the periphery of Mudiyanse Ela of Muturajawela Environment Conservation Area, as a permissible activity. The Central Environmental Authority has informed the Ceylon Electricity Board that required permission could be granted to construct the said  33kV Double Circuit Zebra Tower Line along the boarder of the Muturajawela Environment Conservation Area instead of constructing the same in the periphery of Mudiyanse Ela. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to authorize the Minister in charge of the subject of Environment to issue a New Gazette Notification amending the Gazette Notification No.1466/26 dated 2006‑10‑13, declaring that construction of a 33kV Double Circuit Zebra Tower Line is a permissible task, enabling to construct the said power line along the proposed alternative route, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Agreement between the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka and Hambantota Oil Refinery (Pvt) Ltd.
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2019‑09‑17 to enter into an Agreement  between the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka and Hambantota Oil Refinery (Pvt) Ltd., in order to set up a petroleum refinery at Hambantota with a 420,000 barrels capacity per day, exclusively for the export market. A land in extent of 1,200 acres has also been allocated on 50 years long term lease basis for implementing that project. However, the project proponent has not obtained the said land on lease basis and the project has also not yet been implemented. Although the project proponent has been informed several instances in writing regarding the implementation of the project, no response has been made in that regard. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to terminate the said Agreement, since the project proponent has not acted as per the provisions of the Agreement entered into by the two parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of water from the Samanalawewa Reservoir for cultivation
decision_details: - The Minister of Power and Energy brought to the notice of the Cabinet on the alternative measures that could be taken pertaining to the proposal for the release of water from the Samanawewa Reservoir due to the lack of sufficient water for  cultivations of farmers engaged in farming under the Udawalawa Reservoir.  After an extended discussion on the said alternatives, the Cabinet granted approval to release the maximum possible quantity of water remaining in the Samanalawewa Reservoir for farming and to purchase the necessary electricity from the private sector as a solution to the issues arising with regard to electricity generation due to the above action.

title: Amendments to the Employees' Provident Fund Act, No.15 of 1958 to guarantee the rate of interest on the contributions of the members of the Employees' Provident Fund
decision_details: - The Government has identified the necessity to ensure the retirement payments and benefits of the members of the Employees' Provident Fund without causing an impact on the same through the optimization of the Treasury Bonds held by the said Fund under the Domestic Debt Optimization Programme. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to take necessary action to amend the Employees' Provident Fund Act, No.15 of 1958 so as to guarantee the minimum annual rate of interest on contributions as 9% for the next period of time of four years from 2023 to 2026, taking into consideration the percentages of annual interest benefit paid to the members of the Employees' Provident Fund within the recent period of five years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Achievements in managing the Economic crisis and Way forward
decision_details: - The information presented by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, regarding the issues faced by the country when the current Hon. President was appointed as the Prime Minister and the Minister of Finance in May 2022 and after assuming duties of the Presidency on 2022‑07‑20, the actions taken so far together with the new Cabinet pertaining to the areas such as fiscal policy, monetary policy, energy sector, external sector, debt	restructuring and foreign financing in order to create the economic stability in the country by solving the said issues, was considered by the Cabinet.  Also, the Cabinet granted it's concurrence on the Reform measures that are expected to carry out in the future in order to create economic growth by restoring the economy.

title: Amendment to the Control of Pesticides Act, No.33 of 1980
decision_details: - It has been identified the necessity of amending the Control of Pesticides Act, No.33 of 1980 in consistent with the regulatory priorities in the global pesticide industry and the approaches that support the investigations against growing illegal activities. Accordingly, The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill consisting of provisions including the recovery of public funds spent on eco‑friendly disposal of illegal pesticides from the offenders and the strengthening of punishment and activities related to suppression of repeated illegal acts by offenders and other relevant provisions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Civil Aviation Act, No.14 of 2010
decision_details: - The approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023‑03‑27 to amend section 6(3)(e) of the Civil Aviation Act, No.14 of 2010, enabling more number of service providers to take part in providing aeronautical services. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present it in the Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a new Act to regulate Container Depot Operators
decision_details: - The Licensing of Shipping Agents, Freight Forwarders, Non‑Vessel Operating Common Carriers, and Container Depot Operators Act, No.10 of 1972 has been amended several times and as per the provisions of the said Act, Container Depot Operators are to be regulated considering as a “Service Provider”. It has been observed that pursuing action in accordance with the aforesaid manner adversely affects on the development of Container Depot Operators on modern‑day trade, shipping, and logistics requirements and their infrastructure facilities. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to introduce a new Act with provisions for the regulation and control of business carried on by container depot operators, determination of rates and charges, imposition and collection of rates and charges and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a new Bill for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision  of  a  government  owned  land  in  the  Hambantota  district  for brackish water prawn farming, on long term lease basis
decision_details: - A production of 14,414 Metric Tons have been obtained in the year 2021 through brackish water prawn farming which is a main commercial aquaculture farming in Sri Lanka and targets have been set up to increase the productions up to 50,000 Metric Tons and earn Rs.65,500 million of foreign exchange by the year 2025. However, lack of lands which could be utilized for aquaculture farming in this country remains as a challenge to expand the commercial aquaculture farming any further. In order to face this challenge, the National Aquaculture Development Authority has taken several measures such as introduction of modern technology to achieve a high productivity within a limited space. Accordingly, a Government owned land in extent of 218 acres and 30 perches in the Ambalantota Divisional Secretariat Division of the Hambantota district has been identified as suitable for farming Litopenaeus Vannamei which a farming cycle could be completed in a short period of time. Therefore, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries and the Minister of Tourism and Lands to lease out 109 acres and 15 perches each to W. S. R. Love & K. M. N. Aqua Services (Pvt) Ltd., and Rainbow Foods (Pvt) Ltd., the two companies which have been selected by following the Government Procurement process, based on the valuation of the Government Valuer, for a period of 30 years on long term lease basis, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National  Policy  on  Anti-Money Laundering and Countering the Financing of  Terrorism (AMI/CFT) of Sri Laka  and  the Action  Plan
decision_details: - The Financial Intelligence Unit which has been established under the provisions of the Financial Transactions Reporting Act, No.6 of 2006, functions as a Department of the Central bank of Sri Lanka and it executes the provisions for the prevention of Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing and other unlawful activities defined in the Act. The Financial Actions Task Force, the inter‑governmental body which sets international standards to prevent Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing, has introduced 40 recommendations to be implemented by all the countries. As such, the Asia Pacific Group on Money Laundering, the regional institute of the Financial Actions Task Force evaluates whether Sri Lanka functions in compliance with the recommendations of the said Task Force. The 3rd Mutual Evaluation on Sri Lanka by the said Group is due to be commenced from March 2025. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to implement the National Policy on Anti-Money Laundering and Countering the Financing of Terrorism of Sri Laka for 2023‑2028 in order to fully assure the situation of Sri Lanka and to implement the Action Plans including the functions to be performed by each institution as remedies for the weaknesses identified in the prevention of Money Laundering and Countering the Financing of Terrorism, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Aswesuma Social Welfare Benefit Programme
decision_details:
- The Cabinet decided to grant its concurrence for the following arrangements presented by the Hon. President pertaining to the expeditious payment of benefits under the Aswesuma Social Welfare Benefit Programme:

    • Making payments for 1,588,835 beneficiaries who do not have appeals or objections pending against them, out of 1,792,265 beneficiaries selected by the Welfare Benefit Board for the Aswesuma Programme.
      
    • Making payments for 84,374 selected beneficiaries but have appealed for inclusion in a higher category, under their present category until a final decision is taken having completed the appeal review process.

    • Making entitled payments to 119,056 against whom objections have been filed, out of the selected beneficiaries, until the review process conducted with regard to the said objections is concluded.

    • Making payments for 393,094 Samurdhi beneficiaries who have applied for benefits through this programme but have not been selected, under the Samurdhi Programme until the review process for appeals and objections under the Aswesuma Programme is fully completed.

    • Making payments continuously for beneficiaries receiving Kidney Disease Support and Disability Support at present, through the Divisional Secretariats and paying Elders' Support through Post Offices.

    • Making relevant payments further for 11,660 persons who are suffering from kidney diseases, disabled or elderly,  in Care Homes or places of religious worship.

title: Obtaining Services for Aircraft of SriLankan Airlines at the Cochin International Airport (COK), India and the Jakarta International Airport (CGK), Indonesia
decision_details: - Bids have been invited by Srilankan Airlines Limited to select service suppliers for passenger and ramp and cargo handling services at the Cochin International Airport, India and the Jakartha International Airport, Indonesia. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the service supply contract of the  the Cochin International Airport, India, to AI Airport Services Limited and that of the Jakarta International Airport, Indonesia, to PT. Gapura Angkasa, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Standing Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the National Authority on Tobacco and Alcohol Act, No. 27 of 2006
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the the National Authority on Tobacco and Alcohol Act, No. 27 of 2006, so as to appoint Medical Officer of Health and Additional Medical Officer of Health as Authorized Officers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of a project to prevent the damage caused to the people 	who are frequently affected by the floods in the Gin River
decision_details: - It has been identified the need of implementing a project enabling to provide a permanent solution to prevent the damage caused to the people who are frequently affected by the floods in the Gin River. The proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding with MCC- Sinohydro Consortium to carry out a feasibility study for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Regularization and making efficiency of the role of the Inquirer-into-Sudden Deaths
decision_details: - The General public have been facing inconveniences in obtaining the services of Inquirer-into-Sudden Deaths owing to the absence of exact identification of relevant Inquirer-into-Sudden Deaths Divisions since such appointments are made on the Koralaya basis, municipal area basis and hospital basis. Prevalence of large number of vacancies in certain districts due to not granting Inquirer-into-Sudden Deaths appointments for a long period of time also has caused inconveniences to the General Public. With a view to settling such issues and providing a more efficient and regularized service to the General Public, the Ministry of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms has prepared a Standing Procedure Code clearly stating the provisions including the qualifications for appointment of Inquirer-into-Sudden Deaths, their responsibilities and role. The future programme planned by the Ministry relating to the attachment of all Inquirers-into-sudden Deaths already appointed to Divisional Secretariat Divisions and identified hospitals, appointment of bi-lingual Inquirers-into-Sudden Deaths for bi-lingual Divisional Secretariat Divisions and making fresh recruitments to fill up the remaining vacancies in terms of the provisions of the said Code, was forwarded to the Cabinet by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms and the Cabinet decided to grant the concurrence for the same.

title: Submission of the Order issued under the provisions of the Sri Lanka Export Development Act, No.40 of 1979, for approval in Parliament
decision_details: - An order has been issued under the provisions of the Sri Lanka Export Development Act No. 40 of 1979 to increase the CESS duty levied on the importation of clinker, which is an intermediate material required for cement manufacturing, and fully finished and ready for sale cement, anticipating to increase the revenue generated by importing cement and allied products, while facilitating local manufacturers. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to present the said Order which has been published in the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2336/71 dated 16 June 2023, in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Australia for Cooperation in Sport
decision_details: - The validity period of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between Sri Lanka and Australia for a period of three years to develop cooperation in sports, has ended on 15 February 2020. It has been proposed to sign a new memorandum of understanding so that the said Memorandum of Understanding could be further extended for a period of three years aiming to identify the fields of sports in which outstanding talents can be shown between the two countries and exchange information and programmes between sportspersons and sports officials engaged in those fields as well as to strengthen the bilateral corporation in the field of sports based on mutual benefits. Accordingly, the two parties have reached to a consensus on the draft of the MoU prepared accordingly and the clearance of the Attorney General has also been received for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs to sign the said MoU, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a License Agreement between the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation	and the National Radio and Television Administration of the People's Republic	of China
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a License Agreement between the National Radio and Television Administration of the People's Republic of China and the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation in order to exchange of television programmes, with the aim of strengthening the mutual understanding, friendship and cooperation between the two countries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Mass Media to sign the License Agreement prepared for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Restructuring of the Department of Sri Lanka Railways
decision_details: - It has been identified that it is essential to restructure the Department of Sri Lanka Railways which is classified as a Grade A department of the Government, providing both the  passenger and freight services, in order to reduce the conflicts that have arisen as of now with related to the administrative, financial and operational functions of the said Department and to maintain the provision of services at the optimal level and for that, the concurrence of all the parties related to the Department has been received. Accordingly, taking into account a proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways, the approval was granted by the Cabinet to appoint a committee consisting of experts on relevant subject to submit suitable proposals regarding the restructuring of the department under a more suitable model.

title: Financial Assistance from the World Bank for implementation of the Social	Protection Project
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023.05.08, to negotiate with the World Bank to secure funds for the implementation of a project that will provide better targeted income support and livelihood opportunities to the poor and vulnerable and strengthen the social protection system. In the negotiations held accordingly, the World Bank has agreed to provide US$ 200 million funds under three (03) components as US$ 185 million to support the new welfare benefit payment scheme 'Aswesuma', US$ 07 million to support the implementation of a pilot project to economically empower the selected beneficiaries and US$ 08 million to manage the overall project and strengthen the social protection system.  The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to enter into the relevant Agreement with the International Development Association of the World Bank Group in order to obtain the relevant loan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Fifth Round of Negotiations on the proposed Sri Lanka-Thailand Free	Trade	Agreement
decision_details: - The Fifth Round of Negotiations on the proposed Sri Lanka -Thailand Free Trade Agreement has been held from 2023.06.26 to 2023.06.28 in Colombo. During this Round, Negotiations on Chapters namely Customs Cooporation and Trade Facilitation, Economic Cooporation and Sanitary and Phytosanitary measures have been concluded. The information relating to the progress of the Fifth Round of Negotiations on Sri Lanka -Thailand Free Trade Agreement submitted by the Hon. President stating that it is expected to conclude the relevant negotiations by February, 2024 adhering to the Action Plan of the proposed Agreement and sign the Agreement by March, 2024, was considered by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Inland Revenue Act, No. 24 of 2017
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑06‑28 has granted approval to introduce relevant amendments to the Inland Revenue Act No. 24 of 2017 to revise the income tax rate applicable on the income earned from investment made in Treasury Bonds by the Employees Trust Fund, Employees Provident Fund (EPF), Pension Fund or Gratuity Fund and similar Funds in order to facilitate the Domestic Debt Optimizing process.  The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the draft prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a Standard Operating Procedure for granting Diplomatic Clearance for Foreign Seaborne Vessels arriving in Sri Lanka and Foreign Military or State Aircrafts
decision_details: - Due to the geostrategic location of Sri Lanka in the Indian Ocean, foreign seaborne vessels and foreign military or state aircrafts frequently visit Sri Lanka. Further, States and competent International Organizations are interested in carrying out Marine Scientific Research in the Exclusive Economic Zone and the Continental Shelf of Sri Lanka. In this context, it has been found necessary to prepare a Standard Operating Procedure so as to grant diplomatic clearance for such activities. Accordingly, the Acting Minister of Foreign Affairs has submitted the Standard Operating Procedure prepared in consultation with all parties to the Cabinet and it was decided to grant approval for the same.

title: Japanese Grant Aid for Human Resource Development Scholarship Programme - 2023
decision_details: - The Government of Japan has agreed to grant Yen 284 million (approximately Rs. 611 million) for the second batch of the 4th Framework of the Human Resources Development Scholarship Programme implemented under the Japanese Grant Aid. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to sign the Exchange Notes with the Government of Japan and enter into an Agreement with the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) to obtain the said Grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for the Passenger and Ramp Handling Services for SriLankana Airlines at the Chennai International Airport (MAA), India
decision_details: - The current Standard Ground Handling Agreement for passenger and ramp handling services at the Chennai International Airport is due to expire on 2023‑10‑31. Bids have been invited following the Limited International Bidding Procedure to obtain the said services. Three bids have been received for the same and accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the relevant contract to Bird Airport Services (Chennai) Pvt. Ltd. for a period of 03 years based on the recommendation submitted by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for supplying of Aviation Fuel for SriLankan Airlines at Kathmandu Air Port, Nepal
decision_details: - The current contract to supply fuel to SriLankan Airlines aircraft at Kathmandu Airport is due to expire on 2023.08.31. Bids have been invited under the Limited International Procurement method for the selection of new aircraft fuel suppliers and only one bid has been received. Accordingly, the  proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the relevant contract to Associated Energy Group LLC, the only substantially responsive bidder, for a period of 02 years, based on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Sri Lanka to be a founding member of the Global Biofuels Alliance
decision_details: - It has been announced at the India Energy Week held in February 2023 that steps will be taken to form a Global Biofuel Alliance during India's G20 presidency. Under the proposed alliance, it is expected to corporate the countries such as  Brazil, India and the United States which are leading biofuel producers and consumers, with other interested countries and encourage the sustainable usage of biofuels in the energy sector especially in transportation. Also, the proposed Alliance will pay their attention on developing and strengthening the market by facilitating the global biofuels trade, sharing the best practices towards the development of optimal policies and providing technical support for worldwide national biofuel practices. India seeks the endorsement of all the nations to join the said new Alliance and has invited Sri Lanka to sign the Foundational Document to become a founding member of the Alliance. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy for Sri Lanka to be a founding member of the Global Biofuels Alliance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for strengthening Buddhist relations between Sri Lanka and India
decision_details: - A Memorandum of Understanding has been entered into between Sri Lanka and India on 2022-03-28 to implement the projects under a grant of US$ 15 million provided by the Government of India in order to strengthen the Buddhist relations between the two countries. Under the said Memorandum of Understanding, both parties have agreed to allocate US$ 10 million to provide solar power facilities for Buddhist temples and pirivenas. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to sign a fresh Memorandum of Understanding by making the relevant amendments to the Memorandum of Understanding already entered, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Promoting Circular Economy in the Food Sector (PCEFS) Project, proposed to be financed under the European Union Grant Assistance
decision_details: - A grant of Euro 60 million  has been allocated for the period of 2021-2024 by the "Multi- Annual Indicative Programme 2021-2027 for Sri Lanka" which has been published under the European Union's country strategy for Sri Lanka. It has been proposed to implement a project called "Promoting Circular Economy in the Food Sector" using Euro 15 million from that grant. Promoting the circular economy of the food sector by increasing resilience to food crises and climate change has been identified as the primary objective of the proposed project. The project will support the adoption of efficient food distribution channels/mechanisms, to take action to improve food security for vulnerable people by minimizing food wastage, and to convert food waste into farming inputs such as organic fertilizer and animal feed. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to enter into a Grant Agreement with the European Union for the implementation of the proposed project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a new Prison Administration Act
decision_details: - The Prison system of Sri Lanka is governed under the Prison Ordinance No.16 of 1877 and it has been observed that the provisions included in the said Ordinance are not sufficient to the present day requirements. Further, certain provisions in the said Ordinance are inconsistent with International legal obligations and standards to which Sri Lanka is bound.  Therefore, an initial draft has been prepared by the Prison Law Reform Committee appointed by the then Minister of Justice upon the necessity of introducing a new Prison Administration Act. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reform to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a new Bill, based on the said initial draft, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extending the Concession on Embarkation Levy for Jaffna International Airport
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Meeting held on 2022‑12‑19 to charge only 50% of the embarkation levy to be paid by the International aviation companies at the Jaffna International Airport, for a period of 06 months, in order to promote the use of Jaffna International Airport. The said concessionary period has been expired by at 2023‑07‑11. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to extend the period of charging only 50% of the embarkation levy, by another 06 months so that the price of air tickets can be determined at an affordable price for the passengers using that airport, was approved by the Cabinet .

title: Revision of water and sewerage tariffs
decision_details: - Financial viability and sustainability of the National Water Supply & Drainage Board have to be ensured, enabling to achieve the objectives of expanding the access to safe water and sanitation, improve service quality and implement sustainable water resource management practices. Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply & Estate Infrastructure Development, Cabinet decided to grant approval to revise the water and sewerage tariffs, causing a minimum impact to the social security base provided to low income earning categories in relation to the education, religious and public water supply.

title: Selection of Transaction Advisors for Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation Ltd., Canwill Holdings (Pvt)Ltd.(Hyatt), Hotel Developers Lanka Ltd., (Hilton) and Litro Gas Lanka Ltd.
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑03-13 to restructure the above mentioned companies. Accordingly, Expressions of Interest and Requests for proposal have been called for selecting Transaction Advisors for the said purpose by following the international competitive procurement procedure. Transaction Advisors for the above 4 companies have been selected by following the quality and cost based selection procedures from among the proposals shortlisted by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to enter into relevant agreements with the following selected Transaction Advisiors, was approved by the Cabinet

	(i)	Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation Ltd.- Alvarez and Marsal
	(ii) 	Canwill Holdings (Pvt) Ltd - Deloitte India
	(iii) 	Hotel Developers (Lanka) Ltd - Colliers Singapore
	(iv)	Litro Gas Lanka Ltd - Deloitte India

title: Provision of Welfare Benefit Payments for Elderly Beneficiaries,  Chronic Kidney Patients with unknown etiology (CKDu) and Differently-Abled Persons
decision_details: - Lists with about two million names identified for the implementation of the Aswesuma Welfare Benefit Payment Scheme have now been published at the Divisional Secretariat and Grama Niladhari Divisional levels for submitting appeals and objections. Accordingly, Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies for making welfare benefit payments for the 3 social groups of Elderly Beneficiaries, Chronic Kidney Patients with unknown etiology (CKDu) and Differently-Abled Persons, stated in the Gazette Notification which has already been published, until such persons who have applied for obtaining welfare benefits are determined based on the most appropriate criteria and guidelines for obtaining such benefits under the said Programme.

title: Preparation of a Master Plan for development of the Hambantota District
decision_details: - Although, approval of the cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2018‑06‑26 to assign the task of obtaining consultancy services for the preparation of a Greater Hambantota Regional Structure Plan and a Detailed Master Plan for Key Growth Centres to Surbana Jurong (Private) Company, action have not yet been taken as per the said decision. The Government has decided to give priority to the development of the Hambantota district, and it has been identified that it would be more appropriate to assign the task of preparing a master plan for the development of Hambantota district to Surbana Jurong (Private) Company itself, which has been entrusted with the responsibility of preparing master plans for the development of the Colombo city and the Western Province, and the development of the Eastern Province Strategic Tourism Zone. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to assign the said task to  to Surbana Jurong (Private) Company, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enrollment of the 07th intake under the Interest Free Student Loan Scheme
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meting held on 2023‑04‑24 to enroll the 07th intake under the Interest Free Student Loan Scheme, to follow degree courses in Non-State universities. The Bank of Ceylon and the Peoples' Bank have expressed their concurrence to implement this loan scheme with a minimum interest rate of 13% for the entire loan duration. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to implement the Interest Free Student Loan Scheme for the students who have fulfilled requisite qualifications from among the students selected to follow degree courses upon the GCE(A/L) results in the years of 2019, 2020 and 2021, under the 07th intake, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Mid-Year Fiscal Position Report
decision_details: - In terms of section 10 of the Fiscal Management (Responsibility) Act, No.3 of 2003, the Minister in charge of the subject of Finance is required to release the Report of Mid-Year Fiscal Position to the general public by the end of June of each year and thereafter to table the same in Parliament. Accordingly, the Mid-Year Fiscal Position Report up to 2023‑06‑30 has been published on the website of the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to table the said Report in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bill to amend the approved Borrowing Limit for the Financial Year 2023
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meting held on 2023‑06‑28 to amend the approved borrowing limit for the financial year 2023. Accordingly, a Bill has been drafted by the Legal Draftsman to amend the Appropriation Act, No.43 of 2022 and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the same. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette, and thereafter present it in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Order under subsection (2) of Section 29A of the Judicature Act, No. 2 of 1978
decision_details: - Section 29A(2) of the Judicature Act, No. 2 of 1978 indicates the provisions that the monetary value of all actions specified in the Seventh Schedule over which the Small Claims Court will have exclusive original civil jurisdiction, shall be designated by the Minister in-charge of the subject of Justice from time to time. The Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms has published an Order in the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2328/16 dated 2023.04.21, which states that the monetary value up to Rs. 1.5 million excluding the interest, which has been fixed to the said courts, shall be Rupees two million or not exceeding Rupees two million, excluding the interest. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to submit the said Order in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority Act No. 51 of 1979
decision_details: - The Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023.01.02 to amend the Sri Lanka Ports Authority Act No. 51 of 1979. Accordingly, the clearance of the  Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and then submit it to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Civil Aviation Aeronautical Service Provider (Air Navigation and Aviation	Security) Licensing Regulations No.01 of 2023
decision_details: - The Civil Aviation Aeronautical Service Provider (Air Navigation and Aviation Security) Licensing Regulations No. 01 of 2023 has been promulgated through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2326/16 dated 2023.04.03, as per the provisions of the Civil Aviation Act No. 14 of 2010, enabling to ensure the safe aircraft operation within the aerodromes and airspace of Sri Lanka in accordance with the standards and recommended practices contained in the annexes to the Convention on International Civil Aviation. Accordingly, the proposal submitted by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation Services to submit the said Regulations in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Restructuring the Cooperative Wholesale Establishment
decision_details: - Taking into account the facts that the expected objectives by establishing the Cooperative Wholesale Establishment (Sathosa) have not been fulfilled and that the institution has not contributed effectively to the economy, it has been identified the necessity of restructuring the Sathosa. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to appoint an Operations and Monitoring Committee to carry out the activities related to the restructuring of the Cooperative Wholesale Establishment (Sathosa) and to implement the proposed restructuring process, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing a land plot located in IT Park, Malabe for the establishment of	the laboratory of Sri Lanka Standards Institution
decision_details: - A 3 acre plot of land in the Information Technology Park in Malabe has been allocated for the construction of the laboratory of the Sri Lanka Standards Institution. The amount spent by the Urban Development Authority to acquire that plot of land has already been paid by the Sri Lanka Standards Institution. Accordingly, taking into account the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing, the Cabinet granted approval to transfer the said plot of land to the Sri Lanka Standards Institution through a freehold deed.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding for obtaining oil spill	monitoring service based on satellite technology
decision_details: - As the number of vessels sailing in Sri Lankan territorial waters is increasing with the growth of the marine industry and port development, it has been identified the necessity to establish a system to quickly obtain information about oil spills caused by vessels. By having such a system, it will be possible to take quick steps to prevent marine pollution caused by vessels, to identify the vessels responsible for it and to take relevant legal actions. Accordingly, the Ministry for the Economy and Finance of France has agreed to provide a grant of Euro 601,810 through Collected Localization Satellites, as a pilot project and the draft Memorandum of Understanding proposed to be signed has received the clearance of the Attorney General. The proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to sign the said Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Updated National Physical Planning Policy and Plan - 2048
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2020‑01‑02 has granted approval to update the National Physical Plan in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the 'National Physical Planning Policy and Plan - 2048' has been prepared based on the proposals made  through the Throne Speeches and Budget Speeches presented by the Hon. President, Policy Framework of the Government,  data updated by various institutions and the Report of the Inter-Government Panel on Climate Change - 2021 and as per the instructions of the Technical Advisory Committee established in accordance with the provisions of Town and Country Planning (Amendment) Act, No. 49 of 2000 and with the contribution of all relevant parties. Approval of the Inter-Ministerial Coordinating Committee on  Physical Planning and the National Physical Planning Council has been received for the said plan. Accordingly, The Cabinet decided to grant its concurrence for the implementation of the updated National Physical Planning Policy and Plan - 2048 presented by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing.

title: Providing the land located at Sir James Peiris Mawatha, Colombo 02, which had been leased out to the Board of Governors of Sri Jinarathana Education Institute, as a grant
decision_details: - During the implementation of the Beira Lake Restoration Project,  a block of land in extent of 45 perches located at Sir James Peiris Mawatha, Colombo 02 has been provided to the Sri Jinarathana Education Institute on 99 year lease basis for education purposes, in lieu of land being utilized by the said Institute. The Patron Thero of the Governing Council of Sri Jinarathana Education Institute has made a request to provide the said land block as a grant in lieu of long-term lease, in order to develop the same enabling to provide educational services more efficiently and to provide more facilities to the students of the institute.  The said request has been approved by the Board of Management of the Urban Development Authority on 06.04.2023. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to provide the said block of land to the Governing Council of the Sri Jinarathana Education Institute by the Urban Development Authority as a grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Water Resources Policy and Management Mechanism of  Implementation
decision_details: - Sri Lanka has also now been enlisted in the category of most vulnerable countries  effected by the severe climate change conditions over the last decade. As a result the country has to face unexpected severe droughts and floods due to the gradual decrease in monsoon rainfall in the dry zone areas of the country and the intensified rainfall in the wet zone areas. Optimum management of limited water resources available in this country for drinking, irrigation, energy and service requirements is turning into an extremely complex process under the backdrop of such uncontrollable climate change. Therefore, introduction of more practical Water Resource Policy has become a prime national interest. Accordingly, the Hon. Prime Minister presented the National Water Resources Policy and Management Mechanism of Implementation prepared by the Committee of Experts appointed under the Chairmanship of  Prof. C.M. Madduma Bandara, a former Vice Chancellor of the University of Peradeniya, representing the relevant fields, under the coordination of the Prime Minister's Office and the Cabinet decided to grant approval for the same.

title: Preferential Trade Agreement proposed to be entered into with Indonesia
decision_details: - Indonesia, the largest economy in the South East Asia, has been identified as a potential trade partner for Sri Lanka to build beneficial trade relationships. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to initiate negotiations to enter into a Preferential Trade Agreement as an initial step towards Free Trade Agreement with that country in the long run, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of a Joint Declaration of Intent between the Government of India and the Government of Sri Lanka for Cooperation in the field of Animal Husbandry and Dairying
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Joint Declaration of Intent between the Government of India and the Government of Sri Lanka for Cooperation in the field of Animal Husbandry and Dairying, to work together in order to enhance the quality of milk production in Sri Lanka, achieve self-sufficiency in milk production and increase the income of smallholder farmers. Clearance of the Attorney General has been received to the Joint Declaration drafted for that purpose. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Agriculture  to sign the said Declaration of Intent, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Light Rail Transit (LRT) Project supported by the Government of Japan
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President to develop an appropriate framework to enter into the relevant Agreement by restarting negotiations with the Japanese Diplomatic Missions in Colombo enabling to commence the proposed Light Rail Transit (LRT) Project, was approved by the Government.

title: Submission of the Regulations issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969 to Parliament for approval
decision_details: - The Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No. 10 of 2023 have been published through the Gazette Notification dated 2023‑06‑14 as per the provisions of the Imports and Exports (Control) Act No. 1 of 1969 in order to replace the licensing methodology for importation of wheat flour by imposing a Special Commodity Levy. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the said Regulations to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the Contract between the Ceylon Shipping Corporation and M/s. Shreeji Shipping, India on lightering (barging) for discharging of coal from the mother ships to the jetty of the Lakvijaya Power Station for the seasons 2023/24 and 2024/25
decision_details: - The contract for the use of  lightering  (barging) for discharging coal from ships anchored at the port of Puttalam to the jetty of Lakvijaya Power Station during the years of 2021/22 and 2022/23 had been awarded to M/s. Shreeji Shipping, India. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to extend the Agreement on lightering (barging) between M/s. Shreeji Shipping, India and the Ceylon Shipping Corporation by further period of one year, enabling the carrying out of discharging of coal without any hindrance from the Month of September in this year, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Deployment of Ceylon Corporation Ltd owned Dry Bulk Carrier Ships named Mv. Ceylon Breeze and Mv. Ceylon Princess in year 2023 and 2024
decision_details: - Bids have been invited for the selection of a Charterer or a Commercial Manager on the time chartering basis to place these two vessels on international charter market during the period of 2023 and 2024. Nine (09) bids have been received, out of which 06 bids have been submitted on time chartering basis and 03 bids have been submitted under commercial management. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the Contract of deploying the above two vessels to the M/s Coral Energy DMCC, the bidder who has submitted the financially most attractive offer, based on the recommendations of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening of the Health Delivery Service in the Northern Province under 	Financial Assistance of the Netherlands
decision_details: - It has been entered into an Agreement with the ING Bank N.V. of the Netherlands to obtain a loan of Euro 45 million to finance 75% of the project cost for the "Strengthening of the Health Delivery Service in the Northern Province".The remaining 25% of the project cost is financed by the Invest International Public Programmes B.V. of the Government of the Netherlands as a grant. As of now, the physical progress of the project is about 92%. Considering the current economic situation in Sri Lanka, the Government of the Netherlands has decided to reduce the loan amount by 10% and increase the grant for the project to 35%. The Government of Sri Lanka should enter into a Memorandum of Agreement with the Invest International Public Programmes B.V. of the Government of the Netherlands and the ING Bank N.V. of the Netherlands for that purpose by incorporating relevant amendments. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policy to enter into the said agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Civil Procedure Code (Chapter 101)
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2022‑10‑10 to publish the Civil Procedure Code (Amendment) Bill in the Government Gazette and present the same in Parliament. Further, the Civil Law Reforms Sub Committee of the Ministry of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms has identified several amendments to be added to the said Bill. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the final draft prepared by the Legal Draftsman also incorporating the said amendments. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of  Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conferment of the Honour of Senior Instructing Attorneys-at-Law Bill
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑01‑30 to draft a Bill to introduce a new legislation to recognize the legacy of high standards maintained by senior Instructing Attorneys in the legal sector. Accordingly, the Conferment of the Honour of Senior Instructing Attorneys‑at‑Law Bill has been drafted by the Legal Draftsman and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the said Bill. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette, and thereafter present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation in the Field of Tourism
decision_details: - It has been reached to a consensus between the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority and the Legal Entity of Public Law of the Georgian National Tourism Administration to sign a Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation in the field of Tourism. Clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the draft Memorandum of Understanding prepared for that purpose. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism and Lands, to sign the said MoU was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting of lands to the Capital Investment LLC of United Arab Emirates on long term lease basis to implement a luxury hotel project
decision_details: - The Capital Investment LLC of the United Arab Emirates has submitted a project proposal for obtaining a plot of land bordering the Maussakelle Reservoir currently under the custody of the Ceylon Electricity Board and a small island located within the said reservoir for a project to build and run a hotel complex, having invested a sum of US$ 25 million as a fully direct investment. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to vest the said land plots to the aforementioned Company on long term lease basis in order to implement the said project with the concurrence of the relevant institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appreciation of the Contribution of Upcountry Tamils to the Sri Lankan Economy
decision_details: - Upcountry Tamils who migrated to Sri Lanka from India around 200 years ago, live in Central, Sabaragamuwa and Southern Provinces and they contribute to the national economy in various ways. Their contribution is around 1/3 of the total income of the plantation sector. Accordingly, the Cabinet concurred with the proposal made by the Hon. President to implement the programmes identified with a view to upgrading the living standards of Upcountry Tamil community in collaboration with the Ministry of Plantation Industries and other relevant State institutions to commemorate the completion of 200 years since the arrival of the first generation of the Upcountry Tamil Community to Sri Lanka by February 2023.

title: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2019‑10‑29 has granted approval to prepare the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Bill. The Central Bank of Sri Lanka Bill prepared so has been published in the Government Gazette on 2019‑11‑01 and although it has been submitted to Parliament for approval, it has not been placed on the Order paper. The preliminary draft has been developed incorporating new amendments enabling to fulfill the duties of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka effectively and efficiently to be suited with the present day needs. Accordingly, the draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman has been submitted to the Cabinet by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies and it was decided to grant approval to the said Bill.

title: Establishment of an Office for Overseas Sri Lankan Affairs
decision_details: - In the Interim Budget 2022, the Hon. President has proposed to establish an Office for Overseas Sri Lankan Affairs to function as a central point for coordination to obtain the support of Sri Lankans living abroad. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to take necessary action to establish the proposed “Office for Overseas Sri Lankan Affairs” to obtain the service of 03 million Sri Lankans living abroad for the development of this country and to maintain the activities of the said Office properly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Regulations issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969 to Parliament for approval
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No. 21 of 2022 and Imports Control Regulations on Payment Terms No. 22 of 2022 issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Institute of Charted Shipbrokers of Sri Lanka (Incorporation) Bill
decision_details: - The Institute of Chartered Shipbrokers of Sri Lanka has been established in the year 1987 under the Ceylon Shipping Corporation with the patronage of the Institute of Charted Shipbrokers of England and it comprises of Fellow Members and Associated Members. The prime objective of this institute is to establish professionalism and uplift professionalism of shipbrokers. Further, providing opportunities to its members through study programmes, seminars and workshops to promote professionalism in the discipline and make training opportunities available for youth who have interest in the said field are among the objectives of the Institute. A private Member's Bill has been submitted to Parliament by the Hon. Buddika Pathirana, Member of Parliament in the Matara District to establish the same through a Parliament Act in order to maintain its activities properly and effectively. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the said Bill. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to submit a Report to Parliament recommending the said draft Bill as per the provisions of the Standing Order 52(6), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extending the validity period of the Loan of the Supporting Electricity Supply Reliability Improvement Project
decision_details: - Supporting Electricity Supply Reliability Improvement Project is implemented under the Asian Development Bank (ADB) and two grants extended by the Clean Energy Financing Partnership Facility and the Japan Funds for Poverty Reduction. Action has been taken to extend the deadline for the completion of activities under Package - 4, up to 2023‑11‑29.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to extend the validity period of the ADB Loan facility up to 2024‑03‑31 enabling to secure the required funds, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining additional provisions required for renovation and 	conservation of the National Art Gallery
decision_details: - Although the renovation works of the National Art Gallery have been planned to complete during this year, owing to the situation prevailed in the country, it has not been possible to finish the expected task. Nearly 80% of the renovation work has been completed at present and related plans and estimates have been prepared by the Project Advisory Unit of the Faculty of Architecture, University of Moratuwa for the completion of remaining works. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to secure required provisions so that the remaining renovation works can be completed in the year 2023, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rural Finance Programme implemented under the Smallholder Tea and 	Rubber Revitalization Project
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka and the International Fund for Agricultural Development have entered into an agreement for the implementation of the Smallholder Tea and Rubber Revitalization Project. Under the said project, "Rural Finance Program" is being implemented and the program is due to be terminated on 2022‑12‑31. Another amount of Rs.172.35 million out of the money allocated for that program is to be released to the beneficiaries as loans. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation Industries to extend the period of the duration of the said program till 2023‑06‑30, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of new Visa Categories for the Colombo Port City
decision_details:
- Issuance of visa to the investors and other relevant parties who wish to arrive for miscellaneous services such as international trade, shipping and operations, finance, information technology and tourism to be established in the Colombo Port City and relevant acts incidental thereto have to be accomplished by the Department of Immigration and Emigration. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to take necessary action to take necessary action to introduce following visa categories, based on the recommendations of the Colombo Port City Commission, was approved by the Cabinet: 

*	"Investor Visa" category for investors under the residence visa category
* 	“Employment visa” category for employees
* 	“CPC Residential Property Leaseholder visa" category for foreigners residing in the Colombo Port City on lease basis.

title: Setting up a Training Centre of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign 	Employment for the Monaragala District
decision_details: - Although Monaragala District is geographically the second largest district, no office of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment or a training Centre is operated within the district. The closest training centres to the said district are located at Haliela in Badulla District, Tangalla in Hambanthota district and Ampara. It is possible to use the training Centre located in Bibile road, Monaragala which is presently under the custody of the Department of Divineguma to set up a district training centre of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment thereby providing required training facilities for those who seek foreign employment in low-income earning families. As such the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment; and the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment to hand over the training Centre and premises located in Bibile road, Monaragala to the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Institute of Economics and Trade, Sri Lanka
decision_details: - It is highly important for the Members of Parliament and Senior Public Officials to have a training on Economics and Trade affairs enabling them to reach informed decisions formulating and implementing National Policies. In order to facilitate for the purpose, it has been found appropriate to establish an Institute by the name of "Sri Lanka Institute of Economics and Trade" by an Act of Parliament. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill to establish the Sri Lanka Institute of Economics and Trade, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Parliamentary Elections Act No.1 of 1981
decision_details: - According to section 8(8) of the Parliamentary Elections Act, No.1 of 1981, the Election Commission has published a Code of Conduct relating to the conduct of political parties, independent groups and candidates contesting the election, thorough the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2178/25 dated 2020‑06‑03. It has been identified that it would be appropriate to amend the Parliamentary Elections Act, No.1 of 1981 in order to include actions to be taken in the event of violating this Code of Conduct and to include provisions stating that those will be effective during his/her tenure in the office and enable to provide the opportunity to identified persons holding special positions to vote at a special polling station apart from the polling station allocated for them. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a draft Bill to amend the said Act by incorporating provisions thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Legalization of Media Guidelines issued under the Article 104B(5)(a) of the Constitution
decision_details: - In terms of the Article 104B(5)(a) of the 1978 Constitution, Media Guidelines have been published by the Election Commission under the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2178/24 dated 2020‑06‑03. Nevertheless, provisions pertaining to action that could be taken in the event of violating such guidelines have not been enacted yet. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to include the provisions which indicate that the violation of media guidelines is an election offence in the Presidential Elections (Special Provisions) Act, the Parliamentary Election Act, Local Authorities Elections Ordinance and the Provincial Councils Elections Act or to draft a Bill incorporating relevant provisions enabling take action treating the violation of media guidelines as an offence under each Act related to elections, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting approval in principal for the Procedural Rules of the Public Service Commission
decision_details: - The Procedural Rules of the Public Service Commission implemented with effect from 2009‑04‑02 have been redrafted to be adopted with the present day needs and rules and regulations. The final draft of the Procedural Rules has been prepared incorporating the proposals submitted after further studying the said draft Procedural Rules by the Officials' Committee appointed by the Cabinet. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to grant approval in principal for the Procedural Rules prepared by the Public Service Commission, in terms of the Article 55(1) of the Constitution and implement the same with effect from 2023‑01‑01, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening legal provisions to prohibit sexual harassment, sexual assault 	and sexual bribery and punish the offenders of such criminal acts
decision_details: - Committing sexual harassment violates the fundamental human rights and freedom and provisions related thereto are included in section 345 of the Penal Code. It is observed that this problem continues to exist even though the law provides for the imposition of punishment for such crimes. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a draft Bill enabling to amend the Penal Code by incorporating sections which make sexual harassment and all forms of sexual assaults as criminal acts and provide stringent punishment therefor and include a new section to make sexual bribery an offence, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Judicature Act, No.2 of 1978
decision_details: - The Gazette Extraordinary Notification dated 2021‑07‑30 has been issued promulgating relevant Regulations in terms of the provisions of the Judicature Act enabling the Courts in the Northern Province to exercise jurisdictions to enforce financial statutes enacted by the Northern Provincial Council. When the approval of the Council was sought on 2021‑12‑13 to present the said Regulations in Parliament, the Cabinet decided that the enforcement process of the relevant financial statutes should be implemented simultaneously for both Northern and Eastern Provinces. Accordingly, the Hon. Minister of Justice has taken measures to impose Regulations in accordance with the provisions of the Judicature Act, nominating the Magistrates Courts and District Courts within the Eastern Province to hear and determine matters pertaining to all actions, proceeding or matters arising out of any Financial Statute imposed by the Eastern Provincial Council. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to present the Regulations so imposed , for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Water Supply of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Environment, Climate Change and Technology of the Republic of Maldives on Technical Cooperation towards Development of Water and Sewerage Sector
decision_details: - A proposal has been made to sign a Memorandum of Understanding on Technical Cooperation towards Development of Water and Sewerage Sector between Sri Lanka and the Maldives. Agreement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the clearance of the Attorney General have been received for the draft agreement prepared for the purpose. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply to sign the proposed Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of "Mindfulness" Programme for School Students
decision_details: - The Ministry of Education together with the "Sathi Pasala Foundation" of Ven. Udairiyagama Dhammajeeva Thero, the founder of "Sathi Pasala" have planned to implement the programme of "Mindfulness" for school students. The programme is expected to be implemented in every school in the island as an educational programme that helps to prevent the misbehaviour of students by providing the school students with the skill they need to strengthen their personality while being resilient to complex and dynamic society. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Education to implement a pilot programme on each Wednesday from 2023‑01‑04 to 2023‑03‑24 and thereafter to implement the said program every week on Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 7.30 am to 7.40 am for 10 minutes.

title: Upgrading of Ampara and Mannar Urban Councils as Municipal 	Councils
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022‑08‑08 to take necessary action to convert the capital cities which remain as urban councils in several districts, into municipal councils without spending additional allocations while using the existing infrastructure facilities, office facilities and human resources. Taking into consideration the said approval, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Governments to upgrade Ampara and Mannar in order to facilitate the fulfillment of the desired development tasks in the said two cities, which are the main cities of Ampara and Mannar districts, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and 	Maldives on immigration purposes
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign an MoU between Sri Lanka and Maldives for the cooperation in immigration purposes at the bilateral relations between the two countries.
