Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to sign an MoU to develop and strengthen the cooperation in immigration purposes between the two countries with a view to assisting the management of border controlling for mutual benefits, facilitating the mutual cooperation for skill development in the areas of human resource system and technology, exchanging of training facilities among immigration officers in the promotion of human resources, prevention of international crimes such as illegal migration, human trafficking and smuggling of persons and promotion of cooperation on the issues related to blacklisted passengers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Australian Volunteers Programme 2022 - 2027
decision_details: - The Australian Volunteers Programme funded by the Government of Australia is being implemented across 26 countries and grants are provided under the said programme to make change through locally-led work and to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals. A Memorandum of Understanding has been entered into between Australia and Sri Lanka in the year 2017 in order to implement the said programme in Sri Lanka and the time period of the said MoU has expired by now. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to sign a Memorandum of Subsidiary Arrangement (MSA) to implement the said programme for another period of five years in Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparing the Bill to establish the Parliamentary Budget Office
decision_details: - The Hon. President submitted a preliminary draft for the establishment of the Parliamentary Budget Office for consideration at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022‑10‑31 for consideration and it was decided to refer the said preliminary draft to all party leaders of Parliament and seek their views on the matters therein. Accordingly, the Hon. Prime Minister has discussed with the party leaders regarding the preliminary draft and the views expressed at that discussion were brought to the notice of the Cabinet. As such, The Cabinet decided to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare the draft Bill based on the preliminary draft already prepared, taking also into consideration the said views.

title: Mediation (Settlement of Civil and Commercial Disputes) Bill
decision_details: - Although, the Commercial Mediation Center of Sri Lanka Act No.44 of 2000 was passed by Parliament for the establishment of a Commercial Mediation Center, the anticipated functions could not be fulfilled through the said Act due to the various technical reasons and certain limitations. At present, most of countries adopt voluntary mediation to settle disputes and most of such countries have taken action to introduce rules and regulations for voluntary mediation. Further, such countries have made necessary legislation to authorize their Courts to take action against the parties for an unreasonable refusal to voluntary mediation. It has been found necessary to introduce new legislation to the legal system of this country to encourage towards voluntary mediation giving due attention to the said international tendency. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to take necessary action to prepare the Mediation (Settlement of Civil and Commercial Disputes) Bill in order to repeal the Commercial Mediation Center of Sri Lanka Act No. 44 of 2000 and make provisions for legal provisions on voluntary mediation for civil and commercial disputes and incidental maters related thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Mediation Board Act, No.72 of 1988
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2022‑09‑22 to amend the Mediation Board Act, No.72 of 1988 for introducing provisions pertaining to the appointment of members of the Commission, determining the jurisdiction of Mediation Boards, disputes that can not be settled and filing cases before courts in respect of such disputes, to be suited with the present day needs. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received to the draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting Legal Powers to Maintain the Sri Lanka Navy Hydrographic Service 	at National Level
decision_details: - The proposal for the vesting of marine hydrographic affairs in Sri Lanka's local waters and Exclusive Economic Zone to the Sri Lanka Navy as a non-naval duty was taken up for consideration at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022‑09‑05 and a Cabinet Sub‑Committee was appointed under the chairmanship of the Minister of Ports Shipping and Aviation to further study the said proposal and make recommendations.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to vest the marine hydrographic affairs in Sri Lanka's local waters and Exclusive Economic Zone to the Sri Lanka Navy as a non-naval duty by a Gazette Notification and to establish a National Hydrography Office so that all the agencies dealing with this subject can work together as per the recommendations of the said Committee , was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the National Environmental Action Plan 2022 - 2030
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022‑06‑20 for the National Environmental Policy. In order to implement the said policy, the Ministry of Environment has prepared the National Environmental Action Plan for the period of 2022 - 2030 in collaboration with all relevant parties while adhering to the Sustainable Development Goals of the United Nations and giving consideration to the environmental challenges of the twenty first century. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to implement the said action plan and establish the Committee on Integrated Environment & Development Policy under the chairmanship of the Secretary, to the President in order to take policy decisions at national level and monitor the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Disposal of an allotment of land for the College of General Practitioners of 	Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The College of General Practitioners of Sri Lanka has been established in terms of the provisions of the Act, No.26 of 1974 in order to promote the education of medical practitioner in Sri Lanka. A request has been made to allocate a plot of land to establish and maintain a new office complex for the said College. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism and Lands to transfer an allotment of land in extent of 21.30 perches located at the Thimbirigasyaya Divisional Secretariat Division, belonging to the Government to the College of General Practitioners of Sri Lanka, by way of a free grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the assistance of the Asia Foundation to continuously maintain 	the mediation related activities of the Community Mediation Boards and 	Special Land Mediation Boards
decision_details: - The Asia Foundation which has supported the mediation programme in sri Lanka since its inception has agreed to grant further financial support to continuously maintain and strengthen the mediation related activities of the Community Mediation Boards and Special Land Mediation Boards. Accordingly, the Asia Foundation has agreed to provide a grant of Rs.127 million for the said purpose. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to sign a Memorandum of Understanding to obtain the aforesaid grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Ministry of Health of Sri Lanka and the Christian Medical College of Vellore, India
decision_details: - A bone marrow transplant programme was started in the year 2015 at the Lady Ridgeway Children's Hospital and the Cristian Medical College of Vellore, India has assisted in training the required staff for the said programme in 2017. At present, the basic infrastructure facilities for bone marrow transplant have been established in the Lady Ridgeway Children's Hospital and the said Medical College has agreed to formally provide assistance in the fields of consultation and training in order to maintain its functioning productively. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Health and the Christian Medical College of Vellore, India, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting the South Asian Sub-Regional Committee Meeting and Project Proposal Development Training Programme of the Asia-Pacific Network for Global Change Research
decision_details: - Asia-Pacific Network for Global Change Research is an inter-government network of 22 member countries working towards an Asia-Pacific Region capable of effectively addressing the challenges of global change and sustainability. The prime objective of the said network is to conduct policy-based research required for the global sustainable development in the Asia-Pacific Region and develop the capacity of the region. Accordingly, the Cabinet considered the information submitted by the Minister of Environment on action taken to host to conduct the South Asian Sub-Regional Committee Meeting and Project Proposal Development Training Programme of the Asia-Pacific Network for Global Change Research in Colombo from 2022‑11‑29 to 2022‑12‑01, by the Government of Sri Lanka.

title: Extending the validity period of the Order issued under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017
decision_details: - Orders have been issued from time to time as per the provisions of the Foreign Exchange Act to suspend/restrict the foreign exchange outflow pertaining to the certain capital transactions taking into account the negative impact that may cause to the foreign exchange market. The validity period of the currently issued Order would expire on 2022‑12‑29. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economy and Policy Development to take necessary action to extend the validity period of the Order issued under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017 for another period of six (06) months with effect from 2022‑12‑30, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Issuance of Regulations under the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017, to accommodate Short Term Foreign Loans from overseas to finance payments for the import of raw materials by Local Subsidiaries
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to impose Regulations under section 7(1) of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017 to facilitate the payments utilizing the foreign exchange remitted by mother companies of local subsidiaries located outside Sri lanka or companies within the same group of companies, when importing raw materials by the said local subsidiaries to produce goods for the local market, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Imposing Regulations under Section 47(1) of the Antiquities Ordinance No.9 of 1940
decision_details: - The Department of Archaeology and other State Institutions have the capacity to take legal action against an individual violating the Antiquities Ordinance by unlawfully damaging a site or property of archaeological importance. Accordingly, the aforesaid State Institutions contribute the protection of the archaeological places in Sri Lanka and conservation of the same on behalf of the future generation. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to take necessary action to impose appropriate regulations as per the provisions of the Antiquities Ordinance No.9 of 1940, enabling to grant an allowance from the Antiquities Gift Fund with a view to further motivating the staff members of the said institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Buddhist Temporalities Ordinance No.19 of 1931 and drafting the Theravada Bhikku Kathikavath (Registration) Bill
decision_details: - Although action have been taken on several occasions to amend the Buddhist Temporalities Ordinance No.19 of 1931, the said amendments could not be completed due to the inability to reach an agreement on the views and suggestions made by several parties. An agreement has been reached between the relevant parties by now pertaining to the proposed proposals. Similarly, it has been decided to draft the Theravada Bhikku Kathikavath (Registration) Bill by further amending the preliminary draft Bill of the same, taking into consideration the views and suggestions made by the various parties to introduce an Act including provisions for enforcing the decision of the relevant Sangha Sabha in an instance where a certain Monk does not act according to a decision arrived by a Sangha Sabha of any Nikaya or Chapter. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to take action to prepare a draft Bill to amend the Buddhist Temporalities Ordinance No.19 of 1931 and to draft the Theravada Bhikku Kathikavath (Registration) Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Imposing Regulations for the payment of welfare benefits under the provisions of the Welfare Benefits Act, No.24 of 2002
decision_details: - Regulations on payment of Welfare Benefits (Selection of Persons eligible to receive payments) under the provisions of the Welfare Benefits Act, No.24 of 2002 have been published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification dated 2022‑10‑20.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the said Regulations to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing the Second Additional Protocol to the "Convention on Cybercrime on Enhanced Co-operation and Disclosure of Electronic Evidence" (Budapest Cybercrime Convention)
decision_details: - Sri Lanka is a signatory in the European Convention on Cybercrime on Enhanced Co‑operation and Disclosure of Electronic Evidence which is called as the "Budapest Cybercrime Convention" and the said Convention is in force from 2015‑09‑01. A signing ceremony for the Second Additional Protocol is scheduled to be conducted in Strasbourg, France on 2022‑11‑30, and as such, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms and the Minister of Foreign Affairs to sign the said protocol, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a relevant Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Plantation Industries and Ksapa Company in France for implementation of the Capacity Building Project for 6,000 Rubber Smallholders
decision_details: - The Ksapa Company in France with the financial assistance of the Ministry of Economy, Finance and Recovery of the Government of France and the Michelin Group in France, under the guidance of the Ministry of Plantation Industries has designed to implement the "Rubber Improvement of Value Chain & Embedded Smallholders Resilience Project" to increase the economic strength of 6,000 rubber smallholders in the rubber growing areas of Badalkumbura and Medagama in the Monaragala district. The proposed project has been recommended by the Department of National Planning and the total cost of the project has been estimated as Euro 726,700. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation Industries to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding for the implementation of the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: International Water Conference on Sustainable Development Cooperation, Partnership and Appropriate Technology
decision_details: - The National Water Supply and Drainage Board has taken steps to organize the "International Water Conference on Sustainable Development, Cooperation, Partnership and Appropriate Technology - 2022" from 2022‑12‑14 to 2022‑12‑16 December 2022. This conference is envisaged to achieve the objectives such as bringing together water professionals, foreign delegates, international organizations, Government Officials and Journalists; share ideas and knowledge for research; create links among water professionals and exchange of experiences and achievements in the water sector of different countries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply to conduct the proposed conference involving the relevant local and international institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening Social Cohesion and Peace in Sri Lanka Project (SCOPE) and Green Policy Dialogue Facility Project (GPDF), proposed to be financed under the European Union Grant Assistance
decision_details: - It has been agreed to provide funds under the Multi-Annual Indicative Programme of the European Union to Sri Lanka for the period from 2021 to 2027 with a view to supporting the 'Green Recovery for Sri Lanka' and 'An Inclusive Peaceful Society'. Accordingly, an indicative grant of Euro 60 million has been allocated for the period of 2021 - 2024 for relevant sectors and support measures. Under that, the European Union has expressed its agreement to provide a grant of Euro 16 million to implement the "Strengthening Social Cohesion and Peace in Sri Lanka (SCOPE) Project" and "Green Policy Dialogue Facility(GPDF) Project". Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to enter into grant agreements with the European Union in order to obtain said grants, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of High Impact Community Development Projects with Indian Grant Assistance
decision_details: - The project to implement High Impact Community Development under Indian grant assistance has been implementing since 2005. Accordingly, for the implementation of the said project, Memoranda of Understanding have been signed between the two countries for the periods from 2005 - 2010, 2010 - 2015 and 2015 - 2020. Under the said project, priority is given for the provision of infrastructure facilities in the education, health and community development sectors. The cost of a sub-project implemented under the project is limited to Rs.300 million, and the value of the total number of projects executed at any time is subject to a price ceiling of Rs.5 billion. However, owing to the current economic crisis and high inflation prevailing in the country, it has been difficult to implement certain projects within the maximum price ceiling of Rs.300 million and therefore, both parties have agreed to increase the said maximum price ceiling up to Rs.600 million and the total cost of the projects implemented at any time up to Rs.10 billion. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to revise the Memorandum of Understanding signed between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Sri Lanka Export Development Board and the Swiss Import Promotion Programme (SIPPO)
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Swiss Import Promotion Programme which operates under the State Secretariat for Economic Affairs of Switzerland and the Sri Lanka Export Development Board to carry out a comprehensive study for export products such as processed food, sustainable fish and seafood and value added textiles. The purpose of the proposed study is to expand the opportunities for Sri Lankan export goods to access the European market. A sum of 100,000 Swiss Francs is incurred by the Swiss Import Promotion Program for the study. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion, to sign the proposed Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Banking (Special Provisions) Act
decision_details: - The Central Bank of Sri Lanka has identified the need to strengthen the bank resolution framework under the crisis management framework of financial institutions regulated by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka as an urgent and priority task. The International Monetary Fund and the World Bank have also indicated the need to strengthen the resolution framework to strengthen financial sector safety nets. In view of the difficulty of enacting a comprehensive new banking law within a short period of time, it has been decided to introduce the proposed Banking (Special Provisions) Act as a supplement to the Banking Act No.30 of 1988 by incorporating provisions for resolution of licensed banks, deposit insurance and safe closure/liquidation of accounts of licensed banks. Accordingly, a preliminary draft has been prepared by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, and the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policy to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a new Bill based on the said preliminary draft, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Regulations issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) 	Act, No.1 of 1969 for approval in Parliament
decision_details: - Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to present the Imports Control Regulations on Payment Terms No.19 of 2022 and Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.20 of 2022, issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969, for approval in Parliament.

title: Introducing a new Act instead of the Police Ordinance No.16 of 1865
decision_details: - The Police Ordinance No.16 of 1865 presently in force has been already amended 37 times and approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2014‑11­19 to amend the said Ordinance again. However, depending on the new social trends, the need has been identified to introduce a new Act for the purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to take necessary action to introduce a new Act instead of the Police Ordinance No.16 of 1865, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the National Archives Act, No.48 of 1973
decision_details: - In terms of the Cabinet decision dated 2012‑12‑05, the Legal Draftsman has been directed to draft a Bill to amend the National Archives Act, No.48 of 1973. Accordingly, the Legal Draftsman has drafted a Bill and further the Legal Draftsman has informed that the policy approval of the present Cabinet is required for the said Bill. However, since audio-video records, cinematograph records and digital records are largely produced for the conservation process in addition to paper records, the need has been identified to further amend the National Archives Act so as to suit to the international standards and national requirements. As such the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, to appoint a committee consisting of experts on document management, document preservation and digitalized document management and identify appropriate amendments and thereafter, take necessary action incorporate appropriate amendments to further amend the said Bill that has already been drafted by the Legal Draftsman, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Law to make provisions for the control of election expenses
decision_details: - The Legal Draftsman has drafted a Bill to control the election expenses on the approval of the Cabinet. Clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the said Bill. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter present the same in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increasing the youth representation in Local Government Institutions
decision_details: - Attention of the Ministry of Sports and Youth Affairs has been focused on providing opportunity for youth representation in the decision making process. At present, Colombo District Parliamentarian, Hon. Premnath C. Dolawatte has submitted a Private Member's Bill to Parliament in that regard, and while extending the support for the said Bill, it has been found appropriate to increase the youth representation in Local Government Institutions with a view to creating an environment of which the upliftment of the whole youth community and their aspirations could be achieved. Accordingly, Cabinet approved in principle the proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth, to amend the Local Authorities Elections Ordinance making provisions for the appointment of youth representatives tantamount to not less than 25% of the number of members to be elected according to the first nomination paper and not less than 25% of the number of members to be selected according to the second nomination paper, while safeguarding the women's representation , in terms of the existing provisions of the Local Authorities Elections Ordinance.

title: National Framework on Eco-labeling in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Producers need to carry out their production activities sustainably and the consumers need to consume products and services responsibly and prudently in order to ensure the long term environmental, social and economic well‑being. For the purpose, scientific methodologies such as standardization and certification to prove the “Assurance of Sustainable Consumption and Production Patterns” have to be introduced as stated under Sustainable Development Goal No.12. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to implement the National Framework on Eco-labeling enabling to ensure the environmental performance of productions to other supply chain stakeholders including their customers and the customers or purchasers to make decisions of purchasing relevant products with credibility, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Policy on Environmental Sensitive Areas in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Due to various human activities taking place at present such as certain irregular land use and agricultural practices, informal solid waste disposal and unsustainable use of natural resources, many problems such as ecosystem degradation, soil erosion, drying up of water sources and human-wildlife conflicts have to be encountered. As a result, the biodiversity and base of ecosystem service have been threatened. That situation will lead to a vicious cycle of ecosystem degradation in the long run. Therefore, it is expected through the establishment of the National Policy on Environmental Sensitive Areas to ensure a healthy, safe and conserved environment and economy thereby establishing environmental sensitive areas for social-economic well being and livable environment for all. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to implement the National Policy on Environmental Sensitive Areas in Sri Lanka in order to provide the necessary guidance for the conservation of environmentally sensitive areas and their sustainable utilization by identifying the environmentally sensitive areas across the Island and with the participation of all sectors such as community, private sector, state sector and experts for the land use planning and management of those areas and ensuring a co‑management approach at all levels, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of the “Committee Appointed by the Cabinet of Ministers” in terms of the provisions of the Petroleum Products (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act No.27 of 2022
decision_details: - Section 5 (1) of the Petroleum Products (Special Provisions) Act No. 33 of 2002 includes provisions pertaining to the effect that Minister in charge could grant licenses for the import, export, sale, supply and distribution of petroleum to any person or company as per the recommendations of the “Energy Supply Committee” constituted in accordance with the provisions of section 02 of the Energy Supply (Temporary Provisions) Act No. 02 of 2002. Nevertheless, the Energy Supply Committee appointed as per the provisions of the Energy Supply (Temporary Provisions) Act No. 02 of 2002 has been abolished due to the enactment of the said Act for a period of two years. Provisions have been made to establish a “Committee Appointed by the Cabinet of Ministers” in lieu of the “Energy Supply Committee” as per the Petroleum Products (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act No. 27 of 2022. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to appoint the said Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Presidential Task Force to avoid the use of poisonous and dangerous drugs
decision_details: - The Joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence; the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms; and the Minister of Public Security to establish a Presidential Task Force to identify, plan and implement the suitable pragmetic measures to combat dissemination and use of the poisonous and dangerous drugs and avoid their use, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Agreement for the Transfer of Sentenced Prisoners between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Republic of Mauritius
decision_details: - As per the provisions of the Transfer of Offenders Act, No.5 of 1995, a citizen of another country who has been convicted and imprisoned by a Court in Sri Lanka is able to serve his/her sentence in the country of which he/she claims to be a citizen. Likewise the said Act provides provisions for a Sri Lankan citizen who is imprisoned in a specified country to be transferred back to Sri Lanka to serve his / her balance period of imprisonment. Entering into an Agreement between Sri Lanka and the other relevant country is essential for the above purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to enter into an Agreement for the transfer of sentenced prisoners between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Republic of Mauritius, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revising the National Medicines Policy of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Since approximately 15 years has lapsed from the declaration of the National Medicines Policy which was prepared in the year 2005, it has been found the necessity of revising the said Policy to suit with the present day needs. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to revise the National Medicines Policy through a Committee appointed by the Secretary to the Ministry of Health, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proclamation of the National Day for Biosphere Reserves
decision_details: - The UNESCO General Assembly has declared 03rd November in each year as the “Day for Biosphere Reserves”. The UNESCO has indicated that action should be taken by its member states to draw the attention of the people to encourage them for the protection of Biosphere Reserves. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to declare 03rd November in each year as the “National Day for Biosphere Reserves”, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing opportunity to the public to visit National Parks, Entertainment Parks, Botanical Gardens and to watch movies in cinema halls free of charge on the 75th Independence Day
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President to provide opportunity to the public to visit National Parks, Botanical Gardens and Entertainment Parks/Places free of charge and also to provide opportunity to watch movies with 50% off for ticket prices of the Cinema Halls located across the country on 75th Independence Day falling on 4th February 2023, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Limiting the overseas leave granted to Ministers, State Ministers and Members of 	Parliament of the Government Group during Parliamentary Sitting days 	and Budget Debate
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister to the effect that Ministers, State Ministers and Members of Parliament of the Government Group should not travel abroad during Parliamentary Sitting days and Budget Debate, other than in urgent medical needs or in case of very urgent tasks of the Government, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme for the Budget Debate - 2023
Submission of Orders published in the Government Gazette to Parliament for approval
Bill to amend the Borrowing Limit for the Financial Year 2022
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2022‑10‑17 has granted approval to prepare a Bill to revise the approved borrowing limit for the year 2022. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received to the draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Recommendations submitted to the Hon. President by the Finance Commission relating to the year 2023
decision_details: - In terms of the provisions of the Constitution of Sri Lanka, the recommendations for the financial year 2023 have been submitted to the President by the Finance Commission. Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposals made by the Hon. President, the Cabinet granted approval to take appropriate measures to implement the said recommendations made by the Finance Commission and to submit the said recommendations to Parliament in terms of Article 154R(7) of the Constitution.

title: Rathanatissa Peace Foundation (Incorporation) Bill
decision_details: - The (Incorporation) Bill of Rathnatissa Peace Foundation of which Rev. Eriyawe Rathanathissa Thero, the Chief Incumbent of Sri Vapikaramaya, Palukadawala, Galgamuwa holds the post of Executive Director, has been submitted to Parliament as a Private Member's Bill by Hon. U.K Sumith Udukumbura, Member of Parliament of Kurunegala District. The said Bill has been referred to the Minister of Education as the Minister in charge of the subject, for obtaining a report in that regard in terms of the provisions of the Standing Order 52(6) of Parliament. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. Accordingly, the Cabinet granted its approval for the proposal made by the Minister of Education to submit a report to Parliament recommending the said Bill.

title: Restructuring of SriLankan Airlines Limited and its Subsidiary Companies
decision_details: - It has been found appropriate to restructure SriLankan Airlines Limited and its subsidiary companies by transferring a considerable number of shares and management of the company to investors selected through a transparent procurement process. Accordingly, taking into account the proposals made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation, Cabinet decided to assign the task of studying on the manner in which SriLankan Airlines should be restructured and making recommendations to the Cabinet, to the State-Owned Enterprises Restructuring Unit established under the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policy.

title: 55th Annual Meeting of the Asian Development Bank
decision_details: - Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies attended the 55th Annual Meeting of the of the Asian Development Bank held in Manila, Philippine on 2022‑09‑29 and the Cabinet considered the key points highlighted in the speech made by the President having presided over the Business Forum of the said Meeting as the member representing Sri Lanka at the Board of the Asian Development Bank and the information furnished with regard to the Bilateral discussions conducted with the Chairman of the Asian Development Bank, Minister of Finance of Japan and as well as the President of the Republic of the Philippines.

title: Revision of Solar Rooftop Tariff
decision_details: - Solar Rooftop has added 580MW to the national grid at present and it has been identified the necessity of obtaining another 1800MW through that as per the Long Term Generation Expansion Plan prepared by the Ceylon Electricity Board. As an incentive for that, a Committee has been appointed to submit recommendations for revising the tariff applicable for the purchase of electricity from the presently approved solar power plants. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to revise the tariff as per the recommendation of the said Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the validity period of the Loan obtained for the National Transmission and Distribution Network Development & Efficiency Improvement Project
decision_details: - The Loan Agreement related to obtaining a loan amounting to JPY 24,930 million from the Japan International Co-operation Agency for this Project has been signed on 2015 08 11. The validity period of the said loan amount is to be expired on 2022 10 28. The validity period of the said loan amount has to be extended as the the project could not be implemented as planned due to the prevailing situation in the country. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to extend the validity period of the said loan up to 2026 04 28, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Singapore Convention on Mediation Bill
decision_details: - United Nations Convention on International Settlement Agreements resulting from Mediation which is known as the Singapore Convention on Mediation was adopted on 2018 12 20 by the member countries at the United Nation's General Assembly. Sri Lanka also has signed the said Agreement on 2019 08 07. However, domestic legislation is required to be formulated to enact the said Agreement in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to prepare a suitable Bill, taking into consideration the provisions in the relevant Convention, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Code of Criminal Procedure Act (Chapter XXX - Inquests of Death)
decision_details: - A committee has been appointed under the chairmanship of Prof. Raveendra Fernando to identify appropriate amendments to the existing legislation, procedures and practices pertaining to the conduct of inquests into deaths and submit recommendations. It has been found necessary to amend the Code of Criminal Procedure Act to make necessary provisions to implement the recommendations of the said Committee. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to take necessary action to amend the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Licensing of Shipping Agent Act No.10 of 1972
decision_details: - The Container Operators' Regulations have been issued in the year 2005 as per the provisions of section 3 and 10 of the Licensing of Shipping Agent Act No. 10 of 1972. The Court has decided that the Regulation 10 of the said Act should be amended and the approval has been granted by the Cabinet decision dated 2022 07 04 to introduce necessary amendments to the Licensing of Shipping Agent Act No. 10 of 1972 by incorporating provisions related thereto. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received to the draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Offering incentives to migrant Employees to promote remittance through 	legal channels
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022 08 08 to offer identified incentives for Sri Lankan migrant employees with a view to promoting remittance through legal channels. Accordingly, the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment has issued relevant circular instructions and eligible migrant workers are facilitated to import a two-wheel electric motor vehicle subject to a maximum value of US$ 25,000 and a four-wheel fully electric motor vehicle subject to a maximum value of US$ 65,000. As such, it was decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet for the following measures taken with a view to to further promoting the remittance of foreign exchange earned by migrant workers to Sri Lanka, submitted by the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment for the attention of the Cabinet:

*	Granting permission to import a two wheel electric vehicle of CIF value up to 50% of the amount of foreign exchange remitted until 2023 04 30 or until the date of applying to import a vehicle.

* 	Granting permission to import a four wheel electric vehicle of CIF value up to 50% of the amount of foreign exchange remitted from 2022 05 01 		 to 2023 12 31.

title: Declaration of the National Supply Chain Day
decision_details: - The overall process of transforming raw materials into final products, is called Supply Chain Management and it enables to maximize customer value and actively streamline the supply-side activities of a business in order to obtain competitive advantages in the marketplace. The Institute of Supply and Material Management has pointed out the appropriateness of declaring a National Supply Chain Day with the objective of increasing the awareness amongest the domestic businesses and enterprises on the importance of developing supply chains. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to declare 24th October of each year as the “National Supply Chain Day”, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bilateral Air Services Agreement between Sri Lanka and the Kingdom of 	the Netherlands
decision_details: - Diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and the Kingdom of the Netherlands were established in 1951, and entering into an Air Services Agreement will facilitate the operation of direct passenger and cargo flights between the two countries. It would further enhance tourism, education, trade, investment, agricultural and cultural relations between the two countries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to enter into a Bilateral Air Services Agreement, based on the matters agreed upon during the discussions between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Reconciliation
decision_details:
- The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President on the establishment of the Cabinet Sub‑Committee on Reconciliation under the chairmanship of the Hon. President and comprising of the following members in order to promote the reconciliation among different communities in Sri Lanka and to address and resolve issues faced by the people relating to the resettlement, land and issues relating to missing persons in the aftermath of the conflict in the North and East:

	*	Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena,
			Prime Minister;

		*	Hon. Douglas Devananda,
Minister of Fisheries;

		*	Hon. (Dr.) Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe,
	Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms; and

		*	Hon. Ali Sabry, 
		Minister of Foreign Affairs.

title: Establishment of the 'Jathika Jana Sabha Secretariat' in order to build 'Jana 	Sabha' for strengthening the Participatory Democracy
decision_details: - It has been observed that, the Representative Democratic System which has been exercising in Sri Lanka does not adequately address the true public issues, the relationship between governing circle and the community of the periphery is drifting apart in this system, public opinions are not sufficiently considered in making policy decisions thereby causing social criticisms and based on the said criticisms, views and protests are being emerged in the society against the representative democracy. Under this circumstance, there is a need for a strong mechanism in an organizational structure that operates with participatory democratic features at the rural level and enables the public officials and the general public to discuss rural issues together, determine development priorities and the rural community to take part in the the decision making process. It will be possible to effectively and efficiently prevent the public distress that may occur through bureaucracy and arbitrary politicization through a mechanism with provisions that enable the community of the periphery to actively raise their opinions for the formulation of public policies and implement those policies with community participation. Accordingly, a concept paper on "Jana Sabha System" has been presented in an initiative of the National Movement for Social Justice with an independent institutional structure that can obtain public participation for the formulation of public policies and the successful implementation of those policies. The said concept paper has proposed the establishment of "Grameeya Jana Sabha" covering each Grama Niladhari division in the island and the establishment of "Jathika Jana Sabha" at the national level. As such, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President to accept the “Jana Sabha System” proposed by the said concept paper by the Government as a basic policy and to establish the “Jathika Jana Sabha Secretariat” as the independent focal institution for the establishment of the “Jana Sabha System”.

title: The Recovery of Possession of Premises Given on Lease (Special 	Provisions) Act
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2021‑09‑27 to draft a new Bill for the enactment of a new law in place of the Recovery of Possession of Premises Given on Lease (Special Provisions) Act. Accordingly, clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Ayurveda Act
decision_details: - Ayurveda Act No.31 of 1961 has been previously amended from time to time and it has been found the need to further amend the said Act, enabling to meet the sustainable development goals and the timely requirements. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to amend the Ayurveda Act incorporating appropriate provisions for the expansion of the services of the Ayurveda Department for the advancement of the field of indigenous medicine and for the establishment of Research Herbal Gardens etc, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Public Assets Management Bill
decision_details: - In the Budget Speech made by the Hon. President for the amendment of the Appropriation Act in respect of the financial year 2022, it was pointed out the necessity of introducing several new Acts and revising provisions of several existing Acts with the aim of building a strong economy, increasing the efficiency of the public service and managing the state resources effectively. As such, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill for Public Assets Management, incorporating appropriate provisions enabling to expand the duties of the Comptroller General's Office which is under the purview of the General Treasury and provide legal status to the said office, compile a National Assets Register and introduce a central data base relating to public assets.

title: Increase of the substitute allowance paid to the Female Sub - Postmasters on maternity leave
decision_details: - A female Sub-Postmaster is entitled to obtain maternity leave as per the provisions of the Establishments Code, subject to employing a substitute in service at her own expense during her maternity leave period in terms of the Service Minute of the Sri Lanka Sub-Postmaster Service and an allowance equivalent only to 30 day daily wage is paid as the substitute allowance during that period. It is observed that most of the female Sub - Postmasters limit their maternity leave only up to 30 days due to the fact that a substitute has to be employed at her own expense during the relevant maternity leave period. According to the recommendations of the World Health Organization and other medical recommendations, breast milk should be provided to infants at least up to six months from their birth. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Mass Media to pay 84 days allowance instead of the 30 days allowance being paid to female Sub-Postmasters, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the Rehabilitation of the Suriyakanda - Rakwana (A017) Road Corridor of the Galle - Deniyaya - Madampe Road
decision_details: - A Loan Agreement has been entered into with the OPEC Fund for International Development for the rehabilitation of the road section up to Suriyakanda - Rakwana of the Galle - Deniyaya - Madampe Road. Rehabilitation activities of the said road section is scheduled to be carried out under three (03) contract packages. Among them, two (02) contract packages fall under the threshold limit of the Ministerial Procurement Committee and the other contract package is under to the threshold limit of the Cabinet. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to award the contract package falling under the threshold limit of the Cabinet, to K.D.A. Weerasinghe & Company (Pvt.) Ltd., was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of contract for the construction of the National College of Education for Technological Stream to be established in Narangalla, Kuliyapitiya on a Korean Grant
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2017‑01‑18 has granted approval to establish a National College of Education for Technological Stream in the Narangalla area in Kuliyapitiya under a Grant of the Korean Government and local funds. Nevertheless, construction activities entrusted to the Korea International Cooperation Agency (KOICA) could not be initiated until the end of November, 2021 on various reasons. The KOICA has agreed to assign the said construction activities to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau as a direct contract. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to assign the relevant contract to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the contract for providing an Automated Crew Scheduling and Resource Management System for the SriLankan Airlines
decision_details: - Commercial Airlines across the world implement automated crew scheduling and resource management system for the crew management activities of the Airline. The contract period of the current system of the Srilankan Airlines would expire on 2022‑10‑31. Therefore, the International Competitive Bidding has been followed to procure a suitable service providing agency for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the relevant procurement to the CAE Flight Services USA, Inc for a period of five (05) years as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of 80 Ton Bollard Pull Twin Azimuth Stern Drive Harbour Tug for the Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - There are 07 Tugs which are in good condition in the Port of Colombo at present and it has been identified that another Tug with the capacity of 80 Ton should be purchased for future operations. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to take necessary action to purchase a Tug, following the International Competitive Bidding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a new Legal Deposit Act to replace the old Legal Deposit Act
decision_details: - Systematic management and preservation of public authorities' evidential valuable documents and private documents that reflect the written history and cultural identity of Sri Lanka has been vested with the Department of National Archives. The said Department implements 03 Ordinances viz, the Newspapers Ordinance No. 5 of 1839, the Printers and Publishers Ordinance No.1 of 1885 and the Printing Presses Ordinance No.16 of 1902 pertaining to the legal deposits of such printed publications. Accordingly, legal copies of the relevant documents are deposited in the Department of National Archives. Among the 131 countries in the world, Sri Lanka possess the oldest legal deposit law and it has been identified the necessity of amending the said law to suit with the present day needs. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a draft Bill to introduce a new Legal Deposit Act to Sri Lanka based on the preliminary draft prepared by a Committee of Experts in the relevant field since 2018 in consultation with the relevant parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Civil Procedure Code (Chapter 101) (Section 205)
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022‑01‑18 to draft a Bill to amend the Civil Procedure Code (Chapter 101) (section 205) pertaining to the issuance of certified copies of the judgment or decree to the respective parties to a Case. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter present the same in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Regulations issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 for approval in Parliament
decision_details: - Imports Control Regulations on Payment Terms No.15 of 2022 have been issued pertaining to the importation of goods under the Open Account System and Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.16 of 2022 have been issued in order to encourage the remittance of foreign exchange by Sri Lankans employed abroad. Accordingly, Imports Control Regulations on Payment Terms No.15 of 2022 imposed to enact the importation of essential food items including milk powder and red whole lentils and raw materials required for manufacturing poultry feed based under Open Account/Consignment Account Payment System have been promulgated in the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2297/79 dated 2022‑09‑16. Further, Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.16 of 2022 imposed to enable the Sri Lankans serving abroad to import fully electric vehicles as an incentive have been promulgated in the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2298/55 dated 2022‑09‑23. As such, the proposal made by the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to present the said Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting a block of land belonging to the Urban Development Authority on long term lease basis to implement a Rest House Development Project
decision_details: - A proposal has been made to allocate the land located at No.09, Karaitivu Road, Jaffna, belonging to the Urban Development Authority to M/s Grand Mountain Hotel (Pvt.) Ltd., on a 30 year lease basis, to implement a rest house development project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to grant the said land to M/s Grand Mountain Hotel (Pvt.) Ltd., on a 30 year lease basis to implement a rest house development project, subject to the relevant conditions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making a lump sum payment for the revival of families of missing persons
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022‑03‑14 for the payment of an amount of Rs.100,000/- to the next of kin of the missing person, based on the Certificate of Absence issued for the families of missing persons by the Registrar General. However, taking into consideration the matters that it takes a long time to obtain the Certificate of Absence and the amount of Rs.100,000/- being paid is not sufficient, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to dispense with the requirement of obtaining the Certificate of Absence, if the Office for Reparations has confirmed that the person concerned has been missing and increase the allowance being paid up to Rs.200,000/-, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of land blocks from Infrastructure Developed Regional Industrial Estates to set up industries
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Industries to allocate 16 land blocks under the Regional Industrial Estates Development Programme for identified 16 investors for 35 years on long term lease basis, as recommended by the Regional Industrial Services Committees which have been established under the Industrial Promotion Act No.46 of 1990 and the Project Evaluation Committee coming under the purview of the Ministry of Industries, was approved by Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Appropriation Bill for the Financial Year 2023 to	Parliament
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022‑08‑22 to draft the Appropriation Bill for the financial year 2023. As such the Appropriation Bill for the year 2023 including the draft budget estimates of each Expenditure Head was considered by the Cabinet. The total Recurrent Expenditure has been estimated as Rs. 4,634 billion whereas the total Capital Expenditure has been estimated as Rs.3,245 billion. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to publish the Appropriation Bill for the Year 2023 in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: School Meal Programme
decision_details: - The Government implements the School Meal Programme targeting 1.08 million students of 7,926 schools at an annual cost of Rs. 4 billion. The Government anticipates to implement Programmes under the Poverty Alleviation Policy expeditiously, aiming to achieve the objective “No-one-leaving-behind-with-no-food”. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by Hon. President to further expand the existing school meal programme based on district level poverty and nutritional data while securing funds through foreign donations and take appropriate action to provide a fully nutritious meal for another one million of school children.

title: Amending the Customs Ordinance and the Protection of Government 	Revenue (Special Provisions) Act, No.1 of 2006
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to amend the sections 47 and 57 of the Customs Ordinance and section 3 of the Protection of Government Revenue (Special Provisions) Act, No.1 of 2006. Owing to the provisions of section 153 of the Customs Ordinance, the revenue recovered by the Government by distribution of forfeitures and imposing penalties is very low and therefore the Committee on Public Accounts has pointed out the appropriateness of amending the said section. Further, it has been recognized the necessity of stipulating a statutory period of time to conduct investigations on customs cases and conclude such investigations as a trade facilitation measure for importers and exporters. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to take necessary action to further amend the Customs Ordinance and the Protection of Government Revenue  Act, introducing appropriate provisions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Muriate of Potash (MOP) Fertilizer required for the Maha Season 2022/23
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2022‑06‑20 has granted approval to procure 40,000 MT of MOP fertilizer required for the Maha season 2022/23, utilizing US$ 50 million provided by the Asian Development Bank. Accordingly, the relevant procurement process has been followed and the proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation to award the relevant contract to the Ameropa Asia Pte. Ltd as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revising the Retirement Age of Employees in the State Owned Enterprises
decision_details: - The compulsory age of retirement of the employees serving in the State Owned Enterprises has to be revised as 60 years as proposed by the Interim Budget 2022 passed by Parliament. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to issue the relevant Circular instructions imposing relevant provisions for the same with effect from 2023‑01‑01, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the ''Food Policy Committee''
decision_details: - The Government has recently established a multi-sector mechanism with a view to empowering rural economic revitalization Centers following a bottom-up strategy  in arriving at decisions pertaining to ensuring food security and nutrition. The entire production and distribution mechanism of essential food commodities will be guided and monitored through this mechanism while ensuring the availability of such commodities to the most vulnerable segments of the society at different administrative levels. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to establish the ''Food Policy Committee'' chaired by the Secretary to the President with participation of the Heads of the relevant Institutions to address the short term problems relating to supply, price and marketing and implement long - term programmes to build confidence among manufacturers, traders and consumers on supply chain operations in the country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a Broadcasting Authority Act for Electronic Media
decision_details: - There is no fundamental law in Sri Lanka at present to regulate the content of the television, radio and new media and due to this reason, various parties have encountered numerous issues in broadcasting audio -visual content by such media institutions and issuing licenses for such media institutions as well. The unethical actions of certain media institutions by inciting hatred among the people led to various problems in the country recently. Accordingly, the Cabinet decided to appoint a Cabinet Sub-Committee under the Chairmanship of the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to take into consideration the proposal submitted by the Minister of Mass Media to introduce a new broadcasting law enabling to create a culture accountable to the general public and introduce a code of media ethics to the electronic media taking also into consideration the changes occurring in technical and legal fields while securing the maximum independence of speech and expression, and submit appropriate recommendations in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the National Transport Commission Act No. 37 of 1991
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet of Ministers has been granted previously to amend the National Transport Commission Act No. 37 of 1991 and accordingly an amended draft Bill is being prepared by the Legal Draftsman. It has been identified that it would be appropriate to further amend the said Act by incorporating also the provisions for issuing policies, regulatory regulations and guidelines for public passenger transportation services such as three-wheelers, school vans/buses and office transportation services which are growing at present, to the National Transport Commission Act No. 37 of 1991. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to incorporate the said provisions to the draft Bill being prepared by the Legal Draftsman, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation of maize for animal feed production
decision_details: - Approximately, 600,000 metric tons of maize is annually required for animal feed production and at present, there is a dire scarcity of maize in the market. Although licensees have been issued to import 225,000 metric tons of maize through food manufacturing companies and sellers of animal feed prior to 2022‑12‑31, only 38,000 metric tons of maize have been imported by the end of June, owing to the existing shortage of foreign exchange. The price of one kilogram of maize in the local market has increased up to Rs 220/- resulting a hike in the prices of animal feed also. Accordingly, the prices of chicken and eggs have also increased. It has been observed that there might be a severe crisis in the field of animal husbandry in the near future due to the fact that those involved in poultry farming are attempting to sell eggs without breeding chickens and leaving the industry. As such the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, to grant permission for the Food Promotion Board to import 25,000 metric tons of maize or other suitable grains for animal feed production as recommended by the Department of Animal Production and Health, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Treaty between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and 	Maldives on Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters
decision_details: - Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to enter into a Treaty on Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Republic of Maldives enabling to avoid various constrains confronted when conducting joint investigations as well as to further strengthen the mutual relation between the two countries.

title: Accession to the Protocols relating to amendments of Article 50(a) and 	Article 56 of the Convention on International Civil Aviation (Chicago 	Convention)
decision_details: - Sri Lanka has agreed to amend the Protocols relating to amendments of Article 50(a) and Article 56 of the Convention on International Civil Aviation (Chicago Convention) at the 39th session of the International Civil Aviation Organization Assembly. Provisions will be provided to increase the number of members of the Council from 36 to 40 by amending Article 50 (a) whereas provisions will be provided to increase the number of members from 19 to 21 of the Air Navigation Commission. At present, 60 Contracting States have ratified these two protocols and both protocols shall come into force on the date of deposit of the 128th Instrument of Ratification. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to accede to both protocols by Sri Lanka as a Contracting State, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Support to Integrated Rural Development in the Most 	Vulnerable 	Districts of the Central and Uva Provinces of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The European Union has granted EUR 30 million to implement the “Support to Integrated Rural Development in the Most Vulnerable Districts of the Central and Uva Provinces” and the agreement for the purpose has been signed on 2016‑03‑16. Accordingly, the project duration is to be expire on 2024‑06‑15. However, owing to the outbreak of the Covid-19 pandemic and the the prevailing economic crisis in the country, delays have caused in implementing the project. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to extend the project implementation period and the execution period of the grant agreement until 2025‑06‑15, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for Strengthening Socioeconomic Resilience of Communities 	affected by the Covid-19 pandemic in the Central and Uva provinces
decision_details: - A project funded by the Korean International Cooperation Agency has been scheduled to be implemented for Strengthening Socioeconomic Resilience of plantation communities affected by the Covid-19 pandemic in Nuwara Eliya district of the Central province and Badulla district of the Uva province. This project which is expected to carry out under 03 main components such as, Hygiene, Health and Agriculture for a period of 04 years from 2022 to 2025, will directly benefit about 72,400 people in 05 divisional secretariat divisions of the Nuwara Eliya district and about 19,350 people in 06 divisional secretariat divisions of the Badulla district. The United Nations Human Settlements Programme on behalf of the Government will implement this project with the US$ 06 million grant provided by the Korean International Cooperation Agency and all the coordination activities thereof will be assigned to the Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government to sign a Tri-party Record of Discussion among the Korean International Cooperation Agency, Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government and the Department of External Resources, in order to implement the proposed project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the General Sir John Kotelawala 	Defence University and the University of Calgary, Canada
decision_details: - The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University and the University of Calgary of Canada in order to create collaboration in the study sectors such as conducting selected educational activities, exchange of visiting scholars to conduct teaching and research activities, exchange of undergraduate and post graduate students, conducting joint research activities and providing internship/placement opportunities, between the two parties.

title: Signing of the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons  (TPNW)
decision_details: - The Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons was adopted at the United Nations Organization on 07th July 2017 as the first globally applicable multilateral agreement to prohibiting nuclear weapons, with the support of 122 states. The said Treaty has been effective since 22nd January 2021 and has 86 signatories and 57 ratifications. Sri Lanka supported the adoption of this Treaty by voting in favour at the United Nations Conference and constantly promotes the universal adherence to the same. The said Treaty prohibits the participating states from developing, testing, producing, manufacturing, transferring, possessing, stockpiling nuclear weapons or other nuclear explosive devices and threatening to use them  or allowing to station such nuclear weapons in their territory and assisting, encouraging or inducing anyone to engage in any of such activities as well. Signing this Treaty is entirely consistent with Sri Lanka's principled stance against Weapons of Mass Destruction and in favour of nuclear disarmament. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Foreign Minister to sign the said Treaty by Sri Lanka and initiate the process of reviewing national legislation with a view to completing its ratification processes as soon as possible, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enticing the Airlines to the Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport and the Colombo International Airport, Ratmalana
decision_details: - It has been planned to open the Airports for the tourists and accordingly, as a pilot project, necessary actions have been taken to open the Airports for tourists during the period from 2020‑12‑26 to 2021‑01‑19, by following the recommendations of the Health Authorities. As such, the International Airlines will operate according to specific schedules prepared by the Ministry of Tourism and the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka. Therefore, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism for waiving off the landing and parking fees for the period from 2020‑12‑26 to 2021‑01‑19 from the Airlines to be operated flights to Sri Lanka in order to encourage such Airlines amidsts the crisis presently being faced by the International Aviation sector.

title: Procurement of Food Items for the Tri-Forces for the year 2021
decision_details: - National competitive bids have been called for the procurement of food items for the Tri-Forces for the year 2021. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to award the contracts for the supply of food items required by the Tri - Forces for the year 2021, to the responsive bidders, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: House of Justice Project
decision_details:
- Provisions have been allocated in the Budget 2021 for the implementation of this project and therefore, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Justice to proceed with the project as follows, enabling to initiate project activities at the beginning of the year 2021:

* 	To award the Consultancy Services Contract of this project to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau.
* 	Implementing the project as 04 sub projects and awarding of the contract for the construction of the Magistrate's Court Complex as its first sub-project to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau, subject to the price recommendation of the Standing Technical Evaluation Committee of the Ministry of Housing.
* 	Awarding of Contracts for the remaining 3 sub-projects of the project following the competitive bidding procedure.

title: Entering into Memoranda of Understanding on Bilateral Youth Development Programs
decision_details:
- The proposal made by the Minister of Youth and Sports, to enter into the following Memoranda of Understanding on Youth Development to promote mutually beneficial and long lasting cooperation in the formulation of policies aimed at the development of the youth community was approved by the Cabinet

* 	Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation in the field of Youth Development between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Republic of Tajikistan.
* 	Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation in the field of Youth  Development between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Russian Federation.

title: Expansion of the Kandy Industrial Park
decision_details: - The Kandy Industrial Park owned by the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka was established in 1994 and covers an area of 195 acres. Out of this about 120 acres of land which can be utilized for setting up industries have been allotted for 26 industries. It has been proposed to expand the industrial park using the nearby 5.65 hectares of government owned land and accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism to transfer the said plot of land to the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka as a free grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and South Africa on Cooperation in the Field of Tourism
decision_details: - The Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and South Africa on Cooperation in the field of Tourism was expired in 2017 and at the Sixth Session of the Sri Lanka - South Africa Partnership Forum in 2018, it was proposed to enter into a new Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation in the field of Tourism between the two parties. Accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism to sign a new MoU between the two parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of an Inter-Ministerial Committee for Sustainable Environment Management
decision_details: - Implementation of a Sustainable Environment Policy in line with the Government Manifesto, “Vistas of Prosperity and Splendor” is the leading responsibility of the Ministries and Institutions related to the subject of Environment including the Ministry of Environment. It has been found the necessity to act collaboratively by all the institutions related to the subject of environment to make aware the public as well as to provide accurate information on facts presented in print, electronic and social media when performing the said task. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to establish an Inter-Ministerial Coordinating Committee under the coordination of the of the Ministry of Environment together with the participation of the relevant Ministries and Institutes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting a Feasibility Study in order to implement a Urea Fertilizer Manufacturing Project
decision_details: - Annual Fertilizer Requirement in Sri Lanka is about 340,000 metric tons. The entire quantity is currently being imported. In 2019,  Rs.26 billion have been spent for importation of urea fertilizer. However, it is possible to save the foreign exchange spent on the importation of urea fertilizer through manufacturing of urea within the country itself and the Paranthan Chemicals Company Ltd. which is operated under the Ministry of Industries has focused its attention in that regard. Accordingly, considering the proposal made by the Minister of Industries with regard to the conduct of a feasibility study for the production of urea fertilizer in Sri Lanka, the Cabinet decided to entrust the Sri Lanka Institute of Nano Technology (Pvt) Ltd. to conduct the above feasibility study.

title: Protecting the local coconut oil manufacturers and the Sri Lankan coconut oil brand by developing a coconut based industrial system
decision_details:
- Industrialists and experts in the field of coconut industry have pointed out that if more attention is paid to the coconut industry in Sri Lanka, production can be increased by 50%. Investigations carried out by the Consumer Affairs Authority have confirmed that the coconut oil imported into the country contains nearly 70% of non-coconut oils. Due to the insufficient number of coconuts produced in the country, the continuation of production activities of about 500 factories of coconut and allied products are currently in crisis. As the export income of Sri Lankan coconut oil and coconut related products have increased by 16.6% in 2019 when compared to 2018, it seems that there is a possibility of creating a new trend in the coconut industry with the Government sponsorship.

Accordingly, the following joint proposals submitted by the Minister of Industry and the Minister of Plantation for the development of the coconut related industries were approved by the Cabinet-

*	Importation of broken copra for a period of three months instead of importing coconut oil, in order to encourage the local coconut oil producers.
*	Importation of broken copra with testa by BCC Company, which is a 	state owned institute.
