decision_details: - It has emerged the need of taking a certain temporary measure to provide legal protection to all relevant parties and persons in dispensation of justice on pending court cases due to the COVID - 19 pandemic. Particularly, as per the COVID- 19 pandemic condition, it has become appropriate to make provisions for such measures to be taken deviating to the ordered time limit, when certain persons are ordered to take certain measures within specified time limits. Accordingly, the Cabinet of Ministers approved the proposal submitted by the Minister of Justice to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft the COVID -19 Bill (Temporary Provisions) to impose relevant provisions including such identified matters.

title: Awarding the long term contracts for the importation of Petrol and Diesel for the period of eight months from 2020/11/01 to 2020/06/30
decision_details:
- The Cabinet approved the proposals submitted by the Minister of Energy to award the following long term contracts for the importation of Petrol and Diesel for the period of eight months from 2020‑11‑01 to 2020‑06‑30, as recommended by the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee. 
* 	Awarding the procument to M/s ES Energy DMCC,U.A.E to supply 1,800,000 barrels of Petrol (92 Unl) 
*	 Awarding the procument to M/s Swiss Singapore Overseas Enterprises Pte. Ltd., in Singapore to supply 1,680,000 barrels of Diesel that contain maximum sulphur percentage 0.05.

title: The contract for supplying and laying of water distribution systems in the Jaffna city area
decision_details: - The Cabinet approved the proposal submitted by the Minister of Water Supply, to award the contract for the supplying and laying of water distribution system in the Jaffna city area, which is one of the components of Jaffna – Kilinochchi Water Supply and Sanitation Project, to M/s NCC Company to a sum of Rs.3,160.20 Million (with VAT) as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee.

title: Construction of New Bridge Across the Rajagiriya Nawala Canal connecting Angampitiya Road at Ethulkotte and School Lane at Nawala, Rajagiriya
decision_details: - Limited competitive bids were called to award the contract for the construction of a new bridge across Rajagiriya – Nawala canal connecting Angampitiya Road at Ethulkotte and School Lane, Rajagiriya at Nawala. Accordingly, the proposal submitted by the Minister of Highways to award the relevant contract to the State Development and Construction Corporation for a sum of Rs.1,698.55 million (without VAT), as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for Construction of Gandara Fishery Harbour
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2019‑07‑07 to implement the project for the construction of the Gandara Fishery Harbor in the Devinuwara Divisional Secretariat Division in the Matara District. Accordingly, competitive bids have been called for this purpose and the Cabinet approved the proposal submitted by the Minister of Fisheries to award this contract to RR SENOK JV to a sum of Rs. 5,367.69 million (without VAT), as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee.

title: Awarding Contract for the Construction of the Technology Faculty Building of the Sabaragamuwa Universityof Sri Lanka
decision_details: - International competitive bidding procedure has been followed to select a suitable contractor for the construction of the Technology Faculty Building of the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka under the Asian Development Bank funded Science and Technology Human Resources Development Project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to award the above contract to M/s International Constructions Consortium (Pvt) Ltd, to a sum of US$ 3.01 million and Rs 1,507.24 million (without VAT), as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of Contract for the Construction of the Faculty of Allied Health Sciences Building - Phase 1 of the University of Ruhuna
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2018‑09‑11 to implement the Phase I of the project for the Construction of the Faculty of Allied Health Sciences Building of the University of Ruhuna. Accordingly, National Competitive Biding Procedure has been followed to select a suitable contractor for the purpose. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to award the said contract to M/s Sathuta Builders (Pvt.) Ltd., to a sum of Rs. 1,501.73 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of Contract for selection of an Engineering Consultancy Service Firm for the construction of the Medical Faculty of the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka has signed an agreement with the Saudi Development Fund to obtain a loan of 187.5 million Saudi Riyals to establish the Medical Faculty of the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, competitive bids have been invited for the selection of a consultancy firm for the establishment of the said Medical Faculty. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to award the the relevant consultancy service contract to M/s DAR Engineering of Saudi Arabia, to a sum of 5.37 million Saudi Riyals, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultancy Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Ragama-Peralanda Wetland Recreational Park
decision_details: - The Urban Development Authority has planned to implement a Recreational Park project in the vicinity of Peralanda Wetlands located within the Ragama-Peralanda residential area. Accordingly the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to award the relevant contract as a direct contract to the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation and to provide the necessary consultancy services by the Urban Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Judicature Act, No.2 of 1978
decision_details:
- The Special Committee appointed to amend the Code of Criminal Procedure Act and the Penal Code has recommended the appointment of "Recorder Judges to the High Court" and the conducting of pre-trial conference in High Courts. 

Accordingly, the draft bill for amending the Code of Criminal Procedure Act No 15 of 1979 is being drafted at present, for the purpose of introducing the procedure for pre-trial conference.

Although it is possible to appoint a Recorder Judge to the Court to deal with all the pre-trial and post-trial matters, in terms of the provisions of the Judicature Act, No.2 of 1978, no appointments have been made so far, due to some technical issues in existence. Since the conduct of pre-trial and post-trial hearings is a judicial function, the relevant appointments should be made by the Judicial Service Commission from among the Judges presently serving. Further, it has been identified that it is appropriate to change the designation “ Recorder” in the Judicature Act as “Recorder Judge”. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, to amend the Judicature Act, No.2 of 1978, incorporating the said provisions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief to tea smallholders for the affected tea plantations due to excessive heat and drought condition
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2020‑06‑03 to implement a program to provide tea plants to tea smallholders free of charge to restore tea plantations damaged due to excessive heat and and drought condition. Accordingly, the Cabinet considered the information submitted by the Minister of Plantation that 3.5 million tea plants worth Rs. 105 million had been distributed by the Tea Smallholdings Development Authority and another 2.5 million tea plants worth Rs. 75 million are planned to be distributed within this year.

title: Granting State Lands to Landless War Heroes for Residential Purposes
decision_details: - With the introduction of a new methodology for disposition of state lands to war heroes, having revised the previous policy existed, at the Cabinet meeting held on 2016‑07‑18, the some war heroes who have been granted lands under the previous policy are reported to have faced numerous hardships. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Lands to introduce a new methodology to eliminate these inequalities that have occurred in providing relief to the war heroes belonging to the same category, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of necessary scrap metal for the Local Small Scale Industrialists
decision_details:
- Issues relating to the metal industry had been discussed by the “Inter-Ministerial Task Force on Industry and Enterprise” and the “Presidential Task Force on Economic Revival and Poverty Alleviation” at their meetings. As determined at those discussions, steps have been taken to stop the export of Copper, Aluminium, Stainless Steel, High Carbon Steel, Brass, Cast Iron, Aluminium Ingots and Zinc Ingots with immediate effect, with a view to providing sufficient raw materials for the local metal industrialists. According to a research conducted by the Sri Lanka Industrial Development Board and the University of Moratuwa, it has been proved that there is a high demand for scrap Iron, Cast Iron, Aluminium, Copper and Brass by the local industrialists and the demand for Zinc, Manganese, High Carbon Steel and Stainless Steel is also being increased. 

The demand for Scrap Metal is expected to be increased further in line with policies of the Government pertaining to the promotion of local industries. Therefore, it has been found that it is appropriate to reconsider the current permission that has been given for the export of Copper Wire and to suspend the export of Copper Wire in order to encourage production of more value added products.

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to use the scrap metal of Iron, Copper, Aluminium, Stainless Steel, High Carbon Steel, Brass , Cast Iron and Aluminium Ingots and Zinc Ingots and Copper Wire only for the local industries and to permit to export the unusable Scrap Metal only on the recommendation of the Sri Lanka Industrial Development Board and the other relevant institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing opportunity for sale of products of the Government Institutions in the showroom of the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation
decision_details:
- It is been planned to expand the showroom of the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation which is currently operating at the Narahenpita Dedicated Economic Center and establish a sales center called “Rajawasa” in order to facilitate the customers to obtain the products manufactured and sold in the following Government Institutions under one roof at a reasonable price.
*	 Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation
*	Ceylon Fisheries Corporation
*	Educational Publications Department 
*	 Sri Lanka Tea Board
*	 State Pharmaceuticals Corporation 
*	 B.B.C. Lanka Limited 
*	 Cooperative Development Department 
*	 Lanka Sathosa Limited
*	 Ceylon Cashew Corporation
*	 Mantai Salt Company
*	 Litro Gas Limited
*	 State Timber Corporation
*	 Colombo Commercial Fertilizers Limited
*	Ceylon Fertilizer Company Limited
*	 Milco (Pvt.) Ltd
*	 Coconut Development Authority
*	 State Printing Corporation 

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade to modernize the premises where the showroom of the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation presently located and to establish the proposed “Rajawasa” Sales Center, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief for continuing inter-provincial bus operations in the face of the COVID-19 pandemic situation
decision_details:
- It has been decided to waive off the following charges from the bus operators with effect from March 2020 for continuing inter-provincial bus operations amidst the COVID - 19 pandemic situation. 

*	Permit renewal fees 
*	Late fees 
*	Tender fees 
*	Log fees 
*	Entrance fees 
*	Expressway temporary permit fees

However, it has been identified that the bus operators need to be provided with relief enabling them to provide quality and efficient passenger transport service, since they have confronted with numerous constrains due to re-emergence of the pandemic situation. Accordingly, considering a proposal made by the Minister of Transport, the Cabinet granted approval for further providing the said concessions to the bus operators until the end of this year.

title: Establishment of a Dedicated Pharmaceutical Zone at Arabokka Estate, Hambantota
decision_details: - The Presidential Task Force for Economic Revival and Poverty Alleviation has identified the pharmaceutical manufacturing industry as one of the potential industries that could attract foreign direct investments as well as earn foreign exchange. Therefore, it has been planned to establish a special pharmaceutical manufacturing zone with modern facilities within an area in extent of 400 acres of the Arabokka estate in Hambantota enabling to attract the world renowned pharmaceutical manufacturing companies. It is expected to declare the said project as a Strategic Development Project and grant concessions and incentives for the investors who invest in the said pharmaceutical manufacturing zone. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health for the establishment of 20 pharmaceutical manufacturing companies in 200 acres as phase I of this Project and another 20 pharmaceutical manufacturing companies in 200 more acres as its phase II and to furnish necessary infrastructure facilities by the Board of Investments of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Paediatric Surgical Ward at the Teaching Hospital, Ratnapura
decision_details: - Teaching Hospital, Ratnapura is the largest tertiary care hospital in the Sabaragamuwa province thus providing services to a large number of patients from other provinces as well. Adhering to the need of a surgical ward with proper facilities for the pediatric ward complex consisted of 116 beds, it has been planned to construct a paediatric surgical ward in the second storey of the relevant paediatric ward building. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Health for the construction of the proposed paediatric surgical ward with the funding of the donors and to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Health and the relevant donors for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reservation of Borrow Area for Offshore Sand Mining
decision_details: - The requirement of long-term reserving of a borrow area for offshore sand mining has been arisen for mining sand for the construction industry and as well as for the projects implemented by Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation. The institution has satisfied its sand requirement since the year 1994 by mining sand within an offshore area of 61 square kilometers, having obtained exploration license periodically. Considering the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing, the Cabinet decided to grant approval to permit the the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation for offshore sand mining from the said borrow area of 61 square kilo meters for a period of 10 years, subject to carrying out an Environmental Impact Assessment.

title: Model Memorandum of Understanding on Police Cooperation
decision_details: - It has been observed that entering into bilateral memoranda of understanding with the foreign police organizations who perform their duties in a highly efficient manner with the help of modern technology, will enable our police officers to share their experience, knowledge, skills and internationally recognized practices and standards on modern police duties. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation and State Minister of Internal Security, Home Affairs and Disaster Management to enter into Memoranda of Understanding between the Ministry under which the subject of police falls and the foreign police organizations under the guidance of the Foreign Ministry to establish police cooperation under 17 fields such as terrorist activities, terrorist financing, drug related crimes, human trafficking and smuggling, money laundering, cybercrime etc, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of security services to hospitals and other institutions under the Ministry of Health for the year 2020/2021
decision_details: - The contract has to be awarded for the supply of security services to hospitals and other institutions under the Ministry of Health for the year 2020/2021. Accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Health to award the supply of security services for 35 hospitals and institutions in the Western Province to Rakna Arakshaka Lanka Limited and to award the supply of security services for 26 hospitals and institutions located outside the Western Province to LRDC Services (Pvt) Ltd, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing locally manufactured sarees as uniforms for Dhamma School teachers
decision_details: - Granting of uniforms to the Dhamma School teachers serving in the Buddhist Dhamma Schools throughout the island is being implemented since the year 2004 and accordingly, 76,000 sarees are required for the year 2020 to be awarded as uniforms to Buddhist Dhamma School teachers .  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to purchase 76000 sarees made by local textile manufacturers at Rs. 2,400/- per each, to a sum of Rs. 182.4 million from Lanka Salusala Limited, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Re-establishment of the Spices and Allied Products Marketing Board
decision_details: - Spices and Allied Products Marketing Board has been established under the provisions of section 2 of the State Agricultural Corporations Act No 11 of 1972. At its meeting held on 2008‑07‑16, the Cabinet decided that the functions of the said Board be vested with the Department of Export Agriculture and the institution be closed with effect from 2008‑07‑27. However, the Spices and Allied Products Marketing Board currently falls under the purview of the State Ministry of Development of Minor Crops including Sugarcane, Maize, Cashew, Pepper, Cinnamon, Cloves, Betel Related Industries and Export Promotion. Since the necessity of having a formal mechanism to implement the programmes and projects identified by the said State Ministry, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation to reactivate the Spices and allied products Marketing Board and continue its activities, was approved by the cabinet.

title: Establishment of a New Refinery of 100,000 barrels per day (bblspd) at Sapugaskanda for the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation
decision_details:
- As the existing capacity of the refinery located at Sapugaskanda belonging to the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation is only 40,000 (bblspd), the Corporation refinery meets only 25 % of the local demand for refined petroleum products. The remaining 75% has to be imported, relying much on the foreign exchange. Although a feasibility study had been conducted in 2010 for the renovation and expansion of the refinery to increase that capacity up to 100,000 (bblspd), the subsequent technological changes that have taken place in that field have made it impossible to proceed on the results of the feasibility study.

Accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Energy to take necessary action to initiate a new feasibility study by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to determine the scope, technical, operational and financial feasibility of the project which is to be implemented with a focus on several alternative proposals to enhance the existing refinery capacity of petroleum products, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Streamlining the Fertilizer Production and Distribution System in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Production, supply and application of fertilizer should be scientifically handled in order to ensure a sustainable soil quality to produce quality crops for a healthy food production process. Therefore, a proper Fertilizer Supply Chain Management System with appropriate technological procedures that do not lead to fertilizer wastage, scarcity and deviation from standards, should be followed. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, to take necessary action to provide infrastructure facilities with scientific standards and components based on an automated centralized methodology upon instructions of the Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka, including the completion of National Fertilizer Secretariat with modern technologies, upgrading existing laboratories and strengthening the district level operating and evaluation system including a field inspection mechanism to be established in collaboration with the Sri Lanka Institute of Nanotechnology, to its scope, was approved by the Cabinet .

title: Obtaining used empty bullet Casings and disposed Armor Plates as raw materials for the industries of traditional artisans
decision_details: - Attention has been drawn to solve the issues confronted by the traditional craft industries and rural industries in order to empower the industrialists who involved in those sectors, since such industries can have a huge impact on the economy of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, it has been planned to supply the manufactures the raw materials at a concessionary basis, enabling them to price such goods in order to compete with the imported goods in the market. For the purpose, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to obtain the empty bullet casings (Brass) and disposed armour plates used by the Sri Lanka Army, the Sri Lanka Air Force and the Sri Lanka Navy to the National Crafts Council, deviating from procurement procedure and subject to the pricing formula  approved by the Cabinet in the year 2017 and also to purchase copper, brass and aluminum etc disposed by the Sri Lanka Telecom, the Department of Sri Lanka Railways, the Ceylon Electricity Board and the National Water Supply and Drainage Board at a concessionary price to the National Crafts Council, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining discarded rails of the Department of Sri Lanka Railways for the construction of electric fences and protective fences to minimize the elephant-human conflict
decision_details:
- At present, Elephant - human conflicts are reported in 133 Divisional Secretariat Divisions in 19 Districts in Sri Lanka. Construction of protective fences and electric fences are the key measures from among the measures taken by the Department of Wild Life Conservation to control this situation. Approximately 4,500 km of electric fences have already been erected by now in the aforementioned 133 Divisional Secretariat Divisions while approximately 1,500 km of electric fences, and elephant retention centres with protective fences have been planned to be constructed. Although, timber posts are being used to construct these fences at present those are frequently subject to fall down by elephants. Using of concrete posts too is beyond practical approach due to difficulties found in renovating them.

Therefore, it has been proposed to utilize discarded rails as an alternative solution for the purpose. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Conservation and the Minister of Transport to obtain the discarded rails by the Department of Sri Lanka Railways to the Department of Wild Life Conservation, on free of charge, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Programme for the Establishment of Export Production Villages
decision_details: - It has been designed to implement an Export Production Villages Programme enabling to develop rural products within a formal business model and connect them with the export supply chain as well as to upgrading local manufacturing industries to produce import substitutions. This programme aims to mobilize homogeneous producers scattered in a particular area as an Export Production Village Company and provide with them opportunity to produce their productions to the export market and also to address the issues having minimized the challenges to be faced by them. Further, it is expected to establish Export Production Villages covering the sectors of Agriculture, Fisheries, Industry and Services and to enter into future trade agreements with leading export companies thereby ensuring the sustainability of the said Export Production Villages. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, to implement the said proposed programme by the Sri Lanka Export Development Board utilizing the necessary provisions, under the guidance of the Ministry of Trade, was approved in principle, by the Cabinet.

title: Performing teaching activities by means of television and radio services under the Distance education system
decision_details: - Considering the difficulties erupted for the continuation of teaching activities in the schools due to the COVID - 19 pandemic situation, approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to use both “Eye Channel” and “Nethra Channel” to perform teaching activities by means of television and radio services under the distance education system. With the re-emergence of COVID - 19 pandemic in the country, it has been perceived that optimal alternative distance educational methodologies are essential to be applied for the continuation of educational activities, since re-opening of schools as scheduled seems to be not practical at present. Therefore, it has been planned to prepare and telecast television educational programmes from grades 3 to 13 in all the three languages; Sinhala, Tamil and English. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education, to implement a series of Educational prorammes with the assistance of the State and private television and radio channels in collaboration with the National Institute of Education and the State Ministry of Education Reforms, Open Universities & Distance Learning Promotion, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extending the grace period agreed on the payment of the salaries to the private sector employees in the wake of the crisis caused by the Covid-19 pandemic
decision_details:
- A Task Force has been appointed representing Employers, Trade Unions, the National Labour Advisory Council, the Ministry of Labour and the Department of Labour has been appointed to look into the payment of salaries to the private sector employees in the wake of the crisis caused by the Covid-19 pandemic. The said Task Force has agreed to take action as follows from May to September, 2020.
    • Retaining the jobs of employees of institutions which suspended operations due to the Covid 19 pandemic. 
    • to make arrangements to deploy employees on a roster basis or any other suitable method enabling them to serve proportionately where the institution that can't deploy all their workers in the duty due to the requirement of maintaining social distancing.

    • to pay either 50% of the basic salary of the relevant month in which employee last received his full salary or Rs.14,500, whichever is more remunerative to the employee, in respect of employees of the institutions which had a requirement to retain their workers at home due to the absence of work. 
    • to pay contributions to the Employees’ Provident Fund and the Employees Trust Fund by the employer for the salaries so paid.

The Cabinet noted that the matters submitted by the Minister of Labour to the effect that the said Task Force is in agreement to take action as mentioned above up to December of this year as the spread of Covid-19 pandemic further continuing in the country.

title: Procurement for the supply of 2,000,000 Vials of Biphasic Isophane Insulin Injection BP, 30/70, 1000 IU/10 ml
decision_details: - International competitive bids were invited for the procurement of Biphasic Isophane Insulin Injection which is used to treat for the diabetic patients. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to award the procurement for the supply of 2,000,000 vials of Biphasic Isophane Insulin Injection BP, 30/70, 1000 IU/10 ml to M/s Wokhardt Limited at a total C&F price of US$ 3 million as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for construction of the Faculty Building Complex (Phase I) for the Faculty of Agricultural Sciences of the Sabaragamuwa University, Sri Lanka
decision_details: - National competitive bidding procedure has been followed for the construction of the Faculty Building Complex (Phase 1) for the Faculty of Agricultural Sciences of the Sabaragamuwa University, Sri Lanka. Accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Education, to award the said contract to Sathuta Builders Pvt. Ltd, Kurunegala to a sum of Rs.797.81 million (without VAT) as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of houses for 14 selected devotees affected by the Easter Sunday attack at St. Sebastian's Church, Katuwapitiya, Negombo
decision_details: - The Cabinet approval was granted on 2019‑09‑17 to implement a housing project for the families affected by the bomb explosion that took place at St. Sebastian's Church, Katuwapitiya, Negombo on 2020‑09‑21. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to award the contract for the construction houses for 14 selected families at a cost of Rs. 3.24 million per each under the above programme to the State Engineering Corporation of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of the “Swashakthi Loan Scheme” to provide loan facilities towards developing Small and Medium Scale Business Sector and generating employments
decision_details:
- In the year 2017, the “Swasakthi Loan Scheme” has been launched jointly by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and the Small Business Development Division of the Ministry vested with the subject of Youth Affairs with an investment of Rs. 3500 million. Said loan scheme has been implemented through commercial banks and it provides loans to start a business based on a successful project plan. At present, under the said loan scheme, 13890 entrepreneurs have been provided with Rs. 3064 million. Accordingly, taking into consideration the nature of the project and the compliance with the current needs, the proposal made by the Minister of Youth and Sports, to provide loans to young entrepreneurs within the age of 18 and 40, subject to a maximum of one million rupees, for the implementation of new small and medium scale projects in the following business sectors, was approved by the Cabinet. 

*	IT and computer related projects. 
*	Agricultural, dairy and animal husbandry projects. 
*	Projects related to tourism promotion. 
*	 Projects related to innovations and innovative machinery and plants. 
*	 Food processing products and related projects.

title: Handing over Raigam Korale Tea Shakthi Tea Factory to Raigam Tea Small 	Holdings Development Society
decision_details: - Due to the cease of the tea production activities of the Raigam Korale  Shakthi Tea Factory from April 2019 by the the Dikhena Tea Small Holder Development Society which had taken over the said tea factory on lease basis, tea smallholders who supplied their production to the said factory are faced with severe difficulties. Approximately Rs. 42 million had to be paid to the tea smallholders who supplied tea to the said factory, broker companies and other external parties by the the Dikhena Tea Small Holder Development Society. Taking into account the request made by the tea smallholders to restart the activities of the said factory, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation to hand over the said factory on lease basis to Raigam Tea Small Holdings Development Society, which has the financial strength and 1,800 members to carry out production activities of the Factory, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed dedicated zone for textile manufacturing and related industries at Punnaikudah of Eravur-Pattu Divisional Secretariat Division in Batticaloa District
decision_details: - The establishment of an apparel industrial Zone in Eravur by the Board of Investment in collaboration with the Land Reforms Commission has been identified as a significant priority project of the Ministry of Industries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to declare the apparel industrial zone proposed to be established at Punnaikudah of Eravur-Pattu Divisional Secretariat Division in Batticaloa District as a strategic Development Project as a 'Dedicated Zone for Textile Manufacturing and Related Industries', to vest 275 acres of land identified for the purpose and belonging to the Land Reforms Commission with the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka, to secure provisions required for the said project and to provide investment incentives for the investors those who are investing in that industrial zone, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the Republic of India for obtaining Indian Grant Assistance to implement the High Impact Community Development Projects
decision_details: - The Government of India has extended their grant financing assistance to Sri Lanka since 2005 to implement small scale development projects in view of strengthening the bilateral relationship and development partnership between two countries. Under this grant financing programme, a large number of projects pertaining to the development of infrastructure in the fields such as education, health and community development have been implemented through the Government institutions, Local Authorities and Non Government Organizations. Under the same, the Government of India is in an agreement to provide financial assistance to Sri Lanka in order to implement high impact community development projects for a period of five years from 2020 to 2025. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to enter into a new MoU for the purpose with the Government of India, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Wind Farm Projects in Mannar Island
decision_details: - Construction work of 100 MW Wind Power Plant in Mannar Island is now underway with an investment of US$ 200 million of the Asian Development Bank (ADB). The physical progress of the project is 73% and the construction is expected to be completed by early 2021. Of the US$ 200 million obtained for the project, a balance of US$ 47 million remains and it has been found that another 06 wind turbines could be installed using the said balance thereby increasing the power generation capacity of the said Plant by 20 MW. The Asian Development Bank has granted approval in principle for the capacity enhancing proposal and accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Power to take action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a mechanism to utilize non-forest lands among the residual lands except conservation and reserved forests which are vested with the Conservator General of Forests for productive economic purposes
decision_details: - A decision had been taken in 2006, to transfer the powers vested with the Divisional Secretaries to authorize the use of the remaining non-forest lands of residual lands for activities such as chena cultivation, other farming and temporary economic activities to an Inter-Ministerial Committee. At its meeting held on 2020‑07‑01, Cabinet decided that it would be appropriate to introduce a simplified mechanism of granting permission to engage in such economic activities to minimize the hardships faced by those temporarily engaged in chena farming and other economic activities in such lands. Accordingly, having studied the issues, the officers of the Ministry of Wildlife and Forest Conservation, Ministry of Environment and the Ministry of Lands have formulated a new mechanism. As such, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Conservation, the Minister of Environment and the Minister of Lands to implement the said mechanism, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Sri Lankan Embassies in Romania and Spain
decision_details: - Diplomatic relations between Romania and Sri Lanka commenced in the year 1957 and so far, very good bilateral relations have been established between the two countries. Further, Diplomatic relations between Spain and Sri Lanka commenced in 1955. Accordingly the proposal made by the Foreign Minister to establish Sri Lankan Embassies in the said two countries with a view to further developing the existing relations with those countries with Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Modernizing the process of conducting Examinations in the Department of Examinations of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Department of Examinations of Sri Lanka conducts mainly 4 National Examinations related to school education and about 325 Institutional Examinations annually. The departmental staff carries out most of the work related to conducting those examinations following the usual office procedures and the necessity of digitalizing the examination process has been identified to maintain the accuracy and reliability of the examinations. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to purchase new technical equipment including internet facilities required to modernize the examination management process of the Department of Examinations, to train the respective staff to utilize the said devices and to establish Examination Evaluation Centres at provincial level to facilitate the exam evaluation process, was approved by the cabinet.

title: Re-allocating the Regidale Watte land at Kahapola, Piliyandala to the National Zoological Department
decision_details: - The Cabinet has granted approval in the year 2016 to acquire the Regidale Watte land at Kahapola, Piliyandala which was under the National Zoological Department to the then Ministry in charge of the subject of Buddhashasana and vest the same with the institution called “Light of Asia Foundation” under a Memorandum of Understanding for its project for the Erection of the Theme Park of Sakya Kingdom of Kapilawasthu in India. The said project had been scheduled to commence in the year 2017 and complete in March 2020, however its progress is still less than 5%. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Buddhashasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to cancel the Agreement entered into with the “Light of Asia Foundation” and acquire the said land back to the Ministry of Buddhashasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to re-transfer the said land to the National Zoological Department, retaining 5 acres of the land under the Ministry for its future development activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Additional Financial assistance from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) for the Small and Medium Sized Enterprises Line of Credit Project
decision_details:
- The Asian Development Bank has given its consent to grant a loan amounting to US$ 165 million including an Emergency Response Component of US$ 100 miilion for the measures to be taken to provide solutions to mitigate the circumstances erupted and the negative impact confronted by the Small and Medium Scale Entrepreneurs due to the COVID -19 pandemic. In addition to the above loan, it has also been agreed to award a grant of US$ 1.25 million under the Japan Fund for Poverty Reduction. 
Further, it has been agreed to grant a concessionary loan amount of US$ 400 million for the Secondary Education Sector Improvement Project under the Results Based Lending financial modality of the Asian Development Bank.

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to enter into the respective agreements with the Asian Development Bank to obtain the said loan amounts and the grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Capacity Expansion Project of the Colombo International Container Terminal
decision_details:
- The Project for the development of the South Container Terminal of Colombo Port was implemented under an investment of US$ 500 million and its construction was completed on 2016‑12‑01 and is in commercial operation at present. An Agreement has been entered into by the Colombo International Container Terminal Limited with the Sri Lanka Board of Investment to implement the aforesaid Project. Taking into account the present demand for the activities of the said Terminal and the prospective business opportunities, it has been decided to expand the said project enhancing the capacity of the Terminal without commencing new constructions. 
	Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to introduce new equipment to upgrade and moderate the existing equipment investing US$ 90 million, and thereby implement the productivity enhancing project of the Terminal and to publish the relevant tax relief in accordance with the provisions of the Strategic Development Projects Act in the Government Gazette, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka Bill 2020
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation to introduce a new Act, in place of the existing Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka Act No.36 of 1987, incorporating the provisions required to regulate the stock market of Sri Lanka in keeping with current international best practices, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of a Delimitation Committee to establish new Divisional Secretariat Divisions, to gazette the already established Divisional Secretariat Divisions and to establish and reconstitute of Grama Niladhari Divisions
decision_details: - Based on the administration and development requirements of the Government as well as the requirements of the public, many requests have been made by people's representatives as well as people's organizations for the establishment of new divisional secretariat divisions in certain areas of the country, reconstitution of some divisional secretariat divisions, delimitation and then gazette the already established divisions yet to be gazetted, establishment of new Grama Niladhari divisions and reconstitute of the existing Grama Niladhari divisions. Although, a Delimitation Committee has to be appointed for the purpose, every 05 years, the report of the last committee appointed in the year 2012, has not been published in the Government Gazette and accepted officially due to the technical deficiencies in the Report. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation and State Minister of Internal Security, Home Affairs and Disaster Management, to appoint a new Delimitation Committee for the purpose of carrying out the relevant functions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting/Acquisition of State and Private Lands with the Urban Development Authority for the proposed Urban Development Projects
decision_details: -The Urban Development Authority has planned to implement a number of urban development projects centered on major cities including the city of Colombo. Preliminary activities pertaining to these projects have already been initiated while the Urban Development Authority has to acquire both State owned as well as private owned plots of land already identified for this project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing, to vest with the Urban Development Authority 39 plots of State owned land in terms of section 6(1) of the State Land Ordinance as a free grant and another 05 plots of private lands under the Land Acquisition Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Request for Proposals (RFP) to select investors for the development of 	lands belonging to the Urban Development Authority
decision_details:
-Taking into consideration the time taken in selecting suitable investors for the development of lands belonging to the Urban Development Authority in terms of the existing procedure adopted in this regard, the proposal made by the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to follow the procedure stated below for the same, was approved by the Cabinet. 

    • To authorize the Urban Development Authority to call for Requests for Proposals to alienate lands belonging to the said Authority for the development activities according to the proposed development plans with the full participation of the private sector as well as the Public-Private Partnership in terms of the Government Procurement Guidelines.
      
    • To invite proposals from the interested prospective investors through the Competitive Bidding Process for the development of lands belonging to the Urban Development Authority identified for the projects to be implemented with the Public-Private Partnership.

    • To appoint a Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee to evaluate the said proposals and Project Committees based on the nature of each project. 
    • In determining the value of the lands to base it on the the valuation of the Government Chief Valuer.
    • to alienate the relevant blocks of land to the selected investors on lease basis based on the recommendation of Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee and subject to the approval of the Cabinet.

title: Regulations under the Regulation of Insurance Industry Act, No.43 of 2000
decision_details:
-Regulation of Insurance Industry Act, No.43 of 2000 has been introduced replacing the previous Act No.25 of 1962, to establish the Insurance Board of Sri Lanka currently known as the Insurance Regulatory Commission making provision for the development, supervision and regulation of the insurance industry of Sri Lanka with the objective and responsibility of protecting the rights of the policyholders and potential policyholders by ensuring the conduct of the insurance business in Sri Lanka is carried out in professional manner with integrity and prudence.
	
	The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, to present the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2118/1 dated 2019‑04‑08 issued by virtue of the powers vested with the Minister of Finance, under section 112(3) to be read with section 16 of the new Act, for the purpose of amending the regulations under the previous Act issued through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 610/4 dated 1990‑05‑15, in Parliament.

title: Review of the Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) Compact Agreement
Establishment of an Inter Ministerial Task Force for Industrial and Entrepreneur Development
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Industries and Supply Chain Management to establish an Inter-Ministerial Task Force for Industrial and Entrepreneur Development under the Chairmanship of H.E. the President and the membership of the Minister of Industries and Supply Chain Management and the participation of other relevant Ministers, Secretaries to Ministries and Officers, with a view to minimizing the delays and problematic situations arising in the process of making policy decisions in the manufacturing industry sector which provides a major contribution to the economic development, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the National Policy and Planning Bureau
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President to establish a National Policy and Planning Bureau for the adaptation of economic policies needed to achieve macro economic goals through National Policy and Planning, State Investment Allocation, National Development Planning, the Procurement Process, Project Analysis and Management with transparency and in a strategically oriented manner, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 'Sapiri Gamak' Community Based Rural Development Programme 2020
decision_details: - It has been planned to implement a community based rural development programme called 'Sapiri Gamak' during the year 2020 with the objective of promoting employment and livelihood opportunities through the upliftment of rural facilities.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Prime Minister and Minister of Finance, Economy and Policy Development, to implement the said programme commencing from the 01st of January in 2020 in each Grama Niladhari Division by implementing projects amounting to Rs.2,000,000/- covering all the 14,021 Grama Niladhari Divisions Island-wide,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Gazette Notification to fulfill the legal requirement under Import and Export (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 for approval of the Cabinet of Ministers
decision_details:
The Government Policy 'Saubhagyaye Dekma' ('Vistas of Prosperity') has recognized the necessity of encouraging the farmer and the manufacturer to cultivate crops and manufacture products that can be produced within the country as much as possible. It is expected to uplift the farmer's economy within the country and to control the outflow of local foreign exchange to the other countries.

	As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, Economy and Policy Development to table the Gazette Notification issued on 2019 12 06 making provisions under the Import and Export (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 to control the importation of crops such as cardamom, clove, turmeric, pepper, cinnamon, nutmeg, mace, arecanut, tamarind and black gram and the products such as kites, lanterns/Vesak lanterns and incense sticks, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of food items for the Tri Forces - Supply Year 2020
decision_details: - As per the recommendation made by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) relating to the Procurement of food items  for the Sri Lanka Army, Sri Lanka Navy and Sri Lanka Air Force for the Supply Year 2020, the proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli, Agriculture, Irrigation and Rural Development and State Minister of Defence to award the said procurements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing Relief for Small Scale Industrialists in Traditional Tile, Brick and Pottery Industries to procure Clay
decision_details: - Any person or an institution engaged in clay mining should obtain a license for the same in accordance with the Mines and Minerals Act, No.33 of 1992 as amended by Act, No.66 of 2009 and also a license to transport such raw materials to the site of the relevant industry. However, considering the various difficulties the small scale clay industrialists have to undergo, as a result of the complications in the procedure of obtaining the permits, the approval of the Cabinet has already been granted to simplify the process of obtaining permits for the transportation of sand, clay and soil.  As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment and Wildlife Resources, to amend Section 28 and 30 of the Mines and Minerals Act, No.33 of 1992 as appropriate to provide the provision necessary 	to further simplify the existing licensing procedure when obtaining the raw materials and to introduce a more efficient and simple method to facilitate the industrialists engaged in Tile, Brick and Pottery to continue in their production process sustainably and to ensure that no eco sensitive areas such as river banks are affected by the process, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of  an Interconnected Modernized Road Network in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - In terms of the National Policy Framework named the 'Vistas of Prosperity and Splendour', the modernization of the Road Network has been identified as a key factor necessary to achieve a high level of economic growth. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Roads and Highways, to implement the priority projects such as the construction of Overtaking Lanes at 3-5 km intervals on the National Highways, minimizing traffic congestion and road traffic crashes in areas identified as bottle necks and re surfacing and modernization of the entire road network in conformity with the international standards, the development of 100,000 km of Alternative Road Network, to facilitate a higher level of access to the main Highways and Expressways and improvement of rural access roads to make access to such an alternative road network, was approved in principle, by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Task Force under the Ministry of Education for the implementation of Proposals for New Educational Reforms
decision_details: - It has been identified that the establishment of a 'Task Force pertaining to Education' is essential for providing technological and policy guidelines for the implementation of the proposals for educational reforms, in accordance with the Government policy, in a strategical and transparent manner. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education, to appoint a Task Force comprising of a group of experts with the subject specialists in the relevant field in the identification of proposals for educational reforms, programmes and  strategies, and to assist in the implementation of same, provide guidance, monitor and feedback for the relevant institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining 'Govijana Mandiraya' where the Ministry of Agriculture had been established, to re establish the Ministry of Agriculture
decision_details: - The Government owned building named as 'Govijana Mandiraya' situated at Rajamalwatta Avenue in Battaramulla where the Ministry of Agriculture was previously established, had been given over to the Parliament of Sri Lanka on Cabinet approval with the objective of establishing the Parliamentary Committee System.  However, as of now, the building has not been fully utilized for the purpose. Also, the Government has to incur an expenditure close upon Rs.21 million monthly as rent, as a result of the Ministry of Agriculture being established in another building on a rental basis. Nevertheless, due to the inadequate facilities available in the building both the officers serving in the Ministry and the service recipients have to be subject to various inconveniences. Taking these matters into consideration, the proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli, Agriculture, Irrigation and Rural Development, to re establish the Ministry of Agriculture and the other institutions coming under purview of the Ministry, in the 'Govijana Mandiraya', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The 72nd National Day Celebrations falling on 04th February, 2020
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils & Local Government to appoint a Ministerial Committee under the Chairmanship of Hon. Prime Minister, to draw up the relevant programme for the 72nd National Day Celebrations falling on the 04th of February, 2020 and to organize the necessary arrangements, was approved by the Cabinet. The Cabinet also decided to hold the 72nd National Day Celebrations at the Independence Square in Colombo 07.

title: Introduction of 1000 Information Technology Certificate / Diploma learning opportunities under the Institution of Technology affiliated to the University of Moratuwa
decision_details: - It has been planned to implement an expeditious programme for providing training opportunities for Certificate/Diploma/Advanced Diploma courses for the students who have followed the technology subject streams, other subject streams or the students who have passed the Advanced Level Examination  targeting the job market in the IT Sector which is presently in high demand locally and internationally for software production and internet based job opportunities.  The said programme envisages to commence with 1000 training opportunities in the year 2020 and expects to increase the training opportunities up to 3000 by the year 2022. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Higher Education, Technology and Innovation, to conduct such training courses through the Institute of Technology at Diyagama affiliated to the University of Moratuwa and to get the contribution of a Committee of Experts in the field of Information Technology working in the private and public sectors to design the courses, was approved in principle by the Cabinet.

title: Agreement for the transfer of sentenced persons between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and Czech Republic
decision_details:
- In terms of the provisions of the Transfer of Offenders Act, No.5 of 1995, a citizen of another country convicted and sentenced to imprisonment by a court in Sri Lanka can serve his/her sentence in the country of which he claims to be a citizen and a citizen of Sri Lanka imprisoned in any other country can serve  his/her balance period of imprisonment in Sri Lanka. Nevertheless, in order to make the provisions of the Act to be applicable, it is essential for an Agreement to be entered into between Sri Lanka and the respective country.

	Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Human Rights & Law Reforms to enter into an Agreement on transfer of sentenced persons  between the two countries in conformity with the laws of both the countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Drafting of the Sri Lanka National Defence College Act
decision_details:
- Due to the absence of  a National Defence College in Sri Lanka for conducting higher level courses on national defence, officers of the Tri-forces have to be directed to National Defence Colleges which conduct such courses, established in China, India, Bangladesh and Pakistan. However, due to the limited number of opportunities for the courses offered by those countries annually, it has not  been possible to train the officers as expected.  In this context, approval of the Cabinet has already been granted for the establishment of a National Defence College in Sri Lanka.

	Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli, Agriculture, Irrigation and Rural Development  and the State Minister of Defence to  draft a Bill for the establishment of a National  National Defence College, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reviewing the Current Scope of the 'Financial City Project'
decision_details: - The 'Colombo Port City Project' was commenced in the year 2014, in association with the Sri Lanka Ports Authority and the Chinese investor, CHEC Port City Colombo (Pvt) Ltd., as an investment made by the private sector. After 2015 01 08, changing the original scope of the said project, a project relevant to that has been implemented as the 'Financial City Project'. At present, with the assistance of the external consultants and  under the guidance of the Legal Draftsman, a draft Bill has been prepared to establish a special economic zone by the name of 'Colombo Financial City'. Accordingly, within the current political, social and environmental context, the need has arisen to review the revised scope of the said project and the process followed to revise the said project and therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister to appoint a committee comprising of subject specific experts, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Assignment of Subjects and Functions to the State Ministers who are not Members of the Cabinet
decision_details: - The proposal submitted by H.E. the President to assign subjects and functions to the State Ministers who are not Members of the Cabinet, in terms of Article 44(5) of the Constitution, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Multipurpose Development Task Force
decision_details:
- It has been observed by HE the President that there are large numbers of unskilled employment opportunities in Government and the related agencies which are filled without paying any heed to the low income segment of the society and guided by the political patronage. Taking that matter into consideration, the proposal made by HE the President to set up a Multipurpose Development Task Force as a Government Department to provide employment for 100,000 less educated youth from low income families was approved by the Cabinet.

	Further, it was noted by the Cabinet that it has been planned to commence the recruitment at district level in a transparent manner, to commence the operation of the Department by 15th of January 2020 and the ability of providing services of the said Task Force on a cost recovery basis to the Government, government agencies and the private sector.

title: Appointment of the Cabinet Sub Committee on Cost of Living
Accelerated Programme for State Land Management
decision_details:
- The Minister of Lands & Land Development presented to the attention of the Cabinet, information in respect of 11 programmes planned to be implemented from the month of December 2019 up to the month of March 2020 by the institutions coming under the purview of the Ministry of Lands & Land Development.  Accordingly, the Minister informed the Cabinet further that the programmes such as issuance of permits, Grants and Leases, in terms of the Land Development Ordinance and the State Land Ordinance after  holding Land Kachcheries, conducting Mobile Days and Field Day programmes, issuance of Title Certificates under the Title Registration Act, regularizing of Land Data System, Launching of the New Edition of the Road Map and the preparation of Land Manual etc. are anticipated to be implemented.

	The Cabinet also decided to appoint an Officials' Committee to make recommendations to prepare a simple and a convenient method in respect of the lands given under lease basis enabling the lessees to make their  payments without causing much inconvenience to them.

title: The proposed programme for the maintenance of the electric fences constructed and follow-up action in order to resolve the Human Elephant conflict
decision_details: - The Human Elephant conflict which has arisen in the country has become a national issue subject to the focus of all stakeholders. The proposal made by the Minister of Environment and Wildlife Resources, to update the existing electric fences and maintaining them, to provide the human and physical resources necessary for the purpose in order to resolve the problem and to implement the programmes planned to resolve the problem with the assistance inclusive of the District Secretaries and all relevant stakeholders, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a new, school based scientific methodology instead of the present district based methodology for selection of students to the State Universities on the Z Score method
decision_details: - Although it is the primary responsibility of the Government to provide equal opportunities of education to each and every child, it has been found that even at present, there exist various disparities in terms of the educational facilities and the quality of education among the Provinces, Districts and Schools as well. In the circumstances, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to appoint an Experts Committee comprising of competent persons on the subject matter to make recommendations for the introduction of a school based new scientific methodology instead of the present district based Z Score methodology for selection of students to the State Universities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of the number of National Schools to be 1,000 within the  school network and the establishment of new Tri lingual Schools covering every District
decision_details: - The Ministry of Education has planned to implement a programme to increase the number of National Schools to 1,000 by developing 03 schools equipped with all facilities in each Divisional Secretariat Division and upgrading them as National Schools with the objective of providing a free, equitable and qualitative education to every child. The Ministry of Education has also planned to initiate a State of the Art National School in each District with tri lingual educational opportunities and to initiate 20 such schools in the next two year period. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education for the implementation of the proposed programmes, was approved in principle by the Cabinet.

title: Milling the paddy stocks purchased under the Government Paddy Purchase Programme of 2018/2019 Maha Season into rice and issue them to the market through the Lanka Sathosa Network
decision_details:
- Under the Government Paddy Purchase Programme of 2018/2019 Maha Season, action has been taken during the recent past, to convert a part of the paddy stocks purchased, through the private sector small and medium scale paddy millers. However, since, there is an increasing trend in the price of rice these days, the steps taken to provide relief to the consumer by milling the balance of the paddy stocks of about 42,000 MT out of the paddy stocks purchased and presently remaining in the stores of the Paddy Marketing Board and to provide it to the consumer through the Lanka Sathosa Ltd. outlet network were drawn to the attention of the Cabinet by the Minister of Finance, Economy and Policy Development.

	Similarly, taking into consideration the consent given by the major rice mill owners to supply rice within the period of next 2 - 3 months to the market without a scarcity and also to maintain the maximum retail price of rice as Rs.98/- per kg., it was decided by the Cabinet to fix the maximum price of rice as Rs.98/- per kg.  

	Further, it was also decided by the Cabinet to grant approval to take necessary action for the importation of wheat flour until the crop harvest of the Maha season is had, to enable the people specially living in the estate and urban areas to obtain wheat flour and the products associated with it, at low prices, during the festive season.

title: The removal of the existing requirement on obtaining permits for the transportation of sand, soil and clay necessary for the local industries and the construction industry
decision_details: - Several  Members of the Cabinet pointed out  that difficulties have arisen when securing the necessary raw material for the local industries and as well as the construction industry due to the existing requirement on obtaining permits for the transportation of sand, soil and clay and that various malpractices occur when issuing the relevant permits. Taking these matters into consideration, the Cabinet decided to do away with the the present requirement on obtaining permits for the transportation of sand, soil and clay, with immediate effect.

title: National Policy Framework of the Government - Vistas of Prosperity and Splendour for a Reconstructed Country
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Finance, Economy and Policy Development for the Policy Statement 'Vistas of Prosperity and Splendour for a  Reconstructed Country' presented by H.E. the President with ten fold policies aimed at achieving the four fold outcomes namely, a productive citizenry, a contented family, a disciplined and just society and a prosperous nation, to be accepted as the National Policy Framework of the Government and to direct all Ministries, Departments, Government Institutions, Provincial Councils and Local Authorities etc, to perform their duties and functions accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of Secretaries to the State Ministries
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President  for the appointment of  Secretaries to State Ministries of the the newly appointed State Ministers under Article 44(1) of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a 'Closed Education Service'
decision_details: - It has been identified that it is appropriate to establish a Closed education service consisting of teachers, principals, in-service advisors, teacher educators and Education Administrative Service Officers to resolve their professional problems expeditiously, perform their appraisals systematically and transparently, uplift their professionalism and enhance their job satisfaction, enabling them to deliver their services in an efficient and effective manner. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to establish an Experts' Committee comprising of  subject professionals and educational experts to make a study of the above matters and prepare recommendations pertaining to same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Pivithurulanka National Environmental Management Programme
decision_details: - It has been identified that it is imperative to develop a specific programme to enhance public awareness on the responsibility of environmental management and thereby to increase the public participation on the same and also to obtain the active participation of the other  relevant stakeholders including the local government institutions. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment and Wildlife Resources for the expeditious implementation of a programme in the name of the 'Pivithurulanka National Environmental Management Programme' to carry out the programmes and actions for the entire environmental management continuously in the whole country, inclusive of the establishment of centres for sorting out the waste, providing incinerators to selected local authorities, providing the necessary facilities for enhancing the compost yards and setting up of new compost yards and implementation of programmes for making the public aware of environmental conservation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of the National Colleges of Education to the status of the University Faculties for the conversion of the entire teacher cardre in Sri Lanka as Graduates
decision_details: - A programme to convert the entire teacher community of Sri Lanka into graduates, for enhancing the professionalism of the teachers, has been planned   to be implemented  under the theme: 'An Informed Citizen' and 'A Society Endowed with Knowledge' as depicted in the Policy Statement 'Vistas of Prosperity and Splendour' presented by H.E. the President. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to convert the National Colleges of Education to the status of the University Faculties and provide opportunities for the teachers to obtain their degrees  was approved by the Cabinet in principle and the Cabinet also granted approval to appoint an Experts' Committee representing the fields of Education and Higher Education, to fulfill the requisite Academic and Legal functions with regard to the implementation of this programme.

title: The Regional Rapid Action Learning Workshop on Sanitation and Hygiene
decision_details: - The Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development, Water Supply and Housing Facilities brought to the notice of the Cabinet that  arrangements have been made to conduct the Regional Rapid Action Learning Workshop on Sanitation and Hygiene organized by the Regional Centre for Sanitation for the South Asian Conference on Sanitation (SACOSAN), from 09th to 11th of December 2019 in Sri Lanka, with a view to sharing of learning from practical actions from each other, on the progress achieved relating to sanitation by the countries of the South Asian Region, sharing of lessons learnt,  Identifying innovations and good practices, with the participation of representatives inclusive of the member countries, Sri Lankan professionals in the relevant field, the relevant Officials of the Government Sector of Sri Lanka and the representatives of the Local and International Non‑governmental Organizations.

title: Contract for the construction of the New National School, Maguruoyawatta - Phase II
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Education to award the contract for  the construction of  Phase II of Vishwodha New National School in a plot of land in extent of 5 acres in the area of Maguruoyawatta, Kurunegala, with an investment of Rs.800 million with a view to ensuring a  qualitative education to the students in Kurunegala and the suburb areas under the project of 'Nearest School is the Best School' implemented to provide all the students with equity and qualitative education, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for introducing Home Dialysis System using the Automated Peritoneal Dialysis for Chronic Kidney Disease Patients
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to obtain necessary services to implement the project for  introducing Home Dialysis System using Automated Peritoneal Dialysis on priority basis, for the Chronic Kidney Disease Patients, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for supplying of Aviation Fuel for Sri Lankan Airlines
decision_details: - The Sri Lankan Airlines is presently operating its services to 37 destinations of 19 countries.  In order to maintain its services, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to award the contract for the supply of aviation fuel for SriLankan Airlines at 12 airport locations worldwide, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Emergency Procurement of Liquefied Petroleum Gas
decision_details: - A Gas shortage has been experienced in the domestic market due to the consequences of the attack that took place in September 2019 at oil processing facilities of Saudi Arabia and the surging demand for Liquefied Petroleum Gas following their price reduction in Sri Lanka.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to purchase 12,000 metric tons of Liquefied Petroleum Gas as an emergency procurement, so as to cover the market requirement for the months of November and December 2019, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementing the recommendations of the Committee appointed to provide relief to media persons who were subject to various harassments and persecutions during the period from 2005 to 2015
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President, at the request of the Non Cabinet Minister of Mass Media for payment of compensation to 78 media persons, paying heed to the recommendations made by a Committee appointed to provide relief to media persons who were subject to various harassments and  persecutions during the period from 2005 to 2015, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reimbursement of the Training Expenses of the Grama Niladhari Officers who have fulfilled the requirement of computer literacy
decision_details: - Under the E-Grama Niladhari database to be introduced covering the Grama Niladhari Offices Island wide, the Grama Niladhari Officers will be entrusted with the responsibility of providing various services associated with computers  to the service recipients who visit the offices of the Grama Niladharies. Further, according to the Scheme of Recruitment of the Grama Niladhari service the Grama Niladhari Officers should also complete their training requirements relating to computer literacy. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Internal & Home Affairs and Provincial Councils & Local Government, to grant an allowance of Rs.7,000/- as a reimbursement of the training expenses incurred  by the Grade III Grama Niladhari Officers who have fulfilled the requirement of computer literacy within 03 years from the date of their appointments, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provide employment opportunity under the Graduate Employment Scheme for Social Re-Integrated and Rehabilitated Persons
decision_details: - After the end of the conflict situation which prevailed in the Northern and the Eastern Provinces, 65 persons who had completed the degree out of the youths both male and female and had been socially re-integrated and rehabilitated have been granted appointments previously, under the graduate employment scheme. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of National Policies, Economic Affairs, Resettlement & Rehabilitation, Northern Province Development and Youth Affairs, to grant appointments to another 20 socially re-integrated persons who have undergone the rehabilitation process under the Bureau of Commissioner General of Rehabilitation and who have completed their degree,  under the said scheme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Consortium Architectural Consultancy Service of the proposed Disaster Risk Reduction Observation, Forecasting and Communication Hubs for the Department of Meteorology and the Department of Irrigation' under the Climate Resilience Improvement Project (CRIP)
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development, to award the contracts of Consortium Architectural Consultancy Service of the proposed Disaster Risk Reduction Observation, Forecasting and Communication Hubs for the Department of Meteorology and the Department of Irrigation under the Climate Resilience Improvement Project, to M/s Design Group International (Pvt.) Ltd. for a sum of US$ 63.43 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Award of the tender on Long Term Supply of Coal to 900MW Lakvijaya Power Plant
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Power, Energy and Business Development, to award the contract for the supply of 50% of the quantity of 2.25MT of coal required for the Norochchole Lakvijaya Coal Power Plant for the period from November, 2019 up to April, 2021to generate electricity, to M/s Swiss Singapore Overseas Enterprises Pte. Ltd. at the rate of US$ 60.71 per MT, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchasing of Coal for the Coal Power Plant in Puttalam under the Spot tender
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Power, Energy and Business Development, to award the contract for the purchase of 240,000 MT at the rate of US$ 67.39 per MT, of coal required for the Coal Power Plant in Puttalam under the Spot tender, to M/s Adani Global Pte. Ltd. of Singapore, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the maintenance of the Lakvijaya Power Plant in Puttalam
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Power, Energy and Business Development, to award the contract for obtaining expertise manpower services for Level 'B' maintenance Unit 1 at  Lakvijaya Power Plant in Puttalam to M/s China Machinery Engineering Corporation for a sum of US$ 3.84 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Contract for the Construction of Primary Substations, Distribution Substations and Cables in Dehiwala - Mt.Lavinia and Battaramulla under the National Transmission and Distribution Network Development and Efficiency Improvement Project
