decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Power, Energy and Business Development, to award the contract for the Construction of Primary Substations, Distribution Substations and Cables in Dehiwala - Mt.Lavinia and Battaramulla under Package 4 Lot A of the National Transmission and Distribution Network Development and Efficiency Improvement Project to the joint venture of M/s Siemens Limited India in consortium with M/s DIMO Private Limited of Sri Lanka for a sum equivalent to Rs.4,594.43 million, as recommended  by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Contract for the supply and distribution of 1300km Aerial Bundled Conductors
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Power, Energy and Business Development, to award the contract for the the supply and distribution of 1300km Aerial Bundled Conductors for the distribution divisions of the Ceylon Electricity Board to M/s ACL Cables PLC for a sum of Rs.789.45 million as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of small scale Solar Power Plants under the 'Soorya Bala Sangramaya Phase II'
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Power, Energy and Business Development, to award the contract for Moneragala Grid Substation under the construction of solar power plants, on build, own and operate basis of small scale solar power plants under the 'Soorya Bala Sangramaya, Phase II' programme to M/s Gold Corporation Lanka (Pvt.) Ltd., subject to the rate of purchase price of LKR 14.24 per unit of 1KW, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of the Base Hospitals in Elpitiya and Balapitiya
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine, to carry out the future activities necessary to construct a 09 storey building for the Elpitiya Base Hospital to accommodate an Intensive Care Unit and Wards, Theaters and Accident and Emergency Treatment Unit, Radiology Department and Labs with adequate infrastructure facilities, at an investment of Rs.6.186 million and to construct a 10 storey building for the Balapitiya Base Hospital to accommodate an Outdoor Patients Department and an Accident and Emergency Treatment Unit, all Wards, Theaters, Labs and Supportive Services at an investment of Rs.6,228 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Consultant Services for the Development of Infrastructure Facilities under the Health System Enhancement Project
decision_details: - It has been planned to develop the infrastructure facilities in the Health Services Centres of the North Central, Central, Sabaragamuwa and Uva Provinces and the District Hospitals under the  Health System Enhancement Project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine, to award the contract for Design and Supervision Consultancy of the Infrastructure development to M/s Resources Development Consultants (Pvt.) Ltd. of Sri Lanka, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultants Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the Supply of 1,300,000 Nos. films of Film Laser Blue Base Dry CR, DR, CT and MRI
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to award the contract for the procurement of 1,300,000 films of Film Laser Blue Base Dry CR, DR, CT and MRI compatible with Fuji laser printer size of 35cm x 43cm for a sum of US$ 1.89 million to M/s Fujifilm Corporation of Japan, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the  supply of 60,000 Vials of Human Immunoglobulin for Intravenous use
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to award the contract for the procurement of 60,000 Vials of Human Immunoglobulin for Intravenous used for the treatment of patients with immune deficiencies, for a sum of US$ 6.76 million from M/s Reliance Life Science of India, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the supply of 55,000 vials of Concentrated Monoclonal Purified and Detergent Treated Dried Factor VIII Fraction 200 IU - 350 IU
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to award the contract for the procurement of 55,000 vials of Concentrated Monoclonal Purified and Detergent Treated Dried Factor VIII Fraction           200 IU 350 IU used for the treatment of Haemophilia patients, for a sum of US$ 3.35 million from M/s Baxalta GmbH of Switzerland, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the supply of 300,000 Sterile Hollow Fibre Dialyzers Polysulphone / Polynephrone used for the patients affected with kidney ailments
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to procure 300,000 Sterile Hollow Fibre Dialyzers Polysulphone / Polynephrone used as the dialysis membrane for blood purification of patients affected with kidney ailments, for a sum of US$ 1.35 million from M/s Nipro Asia Pte. Ltd. of Singapore, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Presenting the Gazette Notification under the Sri Lanka Export Development Act, No.40 of 1979 in Parliament for approval
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade to present the Gazette Notification issued in regard to the removal of the CESS levy on importation of goods in accordance with the budget proposals of 2019 and the policy decisions taken by the Government, in Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Declaring the Districts Island wide vulnerable to landslides and extending landslide risk assessment process of the landslide-prone areas
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Disaster Management and Livestock Development, to declare the landslide-prone areas  in the Moneragala, Kurunegala, Gampaha and Colombo Districts in addition to the 10 Districts already declared as landslide-prone areas and to introduce the landslide risk assessment methodology of the National Building Research Organization, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief for the fishing community
decision_details: - As a result of a fire that broke out in June this year in close proximity to  the Kalametiya fishery harbour, the fishing boats and netting gear belonging to the fishermen engaged in the fishing industry have been destroyed. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development, to secure the necessary funds required for the supply of boats, engines and the fishing gear to the affected fishermen in order to re-uplift their livelihood, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into Agreements for collaboration in research in regard to the patients of Chronic Kidney Disease / Chronic Kidney Disease of unknown etiology
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine, to enter into Data Sharing Agreements to initiate integrated research in regard to Chronic Kidney Disease / Chronic Kidney Disease of unknown etiology which has affected the people of the North Central Province, with the Australian Nuclear Science Technology Organization (ANSTO) and to conduct research on early diagnosis of Chronic Kidney Disease of unknown etiology with the University of Stanford of USA, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Inland Revenue (Amendment) Bill
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Finance, to publish the Bill drafted to implement the revenue proposals and reliefs proposed in the Budget of 2019 and to present the said Bill in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Banking Act, No.30 of 1988
decision_details: - The joint proposal made by the Prime Minister and the Minister of Finance to amend Direction No.01 of 2007 issued under the Banking Act, No.30 of 1988 in order to promote local shareholding in the field of banking and as well as to strengthen the capital adequacy requirement of the licensed Commercial Banks in Sri Lanka as proposed in the Budget Speech of 2019 and adopted, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Economic Service Charge (Amendment) Bill
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Finance to publish the draft Bill to amend the Economic Service Charge Act, No.13 of 2006 to give effect to the tax proposals made in the National Budget 2019 in the Government Gazette and subsequently, to present the said draft Bill in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Food Security and Vulnerability Assessment - 2019
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of National Policies, Economic Affairs, Resettlement & Rehabilitation, Northern Province Development and Youth Affairs, to carry out the National Food Security and Vulnerability Assessment in collaboration with all the stakeholders, based on the pilot feasibility study due to be initiated covering the District of Kurunegala to ensure the feasibility on the assessment of the National Comprehensive Food Security and Vulnerability Assessment of Sri Lanka and to establish a National Food Security Cluster comprising of Senior Officers of all the relevant Ministries/line Ministries, to synergize the necessary strategies and programmes with a view to ensuring the National Comprehensive Food Security, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Scientific and Technical Cooperation between the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau and the  Geoscience Institute of Australia
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Australia for the exchange of knowledge and technology mutually beneficial to both parties, pertaining to the fields of Geoscience and minerals, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Parliament (Powers and Privileges) Act, No.21 of 1953
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister to publish the draft (Amendment) Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman amending the Parliament (Powers and Privileges) Act, No.21 of 1953, in the Government Gazette and subsequently, to present it in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining continued monetary donations towards the 'Protection of Children - National Trust Fund
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President to launch a Lottery Ticket on 2019 11 11 operated by the National Lotteries Board of which the draw would be held once a week and credit 10% of the proceeds of the sale of the tickets to the fund in order to strengthen the  'Protection of Children - National Trust Fund', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of White Nadu and Samba Rice from the Local Market to Lanka Sathosa Limited
decision_details: - he proposal made by the Minister of Industry & Commerce, Resettlement of Protracted Displaced Persons, Co‑operative Development and Vocational Training & Skills Development to mill, at least 20,000Mt of paddy (10,000Mt of Nadu and 10,000Mt of Samba) available with the Paddy Marketing Board, through the registered millers of Lanka Sathosa Limited or through the Sri Lanka Co-operative Marketing Federation Limited (MARKFED) and to  supply to the market through the Lanka Sathosa Limited, taking into account of the necessity of having sufficient quantities of rice in the open market to control the increasing trend in the price of rice, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Plantation Sector
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet had been granted previously to allocate a sum of Rs 600 million to the Sri lanka Tea Board through the Ministry of Plantation Industries and to authorize the Sri lanka Tea Board to arrive at a decision relating to the preparation of a suitable mechanism utilizing such funds with a view to  enhancing the productivity of plantation sector expeditiously. As such, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Finance and the Minister of Plantation Industries to implement a productivity incentive scheme utilizing the said funds for the Regional Plantation Companies through the Ministry of Plantation Industries with the objective of improving the efficiency of the estate workers by uplifting their social well-being and the living standards, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Term Contract for the import of 1,960,000 Barrels of Gas Oil (0.05% Maximum Sulpher (MS)  from 2019-10-01 to 2020-06-30
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development, to award the term contract for the import of 1,960,000 Barrels of Gas Oil (0.05% Maximum Sulpher (MS))  for a period of Nine (09) months from 2019-10-01 to 2020-06-30, to M/s Emirates National Oil Company Pte. Ltd., Singapore, as recommended by the Procurement Appeal Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Term Contract for the import of Murban Crude Oil  from 2020-01-01 to 2020-08-31
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development, to award the term contract for the procurement of 8,400,000 barrels of Murban Crude Oil for a period of eight (08) months from  2020-01-01 to 2020-08-31, to M/s B.B. Energy (Asia) Pte. Ltd., Singapore, as recommended by the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proceeds of Crime Act
decision_details: - Due to the severe increase in the incidents  of organized crime, transnational crime and serious economic and financial crime in recent times, it is very important to focus attention on the minimization or eradication of such crimes and the recovery of the proceeds of a crime. Therefore, the Government Appointed Special Presidential Task Force has developed a Policy and Legislative Frame work pertaining to the proposed Proceeds of Crime Act, and that framework sets a  policy statement for the proposed Act. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation to give effect to the concepts and contents  in the policy and the legislative framework of the proposed Proceeds of Crime Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Seeking approval to include recipients of the Certificates of Death (issued to missing persons prior to the introduction of the Certificates of Absence) for interim relief
decision_details: - The Cabinet has made a decision previously, to cancel the Certificates of Death issued to the missing persons and issue 'Certificates of Absence' for them, taking into consideration the interim reports of the Office on the Missing Persons and to make a monthly interim relief payment of Rs.6000/- to the families of such persons. However, since the period of validity of the 'Certificate of Absence' so issued after canceling the Certificate of Death is only for 2 years, the members of the families of such missing persons who have obtained certificates of death have to face various administrative, legal and socio‑economic challenges. As such, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Finance and the Minister of National Integration, Official Languages, Social Progress and Hindu Religious Affairs, to grant the families of missing persons  a monthly interim relief payment of Rs.6,000/- which is given in accordance with 'Certificate of Absence',  if in case a statement is included in a Certificate of Death issued under the Registration of Deaths (Temporary Provisions) Act, No.2 of 1995 to the effect that the reason for the death is  'disappearance' or treated as dead because the relatives have said that the cause of death is due to     'abduction' by unknown persons or in case the relevant Certificate of Death is issued under Section 2 of the Registration of Deaths (Temporary Provisions) Act, No.19 of 2010, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Selection of an Agency for Public Relation Services in Russia and Ukraine for Global Promotional Campaign for Ceylon Tea
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Plantation Industries, to select M/s SPN Communications to implement a Public Relations Campaign for a one year period in Russia and Ukraine under the Global Promotional Campaign for Ceylon Tea, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Global Adult Tobacco Survey - 2019/2020
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President on the request of the Non-Cabinet Minister of Economic Reforms and Public Distribution, seeking approval for the Department of Census and Statistics to conduct a Global Adult Tobacco Survey - 2019/2020 with an estimated cost of US$ 217,000 being a grant provided by the World Health Organization in collaboration with the Centre for Disease Control at the  National Institute of Health in the United States of America, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Service Providers for Developing and Operating the Railway coaches for tourism purposes on lease basis
decision_details: - 	The approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously, to award contracts for developing and operating the Railway coaches for tourism purposes on lease basis. Accordingly, although the luxury railway compartment service is in operation in the Kandy line at present, the said service is not available in the Badulla, Northern, Eastern and Southern lines. As such, taking into consideration the passenger requirements and present day demand, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport & Civil Aviation, to call for bids to select contractors on competitive basis to operate luxury compartments for a 5 year period in the said lines where the luxury compartments services are not being  operated, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Asian Development Bank (ADB) assisted Sustainable Urban Development Project - Package 03 - Awarding of the contract for appointment of consultants for Planning, Detailed Design and Procurement of Environment Management Services for Trincomalee, Dambulla, Kurunegala and Ratnapura
decision_details: - 	The proposal made by the Minister of Megapolis & Western Development, to award the Consultancy Contract for Planning, Detailed Design and Procurement of Environment Management Services for Kurunegala, Ratnapura, Dambulla and Trincomalee, under Package 03 of the Sustainable Urban Development Project implemented under the assistance of the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to WAPCOS Limited, India, Sub Consultant with Summit Engineering Service and Consultants (Pvt.) Ltd. Sri Lanka and the Project Management Associate International (Pvt.) Ltd. Sri Lanka, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultancy Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Request to obtain the Consultancy Services for the Development Projects of the Department of National Zoological Gardens
decision_details: - The consultancy services have been obtained from the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau, the State Engineering Corporation, the State Development and Construction Corporation, the Department of Buildings and the Urban Development Authority for the preparation of the Master Plans of the Dehiwala Zoo, Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage, Pinnawala Zoo, Ridiyagama Safari Park and the Gonapala Farm, coming under the purview of the Department of National Zoological Gardens. As it has been anticipated to complete all the said construction work by the end of the year 2022, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism Development, Wildlife and Christian Religious Affairs, to obtain the consultancy services for the said construction work from the same institutions, based on the nature, complexity of the relevant construction and the experiences gained by the said institutions on the subject, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Prescription Ordinance
decision_details: - The approval of the cabinet has been granted previously to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Draft Bill to amend the Prescription Ordinance.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms, to publish the Draft (Amendment) Bill submitted by the Legal Draftsman in the Government Gazette and subsequently, to present the said draft Bill in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Child Protection Policy
decision_details: - It has been decided by the Cabinet previously, that an amended National Child Protection Policy should be formulated in consultation with all relevant stakeholders and present same to the Cabinet. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Women & Child Affairs and Dry Zone Development for  the implementation of the National Child Protection Policy prepared by the National Child Protection Authority in consultation with all stakeholders in order to create a safe and violence free environment for the children in the future, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation of Urea (Additional Fertilizer Requirements) under the Subsidized Fertilizer Programme for Crop Cultivation other than Paddy
decision_details: - It has been identified previously, that the Urea Fertilizer requirement under the Government Subsidized Fertilizer Programme for the year 2019 as 238,200 MT for the paddy cultivation and 170,000 MT for other crop cultivation. But since, it has been observed that there is a possibility of further increasing of the extent of cultivation in Maha season of 2019  comparatively to the Maha season of 2018, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development, to import an additional amount of 15,000 MT of Urea required for the crops other than  paddy for the coming few months, to prevent a shortage of fertilizer in the country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transfer of the land and buildings where the Kaltota Police Station is located, to the Sri Lanka Police
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development, to transfer a plot of land situated in the Grama Niladhari Division of Kaltota in the Balangoda Divisional Secretariat Division and the buildings therein, used by the Sri Lanka Police for over a period of 30 years to the Sri Lanka Police, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Steering Committee for the development of the Coconut Industry in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Plantation Industries, to establish a Steering Committee comprising of the representatives of the relevant institutions under the Chairmanship of the Secretary, Ministry of Plantation Industries, with the objective of developing the coconut cultivation successfully, through a proper comprehension of the issues prevailing in the coconut industry and management, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Leasing State Lands to the Sri Lanka Cashew Corporation on long term lease basis
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Plantation Industries to transfer the State lands of Poonarin Estate in extent of 479 Acres in Kilinochchi District; Kondachchi Estate in extent of 6,498 Acres and Vellamkulam Estate  in extent of 500 Acres in Mannar District; Mankerni  Estate in extent of 1,075 Acres in Batticaloa District;  Thiriyaya Estate in extent of 681 Acres in Trincomalee District and the land in extent of 441 Acres where Eluwankulama Martin Ipil Ipil Farm is located  in Puttalam District, on long term lease basis to the Sri Lanka Cashew Corporation to cultivate cashew, considering the high potentiality  prevailing in the country for the cashew cultivation,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transfer of 02A- 03R- 34.51P of land at Muthurajawela to the Ceylon Petroleum Storage Terminals Ltd.
decision_details: - At present, the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation is constructing a Tank Farm on a plot of land in extent of 100 Acres, owned by the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation located at Muthurajawela Sand Filled Area. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development to transfer the land in extent of  02A- 03R- 34.51P, by way of sale to Ceylon Petroleum Storage Terminals Ltd.,  for the purpose of parking a large number of Bowsers  which come daily to the said premises and other associated development activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Approval for the Fleming Fund Country Grant for Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health,Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of Sri Lanka  and  the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland to obtain a grant from the Fleming Fund, which is a grant programme   to assist countries in Asia and Africa to address priorities in  Antimicrobial Resistance with a view to strengthening Multisectoral Antimicrobial Resistance and Antimicrobial usage/consumption surveillance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Postgraduate Institute of Management of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura and the Faculty of Business Administration of the University of Kasetsart in Thailand
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of City Planning, Water Supply and Higher Education, to sign a  Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Postgraduate Institute of Management of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura and the Faculty of Business Administration of the University of Kasetsart in Thailand, with the objective of developing the educational cooperation within  the Higher Education Sector,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Regulatory Measures for Water Closets, Water Draw off Taps and Stop Valves Metal and PVC
decision_details: - The National Water Supply and Drainage Board has identified that an excessive quantity of water is leaked and wasted due to the use of sub‑standard  water fittings and as such, there are a several categories of water fittings that should be regulated for the prevention of sub‑standard water fittings being entered into the local market. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of City Planning, Water Supply and Higher Education, to implement the regulatory measures identified pertaining to categories of water fittings such as Water Closets, Water Draw‑off Taps and Stop Valves Metal and PVC so as to derive benefits for the consumers and the producers of local water fittings and the environment as well,  in consultation with the main Government institutions and based on the views of the public and the relevant stakeholders, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion of the loan scheme facilities provided under the 'Enterprise Sri Lanka' Programme
decision_details: - The Enterprise Sri Lanka Programme is being implemented rapidly Island wide  as a Government premier programme integrated with the other Government development programmes and more than a sum of Rs.70,000 million has been distributed among 40,240 beneficiaries  as at 31st of August 2019. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, out of the 22 financial and non‑financial schemes that are being processed under this programme, to advance 'My Future' Loan Scheme, beyond the Advanced Level students,  extending the project period of implementation of the 'Madya Aruna' Loan Scheme from 2019‑07‑02 up to 2020‑12‑31 and getting the National Savings Bank included under the guarantee scheme for the loans granted through 'Ran Aswanna', 'Govi Navoda', 'Jaya Isuru', 'Diri Saviya', 'Green Loan' and 'Special Working Capital Loan Scheme' and revise the said loan scheme in order to achieve the anticipated objectives and to minimize the technnical and practical issues encountered while implementing the loan schemes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Declaration of Moragahakanda - Kaluganga, Mahaweli System 'F' as a Toxic Free Organic Agricultural Produce Sustainable Development Zone
decision_details: - A new Mahaweli system known as System 'F' has been established having settled the affected people due to the Moragahakanda - Kaluganga Development Project in the Laggala Pallegama area and it has also become a village set up under the Blue Green concept. The water needs of these settlers in the area, for drinking purposes and agriculture are provided with the water flowing from the Nuckles catchment mountain range which is devoid of any human settlement and nourishes Kaluganga reservoir with fresh water and has also been identified as a suitable are a for development of agriculture, using only organic manure and clean water. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to declare' Moragahakanda Kaluganga Left and Right bank settlement areas known as System 'F as a Sustainable Development Zone exclusively for organic toxic free Agriculture Production and the upper catchment areas of  Kaluganga and Ambanganga as Contamination Free Watershed Zones and an area of using organic fertilizer for agriculture, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Policy on Sustainable Consumption and Production
decision_details: - The objective of sustainable consumption and production is to promote economic development and social welfare while protecting the environment by managing natural resources sustainably and increasing the quantity of production by reducing resource use. Having observed the adverse impacts of unsustainable development, the Government of Sri Lanka has endorsed a number of conventions in regard to sustainable consumption and production, by joining hands with the International Community. Accordingly, the National Policy on Sustainable Consumption and Production prepared for the achievement of the objectives of sustainable consumption and production and presented by the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Convention on the Chemical Weapons Convention and the Chemical Safety and Security Management for Member States of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) in the Asian Region
decision_details: - The International Convention on the prohibition of production, development,  stockpiling, and use of chemical weapons and on their destruction is primarily  an arms control treaty which is an indirect way of achieving contribution to minimize the chemical disasters and acts of chemical terrorism. Sri Lanka has signed the said convention in 1993. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Defence to hold a Convention on the Chemical Weapons Convention and Chemical Safety and Security Management for Member States of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons in the Asian Region in Colombo on the 3rd, 4th and 5th of December, 2019 with the participation of 15 representatives from the Asian Member States and 25 local representatives by the National Authority for Implementation of the Chemical Weapons Convention operated under the Ministry of Defence in collaboration with the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the National Trust Fund the 'Protection of Children'
decision_details: - In accordance with a decision made by the Cabinet, the National Trust Fund, the 'Protection of Children' has been created on the 01st of October, 2019 with a view to providing the proper guidance, protection and the necessary resources  to the children who have become destitute due to various reasons. A contribution of Rs.17 million has been made by the philanthropists in this regard, on this day which fell on the World Children's Day. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President to take action to enhance this fund by extending a request to all members of the Cabinet of Ministers, all Members of Parliament and the Parliamentary staff, all officers in the Public Service and Public Corporations to make a voluntary contribution of their one day's salary as a donation to the fund, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making the existing Sri Lanka Teachers' Service and Sri Lanka Principals' Service as Closed Services and formulating a suitable salary structure
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to convert the Teachers' Service into a Closed Service and to take necessary measures to formulate an appropriate salary structure for the said service as the initial step of granting a reasonable salary scale for the Teachers' and the Principals' Services. However, since a considerable period of time will be taken to convert the Teachers' and the Principals' Services into Closed Services and to formulate an appropriate salary structure for the services, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to obtain the recommendations of the National Salaries and Cadres Commission on implementing the interim salary proposals given in the Report including the ''Observations and proposals of the Ministry of Education on eliminating salary anomalies in Teachers' and the Principals' Services'' which has been referred to the Special Commission for Reviewing salaries of the Public Service, as an interim proposal,was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Public Debt Management Bureau
decision_details: - A large number of issues has arisen pertaining to the debt management in Sri Lanka and it has been found necessary to have a single institution for this purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to obtain the approval, in principle, to establish an Institution for debt management named as the Public Debt Management Bureau under the purview of the Ministry of Finance, to establish a five member Committee on Public Debt Management under the chairmanship of the Secretary to the Treasury with a view to drafting a Public Debt Management Bill and developing the institutional framework to establish the proposed Bureau and to seek the required provisions for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Gazette Notifications published for approval in Parliament
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Finance, to present the following 07 Extraordinary Gazette Notifications i.e. Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2134/44 dated 01st August 2019, Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2135/54 dated 08th August 2019, Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2135/67 dated 10th August 2019, Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2139/74 dated 07th September 2019, Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2140/20 dated 10th September 2019, Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2143/3 dated 30th September 2019 and Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2143/21 dated 02nd October 2019 issued under the Special Commodity Levy Act, No.48 of 2007, with the objective of providing relief for the consumers and local farmers and the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2140/19 dated 10th September 2019 and the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2142/87 dated 27th September 2019 which contain the revisions of Customs Import Duty under the Revenue Protection Act, No.19 of 1962, for approval of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Minimizing youth unemployment by giving publicity through 'Smart Sri Lanka' on details of employment and training opportunities in the public sector
decision_details: - The main objectives of the institute of 'Smart Sri Lanka' are to coordinate and monitor career guidance activities at national level, impart training to relevant officers regularly, create and develop the software posting details of job courses, professional and business information by adopting new state of the art technology. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E the President, to publish the details of the vacancies available in all Government Ministries and the institutions under their purview,in the software called 'Smart Sri Lanka' , including those published in the Government Gazette, recruitment notices, information pertaining to special loan schemes and technical assistance granted by all Government Ministries and institutions coming under their purview, state banks and financial institutions for entrepreneurs, business enterprises as well, as for self employment purposes and information pertaining to local and foreign entrepreneurship opportunities and vocational and training opportunities provided by the Government Ministries and institutions under their purview and to authorize the Institute of 'Smart Sri Lanka' to liaise with the career guidance units with regard to the registration of graduates who pass out through the Government Universities and trainees who pass out from professional and vocational training institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the Supply of 3,250 vials of Activated Prothrombine Complex Concentrate Injection 500IU
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to award the procurement for the supply of 3,250 vials of Activated Prothrombine Complex Concentrate Injection 500IU used as the treatment to prevent bleeding in hemophilia patients to M/s Baxalta GmbH of Switzerland as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of the Project for 'The rectification of unstable slopes in the premises of Teaching Hospital, Kandy' through the Austrian Soft Loan Scheme
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to award the contract of the project for the rectification of unstable slopes in the premises of the Teaching Hospital, Kandy, to M/s Porr GmbH, through the Austrian Soft Loan Scheme, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conversion of the Sri Lanka Railways Service into a Closed Department and introduction of a specific and unique salary structure
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to convert the Railways Service into a Closed Service and to take the necessary measures in the future to formulate a suitable salary structure. Accordingly, approval was granted by the Cabinet to appoint a Committee under the Chairmanship of a senior official in the Ministry of Public Administration, Disaster Management and Livestock Development, to study and make recommendations pertaining to the practical problems which may arise when implementing the proposals made by the Acting Minister of Transport & Civil Aviation in this regard and the measures to be taken to minimize same.

title: Upgrading of the Teaching Hospital - Kandy to a National Level Hospital
decision_details: - Considering the benefits gained by the patients by upgrading the Teaching Hospital Kandy to a national level hospital, the proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to rename the said hospital as 'National Hospital - Kandy' and to appoint a Medical Officer in the Deputy Director General Grade as the Head of the Institution, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining a Loan of United States Dollars (USD) 25 million from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) of the World Bank for the Implementation of the Public Sector Efficiency Strengthening Project (PSEP)
decision_details: - With a view to improving the transparency and the efficiency of core‑Government and the public financial management functions, through the introduction of the e‑Government Procurement system, Public Financial Management system and the Excise Revenue Management system as priority information systems, the Sri Lanka Government, the World Bank and the European Union have planned to implement a collectively designed Public Sector Efficiency Strengthening Project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, to authorize the Ministry of Finance to enter into a Financing Agreement with the International Bank of Reconstruction and Development of the World Bank in consultation with the Monetary Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, as well, on the monetary implications of the loan facility, to borrow a loan amounting to US$ 25 million, which has several favourable financing terms, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Tax Appeals Commission Act
decision_details: - It has been identified that it is appropriate to increase the number of panels to hear the appeals, as at present, there are 495 cases to the value of Rs.63 billion pending before the Tax Appeals Commission which has been established under the Tax Appeals Commission Act, No.23 of 2011. However, due to the reasons such as, the inability of increasing the number of panels without increasing the number of Members of the Commission and the difficulty in obtaining the services of the retired Judges of the Supreme Court or Court of Appeal, have been found as obstacles in this regard. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to amend the Tax Appeals Commission Act, incorporating provision to increase the number of Members to be appointed to the Tax Appeals Commission from (9) to (12), to increase the Panels to be appointed from (03) to (04) and to make provision for four Members out of the twelve to be appointed from the retired Judges of the Supreme Court, the Court of Appeal or the High Court of Sri Lanka or to appoint the retired senior officers of the Attorney General's Department who have held the position of the Deputy Solicitor General or above and also to amend the Inland Revenue Act, No.24 of 2017 incorporating provision to make or hear appeals against assessments issued under the said Act, since legal provisions are not provided therein in this regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rationalization of Para-Tariffs
decision_details: - The imposition of taxes inclusive of the Special Commodity Levy (SCL) the Ports and Airports Development Levy (PAL) and the Commodity Exports Support Scheme Levy (CESS Levy) which comes under para‑tariffs imposed in order to increase the Government annual revenue, to protect the local products from the competitiveness of importation, results in the increase in cost of living and reduce economic competitiveness causing a reduction in their productivity and efficiency. Such taxes are considered a disadvantage to international trade and really a draw back to divert towards the sectors which have a better economic viability. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to implement a five year strategic plan (2020‑2024), in phases, while also ensuring that the products and industries that really need protection are safe guarded, was approved by the Cabinet. The protective measures such as anti‑dumping and countervailing duties imposed in order to prevent the in flow of goods at prices less than their costs of production will safeguard the domestic industries.

title: Policy Framework for appointing of Private Customs Bonded Warehouses under section 69 of the Customs Ordinance (Chapter 235)
decision_details: - A policy framework for appointing of Public Customs Bonded Warehouses has been in operation since the year 2016. Furthermore, in terms of the budget proposals 2016 the requirement of the minimum floor area imposed for any new public or private warehouse as well as the existing ones is 50,000 sq.ft. However, the existing bondsmen and as well as the entrepreneurs who expect to establish Private Customs Bonded Warehouses have expressed their unwillingness in that regard pointing out that the floor area requirement of the bonded warehouses should be dependent on the nature of the business. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to empower the policy framework laid down under section 69 of the Customs Ordinance (Chapter 235) for establishing private bonded warehouses enabling the relevant limit of sq.ft. of the floor area to be valid further for the Public Customs Bonded Warehouses only and enabling the Director General of Customs to determine the number of sq.ft. area to be imposed in a Private Customs Bonded Warehouse, in accordance with the nature of the business and enabling the local authorities to construct warehouses to suit their requirements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Report of the Auditor General on the President's Fund - 2017
decision_details: - The President's Fund for the financial year ended 31st December 2017 has been audited by the Auditor General in accordance with section 9(2) of the President's Fund Act No.07 of 1978 read with the provisions laid down in Article 154(3) of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to present the Auditor General's Report pertaining to same, in Parliament in accordance with section 10 of the President's Fund Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Stamp Duty (Special Provisions) Act, No.12 of 2006 and the Provincial Councils (Transfer of Stamp Duty) Act, No.13 of 2011
decision_details: - In terms of section 7 of the Stamp Duty (Special Provisions) Act, No.12 of 2006 as amended by the Stamp Duty (Special Provisions) Act, No.10 of 2008, the stamp duty collected by persons authorized to compound such duty, is remitted to the Commissioner General of Inland Revenue and there are instances where requests are made to the Commissioner General of Inland Revenue for refund, from the persons who have made such stamp duty payment in excess or erroneously of the required amount. Although the Commissioner General of Inland Revenue is satisfied that such claims are genuine and legitimate, no refunds could be made since there is no legal provision available in the Stamp Duty (Special Provisions) Act, No.12 of 2006 or the Provincial Councils (Transfer of Stamp Duty) Act, No.13 of 2011 therein, for such refunds. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft the Stamp Duty (Special Provisions) Act, No.12 of 2006 and the Provincial Councils (Transfer of Stamp Duty) Act, No.13 of 2011 incorporating provisions to enable such refunds to be made, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Regulation made under section 7 of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017
decision_details: - The Regulation No.1 of 2017 dated 17th November 2017 has been made under section 7 of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017 with the approval of the Cabinet to provide authority to specify the classes of capital transactions in foreign exchange for permitted investments, their limits and other connected conditions. According to the said Regulation, although it is required for the exporters to bring in the proceeds on merchandise exports to Sri Lanka within 120 days from the date of exportation, enabling the foreign buyers to be attracted on the request of the exporters and considering the concurrence of the Monetary Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to amend the Regulation No.1 of 2017 issued in accordance with section 7 of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017, to extend the 120 day time frame up to 180 days and to present same in Parliament for approval under section 29 of the said Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Betting and Gaming Levy (Amendment) Bill
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Finance to publish the draft (Amendment) Bill for the amendment of the Betting and Gaming Levy Act, No.40 of 1988 prepared by the Legal Draftsman in the Government Gazette for increasing the Annual Levy from Rs.200 million to Rs.400 million, for carrying on the business of gaming other than playing Rudjino, for fixing an Annual Levy of Rs.1 million for carrying on the business of playing Rudjino, for charging an Entrance Levy only from Sri Lankan citizens for entering to a Casino and for increasing the gross collection from 10% to 15%, in accordance with the Budget 2019 and the Cabinet decision dated 2019‑08‑27 and to present the said draft Bill in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Draft policy (Amendment) relating to the Fiscal Management (Responsibility) Act, No.3 of 2003
decision_details: - The Government Fiscal Management (Responsibility) Act, No.3 of 2003 was passed, with a view to introducing Government Fiscal Targets as a guide to be followed to ensure a more responsible Government fiscal management. As stated specifically in the said Act, by reducing the gross Government debt up to a level of 85% by the year 2006 and up to a level of 60% by the year 2013 as a percentage of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP), it was expected to maintain the budget deficit to be in a level of 5% of the Gross Domestic Product. However, as a result of the various internal and global impacts the Sri Lanka economy had to face, the numerical targets could not be achieved and as such, the said targets for the year 2013 and 2016 were revised. On the prevailing Government fiscal situation, the budget deficit and the amount of gross Government debt has to be maintained at an adaptable level to the economy. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, to revise the targets indicated in the initial Finance Act declaring the Government fiscal targets given, to be strictly adhered to, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Termination of the Wildlife Trust
decision_details: - The Wildlife Trust of Sri Lanka established in terms of the provisions of the Trust Ordinance, presently, not engaged in any activity related to the objective of environment conservation and wildlife conservation, has been identified to be terminated in accordance with the Public Finance Circular No.2/2018. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism Development, Wildlife and Christian Religious Affairs, to assign all the assets and liabilities of the Wildlife Trust to the Department of Wildlife Conservation after the winding up of the said Trust, to grant compensation and gratuity for the staff who have expressed their willingness to be relieved of their services, to attach the members of the staff who do not express their willingness to be relieved of their services having received their compensation, to the Department of Wildlife Conservation, as personal to them and to continue to maintain the Randenigala Training Centre further as a Training Centre under the Department of Wildlife Conservation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Gelioya Town Bus Stand and the Economic Centre
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of National Policies, Economic Affairs, Resettlement & Rehabilitation, Northern Province Development and Youth Affairs, to construct a 3 storey building for the Gelioya Main Bus Stand and the Economic Centre equipped with the necessary facilities allowing to accommodate the development activities of the town as well, at a total cost of Rs.233.23 million, considering the non‑availability of sufficient parking facilities for the buses, lack of necessary facilities for the convenience of the passengers, bus drivers and conductors and the congestion aggravated in the town created by the road side vendors in the said bus stand of Gelioya situated along the Nuwara Eliya‑ Colombo main road, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project pertaining to a River for Jaffna
decision_details: - As there are no rivers in the Jaffna peninsula, 'A River Project for Jaffna' has been planned to be carried out in 2 phases as a 5 year project with the objective of overcoming the water shortage in the Jaffna peninsula and reducing salinity in wells bordering the Vadamarachchi Lagoon, increasing the water for agriculture by providing 08 million cubic meters of fresh water per year to the said area and increasing the water availability for drinking and domestic purposes by making fresh water amply available. This project will assist in developing 12,610 hectares of unutilized lands and 1,315 hectares of lands used for paddy, field crops, plantation and grazing purposes and over 300,000 people will be benefited. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment for the implementation of the said project at a cost of Rs.3,609 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transfer of the Company of Mahaweli Consultancy Bureau (Pvt.) Ltd. established as an affiliated company in accordance with section 13 (18) of the Mahaweli Authority Act to the Ministry of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development
decision_details: - The Mahaweli Consultancy Bureau (Pvt.) Ltd. incorporated under the Companies Act, after the restructuring of the Mahaweli Authority of Sri Lanka in 1998, functions with the objective of providing consultancy services to the local and international projects for the irrigation sector and other Government institutions and the preparation of project reports of the other Government institutions. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment and the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development to transfer this company which was in the process of liquidation as per the opinion of the Attorney General, to the Ministry of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development with immediate effect, for providing consultancy services to the institutions coming under the purview of the said Ministry and also enabling it to provide consultancy services pertaining to the small scale engineering constructions of the rural industrial sector productively, along with all its existing financial and physical assets, liabilities, staff and ongoing consultancy services agreed upon along with all its activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Launching of a Lottery titled and crediting its income to the Protection of Children - National Trust Fund
decision_details: - With a view to fulfilling the welfare and future protection of destitute children the and children with special needs, the 'Protection of Children - National Trust Fund' established under the Trust Ordinance on the 01st of October 2019 to mark the World Children's Day, has to be developed systematically. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President to authorize the National Lotteries Board under the supervision of the Ministry of Finance to appropriately launch the  lottery titled 'දරු සම්පත' to be drawn once a week and to credit the excess income from the sale of the lottery ticket: 'දරු සම්පත' to the 'Protection of Children - National Trust Fund' once the cost of the lottery is met out of the proceeds, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The enactment of the National Innovation Agency (NIA) Act
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President to publish the National Innovation Agency Bill to establish the National Innovation Agency with the main objectives of coordinating the various stakeholders in innovation and entrepreneurship and minimizing the gap between the commercialization of research and development, the implementation of projects and programmes to prevent duplication and overlapping, reviewing, coordinating and overseeing the activities of a wide range of stakeholders and assisting in the  budgetary allocation and programme planning of the Ministry of Finance, drafted by the Legal Draftsman, in the Government Gazette in three languages and to present it in Parliament thereafter, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Committee Stage Amendments to the Finance Bill - 2019
decision_details: - The Carbon Tax has been imposed under the Finance Act, No.35 of 2018.  The tax liability depends on the age from the first registration, engine capacity and the fuel type of the vehicle but having considered the requests from the Public, the observations of the experts and the difficulty of implementation at the Divisional Secretariat level, the basis of the chargeability of the tax has been decided to be changed. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amendments to be moved at the Committee Stage of the Finance Bill enabling to charge the tax as payable at the rate and the manner prescribed on the consumption of fuel by the Minister of Finance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entry into term tender for the import of Combined Cargoes of Gasoline (92 Unl) & Gasoline (95 Unl) during the period of nine (09) months from 15th October 2019 to 14th July 2020
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development to award the contract for the import of  1,924,000 barrels (Bbls) of Gasoline (92 Unl) at the premium of US$ 3.456 per Bpl and 476,000 barrels (Bbls) of Gasoline (95 Unl) at the premium of US$ 3.876 per Bpl during the period of nine (09) months from 15th October 2019 to 14 July 2020 to M/s Vitol Asia Pte., Singapore, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Asian Development Bank funded Second Integrated Road Investment Programme - Awarding of eleven (11) civil work contract packages in the Northern Province
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development, to award 08 packages to the M/s Maga Engineering (Pvt.) Ltd., 02 packages to the M/s China National Technical Import and Export Corporation (China) in joint venture with M/s R.R. Construction (Pvt.) Ltd. and 01 package to the M/s Chaina State Construction Engineering Corporation Ltd., China, out of the 11 contract packages for the rehabilitation, improvement and maintenance of the rural roads in the Northern Province under the Asian Development Bank funded Second Integrated Road Investment Programme, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting of the Pilot Study on feasibility of implementing the New Labour Force Standards adopted during the 19th International Conference of Labour Statisticians (ICLS) in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - At the 19th International Conference of Labour Statisticians, a series of amendments have been adopted for the preparation of official labour force statistics and the said standards have also been approved by the Governing Body of the International Labour Organization, as the international labour statistics standards. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President at the request of the Non‑Cabinet Minister of Economic Reforms and Public Distribution, to obtain approval to conduct a pilot study on the feasibility of implementation of new labour statistics standards by the Department of Census and Statistics with the technical assistance from the International Labour Organization and the World Bank, making use of the grant of US$ 212,000.00 provided by the World Bank, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Consultancy Services for the feasibility study and detailed design of the Kandy Suburban Railway Project
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously for the feasibility study and detailed design of the Kandy Suburban Railway Project.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport & Civil Aviation, to award the contract for consultancy services in this regard to IDOM Consulting Engineering, Architecture, S.A.U. (SPA) with Saman Corporation (KOR) as Joint Venture Partners and Resources Development Consultants Ltd., (SRI) as sub‑consultants, on the concurrence of the Asian Development Bank and as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultants Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Green Power Development and Energy Efficiency Improvement Investment Programme - Construction of Primary Substations
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Power, Energy and Business Development, to award the contract for the construction of 33/11kV primary substation coming under Tranche 2 of Package 05 of the Green Power Development and Energy Efficiency Improvement Investment Programme to M/s Siemens Ltd. in Consortium with Dimo (Pvt.) Ltd., at No.36, Kynsey Road, Colombo 08, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the Supply, Delivery, Installation, Commissioning and Maintenance of 14 Phacoemulsification Machines on Repeat order
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to place a repeat order with the original contractor M/s Delmage Forsyth & Co. Ltd., by enhancing the total cost, insurance and freight charges for the supply, delivery, installation, commissioning and maintenance of 14 Phacoemulsification Machines, used for conducting cataract surgeries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of the contract for a building to be constructed at the South Eastern University of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of City Planning, Water Supply and Higher Education to award the contract for the construction of a building complex of staff quarters for the Academic and the Non‑academic Staff of the South Eastern University of Sri Lanka, in accordance with the procurement procedure  carried out, to M/s Nazeeha Hardware & Construction Ltd., for a sum of Rs.272.1 million, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the contract for the Maintenance Repair and Overhaul (MRO) Services of CFM56-5B engines of SriLankan Airlines for the period from 15th August 2019 to 31st December 2023
decision_details: - It is anticipated to  have a quantity of 10 overhauls during the period from the 15th of August 2019 up to 31st of December 2023 in 07 engines used for the 03 A320 aircrafts fitted with CFM56-5B owned by the Sri Lankan Airlines.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to award the procurement for performing the said activity to GE Engine Services, LLC (GE), the lowest evaluated substantially responsive bidder selected out of the bids called for on Limited Competitive Basis, for a sum of US$ 57,785,317, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchasing of Motor Bikes under the National Competitive Bidding Method to enhance the capacity of the Sri Lanka Police under the Proposal No. 400 of the Budget 2017
decision_details: - It has been decided to purchase 480 of 125 cc Motor Bikes by calling for bids under the National Competitive Bidding Method to enhance the capacity of the Sri Lanka Police.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Defence, to purchase 480 Motor Bikes for the value of Rs.322,650/- each, inclusive of all taxes from M/s David Peiris Motor Company Lanka Ltd., in accordance with the bids called for, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC),  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Maritime Rescue Coordinating Centre
decision_details: - Under the Government Policy of developing Sri Lanka as a Maritime Hub, it is due to establish a Maritime Rescue Coordinating Centre with the objective of providing a more efficient, search and rescue service to ensure the security of the crafts engaged in naval and fishing activities and face perils within the maritime zone to be implemented with the Sri Lanka Navy as the key partner and the Coast Guard Department of Sri Lanka, the Sri Lanka Air-force and the Merchant Shipping Secretariat as other partners.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Defence, to carry out the said project in accordance with the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), with the grant of US$ 6 million agreed upon by the Government of India through the Bharat Electronic Limited (BEL) India, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The National Hindu Council of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of National Integration, Official Languages, Social Progress and Hindu Religious Affairs to establish a Council by the name of 'The National Hindu Council of Sri Lanka' in a manner representing all the Hindu community groups living in Sri Lanka, with the expectation of fulfilling the objectives of strengthening  the process of the Government for creating National Integration and co-existence, protecting the Hindu religious beliefs, Hindu culture and Hindu heritage at the National Level and the District Level,  acting peacefully with other communities living in Sri Lanka in order to build a strong Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Asian Pacific Regional Annual Symposium on Express Mail Service (EMS)
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to hold the Asian Pacific Regional Symposium (EMS Symposium) of the International Express Mail Service in the year 2019, in Sri Lanka. However, since the participation of the representatives to the proposed Symposium would be adversely affected due to the terrorist attack that took place on the 29th of April, 2019, it has been decided to hold the above symposium in another country in this year. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Postal Services & Muslim Religious Affairs to keep the Cabinet informed that there is no possibility of holding the above annual Symposium in Sri Lanka in the year 2019 and for approval to hold the annual Symposium in Sri Lanka  in the year 2020, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Consultative meeting of Regional Experts on Investment Promotion for Sustainable Agricultural Development - State Private Farmer Participation
decision_details: - The Cabinet noted the information submitted by the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development that it has been decided to hold the 'Consultative meeting of Regional Experts on Investment Promotion for Sustainable Agricultural Development - State Private Farmer Participation' in Sri Lanka from 23rd  to 25th October 2019 with the objective of exchanging knowledge and experiences gained in various fields among the member countries of the SAARC Organization.

title: Construction of the 'Siyatha' Wetland Park at Gampaha
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Megapolis & Western Development to develop a plot of abandoned paddy land  in extent of 16 hectares at Yakkala - Gampaha Road located in front of Bandaranayaka Maha Vidyalaya as a wetland park with environmental and recreational activities with the approval of the other relevant institutions including the Department of Agrarian Development under the 'Sukitha Purawara' Township Development Project and to allocate plots of land of a minimum of 6 perches from the 10% of the land  extent acquired for the purpose from the project, to the persons who have lost their lands due to the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting a land at Kottawa on 99 years lease basis for a Mixed Development Project
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Megapolis & Western Development to vest a plot of land in extent of 1 acre, 1 rood and 19.40 perches located bordering the High level Road, Kottawa to Richard Pieris Distributors Ltd., at No. 310, Highlevel Road, Navinna, Maharagama  on a 99 year lease basis, to implement a mixed development project, consisting of a super market, luxury shopping malls, recreational activities and residential component with 80 apartments, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Design, Supply and Installation / Construction of the Municipal Solid Waste Sanitary Landfill Disposal Facility (Aruwakkalu)
decision_details: - The contract for Design, Supply and Installation / Construction of the Municipal Solid Waste Sanitary Landfill Disposal Facility at Aruwakkalu has been awarded to the Consortium between China Harbour Engineering Company Limited (CHEC) and the Southwest Municipal Engineering and Research Institute of China (SEMEDRIC) and the proposal made by the Minister of Megapolis & Western Development to allocate 10% of the agreed contract value amounting to US$ 9,048,225.92 and SLR 162,293,621.11 to meet the contingencies arising during the construction, operation and maintenance period, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memoranda of Understanding (MoU) between the University of Colombo and Foreign Universities / Higher Education Institutes on Cooperation in the Field of Higher Education
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of City Planning, Water Supply and Higher Education for the University of Colombo to enter into Bilateral Memoranda of Understanding with the University of Zurich, Switzerland, the Hubei University, P.R. China and the Tsinghua University, P.R. China with the objective of developing and expanding the educational cooperation within the Higher Education Sector of those countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Liability Management Initiatives
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Finance, based on the Cabinet decision dated 2019‑09‑03, to secure the necessary funds for settling the Government debts in the near future, within the borrowing limits approved by the Active Liability Management Act, to raise US$500 million (Japanese Yen 60 billion) with a 10 year maturity of SAMURAI Bonds with the possible credit enhancement from the Japan Bank for International Cooperation and  to appoint the three banks/investment houses namely, Mizuho Securities Company Ltd., SMBC Nikko Securities Inc. and Mitsubishi UFJ Morgan Stanley Securities Co. Ltd., as Joint Lead Arrangers for the said issuance, according to the recommendation of the Monitory Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Presenting a new luxury house as the Super Prize of the Sevana Lottery Draw
decision_details: - Considering the practical problems which had cropped up when presenting a new house as the super prize for the Sevana Lottery Draw, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, to present the money allocated for the super price for making the housing dream of the prize winner a reality, subject to taxes prevailing in the country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Report of the Ministerial Committee appointed to discuss with the representatives of the relevant Trade Unions and submit recommendations to the Cabinet
decision_details: - A Ministerial Committee chaired by the Minister of Finance was appointed by the Cabinet at its special meeting held on 2019.09.27 to examine the action to be taken by the Government pertaining to the ongoing union strikes  in the state sector and submit recommendations to the Cabinet. Accordingly, the recommendations made by the said Ministerial Committee, to revise the Executive Allowance, which is paid to all the officers amounting to Rs.3,000/- to Rs.15,000/- inclusive of the officers of the SLAS entitled to such allowance based on the period of service, as Rs.15,000/- in general, disregarding the period of service and to take the necessary steps to make the teachers' and the principals' services a closed service with the objective of preparing a suitable salary structure with reasonable salary scales and making the railway service as well, a closed one to prepare a suitable salary structure, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vote on Account - 2020
decision_details: - As the next Presidential election is scheduled to be held on the 16th of November 2019, in accordance with the decision of the Cabinet at its meeting held on 2019‑08‑13, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to present a Vote on Account prepared incorporating the financial provisions required to maintain the activities of the Government during the period of the first four months from 01st of January to 30th of April 2020 in Parliament, until the Appropriation Act for the year 2020 is passed in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Replacement of Main Crude Distiller Column, Diesel Hydrotreater Reactor, and the Platformer Unit with a Continuous Catalyst Regeneration type Reformer at the Sapugaskanda Oil Refinery
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development, to award the contract to carry out Front End  Engineering Design as the first phase of the project of  the replacement of Main Crude Distiller Column, Diesel Hydrotreater Reactor, and the Platformer Unit with a Continuous Catalyst Regeneration type Reformer at the Sapugaskanda Oil Refinery to the Institute, UOP LLC,USA as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Pricing/Re-Pricing of Petroleum data available in the Petroleum Resources Development Secretariat
decision_details: - The Petroleum Resources Development Secretariat has to price the newly obtained petroleum data in the M2 Block of Mannar Basin and re-price other old data available in the Mannar, Cauvery and Lanka Basins to carry out future licensing rounds. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development for pricing and re-pricing the data available in the Petroleum Resources Development Secretariat as per the recommendations of the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the supply of 180,000 vials of Anti Rabies (TC) Vaccine
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine, to award the procurement for the supply of 180,000 vials of Anti Rabies (TC) Vaccine (Human Use) (0.5 ml/1 ml) which is used to prevent the rabies disease, to M/s ABC Pharma Services (Pvt) Ltd., as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of the contract for the supply of catering from Narita International Airport Japan, for SriLankan Airline flights from 15th November 2019 for a 02 year contract period
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Finance to award the contract for the supply of Catering Uplift at Narita International Airport, Japan, for a period of 02 years commencing from 15th of November, 2019, at a total contract value of Japanese Yen 307,695,073 for covering 520 SriLankan Airline flights, to M/s Gate Gourmet Japan Ltd., as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Dry Ration Packets to the Sri Lanka Army - Supply Year 2019
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Defence, to award the contract for the procurement of 200,000 Dry Ration Packets for the Sri Lanka Army for the year 2019, for a sum of Rs.175,704,347.83 (without VAT), to M/s Rodesha Enterprise (Pvt.) Ltd., the lowest evaluated substantially responsive bidder, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the approval of the Cabinet for the submission of the draft Bill on Prevention of Offences relating to Sports, in Parliament of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - In terms of the decision arrived by the Cabinet at one of its previous meetings, the Attorney General has been instructed to prepare the Bill on Prevention of Offences Relating to Sports. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the draft bill so prepared and therefore,the proposal made by the Minister of Telecommunication, Foreign Employment and Sports to publish the draft bill prepared incorporating the amendments proposed by the  Attorney General in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Coordination Task Force for the Detection of Proceeds of Crime
decision_details: - All law enforcement agencies have pointed out that the lack of a formal coordination mechanism is the major obstacle in combating and mitigating, if not eliminating, organized criminality, money laundering and terrorist financing. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms, to establish a Coordination Task Force to recover the resources acquired unlawfully under the Chairmanship of the Director of the Financial Intelligence Unit of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and comprising of 10 other members in order the establish an effective coordination mechanism with operational level personnel, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Court Complex at Hulftsdorp in Colombo
decision_details: - The Court Complex at Hulftsdorp in Colombo is a building complex with archaeological values which is nearly 200 years old. Within this complex, 7 Magistrate Courts, 9 District Courts and 7 High Courts, 3 Commercial High Courts and the respective offices of the said Courts are housed and no extensive renovation has been carried out over the years in an appropriate manner. As such, the proposal made by  Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms  to initially erect a pre-built structure and make renovations pertaining to the building complex  by shifting court buildings in stages into same and to set apart the estimated provisions required for the purpose by way of annual provisions to be provided for the Ministry of Justice & Prison Reforms and to assign the said renovation activities to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB) on design and built basis, subject to the approval of the Standing Technological Committee established in the Ministry of Housing, Construction and Cultural Affairs, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Grant of Cabotage Right to Foreign Airlines
decision_details: - Up to date, by the Air Services Agreements that Sri Lanka has negotiated with other States, the Airlines of the Bilateral Partner States have not been granted rights to operate flights in Sri Lanka under cabotage rights.  However, with the aim of having a renaissance in the local aviation sector, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport & Civil Aviation, to authorize the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka to accord cabotage rights to interested foreign airlines to operate commercial air services only among the Internal Airports in Sri Lanka (Batticaloa International Airport, Jaffna International Airport, Colombo International Airport, Ratmalana International Airport and Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport) under a Temporary Operating Permit with one year validity period, issued under the existing Air Services Agreements between Sri Lanka and the respective States of the Airlines which are interested to operate flights between the said International Airports with cabotage rights,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Updating the regulations made for the preservation of artifacts in Sri Lanka to bestow to our posterity
