decision_details: - The Antiquities Ordinance No.9 of 1940 has been enacted with the objective of better preservation of the artifacts and the archaeological sites and monuments which hold historical and archaeological significance in Sri Lanka. In terms of the provisions provided for in section 47 of the said Ordinance, the regulations published in the Gazette Notification No.8698 of 23rd December 1940 have to be updated to suit the present trends. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Housing, Construction and Cultural Affairs to amend the regulations made under section 47 of the Antiquities Ordinance No.9 of 1940 and implement the amendments after presenting them in Parliament for approval and subsequently, to publish in the Government Gazette, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Pre Cast Disaster Resilient Houses for the People Residing in the Disaster Prone Areas
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to construct 400 houses in the Kalutara and Ratnapura Districts under Phase 01 of the Project on constructing Pre‑Cast Disaster Resilient Houses for the people residing in disaster prone areas. By now, lands have been identified to resettle 500 families in the Badulla District and 50 families in the Moneragala District in close proximity to the District boundary of the Badulla District.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Disaster Management and Livestock Development to construct the first 100 houses in the Badulla and Moneragala districts with the objective of resettling of the said 550 families under  Phase 01 of the project,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Lease of a Land at Buthgamuwa Road in Rajagiriya to M/s Baili Investment Lanka (Pvt) Ltd.
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Megapolis & Western Development to lease a plot of land in extent of 2 Acres and 3 Roods facing Rajagiriya, Buthgamuwa Road and Parliament Road for a 99 year period, to M/s Baili Investment Lanka (Pvt) Ltd., for a Mixed Development Project according to the recommendations made by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of a Delimitation Committee for the establishment of the New Divisional Secretariat Divisions, Gazetting of the currently established Divisional Secretariat Divisions and the establishment and Revision of the  Grama Niladhari Divisions
decision_details: - A Delimitation Committee for the establishment of the New Divisional Secretariat Divisions, Gazetting of the currently established Divisional Secretariat Divisions and the establishment and Revision of the Grama Niladhari Divisions has to be appointed once in every five years. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Internal & Home Affairs and Provincial Councils & Local Government, to appoint the new Delimitation Committee comprising of eleven Members under the Chairmanship of a retired Secretary to a Ministry, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the dialysis treatment programme for patients with Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) and Chronic Kidney Disease of uncertain etiology (CKDu)
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to appoint a Technical Evaluation Committee and a Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee to evaluate and to make recommendations on the project proposal made by the Hospinorm Project GmbH, Frankfurter Str, 92, Eschborn, to provide 643 dialysis machines throughout the country inclusive of the supply of 33 new dialysis units and expansion of 50 dialysis units with  improved facilities and also to secure the provisions required for the said project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Amendments to Section 3 of the Protection of Government Revenue (Special Provisions) Act, No.1 of 2006
decision_details: - Complications have arisen due to the fact that in terms of Section 3 of the Protection of Government Revenue (Special Provisions) Act, No.1 of 2006, the date of import (and export) shall be the date of delivery of the Customs Declaration, whereas in terms of Section 16 of the Customs Ordinance, the time of import shall be the time at which the ship importing such goods had actually come within the limits of the Port (and time of export shall be the time at which the goods had been shipped on board).  As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to amend Section 3 of the Protection of Government Revenue (Special Provisions) Act, No.1 of 2006 to enable to keep the consistency between the provisions of the two Acts, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Land (Restrictions on Alienation) (Amendment) Bill
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Finance to publish the draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman to amend the Land (Restrictions on Alienation) Act, No.38 of 2014 incorporating the necessary legal provisions to exclude the companies listed in the Colombo Stock Exchange from the application of prohibition on purchasing of lands in Sri Lanka, in the Government Gazette and present it in Parliament for approval,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of houses for the landless protracted IDPs of the Jaffna District
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of National Policies, Economic Affairs, Resettlement & Rehabilitation, Northern Province Development and Youth Affairs to construct 250 housing units each with 600 sq ft. as two storey twin compartment housing complex in the land purchased by a donor in a private land called Rasalikulankarai in extent of 7.5 acres situated in the New Moor Street of the Grama Niladhari Division, No.88 of the Jaffna Divisional Secretariat Division and given as a gift to resettle 250 families out of the 535 families of the protracted IDPs of the Jaffna District and registered as landless, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Rural Agri Business Value Chains and Improvement of Related Common Facilities - Smallholder Agribusiness Partnership Programme (SAPP)
decision_details: - The Smallholder Agribusiness Partnership Programme is jointly implemented to facilitate smallholder farmers through agriculture value chain partnerships created by Public, Private and Production Participation (4P) by the Government of Sri Lanka, International Fund for Agriculture Development (IFAD), Private Sector, Participatory Financial Institutes (PFIs) and the beneficiaries through an investment of US$ 105 million. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President to authorize the Smallholder Agribusiness Partnerships Programme (SSAP) to provide in kind or financial grants to Farmers'/Producers' Organizations who are engaged in the said 4P projects, not exceeding the value of Rs.5 million per value chain project, for development of ‘off farm’ and common facilities/services which has been identified as essential to ensure the smooth operation of Public Private Producer Partnership (4P) projects, accordingly to improve the income level of farmers and minimize their risk in market, and to be implemented in collaboration with the Ministry in charge of the subject of Agriculture and the other relevant ministries was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Additional Ship to Shore (STS) Crane for the Sri lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to award the contract for the supply, installation and commissioning of 03 Ships to Shore Cranes at the Jaya Container Terminals Stage(V) Container quay to M/s Shanghai Zhenhua Heavy Industries Co., Ltd,. Accordingly,  the proposal made by the Minister of  Ports & Shipping and  Southern Development to award the contract for the procurement of an additional Ship to Shore Crane to  M/s Shanghai Zhenhua Heavy Industries on the same terms and conditions and payment method of the above contract, following the Repeat Order Procurement Method of the Government Procurement Guidelines 2006, as recommended by the Ca

title: Supply, Installation and Commissioning of Explosive Detection Systems for the Cabin Baggage (EDSCB) at the  Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA)
decision_details: - X-Ray Cabin Baggage Screening Machines utilized to inspect the cabin baggage  in the boarding gates at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have been installed there since 2004 and breakdown of any of the said machines could lead to flight delays. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport & Civil Aviation to commence the relevant purchasing to replace the the existing old Cabin Baggage X-ray machines with state of art X- ray machines of Computer Tomography for explosive detection and related security requirements, to ensure the aviation security standards,  under the provisions of the emergency procurement utilizing the funds available for Airport & Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) Limited, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 'Reconstruction of 25 Bridges Project' funded by the Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development (KFAED) - Procurement of a Contractor for Civil Works
decision_details: - It has been planned to reconstruct 09 dilapidated and narrow bridges in the national road network of the Sabaragamuwa Province under the package 02 of the 'Reconstruction of 25 Bridges Project' funded by the Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development (KFAED). As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development, to award the contract for the reconstruction of 05 bridges in the Dehiowita - Deraniyagala road, 02 bridges in the Galigamuwa - Ruwanwella road and 01 bridge each in the Kegalle - Bulathkohupitiya road and Mawanella - Hemmathagama road, to M/s ELS Construction (Pvt).,Ltd,  to a sum of Rs 1289.76 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Landslide Countermeasures at six road sites in the Sabaragamuwa and Uva Provinces for the Landslide Disaster Protection Project - Package 02
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development to revise the original contract price of Landslide Countermeasures at six road sites in the Sabaragamuwa and Uva Provinces under the Road Disaster Management Package 02 and to award the contract for the construction of Landslide Countermeasures in the identified locations at Ambepussa, Haputhale, Bandarawela, Uduwara and Ella to the current contractor, RR- Soltec Joint Venture, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Fertilizer 2019 - (October)
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development, to obtain covering approval to procure 2,000 MTs of Urea at US$ 299.50 per MT from M/s Agri Commodities & Finance and 8,500 MTs of Muriate of Potash at US$ 349.43 per MT from M/s Agricultural Resources & Investment Pte. Ltd., as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee in order to fulfill the fertilizer requirement of the Ceylon Fertilizer Company Limited and the Colombo Commercial Fertilizer Company Limited for the month of October, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Sangilipalama Rural Water Supply Scheme in the Nuwara Eliya District
decision_details: - The objective of the Water Supply and Sanitation Improvement Project (2015 2020) is to improve the supply of pipe born water and sanitation facilities focusing on 540	Grama Niladhari Divisions in the selected 07 districts of Mullaitivu, Kilinochchi, Badulla, Moneragala, Ratnapura, Kegalle and Nuwara Eliya which do not have safe drinking water facilities. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of City Planning, Water Supply and Higher Education to award the contract for the construction of the Sangilipalama Rural Water Supply Scheme which is implemented, as a part of the project to provide safe drinking water to 14 Grama Niladhari Divisions and to benefit 3050 households by 2039 in the Kotmale Divisional Secretariat Division in the Nuwara Eliya Dirtrict to M/s Q SJV (Qingdao Savinda JV) as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Presenting of the Regulations made by the Minister of Sports under section 41 of the Sports Act, No.25 of 1973 in Parliament
decision_details: - The Gazette (Extraordinary) Notification No.2137/86 dated 2019 08 23 and the Gazette (Extraordinary) Notification No.2137/85  dated 2019 08 23 have been issued to achieve the objective of hearing the appeals related to the elections pertaining to National Sports Associations, in a convenient and formal manner and appointing disciplined and more suitable persons for sports administration. Accordingly, 	the proposal made by the Minister of Telecommunication, Foreign Employment and Sports, to present the above two Gazette Notifications in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Developing the Galle Face Green
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Ports Authority has undertaken certain development work at the Galle Face Green with Corporate and Social Responsibility (CSR) Funds with the approval of the Cabinet of Ministers in 2007 along with its own funds and the funds of the National Budget. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of  Ports & Shipping and  Southern Development, to set apart a sum of Rs.300 million, being the total estimated cost under the proposed Corporate and Social Responsibility (CSR) Budget for the year 2019/2021 and to complete the development activities by stages within a period of nearly 18 months, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Drafting the new Education Bill
decision_details: - The legal basis of the present education system is the Education Ordinance No.31 of 1939 and the subsequent amendments made to the said Ordinance and the Special Acts. Since, most of the provisions included in these Acts are now obsolete, with a view to updating the Acts, the proposed draft framework the Ministry of Education, has submitted, having considered the written and oral suggestions made by the stakeholders in the education sector and various other fields to be taken into consideration for the preparation of the new Education Bill. As such, it was decided by the Cabinet to appoint a Committee of Experts comprising of the representatives of the Ministry of Education,  the Ministry of Women & Child Affairs and Dry Zone Development, the Ministry of City Planning, Water Supply and Higher Education, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of National Policies, Economic Affairs, Resettlement & Rehabilitation, Northern Province Development and Youth Affairs, University Grants Commission, Department of National Planning, National Education Commission, the National Institute of Education and private sector educational institutes, to review the new Education Bill and to make recommendations.

title: Payment of a special allowance to the Executive Officers of the Public Sector
decision_details: - A Cabinet Sub-Committee was appointed by the Cabinet at its meeting held on  26th of March 2019, under the Chairmanship of the Minister of Public Administration, Disaster Management and Livestock Development and the membership of the Minister of Megapolis & Western Development and the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development, to study the recommendations made by the National Salaries and Cadres Commission relating to the payment of a special allowance to the Executive Officers of the Public Sector and to submit a Report to the Cabinet. The recommendations submitted by the said Sub Committee were taken into consideration by the Cabinet. Further, the Cabinet took into consideration that the Cabinet has granted approval to implement 50% out of the increase of salaries in the Public Service recommended by the Report of the Special Commission on reviewing the salaries of the Public Sector appointed by H.E. the President, with effect from 01st of July 2020 and the balance 50 % increase with effect from 01st of January 2021, at its meeting held on the 10th of September 2019. Accordingly, with a view to providing relief to the entire Public Service, the Cabinet approved to grant 50% out of the salary increase recommended by the Special Commission on reviewing the salaries of the Public Sector with effect from 01st of January 2020.

title: Establishment of the Regional Integrated Multi-Hazard Early Warning System Regional Hub for the South Asian Region
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously, to establish the Regional Integrated Multi-Hazard Early Warning System Regional Hub for the South Asian Region in the premises of the Department of Meteorology. However, the matters submitted by the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development  and the Minister of Public Administration, Disaster Management and Rural Economic Affairs to the effect that it has been planned to establish the  proposed regional hub in the Irrigation Department premises due to space and financial constraints, was noted by the Cabinet

title: Construction of a new building to establish the Ministry of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development, to construct a storey building in the land called 'Ambalangodella' belonging to the said Ministry, in extent of approximately 6 acres adjacent to the Ministry of Lands and Parliamentary Reforms,  to house the offices of the Ministry of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development situated in Colombo including the Department of Agrarian Development under one roof as 'Govijana Mandiraya', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Drafting an identical Act for the Ceylon Fishery Harbours Corporation
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Rural Economic Affairs, Irrigation and Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development, to draft a new Parliamentary Act identical to the Ceylon Fishing Harbour Corporation by the Legal Draftsman with a view to converting the said corporation to enhance the generation of income sufficient for self existence and to be profitable by strengthening the same legally and increasing the income generation capability, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion of the Norochcholai Coal Power Plant
decision_details: - Considering the fact that the construction of a new power plant as an extension of the Norochcholai Coal Power Plant is in conformity with the policy of the future electricity generation mix of Sri Lanka and the Long Term Generation Expansion Plan approved for 2018-2037 by the Public Utility Commission of Sri Lanka, which was approved by the Cabinet previously, the proposal made by the Minister of Power, Energy and Business Development, to build the 04th power plant unit with a capacity of 300 MW as an extension of the Norochcholai Coal Power Plant within the same premises, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting of the Sri Jayewardenepura National School of Nursing with the Faculty of Nursing of the University of Colombo
decision_details: - A Faculty of Nursing affiliated to the University of Colombo has been commenced in the year 2018, utilizing the buildings of the Sri Jayewardenepura National School of Nursing with a view to enhancing the quality of nursing education up to a degree level and creating nursing professionals with high competency at a globally competitive level. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of City Planning, Water Supply and Higher Education, to vest the buildings and the assets belonging to the said nurses training school, its staff administered by the Ministry of  Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine and the land where the relevant buildings are situated and belonging to the Sri Jayewardenepura Hospital, with the University of Colombo through the Ministry of City Planning, Water Supply and Higher Education, for the use of the Faculty of Nursing of the University of Colombo, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the National Gem and Jewellery Authority Act, No.50 of 1993
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation to amend several sections of the National Gem and Jewellery Authority Act, No.50 of 1993, to arrive at policy decisions in principle to address the legal and institutional issues which have arisen at present and expected to  arisen in future and also with a view to achieving the objectives of the Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of Salary and Allowances paid to the Members of the Tri-forces and the Police who died or became disabled directly due to Terrorist activities or activities done for the prevention of same, while on duty, in operational areas or in areas not nominated as operational areas, during the conflict period, until the completion of 55 years of age and to the dependents of the deceased members for their lifetime and to the disabled member for his lifetime
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Defence, in  accordance with the recommendations made by the Officials' Committee under the Chairmanship of an Additional Secretary to the Ministry in charge of the subject of Public Administration and appointed by the Cabinet to study the relevant matter and make recommendations,  to provide further relief in addition to the benefits already received by the members of the Tri forces and the Police who died or became disabled directly due to terrorist activities or activities done for the prevention of same, while on duty, in operational areas or in areas not nominated as operational areas, during the conflict period, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening of the Operational Affairs of National Security
decision_details: - Consequent to the series of terrorist attacks by the religious extremists on the 21st of April, 2019, the necessity of further strengthening the existing institutional structure to ensure security operations strictly to meet the challenges posed to national security has been identified. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation, to establish the  National Security Council, instituted in 1999 under  the Public Security Ordinance and the newly proposed National Security Advisory Committee, the National Security Council Secretariat and the Experts Committees on National Security (Economic, International Affairs, Social and Religious, Research and Analysis, Scientific and Technological and Strategic Management) to be established by an Act of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No.3 of 2016 enabling to increase the existing Minimum National Wage
decision_details: - In terms of the National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No.3 of 2016, The National minimum monthly salary of Rs.10,000/- (Rs.400x25) and the national minimum daily wage of Rs. 400/- (Rs.50x8) had been stipulated with effect from the 01st of January 2016.  Considering the increasing cost of living, the approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to amend section 3 of the said Act enabling to increase the existing national minimum wage of Rs. 10,000/- by Rs. 2,500/- up to Rs.12,500/- and the national minimum daily wage of Rs. 400/- by Rs.100/- up to Rs.500/-. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President at the request of the Non Cabinet Minister of Labour and Trade Union Relations to publish the draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman amending section 3 of the  National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No.3 of 2016 in the Government Gazette and subsequently, to present it in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting ownership of 101 'Shelter for All' new model villages with the housing beneficiaries
decision_details: - One of the key development initiatives of the 'Shelter for All' national housing drive which commenced from the year 2015 is the model village programme.  Under the said programme, the number of model villages vested with the  housing beneficiaries with all the required amenities of a settlement is 286 and the submission made by the Minister of Housing, Construction and Cultural Affairs that the ownership of 101 model villages out of the said number will be vested with the beneficiaries awaiting the ownership of a house of their own, during the two week period from 23rd September to 07th October, preceding the World Habitat Day which falls on 07th October, was noted by the Cabinet.

title: Introducing an effective legal framework to counter terrorism
decision_details: - New laws are required in respect of areas such as temporary restriction orders, prohibition on encouragement of terrorism in various ways and control of being in designated foreign areas and the collection of biometric data etc in order to deal with the new dimensions of terrorism. Accordingly, The joint proposal made by the Prime Minister and the Minister of Foreign Affairs to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation for the existing legislation  or to draft appropriate new legislation as per the proposals submitted by the Ministerial Committee appointed by the Cabinet for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of an additional Pilot Launch for Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - 	Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to award the contract for the supply of 02 Pilot Launches for Sri Lanka Ports Authority to Colombo Dockyard PLC, Sri Lanka. Since Sri Lanka Ports Authority  has identified the necessity of having another Pilot Launch in addition to the said two Pilot Launches in view of delivering efficient navigational services within the operational ports, the proposal made by the Minister of  Ports & Shipping and  Southern Development  to award the contract for the procurement of an additional Pilot Launch for Sri Lanka Ports Authority to M/s Colombo Dockyard PLC, Sri Lanka on the same terms and conditions of the above contract under the provisions of Repeat Order Procurement Method of the Procurement Guideline 2006  as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation and Improvements to Road Sections of the Orugodawatta - Ambatale Road
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development,  to award the contract for the rehabilitation and improvements (Stage II) to the first 2.9 km road section and the road sections from 4.2 km to 5.44 km of the Orugodawatta - Ambatale Road, (B -435) to M/s Tudawe Brothers (Pvt.) Ltd., as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Term Contract for the importation of Gasoline from 2019 10 01 to 2020 05 31
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development, to award the contract for the importation of  900,000 Bbls of Gasoline during the period of eight months from 2019 10 01 to 2020 05 31, to M/s Vitol Asia Pte. Ltd., of Singapore, as recommended by the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Term Contract for the importation of Gas Oil and Jet A-1 from 2019 10 01 to 2020 05 31
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Highways & Road Development and Petroleum Resources Development, to award the contract for the importation of 1.04 million Bbls of Gas Oil and 1.28 million Bbls of Jet A-1 during the period of eight months from 2019 10 01 to 2020 05 31, to M/s Mena Energy DMCC of the United Arab Emirates, as recommended by the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchasing of Coal required for the Coal Power Plant in Puttalam
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Power, Energy and Business Development, to grant covering approval for awarding the contract for the purchase of 300,000 MT of coal required for the Coal Power Plant in Puttalam, to M/s Swiss Singapore Overseas Enterprises Pte. Ltd, 65, Chulia Street # 48-05, OCBC Centre, Singapore, as recommended by the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of Uniforms and other clothing material required for the Three Forces, the Department of Civil Security, the National Cadet Corps,  the Sri Lanka Police and the Special Task Force for the year 2019
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted in the year 2005, to fulfill the textile requirements of the Tri Forces and the other Public Institutions coming under the purview of the Ministry of Defence from the local textile manufacturers.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Defence, to purchase textile material from the selected local textile manufacturers through the Domestic Textile Allocation Committee, on the quotations called to fulfill  the textile material requirement of the Sri Lanka Army, the Sri Lanka Navy, the Sri Lanka Air Force, the Department of Civil Security, the National Cadet Corps, the Sri Lanka Police and the Special Task Force, for the year 2019,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the Kingdom of Cambodia and the Government of Sri Lanka on Exemption of Visa requirement for holders of Diplomatic, Special, Official and Service Passports
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Internal & Home Affairs and Provincial Councils & Local Government, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the Kingdom of Cambodia and the Government of Sri Lanka on Exemption of Visa requirement for holders of Diplomatic, Official and Service Passports, with a view to promoting further, the friendly ties between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Jaffna and the University of Bristol in the United Kingdom
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of City Planning, Water Supply and Higher Education, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Jaffna and the University of Bristol in the United Kingdom, with a view to promoting educational corporation within the higher education sector, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Support to the Food Safety and Quality in Sri Lanka Project and Sri Lanka's Nationally Determined Contributions in the Industry Sector Project, proposed to be financed under the European Union grant assistance
decision_details: - 	The 'Multiannual Indicative Programme of 2014 - 2020 for Sri Lanka' is due to be implemented under the European Union grant assistance with a view to supporting Integrated Rural Development and Democratic Governance and Reconciliation in Sri Lanka.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance, to enter into financing agreements with the European Union to obtain a grant of Euro 11 million and Euro 7.81 million, respectively, for 'Support to Foot Safety and Quality in Sri Lanka Project' and for 'Sri Lanka's Nationally Determined Contributions in the Industry Sector Project', out of the Euro 110 million set apart under the 'Integrated Rural Development in Sri Lanka', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into Viability Gap Funding Agreements (VGF) with Domestic Air Services Companies to undertake scheduled domestic air services to selected destinations
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has already been granted to select domestic aviation companies applicable only to operate scheduled domestic flights to selected destinations, which do not exceed a maximum charge of US$ 100 - 150 for one way travel and to finalize a viability gap funding mechanism to settle any shortfall on expenditure and  income that would occur, as an inducement to the tourism industry.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Prime Minister and Minister of National Policies, Economic Affairs, Resettlement & Rehabilitation, Northern Province Development and Youth Affairs, for the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority to enter into Viability Gap Funding Agreements with the said domestic aviation companies, subject to presenting the detailed operating statistics and the business plan for the next one year to the National Agency for Public-Private Partnership (NAPPP), on the format prepared by NAPPP, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Liquidation of Natural Resources Management Services (Pvt.) Ltd., Mahaweli Venture Capital Company (Pvt.) Ltd., and Mahaweli Engineering Services (Pvt.) Ltd., companies incorporated under Section 13(18) of the Mahaweli Authority of Sri Lanka Act
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to liquidate the Natural Resources Management Services (Pvt.) Ltd., Mahaweli Venture Capital Company (Pvt.) Ltd., and Mahaweli Engineering Services (Pvt.) Ltd., companies incorporated under section 13(18) of Mahaweli Authority of Sri Lanka Act, which can not be maintained as of now, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting Permanent Appointments to the employees recruited on Temporary, Casual (on Daily wages), Substitute, Contract or Relief Basis
decision_details: - The joint proposal made by the Prime Minister, the Minister of Finance and the Minister of Public Administration, Disaster Management and Rural Economic Affairs, to enforce the provisions of the following circulars, to grant permanent and pensionable appointments to those who have failed to get permanency due to the inability  to fulfill the requirements stipulated in the Public Administration Circular No.25/2014 and 25/2014(I), at the time of their issuance and also for the employees recruited on temporary, casual (on daily wages), substitute, contract or relief basis to primary grades in the public institutions on exigencies of service and who have completed a period of service exceeding 180 days, subject to fulfilling the required qualifications of the said posts as at 2019 09 01, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Declaration of the 'Information Month' to coincide with the International Right to Know Day
decision_details: - The Right to Information Act No.12 of 2016 which was passed in Parliament of Sri Lanka on the 4th of August 2016, has now been ranked as the fourth best Act in the world and the Ministry of Mass Media which has been entrusted with the prime responsibility of implementing the said Act, is taking appropriate measures to effectively implement the same. Therefore, the proposal made by H.E the President as per the request of the Non-Cabinet Minister of Mass media to declare the period from 15th of September 2019 to 15th of October 2019 as the 'Information Month' to coincide with the 'International Right to Know Day' which falls on 28th of September 2019, to issue a Circular to instruct all the State Institutions to engage in activities related to this Act, to organize awareness programmes for citizens so as to cover all the divisional secretariat divisions of the country to coincide with this event, to implement RTI mobile services under the theme of 'Right to Information to the Village' in 05 selected districts, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Multi Sector Action Plan for Nutrition 2018 - 2025
decision_details: - In terms of the National Nutrition Policy declared in the year 2010, it is essential to accomplish the major objectives such as ensuring the involvement and contribution of both health and non-health sectors as well as the Government and Non-Governmental stakeholders in the nutrition improvement process, achieving the sustainable development goals by 2030 including the eradication of all forms of malnutrition and also making contribution to achieve global efforts of ending malnutrition by the year 2025, as agreed at the World Health Assembly held in 2012. As such, the proposal made by H.E the President to obtain approval, in principle to implement the Multi Sector Action Plan for Nutrition 2018 - 2025 (Phase II) which has been prepared with the participation of multi - stakeholders including all the relevant ministries, provincial councils, district and divisional administrative authorities, development partners, donors, agencies, acedemia, business community, civil society organizations and non governmental organizations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increase of  fines (Bail Act, No.30 of 1997)
decision_details: - Since the fines imposed in respect of violating the provisions in certain Acts and Ordinances are totally inadequate to prevent such violations, a Committee was appointed by the then Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms to study this situation and where appropriate to make  recommendations  for the increase of the said fines. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation for the increase of fines in the Bail Act in accordance with the recommendations of the said Committee report, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Penal Code and the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously, to draft legislation on hate speech, as an amendment to the Penal Code and  the Code of Criminal Procedure. The draft Bill prepared accordingly, has been presented to the Sectoral Oversight Committee in Parliament and the proposal made by the Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms to publish the new draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman in accordance with the recommendations of the said Committee, in the Gazette and subsequently, present it in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979
decision_details: - The Draft (Amendment) Bill to the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979 has been published in the Gazette of 14th June 2019. Subsequently, the Sectoral Oversight Committee which had met to consider the draft Bill has proposed several amendments and the Legal Draftsman has drafted these amendments as Committee Stage Amendments. In view of the decision given by the Cabinet previously, the Committee Stage Amendments which affect the core of a Bill should be submitted to the Cabinet for approval prior to tabling the same in Parliament. Accordingly, the said Committee Stage Amendments and the draft Bill published in the Gazette of 14th June 2019 submitted to the Cabinet by the Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the 'National Council for Road Safety' in the name of the 'Commission for National Transport Safety
decision_details: - The need for the National Council for Road Safety established by the Motor Traffic (Amendment) Act, No.5 of 1998 as a 'Council' comprising of 17 member institutes, to be established as a powerful and legal entity has been identified. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport & Civil Aviation to establish the National Council for Road Safety by the name of the 'Commission for National Transport Safety', as a powerful institute within a formal legal framework and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft appropriate legislation to establish the said Commission, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocating the plots of land in the Ratnapura New Town for the construction of the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Health Training Centre
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Megapolis & Western Development to release the two plots of land in extent of 3 Roods 1.5 perches in the Ratnapura New Town belonging to the Urban Development Authority to the Land Commissioner General enabling to allocate the lands for the Provincial Health Department of the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council, to construct the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Health Training Centre subject to the payment of Rs.30 million being the valuation of the Government Valuer, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Development Projects utilizing the Treasury funds allocated to the Ministry of Megapolis and Western Development for the year 2019
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Megapolis & Western Development for the implementation of the five (05) projects in which the total estimated cost exceeds Rs.20 million, namely, 'Seruwavila Development - Stage II', 'Jaffna Town Development - Bustand - Stage II', 'Improvement of Welikanda Town' - 'Eluwankulama - Aruwakadu Road Improvement' and 'Aththidiya Childrens' Orphanage - Stage II', utilizing the Treasury funds allocated for the year 2019, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Building for the Accident and Emergency Care Unit of the District General Hospital in Ampara
decision_details: - Considering the urgent need for providing facilities for accident and emergency care services at the District General Hospital in Ampara, the proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to award the contract for the construction of a two storey building for the Accident and Emergency Care Unit of the said hospital, to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau on Turn-Key (Design and Build) Basis, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Out Patients Department (OPD) building of the District General Hospital in Kalutara
decision_details: - It has been identified that the accommodation facilities available in the existing Out Patient Department building of the District General Hospital in Kalutara are inadequate, due to the increase in the demand for Out Patients treatment services during the past years.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine to construct the Out Patients Department (OPD) building of the said hospital, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the approval for Rs.121 million to be set apart for the development of the Nuwarawela Stadium and Shopping Complex in Kandy
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Minister of Public Enterprise, Kandyan Heritage and Kandy Development to construct the Nuwarawela Stadium and the Shopping Complex within the Kandy Municipal Council area under the supervision of the Kandy Municipal Council, utilizing a sum of Rs.121 million from the provisions of the consolidated fund, for the enhancement of the living standard of the community specially of the Kandy Municipal Council area and the Gangawata Korale Pradeshiya Sabha, minimizing of the traffic congestion in the Kandy city, increasing the income status of the Kandy Municipal Council, providing a good market price for agro based products and the other products of the people in the area and making better marketing facilities for the consumers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Financial assistance from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) for the  implementation of the 2nd Integrated Road Investment Program
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka has entered into a Framework Financing Agreement with the Asian Development Bank to obtain multi-tranche financial facilities up to an aggregate of US$ 900 million to finance the Second Integrated Road Investment Programme to rehabilitate about 3,400 km of rural access roads and around 340 km of national roads in the Northern, Eastern, Uva and Western Provinces and for improving the capacity of road agencies pertaining to rehabilitation, maintenance, safeguards, road safety, research and road design and construction. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to enter into a loan Agreement with the said bank to obtain a US$ 150 million from the Regular Ordinary Capital Resources of the Asian Development Bank, for the 02nd tranche of the programme with a total  investment cost of US$ 171.8 million and  is expected to be completed by the year 2023,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening of Transformation, Reconciliation and Inclusive Democratic Engagement (STRIDE) Project
decision_details: - A project known as ''Strengthening of Transformation, Reconciliation and Complete Democratic Intervention'' is to be implemented with the indirect management of the World Bank, the United Nations Development Programme and the British Council with the overall objective of Strengthening the  execution of decentralized functions in the Northern, Eastern, North Central and Uva Provinces and the dialogue between the people and the Government, thereby contributing to the resolution of critical underline causes of disputes and the prevention of escalation of local disputes. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Finance to enter into a Grant Agreement with the European Union to obtain a grant of Euro 40 million for financing the said project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Recruitment and Training of Graduate Trainees
decision_details: - In accordance with the approval granted by the Cabinet previously, the intimation made by the Hon. Prime Minister and Minister of National Policies, Economic Affairs, Resettlement & Rehabilitation, Northern Province Development and Youth Affairs, to the effect, that graduates from the year 2012 will be recruited for training on chronological order for the remaining 4,667 posts of Graduate Trainees, in September, 2019, giving priority to the external and internal degree holders who are on the threshold of the age limit of 45 years, was noted by the Cabinet.

title: Payment of allowances as a compensation in addition to the valuation of the lands acquired from land owners affected due to Moragahakanda - Kaluganga Development Project
decision_details: - The approval of Cabinet has been granted previously to pay an additional compensation of  50% of the assessed compensation for the persons affected due to Moragahakanda - Kaluganga Project, who were permanently residing in the Naula and Laggala Divisional Secretariat Areas, taking into consideration the demands made by them indicating that valuation of the acquired properties for the project has been lessened due to the lack of development of infrastructure facilities of the area compared to the nearby areas and also due to properties of the residents in the area not being renovated by them consequent to the long time delay in commencing the construction after the declaration of the project and the uncertainty that prevailed in the implementation of same.  The proposal made by the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment to pay the said 50% additional compensation to the families of the Medirigiriya Divisional Secretariat Division who have not been included in the relevant Review Committee Report but subsequently determined as project affected, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparation of a National Policy and Strategy on Sustainable Development
decision_details: - Considering the importance of achieving Sustainable Development Goals for the development of the country, our commitment towards the global efforts to create a sustainably developed world and the need for every government organization to  act as an arm of one government, the proposal made by H.E. the President, that every Ministry to have a common vision of a 'Sustainably Developed Sri Lanka', that every Provincial Council to have a vision of a 'Sustainably Developed  ............... (relevant name of the province) Province for a Sustainably Developed Sri Lanka', for every Government Institution to prepare its public service delivery strategies giving priority to sustainable development goals, that every government institution to propose programmes and projects under the strategies so identified and for the Sustainable Development Council established by the Sustainable Development Act to formulate a National Policy and Strategies on Sustainable Development, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Sustainable Development Vision of Sri Lanka 2030
decision_details: - The Report compiled by a Committee of 41 experts appointed by H.E. the President with the approval of the Cabinet of Ministers as  'Sustainable Sri Lanka 2030 Vision and Strategic Path' and handed over to the Sustainable Development Council, will in future, serve as the strategic guidance for the preparation of the National Policy and Strategy on Sustainable Development.  Accordingly, the recommendation made by H.E. the President that until such time, that the National Policy and Strategy is formulated in conformity with the sustainable development goals and targets, it is appropriate to present  proposals for projects and programmes for the budget 2020, taking cognizance of the sectoral priorities, new initiatives and options described in the 'Sustainable Sri Lanka 2030 Vision and Strategic Path', was noted by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of professionals with competency and experience as Chairmen and Members of the Boards of Directors of Statutory Boards
decision_details: - The Government has emphasized the need for the appointment of professionals with competency and experience as Chairmen and Members of the Boards of Directors when appointments are made as Chairmen and Members of the Boards of Directors in the Public Corporations, Statutory Boards inclusive of  State Owned Enterprises, to enable to achieve the set objectives and targets of the said Enterprises. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to appoint a Committee under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the President to make the necessary recommendations to enable the Ministers in‑charge of the relevant subjects to appoint graduates of a recognized University of Sri Lanka or a foreign University or persons with recognized professional qualifications and long term professional experience in the relevant field, based on the criteria approved previously by the Cabinet, except in the case of Ex-Officio Members, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vote on Account - 2019
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously, to present a Vote on Account to secure the provision necessary for the first 04 months of the year, 2019.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to present a resolution in Parliament (Vote on Account) to incur a total  expenditure of Rs.1,735 billion made up of Rs.760 billion to maintain the Public Services of the Government, Rs.970 billion for providing services already authorized by various laws and Rs.5 billion for the Advanced Account Activities until an Appropriation Bill for the year 2019 is submitted, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Parallel Roads for access to the houses situated on either side of the Matara - Beliatte Railway Track
decision_details: - The construction activities of the Matara - Beliatte railway project is nearing completion and it is expected to commence train operations from the year 2019 covering the entire coastal railway track from Colombo to Beliatte. The need for the construction of parallel roads has been identified considering the necessity of providing access to the houses of the people living in the area  being situated on either side of the Matara - Beliatte railway track. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to get the construction activities of 54 roads with a total length of 12.95 km done under the supervision of the Road Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Incurring the Government expenditure for the first four months of the 	year 2019
decision_details: - Since there is inadequate time to present the Budget for the year 2019 due to the recent shuffles in the composition of the Ministries, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to secure the budgetary provisions required to maintain the Government services uninterruptedly for the first four months of the year 2019 through a Vote on Account in compliance with the precedence followed in similar situations, until the Budget for the year 2019 is passed and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft the resolution in this regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The ongoing Government Procurements to be carried out without any delay
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to provide the necessary instructions to the Line Ministries to carry out the ongoing Government Procurement without any delay in accordance with the recent changes in the Ministerial portfolios, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Continuous implementation of the project on Education for Social Cohesion
decision_details: - The project of Education for Social Cohesion has been implemented successfully from the year 2005 under the technical grant assistance of the Government of Germany. This project is being implemented with the objective of enabling the children, the youth, their families and communities to live together harmoniously and peacefully in a multi-lingual society. The Government of the Federal Republic of Germany has provided a grant assistance of Euro 15.8 million for this project and has agreed to provide another Euro grant of 250,000 for the further implementation of the project. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to sign Exchange of Notes to obtain the said grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the new building with seven storeys for the Faculty of Arts of the University of Peradeniya
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Education & Higher Education, to award the contract for the construction of a building with seven storeys for the Faculty of Arts of the University of Peradeniya to M/s Sathuta Builders (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs.397.3 million in accordance with the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of the civil work contract of the Project for enhancing the Deep Berth Capacity of the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - In order to coincide with the development activities carried out to gain competitive opportunities for handling larger container vessels arriving at the Port of Colombo, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for the civil work component of the project for the enhancement of the deep berth capacity of the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, implemented by utilizing the funds of the said Authority to M/s China Harbour Engineering Company Ltd., as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Container Handling Equipment for the Jaya Container Terminal of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for purchasing 03 cranes required for container handling from ships to the shore for (JCT) - V under the modernization of  the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) - V of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority by utilizing the funds of the said Authority to M/s. Shanghai Zhenhua Heavy Industries Co. Ltd. for a sum of US$ 25.7 million, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into Agreements / Memoranda of Understanding (MoU) between the Local Authorities of Sri Lanka and the Provincial Entities of Foreign Countries under the Friendship City Concept
decision_details: - Various Local Authorities have implemented several programmes in collaboration with the different provincial entities of foreign countries under the Friendship City Concept. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils, Local Government and Sports, to appoint an Officials' Committee representing all the relevant Ministries and Institutions to evaluate the proposals made in respect of such Programmes or Agreements and take necessary future course of action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improving the efficiency of the Dairy Farms
decision_details: - Dairy cattle of around 5,000 belonging to the European Breeds and their crosses have been imported from Australia and New Zealend and distributed among the dairy farms scattered all over the Island in order to enhance the dairy production in Sri Lanka.  Although, the average production potential of these cattle is 20 to 25 Liters per day due to various reasons such as poor management standards and the environmental effects, a very low milk production of about 10 to 15 Liters per day is reported. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development and Rural Economic Affairs, to implement the projects planned for the improvement of the productivity of the farms and the enhancement of their efficiency and to appoint an Experts' Committee comprising of the representatives of the Department of Animal Production and Health and the National Livestock Development Board and to study the strategies needed in this respect and make recommendations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing Facilities to increase Domestic Maize Production
decision_details: - Maize has been imported over the past few years as the domestic maize production was not sufficient to meet the market requirements due to adverse weather and several other issues. With the increase of domestic maize production, the importation of maize can be minimized thereby reducing the foreign exchange spent, as well as increasing the income of the local maize producers. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Agriculture, to provide loan facilities required to increase the domestic maize production under the loan schemes presently being implemented at concessionary interest rates, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Debt Recovery (Special Provisions) Act, No.2 of 1990
decision_details: - The Debt Recovery (Special Provisions) Act, No.2 of 1990 has been introduced with the objective of introducing an expeditious procedure for the recovery of debts. However, since the said Act covers only the lending institutions that were in existence, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to amend section 30 of the said Act to make legal provision required to include the Licensed Specialized Banks established subsequently for the purposes of this Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of 02 Wave Rider Inshore Patrol Crafts for the Coast Guard of the Republic of Seychelles
decision_details: - During a state visit by H.E. the President in the Republic of Seychelles, H.E.  had acceded to a request made to construct two Wave Rider Inshore Patrol Crafts for the coast guard of the Republic of Seychelles. Accordingly, with a view to strengthening the diplomatic relations between the two countries, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Defence, to carry out the construction activities of the Wave Rider Inshore Patrol Crafts by the Sri Lanka Navy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Empowering local potato farmers
decision_details: - The Government, with the increase of supply of potato in the market due to the bountiful harvest of potato in Welimada and suburban areas, has taken measures to purchase the potato harvest from the farmers with a view to ensuring a reasonable price for the products. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to secure provisions to settle the payments of the farmers for the potato stock purchased by the Consumer Co-operative Societies Federation Ltd., was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting post procurement reviews and detailed investigations
decision_details: - The Government has focused its attention to ensure that the state funds spent  on public procurement made for various requirements of the government, are value for money and to ascertain that such procurement is made in terms of the Government Procurement Guidelines.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to implement the proposals for post procurement reviews and detailed investigations on all public procurement made by the government institutions avoiding duplication with the programmes of other Ministries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting the Forthcoming Provincial Councils Election
decision_details: Provisions have to be made expeditiously to hold the Provincial Councils Election since the official tenure of 06 provincial councils out of 09 have been expired by now. The delimitation of electorates required to hold elections under the Mixed Member Proportionate System presently being implemented to elect members for provincial councils which was introduced by the Provincial Councils Elections Act, No.2 of 1988 as amended by the Provincial Councils Elections (Amendment) Act, No.17 of 2017 has not yet been completed. As such, considering the exigency of holding the Provincial Council Election, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils, Local Government and Sports, to draft legislation to hold the Provincial Council Elections under the previous proportional representative system, and to ensure 25% women candidates at the said election, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of a seed paddy subsidy for paddy cultivation damaged by Plant Hoppers and Stem Borers during the Yala Season - 2018
decision_details: A vast damage has been caused to the paddy cultivation due to the rapid spread of brown plant hopper and yellow stem borer during the Yala season of 2018 in the Polonnaruwa and Ampara districts. Accordingly, it has been estimated that damages have been caused to 34,759 acres of paddy land owned by 18,280 farmers in the Polonnaruwa district and 7,402 acres of paddy land owned by 3,676 farmers in the Ampara district. Therefore, it has been found difficult for the farmers to obtain seed paddy for the Maha season of 2018/19. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, and Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to grant a compensation of Rs.1,500 to Rs.3,000 per acre relative to the damages caused for the farmers who were affected due to the pest damages to purchase seed paddy for the Maha season of 2018/19, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme for Economic Revival
decision_details: Action is being taken by the Government to revive the economy by strengthening the local entrepreneurs and industries through relaxation of excessive taxes, empowering the agricultural sector and providing reliefs to the consumers through reduction of prices of the essential commodities. Under this, it has been proposed to provide various reliefs such as reduction of prices of fuel and the essential commodities, provision of debt reliefs to farmers,  small scale mill owners and the women living in drought affected areas, providing chemical fertilizer at concessionary price, lowering the high tax burden, providing tax concessions to local agriculture, constructions, small scale businessmen, those who are engaged in foreign employment, professionals and small and medium scale entrepreneurs, and uplifting the livelihood of the Samurdhi beneficiaries. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to make amendments to the relevant Acts for obtaining the legal sanction required for the implementation of the proposals made by the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs on 2018‑11‑01, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of water to the areas of Inamaluwa, Kitulhitiyawa, Sigiriya, Habarana, Galewela and Thiththawelgolla under the Local Government Enhancement Sector Project
decision_details: It has been planned to implement water supply schemes to cater to the water supply needs of the people living in the areas of Inamaluwa, Kitulhitiyawa, Sigiriya, Habarana, Galewela and Thiththawelgolla under the Grater Dambulla Water Scheme of the Local Government Enhancement Sector Project. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils, Local Government and Sports to award the contracts for the water supply extension to Inamaluwa and  Kitulhitiyawa areas, for a sum of Rs.491.9 million and the water supply extension to Sigiriya and Habarana areas, for a sum of Rs.415.3 million  to M/s PND, E&C Joint Venture, and the water supply extension to Galawela and Thiththawelgolla areas to M/s Squire Mech Engineering (Pvt.) Ltd. for a sum of Rs.660.6 million, in accordance with the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of School Uniform Material for the year 2019
decision_details: The Government, through out a period of 25 years from the year 1993 up to now, has been engaged in supplying school uniform material to the school children of about 45 million in order to ensure the equality of educational opportunities to the children receiving free education. It has been found that it is financially profitable to supply uniform material obtained from the local cloth manufactures, as was done earlier, relative to the 'gift voucher method' adopted in recent times. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Education & Higher Education, to provide the school children with uniform material for the year 2019, considering the saving of about Rs.50/- per meter of cloth and also the saving of the foreign exchange by obtaining cloth material from the local manufactures, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Nomination of  Cabinet Spokesmen
decision_details: - The Cabinet of Ministers decided to nominate Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe,  Minister of Ports and Shipping and Hon. Keheliya Rambukwella, State Minister of Mass Media and Digital Infrastructure to function as the Cabinet Spokesmen.

title: Awarding of the contract for the construction of a building for the Faculty of Applied Sciences of the Sabaragamuwa University
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Education & Higher Education, to award the contract for the construction of laboratories and lecture halls specified to be constructed as Stage II ‑ Phase I of the new building complex proposed for the Faculty of Applied Sciences of the Sabaragamuwa University, to M/s Sathuta Builders (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs.452.4 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project on 'Biomass Energy 2022' for Fueling the Economy
decision_details: - The importance of promoting the use of domestic energy resources has been identified with a view to minimizing the foreign exchange spent for the importation of fuels such as petroleum and coal for the energy needs of Sri Lanka, As such, a project named 'Biomass Energy 2022' has been planned  to develop 1000 entrepreneurs for growing of biomass energy and processing of agricultural waste as biomass energy through the establishment of 50 biomass energy collection and processing centres across the country. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to implement this programme with the financial support of the public, private, as well as the foreign sector, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Sri Lanka National Freedom from Hunger Campaign Board Act
decision_details: - The necessity has arisen to amend the Sri Lanka National Freedom from Hunger Campaign Board Act in keeping with the present economical and global trends. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to draft legislation to change the title of the Sri Lanka National Freedom from Hunger Campaign Board to read as the 'Sri Lanka Food Promotion and Agri Marketing Board' to revise the general objectives of the said Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of an Accelerated Agriculture Development Programme, “North East Agricultural Revival (Krushi Navodaya)”
decision_details: - It has been identified that the challenges such as low productivity, scarcity of seeds, land use issues, climate changes, inefficient post harvest management, problems associated with marketing and value addition, difficulties in water supply, problems relating to agricultural roads and rehabilitation of tanks, scarcity of infrastructure facilities and the dearth of officers to be engaged in the field have to be overcome to further improve the agricultural harvest of the Northern and Eastern Provinces. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Agriculture, to implement an accelerated Agricultural Development Programme, “North East Agricultural Revival (Krushi Navodaya)” in order to further increase the contribution made by the Northern and Eastern provinces to the national economy and to uplift the living standard of the people in those areas, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Abandoned Rural Tanks
decision_details: - In accordance with the database of the minor irrigation system and primary water sources of the Department of Agrarian Development, 14,421 tanks are in a state of operation at present and it has been identified that 1958 rural tanks have been abandoned  on the grounds of internal conflicts and the spread of infectious diseases. It is anticipated that around a  new cultivable extent of 97,900 acres can be cultivated by renovating these tanks. Further, taking also into consideration the benefits they provide for the nourishment of the ground water resources and to improve the forest cover and the wild life in the waste lands, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to renovate the tanks which are technically confirmed as suitable for renovation,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improving the facilities of the Sri Lanka Schools of Agriculture
decision_details: - In order to attract the the younger generation to the field of agriculture, 05 Sri Lanka Schools of Agriculture established in Kundasale, Pelwehera, Angunakolapelessa, Karapincha and Vavuniya produce Agricultural Diploma Holders of NVQ Level 6 providing them with the education pertaining to the new technology. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to increase the number of students recruited to the Schools of Agriculture and to provide them with a quality education and thereby enhancing the agricultural production of the country quantitatively and qualitatively with the cooperation of the Ministry of Skills Development and Vocational Training, as well, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening of the Crop Forecast Information System (CFIS) to minimize the gluts and scarcities of food crops
decision_details: - Crop Forecast Reports which include the data on the island-wide information on the prevailing crop situation,anticipated production in respect of the different seasons, crop damages and harvesting schedules are issued by the Department of Agriculture and such data can be considered the most reliable data base presently being used for making timely decisions including decisions regarding the importation of food crops. The said data base is presently being used through the software named 'Crop Forecast Information System (CFIS)'. Accordingly, with the objective of further utilizing the said information system efficiently and productively, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to upgrade the said Information System utilizing the resources available in the Agrarian Service Centres and the Deputy Director of Agriculture Offices established throughout the country, and the Mahaweli Zonal Offices, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tariffs Revision for the Services provided by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority and  the Jaya Bahalu Container Terminal (Pvt.) Ltd
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to revise the tariff charges for the services provided by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority and  the Jaya Bahalu Container Terminal (Pvt.) Ltd in keeping with the present market trends and enabling to provide a more qualitative service and to introduce a uniform method of  tariff rates among the harbours, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Headquarters building of the Sri Lanka Coast Guard Department
decision_details: - It has been decided to establish the Headquarters of the Sri Lanka Coast Guard Department with all facilities in close proximity with the Colombo city in order to maintain a proper coordination with the Government Institutions, to conduct meetings, seminars and bi‑lateral discussions and to supervise the coast guard operations and administrative functions enabling more efficient and effective performance of the duties of the Department which is entrusted with the safety of the Sri Lankan maritime zone and the protection of lives and property within the zone. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to construct an eleven storey building for the Headquarters of the said Department within the premises of the Wellawatta area where another office of the same Department has already been established, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Climate Change Mitigation Action Support Project
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to implement the Climate Change Mitigation Action Support Project for the mitigation of the greenhouse gas emission, under the World Bank assistance. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to establish a Project Management Unit comprising of the officials of the Ministry of Mahaweli Development and Environment and the persons with expertise knowledge in the relevant fields, for the proper management of the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the NAVIS Terminal Management System at the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) and the Unity Container Terminal (UCT) at the Sri Lanka Ports Authority.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for the improvement of the NAVIS Terminal Management System at the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) and the Unity Container Terminal (UCT) at the Sri Lanka Ports Authority to ACCESS NAVIS Joint Venture in accordance with the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of the Panadura Base Hospital and provision of medical equipment
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to award the procurement for the development of the Panadura Base Hospital and provision of medical equipment which provides medical services to the people living in the areas of Beruwala, Kalutara, Bandragama, Ratnapura, Moratuwa and Ratmalana for a sum of Euro million 106.4 to M/s GITEC IGIP Consultant GmbH of Germany, in accordance with the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of the contracts for the construction under the Gampaha, Attanagalla, Minuwangoda Integrated Water Supply Project
decision_details: - The contract for the Gampaha, Attanagalla, Minuwangoda Integrated Water Supply Project has been been awarded to M/s China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC). Under this project, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board, has planned to carry out 08 major constructions as sub contracts. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to award the contract for the laying of fittings and DI/PVC Pipes for the Transmission and Distribution Mains in Attanagalla out of those sub contracts, to the Joint Venture of M/s Sierra Construction Limited and K D A Weerasinghe Co. (Pvt.) Limited, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of parallel roads for the houses on one side of the Matara-Beliatta Railway.
decision_details: - The construction activities of the Matara-Beliatta Railway Project are nearing completion and it is expected to implement the railway operations from Colombo to Beliatta from the year 2019 covering the entire coastal line. Since the houses of the people living in the area are on one side of the Matara-Beliatta railway line, it has been found necessary to construct roads parallel to the said railway line in order to provide access to those houses. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to have the construction activities of 54 roads of 12.95 km in total length carried out under the supervision of the Road Development Authority (RDA), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Oil and Lubricants for the Sri Lanka Transport Board Buses.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to award the contract for the procurement of Oil and Lubricants for the buses of the Sri Lanka Transport Board to M/s Lanka IOC PLC, M/s Chevron Lubricant Lanka PLC and M/s McLarens Lubricant Ltd., as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Road Development Projects in the Northern and Eastern Provinces.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to award 05 Contract packages for the rehabilitation and improvement of the roads in the Northern and Eastern Provinces identified to be developed expeditiously by the District Development Committees of the said Provinces, to the recognized road construction companies as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee/ Project Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Tamil Medium National School in Kelaniya Education Zone.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon.
