Mano Ganesan, the Minister of National Integration, Reconciliation and Official Languages, to establish a Tamil medium Hindu School named Arun Manickavasagam Hindu College, in Kelaniya Educational Zone to uplift the educational standards of the children studying in the Tamil medium in the Gampaha and the Wattala area, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion of the facilities at the Vocational Training Centre,  Anamaduwa
decision_details: - It has been proposed to expand the facilities of the Vocational Training Centre at Anamaduwa with a view to conducting courses targeting the present job market. This will enable to conduct the courses such as Cookery, Bakery and Related Products, Computer Graphic Designing and Human Resource Management belonging to National Vocational Qualifications (NVQ) Level 4 (equivalent to G.C.E. A/L) which have a great demand in the job market. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayake, the Minister of Youth Affairs, Project Management and Southern Development, to secure Rs. 100 million for the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Presentation of the Extraordinary Gazette Notification that includes the list of prohibited substances in Parliament.
decision_details: - A list that includes prohibited substances and methods which are banned to be used by athletes is published by the World Anti-Doping Agency annually. At the same time, in terms of section 34 of the Convention against Doping in Sports Act, No.33 of 2013, the list of such substances declaring the prohibition of such substances in sports has been published in the Extraordinary Gazette Notification No.2083/32. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils, Local Government and Sports, to present the said Gazette Notification, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of a Chiller for the Central Air Conditioning System of the Superior Courts Complex Building.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms, to secure funds amounting to Rs 50 million to purchase a Chiller for the Central Air Conditioning System of the Superior Courts Complex, in order to supply the air conditioning facilities necessary to carry out the functions of the Supreme Court and the Court of Appeal, uninterruptedly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the outputs of the Fishery Infrastructure Facilities and Aquaculture Development of the Northern Province Sustainable Fisheries Development Project.
decision_details: - It has been planned to implement the Northern Province Sustainable Fisheries Development Project comprising of the 03 outputs of construction and development of fisheries harbour, anchorages and ferry,  aquaculture development and livelihood development with the financial assistance of US $ 174 million to be granted by the Asian Development Bank during the period from 2018 - 2024. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development and Rural Economic Affairs, to establish a Project Implementation Unit(PIU) for the implementation of the project outputs of fisheries infrastructure facilities and  aquaculture, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Science & Technology Human Resources Development Project.
decision_details: -With the introduction of the 'Technology Stream' for the G.C.E. Advanced Level, the University Grants Commission has recognized 10 State Universities to award degrees for the new technology subjects.  As such, it has been planned to establish 03 Technological Faculties in the University of Kelaniya, Rajarata University and the Sabaragamuwa University and an Engineering Faculty in the University of Sri Jayawardhanapura.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Higher Education & Cultural Affairs, to secure Rs.26,400 million necessary for the Universities to  develop  their physical and human resources for the commencement of the said degree  programmes within the time frame from 2018-2023, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The restoration of the Kudawilachchiya and the Dematagala Tanks.
decision_details: - The water collected in the Mahawilachchiya Reservoir situated adjacent to the Wilpattu National Park is the only available source of water for drinking as well as agricultural purposes of the people of the area.  As the water collected in the said reservoir is not adequate for the needs of the people, the restoration of the Kudawilachchiya tank which is a large abandoned tank situated in the Wilpattu National Park has been proposed. Also as the rural tanks situated close to the Palagala area experience shortages of water frequently, it has been identified that a project could be implemented by the restoration of the abandoned Dematagala Tank with a feeder canal to supply additional water to the rural tanks by constructing an anicut across the Heven Ella Oya, as a remedial measure. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources & Disaster Management, for the restoration of the Kudawilachchiya tank and the Dematagala tank, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Carrying out Geotechnical Investigations necessary for the Engineering Designs of the Kelani Flood Embankment.
decision_details: - It has been proposed to construct a flood embankment along the Kelani river from Hanwella up to the river mouth to mitigate the damage caused around the Kelani River Basin by floods. The said activities are planned to be carried out under 03 sub-projects.  A Geotechnical Investigation has to be carried out prior to the construction of the proposed flood embankments and as such, the proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources & Disaster Management, to get the necessary activities done by the National Building Research Institute, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Exhibition, forum and award ceremony on Innovation in Agriculture
decision_details: - As a step towards modernization of the Agricultural sector in Sri Lanka, arrangements have been made to conduct an exhibition on Innovation in Agriculture, the Forum for Modernization of Agriculture and an Awards Ceremony for Stakeholders engaged in the Agriculture sector from 11th - 16th December, 2018 at the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH) in Colombo. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to conduct the said programme in association with all sectors engaged in the agricultural activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Modernization of the Seed and Planting Material Supply System of the Department of Agriculture
decision_details: - Due to the limitations prevailing in the essential facilities to be deployed for the production activities carried out in the seed farms of the Department of Agriculture, it has been difficult to produce seeds at the required quantities. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to secure the funds required for the mechanization of seed processing, establishment of a combined drying and processing complex at Maha Illuppallama, Ampara and Aluttarama, purchasing the necessary equipment for the Palwehera and Bataatha farms, construction of 04 seed stores in Rahangala, Seethaeliya, Bataatha and Ampara farms and the development of seeds and other supply facilities, through the Medium Term Budgetary Framework, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a National Level Analytical Laboratory.
decision_details: - The need for the establishment of a high level analytical laboratory to regulate the inputs of the chemical and organic fertilizer and the pesticides and to regulate the excessive usage and the residue levels contained in the locally produced food has been identified. With the establishment of such high level laboratory facilities it would be possible to provide low cost as well as more reliable analytical services to all stakeholders. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Agriculture, to establish a national level analytical laboratory with an investment of Rs.286 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the quality of seeds and planting material.
decision_details: - In terms of the Seed Act, No.22 of 2003, the Department of Agriculture is vested with the legal authority and responsibility of controlling the quality of all planting material such as food crops, plantation crops, export agricultural crops, ornamental flowers and foliage, forest plants and medicinal herbal crops. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to provide the infrastructure facilities further needed for the seed testing laboratories that operate under the seed certification service of the Department of Agriculture to carry out the procedure presently being adopted in a more proper and an efficient manner, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Food safety enhancement.
decision_details: - The Centre for Excellence on Organic Agriculture (CEOA) at Makandura conducts research and technology transfer on Organic Agriculture and organic fertilizer while the Regional Agriculture Research and Development Centre (RARDC) conducts research in various other disciplines such as crop improvement soil and plant nutrition. It has been identified that there is a possibility for establishing a new centre for the development of Sustainable Agriculture by combining these two institutions. The combination of these two institutes will result in the creation of a premier institute which could hold the responsibility for providing training on eco-friendly agriculture and project activities Island wide productively, motivating promotion and research in organic agriculture and organic fertilizer and also as the premier institute for local organic certification and the National Reference Unit for soil micro biology. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to combine the said two institutes and establish the Centre for Sustainable Agriculture and to provide the necessary facilities for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of Polduwa by-pass Road from Suhurupaya to Kanatta Road
decision_details: - Action is being taken to relocate the government administrative offices in the Administrative City of Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte and the development activities of the area have to be carried out parallelly. Under this, it was proposed to construct a road from Dematagoda to Outer Circular Highway (OCH) and the construction activities from Polduwa Junction to Koswatta has been commenced by now. The Stage I  of this project from Polduwa Junction to Suhurupaya has been completed and the Stage II from Suhurupaya to Kanatta Road is under construction. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to secure the provisions of Rs.328.63 million required for the completion of the said construction activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the sanitation facilities in the Kataragama Sacred City.
decision_details: - The Cabinet of Ministers has previously granted approval to implement the Development Project at Kataragama Sacred city. In addition to this project, considering the inadequate sanitation facilities and solid waste disposal mechanism for the general public visiting the sacred city, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to construct the required sanitation blocks in the Kataragama and Kebiliththa areas, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Building Complex for the Anuradhapura District Secretariat.
decision_details: - Taking into consideration the space limitations prevailing in the building where the Anuradhapura District Secretariat is being maintained and with a view to providing more qualitative public service, the proposal made by Hon. Vajira Abeywardena, the Minister of Home Affairs, to construct a building complex of 150,000 sq.ft. with 07 floors with an investment of Rs.1,731.3 million, in place of the building being used to maintain the Anuradhapura District Secretariat and around 30 other offices of different Government Institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Removal of sand dunes accumulated at the Harbour Mouth of the Oluvil Port.
decision_details: - Difficulty in entering the fishing boats into the harbor due to the accumulation of sand dunes in the harbour mouth of the Oluvil Port has caused disruptions for the livelihood of the fishermen in the said area. As such, the information bought to the notice of the Cabinet of Ministers by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, that measures are being taken to remove sand dunes accumulated in the harbour mouth of the port using dredgers enabling to use the Port without interrupting the fishing activities, was noted by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of the existing Analogue X-Ray System to Digital X-Ray System in the Government Hospitals.
decision_details: - Digital X-Ray images have been identified as the best effective technological  method for a successful early diagnosis of a disease.  As such, a proposal has been made to use digital X-Ray systems instead of  the analogue X-Ray systems already used in the Government Hospitals. Under the said project, it has been planned to retrofit 50  analogue X-Ray machines already existing in the hospitals with Digital Radiology panels and obtain 25 Digital Mobile X-Ray systems. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to procure a quality technological Advanced digital radiography system, utilizing the funds to be received through the concessionary financing of 'FINEXPO' from the Kingdom of Belguim, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Project of Introducing Home Dialysis System using the Automated Peritoneal Dialysis, for Kidney Disease patients.
decision_details: - A proposal has been submitted to the Cabinet previously on the implementation of a project of introducing a Home Dialysis System using the Automated Peritoneal Dialysis, for Kidney Disease patients and accordingly it was decided to appoint a Cabinet Sub-Committee to examine the said proposal and submit its recommendations to the Cabinet. As such, considering the recommendations made by the said Sub-Committee, Hon. Mohomed Casim Mohomed Faizal, the Acting Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, submitted  the proposals to be implemented for the  notice of the Cabinet.

title: Payment of Compensation for the lands acquired for the construction of Demodara Reskuru Reservoir.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to pay compensation of Rs 61.37 million to the land owners of the acquired lands from Ella and Hali Ela divisional secretaries for the construction of Demodara Reskuru Reservoir of the Badulla Hali Ela, Ella Integrated Water Supply Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the University of Vocational Technology (UNIVOTEC) of Sri Lanka and the Seychelles Institute of Technology (SIT) of Seychelles.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, the Minister of Science, Technology, Research, Skills Development & Vocational Training and Kandyan Heritage on the Memorandum of Understanding entered into between the University of Vocational Technology of Sri Lanka and the Seychelles Institute of Technology of Seychelles in the fields such as academic research training, departmental exchange, capacity building and joint student activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Agreement between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Belarus on Science, Technology and Innovation Cooperation.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, the Minister of Science, Technology, Research, Skills Development & Vocational Training and Kandyan Heritage to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on strengthening and expansion of the Scientific and Technological Cooperation between the Republic of Belarus and the Government of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into an Agreement between Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia for the Avoidance of Double Taxation and Prevention of Fiscal Evasion with Respect to Taxes on Income.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to  enter into an Agreement between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Saudi Arabia for the Avoidance of Double Taxation and Prevention of Fiscal Evasion with Respect to Taxes on Income, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Drafting the Public Financial Management Act.
decision_details: - The Cabinet of Ministers has recommended previously to appoint a Committee  comprising of expertise in the relevant field to examine and submit recommendations on the Public Financial Management Bill scheduled to be introduced to form a legal framework on transparency, accountability, productivity, efficiency and frugality of the activities related to public financial management. The proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to draft the  Public Financial Management Bill with the inclusion of the recommendations made by the said Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of the Palaly Airport to operate Domestic Commercial Flights.
decision_details: - For the promotion of the tourism industry,the necessity of developing of the Palaly Airport to operate domestic commercial flights has been identified. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policie and Economic Affairs, Hon. John Amaratunga, the Minister of Tourism Development and Christian Religious Affairs and Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation,to use the Palaly Airport for scheduled domestic commercial passenger operations and to carry out the developments activities of the said Airport expeditiously by the Sri Lanka Air Force with an investment of Rs.1,965 million for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of an International Buddhist Organization for the promotion of the Buddhist Philosophy.
decision_details: - It has been proposed to establish an International Buddhist Organization to promote Buddhist philosophy locally and internationally. Accordingly, it is expected to make Sri Lanka as the center for promoting and disseminating the Buddhist philosophy and  to take necessary measures to protect and conserve Buddhist monuments and places all over the world. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Buddhasasana, to draft necessary legislation to establish the proposed International Buddhist Organization, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining financial assistance to strengthen the local authorities and to develop the provincial infrastructure facilities.
decision_details: - The Cabinet of Ministers has granted its approval previously to implement the project for strengthening the local authorities and developing the provincial infrastructure facilities covering 134 local authorities of Northern, Eastern, North Central and Uva Provinces.  The International Development Association (IDA) of the World Bank has agreed to provide a financial assistance of (USD) 70 million for this project. Accordingly, the proposal 	made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to conduct loan negotiations to secure funds and enter into relevant loan agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the financial assistance to implement the Climate Smart Irrigated 	Agriculture Project.
decision_details: - 	The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval previously to implement  the Climate Smart Irrigated Agriculture Project. The International Development Association (IDA) of the World Bank has agreed to provide financial assistance amounting to USD125 million to implement this project. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to conduct loan negotiation for the said purpose and enter into relevant agreements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for strengthening the Regional Development Bank - (RDB)
decision_details: - The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has agreed to provide financial assistance amounting to  (USD) 50 million for the Project on strengthening the Regiona Development Bank and in addition to providing USD 01 million through the Japan Fund for Poverty Reduction (JFPR) to strengthen the operational capacity of the bank. As such the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Harsha De Silva, the Acting Minister, National Policies and Economic Affairs, to conduct the loan negotiation for the said purpose and enter into relevant agreements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Augmentation of the National Kidney Fund for treatment, prevention and welfare of kidney patients.
decision_details: - 	“The National Kidney Fund” was established to provide more appropriate treatments, prevention and welfare services for the patients from low income families suffering from Chronic Kidney Disease of uncertain etiology. Utilizing  the said fund, activities such as awareness programmes, programmes to Pre identify kidney patients, development of infrastructure in health sector required for treatments of patients and providing pure drinking water are carried out. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to appoint a Supervisory Board chaired by the Secretary to the President to carry out its functions effectively and to form a scheme to grant its benefits, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The manufacture of asbestos, the usage and the import of raw material required for the manufacture of asbestos.
decision_details:
- The industrialists engaged in the production of asbestos as well as the experts on the subject have made various representations and submissions pertaining to the policy decision taken by the Government on 2016-09-06, imposing restrictions on the manufacture and use of asbestos in Sri Lanka and the import of the raw materials required for the manufacture of asbestos, to be effective from 01st January 2018.

	80% of the asbestos imported to Sri Lanka is used for the manufacture of roofing sheets and several members of the Cabinet has brought to the notice of the Cabinet the difficulties faced by the housing constructors due to these restrictions. At this meeting, the difficulties in creating opportunities to purchase suitable alternative products in the market at a fair price, as well, due to the restrictions imposed on the use of asbestos in the country within a short span of time was extensively discussed.

	As such, the Cabinet decided to suspend the said decision, until a further study is carried out and a final decision is taken, on the restrictions to be imposed pertaining to the manufacture and use of asbestos in Sri Lanka and the import of raw  material required for the manufacture of asbestos which was to be implemented, with effect from 2018-01-01.

title: Suspension of Sri Lanka Tea Imports by the Russian Federation
decision_details:
- The Russian Federation has temporarily suspended the export of agricultural products  of Sri Lanka with effect from 2017-12-18, following the detection of a live larvae of the Kapra Beetle (Trogoderma granarium) in the packaging material of a consignment of tea exported from Sri Lanka. Export of tea to the Federation of Russia by the Government of Sri Lanka accounts for 11% of the Sri Lanka's entire tea exports by value and therefore, Hon. Navin Dissanayake, the Minister of  Plantation Industries has pointed out that the situation warrant special attention since the specific beetle species is very rare in Sri Lanka and the occurrence of such a beetle in a tea container shipped to Russia is an unusual matter for concern. 

In this context, it would be essential to act swiftly to take action to safeguard the reputation of the high standards and quality the Sri Lankan tea industry has earned. Accordingly, Hon. Navin Dissanayake, the Minister of  Plantation Industries informed the Cabinet that a delegation led by him, including the Chairman of the Sri Lanka Tea Board, Director General of Agriculture and Specialists from the National Plant Quarantine Service are in readiness to travel to Russia, on short notice, as soon as the Russian Government intimates a date for such a meeting. Approval of the Cabinet was granted to extend the other diplomatic moves, as well, for the removal of the suspension of Sri Lankan tea imports.

title: Metro Colombo Solid Waste Management Project - Signing of the Grant Agreement for the Project Preparation Special Fund
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet has been granted for the Metro Colombo Solid Waste Management Project and under this, the implementation of the sanitary Landfill at Aruwakkalu, Puttlam has been expedited. In this regard, the World Bank and the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) will grant a credit facility of US$115 million and the Government of Sri Lanka will incur an expenditure of a sum of US$44 million, for the purpose.

In addition, the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank has expressed its willingness to donate US $ 700,000 to implement the initial activities required to expedite the project. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to enter into a Grant Agreement between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank, to obtain the financial grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of Salaries and Allowances of the Judges and the Law Officers of the Attorney General’s Department and the Legal Draftsman’s Department
decision_details:
- The need for the revision of salaries and allowances of the Judges and the Law Officers of the Attorney General’s Department and the Legal Draftsman’s Department, considering the functions they perform and the responsibility they are entrusted with has been the subject under discussion for a length of time.  

The Cabinet Sub-Committee on Establishment Matters has had consultations with the National Salaries and Cadres Commission and the other relevant stakeholders on this issue and an Officials' Committee has also been appointed to study the matter. Accordingly, taking into consideration the recommendations of the Officials' Committee, the Cabinet has granted approval to revise the salaries and allowances of the High Court Judges, Judges of the other Lower Courts and the Law Officers of the Attorney General’s Department and the Legal Draftsman’s Department to be effective from the year 2018 and considering such revisions to move a resolution in Parliament to revise the salaries and allowances of the Judges of the Superior Courts, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Guidelines to be adhered to by the Electronic or Printed Media during the period pertaining to a Referendum or an Election
decision_details:
- The Election Commission issues Media Guidelines to be adhered to by the electronic and printed media owners, social website owners and administrators during a period of election, with a view to maintaining the conducive environment required for conducting a free and fair election. It is the responsibility of all political parties / independent groups and political activists, observer organizations and civil organizations as well as all citizens to act in such manner to enable the media institutions to function in accordance with these guidelines. 

The Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2048/1 dated 2017-12-04 has been published specifying these media guidelines which includes publishing media reports impartially pertaining to elections, allocating air time without causing any injustice or providing any special benefit to any independent group or a candidate, providing sufficient opportunities to the party aggrieved or to any party presenting contrary views, to counter any matter broadcast, to present clarifications against such opinion and acting in terms of the media guidelines. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to present the Gazette Extraordinary Notification in Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of a Reinsurance Programme to cover Agricultural Insurance Schemes funded by the National Insurance Trust Fund (NITF)
decision_details:
- Considering the increase of the benefits provided under various agricultural insurance schemes funded by the National Insurance Trust Fund during the past period and the escalation of the possible damages to the crops to be caused by various natural disasters, it has been decided to obtain a re-insurance cover for the said insurance schemes.

Bids have been called upon to select an institution for the purpose and the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to enter into Agreements with the Swiss Re Asia PTE Ltd. and J.B. Boda & Co(S) PTE Ltd. of Singapore for obtaining the re-insurance facility at a sum of Rs.257.8 million for the period of 2018-01-01 to 2018-12-31 (inclusive of both days) as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Execution of the Digital Advertising Campaign in 2018 by the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau (SLTPB)
decision_details:
- The Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau has planned to implement a Digital Advertising Campaign to promote Sri Lanka as a favourite travel destination in the countries such as the United Kingdom, Germany, France, India and China. Due to various reasons, the selection of a suitable Agency for the purpose has been delayed and  the need to expedite the process has been identified.

	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. John Amaratunga, the Minister of Tourism Development and Christian Religious Affairs, to call for bids for the purpose from the Digital Advertising Agencies as recommended by the Cabinet Committee on Economic Management (CCEM), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion of the Nanotechnology and Science Park
decision_details:
- The Sri Lanka Institute of Nano Technology (SLINTEC) has been commenced, with a view to creating a research based environment in the country in collaboration with the private sector. At present, six private companies are conjoined for the research programmes of the Institute and several other companies have expressed their willingness for such research programmes. It will be possible to make these local products as competitive products in the international market by additional value addition for such local products through these research activities. The service of the Sri Lankans abroad who are experts in Science, Engineering and Technology fields may be re-attracted to the country by providing the appropriate infrastructure facilities and it will pave the way for improving the investments carried out by the global companies in the country. 

As such, it has been proposed to further expand the facilities in the Nanotechnology and Science Park situated at Mahenwatta, Pitipana, Homagama and the proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, the Minister of Science, Technology and Research, to implement its activities expeditiously, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting combined operations by the Wildlife, Police and Security Forces for the conservation of wild elephant population and the wildlife resources of Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- The Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance has vested the necessary legal authority with the Wildlife Officers and the Police Officers to ensure the protection of wildlife resources within and outside the wildlife protected areas. Management of the wild animal human conflict and related duties including the elephant-human conflict are also entrusted with the Wildlife Conservation Officers. Around 240 wild elephants die each year due to the elephant-human conflict. Meanwhile, several incidents of killing tuskers within the protected areas have been reported during the recent times. 

	As such, with a view to preventing the recurrence of such situations and to protect the country's elephant population including the tuskers and other wild animals within the precincts of the forests,  the proposal made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Sustainable Development and Wildlife, to establish a combined task force comprising of the officers of the Department of Wildlife Conservation, the Police Special Task Force and the officers of the  Security Forces and implement a field patrolling programme with the assistance of the field officers of the Department of Forest Conservation and the Sri Lanka Mahaweli Authority, in times of need, was approved by the Cabinet.  

	Further, the Cabinet also granted approval for the proposal made to amend the  Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance to make enable to impose life imprisonment on a person found guilty by a court of law for killing of wild elephants.

title: Resolving the issues relating to Cost of Living and providing Flood and Drought Relief
decision_details:
- Unexpected weather conditions have affected the food supply in the country and as a result, the prices of food products have escalated. On the other hand, the livelihood of the people has also been hampered due to the floods and drought that occurred in recent times. The Cabinet Sub-Committee on Cost of Living and the Cabinet Committee on Economic Management have held a series of discussions on the measures to be adopted to mitigate this situation. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister, to take the following measures without any delay,  in accordance with the decisions taken at such discussions, was approved by the Cabinet:

i.	Establishment of a 'Family Budget Unit' comprising of the relevant officials to review the supply of essential items at an affordable price for households.

ii.	Establishment of a Coordinating Committee under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the Ministry of Finance and Mass Media with the participation of the Secretaries to other relevant Ministries to ensure the successful implementation of the decisions taken by the  Sub-Committee on Cost of Living.

iii.	Implementation of a programme for distributing a Budget Pack of essential food items consisting of rice, lentils, sugar, sprats, onion, potato and canned fish through the supermarkets, Sathosa and the other private shops until the beginning of the Sinhala/Tamil new year season.


iv.	Formulating a mechanism to reimburse 50% of the income tax paid by the participating institutions and retail traders and to grant concessional electricity tariff incentives. 

v.	Vesting the responsibility with the Secretary to the Ministry of National Policies and Economic Affairs to monitor the relevant activities for expediting the import of coconut kernel.

vi.	Exploring the possibility of  getting the assistance of Australia to establish the quarantine mechanism adopted by Australia when importing coconut kernel in Sri Lanka, as well. 

vii.	Payment of the difference of the compensation agreed to be paid by the National Insurance Trust Fund to the persons affected by floods and the assessment value to be paid to such persons before 31st of December 2017 through the District Secretaries.

viii.	Taking appropriate measures to provide relief to the farmer families of Kurunegala, Puttalam, Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa and the Wanni Districts where the cultivation was affected for three or four seasons consecutively due to adverse weather conditions.

title: Resolving the Administrative, Salaries and Professional Issues of the Department of Sri Lanka Railways
decision_details:
- The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2017-12-12 decided to appoint a Ministerial Sub-Committee with the Chairmanship of Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, the Minister of Special Assignments and an Officials' Committee to assist the said Committee, to conduct negotiations with the representatives of the trade unions of the Department of Sri Lanka Railways to resolve the administrative, salary and other professional issues presented by them and submit their recommendations expeditiously. 
As such, the said Ministerial Sub-Committee has conducted negotiations with the relevant trade unions and it has been recommended that, administrative and salary issues existing in the Department of Sri Lanka Railways should be discussed with all relevant parties to find solutions and that the railway, health and educational services should be re-structured as closed services.

Accordingly, the Cabinet decided to request the Ministerial Sub-Committee to submit their recommendations to the Cabinet in regard to the future measures to be adopted in that connection and also to appoint a Committee to facilitate the said Sub-Committee comprising of Secretaries of another three Ministries, a representative of the Public Service Commission, National Salaries and Cadres Commission and a Personnel Management Specialist of the private sector under the Chairmanship of the Secretary, Ministry of Public Administration and Management.

title: Providing Police Quarters for Junior Police Officers in the Southern Province
decision_details: - It has been decided to purchase 192 houses from the 'Nila Sewana' housing project at Wekunagoda in  Galle, to provide housing facilities adequately, to the junior police officers in service in the Police Divisions of Galle, Matara, Elpitiya and Tangalle in the Southern Province.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayake, the Minister of Law & Order and Southern Development, to secure funds to the amount of Rs.729.6 million for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Securing a plot of land for the construction of an Accident and Emergency Treatment Unit for the Colombo East Base Hospital
decision_details:
- The functions of the Colombo East Base Hospital situated in Mulleriyawa, has been greatly expanded during the previous years and concurrent to same, it has become essential to upgrade the space facilities of the hospital. Therefore, it is essential to construct an Accident and Emergency Treatment Unit for the hospital and for this purpose, a plot of land  adjoining the hospital land with easy access facilities is required. 

A plot of land around 01 hectare out of the land belonging to the hospital has been given on a 30 year lease to a private party in 2001, but the said party has failed to fulfill the conditions of the lease. As such, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to cancel the relevant lease agreement and to release the said land  for the construction of an Emergency Treatment Unit for same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enhancing the organic food production and opening of export markets for such products
decision_details:
- A great demand is being created in the International Market for organic food products produced devoid of chemical fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide. As such, having selected 15,000 farmers engaged in organic agriculture under the 'National Programme on Food Production', a programme has been planned to be implemented to provide them with the basic knowledge and training to engage in  organic farming in a systematic manner to give them the production certificate required to present their products to the International markets and to provide facilities for export of such products. 

	A proposal has also been made to implement a programme to provide technical training for 2,500 young farmers on mushroom cultivation, inviting a specialist group from China and to provide them with market opportunities and financial facilities. It has also been planned to establish several model farms within the country where technological equipment and implements are used to attract the young community to agriculture and to impart about 6,500 youth  with agri entrepreneur knowledge.

	Accordingly, the Joint proposal made by H.E. the President, Maithripala Sirisena, and Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, the Minister of Social Empowerment, Welfare and Kandyan Heritage, to implement the said programmes, with the objective of enhancing the domestic food production and making avenues for obtaining a high revenue for the local farmers by exporting the agri products of Sri Lanka to the International markets, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Award of contract for the establishment of small scale Solar Power Plants  under the 'Soorya Bala Sangramaya Programme'
decision_details: - It has been planned to establish Solar Power Plants under the 'Soorya Bala Sangramaya Programme' Islandwide and suitable grid substations have been identified to transmit power to the National Electricity Network. Accordingly, proposals have been called upon from private investors for the establishment of 60 small scale Solar Power Plants with the capacity of 01 MW, on the basis of purchasing electricity for 20 grid substations under Phase II of the Programme. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to award the tender for the construction of the Solar Power Plants, to the investors selected on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) and the Procurement Appeal Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Laying of Synthetic Running Track of the Diyagama, Homagama Sports Academy and improving the Athletic Ground Facilities
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara, the Minister of Sports, to award the contract, for providing facilities and laying of 400 meter Synthetic Running Track of nine lanes, for repairs in the middle ground for foot-ball, hockey and rugger inclusive of the repairs and improvements to the athletic ground facilities, to the CML-MTD Construction Ltd. for a sum of Rs.310 million as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of another 44 bridges by utilizing the balance of provisions of the  Rural Bridges Project
decision_details: - The project duration of the Rural Bridges Project implemented to construct steel bridges, with the objective of avoiding transport difficulties faced by the people in the rural areas is due to expire on 8th March 2018. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government, to design and construct 35 additional rural bridges  and 09 temporary span panel bridges for each Province, by utilizing the balance of the contingencies allocated under Phase II and III of the said project and to extend the project duration up to 31st August 2018, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Carrying out maintenance work of the  Turbine of Unit 2 and the major accessories of the Lakvijaya Power Station
decision_details:
- Lakvijaya power plant in Puttlam consists of 3 units each of 300 MW.  The unit 02 of the Turbine which started its power generation activity in the year 2014,  consists of 15 major systems and the maintenance work pertaining to the  system due for the first time has to be carried out. The Memorandum of Understanding entered into with the China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC), the original contractor, is valid until September 2019.

Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to award the said maintenance contract to  the China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) for a sum of Rs.263.4 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the buildings necessary for the Relocation of the Manning Market of Pettah in Peliyagoda
decision_details:
- Measures have been taken to relocate the Manning Market in Peliyagoda, since the area of land in Pettah, in which the Manning Market has been established, is due to be used as a Multi-Modal Transport Hub.  The development activities of the relevant area at Peliyagoda and laying of the foundation are nearing completion. 

As such, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to award the contract of the construction of the superstructure, which has been designed to be constructed at its next stage, to the M/s Maga Engineering (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs.4,507 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Contract for elevating the Minipe Anicut including the Water Control and Measurement Facilities for the Left Bank and the Right Bank Canals under the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to award the contract for elevating the Minipe Anicut including the water control and measurement facilities for the left bank and the right bank canals constructed under the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme, to China Gezhouba Group Company Ltd., for a sum of Rs.1,576.9 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Consultancy Services for the proposed Tunnels to be constructed under the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme
decision_details: - The Kaluganga-Moragahakanda Transfer Tunnel and the Tunnel Nos.3 and 4 of the Upper Elahera Canal are due to be constructed in the year 2018 under  Phase two of the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme implemented under the loan assistance of the Asian Development Bank (ADB). As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to award the contract for providing consultancy services for the management of the contracts pertaining to the said construction activities, supervision of construction, commissioning and operation, to the present consultants of the project, Lhameyer International Gmbh GeoConsult ZT Gmbh JV, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enhancing the quality and recognition of the Degree Courses awarded by 'the University of Vocational Technology (UNIVOTEC) and the Ocean University of Sri Lanka'
decision_details: - The University of Vocational Technology (UNIVOTEC) of Sri Lanka and the Ocean University of Sri Lanka have been established under separate Acts of Parliament, with a view to implementing technical and professional degree courses to provide  a better practical knowledge.  As such, the joint proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways and Hon. Chandima Weerakkody, the Minister of Skills Development and Vocational Training, to adopt the same methodology for the  institutional review and the subject/programme review applied for by the University Grants Commission in respect of the other State Universities for the said two (02) Universities as well, as appropriate, with the objective of improving the qualitative aspect and recognition of the degree programmes offered by same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the School of Public Policy and Management of South Korea for training of public officers of Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- The responsibility of  developing the capabilities of the officers belonging to the All Island Services of the Public Service of Sri Lanka is vested with the Sri Lanka Institute of Development Administration (SLIDA). At present, the institute is engaged with foreign educational institutes with the intention of  expanding its network for the purpose of promoting the qualitative standards of the training programmes of the institute.

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Maddumabandara, the Minister of Public Administration and Management, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding with a view to strengthening the mutual cooperation between the KDI School of Public Policy and Management which is a recognized educational institute in South Korea for the development of skills in the fields of Public Policy, Public Administration, Human Resource Management and exchange of knowledge and the SLIDA of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Creating a post of Vice Principal of the Sri Lanka Law College
decision_details:
- Considering the importance of having a second administrative tier to entrust a part of the workload of the enormous duties to be accomplished by the Principal of the Sri lanka Law College, the Council of Legal Education has taken measures to amend the rules  pertaining to the appointment of staff of the Law College, to create a post of Vice Principal of the Sri Lanka Law College.

The rules as amended prepared by the Council of Legal Education, in consultation with Minister of Justice, have been published in the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2047/27 dated 2017-11-28. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice, to present the said Gazette Notification in Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making it mandatory to conduct trials daily in  the High Court
decision_details:
- The proviso to section 263(1) of the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979 states that every trial in the High Court with or without a jury, shall as far as practicable, be held daily. However, trials are not so held daily and therefore, it has resulted in an enormous backlog of cases in the High Court.  By September 2017, the total number of cases pending in the High Courts was 17,565.  Since the delay in the administration of justice results in bringing about adverse consequences, it is necessary to remedy this situation expeditiously. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice, to amend the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, making provisions to make it mandatory to conduct trials in the High Court daily, except in exceptional circumstances and for justifiable reasons sufficient to be recorded, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Accreditation of Raw Rubber and Chemical Analysis Laboratory of the  Rubber Research Institute of Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- The income from raw rubber an value added rubber products contribute 8% of the total national export revenue. The responsibility of quality certification of raw rubber used to manufacture rubber related products in Sri Lanka, in compliance with the international standards and advanced technology, introduced to Sri Lanka from time to time, has been entrusted with the 'Raw Rubber and Chemical Analysis Laboratory' of the Rubber Research Institute of Sri Lanka.

The laboratory which has been established 40 years ago, needs to be modified in compliance with the timely requirements and the international standards. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Navin Dissanayake, the Minister of  Plantation Industries, for the modernization of the Raw Rubber and Chemical Analysis Laboratory of the Rubber Research Institute of Sri Lanka as an accredited laboratory, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Building of the Colombo International Financial Complex (CIFC) in the Colombo Port City
decision_details:
- Presently around 50% of the reclamation work of the Colombo Port City Development Project is completed and the construction of the Colombo International Financial Complex is scheduled to be commenced in the latter part of the year 2018. The internal infrastructure facilities, construction plans required for the purpose have now been completed and its environment impact assessment is open for public comments. An international competition has been held to select the design for the proposed building complex and  'Skid more Owings and Merrill (SOM)' of the United States of America selected accordingly has been awarded the contract to design the complex.  

The investment for the proposed construction is around US$1 billion and accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to enter into a non-binding Memorandum of Understanding between the China Harbour Engineering Corporation, the Ministry of Megapolis and Western Development and the Colombo Port City (Pvt.) Ltd. to enable to secure this sum as a foreign direct investment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Building for the Sri Lanka Institute of Textile and Apparels
decision_details: - Providing of training, testing, technological and management consultancy services required for the apparel industry is vested with the Sri Lanka Institute of Textile and Apparel. Although, it was initially planned to construct a 04 storey building, considering its proposed activities and expansion for the future, it has been subsequently decided to make it a 6 storey building. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, the Minister of Industry and Commerce, to construct the said building with 6 storeys, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting of a land to construct a Studio Complex in the Northern Province for the Reconciliation Channel
decision_details:
- Since, the 'Channel EYE' launched as the second channel of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation and operated from the year 2000 prioritizes its air time for sports programmes, the necessity of an exclusive channel has arisen specially for the Tamil speaking people of the Northern and the Eastern Provinces. When promoting National Reconciliation since, the existence of a TV channel of this nature is a prerequisite, it has been decided to establish a new channel named the 'Reconciliation Channel' and a separate frequency has also been allocated. Orders have been placed by now to procure the required technological equipment for the new channel and a studio complex has to be constructed in the Northern Province for its broadcasting activities.

	As such, a 100 perches of land in the Chavakachcheri area in Jaffna, where the Meesalei Weerasingham Central College is situated has been set apart by the District Secretary of Jaffna for the construction of the said studio complex.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to vest the said land with the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation (SLRC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri  Lanka and Belgium on the Establishment of a Bilateral Consultation Mechanism
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Thilak Marapana, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on a Bilateral Consultation Mechanism between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka and the Federal Public Service Foreign Affairs, Foreign Trade and Development Cooperation of the Kingdom of Belgium with the objective of further strengthening the bilateral relations and the corporation between Sri Lanka and Belgium, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of Civil Aviation Operations in the Ratmalana Airport
decision_details:
- Ratmalana Airport was the first airport of the country which was established in the year 1938 for the commercial civil flight operations and it served both domestic and international flight operations until the Katunayake Airport was opened in the year 1969.  This airport has a 1,860 meter long and 45 meter wide runway and the land space of the airport is approximately 460 acres.  Although vast benefits could be accrued with the promotion of civil aviation operational activities in this airport which is situated in close proximity to the Colombo City, lack of adequate space has been an obstacle for the expansion of its activities.   

Therefore, it has been planned to get an extent of 25 acres situated to the South of the Air Port Runway to be used for civil aviation activities and accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, for the relocation of the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) facilities on the Southern Side of the Ratmalana Runway in the Northern Side with the consent of the SLAF, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Control of Forest Fires in Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- Forest fires is attributed as one of the major causes for the decline of natural forest cover in the country. There are no natural forest fires in Sri Lanka and it has been observed that all fires that emanate in the forest areas are due to the negligence or deliberate actions of human beings. Cattle owners, specially set fire on the grass lands with the objective of getting tender grass and these fires spread into forest resulting forest fires. Hunters set fire to the forests to hunt animals and the chena cultivators set fire to the forest to clear the land for cultivation. Further, the fire used by the labourers who work on the railway tracks, fires set by some villagers on their lands bordering the forest boundaries and cigarette buttes and matches discarded by the passers-by etc. result in negligent fires and some people set fire to the forest for pleasure as well.   

	Destruction of flora and fauna and the destruction of their habitats, due to forest fires in the dry zone such as  the exposure of soil and erosion during the subsequent rainy season, the blocking of streams and rivers and siltation of reservoirs reducing their water storage capacity, release of Carbon Dioxide to the atmosphere are several adverse effects that result due to forest fires.  In the year 2016 alone 2,945 hectares of forest lands have been subject to forest fires.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President, Maithripala Sirisena in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, with the objective of controlling and preventing forest fires, to implement a series of programmes to cover the whole Island for the establishment of fire belts to prevent the spread of fires, establishment of fire extinguishing emergency responsive units associated with areas where fires occur frequently and including public awareness of the matter, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the 'Institute of National Security Studies' of Sri Lanka by an Act of Parliament
decision_details:
- Sri Lanka, is strategically positioned geographically, with a risk of its being vulnerable to both traditional and non-traditional security threats. As such,  the 'Institute of National Security Studies of Sri Lanka' was established in the year 2016, as a think tank dedicated to work as the central repository  of knowledge on national security, for deliberations inclusive of the Government,  private sector and the civil society to make enable to discuss and take action on the issues identified pertaining to the national security and stability and the measures that could be adopted in that regard.  

	Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Defence, to establish the Institute of National Security Studies of Sri Lanka by an Act of Parliament to enable formally to achieve the said objectives and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill providing the necessary provision in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Firing Ranges and Military Training Act, No.24 of 1951
decision_details:
- The firing ranges established in the country are presently provided by the Ministry of Defence for training only to the Tri-Forces and the Sri Lanka Police. It has become a timely requirement to utilize these firing ranges for providing the training on firearms and explosives more formally to the persons recruited as security officers to the private security agencies, state banks, public institutions and the semi-government institutions and the sea marshals deployed for the protection of merchant vessels.

	Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to amend the Firing Ranges and Military Training Act, No.24 of 1951, to make enable to utilize the said firing ranges for the purpose intended, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The strike initiated by several categories of employees of the Department of Sri Lanka Railways
Leasing out of the Port property and the Common Amenities to commence the operational activities of the Hambantota Port
decision_details:
- In accordance with the conditions laid down in the Concessionary Agreement  singed on the 29th of July 2017 to develop the Hambantota Port by expanding its operational activities under the  Public-Private Partnership (PPP) initiative, the Port property and the common amenities should be given over to the Hambantota International Port Group (Pvt.) Ltd. (HIPG) and the Hambantota International Port Services Company (Pvt.)Ltd.(HIPS) on lease basis, in order to commence the operational activities of the Port. 

	The Lease Agreements pertaining to the lease of the Port property and the common amenities were signed earlier and accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to issue instructions to the relevant State Institutions in regard to the implementation of the Agreements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expediting the restoration activities of the seven storeyed building of the District General Hospital in  Negombo
decision_details: - The contract for the restoration of the seven storeyed building of the District General Hospital in  Negombo has been vested with the State Development and Construction Corporation (SD&CC) in the year 2015. It has been observed that the said restoration activities are moving at a slow pace and as a result, the patients and the hospital staff are faced with a number of difficulties. As such, in accordance with the request made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, the Cabinet granted approval to obtain the services of the Sri Lanka Army for expediting the said construction activities.

title: The Report of the Officials’ Committee appointed in terms of the Cabinet decision dated 2017-10-03 on 'Procurement of Vehicles for Government Agencies'
decision_details:
- The Cabinet at its meeting held on 03rd October 2017 decided to appoint an Officials' Committee, under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the President, to examine the issues that have surfaced in implementing the 'Operational Leasing Method' which is presently being adopted for procuring vehicles for the Government Institutions and submit recommendations. Accordingly, approval of the Cabinet was granted to implement the following recommendations made by the said Committee.

i. 	Procurement of vehicles required for political authorities such as  Ministers, State Ministers and Deputy Ministers through the Direct Purchase method.

ii. 	Procurement of vehicles required for the Senior Officers of the Government through the Financial leasing  method.

iii. 	Further following the Operational Leasing Method for Double Cabs for heavy usage and high maintenance and vehicles with several passenger seats.

iv. 	Operating a formal procedure for the productive use of vehicles of the Government Institutions by the Comptroller General of the General Treasury.

v.  	The Chief Accounting Officer of the relevant Ministry to ensure that an officer is entitled to a single vehicle in terms of a formal approval. 

vi.  	Granting priority to procure vehicles with Hybrid engines and taking action for the disposal of vehicles over 10 years, considering their high maintenance cost.

title: Introduction of the Electronic Government Procurement (e-GP) to the Public Procurement System in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Considering the benefits to be achieved by the institutions of both public and private sectors, by enhancing the transparency of the Public Procurement System, monitoring and regulating the procurement process, deriving large scale economic benefits through integrated procurement, treating the suppliers equally and by creating a competitive platform for them, the Electronic  Procurement System needs to be introduced without delay.  The proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to introduce the Electronic Procurement System to the Public Procurement System in Sri Lanka, on the recommendations submitted by the working group appointed for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of two Pilot Launches for the Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - It has become necessary to purchase two (02) Pilot  Launches for the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, to provide efficient navigational services to the vessels arriving at the Port of Colombo. For this purpose, a financial allocation of Rs.500 million has been made out of the funds of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to purchase two (02) Pilot Launches by calling for International Competitive Bids, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of equipment required for the construction of four New Grid Substations at Nawalapitiya, Ragala, Wewalwatta and Maliboda
decision_details:
- In order to interconnect the electricity generated in the mini hydro power plants with the main electricity transmission system, the Ceylon Electricity Board has planned to construct four (04) Grid Substations at Nawalapitiya, Ragala, Wewalwatta and Maliboda and the related transmission lines. Its construction activities are implemented under 03 packages and under the package 02 of them, the essential equipment are purchased as Lot A and Lot B.

	As such, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to award the contract for the purchase of equipment under Lot A in package 02 to M/s Siemens Ltd., for a sum of Rs.297.2 million and the contract for the purchase of equipment under Lot B to M/s Ceylex Engineering (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs.122.9 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Management of the Warehouse Complexes being constructed in the Districts of Polonnaruwa, Killinochchi and Ratnapura
decision_details:
- As a solution for the decline of prices of agricultural products due to the glut situation of such products in the market during the harvesting period, the Government has implemented a project for providing high quality storage facilities to the farmers to store their agricultural crops. Under this project, action has been taken to construct 03 warehouse complexes in the Districts of Polonnaruwa, Kilinochchi and Ratnapura at the cost of Rs.600 million. Out of them, the construction of the warehouse at Ratnapura has already been completed and the construction work of the other two warehouses is due to be completed by early 2018. 

It has been identified that it would be appropriate to assign the management of these warehouse complexes with an external party, on the basis of a monthly fee. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to assign the contracts for the management of warehouses at Polonnaruwa, Ratnapura and Kilinochchi, to the Regional Development Bank with experience in this regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement to the Passenger Terminal Capacity of the Interim Terminal Building at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA)
decision_details:
- The design capacity of the passenger terminal building of the  Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) is 6 million air passengers per annum.  However, 9.5 million air passengers have been handled in the year 2016 and this number continuous to increase annually. As such, in order to increase the annual  passenger handling capacity up to 15 million a project for the construction of a new passenger terminal has been initiated. 

It is expected that the construction activities of the terminal can be finalized around the year 2022 and until such time, in order to address the congestion of the air passenger traffic, as an intermediary solution,  it has been proposed to construct a pre-fabricated passenger terminal.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to take necessary action to finalize the construction of a pre-fabricated building by the end of year 2018, to facilitate 400 departing passengers in an hour at peak hours, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Calling for Bids for the construction of an Airport Hotel
decision_details:
- With a view to providing a better service to the air passengers and tourists, two investors have been provided with blocks of land for the construction and maintenance of two hotels with Star Class in two blocks of land located in the Katunayake Bandaranaike International Airport, belonging to the Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) Limited (AASL). However, due to the failure of pursuing action by those investors in terms of their proposals, it has been decided to call for Requests for Proposals (RFP) once again, in respect of those blocks of land. 

	As such, proposals have already been called upon for the construction of a 4-Star Airport hotel in one of the blocks of land and the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to call for proposals to select a suitable investor for the construction and maintenance of a 2-Star Airport Hotel in the other block of land, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of uniform and other clothing materials for the Tri-Forces, Department of Civil Security and the National Cadet Corps
decision_details: - The uniforms and other clothing materials required for the Sri Lanka Army, Sri Lanka Navy, Sri Lanka Air Force, Department of Civil Security and the National Cadet Corps are supplied by calling quotations from the Local Textile Manufacturers. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Defence, to purchase the uniforms and clothing material required for the year 2017, from the local textile manufacturing institutions recommended by the Domestic Textile Allocation Committee, at the cost of Rs.1,887.8 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing of an Information and Communication Technology System for Blocks 06 and 07 in the Akuregoda Defence Headquarters Complex Project
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Defence, to award the construction for the provision of an Information & Communication Technology System for Blocks 06 and 07 in the Akuregoda Defence Headquarters Complex, to M/s VS Information (Pvt.) Ltd., at a sum of Rs.372.06 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Specialized Consultancy for the Sri Lanka Police Reforms
decision_details:
- Reforming of the Sri Lanka Police so as to suit the present and future goals is a timely need. A Committee comprising of experts of the relevant field was appointed for the purpose of making recommendations and the said Committee has stressed the need for the transformation of the Sri Lanka Police service into a dignified profession which upholds the principles of Good Governance. 

As such, it has been decided to secure the services of an experienced consultant to implement the recommendations made by the said Committee. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayake, the Minister of Law & Order and Southern Development, to seek the assistance of the British National Sir Hugh Orde, a British National with vast expertise on Police Reforms, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading the Milk Production Network in Jaffna
decision_details:
- It has been observed that the need for milk is more than 5,000 litre per day in Jaffana town and the surrounding areas. Consumption of liquid milk is also hiking up and therefore, in order to fulfill the need, it is imperative that the facilities be upgraded for the management of milk production.

As such, it has been planned to purchase machines to pasteurize milk and  hand over these machines to the YARLCO milk processing factory of the Jaffna District Development Cooperative Society so as to expand and strengthen the liquid milk and milk related production network in the Jaffana District. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. D.M. Swaminathan, the Minister of Prison Reforms, Rehabilitation, Resettlement and Hindu Religious Affairs, to implement the proposed project at an estimated cost of Rs. 59.8 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of the Port of Kankesanthurai
decision_details:
- The Port of Kankesanthurai located 15 km in North to the City of Jaffna was a Port constructed for the transportation of raw materials required for the Kankesanthurai Cement Factory. Cargo Vessels below 2,500 tons can be operated at this Port which is around 06 metres in depth. Since this Port is located in close proximity with Indian Harbours, there is a potential of connecting this with the international shipping activities, enhancing regional industries and developing the same as a Regional Harbour providing the services required for the Northern and North Central Provinces.

Accordingly, the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) has designed plans for the rehabilitation of the breakwater of the Port of Kankesanthurai, construction of a new jetty in order to expand its commercial operations. It has been decided to establish a Warehouse and to construct an Administration Building. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to transfer a land in extent of 50 acres required for the purpose, from the Sri Lanka Cement Corporation, over to the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining an alternative land from Kundasale in Kandy for the 'Nilasevana' housing project
decision_details:
- It has been planned to construct a Housing Complex in the Kundasale area in Kandy under the 'Nilasevana' Housing Project implemented as a Public-Private Partnership Project, with a view to providing houses to Public Officers. Since the land allocated for the purpose is situated adjacent to the Meditation Centre, it has been decided to implement the project in another location, taking into consideration the hindrances that could be caused to the activities taking place at this religious site.

As such, the joint proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Maddumabandara, the Minister of Public Administration and Management and Hon. Malik Samarawickrema, the Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade, to allocate a block of land situated in the Mahawatta village in the Kundasale area as an alternative land, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enhancing the Performance of State Plantation Companies
decision_details:
- There are 49,654 hectares of land under the custody of the State Plantation Companies and the direct employment opportunities provided by the companies are 16,373. The weak financial position, excessive of statutory obligations, outdated agricultural practices, inefficient management practices and different external factors have resulted in long term under-performance of these plantation companies.

Therefore, a proposal has been made to implement a performance enhancing process of these plantation companies through the introduction of modern technology and crop varieties, optimum utilization of land and natural resources, access for private investments, institutional development and providing solutions for difficulties faced by those who are engaged in the plantation sector. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Kabir Hashim, the Minister of Public Enterprise Development, to implement the proposed project in respect of the Janatha Estates Development Board (JEDB), Sri Lanka State Plantations Corporation (SLSPC), Elkaduwa Plantations Limited (EPL), Gal-Oya Plantations and the Sri Lanka Cashew Corporation (SLCC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Promoting Ceylon Tea in the People's Republic of China
decision_details:
- Owing to the qualitative aspect of Ceylon Tea, an opportunity has been created to popularize Ceylon Tea within China which inherits a deeply rooted culture for tea.  Since the Chinese people shows a trend towards consumption from green tea up to black tea, it has been recognized that the introduction of a formal procedure to popularize black tea of Sri Lanka in the Chinese market is appropriate.

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Navin Dissanayake, the Minister of  Plantation Industries, to prepare a specific procedure for the purpose subsequent to discussions with the relevant institutions in the the People's Republic of China and to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding for conducting tea auctions in China, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Joint Ventures centered around Fishery Harbours and Anchorages under the Fishery Harbour Village Programme
decision_details:
- The attention of the Government has been focused to create a new business community, generate new employment opportunities and increase the fishery products export revenue with the use of the facilities found in the Fishery Harbours and obtaining the participation of the people living closer to the Fishery Harbours, by establishing the value added fishery products and services with the corporation of the private sector investors as well.

	Accordingly, the approval of the Cabinet has been granted to obtain the assistance of the local and foreign investors for the diversification of the  fishery harbour operations under the Fishery Harbour Village Programme. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, to create service facilities and the improvement of infrastructure facilities associated with all fishery harbours of Dikkowita, Modara, Galle, Cod Bay and Oluvil and facilities pertaining to the repairs of fishery and non-fishery vessels, to support tourism by improving the infrastructure facilities in close proximity to all fishery harbours and anchorages, the construction of solar power and wind power plants inclusive of the implementation of several other projects, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Authorization for the construction of a new Brackish Water Shrimp Farm in the Puttalam District
decision_details:
