- Brackish Water Shrimp Farming is the main commercial aquaculture activity presently carried out in Sri Lanka and  in the Puttalam District alone where it is found more popularly there are 1,320 shrimp farms in an extent of 4,500 hectares.  The main source of water supply for these farms is the Dutch Canal that connects Chilaw, Puttalam and the Mundalama lagoons. Taking into consideration, the adverse effects caused to the industry due to exceeding of its maximum limits of water intake and the non availability of an adequate water source to open up farms, the usage of new lands for shrimp farming in the District was terminated in the year 2003.  

By now the usage of water in the Dutch Canal is carried out sustainably by providing water on a seasonal time table.  Similarly, the semi intensive farming method presently adopted under a low stocking density in place of the high intensive farming method has prompted for new proposals being made to open up shrimp farms in the Puttalam District.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, to take up project proposals which could be assured to have high potential with the objective of promoting shrimp farming industry in the Puttalam District under the high intensive farming method only, under a strict regulatory method, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Payment of compensation for the acquisition of lands for the development activities of the George Rajapaksha Playground at Weeraketiya
decision_details: - Under the Weeraketiya City Development Project, a land in extent of 0.3288 hectares has been acquired by the Urban Development Authority (UDA) for the development of the George Rajapaksha Playground. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to secure funds amounting to Rs.19.5 million required for the payment of compensation and the interest for the lands so acquired, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of Transport infrastructure facilities to the Colombo Port City - Construction of the underground Marine Drive Extension
decision_details: - It has been planned to adopt the Public-Private Partnership methodology for the construction activities of the infrastructure facilities of the proposed Colombo Port City. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to implement the project for the construction of the underground Marine Drive Extension as  an entry into the Port City from the Colpetty Railway Station up to Colombo Chaithya Road, with the Port City Project Company as a Public‑Private Partnership Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Certification System on Health and Safety in the Textile and Apparel Products
decision_details:
- It is a complicated matter to identify the qualitatively right clothes for use out of the varieties of clothes found in the market. Attention must be paid on the health safety on the raw materials and the other chemicals used specially in the manufacture and pacing of fabrics  and the manufactures and consumers should be provided with adequate knowledge of this matter.

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, the Minister of Industry and Commerce, to make health and safety certification as a mandatory requirement for locally manufactured and imported textile and apparel products prior to gaining entry into the local market, to authorize the Sri Lanka Institute of Textile and Apparel as the agent responsible for certification, to decide relevant criterion with the assistance of the Sri Lanka Standards Institute and to make the process enforceable through the Consumer Affairs Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Governments of the Member States of the Indian Ocean Rim Association for the promotion of Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs)
decision_details: - The Indian Ocean Rim Association with the objective of driving innovation and competition among the member countries, has focused its attention to connect micro-enterprises and the informal sector with large companies and international value chains and thereby, to promote Small and Medium scale Enterprises. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, the Minister of Industry and Commerce, for a suitable authority of the Ministry of Industry and Commerce on behalf of Sri Lanka to sign the Memorandum of Understanding to be entered into between the member countries of the said Association, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Prescribing the Minimum Standards for the Medical Education
decision_details:
- Publishing of Minimum Standards on Medical Education under the Medical Ordinance, was a long felt need. The Sri Lanka Medical Council has drafted  the Minimum Standards required for the Medical Education so as to cover the relevant sectors of medical education such as the minimum qualifications required for university entrance, content in the courses for medical education, assessment of medical students, academic staff, resources and facilities for education, course reviews, updating the syllabuses continuously and administration and management. All the relevant stakeholders including the Sri Lanka Medical Council, the University Grants Commission and the Attorney General have reached consensus with regard to the regulation of standards. 

The Cabinet has decided to treat that the minimum qualification required for every student for entry into a University of Sri Lanka to follow Medical Education to be a minimum of two (02) Credit passes and an Ordinary pass obtained at the G.C.E. (A/L) Examination for Biology, Chemistry and Physics, at one and the same sitting. 

 Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to publish in the Government Gazette the Minimum Standards for Medical Education in Sri Lanka as Regulations under the Medical Ordinance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Acquisition of Competencies on Nano-Satellite Technologies and Space Engineering
decision_details:
- The institute of technology KYUTECH, one of the National Universities of Japan, has implemented a programme, with the aim of granting capability of basic satellite technologies acquisition for the countries which have not  undertaken space faring. Thereby it provides experiences on the whole process of planning, designing, developing, fabricating, examining, launching and operating a Nano-Satellite. Under its first stage, a Satellite has been successfully launched to the orbit by a team of engineers representing the countries of Japan, Mongolia,Ghana and Bangladesh.


Two Engineers of the Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies (ACCIMT) have been selected for designing a  Nano-Satellite and launching it under the next stage of this programme and thereby it would be able for Sri Lanka to obtain knowledge and experiences of this field. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, the Minister of Science, Technology and Research, to enter into a Cooperative Research Agreement with the Japanese National University - Kyushu Institute of Technology (KYUTECH), Japan and the Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies (ACCIMT) on the participation in the Nano-Satellite programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of incubators in five districts
decision_details: - Rs.100 million has been allocated through the Budget proposals 2017, to establish an Innovation Accelerator Fund and to set up incubators in five districts to support startup. Accordingly, it has been designed to implement the Innovation Accelerator Fund under the Innovators Fund presently being operated and measures have been taken to set up incubators through the Universities of Peradeniya and Jaffna and the National Engineering Research and Development Corporation. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, the Minister of Science, Technology and Research, to allocate the funds required for implementing the proposed two projects to the Sri Lanka Inventors Commission, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing compensation to persons who had private ownership of their lands which were damaged due to the landslide and those situated in the high risk zones at Meethotamulla, solid waste dump
decision_details:
- All persons who have expressed their willingness to accept alternative houses out of the house owners evacuated due to the damages and the high risk situation on account of the landslide of the solid waste dump at Meethotamulla, have been provided with such houses and the number of houses so provided is 170.  

	Consequent to this disaster, action has been taken to acquire lands where the damaged houses are located in the risk zone marked by the National Building Research Organization (NBRO) and 110 such land owners have been identified. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, the Minister of Disaster Management, to pay the assessed value of the lands and houses of those 110 land owners as compensation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Hydrology Study - Kalmunai Master Plan Project
decision_details: - The task of preparing the Master Plan on Integrated Township Development in the areas of Kalmunai and Sammanthurai has been vested with the Ministry of City Planning and Water Supply and the plan is being prepared with the assistance of the University of Moratuwa. For the purpose, a comprehensive hydrological study needs to be carried out.  Out of this study, it is expected to create a suitable system to prevent the floods occurring due to the water-logging issue in the Kalmunai area.  As such, the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with M/s Hydroinformatics Institute Pte. Ltd. of Singapore, to obtain the assistance of the Institute to carry out the Hydrological Study, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief to the affected persons due to the acquisition of lands  for the construction of a New Railway Track from Kurunegala to Habarana via Dambulla
decision_details: - An extent of approximately 300 acres will have to be acquired for the project for the construction of a new Railway Track 84 kms in length from Kurunegala to Habarana via Dambulla under the 'Awakening Rajarata' Presidential Programme - 'Let's Awaken Polonnaruwa' District Development Programme 2016 - 2020. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to follow the special procedure adopted in respect of the payment of compensation for the the acquisition of lands for large scale projects, with a view to carrying out the acquisition activities expeditiously without an interruption, in order to make a more justifiable compensation for the persons who are affected due to the acquisition of their lands, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of the Royal Botanical Gardens at Peradeniya
decision_details:
- The Royal Botanical Gardens at Peradeniya which is more than 196 years old is comprised of 147 acres of land where more than 3,500 plant species are conserved. This internationally acclaimed botanical gardens has an annual turnout of approximately 1.6 million local and foreign tourists and it has been planned to further improve the available facilities, considering the objectives of the spectators in regard to education, research and recreation. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Sustainable Development and Wildlife, to implement a project for the development of the Royal Botanical Gardens at Peradeniya within the next period of 05 years and to secure funds amounting to Rs.385 million necessary for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Establishment of a Vocational Training Centre for the Tourism Industry in the Nilaveli area of Trincomalee
decision_details:
- The National Youth Services Council has planned to commence a training centre in the Nilaveli area of Trincomalee in the year 2018 for training the youth for job opportunities in the tourism industry. 

	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to get 200 acres of land situated in the Nilaveli area vested with the Tourism Development Authority to be vested with the Ministry of National Policies and Economic Affairs for the establishment of the proposed training centre, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Continuation of the '1990 Suwaseriya' Emergency Pre-hospital Care Ambulance Service
decision_details:
- The Emergency Pre-hospital Care Ambulance Service which commenced in the Southern and Western Provinces with Indian Grant Assistance is presently implemented successfully and the approval of the Cabinet has been granted to establish the '1990 Suwaseriya Foundation' by an Act of Parliament for the uninterrupted supply of the service. The Drafting of the Bill for the purpose is in progress.

	Under Phase II of this initiative, the Government of India has agreed to provide an additional grant facility for the expansion of the above service in the other seven Provinces as well, by deploying 209 additional ambulances. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs,  to extend the period of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) entered into between the GVK EMRI Lanka (Pvt.) (GEL) Ltd. and the Ministry of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine to continue the service uninterruptedly until the '1990 Suwaseriya Foundation' is established, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the participation of the people to protect the forests in the Dry   Zones
decision_details:
- In accordance with the census  and statistics data of the year 2010 the total land area of the Island is 29.7%. The importance of the participation of the people for forest management has been recognized by the National Forest Policy as well and the Department of Forest Conservation has introduced various strategies for the purpose.  It is essential to further implement the programmes of this nature with a view to increasing further the forest cover of the country and its sustainability. 

	As such, a proposal has been made to activate the 'Sri Lanka Community Forestry Programme' for the upliftment of the economic status of the community living closer to the forests and the protection of the forest. Under this programme, it is expected to take measures such as introducing livelihood methods to enhance the economic status of the rural community living in close proximity to the forests in the 17 Districts which represent the Dry Zone and the Intermediate Zone of Sri Lanka, providing the necessary training equipment for such purpose, activating home gardening and inducing the school going children to engage in forest conservation etc. Through this programme, it will be possible to provide direct economic benefits to over 20,000 persons and the conservation of about 30,000 hectares of forest land. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment,  to implement the above project at a cost of Rs.261.06 million, within the period from 2018-2020, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a new building for the Jaffna District Office of the Election Commission
decision_details:
- Twenty five Divisional Offices have been established at the level of Administrative Districts to facilitate in carrying out the statutory as well as the administrative functions of the Election Commission. Since the Jaffna Election Office functions within a limited space set apart from the Jaffna District Secretariat building with inadequate facilities, the need for the construction of a separate office building for same has been identified and for this purpose, a plot of land belonging to the Government within the municipal limits of Jaffna has already been allocated.

	Accordingly, taking into consideration the present and future needs,              the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to construct a  4 storey building with a floor area of 18,425 sq.ft. for the Election Office of the Jaffna District and to secure funds amounting to Rs.97.7 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Short Term Measures for reducing the Cost of Living
Performing of Emergency Heart Surgeries through Private Hospitals
decision_details: - As the two theaters of the Cardiology unit of the Colombo National Hospital, are under renovation, the heart surgeries performed there have been suspended. As such, the Colombo National Hospital is presently transferring the patients there over to the Sri Jayawardhanapura Hospital for heart surgeries, but it has not been an adequate measure to overcome the issue. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister and Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to make necessary arrangements to refer the heart patients over to the private hospitals where cardiology units are available, for emergency treatments, at Government expense and to expedite the renovation work of the Cardiology unit in the Colombo National Hospital, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Consultancy Services for the Feasibility Study and the Detailed Design of Colombo Suburban Railway Project
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to award the Consultancy Services Contract for the   Feasibility Study and the Detailed Design of the project implemented with the objective of upgrading the railway system in Colombo and Suburban areas to M/s DOHWA Engineering Co. Ltd., and its partners for a sum of 256,030 Sterling Pounds, US$ 6,481,575 and Rs.379,213,616 as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultancy Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting Rs.50,000/- as house rent allowance further for the owners of the houses evacuated due to the Landslide which occurred at the Meethotamulla Garbage Dump
decision_details:
- Under the first and second phase of the housing programme  to provide houses for those who were deprived of their houses and the families evacuated from their dwelling houses which were prone to high risk as a result of the landslides which occurred in the garbage dump at Meethotamulla in Kolonnawa on the 2017-04-14, have been provided with houses to 98 families  and another 72 families have been provided with alternative houses on 2017-11-08 under the third phase of the programme.

The families were given a monthly house rent allowance of Rs.50,000/- up to the month of August 2017 until they were resettled. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, the Minister of Disaster Management, to grant the house rent allowance for the 72 families who were resettled for the last time for the period of two (02)  months up to August 2017, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Planning of Public Investments  Efficiently  and  the Programmatic Project Preparation Facility
decision_details: - Programmatic Project Preparation Facility- PPPF has been designed to be implemented with the aim of achieving the desired objectives of improving the quality at the inception of projects implemented by the Government, improving the implementation mechanisms and enhancing the capacity of making project preparation documents within the different Government Agencies. Therefore,in order to secure US $ 4 million required for the purpose, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to enter into a Financing Agreement with the World Bank, was approved with Cabinet.

title: Managing the Public Expenditure for the Reconstruction of Properties Damaged due to the adverse weather
decision_details: - The General Treasury has already provided an additional allocation of Rs.32 billion to restore the livelihood of the affected people due to drought, flood and adverse weather during the recent times and to rehabilitate the damaged properties. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to make use of the provisions which have not been utilized so far by various  ministries, so that the funds further required for the purpose, could be managed within the provisions which have already been granted, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of the Shareholder Agreement for the commencement of the 	operational activities of the Port of Hambantota
decision_details:
- In order to develop the Port of Hambantota by expanding its operations under the Public-Private Partnership, a Concession Agreement was signed on 29th July 2017 among the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA), the Government of Sri Lanka, China Merchants Port Holdings Company Limited (CM Port), Hambantota International Port Group (Private) Limited (HIPG) and Hambantota International Port Services (Private) Limited (HIPS). Accordingly, International Port Group (Private) Limited (HIPG) and Hambantota International Port Services (Private) Limited (HIPS), the two unique services companies established for the development of the Port of Hambantota, have planned to commence its operational activities on 09th December 2017 on the terms agreed upon in the Agreement. 
	85% of the Share Capital of the HIPG Company will be possessed by the CM Port Company or its affiliation and 15% of the same will be vested with the Sri  Lanka Ports Authority. Similarly, 58% of the Share Capital of the HIPS Company will be possessed by the HIPG Company and the rest of 42% will be vested with the Sri Lanka Ports Authority. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to sign the Shareholder Agreement prepared as a Supplementary Agreement to the Original Agreement among the relevant parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Left Bank Main Canal of the Yan Oya Reservoir Project
decision_details: - The Yan Oya Reservoir Development Project, which is one of the major scale irrigation development projects implemented in Sri Lanka in the recent times, provides water to around 4,190 hectares of lands in the areas of the Districts of Anuradhapura and Trincomalee faced with scarcity of water for cultivation purposes. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to award the contract for the construction of the Left Bank Main Canal of the project, to M/s China CAMC Engineering Co. Ltd., (CAMCE), for  a sum of US$ 39.5 million on design and built basis, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee (CANC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of Solar Power Systems to the Public Institutions under the  	Soorya Bala Sangramaya Programme
decision_details: - Under the Soorya Bala Sangramaya Programme, a project has been planned to provide Solar Power Systems to the Public Institutions. The Sustainable Energy Authority has identified such public institutions where the solar power systems can be installed for the purpose and tenders have been called for to select suitable institutions for the purpose of installing these solar power systems. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to award the contracts for the installation of solar power systems in 63 Government hospitals, 13 Government schools and 01 Divisional Secretariat Division, to the institutions recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Fair and the Commercial Building at the Kurusa Junction at Alubomulla in Bandaragama
decision_details: - It has been proposed to construct a Fair, a Commercial Complex and a Multi-purpose building in the land belonging to the Bandaragama Multi Purpose Cooperative Society, located in close proximity to the Kurusa Junction at Alubomulla in Bandaragama along the Panadura - Horana main road. It is expected to construct 120 trade stalls under this project. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to implement this project at an estimated cost of Rs.200 million under the 'Sukithapurawara' Township Development Programme and to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the said Cooperative Society for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Consultancy Services required for the Township Development Programmes to be implemented in 2018
decision_details: - Under the 'Sukithapurawara' Township Development Programme implemented by the Ministry of Megapolis and Western Development, it has been proposed to implement 80 new projects in the year 2018. With a view to completing the new projects expeditiously, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to vest the contracts for the provision of consultancy services required according to the nature of each construction work, with the Urban Development Authority (UDA), Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB), State Engineering Corporation (SEC), Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation (SLLR&DC), Provincial Road Development Authority (PRDA), Road Development Authority (RDA) and the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the Surgical / Medical Units at the Teaching Hospital at Karapitiya
decision_details: - It is essential to extend the Surgical / Medical Units at the Teaching Hospital at Karapitiya in Galle, which is one of the major hospitals in Sri Lanka, in order to enhance its surgical and medical facilities. As such, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to award the contract of its construction, to M/s Subasinghe Contractors & Earth Movers for a sum of Rs.690 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of the contract for the External Work and the Land Development Work of the Modern Research and Development Complex (MRDC)
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, the Minister of Science, Technology and Research, to award the contract for the External Work and the Land Development Work of the Modern Research and Development Complex (MRDC) at the Industrial Technology Institute (ITI) situated in the Malabe area, to M/s. Ranasiha Lanka Construction (Pvt.) Ltd. for a sum of Rs.215.9 million as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Library Building Complex at the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to award the contract of Phase-1 of the project for the construction of the Library Building Complex at the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka, to M/s CML-MTD Construction Ltd., for a sum of Rs.315 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of the National Holiday Resorts (NHR)
decision_details: - The national holiday resorts situated in Anuradhapura, Nuwara Eliya, Bandarawela and Katharagama and managed by the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority are very popular among the Public Officers and the domestic holiday seekers. As such, the proposal made by Hon.John Amaratunga, the Minister of Tourism Development and Christian Religious Affairs, to redevelop the holiday resorts with a view to making those more attractive to tourists, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation and Reactivation of Myliddy Fishery Harbour
decision_details:
- In the decade of 1980, the Myliddy fishery harbour situated in the Walikkamam area of Jaffna was a major fishery harbour which provided a significant contribution towards the fishery industry and it was considered unique due to the fact that it could be used even during the North East monsoon period. During the period of the conflict, the activities of this harbour was disrupted and with the re-emergence of a peaceful environment in the Northern Province, the fisheries  harbour and its 54 acre land has been released in July 2017 enabling it to be used for the fisheries industry. 

	Since, the displaced people who were living in the area have returned to the area once again, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs,  to take measures to commence the renovation activities expeditiously in the Myliddy fishery harbour, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement to the Existing Network Infrastructure at the Parliament
decision_details: - The need for the adoption of the state-of-the-art technologies to effectively carry out the essential administrative and parliamentary functions of the Parliament of Sri Lanka has been recognized. In this regard the e-Parliament project is implemented by the Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka (ICTA).  In this respect, it is essential to improve the existing computer network infrastructure facilities and as such, the proposal made by Hon. Harin Fernando, the Minister of Telecommunication and Digital Infrastructure, to adopt the Government Procurement Procedure to select an appropriate agency for the supply of the necessary equipment and the services, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of infrastructure road facilities for the plantation community
decision_details: - Due to the difficulty in accessing the facilities such as health,  education, safety water and other infrastructure, the life indicators pertaining to the plantation region are low when compared to the other areas of the country. As such, it is essential to improve the road development activities for easy access to such infrastructure facilities. Accordingly,  the proposal made by Hon. U. Palani Digambaram, the Minister of  Hill Country New Villages, Infrastructure and Community Development, to rehabilitate the road section in the Hatton area leading from Brodack to Abbotsligh by mettalling and taring, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of lands on Lease Basis for a farming project of Milkfish (Chanos Chanos)
decision_details:
- In the long line fishing method used for harvesting the major commodities of Sri Lankan fish exports such as Tuna and Bill Fish, Squids, Milkfish and Gold Strip Sardinella are used as baits. Though about 7,000 MT of baits are required for the purpose annually, only around 3,000 MT of the same is satisfied locally. Since, more baits have to be imported the price of the major domestic commodities of fish exports rise and causes adverse effects on imposing a competitive price for those products in the International Market.

	It will be beneficial to produce milkfish (Chanos Chanos) at commercial level to be used as bait as well as for human consumption and it may lead to saving a some amount of foreign currency out of over of Rs.01 billion spent annually for the importation of baits.   The All Island Multiday Fishing Vessels Owners' Association has presented a project proposal for conducting intensive farming of milkfish. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, to grant a block of land 12.14 hectares in extent located in Bangadeniya in the District of Puttalam, belonging to the National Aquaculture Development Authority of Sri Lanka (NAQDA), on lease basis, to the said Association for the implementation of the project by the National Aquaculture Development Authority of Sri Lanka as the Government Partner on Public-Private Partnership basis, subject to carrying out a specific environmental impact assessment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Teledrama, Film and Commercials Levy
decision_details:
- Taking into consideration the impact on the local teledramas and the film industry by dubbed foreign teledramas, films and commercials flowing into the country, it has been proposed in the budget 2017 to increase the 'Teledrama, Film and Commercial Levy' imposed on the teledramas, films and commercials dubbed in sinhala or tamil language. 

As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to present the Extraordinary Gazette Notification No.2044/21 dated 2017-11-07 published in terms of the provisions of the Finance Act, No.11 of 2006 amending the relevant levy, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enactment of Laws for the prevention of touting at the Airport
decision_details:
- Considering the difficulties faced by the air passengers due to various unauthorized touts being present at the common areas of the Bandaranaike International Airport, approval of the Cabinet has been granted to enact laws to control such activities. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to publish the draft Bill to amend the Civil Aviation Act, No.14 of 2010 in the Government Gazette providing for touting and for loading any baggage to vehicles by unauthorized persons at the Airport as offences under the Civil Aviation Act and for the arrest of such persons committing such offences and to file action in the Magistrate Court having the  jurisdiction over the area where the Airport is situated without the sanction of the Attorney General, and subsequently, to present it in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Bilateral Air Services Agreement between Tanzania, Rwanda, Azerbaijan, Poland  and Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to sign the proposed Air Services Agreements between Sri Lanka, Tanzania, Rwanda, Azerbaijan and Poland, presently, agreed upon at the official level and  subsequently to take appropriate measures for its entry into force, with a view to formalizing the Air Services between each country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Securing Financial Aid from the Government of Hungary for the development Projects
decision_details:
- The Government of Hungary has agreed to provide funds for the development of some of the projects implemented by the Government of Sri Lanka. Under this programme, concessionary loan facilities in a sum of Euro 149 million will be provided for, in respect of the following  projects through the Import and Export Bank of Hungary.

	1.	Bingiriya - Udubaddawa Water Supply Project (Euro 53 million)

2.	Construction of Flyovers - Kohuwala, Kirulapona and Yangalmodara (Euro 52 million)
	3.	Electronic Court Management System (Euro 32 million)

	4.	Railway Level Crossing Protection Project (Euro 12 million)

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to enter into an Aid Credit Framework Programme Agreement with the Government of Hungary in respect of the said loan facility, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a 400 MW Natural Gas Power Plant in Hambantota
decision_details: - Considering the importance of the introduction of natural gas as a resource for the energy generation field in Sri Lanka, deliberations have been made to establish a 400 MW Natural Gas Power Plant in Hambantota by the Governments of China and Sri Lanka jointly, on Government to Government basis. With the main objective of providing electricity to the industrial zone proposed to be established in Hambantota and avoiding the possible scarcity of electricity in future, it is due to be implemented as a special project. Accordingly, the  proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to set up this Natural Gas Power Plant and the Natural Gas Unloading Terminal between the China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) nominated by the Government of China and the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) as a Joint Venture, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing of facilities for the establishment of an Internationally recognized Business School in Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- The Government has recognized the importance of taking modern and sustainable measures to achieve an expeditious economic growth by transforming Sri Lanka into a knowledge based economy.  As such, the Cabinet approval has been granted to establish a world recognized engineering school and a business school in Sri Lanka to provide the knowledge and the professional skill necessary to enhance the qualitative aspect of the workforce of the country. 

As a result of discussions had with the renowned universities of the world, a proposal has been put forward by the Berkeley Haas Business School in California of the United States of the America to establish a Business School in Sri Lanka on a not-for-profit basis. The University expects to establish the proposed Business School as a regional hub of the Indian Ocean. The educational opportunities will be open to the bright students possessing skills and talents, irrespective of their financial background.

This business school has been planned to be established in the District of Gampaha and the joint proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs,  Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways and Hon. Susil Premajayantha, the Minister of Science, Technology and Research, to provide for its initial planning activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting of Concessionary Loans to students to follow Degree Programmes
decision_details:
- In accordance with a proposal made in the National Budget of 2017, the Government has launched a project to provide an interest free concessionary loan facility subject to a maximum limit of Rs.800,000 to facilitate the students who were unable to secure admission to the state universities due to the z-score method adopted, to follow the degree programmes offered by the Non-Governmental Degree Awarding Institutions. To coincide with this, the Cabinet approval has also been granted to provide a loan up to a Rs.1.1 million to the youth who have passed the G.C.E. (A/L) so as to cover their general expenses as well, to follow the Degree in Education Programmes from the non-governmental Higher Educational Institutes.  

	As such, in addition to the expenditure to cover the course fee and the books through this loan to the youth who follow other Degree Programmes, a proposal has been made to add Rs.75,000/- for the other general expenses as well. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to enhance the maximum amount of this loan granted under the programme to Rupees one million twenty five thousand (Rs.1,025,000) for a degree of 03 year duration and Rupees one million hundred thousand (RS.1,100,000) for a degree of 04 year duration, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of funds for the implementation of the second phase of the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme
decision_details:
- The Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme funded by the Asian  Development Bank (ADB) has been implemented with the objective of developing the dry areas in the North Western, North Central and Northern Provinces by providing Mahaweli water to those areas. Under the first phase of this programme, the three (03) major investment projects namely, the Upper Elahera Canal project, North Western Province Canal project and Minipe Left Bank Canal Rehabilitation project, are implemented. 

	A sum of US$ 210 million is due to be obtained from the ADB under the second phase of this Loan Agreement and it has been planned to use the same for the construction of a part of the Upper Elahera Canal  project with the tunnel, a part of the transfer canal linking Kaluganga-Moragahakanda of the Upper Elahera Canal  project, a part of the Mahakithula tunnel of the North Western Provincial Canal Project, Mahakithula and Mahakirula reservoirs and the feeder canal from Mahakithula to Mahakirula reservoir, and for the implementation of the environmental and social security activities in the aforesaid constructing areas. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to obtain the funds for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enhancement of the local dairy production by producing Young Dairy Farm Entrepreneurs
decision_details:
- Due to the non-production of the required quantity of liquid milk or milk powder inside the country for the consumption of the Sri Lankans, a large amount of foreign currency has to be disbursed annually for the importation of such dairy products. Therefore, focus of the Government has been made for enlisting the contribution of the Youth Community to enhance the dairy production capacity in the country adopting advanced scientific methods and technology.

	As such, a proposal has been made to implement a programme for producing of Young Dairy Farm Entrepreneurs under the aegis of the National Programme on Food Production. Under this programme, it has been planned to select youth to be fully involved in dairy farming, provide them with technical knowledge and resources and, to build them up as entrepreneurs with the capacity of producing at least 100 litres of milk, per day. It is expected that it would be possible to raise the domestic dairy production to the optimal level, by establishing such 10,000 units of young entrepreneurs.

	Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to implement its Pilot Project in the District of Kandy with the assistance of the Ministry of Rural Economy, the Central Provincial Council and the District Secretariat, Kandy and to implement the same in other areas based on its success, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of fertilizer for the Maha Season - 2017/2018
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Agriculture, to award the tender for procuring 72,000 MT of Urea required for the distribution of fertilizer for the Maha Season 2017/2018 by the Government Fertilizer Companies, to M/s JAT Holding (Pvt.) Ltd. which has successfully submitted the bid in this regard, for a sum of US$ 23.57 million being US$ 327.40 per MT, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Agreement to be signed between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Korea  on Cooperation in the fields of Culture, Arts, Education, Youth activities and Sports
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Thilak Marapana, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, to sign an Agreement between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Korea with a view to strengthening the mutual friendly relations existing  between the two countries and promoting cooperation in the fields of Culture, Arts, Education, Youth activities and Sports, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Hosting of the First Annual Conference of Non-Communicable Diseases (NCD) of SAARC Countries
decision_details:
- All the countries in the SAARC region have faced the problem pertaining to the non-communicable diseases.  At the meeting of the Health Ministers of the SAARC countries, a proposal has been made that a conference of the SAARC countries be held to discuss the ways and means to solve the problem and to provide opportunities to exchange the experiences of the respective countries and to provide opportunities for the improvement of the prevailing methodologies for the control of the non-communicable diseases.   

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to host the said conference on the 9th and 10th of December 2017 in Colombo, Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Korea on Investment Promotion
decision_details:
- The Republic of Korea is regarded as an important country which makes Foreign Direct Investment in Sri Lanka and Korea has already made investments in over 70 companies of Sri Lanka. A number of other sectors have been identified where there is the potential for expanding the Korean investments in Sri Lanka and in this respect, it is appropriate to further strengthen the investment cooperation and collaboration between the two countries.  

As such, the proposal made by Hon. Malik Samarawickrema, the Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Korea to promote investment exchange between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Regulations in respect of the list of the Import Control and Banned Items and the list of the Export Control Items under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969
decision_details:
- Sri Lanka has been a member of the World Customs Organization since the year 1968 and the country is obligatory to implement the International Convention on Harmonized Commodity Description and the Coding System. Steps have been taken to update the new Harmonized Coding System in accordance with the sharp changes in the Patterns of International Trade and Technology and as such, the National Harmonized System has been amended as a Harmonized Coding System with eight digits.  

	It is necessary to amend the Regulations (controlled items) published under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 pertaining to the import control, banned and export control items to coincide with the same.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Malik Samarawickrema, the Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade, to present the Gazette Extraordinary Notifications No.2044/40 and No.2044/41 dated 2017‑11‑09 published with amendments to those regulations, in Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Stage - II of the Accident and Emergency Medical Treatment Unit in the District General Hospital of Polonnaruwa
decision_details:
- The District General Hospital of Polonnaruwa is the major hospital which provides patient care services to the people living in the area.  As the presently available facilities are inadequate to provide accident and emergency treatment for the patients, the construction of the Accident and Emergency Medical Treatment Unit commenced in the year 2015. As of now, Stage‑I of the project for the construction of two storeys is nearing completion and is about to be handed over.  



	Accordingly, considering the necessity of commencing the activities pertaining to Stage‑II of the project expeditiously, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to hand over the construction work to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau and the Engineering Services (Pvt.) Limited on Design and Built basis, for a sum of Rs.643.36 million, including tax, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchasing of 06 Armoured Vehicles required for the Special Task Force proposed for UN Peacekeeping Operations
decision_details:
- The Cabinet has granted approval previously to procure the vehicles and equipment required for the Special Task Force proposed for the UN Peacekeeping Operations. As such, bids have been called for, to purchase 06 Armoured Vehicles required to be used for the proposed programme.  

	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayake, the Minister of Law & Order and Southern Development, to purchase 06 Armoured Vehicles for a sum of Rs.413.59 million, Rs.68.93 million being the unit price, including tax, from M/s Securatec Lanka (Pvt.) Ltd., in accordance with the recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Installation of a Fuel Storage Tank in the Petroleum Storage Terminal of Kolonnawa
decision_details:
- Adequate storage facilities should be provided for each petroleum product in order to maintain a stock of fuel in Sri Lanka sufficient at least for a minimum of 30 days and it has been estimated that an additional storage capacity for 100,000 MT is required.  As a preliminary measure, tenders have been called for to install a Petrol Storage Tank of 15,000 m3 at the Kolonnawa Terminal.  

	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Arjuna Ranatunga, the Minister of Petroleum Resources Development, to award the contract to install a Fuel Storage Tank with a capacity of 15,000 m3 with Internal Floating Roof at Kolonnawa, to M/s Indo East Engineering & Construction (Lanka) Pte. Ltd., for a sum of Rs.412.78 million excluding tax, in accordance with the recommendations of the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Installation of the Fuel Hydrant System and Upgrading of the Aviation Refueling Terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA)
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Arjuna Ranatunga, the Minister of Petroleum Resources Development, to award the contract for the installation of the Fuel Hydrant System for the proposed new Apron - E implemented concurrent to the development activities of Phase II of the BIA and upgrading of the Aviation Refueling Terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport to the Joint Venture of M/s WEC Engineers and Constructors Pte. Ltd., Singapore, M/s Pte. Wijaya Karya and M/s China National Chemical Engineering, for a sum of US$ 51.5 million, excluding tax and to secure the financial facilities necessary, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading the Printing Press of the Department of Examinations in Sri Lanka with the new technology
decision_details:
- The Department of Examinations in Sri Lanka carries out the printing of the examination papers and documents necessary for conducting of about 270 examinations annually and most of the machines in use for the purpose are older than 30 years. The secrecy of the examinations can be safeguarded optimally by the introduction of the new technological methods and thereby, the confidence of the candidates on the examinations will also rise. The Cabinet has granted approval to improve its system  by using the Digital Printing Technology for the Printing Press of the Department of Examinations of Sri Lanka. 

	As such, the proposal made by Hon. Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, the Minister of Education, to award the contract for upgrading the Printing Press of the Department of Examination of Sri Lanka by introducing the Digital Printing Technology to M/s Metropolitan Office (Pvt.) Limited, for a sum of US$ 2.9 million and Rs.15 million, excluding tax, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of footwear for students in difficult, most difficult and remote schools
decision_details:
- The Ministry of Education is implementing the programme for the provision of a pair of footwear for the students in the difficult, most difficult and remote schools. Accordingly, footwear have been provided to 621,941 students in the year 2016 and a sum of Rs.592.2 million has been spent by the Government for the purpose. In implementing this programme, suppliers were selected through  a procurement process and they adopted a method of getting the sizes of the feet of the students to manufacture footwear to fit those sizes and distributed those footwear to the schools. Considering the lengthy period of about 6 months taken and the necessity of providing footwear to all school students at the same time, focus has been made to implement this programme by providing a gift voucher to the students in lieu of the above procedure in providing the footwear required for this year. 

As such, the proposal made by Hon. Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, the Minister of Education, to implement the programme in this year by providing the students with gift vouchers to the value of Rs.1,200/- to Rs.1,500/- according to their grades, incurring an expenditure of around Rs.808.27 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Global Promotion and Marketing Campaign for 'Ceylon Tea'
decision_details:
- The Sri Lanka Tea Board has initiated a global promotion campaign for the 'Ceylon Tea' with the primary objective of sustaining the existing demand for the Sri Lankan Tea as 'Ceylon Tea', re‑building the image of pure 'Ceylon Tea' in the lost market and establishing the Sri Lankan Tea brands in the international market. Action will be taken in terms of the Government Procurement Procedure in this regard for selecting an agency for consultancy services for the media planning, scheduling and buying.  

	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Navin Dissanayake, the Minister of  Plantation Industries, to select the Dentsu Grant (Pvt.) Ltd. as the Consultancy Agency in that regard, for a sum of Rs.219.89 million and for a period of three (03) years, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Consultancy Committee for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Middle Income Housing Project at Elliot Place in Borella
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to award the design and construction contract of the proposed Middle Income Housing Project of 400 housing units at  Elliot Place in Borella, on design and built basis to M/s Yanjian Group Co. Ltd., for a sum of Rs.7,799 million, excluding tax, as per the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of Full Cream Milk Powder required for the Production of Thriposha
decision_details: - Thriposha is a nutritious food supplement, distributed free of charge by the Ministry of  Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine to the children with malnutrition, pregnant mothers with nutrition problems and lactating mothers. The main raw material used for the manufacturing of Thriposha is full cream milk powder and from the year 2014 to 2017 the milk powder required for the purpose has been supplied by the M/s. Milco (Private) Limited. Considering the contribution that could be made for the local diary farmers in uplifting their economic well-being by continuing to purchase milk from Milco, which is a Government owned company engaged in the production of local milk products and the advantage of purchasing milk directly without intermediaries, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to purchase 600 MT of full cream milk required to manufacture Thriposha for the year 2018, for a sum of Rs.486 million (excluding tax), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Accelerating the Construction and Development activities of the Hospitals
decision_details: - Considering the need to accelerate the development activities of the hospitals, a proposal has been made to entrust certain construction activities with the Government Construction Agencies, in order to overcome the delays that take place due to the adoption of the General Procurement Procedure. As such, taking into consideration a  proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, the Cabinet granted approval to entrust the construction activities of the Oral Health Unit in the Teaching Hospital in Karapitiya, the Specialized Pediatric Ward Complex in the General Hospital in Ampara and the New Building Complex in Ninthavur to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau and the Central Engineering Services (Private) Limited., and the construction of the six storey building with an operation theatre in the Base Hospital in Horana to the State Engineering Corporation of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading the Old Kotte Road (Rajagiriya Section)
decision_details:
- The Cabinet has granted approval previously for widening the Mahaiyawa tunnel, expanding the Denzil Kobbekaduwa Mawatha, making improvements to the Old Kotte Road (Rajagiriya Section) and constructing the drainage system in the Kurunegala City by using the available savings of the road projects carried out under the Programme for the Rehabilitation of National Highways funded by the local banks.  

Since acceleration of the improvements to the Old Kotte Road (Rajagiriya Section) will ease the existing traffic congestion around the Rajagiriya roundabout, it has become necessary to complete the improvements to that section within a short period of time and as such, the proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, for the Road Development Authority to complete the task by adopting the direct labour method, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of Contracts for Rebuilding and Pre-curing services for tyres of the buses of the Sri Lanka Transport Board
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to award the contracts for providing the services for re‑building and pre-curing of tyres of the buses of the Sri Lanka Transport Board over to 09 companies, as per the recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) and the Procurement Appeal Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Export Crops Villages Project
decision_details:
- The Ministerial Committee on Kandy City Development has identified the necessity of utilizing the lands owned by the state institutions situated around the Kandy area which have not been used productively to be made use of for re-cultivation or for ear-marked export oriented purposes.  

As such, a proposal has been made to implement a project named  'Export Crops Villages Project'.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, the Minister of Special Assignments and Chairman of the Ministerial Committee on Kandy City Development, to grant an extent of land of 400 acres situated in the Woodside Estate of the Medadumbara Divisional Secretariat Division identified as suitable, to be given on lease basis, under this project to the selected beneficiaries,to provide the necessary technical know how to carry out agricultural activities in these lands and to expand the activities of the project depending on its success, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparation of a legal framework to implement the National Land Use Policy
decision_details:
- The Cabinet has granted approval for the National Land Use Policy prepared by a Committee of Experts under the Sustainable Land Management Project and to enact legislation for its implementation. The absence of a National Land Use Policy to be enforced by law, has been identified as one of the major causes for the occurrence of disasters such as floods and landslides in the country in the recent times.  

As such, the proposal made by Hon. Gayantha Karunathilaka, the Minister of Lands and Parliamentary Reforms, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare the required draft Bill, based on the said National Land Use Policy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Regularizing the disposition of state lands and the prevention of encroachment in state lands
decision_details:
- The Cabinet appointed a Committee comprising of the officers of the relevant institutions relating to the subject of Land to study and report facts pertaining to the same, to prepare a formal methodology for regularizing the disposition of state lands and and the prevention of encroachment in state lands.  

Accordingly, taking into consideration the recommendations made by the Committee and the facts submitted by H.E. the President and the Ministers of Defence; and Megapolis and Western Development in this regard, the proposal made by Hon. Gayantha Karunathilaka, the Minister of Lands and Parliamentary Reforms, to implement the proposals submitted with regard to further strengthening of the existing methodology for the prevention of encroachment in State Lands and the disposition of State Lands, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rajgama Urban Housing Project
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet has been received for the Rajgama Housing Project which is being implemented by the Urban Settlement Development Authority. Under the said project, new houses will be built for 92 low income earning families including 39 families who were displaced by the Tsunami catastrophe and while implementing the project the need to renovate and upgrade 45 houses located in the same premises which are in a state of disrepair has also been identified. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to implement the proposed housing project so as to provide housing facilities for 137 families and also to construct a community hall as a common infrastructure facility for the village, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Debt Conciliation Ordinance, No.39 of 1941
decision_details: - A proposal has been made to expand the  jurisdiction of the Debt Conciliation Board to extend the activities of the board confined presently to Colombo, to other places as well with a view to making use of the Debt Conciliation Board as a more effective alternative mechanism in the settlement of disputes relating to debts and to widen its membership further to stabilize its functions to be productive and also to change the selection criteria. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice,  to amend the Debt Conciliation Ordinance, No.39 of 1941 making provision for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading Aquaculture in Manmoonai South West of Batticaloa
decision_details:
- A proposal has been made to re-establish an aquaculture industry in a land in extent of 202.343 hectares (500 acres) situated in the Manmoonai South West Divisional Secretariat Division of Batticaloa, which had been used as brackish water shrimp farm, prior to the eruption of the conflict environment. It would provide a high contribution to the national economy and would generate nearly 900 direct job opportunities in the area. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, to allocate the said land to the selected investors on lease basis, adopting the Government Procurement Procedure, through the Sri Lanka Board of Investment to build 450 ponds within the limits of the said area to cultivate high valued species including Brackish water shrimps, Mud Crabs, Milk-fish and Bait, potential in making high economic profits, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Future activities of the Weras Ganga Storm Water Drainage and the  Environment Improvement Project
decision_details:
- The drainage system for Storm water has been upgraded in the areas of Boralesgamuwa, Rattanapitiya, Piliyandala, Werahera and Nugegoda through  the development activities carried out under the Weras Ganga project which is being implemented with the prime objective of flood control and it has resulted in mitigating the flood threats in the areas. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to implement the further development activities which have been designed under the project, with the objective of mitigating the flood threat in the areas of Kesbewa, Maharagama, Dehiwala, Rathmalana and Moratuwa Divisional Secretariat Divisions and secure funds required for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Action on the obligation of Sri Lanka according to the Trade Facilitation Agreement (TFA) of the World Trade Organization
decision_details:
- The Trade Facilitation Agreement has been entered into as a Bi-lateral Agreement with the objective of clarifying the sections on trade facilitation in the General Agreement on Trade and Tariff and improvement and for removing the obstacles in regard to the movement of goods including goods in transit, issuance and clearance. Through this Agreement it is expected to accelerate the movement of goods across borders, issuance and clearance. 

	
	Sri Lanka has already ratified this Agreement and by fulfilling the obligations of Sri Lanka under the Agreement, a number of benefits such as, the raising of the Sri Lanka's rank in the global trade facilitation indicators, reduction of cost in the international trade, the capability of being more competitive within the  international market, could be accrued.      

	Therefore, a National Committee on Trade Facilitation has already been set up for the co-ordination of the relevant activities in this regard. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, the Minister of Industry and Commerce; and Hon. Malik Samarawickrema, the Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade, to expand the scope of the Committee with the inclusion of other active trade facility activities outside the purview of the provisions of the Trade Facilitation Agreement, as well and to prepare an Action Plan to take action in accordance with the obligations of the Trade Facilitation Agreement of the World Trade Organization, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bilateral Air Services Agreement between Sri Lanka and the Hellenic Republic (Greece)
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to sign the Agreement presently agreed upon at the official level with a view to formalizing the Air Services between Sri Lanka and the Hellenic Republic (Greece) and subsequently, to enforce the provisions of the Agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bilateral Air Services Agreement between Sri Lanka and Jamaica
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to sign the Agreement presently agreed upon at the official level with a view to formalizing the Air Services between Sri Lanka and Jamaica and subsequently, to enforce the provisions of the Agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conversion of the Pinus Plantation in Sri Lanka into a Plantation of indigenous plant species
decision_details:
- The Pinus Plantation in Sri Lanka had been established during the period from 1960 - 1990 in order to produce raw material for the paper industry and to  create a forest cover on the degraded lands in the catchment areas. At present, there are  16,000 hectares of pinus plantation in the wet and the intermediate zones of Sri Lanka. Since under plantation does not exist in the pinus plantation found in the hilly areas, its contribution towards the watershed conservation is minimal. 

	As such, a proposal has been made for the implementation of a project to plant   indigenous plant species for the development of an under planting in the pinus plantations carried out for the environmental conservation in the watershed areas. Through this, there will be a possibility of increasing the soil and water conservation in such plantations and developing the biodiversity. Accordingly,  the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to implement this project under the grant aid provided by the Asia Pacific Network for Sustainable Forest Management and Rehabilitation during the on coming period of 3 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining a Coast Guard Vessel for the Coast Guard Department of Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- The Coast Guard Department of Sri Lanka carries out the mission of enforcing the Maritime Law of Sri Lanka in the sea belt along Sri Lanka which is approximately 517,000 Sq. kms.  Due to the existence of busy international shipping lanes passing through the Southern Coast of Sri Lanka just beyond 5 nautical miles from the land and with the increase in the security challenges such as maritime terrorism, drug trafficking, human smuggling, piracy and illegal fishing, it is essential to increase the number of vessels required for the coast guard activities. 	

	According to a request made from the Government of India the coast guard vessel called 'Varuna' used by the Indian Department of Coast Guard will be given over to the Coast Guard Department of Sri  Lanka free of charge and it will help to enhance the coast guard capabilities of the said Department. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Defence, to accept the said vessel as an award, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The empowerment of a National Arts and Cultural Policy
decision_details: - The factors directly impacting on the collective public consciousness of a country are its Arts and Culture, Education, Mass Media and the Religion. From among the above, the field of Arts and Culture is decisive in performing a pioneering role in regard to healing of the society. A group of internationally renowned artists and intellectuals have made an initiative to create a cultural renaissance in Sri Lanka by the formulation and implementation of a new Arts and Cultural policy. Through the creation of a Vision, understanding and changes in relation to arts and culture of the country, it will be possible to build a grounding necessary to form a citizen to be integrated within one another and the other communities culturally.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to establish a National Operational Unit for the cultural renewal, affiliated to the Presidential Secretariat, for effective coordination among other relevant institutions and to take the necessary future measures for this purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Translating 'Maha Soopawansaya' into English
decision_details:
- Sri Lanka possess the heritage of a sophisticated food culture inherited from the past and the indigenous food culture seemed to have been greatly influential for the health and well being of the early day society. Deshabandu Dr. T. Pablis Silva has compiled a valuable book on the history and evolution of the food culture of Sri Lanka in collaboration with several academics of the University of Sri Jayawardenepura. 

	In translating this book into the English language, an opportunity will be created to present to the world the knowledge and the heritage of Sri Lanka possessed in the field. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to secure funds to translate 'Maha Soopawansaya' into English and print 1,000 copies of the book, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enacting legislation to provide for the preparation of a supplementary Register of Electors enabling the youth to exercise their franchise
decision_details:
- In terms of the provisions of the Registration of Electors Act, No.44 of 1980 all citizens who attain 18 years of age as at 1st of June every year are registered as electors. For this purpose the Electoral Register is revised annually and it takes about 6 months to complete the process. In case an election is held after the commencement of the revision of the Electoral Register on the 1st of June in any year but prior to the certification of the same, the Electoral Register of the previous year will be made applicable and the electors who have completed 18 years of age and eligible to be registered in the new Electoral Register will be deprived of the opportunity of exercising their voting rights. 

	As such, the Election Commission has proposed that it is appropriate to prepare a supplementary electoral list to provide and opportunity to excise their vote by including the names of those who will attain age of 18 years during the period subsequent to the certification of the electoral list and until the commencement of the revision of the electoral list of the following year, in the electoral list which has by then been certified, without any delay.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to make provision for this purpose by amending the Registration of Electors Act, No.44 of 1980, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Report of the  Cabinet  Sub-Committee  appointed  to examine the shortage of Petrol that prevailed in the country in the first week of November 2017
decision_details:
- Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, the Minister of Special Assignments, presented the report of the Cabinet Sub-Committee appointed under his chairmanship to examine the shortage of  petrol which had prevailed in the country during the first week of  November 2017 causing a hindrance to the day to day activities of the General Public and the causes which led to such a shortage, to identify the parties responsible for the situation and the measures to be adopted to avoid recurrence of such situations in the future. 

Accordingly, it has been identified that the sudden shortage of petrol has been caused due to the long run deficiency that prevailed in the Petroleum Stock Management System and it has been recommended that it is appropriate to appoint a Board of Inquiry comprising of  three technically qualified officers to identify the officers who are directly responsible for the situation and obtain a Report. Recommendations have also been made in the Report to install additional fuel storage facilities and adopt modern stock control management system in order to avoid recurrence of such situations in the future. As such, the approval of the Cabinet has been granted to pursue action as recommended by the said report.

title: Accession to the Optional Protocol to the Convention against Torture and other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment
decision_details:
- The Convention against Torture and other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment was signed by Sri Lanka in the year 1984 and the provisions of the Convention were enforced in the year 1994 by the existing law of this country.  

	The proposal made by Hon. Thilak Marapana, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, for Sri Lanka to sign the Optional Protocol under the said Convention demonstrating the sincerity and the determination of the Government to combat Torture and to co-operate with the National and International mechanism for the purpose of compliance, for  the regular inspection of the places of detention and to take necessary action to improve the welfare of the persons detained on Judicial Orders or otherwise, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the  Concession Agreement signed for the improvement of the Port of Hambantota by a Public-Private Partnership (PPP)
Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Switzerland and Sri Lanka on Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters
decision_details: - Cabinet has granted approval on 2017-06-13 to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Switzerland and Sri Lanka on Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters, with a view to enforcing the laws existing in both countries pertaining to the conduct of investigations on crimes, filing of cases, prevention of crimes and confiscation of money generated from criminal activities.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice, to enter into the MoU for the purpose as agreed at the deliberations between the relevant officials of both countries and to enter into an Agreement between both countries after successful implementation of the same for a few years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Loan Assistance for the Implementation of Tranche 2 of the  Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme
decision_details:
- The Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme is implemented with the objective of providing Mahaweli River Water for agricultural activities, drinking water requirement and commercial purposes in the North Western, North Central and Northern Provinces and thereby, improving the productive utilization of the said water. Under Tranche 2 of the programme, it is expected to construct the Conveyance Canal of the Upper Elahera canal of 62 km in length connecting the Moragahakanda and Huruluwewa reservoirs, to construct the canal with tunnels linking the Kalu Ganga and Moragahakanda reservoirs and to carry out the rest of the construction activities of the Mahakirula reservoirs and  the inlet tunnel of Mahakithula.  

	The total investment for the Tranche 2 is US$ 242 million and a contribution of US$ 32 million out of same will be borne by the Government of Sri Lanka. The remainder financial requirement of US$ 210 million is due to be recovered as a Loan from the Asian Development Bank (ADB). As such,  the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to conduct negotiations with the ADB to obtain the said loan and to enter into the relevant Loan Agreements with the bank, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Declaration of Mahaweli System 'E' as a special area of Authority of the Sri Lanka Mahaweli Authority
decision_details:
- Around 20,000 families are permanently residing for over 40 years in the area situated in the Minipe Canal Left Bank to the left side of the eastern boundary of Victoria, Randenigala and Rantambe Sanctuaries.  It has been identified that it is appropriate to vest the development and administrative functions of the area with the Sri Lanka Mahaweli Authority enabling the implementation of a development plan pertaining to the area and for this purpose, the limits of the wildlife reserves have to be re-demarcated. 

Accordingly, the joint proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, and Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Sustainable Development and Wildlife, to declare the area identified belonging to the Minipe and Wilgamuwa Divisional Secretariat Divisions simultaneous to the Minipe Canal Left Bank Rehabilitation Special Development Project as Mahaweli System 'E Zone' by a Gazette Notification, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Selection of a Consultancy Company to develop Strategies for the Digital Economy of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Government has accorded priority for the development of the digital economy of Sri Lanka. The proposal made by Hon. Harin Fernando, the Minister of Telecommunication and Digital Infrastructure, to award the contract for the Consultancy Services for securing the required financial sources to M/s McKinsey & Company for a sum of US$ 1.425 million, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee (CANC), was approved by the Cabinet.
