title: Disposal of the Fly Ash produced as a by product from the Power Plant Puttalam
decision_details:
- In generating electricity at the coal power plant in Puttalam, with a capacity of 900 MW, it burns about 2.4 Million Metric Tons of coal  per year. As a by product of the said burning process, it generates 255,000 MT of Ash per year and since Ash is used for manufacturing cement and roofing sheets, there is a high demand for Ash in the market. 

As such, bids have been called for the disposal of Ash accumulated in the said power plant, under the Government Tender Procedure. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to dispose the quantum of Ash in the power plant to the qualified companies from among those who have submitted bids, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee and the Procurement Appeal Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchasing of Lubricating Oil required for the Sapugaskanda Power Plant for the year 2017/2018
decision_details: - The Sapugaskanda Power Plant of the Ceylon Electricity Board comprises of 4 generators with a capacity of 18 MW and 8 generators of 10 MW.  As such, the joint proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy and Hon. Arjuna Ranatunga, the Minister of Petroleum Resources Development, to award the tender for the purchasing of 1.1 million of Litres of the types of Lubricating Oil required for the generators for the year 2017/2018 but not provided by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, at a sum of Rs.234.43 each per Litre of Lubricating Oil, to M/s Chevron Lanka PLC, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Drafting of a Bill to legalize the Bureau of the Commissioner General of Rehabilitation
decision_details:
- The Bureau of the Commissioner General of Rehabilitation was established in the year 2006 by a Gazette (Extraordinary) Notification  under the Public Security Ordinance for the rehabilitation of the LTTE ex-combatants who were taken into custody during the period of the conflict and misguided persons who surrendered willingly. Taking into consideration the success achieved by the Bureau in executing its mandate to rehabilitate the misguided combatants, the responsibility of rehabilitating the persons addicted to drugs has also been vested with the Bureau and presently 1,774 drug addicts have been rehabilitated and socially re-integrated. 

	As such, the proposal made by Hon. D.M. Swaminathan, the Minister of Prison Reforms, Rehabilitation, Resettlement and Hindu Religious Affairs, to formally establish the Bureau of the Commissioner General of Rehabilitation by an Act of Parliament, making provision to rehabilitate and socially re-integrate the misguided combatants referred for rehabilitation on Judicial Orders, extremists or those who have engaged in destructive activities and addicts of Drugs and Poisonous Drugs and to carry out follow-up action in respect of the above persons, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Holding of the Annual General Meeting and Conference of the Commonwealth Local Government Forum in Sri Lanka in 2019
decision_details:
- Sri Lanka is a Member of the Commonwealth Local Government Forum established relating to the field of the Local Government. The Annual General Meeting and the International Conference of this forum held once in two years provides an opportunity for sharing of the qualitative changes that take place in the Local Government sector.  

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government, to submit a proposal to the conference of the forum which will be held in Malta from 21st to 24th of November this year to host the Annual General Meeting of the Commonwealth Local Government Forum and the International Conference in Sri Lanka in 2019, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Land Development Ordinance
decision_details:
- The Land Development Ordinance No.19 of 1935 had set the legal background for the distribution of crown lands for the farmer community for residential and agricultural purposes and for the people of the middle class for the large scale agricultural purposes. Subsequently, considering the socio-economic changes that had taken place, the Ordinance has been amended from time to time. A proposal has been made to introduce further amendments to this Ordinance considering matters based on the representations made by the Members of Parliament, the general public and various organizations to meet the present day socio-economie requirements. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Gayantha Karunathilaka, the Minister of Lands and Parliamentary Reforms, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation for the introduction of a new Grant with lenient conditions,  providing the opportunity to use the lands given under Grant for residential purposes for other objectives, in an instance when the holder of the grant dies without a nominated successor to make provision for the inheritance of the grant property to be devolved under the Civil Law, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enhancing the performance of the Department of Government Factory
decision_details:
- The function of the Department of Government Factory is to provide products and services for both the private and the public sector and for heavy structures specially pertaining to the irrigation sector.  A proposal has been made to purchase a brand new overhead crane with a capacity of 8 Tons for the Department in order to enhance the efficiency and the production capacity of the Foundry Workshop where the manufacturing of irrigation water management sluice gates, and operating systems and accessories take place.  

	A proposal has also been made to introduce a software system for Administrative Resource Planning for the improvement of the administrative performance of the Department. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to secure the funds necessary for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Accelerated Programme for the development of Middle Income Housing and Infrastructure facilities
decision_details:
- The Government with the participation of the Private Sector has implemented an accelerated programme for the development of the houses and infrastructure in the urban and semi-urban areas with the objective of providing houses for the  middle income wage earner families. As such, it is essential to allocate expeditiously the lands required for the housing projects, in order to implement these projects successfully. 

	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to release several plots of lands owned by the state situated in Akmeemana, Kurunegala, Puttalam, Hambantota and Anamaduwa areas identified as suitable for the implementation of the housing development projects, to the National Housing Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Promoting the sales at the Buddha Jayanthi Bookshop of the Department of Buddhist Affairs
decision_details: - The concise Thripitaka publications, Buddhist Encyclopedia and other Sinhala and English Buddhist books compiled with the complements of the Department of Buddhist Affairs are sold at the Buddha Jayanthi Bookshop of the Department. Considering the importance of selling these books at a concessionary rate for the convenience of the local and foreign scholars and the readers who conduct studies on Buddhism and the Buddhist philosophy, the proposal made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Buddhasasana, to allow discounts on selected publications sold there, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of the Sri Lanka Mass Media Training Institute
decision_details:
- The Sri Lanka Mass Media Training Institute established in 1982, with the financial and human resource contribution of the Friedrich Ebert Foundation in Germany, was initiated with the objective of training the technicians required for the Sri Lanka Television Broadcasting Service. The institute is presently conducting about 18 courses aimed at various professions in the field of Mass Media and around 450 students are engaged annually in the educational activities of the institute.   

A proposal has been made to implement a 3 year plan to transform the Sri Lanka Mass Media Training Institute to be the National Institute which provides the required professional training in the field of Mass Media of the country.  Through this initiative, it is expected to upgrade the infrastructure facilities of the institute and also to extend the training programmes to the Northern and Eastern Provinces. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to secure the funds required for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Selacine Television Institute as a State Owned  Company Limited by Guarantee
decision_details: - The fully state owned Selacine Television Institute which commenced in the year 1982 primarily conducts Government Commercial advertising and event management. As such, for the institution to enable build up stability as an effective commercial institute functioning competitively along with the other commercial advertising and event management institutions, the proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to establish the Selacine Television Institute under the Companies Act, No.7 of 2007 as a fully state owned company limited by guarantee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and South Africa on Scientific and Technological Cooperation
decision_details: - A proposal has been made to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and South Africa to promote an effective cooperation in the fields of science, research and technology for the enhancement of social and economic development. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, the Minister of Science, Technology and Research, to sign the MoU during the Science Forum which will be held on 07th and 08th of December 2017 in South Africa, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the unstable Slopes and Landslides along the Upcountry Railway Line
decision_details:
- The National Buildings Research Organization (NBRO) has pointed out the need of implementing a project for stabilizing the landslides prone areas and unstable slopes found along the upcountry railway line with a view to ensuring the uninterrupted and safe operational activities of the railway line, taking into consideration the adverse effects of the landslides which occurred during the past period.  

	Accordingly, the joint proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation and Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, the Minister of Disaster Management, for the National Buildings Research Organization and the Sri Lanka Railways to implement the project jointly for the renovation of landslide risk areas and unstable slopes in the upcountry railway line including the improvement of the drainage system giving priority over to the areas between Rambukkana and Badulla, which would span over the next 5 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Flying School at the Batticaloa Airport
decision_details:
- With the opening of the Batticaloa Airport more constructively, for civil aviation operations it is anticipated that a significant development will take place in the economic activities of the Eastern Province owing to the reawakening of the domestic Civil Aviation Services simultaneously with the development of the tourism industry. Considering the conducive weather condition prevailing in the area for the civil aviation activities, the presence of 5 domestic aerodromes within a radius of 135km with less air traffic congestion, the ability of making operational activities in a free air space etc., proposals for Expression of Interests (EoI) have been called for from the parties interested in the domestic air services operational activities of the Batticaloa Airport.   

	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to provide the facilities required to implement the project proposal presented by M/s Skurai Aviation to operate domestic aviation services at the Batticaloa Airport and to establish a Flying Training School at the Batticaloa Airport, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Formulation of a formal methodology for the management of hazardous wastes and chemicals
decision_details:
- In the face of rapid industrialization, many countries have focused their attention on the mitigation of the adverse effects caused to the human health and environment due to the increased use of chemical substances.  Sri Lanka is also a signatory to the Basel Convention, Stockholm Convention, Rotterdam Convention and the Minamata Convention adopted in this regard. 

	Therefore, when encouraging industry related investments for the economic development of Sri Lanka, it is necessary for Sri Lanka to take measures to ensure that chemical substances are used securely without being harmful to the eco-system. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, for the formulation of a National Policy on the Management of hazardous wastes and chemicals in Sri Lanka and a comprehensive methodology for implementation of same with the participation of all relevant stakeholders, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bringing back to normalcy to the prevailing shortage of Petrol in the country  expeditiously
decision_details:
- The attention of the Cabinet has been drawn to the shortage of Petrol countrywide which has caused an obstruction to the day to day activities of the General Public.  As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to appoint a Ministerial Sub‑Committee comprising of the following Ministers to examine and make recommendations in regard to urgent measures to be adopted to avoid the prevailing shortage of petrol, the causes which have led to such situation, the parties responsible for such occurrence and measures to avoid recurrence of such situation in future, was approved by the Cabinet.   

i.	Hon.	(Dr.) Sarath Amunugama
	Minister of Special Assignments - (Chairman)
			
ii.	Hon.	Anura Priyadharshana Yapa
	Minister of Disaster Management

iii.	Hon.	Patali Champika Ranawaka
	Minister of Megapolis and Western Development

iv.	Hon.	Arjuna Ranatunga
	Minister of Petroleum Resources Development

title: Awarding of the Contract for the Balance Construction Work of the Four Storey Building for the District Secretariat of Polonnaruwa
decision_details:
- The Cabinet has granted approval previously to construct a four storey building for the District Secretariat of Polonnaruwa.  Accordingly, the contract for the construction of its Phase‑I had been awarded to M/s Micro Construction (Pvt.) Ltd., and the construction activities are at the level of nearing completion. 

Considering the progress of the construction activities, the proposal made by Hon. Vajira Abeywardena, the Minister of Home Affairs, to award the construction of its Phase‑II over to the same company for a sum of Rs.952.90 million, excluding taxes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Two Storey Building for the Divisional Secretariat of Mahiyanganaya
decision_details: - The Cabinet has granted approval previously to construct a new two storey building for the Divisional Secretariat of Mahiyanganaya. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Vajira Abeywardena, the Minister of Home Affairs, to award the contract for the construction of the building to M/s Finite Lanka (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs.140.96 million, excluding taxes, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a High Court in terms of Article 105 (1)(c) of the Constitution
decision_details:
- It has been practically difficult to complete the cases expeditiously, pertaining to financial frauds, corruption, defrauding the State of its assets and revenue and similar offences, owing to the backlog of cases in the Courts of Law of the country.  As such, it has been identified that the establishment of a High Court dedicated to hear expeditiously, the charges pertaining to offences committed  against Public Property, Money Laundering, Terrorist Financing, Criminal Breach of Trust, Misappropriation of Public Property and Organized Crimes including Bribery and Corruption and highly complex financial frauds, is suited. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation necessary to establish a High Court in terms of the provisions of Article 105 (1)(c) of the Constitution,  comprising of 3 Benches each with 3 judges named by the Chief Justice and for the Chief Justice to refer the cases relating to the commission of the  specified offences, at the request of the Attorney General or on his own motion and to provide for an appeal directly to the Supreme Court against an Order made by such High Court, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Report on 'Recent Economic Developments: Highlights of 2017 and Prospects for 2018' of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka to  Parliament
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to present the Report published by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka on 'Recent Economic Developments: Highlights of 2017 and Prospects for 2018' inclusive of the performance of the Real Sector, External Sector, Fiscal Sector and the Monetary Sector', up to October 2017, in Parliament, to coincide with the 2018 budget, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending legislation  relating to Bribery and Corruption
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to amend the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption Act and the Acts incidental thereto, in order to make the laws applicable for eradicating bribery and corruption in Sri Lanka to meet the contemporary legal requirements and to overcome the issues which have surfaced due to the inconsistencies found in the existing laws when implementing same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a 400 MW Natural Gas Power Plant in Hambantota
decision_details: - With the prime objective of providing electricity to the industrial zone proposed to be constructed at Hambantota and to overcome the power scarcity that may occur in the future, it has been decided to establish a Natural Gas Power Plant of 400 MW, in Hambantota as a joint project implemented by the Government of China and the Government of Sri Lanka. The project is expected to be implemented as a Joint Venture between the the China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC), nominated by the Government of China and the Ceylon Electricity Board. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to implement the proposed project with relevant approvals, having included it into the long term energy plan accepted by the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: House of Justice Project
decision_details: - The accommodation of the buildings  presently, used for  the High Courts, District Courts and Magistrate's Courts in the Hulftsdorp Court Complex, Colombo is limited and an element of risk has cropped up due to the buildings being very old.  Further, adequate building facilities need to be provided for the different institutions related to the justice sector, located in the Superior Courts Complex. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice, to select a suitable developer/contractor from among the local and foreign contractors who are presently engaged in the implementation of development projects in the country on competitive basis, to implement the 'House of Justice' project for the construction of a Courts complex comprising of 40 Court Houses, Ministry of Justice complex, upgrading the Judges' Institute and a Law Centre for training of Attorneys-at-Law, was approved by the cabinet.

title: Purchasing Coal for the Coal Power Plant in Puttalam through Spot Tenders
decision_details: - Considering the requirement of the supply of coal expeditiously to the Coal Power Plant in Puttalam, authority has been granted to purchase the required coal through spot tender procedure subject to the covering approval of the Cabinet and as approved by the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SSCAPC). Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy,  to purchase an amount of 300,000 MT of coal required for  the plant from the Swiss Singapore Overseas Enterprises Pte. Ltd., the lowest substantially responsive bidder, out of the registered suppliers at FOBT price of US$ 87.97 per MT, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Galigamuwa Water Supply Scheme
decision_details:
- Under the Water Supply and Sanitation Improvement project, it is expected to provide upgraded Water Supply facilities for about 530,000 people and upgraded sanitation facilities for another 175,000 people living in 540 Grama Niladhari Divisions, in the Districts of Mullaitivu, Kilinochchi, Badulla, Monaragala, Ratnapura, Kegalle and Nuwara Eliya. 

Under the first component of this project, the Galigamuwa Water supply scheme, in Kegalle district is expected to be constructed  and by which safe drinking water will be provided for a population of 45,000 in 29 Grama Niladhari Divisions including the Galigamuwa town, as well in future. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to award the contract for the construction of a  Water Treatment Plant with a treated water production capacity of 9,000 cubic meters per day and the laying of transmission and distribution systems and the related activities, to M/s Sierra Construction (Pvt.) limited, for a sum of US$ 4.6 million and LKR 1,268 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Training Centre and other buildings at Thelawala under the Greater Colombo Water & Wastewater Management Improvement Investment Programme
decision_details:
- The objective of the Greater Colombo Water & Wastewater Management Improvement Investment Programme is to regulate the use of non‑revenue water and the improvement and management of the water facilities provided to the general public. Under  second phase of the programme, it is proposed to construct the training centre at Thelawala  and this training centre is expected to be used to train officers of different levels who are engaged in the regulatory project of non‑revenue water and other officers of the National Water Supply & Drainage Board. 
	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to award the contract for the construction of a four storey training centre, five storey hostel building and a canteen to M/s Sierra Construction (Pvt.) Ltd., as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the expansion of Pipe Borne Sewerage Coverage in the Dehiwala-Mt. Lavinia
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to secure funds for the project for the expansion of Pipe Borne Sewerage Coverage in the Urban Area of Dehiwala-Mt.Lavinia subject to high urbanization and to award the contract of the project to M/s Vinci Construction Grands Projects/LUDWIG PFEIFFER Hoch‑u Tiefabau GmBH & Co., was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation activities of the Akuressa Nilwala National College of Education damaged due to natural disasters
decision_details:
- The buildings and equipment of the Akuressa Nilwala National College of Education were severely damaged due to the effects of natural disasters that took place in last May and consequently, the assignment of teachers to the schools duly, has been delayed as a result of the inability to complete the training courses of teachers within the stipulated period. 

	Therefore, it is necessary to renovate those damaged buildings expeditiously and modernize same to suit the future needs and the Czech Republic has agreed to provide the financial assistance required for the purpose. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, the Minister of Education, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to obtain financial aid amounting to Rs.15 million for carrying out the renovation and improvement activities of the Nilwala National College of Education, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Use of underutilized Lands for Housing and Human Settlement Development
decision_details:
- It has been observed that certain challenges have surfaced in the use of underutilized lands for development activities as a result of the regulations imposed by the Government for the prevention of paddy lands, other agricultural lands and forest reserves being used for other purposes. When lands are used for human settlement development, specially, in rapidly urbanizing areas and  if the name of a portion of land ends with the terms 'Wela', 'Kumbura', or 'Deniya' in a survey plan, it has been found difficult to use such lands for housing construction although the lands cannot actually be used for cultivation.  As such, the Cabinet has already appointed a Committee to formulate an expeditious methodology and make recommendations with regard to releasing of underutilized lands for development purposes.  

	The joint proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Agriculture and Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to appoint a special team of officers from the Head Office of the Agrarian Development Department to accord  priority and take action to carry out field inspections expeditiously with the officers of the relevant institutions,  when such underutilized lands have to be used for housing construction and subsequently grant the approval required, in accordance with the recommendations of the Officials' Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of an Agreement for the Transfer of sentenced persons between Sri Lanka and  Thailand
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice, to enter into an Agreement between Sri Lanka and Thailand to transfer a citizen of Thailand who has been convicted by a Court of Law in Sri Lanka  and imprisoned and a citizen of Sri Lanka who has been convicted by a Court of Law in Thailand and imprisoned subject to punishment, between the two countries to enable them to spend the rest of their period of punishment in their own countries and to ratify the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting of the lands utilized for the Parliamentary Complex
decision_details: - A part of the lands in extent of about 1,000 acres acquired from the areas of Battaramulla, Kaduwela, Sri Jayawardenapura and Maharagama by the Urban Development Authority (UDA) under the Administrative Capital City Development Programme of Sri Jayawardenapura, Kotte, have been utilized for the construction of the Parliamentary Complex and another part apportioned as water reserves. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to vest such portions of land which are utilized for the Parliamentary Complex but not formally vested up to now, with the Sri Lanka Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Presenting the Gazette Notification No.2031/49 issued in terms of the Revenue Protection Act for approval of Parliament
decision_details: - Taking into consideration the requests made by the relevant industrialists, the proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Finance and Mass Media, to present the Gazette Notification No.2031/49 dated 11th August 2017 in terms of the Revenue Protection Act, No.19 of 1962, to amend the descriptions of the selected Harmonized Commodity Codes and to create new sub divisions therein, in accordance with the policy decisions of the Government, in Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing a monthly allowance to the elderly citizens over 100 years of age
decision_details:
- The existence of elderly population over 100 years of age is considered a benchmark that reflects a country's development in the field of health. It has been identified that by now around 350 elderly people over 100 years of age live in Sri Lanka.  

As such, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, the Minister of Social Empowerment, Welfare and Kandyan Heritage, to grant a payment of Rs.5,000/- per month for the low income earning elderly citizens over 100 years of age with a view to ensuring the security of their lives, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Framework Agreement for Economic Development Cooperation with the Republic of Korea
decision_details:
- The Government of Korea has agreed to grant a concessionary loan of a sum  equivalent to US$ 500 million to Sri Lanka for development purposes within the period from 2017 to 2019, with a view to further strengthening the friendship and the economic cooperation between the two countries. The Korean loan aid is granted at  very low interest rates with a 40 year repayment period including a 10 year grace period. 

As such, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to enter into a Framework Agreement with the Government of the Republic of Korea to obtain the said loan scheduled to be given from the Economic Development Corporation Fund of the Export and Import Bank of Korea, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Constitution of new Local Authorities
decision_details:
- The approval of the Cabinet has been granted to the criteria prepared by a Committee of Experts to establish new Local Authorities and to upgrade the existing Local Authorities. Based on such criteria, it has been decided to constitute the present Ambagamuwa Pradeshiya Sabha area as 03 new Local Authorities namely Ambagamuwa, Maskeliya and Norwood Pradeshiya Sabhas and the present Nuwara Eliya Pradeshiya Sabha area as 03 new Local Authorities namely Nuwara Eliya, Agarapatana and Kotagala Pradeshiya Sabhas. 

	As such, the Cabinet took note of the information furnished by Hon. Faizer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government, to the effect that action is being carried out to publish the Orders in the Government Gazette dated 2017‑11‑01 for the constitution of all Local Authorities inclusive of the said Local Authorities.

title: Memorandum of Cooperation on the Technical Intern Training Programme between Japan and Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Foreign Employment, to enter into a Memorandum of Cooperation on the Technical Intern Training Programme between the Ministry of Justice, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare of Japan and the Ministry of Foreign Employment of Sri Lanka with the objective of transferring high technical skills, techniques and knowledge from Japan to Sri Lanka, and exchange technical intern trainees between the two countries aimed at promoting bi‑lateral cooperation and considering the benefits derived to the migrant workers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of the Municipal Car Park in the Kandy City
decision_details: - It has been designed to upgrade the  Municipal Car Park Roof Top in the Kandy City under the Strategic Cities Development Project. The proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to award the above contract to M/s Sierra Construction (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs 654.11 million, excluding taxes, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of Consultancy Services Contract for Pre-Feasibility and Feasibility Study for the Six Light Rail Transit (LRT) lines in the Western Region of Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- It has been proposed to introduce Light Rail Transit lines in order to overcome the existing heavy traffic congestion in Colombo and suburbs and to address the issues related to the public transport system. Six Light Rail Transport Lines are to be constructed  in Colombo and suburbs accordingly and this project will be implemented under the Public Private Partnership basis. 

International Competitive bids have been called to select a consultancy agency to carry out the Pre-Feasibility studies prior to the construction of these six Light Rail Transit lines. Accordingly, bids have been submitted by five International Companies and therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to award the above consultancy service contract to M/s Seoyoung Engineering Co. Ltd., (SYE), Saman Corporation, Korea, for a sum of Rs 202 million, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultancy Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of infrastructure facilities in the Universities
Strengthening of the Bilateral Trade and Economic Cooperation between  Australia and Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The diplomatic ties  established in 1947 between Sri Lanka and Australia, one of the most developed countries in the world which has achieved high ranks in the global economic indicators. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Malik Samarawickrema, the Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade,  to enter into agreements to strengthen the Bilateral Trade and Economic Cooperation by further expanding the economic cooperation between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reconstruction of the Buddhist Temples affected by adverse weather conditions
decision_details: - Due to the flood and landslides which occurred in May 2017, damages, which involve the collapse of buildings, roofs, protective walls and walls around Bodhi trees have taken place in several Buddhist temples located in many areas island wide and the cost of the total loss has been reported as Rs 113.87 million by the District Secretaries. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Buddhasasana, to renovate the temples spread over in 09 Districts by utilizing the balance provision of  Rs 113.87, from the provisions allocated to the Ministry of Buddhasasana for conducting the United Nations Day of Vesak Celebrations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Groundwater Surveying Equipment and Drilling Machines for the Development of the Groundwater Resources of the areas affected by Dry Weather
decision_details: - Surface water sources as well as ground water sources are used in order to fulfill the demand for water in Sri Lanka. Due to the dry weather conditions prevailing in Sri Lanka, ground water sources have to be used mostly, to fulfill the water needs of specially in the District of Jaffna, Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa, Monaragala and Hambantota. The Water Resources Board is the main institution for the development of ground water resources in Sri Lanka but since most of the drilling machines owned by the  Board are more than 20 years old, the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to provide facilities necessary for the development and improvement of the ground water resources in the areas affected by dry weather conditions and for the usage of ground water sources with some regulatory measures, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Sugarcane Research Institute Act, No.75 of 1981
decision_details: - The Sugarcane Research Institute Act, No.75 of 1981 has been enacted with a view to providing facilities for researches conducted in the field of sugarcane cultivation. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Wasantha Perera, the Acting Minister of Plantation Industries, to amend the Sugarcane Research Institute Act, to extend the activities of the Sugarcane Research Institute to enable the   development of the sugarcane cultivation sector as well without limiting it to that of the institute only, by further expanding the scope of the Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) Gateway Project
decision_details: - It has been planned to develop the area adjoining the 18th Mile Post of the Colombo - Negambo road situated  adjoining the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) inclusive of transport, business, commercial, leisure and  recreational activities. Under Phase 1 of this  project, it is due to establish an integrated bus terminal, upgrade the railway station,  establish a taxi stand, a touring vehicle stand, banking services, cinema halls, hotels, recreational waterfronts, super market complexes etc. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to implement the 'Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) Gateway Project', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Lands for Aero City Development
Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between  Sri Lanka and the State of Qatar on Visa exemption of citizens who are holders of Diplomatic, Special and Official Passports
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Navinne, the Minister of  Internal Affairs, Wayamba Development and Cultural Affairs, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and the State of Qatar on Visa exemption of citizens in Sri Lanka and Qatar who are holders of Diplomatic, Special and Official Passports, with a view to strengthening the friendly relations between Sri Lanka and the State of Qatar, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: State Christmas Festival -2017
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. John Amaratunga, the Minister of Tourism Development and Christian Religious Affairs, to hold the 2017 State Christmas Festival under the theme "Christmas, the Origin of Love" in order to share the spirit of Christmas with a deep sense of commitment under the aegis of the Trincomalee Diocese, as one nation, in one country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Further expanding of the Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises Line of Credit Project
decision_details:
- The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has provided funds amounting to US$ 100 million for the implementation of a Line of Credit Project for the purpose of upgrading the Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises in Sri Lanka. Given the excessive demand for this loan scheme, it is anticipated that it will be possible to grant concessionary loans to Small and Medium-Size Entrepreneurs utilizing the fund in full, before completion of the period of the proposed project.    

	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to conduct negotiations with the Asian Development Bank to secure an additional fund of US$ 75 million to enable to grant concessionary loans to a  larger number of beneficiaries by further expanding the proposed loan scheme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Compost Yard under the proposed Consolidated Solid Waste Management Project in the Gampaha District
decision_details:
- The approval of the Cabinet has been granted for the implementation of a Solid Waste Management Project inclusive of the construction of a Hygienic Litter Bin in the Gampaha District where Urban Solid Waste gets collected largely due to the excessive population and the rapid industrialization. It has also been planned to manufacture organic fertilizer, having systematically categorized the solid waste collected by the Local Authorities in the Gampaha District, under this project utilizing the degradable waste. 

	As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to construct expeditiously, the organic fertilizer manufacturing yard required for the purpose of production,  as its initial step, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proclamation of the year 2018 as the 'Food Production Year'
decision_details:
- The 'National Food Production Programme - 2016 - 2018' was initiated targeting food security and sustainable cultivation and focus was laid on the manufacture of every essential food item which could be produced locally since Sri Lanka has to spend foreign currency exceeding Rs.200 billion annually for the importation of essential food items. However, the food production process in the country has faced a severe drawback due to the adverse weather conditions that prevailed during the past cultivation seasons and with a view to averting this situation and carrying out food production activities with a new vigour, the week for 'National Food Production Drive' was initiated recently.  

	By this, it is anticipated to achieve through a collective approach, the provision of remedies for the issues faced by the agriculture sector and the policy and technical guidance required for same, regaining our receding pride in agriculture and achieveing a sustainable agricultural development by rescuing the farmers from the difficult situations they are confronted with and making them the pioneers of the development of this country. Accordingly, the Cabinet took note of the information furnished by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, that action is being taken to direct the National Food Production Drive in collaboration with the Public Sector, Private Sector and Non‑Governmental Organizations as Stakeholders and to declare the year 2018 as the 'Food Production Year', giving priority to the formulation of policies and plans, in this regard.

title: Providing a Medical, Clinical and Healthcare Service with enhanced facilities for the benefit of Sri Lanka people affected by the Chronic Kidney Disease
'Diviyata Udanaya' Programme for Development of Micro and Cottage Industries
decision_details: - The budget 2017 has proposed to re‑commence the textile and the handloom industry and to upgrade the industrial estates for the development of small and medium scale industry projects.  Accordingly, the Cabinet taking note of the proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, the Minister of Industry and Commerce, to implement a programme named 'Diviyata Udanaya', to transform 10,000 household producers engaged in handloom and apparel, food products, woodwork and handicrafts as commercial level entrepreneurs, and to generate 11,000 direct and indirect new employment opportunities by creating 11,000 entrepreneurs through knowledge and skills development programmes, granted approval to implement the said programme in collaboration with similar loan scheme programmes implemented by the Government.

title: Upgrading of the Terminal Management Software (TMS) System of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - The Port of Colombo is functioning as a major container hub port in the South Asian Region and the other countries in the region are engaged in the development and modernization of the facilities and processes of their ports with the aim of bringing them into prominence. In this background, the Port of Colombo has to face severe competition and therefore, the software system used in the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) and the Unity Container Terminal (UCT) operated by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority in the Port of Colombo has to be updated expeditiously.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to upgrade the current Terminal Management Software (TMS) System used by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, utilizing the funds of the Authority and to appoint a Technical Evaluation Committee (TEC) and a Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), to take action in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Disposal of Marine Gas Oil (MGO) and  CST Fuel Oil Stock in the Tank Farm at the Hambantota Port
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously for  calling of tenders for the  disposal of 13,500 MT of Marine Gas Oil (MGO) and 628 MT of IFO-380 CST Fuel Oil Stock in the Tank Farm at the Hambantota Port, as the relevant empty tanks have to be handed over expeditiously, in terms of the provisions of the Hambanthota Concessionary Agreement. Accordingly,the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to grant the said fuel stock to Interocean Energy (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum  of US$ 3,220,800, as recommended by the Technical Evaluation Committee, as per the competitive bids called accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Married Quarters for the Junior Police Officers
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to award the contract for the construction of Married Quarters for Junior Police Officers at Kumaran Ratnam Road, Colombo 02 to M/s Construction Managers & Planners (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs.482.4 million without tax, as recommended by the Procurement Appeal Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of minor reservoirs
decision_details: - According to a survey conducted in the years 2015/2016, 10,497 minor reservoirs have been identified as being in a condition that requires rehabilitation. The expeditious initiation of the said rehabilitation is hindered by the dearth of technical staff in the Department of Agrarian Development. In order to address this, the proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Agriculture, to assign the preparation of engineering estimates, the supervision of construction sites and suchlike technical services necessary for the identified expeditious rehabilitation work that would incur a cost of more than Rs. 5 million, to external institutions with requisite skills, qualifications and experience following the national procurement guidelines, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tender for the Transportation and Installation of 50 Diesel Generators, 25 Transformers and 25  Diesel Tanks
decision_details: - When electricity is generated by the Ceylon Electricity Board,  the entire system undergoes a total failure due to generation deficiencies that occur at times and as such, the Board has decided to purchase container stored 50 diesel generators to avert minor blackouts. Similarly, it has also been decided to procure 25 container stored transformers and 25 diesel fuel tanks. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to authorize the Ceylon Electricity Board, to award the contract of the said tender to M/s Sterling and Wilson Private Ltd.,  in India, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchasing Coal for Coal Power Plant in Puttalam through Spot Tenders
decision_details: - It has been decided to purchase the coal required expeditiously for the Puttalam Coal Power Plant under the Spot Tender methodology. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to award the tender for the purchase of 300,000 MT of coal for US$ 91.85 per MT to M/s Swiss Singapore Overseas Enterprises Pte Ltd., was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Stage II of the Accident and Emergency Medical Treatment Unit at the Teaching Hospital, Jaffna
decision_details:
- Since the facilities available for accident and emergency medical treatment for patients are not adequate, activities of Stage I of the construction of accident and emergency medical treatment unit of the Jaffna Teaching Hospital was commenced by utilizing the provisions set apart under budget 2015 and by now, the said activities are being carried out by the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau and simultaneously the construction activities of Stage II also have to be commenced. 

	Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to award the contract for the construction of Stage II of the  Accident and Emergency Medical Treatment Unit of the Teaching Hospital, Jaffna on 'design and built' basis to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB) and the Central Engineering Services (Pvt.) Ltd. for a sum of Rs.1,359.35 million, with tax, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The new Electoral system and creating of awareness among the General Public and the Civil Organizations on Women's representation within that system
decision_details: - The legal base required for the implementation of the new Electoral System in all Local Authorities has been created by the Local Authorities Elections (Amendment) Act, No.16 of 2017. These amendments have brought about the election of a Member accountable to the Division and  ensured the Proportional Representation.  However, it has become apparent that the public understanding of these amendments is still not at a sufficient level. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs; Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government; and Hon. (Mrs.) Chandrani Bandara, the Minister of Women and Child Affairs, to implement expeditious programmes to create awareness of the general public and the civil organizations in respect of the mixed proportional representation system introduced through the amendments to the Local Authorities Election System and the assurance of  women's representation expected therein, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the  Postal Department of Sri Lanka and other Foreign Postal Institutions relating to the combined issuing of stamps
decision_details: - It has been decided to issue commemorative stamps in commemoration of  60 years of the start of the diplomatic relations between the Russian Federation  and Nepal with Sri Lanka and 40 years of diplomatic relations with the Republic of Korea. These commemorative stamps are to be created between Sri Lanka and Nepal based on the historical Buddhist Shrines and between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Korea based on Cultural Dances of the two countries and between Sri Lanka and the Russian Federation based on Cave Temples of Sri Lanka and the similar religious sites in Russia. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. M.H.A. Haleem, the Minister of Posts, Postal Services and Muslim Religious Affairs, to sign the MoUs between the Postal Department and the relevant Postal Institutions of the respective countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Republic of Korea for sending workers under the Employment Permit System (EPS)
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice,  to extend the period of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between the Ministry of Employment and Labour of the Republic of Korea and the Ministry of Foreign Employment of the Democratic Socialist Republic of  Sri Lanka in the year 2015 for a further period of 02 years, with a view to making provisions for implementing an employment permit system to enhance the transparency and efficiency of the process of providing employment for Sri Lankan workers in the Republic of Korea and to carry out suitable measures for cooperation between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The adoption of a National Action Plan to combat Corruption in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice, to prepare an  Action Plan to combat corruption in Sri Lanka with the collaboration of the relevant agencies to strengthen the anti-bribery and corruption agencies, to co-coordinate productively the entire institutional structure to promote national integration, to enhance the co‑operation of the public and private sector with regard to the prevention of fraud, bribery and corruption and raise public understanding of the adverse effects of bribery and corruption on Sri Lankan society, was approved by  the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Storm Water Drainage & Environment Improvement Project for Kalu Oya Basin
decision_details: - The Kalu Oya basin in the Gampaha District has been identified as a priority area for the future urban development activities and therefore, it has been proposed to design and implement a storm water drainage and environment improvement project for the basin within a duration of 5 years (2018 - 2022). As such, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to implement the project as a priority project under foreign aid, was approved in principle by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a New Technical College at Meesalai North, Thenmarachchi in the Jaffna District
decision_details:
- The College of Technology in Jaffna is the only institute functioning under the Department of Technical Education and Training for providing quality vocational training opportunities to the youth in the Jaffna District. The college receives approximately 8,000 applications annually for admission to courses but the facilities available in the Technical College are sufficient only for about 1,500 trainees. 

Taking this situation into consideration, a proposal has been made to establish  a technical college at Meesalai North, Thenmarachchi at Walikamam  where it has been designed to conduct several vocational courses pertaining to the National Vocational Qualification (NVQ) Level 3 and 4. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Chandima Weerakkody, the Minister of  Skills Development and Vocational Training, to construct the said technical college at a cost of Rs 560 million, within the next two years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Medical Ordinance in order to prepare the Specialist Register
decision_details: - The maintenance of separate registers of specialists is considered as an important  precondition for obtaining of more secure medical care by the general public. Taking this matter into consideration, approval of the Cabinet has been granted to amend the Medical Ordinance to prepare a Specialist Register with the objective of preserving the quality of patient care services. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to publish the Bill to amend the Medical Ordinance prepared accordingly, in the Government Gazette and to present the same in Parliament thereafter, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting of permanent houses to the displaced families who should be resettled in other safe locations due to the risk of floods
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet has been granted to implement a programme for  granting permanent houses for 14,860 families living in high risk landslide zones, identified by the National Buildings and Research Organization to be settled in a safe location. As such, the programme is being implemented at present  through the District Secretaries. 

In addition to the said programme, District Secretaries have pointed out that it is appropriate that families whose houses were completely damaged due to the flood disaster that occurred in the year 2017 and are due to be resettled in a safe location, are also given houses on the same basis on which the above programme was implemented. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, the Minister of Disaster Management, to construct 1,122 houses in safe areas, for the resettlement of families in 05 districts, who  live in high risk flood zones and whose houses were damaged due to the floods, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Wattegama Samurdhi Community Based Bank
decision_details: - 332 Samurdhi General Councils and 1,074 Samurdhi Community based banks  function island-wide presently. It has become a timely need to upgrade the facilities of those buildings where the branches of these Samurdhi banks are located. Accordingly, a proposal has been made to establish the Wattegama Samurdhi Community Based Bank in the Kandy District, which is presently maintained amidst various shortcomings in a place that is  really difficult  to access, in a location where the public could be served conveniently. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, the Minister of Social Empowerment, Welfare and Kandyan Heritage, to vest a state land of 20 perches located at Wattegama, with the Department of Samurdhi Development, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of Kundasale-Haragama Water Supply Scheme
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has already been granted to implement Kundasale-Haragama Water Supply Scheme with foreign aid assistance. However, taking into consideration the difficulties faced by 6000 families in 14 villages  in the Pathahewaheta and Kundasale Divisional Secretariat Divisions, due to the lack of safe drinking water caused through  the delay in implementing the project, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, the Minister of Social Empowerment, Welfare and Kandyan Heritage, to upgrade the Kundasale‑Haragama Water Supply Scheme to fulfill the water needs of the public in 14 villages including Anuragama, Pubudugama and Mudunakade where Samurdhi beneficiaries and low income earning families live, utilizing the funds of the Samurdhi Development Fund established in respect of the common development activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute (BIDTI) of Sri Lanka and the Institute of Foreign Affairs of Nepal (IFA)
decision_details:
- A proposal has been made to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute (BIDTI) of Sri Lanka and the Institute of Foreign Affairs of Nepal (IFA) to provide an opportunity for the officials in the diplomatic, foreign policy and international relation sectors in Sri Lanka and Nepal, and the parties interested in those fields, to  exchange information, expertise and training programmes. 

As such, this will pave the way to further expand the long term friendship existing between Sri Lanka and Nepal and to build up interrelations among emerging leaders, officials and students of both countries.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Thilak Marapana, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, to sign the proposed MoU and thereafter, take appropriate measures to implement the Agreement effectively, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Securities Exchange Act - 2017
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet has been granted to introduce a new Act in lieu of the Securities and Exchange Commission Act, No.36 of 1987 to suit the challenges presently faced by the Capital Market. As such, the proposed 'Securities Exchange Bill' has been formulated for Sri Lanka, taking into consideration the regulatory principles and standards adopted by the stock exchange regulatory institutions which function successfully in the developing countries.  

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and to present the same in Parliament thereafter for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the term of the Secretariat for Coordinating Reconciliation Mechanisms (SCRM)
decision_details:
- The Secretariat for Coordinating Reconciliation Mechanisms (SCRM) was established in the year 2015 for a period of two (02) years, for the effective implementation of the decisions, programmes and processes related to the reconciliation in Sri Lanka. The Secretariat continues to discharge its functions by coordinating the relevant Ministries and the stakeholders such as other  Government Institutions, International Organizations and the Civil Society and facilitating the reconciliation process.  

	As such, considering the need for implementing a planned programme to create awareness among the general public of the country for building up reconciliation, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister,  to extend the tenure of the said office up to 2019‑03‑31, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of a Special Disaster Management Plan in association with the affected areas of the Uma Oya Multipurpose Development Project
decision_details:
- The need for the proper management of the situation of the area during the forthcoming rainy monsoon has arisen, owing to the water leakage which had occurred during the excavations of the tunnel of the Uma Oya Multipurpose Development Project. It has been proposed to implement a special pre-planned disaster management plan within the period of next three (03) months for the purpose.  

Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to  implement a Special Disaster Management Plan to identify beforehand, the landslide risks in the Grama Niladhari Divisions in the Divisional Secretariat Divisions of Bandarawela, Ella and Welimada and frequently monitor the said landslide prone places during the forthcoming rainy season to respond expeditiously in case of an emergency disaster situation and establish a Special Disaster Management Operation Centre around the Bandarawela Town to direct the said operations,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the Supply and delivery of cylinder lubricating oil for Barge Mounted Power Plant
decision_details: - The 60MW Barge Mounted Thermal Power Plant owned by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) consists of 4 generators.  It has been estimated that 750,000 liters of cylinder lubricant oil and 175,000 liters of system lubricating oil is required for these generators for the forthcoming year.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to award the contract for the supply and distribution of lubricating oil to M/s N.M. Distributors (Pvt.) Ltd., at a sum of Rs.295.40 per litre of cylinder lubricating oil and at a sum of Rs.253.83 per litre of system lubricating oil, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Environment improvement Work of the proposed Multi - Model Transport Centre at Makumbura
decision_details:
- Development activities of the area, associated with Kottawa - Makumbura Interchange of the Southern Expressway are presently being carried out under the Programme for the improvement of the Colombo City Transport Services to transform it into a multi-purpose transport hub to coalesce and meet the transportation needs of commuters and a proposal has also been made to carry out improvements on commercial, recreational and environmental activities to coincide with such development. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to accomplish these development tasks through the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation by utilizing the funds of the Urban Development Authority, was approved by the cabinet.

title: Construction of the proposed Medical Ward Complex at the District General Hospital in Chilaw
decision_details: - District General Hospital-Chilaw is the largest hospital that provides  patient care services to the population of the Puttlam District. Therefore, a proposal has been made to upgrade the medical ward complex of the hospital where 88 beds are presently available, with a view to facilitating a larger number of patients. Accordingly, taking into consideration the need of accomplishing the said task expeditiously,  the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to award the contract for the construction of the proposed medical wards complex, to the State Engineering Cooperation of Sri Lanka, for a sum of Rs 583 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the cabinet.

title: Construction of the Renal Care Unit at the Teaching Hospital in Batticaloa
decision_details:
- Batticaloa District has been identified as a district with a high prevalence of kidney disease. Therefore, a proposal has been made to construct a renal care unit equipped with clinical and laboratory facilities at the teaching hospital Batticaloa, enabling it to supply an easy to access quality care service and identify the disease at its early stage for the purpose of preventing deaths due to kidney diseases. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to award the above contract for  the construction of the Renal Treatment Unit to M/s Nuwani Construction (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs 383 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Clinical Building at the Rehabilitation Hospital in Ragama
decision_details: - A proposal has been made to construct the new clinical building at the Ragama Rehabilitation Hospital which is the only institution in the country developed solely for the purpose of rehabilitation treatment.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to award the contract for the construction of the above building to M/s Link Engineering (Pvt) Ltd., for a sum of Rs 195 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the cabinet.

title: Agreement on Economic Cooperation between the Government of the Republic of Korea and the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Republic of Korea which has achieved an incredible growth in the economic and the technical field, over the past several decades, is considered a leading country in the technology sector of the global market. As such, a proposal has been made to sign an Economic Cooperation Agreement on Investment Partnership, Trade Relations, Tourism Promotion and Industrial Cooperation etc with the Republic of Korea, and the proposal made by Hon. Malik Samarawickrema, the Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade,  to sign the aforesaid Agreement during the official visit of H.E the President, Maithripala Sirisena, to the Republic of Korea scheduled to take place at the end of November this year, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a new prison lockup in Mannar
decision_details: - The prison inmates due to be produced before the Mannar Courts are detained in the Vavuniya Prison and it is a difficult task to convey them daily along a distance of about 85 KM from the Vavuniya Prison to the Mannar Courts. As such, they are escorted to Mannar the day before and detained temporarily in a building  belonging to the Department of Customs and since the building is very old it has been difficult to provide the inmates with even the basic facilities. Accordingly, considering the need of constructing a permanent prison lockup in Mannar for the Department of Prisons, the proposal made by Hon. D.M. Swaminathan, the Minister of Prison Reforms, Rehabilitation, Resettlement and Hindu Religious Affairs, to construct a new prison lockup in the block of land located in the Grama Niladhari Division of Uppukulama (South) adjoining the Mannar Court Complex released to the Department of Prisons, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of land ownership and proper housing for the Plantation Community
decision_details:
- It is expected to grant houses for the beneficiaries at the end of this year from  several housing projects under the Government programme for granting housing facilities with clear title deeds to the plantation community living in line rooms.  

Accordingly, it has been planned to grant title deeds for 2,551 houses constructed under the Green Gold Housing Programme, 1,134 houses of Phase I, constructed under the Indian Grant for families affected by disasters in the year 2017, and  75 houses of the Meeriyabedda Housing Project,  implemented   for people who had lost their houses due to disasters in the year 2015. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. U. Palani Digambaram, the Minister of  Hill Country New Villages, Infrastructure and Community Development,  to get the plots of land  on which the relevant housing schemes are implemented, released from the regional plantation companies for the issue of such title deeds, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Regulations to regulate Small Commercial Vessels promulgated under the Merchant Shipping Act, No. 52 of 1971
decision_details: - Along with the growth of the tourism industry, there is a huge trend towards using small vessels for coastal passenger transportation and recreational affairs in Sri Lanka. The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to present the Gazette Extraordinary Notification  No.2017/31 dated 2017-05-04, containing 'Merchant Shipping (Small Commercial Vessels) Regulations' issued by the Minister of Ports and Shipping, under the Merchant Shipping Act, No.52 of 1971, in order to regularize the registration and regulation of small commercial vessels, in Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: State Vesak Festival of the year 2018
decision_details: - The proposal  made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Buddhasasana, to conduct  the State Vesak Festival of the year 2018 of 2562nd year of Buddhist Era, centralizing  the historic Bingiriya Raja Maha Viharaya in the Kurunegala District and to  declare the 26th April to 02nd May of 2018 as the 'Vesak Week', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Formulation of a mechanism for the development, conservation and management of river basins
decision_details: - A vital need has arisen for the proper conservation of the river basins and catchment areas in Sri Lanka when facing the issues caused through the irregular utilization of land areas that should be conserved due to population growth and the challenges posed by urbanization and industrialization. A proper institutional structure has to be established to control the issues such as  pollution of river water due to the disposal of  garbage and industrial effluent, erosion of the bed and banks of rivers due to sand mining, excavation for gem, clay and other minerals, the changes to course and flow of rivers due to irregular constructions and various human activities and endangering of the ecological environment due to different development activities carried out in river reserve areas. Therefore, taking into consideration the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to carry out the  development, conservation and management of river basins and catchment areas in Sri Lanka with a participatory management approach, the Cabinet decided to grant approval in principle, for the formulation of a suitable mechanism for the purpose, with the representation of all ministries and institutions.

title: Establishment of a Monitoring Office of the International Rice Research Institution (IRRI) in Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- Although paddy production should be further increased with the challenges of climatic change and population increase in order to meet the food requirement of the country, it is not possible to practically increase the arable land  any further and as such, it has become absolutely necessary to increase the paddy production and the qualitative aspect of the produce with the use of research findings and new technological methods.  

In obtaining the scientific and technical knowledge required for Sri Lanka in this regard, the Headquarters of the International Rice Research Institution established in the Philippines has made a great contribution. It has been proposed to establish an Operating Office of the Institution at the Paddy Research Institute situated in Bathalagoda, Sri Lanka, in order to carry out the research and training programmes relating to the future paddy cultivation more productively.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Agriculture, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the International Rice Research Institution and the  Paddy Research Institute  of Sri Lanka for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Small Scale Solar Power Plants under the Soorya Bala Sangramaya Programme - Phase II
decision_details:
- The Cabinet has granted approval to establish 60 solar power plants of 01 MW under phase I of the Soorya Bala Sangramaya Programme and at present, the evaluation of the proposals submitted in this regard is being processed.  The Ceylon Electricity Board has confirmed that an opportunity could be provided for 90 solar power plant projects of 01 MW under phase II of the project.  

When calling for proposals from the investors, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to review the criteria adopted in phase I of the project and call applications for 90 projects in respect of phase II, with the necessary amendments to create a greater competition, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of the Garbage Dumping Land in Peliyagoda
decision_details: - A proposal has been made to utilize the extent exceeding 07 Acres of land with a high market value belonging to the Urban Development Authority used at present as a dumping ground for solid waste, for development purposes. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to develop the plot of land by a systematic filling of the land and designing a Storm Water Drainage System in the adjoining area, with the assistance of the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation (SLLR&DC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting of an additional land to provide the infrastructure facilities for the 'walk up' apartment complex at Angoda
decision_details:
- The 'Urban Regeneration Project' has undertaken to construct apartments to resettle the residents of the underserved settlements in the city of Colombo. By now,  6,000 apartment units have been constructed in 12 locations in the city of Colombo and its suburbs under phase I of the Project. 
 
As such, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to get an additional extent of land from the adjoining state owned land vested with the Urban Development Authority to construct a sewer treatment plant for the apartment complex being constructed with 500 units in Angoda under the 'Urban Regeneration Project', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Public Market Complexes
decision_details:
- It has been observed that most of the Public Market Complexes built in the  major town centres of the Western Province, a number of decades before, using   substantial extents of land, are in a very primitive and dilapidated condition. As such, it has been proposed to renovate these Market Complexes managed by the Local Authorities to suit the present trends to make the optimum use of such space for commercial purposes.             

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development to implement a project, for the development of the Public Market Complexes situated at Collpetty, Bambalapitiya, Borella, Nugegoda, Maharagama, Dehiwala, Mount Lavinia, Moratuwa and Katubedda with the state of the art facilities under a joint formal methodology adopted by the Urban Development Authority (UDA) and the relevant local authorities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reduction of Landslide Vulnerability by the Disaster Mitigation Measures
decision_details:
- Due to intensive rains caused by climatic changes and as well as Landslides owing to the poor land use patterns resulting in slope instabilities have become a common occurrence in the mountainous region of the country. The National  Building Research Organization (NBRO) and the other relevant Government Institutions have implemented a diverse number of programmes for the management of landslide risks. Measures for the mitigation of disaster risks should be taken, further, in order to arrest the threat of landslide as a whole, inclusive of the use of technical equipment required to detect the risks beforehand, embankment strengthening, surface water and ground water flows management, preparedness supported by training, awareness creation and construction of temporary evacuation centres.   

Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, the Minister of Disaster Management, to mitigate the risk of landslides by adopting the measures for risks mitigation and to implement a project for the mitigation of disaster risks within the forthcoming four (04) years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief assistance to the people affected due to the dry weather conditions
decision_details:
- The Government has implemented a programme presently, for providing a dry ration for the families who have been deprived of their livelihoods due to the extreme dry weather conditions and facing severe economic difficulties. Under this programme, the dry rations have been given to 740,000 families of 19 Districts. Although, several Districts have received a considerable rainfall, it is observed that the rainfall so received is not adequate enough to overcome the situation in the areas where extreme dry weather conditions prevail and also that the families who are affected due to the drought will need a considerable amount of time to rebuild their livelihoods.  

As such, the proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, the Minister of Disaster Management, to continue to give the dry rations for those families further and for the Ministry of Disaster Management to secure the funds necessary for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Resettlement of families resident in the lands to be used for the development purposes of the Kelani Valley Railway Line in other locations
decision_details:
