- The objective of the Kelani Valley Railway Line Development Project is the development of the road section from Maradana to Padukka by constructing a double track and for rehabilitating the balance section up to Avissawella. A survey is being conducted on the socio-economic effects when releasing lands required for the project and the activities of the survey from Maradana to Homagama has by now been completed. As revealed in the survey, the 2,100 families who reside in the railway reservations on either side of the railway line should be resettled in other places before commencing the construction work of the project.  

In this respect, the preferred and the most practicable solution available at present for addressing this issue is to utilize the Housing Units of the Housing Projects constructed by the Urban Development Authority (UDA) under the 'Urban Regeneration Project'. The Authority has consented to set apart 2,036 houses with a capacity of 400 to 500 sq. feet for the purpose for a value of Rs.4 to Rs.5 million each, from the houses expected to be completed from such projects, within the period from 2017 to 2019.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to secure the funds necessary to reserve such houses, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on the Conservation of Migratory Sharks
decision_details:
- Sri Lanka being a party to the Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species of Wild Animals, since 1993 is bound to ensure the protection of the migratory wild animals listed in this Convention within the territorial waters of the country. This Convention favours the signing of International and Regional Level MoUs between the Governments covering the migratory animal species or groups.   

	As such, a proposal has been made to sign a MoU regarding the conservation of the migratory sharks at the stakeholders Convention scheduled to be held in Philippines from 22nd to 28th of October 2017. The said MoU will be helpful in providing opportunities for sources of financial and technical assistance for the conservation of migratory sharks. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Sustainable Development and Wildlife, to sign the MoU on behalf of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion and Improvement of Daycare Facilities for Children
decision_details:
- Presently, the women labour force participation in the national labour force is only 36% and the constraint for increasing it further due to women resigning from their jobs and their lack of interest on being employed because of the  responsibility of childcare placed on them has been identified as the lack of adequate facilities for childcare. Since, a considerable number of women with a higher level of education could be harnessed in obtaining their contributions to the economy of the country, the Government has identified that priority should be accorded further for the enhancement of this sector through the development of affordable and high quality daycare facilities in the country.   

According to a survey carried out by the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs, it has been revealed that around 24,000 children are taken care of, in 1,200 daycare centres managed by both the Government and the private sector in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to appoint a Committee comprising of the representatives of the Government, the Provincial Councils and the Private Sector to study the further expansion and enhancement of the child daycare facilities in Sri Lanka, identifying the problems pertaining to the field, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and Nepal on Youth Development
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and Nepal focusing attention on the areas where priority has to be given in  the area of co-operation on youth development, such as implementation of programmes for sharing the knowledge and experience, leadership and personality development, as well as skills development, youth  cultural programmes, encouraging the youth entrepreneurs in both countries, exchange programmes between the two countries to facilitate for the youth volunteer groups etc., was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making provisions for the control of election expenses
decision_details:
- For the proper exercise of the universal suffrage which is an integral part of the peoples sovereignty, conducting of free and fair elections is an absolute necessity.  If an election is to be held in a free and fair manner, it is necessary to have the true reflection of the opinion of the people in exercising their vote without any influence and if any political party, a group or a candidate spends money lavishly with no control it will cause a considerable effect on the choice of the people. 

	Many countries including India have introduced legislation to control election expenses to ensure the true reflection of the peoples' opinion and it has been found that such kind of a control on the election expenses will also help to reduce illegal acts, violent incidents as well as corruptions. In the elections held in Sri Lanka prior to 1977 there were laws in force to obtain Reports of expenses borne by the candidates but under the present system of elections such provisions have not been enshrined. The Election Commission has reported that a basic consensus has been reached in this regard, after a discussion with the Secretaries and representatives of the recognized political parties and the legal fraternity. 

	Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to amend the existing election laws and also to enact new laws to enable to obtain the Reports of election expenses incurred by political parties, groups and the candidates and to impose a ceiling on such expenditure, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Import of Rice to maintain a buffer stock for the prevention of a price hike in the Domestic Market
decision_details: - Due to the adverse weather conditions prevailing in the island, which has resulted in not having adequate rain, there is a steep decline in the extent of land cultivated in paddy in the Maha Season this year. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, the Minister of Industry and Commerce, for the private sector to import rice and maintain a buffer stock to prevent any shortage of rice in the market, to store the rice so imported in the bonded warehouses as a buffer stock and to release the rice to the market systematically, so as to enable the control  of price of  rice in the market, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion of the facilities in the Vocational Training Centre, Moneragala of the National Youth Services Council
decision_details: - The Moneragala Vocational Training Centre of the National Youth Services Council was established in the year 1987 and no proper programme has since been initiated up to now for the expansion of its facilities. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs,  to construct a new building to accommodate lecture halls in the Vocational Training Centre, Moneragala, to conduct 10 courses, with facilities for training of 250 youth, aimed at the job market for motor mechanism, construction and tourist hotel industry, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding four Contracts for the Development of Roads under the Let's Awaken Polonnaruwa District Development Programme of the Presidential Programme for 'Awakening Rajarata'
decision_details:
- The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to award the following four contracts implemented under the Let's Awaken Polonnaruwa District Development Programme of the Presidential Programme for 'Awakening Rajarata, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet. 

*	Development of Manampitiya - Aralaganwila - Maduru Oya Road (from 3.0km up to 33.0km)
*	Rehabilitation and Improvement of the Dehiattakandiaya - Aralaganwila of Road (from 0km up to 21.10km)
*	Improvement of the Minneriya - Galoya Road (from 0km up to 14.54km)
*	Improvement of the Elahera - Giritale Road (from 0km up to 29.0km)

title: Financing the Consultancy Services for Design Review and Construction Supervision of Civil Works for extension of the Southern Expressway Project
decision_details: - The construction work of all the 4 Sections of the Southern Expressway from Matara to Hambantota commenced in the latter part of 2015 and as of now the construction work is underway.  As such, the proposal made by Hon. Ravi Karunanayake, the Minister of Finance, to enter into a Framework Agreement with the Government of the Peoples Republic of China, to obtain a loan of Renminbi Yuan 577 Million for the Design Review and the Construction Supervision of Civil Work and also to enter into a Loan Agreement with Exim Bank of China to obtain the above Loan under the concessional loan facilities provided by the Government of China, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Pilot Project for establishment of a Ground Water Monitoring Network covering the Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa and Moneragala Districts
decision_details: - Proper management of ground water usage in Sri Lanka is extremely important and in this context, it is essential to collect timely data on quantity and quality of ground water.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to award the contract for the establishment of a pilot project on the data network on ground water monitoring, covering the river basins of the Malwathu Oya in the Anuradhapura District, the Maduru Oya in the Polonnaruwa District and the Kumbukkan Oya in the Moneragala District, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Building for the Divisional Secretariat,  Homagama
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Vajira Abeywardena, the Minister of Home Affairs, to award the contract for the construction of a new 03 storeyed building for the Divisional Secretariat, Homagama, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Setting up of an Intravenous Solution Manufacturing Plant in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Government spends a large sum of money annually, for the importation of medicinal drugs and other medical equipment. The Cabinet approval has already been granted to set up an Intravenous Solution Manufacturing Plant in Sri Lanka to save foreign exchange at least to a certain extent and enable the manufacture of essential Intravenous Medicinal Products in their fresh and high quality form and supply in a short supply time to all hospitals in the country uninterruptedly. As such, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to award the contract of the project for setting up of the manufacturing plant, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Infrastructure facilities of the Universities
decision_details: - In order to retain the services of the academic and non-academic staff of the Universities outside Colombo, it is imperative that they are provided with accommodation facilities within the University premises itself.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to implement the projects for the construction of quarters for the staff of the  Rajarata, Ruhuna, Wayamba, Sabaragamuwa, Eastern and Jaffna Universities, to construct a 4 storeyed building for the development of the Jaffna Regional Centre of the Open University and also to renovate the old buildings at the Peradeniya University premises and put them in order, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a new rail track from Kurunegala to Habarana via Dambulla
decision_details: - An impact assessment has already been made on the construction of a  new rail track from Kurunegala to Habarana via Dambulla.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to obtain the services of the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB), to assist the Negotiation Committee Appointed by the Cabinet of Ministers, in the Technological Proposal made by the Project Proposer which is a Chinese Engineering Company, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Resettlement of the displaced families due to the implementation of the Moragahakanda - Kaluganga Development Project in the Medirigiriya Divisional Secretary's Division
decision_details: - A section of the displaced families owing to the Moragahakanda - Kaluganga Development Project is re-settled in the Kaluganga Catchment area and 9,000 Ha of productive lands in the Medirigiriya area belonging to the Mahaweli D-Zone have been identified to re-settle the remaining families.  Under this programme the development activities in 4 Grama Niladari Divisions of the Medirigiriya Divisional Secretary's Division is already underway and is scheduled to carry out the human settlement development activities, in order to completely cover the Divisional Secretary's Division. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to expand the irrigational and human settlement development activities in the 9 Grama Niladari Divisions of the Medirigiriya Divisional Secretary's Division which is presently under-developed and also to conduct feasibility studies to expand the development activities of the remaining 32 Grama Niladari Divisions,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Knuckles Information Centre - Forest Conservation Department
decision_details: - The construction work of a fully pledged information centre, within the Knuckles Conservation Forest belonging to the World Heritage Site of the Central Highlands commenced in 2014 but the construction of the centre has been suspended for want of necessary funds.  As such,  the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to re-commence the construction work of the information centre, utilizing the Rs.23 Million, from the 'Punarudaya Work Programme of 2016-2018', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Establishment of a Solar Power Park of 100MW in the Siyabalaanduwa Area
decision_details: - At present, an unprecedented attention is being diverted worldwide in the generation of electricity through the eco-friendly renewable energy sources. In this respect, a high priority has been accorded to solar power.  Presently, solar power plants of 11.3Mw have been connected to the Central Electricity Board Network of Sri Lanka and up to now nearly 30Mw is generated under the Net Metering System. By now, several projects are being implemented with the objective of increasing electricity generation in Sri Lanka through solar power and it has also been planned to establish 03 new solar power parks. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to conduct a feasibility study for the construction of a solar power park with a capacity of 100Mw in the Moneragala, Siyambalanduwa area, as a first step, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Recreational Facilities Development Project at Kumbichchankulama Lake at Anuradhapura
decision_details: - Although, the Anuradhapura town has the basic infrastructure facilities as well as common amenities, to cater to the population there are no recreation and leisure facilities in the town.  As such, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to allocate funds for Phase II of the project with the objective of renovating the Kumbichchankulama Lake and developing its surroundings with recreational facilities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Declaration of a National Integration and Reconciliation Week from 8th-14th January 2017
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of National Integration and Reconciliation, to declare, 'the National Integration and Reconciliation Week' every year from 8th-14th January 2017, with a view to laying the foundation for promoting a nation building effort for a united, strong, reconciled and prosperous nation and to implement various programmes focussing on all schools in the island, the media and public and private institutions to co-inside with the Reconciliation Week from the year 2017, highlighting the importance of National Integration, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Programme on Prevention of Chronic Kidney Disease - 2016 to 2018
decision_details: - The Chronic Kidney Disease of unknown etiology, a major non-contagious disease, which has taken root in Sri Lanka recently has by now become more prevalent in the North Central, Uva, Wayamba, Northern, Central and Eastern Provinces of Sri Lanka, while patients have also been reported, to a certain extent, in the District of Hambantota in the Southern Province. This disease has not only become a major health hazard but also has created several socio economic problems, as well. In order to overcome the health crisis which has arisen due to the disease, it is essential to launch a programme for prevention, screening of patients, treatment of patients, implementation of welfare measures constantly for the families of the patients and the provision of safe drinking water.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to obtain funds necessary for the National Programme on   Prevention of Chronic Kidney Disease implemented by the Presidential Task Force on  Prevention of Kidney Disease during the period from 2016 to 2018, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Relocation of two transmission lines to facilitate construction of the proposed New Bridge over the Kelani River
decision_details: - The preliminary activities for construction of a six-lane bridge over the Kelani River for connecting the existing Colombo - Katunayake Express Way, have now been completed. In this regard, it is necessary to relocate two main power transmission lines of Kolonnawa - Kelanitissa 132kv and the Biyagama - Kelanitissa 420kv, to facilitate the construction of the new bridge. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to award the contract for relocating the two power transmission lines, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Budget Financing for 2016 and 2017
decision_details: - When mobilizing the funds required for the Budget Financing, in addition to accessing the domestic market through Government Securities, the foreign currency financing resources, raising of Foreign Currency Credit facilities through the Foreign Currency Banking Units of the State Banks, provision of the foreign exchange term financing facilities and the issue of International Sovereign Bonds also could be utilized.  According to the alternative diversified borrowing options, the required funds could be mobilized at a reduced cost and an opportunity also will be created for various investors who show interest, to gain access to the Sri Lanka Loan Market.  At the same time, a greater competition will also be created among those investors.  Accordingly, the joint proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wirckremasinghe, the Prime Minister, in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, and Hon. Ravi Karunanayake, the Minister of Finance, to appoint a Steering Committee and a Technical Evaluation Committee comprising of the officials of the General Treasury, the Ministry of National Policies and Economic Affairs and the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, to pursue action to move forward in the provision of foreign exchange term financing facility, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: ‘Awakening Rajarata’ - Presidential Programme - Award of Three Contracts for Road Development under the ‘Let’s Awaken Polonnaruwa’ District Development Programme - 2016-2020
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to award the contracts for the development of Habarana - Batticaloa Road (B529) in the Urban Area of Polonnaruwa with a 4 lane track up to a distance of 7.5 km, improvement of Dambulla - Bakamuna - Kalagahawela Road (B615) up to a distance of 13.6 km and widening and carpeting 5.06 km of the Maradankadawala - Habarana - Thirikkondiyamadu Road from Polonnaruwa to the New Town, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Colombo National Highways Project - Improvement of the Road section from Kottawa to Moragahahena on the Kottawa - Thalagala Road (B239)
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to award the contract for the improvement of the Road section from Kottawa to Moragahahena on the Kottawa - Thalagala Road (B239) from 1.0 km to 15.48 km under the Colombo National Highways Project funded by the OPEC Fund for International Development (OFID), as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Colombo National Highways Project - Improvement of the Road section from Godagama to Bope in the Kotte-Bope Road (B240)
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to award the contract for the improvement of Road section from Godagama to Bope in the Kotte-Bope Road (B240) from 16.740 km to 28.004 km under the Colombo National Highways Project funded by the OPEC Fund for International Development (OFID), as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Mulativu Police Station
decision_details: - Priority has been accorded for the construction of buildings for Police Stations and the improvement of the existing Police Stations under the special programme initiated in order to maintain law and order within the Northern Province. Although, Cabinet approval was granted in 2014, to construct a new building for the Mulativu Police Station instead of the building it occupied on rental basis, the implementation of the project has been delayed.  As such, the proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayaka, the Minister of Law & Order and Southern Development, to initiate the construction of the building for the Mulativu Police Station expeditiously, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the Kelani River Flood Protection Bunds
decision_details: - The Kelani River is one of the major rivers in Sri Lanka and a 2/3 area of its basin consists of low lands including the Colombo City and the suburbs in an around it, which get flooded frequently.  During the floods in May 2016, it was observed that there are weak sections in the bunds erected under the scheme designed for the protection of the Colombo City and the Kelaniya Town, from river flooding.  The major reason for the vulnerability of flood protection trends are public encroachments. With the objective of renovating the existing major bunds, the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to implement a project for the development of the flood protection bunds of the Kelani River, at an estimated cost of Rs.1,000 Million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Multi purpose Fishery Harbours in Udappuwa, Delft, Madhagal and Chalei
decision_details: - The Government has planned to establish Multi purpose Fishery Harbour Complexes so as to cover all the three fields namely the fishery, commercial and tourism. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding with the Ministry of Oceans and Fisheries of the Republic of Korea, to make enable large fishing trawlers to gain access and to construct Multi purpose Fishery Harbours in Udappuwa, Delft, Madhagal and Chalei with cold storage, fish drying, packing facilities and centres for repairing fishing equipment and for the preparation of a feasibility report on constructing the above multi purpose harbours, free of charge, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Millawa Industries Cluster as Phase I of the Proposed Horana Industrial Township Development
decision_details: - It is proposed to establish two large industrial townships in Horana and Meerigama areas under the Western Region Megapolis Plan.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to establish the Millawa Industrial Cluster as Phase-I in the Horana Industrial Township Development Project on a Public Private Partnership basis and for the Urban Development Authority to obtain the required land for the purpose, from the Land Reform Commission, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Building for the Out Patients Department of the National Hospital of Sri Lanka (NHSL)
decision_details: - The National Hospital of Sri Lanka comprising of 3,300 beds and situated in a 32 acre land in Colombo is the largest hospital in the South East Asia. The Out Patients Department of the Hospital maintained in the same building where it was first established in the year 1948 and the infrastructure facilities found are inadequate to provide the necessary facilities for over 5,000 patients coming to the Department daily for treatment. As such, it has been planned to construct a new Out Patients Department Complex at the Sri Lanka National Hospital as an award of the the Republic of China.  Accordingly,  the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to enter into an Agreement with the Republic of China to implement the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Safety Center for temporary accommodation of  people affected during a disastrous situation
decision_details: - The National Building and Research Organization has identified that Badulla, as a high risk landslides prone District due to intensive rainfall.  As such, it is obligatory to ensure the safety of the affected community and to construct a safety centre where the people subject to emergency disaster situations could be provided shelter. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, the Minister of Disaster Management, to acquire a land in extent of half an acre belonging to the Balangoda Plantation Company to the Ministry of Disaster Management, for the construction of a safety centre where people could be temporarily accommodated during an emergency disaster situation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The National Policy on Elimination of Child Labour from Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka made a commitment to eliminate child labour from Sri Lanka at the Global Child Labour Conference, held in the Hague city of the Netherlands, in the year 2010.  According to the Child Activity Survey conducted in the year 2015/2016, the number of Child Labour in Sri Lanka has been reduced by about 50% in comparison to the year 2008/2009.  As such, Sri Lanka has the potential to achieve zero tolerance in the elimination of child labour. Further, implementing a National Child Labour Policy is one of the initiatives in the Action Plan in relation to regaining the European Union's Generalized Scheme of Preferences (GSP) to the country.  Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, the Minister of Labour and Trade Union Relations, to recognize the national policy for the total elimination of child labour from Sri Lanka and to  implement same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Sri Lanka and Tajikistan for the development of Sports
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara, the Minister of Sports, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of  Sri Lanka and the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan, with the objective of taking necessary measures for the development sports having identified the significant fields of sports that have acquired achievements in both the countries, during the official visit of H.E. Emomali Rahmon, the President of the Republic of Tajikistan, to Sri Lanka, scheduled between 13th to 15th of December 2016, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding on Political Consultations between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Tajikistan and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Harsha de Silva, the Acting Minister of Foreign Affairs, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding on Political Consultations between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Tajikistan and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka, with the objective of enhancing bilateral relations and cooperation in the political as well as economic, trade, scientific, technical and cultural fields, during the official visit of H.E. Emomali Rahmon, the President of the Republic of Tajikistan, to Sri Lanka, scheduled between 13th to 15th of December 2016, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and  Tajikistan on Cooperation in the Field of Tourism
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. John Amarathunga, the Minister of Tourism Development and Christian Religious Affairs, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of  Sri Lanka and the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan, on Cooperation in the Field of Tourism, during the official visit of the President of Tajikistan to Sri Lanka, scheduled between 13th to 15th of December 2016, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Training Programme in Skills Development associated with the Gem & Jewellary Industry
decision_details: - The objective of the National Gem and Jewellery Research Training Institution, in widening the scope of its research and training activities, is to further enhance the contribution by the industry towards the economic development of Sri Lanka. With the objective of providing foreign employment opportunities for skilled personal in the sector, to convert the National Gem and Jewellery Research Training Institution into a Gem and Jewellery Education Institution of International standard, which could attract foreign students, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to implement a skilled development project to further the scope of the training opportunities provided by the institution, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Dam Safety & Water Resources Plans which could be utilized for the Future Development Activities
decision_details: - The necessity for an updated National Water Resources Development and Management Plan for Sri Lanka, has surfaced, in order to achieve the current targets and objectives of the development of the country. The Mahaweli Master Plan has also not been updated since 1978. The three (03) Water Resource Plans namely; the National Plan of Water Usage, updated Mahaweli Water Resources Development Plan and the Integrated Water Resources Development Plan of the Mundeni Aru Basin have been prepared under the Dam Safety and Water Resources Planning Project commenced in the year 2007. Therefore, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment to treat the above mentioned plans as a National Document containing Guidelines in Water Sector Development in Sri Lanka and to keep the 03 Plans in the custody of the National Planning Department, to be used as Guidelines by any institution engaged in the Water Resources Development Field in Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Accommodation for the other Rankers of the Sri Lanka Army
decision_details: - Insufficient accommodation facilities available in Colombo for the staff of the Army Head Quarters and the Institutions affiliated to it and the other staff of the Army Hospital, stationed in Colombo has become a problem.  As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to construct a new building with accommodation facilities for other rankers as well, at the premises owned by the Sri Lanka Army situated at Manning Town, Narahenpita, at an estimated cost of Rs.239.12 Million, as a remedial measure to overcome the situation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Main Sewerage System in the Panagoda Army Camp
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Army Camp in Panagoda, established in the year 1952 comprises of the Security Force Head Quarters (West), 07 Regimental Centres, a Base Hospital and the quarters of the officers and other Rankers.  The Main Sewerage System in the Camp is found to be in a dilapidated condition and identified as unproductive to carry out repairs.   Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to construct a new Sewerage System in the Panagoda Army Camp, at an estimated cost of Rs.80 Million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a new building for the use of the Army Women’s Corps
decision_details: - The Regiment Head Quarters of Army Women’s Corps is housed in an old building situated in an extent of 92 perches, at Kingsy Road, Borella.  Therefore, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to construct a new building instead of the old building, in the same premises, at an estimated cost of Rs.94 Million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Realization of a National Sustainable Development Vision of Sri Lanka - 2030
decision_details: - Realization of Sustainable Development always depends on achieving the multi sector targets.  Therefore, to achieve such targets, follow up action and evaluation activities become extremely vital. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to appoint a Cabinet Sub-Committee comprising of 05 Cabinet Ministers and a Provincial Chief Minister and an Expert Committee to assist in the functions of the Sub-Committee, for the formulation of the National Sustainable Development Vision-2030 inspired by the United Nations' 17 Sustainable Development Goals, identifying development priorities to be achieved by Sri Lanka, drawing up a time frame to achieve the identified goals, identifying the role assigned to the State, Private and Civil Society Organizations in the accomplishment of Sustainable Development Goals - 2030, and to review the progress in the realization of the identified goals and to update the sustainable development goals and the strategies after review, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Joint Cabinet Memorandum of the Ministerial Committee on the Development of Hambantota Port
decision_details: - The joint proposal made by Hon. Malik Samarawickrama, the Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade and Hon.(Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, the Minister of Special Assignments, to develop the Hambantota Port in collaboration with the China Merchants Port Holding (CMPort) Company on a Public Private Partnership basis, on the approval given by the Hon. Attorney General in respect of the finalized Framework Agreement in accordance with the provisions of the Framework Agreement, based on the final decisions  of the the Cabinet Committee on Economic Management (CCEM) pertaining to the restructuring of the Hamabantota Port and  to confer authority on the relevant authorities to sign the Framework Agreement with the investing company, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of a Ministerial Sub-Committee to investigate into the implementation of Gin-Nilwala Diversion Project
Bilateral Instruments to be signed between Sri Lanka and Malaysia during the forthcoming official visit of H.E. the President to Malaysia
Construction of the Nuwara Eliya High Altitude Sports Complex
decision_details: - Since, training in a high altitude increases the endurance ability of sports men and women, it is beneficial to conduct outdoor and indoor training in such a background. While emphasizing the need of a high altitude training centre for the Sri Lankan sports men and women, the Government has focused its attention on the construction of a high altitude sports complex in the Nuwara Eliya District situated 1,895 Meters above the mean sea level to meet the needs of the sports men and women of Sri Lanka and to provide high altitude training at international level for the sports men and women of the neighbouring countries as well, with a view to earning foreign exchange.  Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara, the Minister of Sports, for the Government of Sri Lanka to enter into an Agreement, with a French Company selected from the project proposals received to construct the  Nuwara Eliya High Altitude Sports Complex, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of small scale Solar Power Plants under the Soorya Bala Sangramaya - Stage 2
decision_details: - In order to cater to the increasing demand in electricity and also to ensure the energy security of the country, diversification of energy generating sources is essential.  Although there is a high demand from investors to establish Solar Power Plants, it is only 60Mw which has been recommended technologically, for absorption to the medium voltage of the National Grid during this year.  Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to implement a new project called 'Soorya Bala Sangramaya' - Stage 2, and to enable the selection of investors who have come forward to establish solar power plants of 1Mw for the 60Mw solar power capacity, through a competitive bidding process which is fair and transparent, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Award of Plant & Design - Build Contract of the Deduru Oya Water Supply Project
decision_details: - The Deduru Oya Water Supply Project is implemented with the objective of providing an adequate supply of safe and reliable drinking water to a population living in 97 Grama Niladari Divisions in the Mahawa and Polpithigama Divisional Secretariat Divisions in the Kurunegala District.  Under this project, it is expected to provide 18,150 house connections and more than 90,800 people will be benefited by it.   Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to award the Plant and Design Build Contract for Civil and Mechanical and Electrical work, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of Contracts for the Buildings to be Constructed in the Jaffna & Wayamba Universities
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to award the contracts for the construction of a sports and exercise hall in the University of Jaffna, a science laboratory in the Wayamba University and also a building for the Agriculture and Plantation Management Faculty of the same University, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the Police Information and Communication System (PICS)
decision_details: - Cabinet approval had been granted in the year 2013, for the implementation of the Police Information and Communication System (PICS).  However, due to the technological advancement of the new inventions in the field, it is observed that the overall purview of the whole system needs to be revised. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayaka, the Minister of Law & Order and Southern Development, to appoint a Steering Committee in consultation with the Ministry of Finance for a further revision of the entire compass of the project, to set apart a permanent range of frequency for the Sri Lanka Police Department, to apply 'digital' communication equipment instead of  'analogue' equipment, when the above project is established with the approval of the Telecommunication Regulatory Commission (TRC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Elimination of violence against women within the work places and  empowerment of women
decision_details: - In accordance with the International Agreements entered into by Sri Lanka, legal and other measures to protect and safeguard women from various forms of violence caused to them within their work places need to put in place. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Chandrani Bandara, the Minister of Women and Child Affairs, to establish Committees headed by Senior Officials of the Ministries, Departments and the Institutions functioning at the district and divisional level, to eliminate violence against women within the work places, just because of being a woman, with a view to protecting and empowering women, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of Land Ownership and Proper Housing for the Plantation Community
decision_details: - At present, there are about 256,533 families living in the Estates belonging to the Regional Plantation Companies and 9,025 families in the Estates owned by the Government.  The number of houses constructed presently for these families are around 33,000 and the remaining families live in the line rooms and the temporary sheds.  In accordance with the Government policy of handing over land ownership, the joint proposal made by Hon. U. Palani Digambaram, the Minister of Hill Country New Villages, Infrastructure and Community Development, Hon. Navin Dissanayake, the Minister of Plantation Industries and Hon. John Amarathunga, the Minister of Lands, to grant transferable deeds for 07 perches of land which could be offered to banks as security to the legal residents in estates and to release the lands identified as not prone to the risk of landslides from the Regional Plantation Companies and other State Institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Restoration of Madulla, Bingoda, Kolallawatta Reservoir
decision_details: - The people of the area are engaged in their farming activities depending on the Madulla, Bingoda, Kolallawatta reservoir situated in the Divisional Secretary's Division of Madulla in the Moneragla District of the Uva Province have made requests from a long time for the formal  construction of the reservoir.  Accordingly, it has been planned to restore the reservoir and to improve the land and paddy cultivation of the area and to enhance the living standards of the people with the establishment of a sustainable irrigation system.  As such, the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to construct the proposed reservoir across the Kolallawatta Aru which is a branch of the Unachchi Aru after carrying out an assessment study on the environmental impacts, at an estimated cost of Rs.320 Million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Promotion of aquaculture on a commercial scale
decision_details: - The expectation of the Government is to derive a target income of US$ 425 Million, the raring of aquaculture of fish varieties on a commercial basis utilising high technology and exporting same by the year 2020.  As such, the Sri Lanka Aquaculture Development Authority is making an effort to attract investors engaged in aquaculture on a commercial basis utilising the latest technologies. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, to identify suitable lands for the purpose and suitable waterways in the sea and the fresh water reservoirs and to lease same to suitable investors, as recommended by the Cabinet Sub-Committee appointed for making a study on this matter, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Relocation of the Manning Market at Peliyagoda
decision_details: - Under the redevelopment programme of the Colombo City, it has been planned to relocate the Manning Market at Pettah in Peliyagoda and to construct the main building of the Multi-Mode Transport Hub in the land where the Manning Market is presently situated, as proposed under the  Western Region Megapolis Plan.  The construction work necessary for removing around 1,200 traders within the Manning Market at present and relocating them in a land belonging to the State Engineering Corporation is underway. However, since a need has arisen for the commencement of the construction work of the proposed Multi-Mode Transport Hub without any delay, until the completion of the said relocation work, it has become necessary to relocate the traders of the Manning Market expeditiously in another land.  As such, the joint proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development and Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to get an adjoining plot of land of about 06 acres belonging to the State Engineering Corporation situated in the Peliyagoda area, on lease basis, for a period of 03 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Multi-Model Transport Centre at Battaramulla
decision_details: - With the location of all Government administrative Institutions in the areas of Battaramulla and Sri Jayawardhanapura, Kotte under the master plan of the Megapolis and Western Development, it is important to minimize the vehicle congestion that would be created in doing so.  Due to the development activities of the future, it has been proposed to provide multi model transport facilities like Bus and light Rail Transits, elevated highways and inland water transport facilities, in order to address the upcoming transport demand of the said area.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to implement a mixed development project comprising of a multi model transport centre, office accommodation of 113,000 sq.ft, a 33,000 sq.ft of residential apartments and 60,000 sq.ft of commercial space under the Public and Private Partnership basis, adjoining the Battaramulla 'Suhurupaya' building, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief to the aged and sick artistes
decision_details: - With a view to providing relief for the aged and sick artistes of low income who had rendered a great service to the advancement of the field of Arts by dedicating their lives for same, a welfare assistance programme implemented by the Department of Cultural Affairs, through which 1,019 artistes of such calibre are given financial aid in an annual sum of Rs.5,000/- per artiste, presently. Considering the present economic situation prevailing in the country, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Navinne, the Minister of Internal Affairs, Wayamba Development and Cultural Affairs, to increase the annual aid of Rs.5,000/- provided for them to Rs.10,000/- in the year 2017 and also to increase the number of artistes of low income receiving such aid up to Rs.5,000/-, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Five Year Corporate Plan for Wayamba
decision_details: - The Ministry of Wayamba Development and Cultural Affairs has been vested with the responsibility of establishing the Wayamba Secretariat with the objective of coordinating, the economic and infrastructure facilities of development projects and the formulation and implementation of policies.  Accordingly, the five year corporate plan formulated by the Ministry under the patronage of all parties covering the period of 2017-2021 under the sectors of agriculture and irrigation, livestock, fisheries and aquaculture, tourism, human resource development, investment promotion and development of industries and the development of rural infrastructure facilities, aimed at the development of the economic and infrastructure facilities of the Wayamba Province was submitted to the Cabinet by Hon. S.B. Navinne, the Minister of Internal Affairs, Wayamba Development and Cultural Affairs.

title: Purchasing of a Land to Construct a Hostel for Male Students of the Institute of Indigenous Medicine, Colombo
decision_details: - The policy of the Government is to complete the process of providing hostel facilities to all University students who need hostels by the end of the year 2018. Although, the hostel issue of all the female students studying in the Institute of Indigenous Medicine, Rajagiriya has been addressed, the problem relating to male students studying there has been addressed through houses provided on rent basis for the time being and the permanent solution, has been identified as purchasing a land and constructing a hostel.  As such, the proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriwella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to purchase a plot of land in extent of 62 perches situated within the Municipal limits of Sri Jayewardhanepura, Kotte, at a cost of Rs.99.5 Million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Orders for the regulation of maintaining of Sea Turtle Conservation Study Centers
decision_details: - In terms of the Fauna and Flora Protection Act, all turtle species living in the coastal belt of the Island and those living in the Sea Zones are considered as highly protected reptiles and keeping such animal in one's possession is a punishable offence. The sea turtle conservation centres in the Southern coast maintained by the private sector with the objective of bringing the sea turtle eggs from the coast and protecting them in the artificial nests prepared for the purpose and subsequently releasing the baby sea turtles so born into the sea, have been operative since 1980.  Around 15 such centres are maintained in the Southern Coast and they have become popular tourist and conservation centres. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Sustainable Development and Wildlife, to formalize these private turtle conservation centres further, to register the centres in the Department of Wild Life Conservation and provide provision to regulate them granting permission to operate under annual permits and to publish the Orders prepared under the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance Act, in a Gazette Notification, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Tunnel of the Upper Elehara Canal under the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Program
decision_details: - The objective of Stage I of the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Program is to improve the agro-economic crop production of the area providing Mahaweli water for agricultural activities, drinking water and commercial activities in the North Central and North Western Provinces.  Under this programme, it has been planned to construct a 65.5km long canal from Moragahakanda reservoir to Huruluwewa Reservoir, capable of conveying 974 Million Cu.m. of water per year.  In designing the canal a section in extent of 26 km long has been designed to trace through the Giritale and Minneriya sanctuary and the forest reserves.  The proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to construct the said part as a tunnel section, to minimize the damage caused to the environment and wild animals, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a New Bill to prevent the infiltration of dangerous and invading plants and animal species and for their destruction
decision_details: - Sri Lanka holds a premier position among the countries where bio-diversity is rampant.  Hence, it has become essential to protect the natural environment network of the country and also to conserve the plants and animal species inherent to the country.  Studies on invasive alien organisms have revealed that the existing laws are inadequate to control the threats caused to the bio-diversity of Sri Lanka, from invading plants and animal species. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to instruct the Legal Draftsman, to draft a new Act, making provisions to prevent the infiltration of dangerous and invading plants and animal species to Sri Lanka and to destroy such plants and animals, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposal for Liquidating the Rakna Arakshaka Lanka Limited
decision_details: - Due to the state of the national security that prevailed in the Island it was essential to deploy the Army personnel to the duties in respect of law and order, by removing such personnel from the duties assigned at public and private institutions, economical nerve centres and other special institutions. Accordingly, the Rakna Arakshaka Lanka Limited was established as a security service affiliated to the Government for providing protection for the said institutions. However, due to the peaceful environment prevalent at present, it is observed that a state owned private security service is no longer required.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to transfer the Ground Defence activities to the Civil Security Service Department and the Marine Security activities to the Sri Lanka Navy, was approved by the Cabinet in principle.

title: Extension of the concessionary period granted for the registration of transfer at the time of change of possession of motor vehicles subject to a surcharge, up to 2016?12?31
decision_details: - The concessionary period of 03 months granted by the Cabinet for registration of transfers at the time of change of possession of motor vehicles subject to a surcharge is due to expire on 2016-11-30.  Therefore, due to a large number of persons coming to the department for registration of transfer of these vehicles a great congestion has been created, presently, in the official functions of the department.   As such, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to extend the concessionary period by a further one month up to 2016-12-31, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a building for the Attorney General's Department
decision_details: - Acknowledging that the space available at the Attorney General's Department is in adequate to conduct its affairs without hindrance, approval has been granted by the Cabinet to construct a new building within the Superior Court Complex premises itself. Accordingly, the initial work in the construction of the new building has already been completed. As such, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Justice, to award the contract for the construction of the remaining part of the proposed new building as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Sand nourishment project in the Marawila Beach (Phase II)
decision_details: - The Phase II of the sand nourishment project implemented for pumping sand to minimize the coastal erosion of the Marawila beach has already commenced.  As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to pump an additional 400,000 Cu.m of sand for the nourishment of an extra area for the long term stability of the Marawila-Thalawila beach line, making use of the balance provision available under this project for 2016, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of the office allowance for Members of Parliament and enhancement of the Parliament sitting allowance
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Gayantha Karunathilaka, the Minister of Parliamentary Reforms and Mass Media, to grant a monthly allowance of Rs.100,000/- to all Hon. Members of Parliament including the Members  appointed under the National List to cover the expenses borne on  maintenance of an office, and to enhance the Parliament sitting allowance from Rs.500 to Rs.2,500/- with effect from January 2017, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Court Complex of Wattala
decision_details: - The Cabinet approval has been granted to award the contract for the construction of Phase I of the Wattala Court Building Complex to the Sri Lanka State Engineering Corporation, at an estimated cost of Rs.156.18 Million. Presently, all Court functions of the Wattala Courts are conducted in a part of the Mahara Court Complex.  In order to provide a better service to all persons access the services of the Wattala Courts it is imperative that the project is completed expeditiously.  Accordingly, The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Justice, to award the contract to the Sri Lanka State Engineering Corporation to construct Phase II of the Court Complex at a cost of Rs.148.29 Million, incorporating certain requirements identified as pre-requites to be included in Phase II of the Court Complex, construction of Phase I, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of two Wind Power Plants at the Chunnakam area
decision_details: - The Government has focused its attention to fulfil the greater part of the electricity demand by using renewable energy sources and in this regard, it has been proposed to construct wind power plants.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to construct two wind power plants of 10 Mw each, in the Chunnakam area, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Greater Colombo Transmission and Distribution Loss Reduction Project
decision_details: - The Greater Colombo Transmission and Distribution Loss Reduction Project is implemented under the loan facilities of the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA), with a view to contributing to the economic development in the region by strengthening the transmission and distribution capacity and enhancing the transmission and distribution network in the Greater Colombo area for increasing the reliability of power supply and reducing transmission losses. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to award the contract for the supply of specially made vehicles required for the distribution work under Package 3 of the project, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC),  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Completion of partially completed projects in the areas of Tangalle, Angunukolapellessa and Middeniya
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to complete the partially done construction work of the projects pertaining to Tangalle and Angunukolapellessa Commercial Complex and the Side Walks under Middeniya Town Development through the new contractors selected after a competitive bidding process, at an estimated cost of Rs.60.8 Million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the Badulla-Chenkalady Road - Road sections from Badulla to Passara and Passara to Lunugala
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to award the contracts for improving the road sections of 20 km in length from Badulla to Passara and 21 km in length from Passara to Lunugala, under the Badulla-Chenkalady Road development project funded by the OPEC Fund for International Development (OFID), as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Research and Training Complex at the Faculty of Agriculture in the University of Jaffna
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to award the contract for consultancy services of the above project funded by the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA), as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procuring 1,000 new 40-46 seater (2x2) high back, buses for the Sri Lanka Transport Board
decision_details: - Bids were invited for repairing 1,000 old buses of the Sri Lanka Transport Board but since the repairing cost of a bus, in accordance with the responses received was almost equal to the cost of procuring a new bus, it was found that repairing is not economically productive.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to suspend the project for the repairing of 1,000 buses and instead to purchase 40-46 seater (2x2) high back, 1,000 new passenger buses, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of 100 Housing Units to the Sri Lanka Police from the ‘Nila Sevana’ Project at Wekunagoda, Galle
decision_details: - ‘Nila Sevana’ Project at Wekunagoda, Galle is a project jointly carried out under a tripartite Agreement by the Board of Investment, Ministry of Public Administration and Management and the Private Sector. The proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayaka, the Minister of Law & Order and Southern Development, seeking the allocation of Treasury Funds of Rs.333 to the Sri Lanka Police to provide 100 units from the said Project to the Police personnel such as Police Constables, Police Sergeants and Police Officers in the Inspector Grades serving in the Galle area needing housing facilities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The construction of a New National School with Multi-ethnic and Tri-lingual Education in the Polonnaruwa District
decision_details: - The Cabinet has already granted approval to commence a new school in the Kaduruwela town starting from Grade 6 including all facilities, since the space available in the Royal College of Polonnaruwa is inadequate to provide an opportunity for all the children of the Polonnaruwa District who get through the Grade 5 scholarship examination, to be admitted to the Grade 6 of the Royal College of Polonnaruwa.  It has been estimated that an approximate sum of Rs.1,200 Million will have to be spent to construct this new Model National College which is expected to be operative with Multi-ethnic and Tri-lingual Education with a view to ensuring national reconciliation.   Out of this sum, about Rs.900 Million will be borne by the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of India has agreed to provide the balance of Rs.300 Million.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, the Minister of Education, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding with the Republic of India, to obtain the financial aid agreed upon and also to implement the construction work of this school with the coordination of the Ministry of Education, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Memorandum of Understanding for employment of Sri Lankans in Malaysia
decision_details: - The Cabinet has granted approval in the year 2015 to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and Malaysia to establish a methodology facilitating the recruitment and employment of domestic workers and other workers for employment in Malaysia in such manner as to safeguard the rights of such migrant workers.  The proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalata Atukorala, the Minister of Foreign Employment, to sign the Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Human Resources of the Government of Malaysia and the Ministry of Foreign Employment of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, prepared incorporating the subsequent amendments as well, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Protecting houses of the Sobasiripura Housing Scheme under the threat of Landslide
decision_details: - The National Building Research Organization has shown that a considerable number of houses in the Sobasiripura Housing Scheme constructed in the Seethawaka Divisional Secretariat Division of the Colombo District under the 'Semata Sevena Model Villages Programme' by the National Housing Development Authority could be subject to the threat of landslide. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to get funds allocated from General Treasury required for taking the preliminary steps to protect the houses of the Sobasiripura Housing Scheme subject to the threat of landslide, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposal for Setting up of a Meter Enclosure Manufacturing Factory
decision_details: - The Ceylon Electricity Board and the Lanka Electricity (Pvt) Company (LECO) require more than 250,000 meter enclosures annually.  These are presently obtained from the open market via a competitive bidding process and due to the scarcity of the items which occur at various instances, it has not be possible to fulfil the customer demand.  As a remedial measure in this regard, the  proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, for the Sri Lanka Energies (Pvt) Ltd. affiliated to the Ceylon Electricity Board to establish a Meter Enclosure Manufacturing Factory in the Galigamuwa industrial zone in the Kegalle District and to provide the Meter Enclosures so produced to the Ceylon Electricity Board and the Lanka Electricity (Pvt) Company, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: A land for the construction of the District Sports Complex at Dadalle
decision_details: - With the conversion of the public playground in Galle into an International Cricket Stadium, a land in extent of 17 Acres at Dadalla has been identified to be developed as a public playground.  Land filling and  the preliminary construction activities of the playground have been completed and the construction of a 400 meter track and a swimming pool is in progress. Therefore, the joint proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development and Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara, the Minister of Sports, to obtain a sum of Rs.400 Million from the General Treasury to complete the land acquisition process to enable the expeditious completion of the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of a land to construct the Head Quarters of the Sri Lanka Amarapura Nikayabhiwurdhi Dayaka Sabhawa
decision_details: - There are around 3,700 temples connected to the Sri Lanka Amarapura Nikaya spread throughout the country where nearly 12,000 Bikkus reside. Considering the request made by the Sri Lanka Amarapura Nikayabhiwurdhi Dayaka Sabhawa for a plot of land to build its Head Quarters, in order to extend its religious activities in the country as well as internationally, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to release a plot of land in extent 2 Roods and 4.2 perches, situated in the Sri Jayawardhenapura Hospital Road, owned by the Urban Development Authority, to the Sri Lanka Amarapura Nikayabhiwurdhi Dayaka Sabhawa as a free grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the New Utility & Infrastructure facilities needed for the Development of  the Western Region Megapolis
Construction of a Student Hostel for the Ceylon German Technical Training Institute
decision_details: - The Ceylon German Technical Training Institute (the German Tech) established under German financial aid, presently conducts 10 full time training courses and around 2,000 students from various parts of the Island are engaged in following them.  Action is being taken to increase the intake of students by a further 200 by the end of year 2017.  It is important to provide hostel facilities to the students to create a proper learning environment necessary for a qualitative education and accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Skills Development and Vocational Training, to construct a 05 storeyed hostel building for the Ceylon German Technical Training Institute in the Attidiya area of Dehiwala to accommodate around 1,000 students, at an estimated cost of Rs.280 Million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a new Building for the National Lotteries Board
decision_details: - The National Lotteries Board contributes a large sum of money to the Consolidated Fund of the Government but its head office is housed in a  building obtained on annual rental basis at a cost of Rs.17.5 Million.  The space available in the building is also inadequate to conduct the operations of the organization. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Ravi Karunanayake, the Minister of Finance, to construct a new building for the National Lotteries Board in the land owned by the Board in Vauxhall Street, Colombo 02, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Quarantine and Prevention of Diseases Ordinance
decision_details: - It is necessary to establish the legislative framework in the country to facilitate the operation of health strategies to prevent the spread of international diseases in a background where global links are created which generate major population flows along trade, tourism and labour in and out of the country.  In the International Health Regulations (IHR-2005) to which Sri Lanka has become a signatory, provides a public health response to the international spread of diseases in ways that are commensurate with and restricted to public health risks, for the prevention of the spread of international diseases and their control and for the protection from such diseases, and avoid unnecessary interference with international traffic and trade. As such, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to make the necessary amendments to the Quarantine and Prevention of diseases Ordinance presently in force in Sri Lanka to capture all the relevant articles of the said regulations for the implementation in Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Priority Water Supply Projects in the Western Region Megapolis Area
decision_details: - The Government has accorded priority to fulfil the necessary utility services to meet the needs of the growing population of the Western Region Megapolis Area.  97.3% of the population in the Western Region has access to safe water supply and 57.5% of them receive pipe borne water supply services.  The 19 water treatment plants found in this region purify 1,078,520 Cu.m. of water per day. Based on the projected population of 8.7 Million in 2030 the demand for water is expected to grow up to about 2,200,000 Cu.m. per day for which new water supply schemes will have to be implemented.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to implement 05 new water supply schemes to cover Colombo and its immediate suburbs of the Western Region, Industrial Township of Meerigama, the proposed Aero city at Meerigama, Diwulapitiya, Homagama, Horana and the surrounding areas, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Prohibition of touting within the Airport
decision_details: - The touts at the Arrival Lobby and the Porch Area considered as public areas at the Bandaranaike International Airport are engaged in providing unauthorized transport facilities, money changing and baggage loading and illegal activities and this has caused much difficulties to the  passengers as well as the Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) Ltd.  As the existing legislation is inadequate to control the situation, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to amend the Civil Aviation Act, No.14 of 2010 to prevent touting at the premises of the Airport by various persons, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the ‘Ranaviru Resource Centre’ at Hendala which provides vocational training to the disabled war heroes
decision_details: - The ‘Ranaviru Resource Centre’ situated at Hendala is in operation from the year 2010 as an institution which provides vocational training to the war heroes who had been disabled in the battle grounds, for the purpose of creating the necessary environment for them to lead a dignified life  within the civil society. More than 09 vocational training courses are implemented with the infrastructure facilities provided for in the 1st phase of the institution.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence,  to construct 05 new buildings in the 2nd phase and on completion of the necessary infrastructure facilities to increase the number of training courses up to 15 to elevate the ‘Ranaviru Resource Centre’ as a formal vocational training centre, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the National Defence College (NDC), Sri Lanka
decision_details: - A proposal has been made to establish a National Defence College in Sri Lanka, with the objective of linking Sri Lanka strategically with the global trends, to bring both local and foreign Defence scholars together to share their experiences at a central platform and provide a formal training in strategic level aspects of security to a greater number of officers of the Forces as well as civil officers.  Accordingly, considering the importance of establishing the academy in the vicinity of Colombo, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to establish it in the premises of 'Mumtaz Mahal', the official residence formally used by the Speaker to the Parliament having made suitable renovations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Domestic Airline Service through Public-Private Joint Venture Partnership
decision_details: - It has been proposed to establish a Domestic Airline Service for civil passenger transportation through Public-Private Joint Venture Partnership in accordance with the criteria laid down by the International Civil Aviation Authority.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to call for proposals from a larger number of persons from the private sector with adequate financial stability, with a view to selecting a suitable investor to commence a joint venture with the Sri Lanka Air Force, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Land Subsidence at Achchuveli in the Jaffna District
decision_details: - A land subsidence incidence in the farming lands of the Achchuveli area has been reported and cracks developing on the ground in the affected location over a prolonged period have also been noticed. Since the land in the area is composed of limestone it is prone to form cavities and caverns.  Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. D.M. Swaminathan, the Minister of Prison Reforms, Rehabilitation, Resettlement and Hindu Religious Affairs, for the National Building Research Organization to make a further study to clarify and confirm the cause of this situation, to enable decision making with regard to the future land use and development taking into consideration the sinking of land would have long-term repercussions on land use practices and  human settlements in future, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Initiating Public Consultation Process on Media Standards and Entitlements
decision_details: - It has been proposed to establish an Independent Commission to regulate the news content of the print media, broadcast media (Television and Radio) and locally registered Websites, in accordance with internationally recognized professional standards and practices, with the objective of promoting high professional and ethical standards in news media, while ensuring a free, independent and diverse media. Hence, the proposal made by Hon. Gayantha Karunathilaka, the Minister of Parliamentary Reforms and Mass Media to conduct a comprehensive public consultation process for the implementation of the above proposal, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters Act
decision_details: - The Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters Act, No.25 of 2002 provides for the provision of assistance by Sri Lanka to other countries in respect of criminal activities in those countries and vice versa, when combating transnational crime and strengthening of prevention of crime. Considering the recent development standards relevant to this field, concerning identification of money laundering, criminalization of   bribery as a mandatory measure to combat corruption as indicated in Article 16 of the United Nations Convention against Corruption, criminal offences related to computer systems and data, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Justice to amend the Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters Act reflecting Sri Lanka's international obligations in relation to criminal investigations and confiscation of criminal proceeds, was approved by the  Cabinet.

title: Minimizing of the delays experienced in Court Procedures by Providing for Pre?Trial Procedure
decision_details: - The Public has to face great difficulties due to the delays caused in Court Procedure.  Although several measures have been adopted from time to time to overcome this situation, a large number of Cases are still piled up   in Courts.  The Cabinet has already given approval to introduce Pre‑Trial Procedure in order to solve this problem.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Justice to publish the Civil Procedure Code (Amendment) Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman and given clearance by the Attorney General, in the Government Gazette and present it in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Seed and Planting Material Development Project
decision_details: - It has been scientifically confirmed that the quality of harvesting and productivity could be increased through ensuring the availability of quality seeds and planting material.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Agriculture to implement projects to ensure the availability of high quality seed and planting material required for assuring sustainability of agricultural and food security of the country, utilizing the lands belonging to the Department of Agriculture and the Institutions coming under it, which have not been used for any productive purpose, with public‑private partnership participation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of charges for the services rendered by the Department of Registrar of Companies
