decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, the Minister of Industry and Commerce to present the Gazette Extraordinary No.1990/12 dated 2016‑10‑25 issued by the Hon. Minister,  revising the fees for the services rendered by the Department of Registrar of Companies under the provisions of the Companies Act, No.07 of 2007 and the Societies Ordinance, No.16 of 1891 as amended by the Act, No.11 of 2005, in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of a Herbal Cultivation Project for the Production of High Standard Ayurveda Medicinal Raw Materials
decision_details: - According to data from the Department of Ayurveda,  60% of the annual raw materials used for local and Ayurvedic medicines are met out of importations.  As a remedial measure, the Budget of 2016 proposed to commence a short term herbal plant cultivation to meet the demand for medicinal raw materials.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine to initiate a farmer participatory herbal plant cultivation project for the production of high standard medicinal raw materials centered around the districts of Ratnapura, Kurunegala, Anuradhapura, Moneragala and Galle and for the marketing network of the Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Drugs Corporation to purchase the medicinal raw materials produced in the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Sri Lanka Institute of Digital Health Innovation & Commercialization
decision_details: - Convergence of the genomic medicine and information and communication technologies are referred to as Digital Health and it is making a paradigm shift in the field of health-care for higher quality delivery of services,  superior outcomes and lower costs. In the recent past, a steep increase in the amount of global investment is shown in the Digital Health Sector and the future of the Health-care Sector will depend on the Digital Health Innovation.  In this context, with a view to reaping maximum benefits to Sri Lanka, the proposal made by Hon.  Susil Premajayantha, the Minister of Science, Technology and Research, for the establishment of the 'Sri Lanka Institute of Digital Health Innovation and Commercialization' as a Public‑Private Partnership to make enable to build network with the world recognized commercial and research organizations in order to foster high quality innovations with the use of modern digital and genomic technology, was approved by the Cabinet as a matter of principle.

title: National Quality Policy
decision_details: - The initial quality policy for improving the quality of goods and services in Sri Lanka was implemented in the year 1998.  Considering the ongoing extensive development activities in Sri Lanka, at present and the objectives of the government, the proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, the Minister of Science, Technology and Research for the implementation of the "National Quality Policy" formulated, focusing  on the health, education, highways, transport and trade & commerce  sectors  and taking into consideration the views expressed by the representatives of those sectors and adopting a broad/strong participatory approach, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Presenting the International Labour Organization Recommendation 204  in Parliament
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, the Minister of Labour and Trade Union Relations to present the 'Recommendation 204', adopted at the 104th session of the International  Labour Conference, concerning the transition from the informal to the formal economy,  in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of the Global Positioning System for Train Operations with more efficiency and safety
decision_details: - The necessity for the introduction of Modern Technology for Sri Lanka Railways to bring out improvement in the efficiency and safety of train operations, has been identified.  Accordingly, with a view to accruing benefits to both the Sri Lanka Railways and the General Public, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation to procure Train Operating and Information System (TOIS) based on the Global Positioning System (GPS) from the Ministry of Defence through which the exact locations and speed of trains could be viewed more preciously on global information based maps and combining it with the existing train time indicating system, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increasing the fine imposed against persons operating buses without valid passenger permits
decision_details: - In order to  enhance the quality of the passenger bus services and also to prevent people being subject to dangerous situations, a necessity has arisen to strengthen the existing laws against those who deploy buses without the valid passenger permits.  Therefore,  the Cabinet has granted approval to increase the minimum fine of Rs.10,000/- presently imposed by Magistrate Courts to Rs.200,000/- against those who operate bus services without a valid Passenger Transport Permit issued by the National Transport Commission. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to present the National Transport (Amendment) Act, amending section 40 of the National Transport Commission Act, No.37 of 1991 for this purpose, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Ensuring the protection and well-being of the tamed elephants
decision_details: - The Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance provides for owners of domesticated elephants to register such elephants with the Department of Wildlife Conservation and obtain an annual license in order to keep them in their possession. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Sustainable Development and Wildlife, to publish the Orders in terms of the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance, with the objective of ensuring the protection and well being of the registered elephants and relating to the specifications on the places where such elephants are kept, maintenance of good health conditions, the responsibility of the owners and keepers of such elephants, caring for the calves of the registered she-elephants, harnessing them in work, breeding, using them in processions and decorating them with attire and ornaments etc., was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Exploration and Assessment of Gem Deposits in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Although, it has been assessed that gem deposits are spread over 70% of the total land area of Sri Lanka, gem mining is concentrated only to a limited area of 10%. Therefore, the proposal made by H.E. the President, Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment to implement the project planned for the Exploration and Assessment of gem deposits in Sri Lanka, with a view to identifying the insitu gem deposits which have not been explored as yet, by developing a gem potential database including maps and introducing an eco‑friendly mining methodologies and preparation of guidelines for sustainable gem mining operations during the period from 2017 to 2021, under three phases, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Third Phase of the Army Hospital Project (Narahenpita)
decision_details: - The construction of the 1st and the 2nd phases of the project for relocation of the Army Hospital at Narahenpita which was located in the Army Headquarters, has been completed. In order to upgrade it as a state‑of‑the art Hospital, plans have been made to continue with the 3rd phase of the Hospital for the construction of three new building complexes, with specialized medical facilities and accommodation facilities for Medical Officers and as well as other Officers, and storage and maintenance facilities.  As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President, Maithripala Sirisena in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to implement the 3rd phase of the Army Hospital Project at an estimated cost of Rs.7,088.32 Million and to commence its construction work in the year 2017, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Continuation of the Anti-Corruption Committee Secretariat
decision_details: - The attention of the Government has been drawn for restructuring the Anti‑Corruption Committee structure and it has been proposed to establish a fully‑powered Serious Frauds Office, similar to the Serious Fraud Office of the United Kingdom.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister to continue the operations of the Anti‑Corruption Committee Secretariat (ACCS) established in 2015, to receive complaints regarding serious frauds and corruption and to facilitate the related investigations, until such time that, a new anti‑corruption structure is introduced, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Law to Introduce National Minimum Wage for Employees of the Private Sector
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Ravindra Samaraweera, the Acting Minister of Labour and Trade Union Relations, to obtain the approval for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman, in relation to the introduction of a National Minimum Wage for the employees of the Private Sector, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increase of Wages of Private Sector Employees
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Ravindra Samaraweera, the Acting Minister of Labour and Trade Union Relations, to obtain the approval for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman, in relation to the increase of wages of the Private Sector employees, as recommended by the Budget Proposals of 2016, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Award of Contract for upgrading Tissamaharama Water Supply Scheme
decision_details: - The Cabinet granted approval on 2015-11-18 to upgrade the Tissamaharama Water Supply Scheme, at a cost of Rs.393 million, on a proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, for the National Water Supply and Drainage Board to undertake the construction work comes under its purview under the said project and to handover the other construction work to the State Development and Construction Corporation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The proposed Memoranda of Understanding to be signed between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of Pakistan
Police Hospital Expansion Project at Narahenpita - Completion of the Balance Work
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayaka, the Minister of Law & Order and Southern Development, to award the Contract for the completion of the balance work remaining under the Police Hospital Expansion Project at Narahenpita, in accordance with the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply, Installation & Commissioning of Air Traffic Management System at Bandaranaike International Airport, Katunayake
decision_details: - The Air Traffic Management System presently being used at the Bandaranaike International Airport, Katunayaka is utilized for the controlling of the air traffic in the high traffic density air space around the Airport. In order to assure safe air traffic controlling around the Airport which suits the present day needs, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, for the supply, installation and commissioning of an Air Traffic Management System, at an estimated cost of Rs.320 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increase of the limit of monetary value in respect of the disputes to be referred to compulsory mediation
decision_details: - It was provided in the Section 7 (a) of the Mediation Boards Act, No.72 of 1988, that the disputes in relation to movable or immovable property or a debt, damage or demand, which do not exceed Rs.25,000/- in value should be referred to compulsory mediation. That compulsory limit was increased up to Rs.250,000/- by the Mediation Boards (Amendment) Act, No.04 of 2011. In order to increase this monetary limit up to Rs.500,000/- on present requirements, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Justice, to amend the Mediation Boards Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Ratification of ILO Convention (C 122) of 1964 on Employment Policy
decision_details: - The International Labour Organization (ILO) adopted 'the Convention C 122 on the Employment Policy' and its accompanying 'Recommendation R 122' in 1964. The Convention C 122 basically calls upon the ratifying states to declare and pursue an active policy designed to promote full, productive and freely chosen employment, in consultation with the workers' and employers' representatives. 'The National Human Resources and Employment Policy of Sri Lanka' launched in the year 2013 provides the framework for full, productive and freely chosen employment. The ratification of the Convention C 122 will further strengthen the functioning of the labour standard system as well as the social policy of the country. Further, it will be important for the governance as well. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, the Minister of Labour and Trade Union Relations, to ratify the ILO Convention C 122 on Employment Policy (1964), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Ratification of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities
decision_details: - 'The International Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities' was adopted in the year 2006 by the United Nations General Assembly, in keeping with the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) and the International Conventions on Human Rights. Sri Lanka has become a signatory to that Convention in the year 2007 and having considered that the enforcement of that Convention in Sri Lanka would be more important for the best interests of the persons with disabilities, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, the Minister of Social Empowerment and Welfare, to ratify the said Convention, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Promoting conservation of Bio-Diversity in environmentally sensitive land tracts and maintenance of services of Ecosystems
decision_details:
- 'The Project to Promote Conservation of Bio-diversity in Environmentally Sensitive Land Tracts in Sri Lanka and Maintenance of Services of Ecosystems' was granted to Sri Lanka by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and Global Environment Facility (GEF), and the main objective of the said project is to declare environmentally sensitive land tracts as a mechanism to ensure that the development activities implemented in the areas of high environmental importance, in a manner that conserves bio-diversity and the services of ecosystems and to identify two pilot areas for establishing and maintaining such mechanism. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President, Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to implement this project in the following pilot areas, within a period of 5 years, utilizing the grant of US$ 2.62 million, was approved by the Cabinet:  

*	The environmentally sensitive land tract in Kalawewa - Ipalogama, Palagala, Kekirawa and Galnewa Divisional Secretariat Divisions in the Anuradhapura District.  

*	The environmentally sensitive land tract in Wilpattu - Wanathavilluwa Divisional Secretariat Division in the Puttalam District.

title: Green Fishery Harbour Project - Mirissa
decision_details: - The proposal made by H.E the President, Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to implement the 'Green Fishery Harbour Project' prepared by the Marine Environment Protection Authority, at an investment of Rs.30.4 million of local funds, with a view to building the sustainability of the fisheries and tourism industries associated with the Mirissa Fishery Harbour through converting the said harbour, which is one of the major harbours situated in the Southern Province, into a Green Fishery Harbour, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Ministry of Finance of Sri Lanka and Export Credit Bank of Turkey (TURK Exim Bank)
decision_details: - In order to strengthen the journey towards country's development, it has become necessary to attract new development partners and enhance the  number of existing development partners. Accordingly, with a view to strengthening the bilateral relationship between Sri Lanka and Turkey, which is an active member of G-20 group of developed countries and currently holds the presidency of that group, through financial cooperation, it has been proposed to sign a MoU between Sri Lanka and Export Credit Bank of Turkey.  Under this MoU, the TURK Exim Bank will agree to provide a credit line in an amount of US$ 350 million  for the implementation of priority development projects of the Government of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ravi Karunanayake, the Minister of Finance, to enter into relevant agreements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Constitutional Assembly
decision_details: - The Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, informed the Cabinet that he intends to move a resolution in Parliament on 2016-01-09, for the Parliament to meet as a Constitutional Assembly, to arrive at a consensus on Constitutional Reforms.

title: Appointing a Committee to receive Public Representations on Constitutional Reforms
decision_details: - A Cabinet Sub-Committee on Constitutional Reforms was appointed at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2015-11-18, to conduct discussions for the introduction of a new Constitution.  At a meeting of that Sub-Committee, it has been decided to appoint  a Committee to receive public representations on Constitutional Reforms through both printed and electronic media.  On the information submitted by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Cabinet noted that a Committee comprising of 24 eminent persons will be appointed to receive public representations orally and that Committee will function in panels of 03 members and have simultaneous sittings in the different parts of the country and take action to receive public representations.

title: Emoluments and other allowances paid to the Chairpersons and Members of  Commissions
decision_details: - In order to provide the Chairpersons and Members of the Commissions established under the 19th Amendment to the Constitution with adequate emoluments and other allowances, enabling them to discharge functions of such Commissions on full time basis, the proposal made by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, to revise  the emoluments presently paid to them, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Procedures to be adopted in granting approval for Public Officers to travel abroad
decision_details: - The officers belonging to the Executive Grades of the Public Service, Provincial Public Service and Statutory Corporations should obtain the approval of the Prime Minister, in case they travel abroad for any official purpose, in accordance with the provisions of the Chapter XV of the Establishments Code. The Prime Minister's Office receives a large number of applications daily in this regard and it has been observed that it is not practicable to forward those applications in time for the approval, due to the wide scope of work presently entrusted with the Prime Minister's Office. Therefore, the proposal made by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, to make appropriate amendments to the   Establishments Code introducing a methodology enabling such officers to obtain the approval has to be taken before leaving the country, without delay and easily, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of a pair of footwear for students in the difficult, the most difficult and the isolated Schools
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, the Minister of Education, to purchase 640,000 pairs of footwear, under the programme for the provision of a pair of footwear for students considered to be in the difficult, the most difficult and the isolated Schools, at an estimated cost of Rs.640 million, in accordance with the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Green Power Development and Energy Efficiency Improvement Investment Programme
decision_details: - Asian Development Bank and French Development Agency (AFD) will provide US$ 53.91 million for the Green Power Development and Energy Efficiency Improvement Investment Programme. This programme is implemented under five major parts and the enhancement of the Transmission Infrastructure Capacity is one such project.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to award the Contract for the construction of transmission line under that project, as per the recommendation made by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Central Expressway Project - Approval to obtain proposals from the Metallurgical Corporation of China (MCC) and to examine the possibility of obtaining credit facility for the execution of construction of the section from Kadawatha to Kossinna (0+500 km - 4+540 km)
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways,  to explore the possibility of obtaining credit facility required for the construction of the section from Kadawatha to Kossinna in the Central Expressway Project from the EXIM Bank of China and to obtain technological and financial proposals from the Metallurgical Corporation of China (MCC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Southern Transport Development Project - Implementation of the newly identified projects out of the balance funds of the project, for the construction of south section from Pinnaduwa to Godagama
decision_details: - The EXIM Bank of China has granted funds for the construction of the  south section from Pinnaduwa to Godagama, under the Southern Transport Development Project and there is a further saving of around Sri Lankan Rs.2 billion, after the implementation of the project.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to improve the local roads and bridges associated with the Southern Expressway and purchase special vehicles required for the operation of the Expressway, by utilizing the said balance amount, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply, Installation & Commissioning of Aeronautical Information Management System for Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Aeronautical Information Management System is used to generate, distribute and receive all the information from the other aeronautical zones, required to control the flights in the Sri Lankan aeronautical information zone. However, it has been apparent that this system is incompatible with the present day needs.  The amount of the aeronautical data to be controlled increases daily and the unavailability of the necessary system assistance has caused in the decline of the quality of the information and the high probability of errors. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala De Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to invite international competitive bids for the supply, installation and commissioning of the Aeronautical Information Management System, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Use of Indian Line of Credit for uplifting infrastructure facilities for Railway and to develop train-bus integrated service for a more efficient and comfortable public transport service
decision_details: - It has become difficult to provide a comfortable, safe and efficient  service for the passengers, due to having aged locomotives and passenger compartments in the railway, which is one of the major modes of public transport. At present,  more than 50% of the locomotives have exceeded  a span of 30 years and 550 passenger compartments have exceeded a span of 25 years.  Considering the above facts, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala De Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation,  to take necessary steps to purchase locomotives and passenger compartments and to renovate the railway signaling system, utilizing the remaining funds of US$ 40 million of the Indian Line of Credit under the Northern Railway Development Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Installation of new Sound System, CCTV System, Master Clock System and the Telephone Exchange in Parliament
decision_details: - The existing Sound System, CCTV System, Master Clock System and the Telephone Exchange in Parliament have become obsolete, leading to a situation where a reliable service could not be had up to expectations.      Therefore, the proposal made by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, to install new systems at an estimated cost of Rs.400 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting relief to the Public Officers who submitted nominations for  the Election of two Local Authorities in the Northern Province subsequently postponed
decision_details: - Although the nominations were accepted in January 2011 for the Election of Pudukudirippu and Maritimepattu Pradeshiya Sabas of Northern Province, the election had to be postponed due to non-completion of the removal of land mines in the relevant areas and the enjoining order issued by the Supreme Court to that effect. There are Public Officers among the candidates who submitted nominations for this Election and they have to remain on no-pay leave due to non holding of the Election.  Since this situation had arisen due to matters beyond the control of that officers, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government, to permit the said officers to report to the last served place of work, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Plastering 3,000 Houses each in 25 Districts to mark the Induction of His Excellency the President
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, for the implementation of an Islandwide programme of  providing building materials required to plaster 75,000 houses selected from the 25 districts of the country (3,000 houses from each district), to mark the first anniversary of the induction of H.E. the President, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Government's Intervention for having a Competitive Price for Mid-Season Green Gram Production
decision_details: - The annual green gram requirement of the country is around 26,000 mt and Rs.851 million is spent annually for the importation of green gram. In order to minimize the importation cost, the green gram cultivation was successfully implemented in the mid season of the year 2015 under the National Food Production Programme.  The farmers in the districts of Anuradhapura, Mannar, Kurunegala, Monaragala and Hambantota have produced around 3,200 mt of green gram. The present market price per kg of green gram is between Rs.120/- and Rs.140/- and that price is insufficient when it compares with the production cost.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Agriculture, to release the required funds as an advance, to the District Secretaries, through the Farmers' Trust Fund, subject to a maximum of Rs.50 million for the purchase of green gram paying Rs.180/- per kilo, with a view to encouraging the farmers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining approval for the Implementation of Special Flood Mitigation Projects to be carried out in the year 2016 by the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation & Development Corporation (SLLR&DC)
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Land Reclamation & Development Corporation has designed several special flood mitigation projects to be implemented in the year 2016 to mitigate the risk of flood in the areas associated with the capital City of Colombo and so as to ensure an environmentally sustainable township.  Under these projects, it is expected to conserve  the Muthurajawela marshy land, which has a very rich bio?diversity and to commence the initial studies pertaining to the Kalu Oya Storm Water and Environmental Improvement Project, with a view to preventing floods outside the City of Colombo.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to implement the relevant projects in the year 2016, at an estimated cost of Rs.3,878 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of Regulations in relation to the issuance of a new National Identity Card instead of the National Identity Card presently in use
decision_details: - It has been observed that the various issues and difficulties arise in the use of the Identity Cards presently being issued by the Department of Registration of Persons.  Therefore, taking into consideration the International standards,  the necessary actions are already being carried out to provide for the establishment of a National Persons Database and issuance of a secured Electronic National Identity Card incorporating the bio-metric information of the relevant person.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Navinne, the Minister of Internal Affairs, Wayamba Development and Cultural Affairs, to take necessary steps to enact regulations in that regard, as per the provisions of the Registration of Persons Act, No.32 of 1968, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Payment of Retirement benefits to Dr. Wickramabahu Karunaratne, who served as a Senior Lecturer at the University of Peradeniya
decision_details: - The Proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to pay the retirement benefits to Dr. Wickramabahu Karunaratne, who served as a Senior Lecturer at the University of Peradeniya, treating that he has served in the relevant post from 1982-11-01, the date of termination of his post until retirement on reaching the age of 65 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The use of the title 'Samurdhi' for Divineguma Act, No.01 of 2013
decision_details: - The Department of Divineguma Development was established in the year 2013 with the amalgamation of the institutions of Sri Lanka Samurdhi Authority, Sri Lanka Udarata Development Authority, Southern Development Authority of Sri Lanka, the Department of Upcountry Peasantry Rehabilitation and the Department of Commissioner General of Samurdhi. However, the name 'Samurdhi' is much popular and recognized among public, since the Samurdhi Programme was implemented with the main objective of elimination of poverty.  As such, taken into consideration the requests made to replace the name 'Divineguma' with the name 'Samurdhi', by the small groups organized under this programme, societies, unions and the village level officers who implement this programme, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, the Minister of Social Empowerment and Welfare, to amend the Divineguma Act, No.1 of 2013 to substitute the title 'Divineguma' with the 'Samurdhi', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Requirement of Rolling Stock for Upcountry Line Operations in Sri Lanka Railways
decision_details: - 50% of the fleet of locomotives in Sri Lanka Railway has already passed the economic life span of 30 years and therefore, in order to provide a reliable and efficient service, the addition of new engines and the gradual disposal of the uneconomical locomotives should take place.  An Officials' Committee appointed for the purpose in the year 2014, has formulated a Procurement Plan for a period of 10 years and as per the recommendation of the said Committee, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation,  to take measures relevant to procurement of 12 Nos. locomotives and 09 units of Diesel Multiple Units to be used for the operations in the Upcountry Line, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reinsurance Cover (Retrocession) for National Insurance Trust Fund for the year 2016
decision_details: - It is mandatory for all general insurance companies in Sri Lanka to place 30% of their reinsurance requirements at the National Insurance Trust Fund (NITF).   With a view to minimizing the risks that have to be borne by the NITF that may arise from the reinsurance coverage so provided,  due to any exceptional catastrophe, the proposal made by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to obtain a reinsurance cover from foreign reinsurance companies, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Secretariat for Coordinating the Reconciliation Mechanisms
decision_details:
- The  golden opportunity dawned for Sri Lanka in May 2009, subsequent to the conclusion of the conflict, to achieve reconciliation and a durable peace lost due to various reasons. The restoration of reconciliation among Sri Lankans has become an essential matter which needs to be attended to without further delay. Currently, various Government Institutions including Ministries work on building reconciliation in the country. However, the absence of a central entity to coordinate such activities has led to several practical problems such as undue delays in implementing decisions and programmes as well as duplication of work.  Therefore,  in order to effectively implement the decisions, programmes and processes related to Reconciliation Process, the proposal made by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickramasinghe, to establish a Secretariat of Coordinating the Reconciliation Mechanisms (SCRM) which bears the following responsibilities, in the Prime Minister's Office, with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.  

*	Coordinating national level consultations on reconciliation mechanisms. 

*	developing a time-bound plan for the setting up of relevant reconciliation mechanisms such as 'the Office on Missing Persons', 'the Commission for Truth, Justice, Reconciliation, and Non -recurrence'.  

*	coordinating with the domestic institutions including Sri Lanka Human Rights Commission and as well as with the international institutions such as the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR). 

*	oversee progress and coordinate implementation of the recommendations contained in the Lessons Learnt and Reconciliation Commission (LLRC) Report, other Commission Reports and Report of the OHCHR. 

*	coordination of any other requirement relating to strengthening of the Rule of Law, Human Rights and administrative and judicial reforms.

title: Signing and Ratification of the International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance
decision_details: - The above Convention which is based on the fundamental principle that “no person shall be subjected to enforced disappearance” defines enforced disappearance as a human rights violation and each State Party to this Convention has to enact legislation to prohibit such enforced disappearance, treating it as a criminal offence. So far, the Convention has been signed by 94 states and ratified by 51. In keeping with the mandate and the vision of this Government to safeguard and protect the  human rights of all citizens and to ensure the non-recurrence of conflicts, the proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Foreign Affairs,  to sign the International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance and to take necessary measures to effect the provisions of that Convention in the country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Seven Storied New Building Complex for the  Health Education Bureau
decision_details: - The main task of the Health Education Bureau is to assist the public to have a healthy life, through enhancing the health promotional activities.  For this purpose, the institution conducts health educational awareness programmes in collaboration with various other institutions. The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to construct a building with adequate space to enable that institute to conduct its affairs more formally, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the proposed Medical Ward Complex in the District General Hospital, Chilaw
decision_details: - The District General Hospital, Chilaw being the major hospital situated in the Puttlam District in the North-Western Province, provides patient care services for the people of Chilaw as well as for its suburbs.  In order to provide a qualitative patient care service equipped with modern facilities to the people who benefit from the hospital, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to construct a new medical ward complex, at an estimated cost of Rs.696 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Batticaloa Airport
decision_details: - Although a project has been initiated during the recent past to construct a Terminal Building and renovate the Airport Runaway, Taxiway and Apron at the Batticaloa Airport with the objective of developing it for commercial passenger services, the activities of the said project have not yet been completed. Therefore, in order to complete the relevant constructions expeditiously, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to assign the said activities to the Sri Lanka Air force, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Project for the welfare of the women of the Ampara District who were affected by war
decision_details: - The Entrepreneur Development Training Programme implemented by the then Ministry of Child Development and Women's Affairs in collaboration with the Indian Government, for the women of the Batticaloa District who were affected by war, has been highly successful and these women are engaged themselves in self-employment having been registered as a Cooperative Development Society. Considering the success of this project, it has been planned to implement a similar project in the Ampara District as well.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Chandrani Bandara, the Minister of Women and Child Affairs, to implement the above project for the welfare of the war affected women of the Ampara District, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of lands in the Sacred Kalutara Bodhi Premises to the Kalutara Bodhi Trustee Board on a Long Term Lease Basis, under the State Land Ordinance
decision_details: - The Kalutara Sacred Bodhi is venerated by thousands of Buddhist devotees of the Island. The entire premises where the Bodhi and the other places of worship such as Chaithya, Shrine room and the lower garden of the Bodhi situated consists with 07 blocks of land owned by the state in an extent of 3.41 hectares. These blocks of land are being developed by the Kalutara Bodhi Trustee Board from a long time.  Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. M.K.A.D.S. Gunawardana, the Minister of Lands, to provide these blocks of land to the Kalutara Bodhi Trustee Board on a long term Lease basis, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the strengthening of the Small and Medium scale Enterprises in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - This project is implemented with the objective of strengthening of the Small and Medium scale Enterprises and enhancing the opportunities for the employment.  The Asian Development Bank has agreed to provide US$ 100 million for the purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ravi Karunanayake, the Minister of Finance, to conduct negotiations   with that Bank and to enter into the relevant agreements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading the National Blood Transfusion Service of Sri Lanka with State of the Art Technology giving special emphasis to Northern and Eastern Provinces
decision_details:
- National Blood Transfusion Service consists of 18 cluster centres and 93 peripheral blood banks attached to the major hospitals in Sri Lanka.  A project is already in operation to improve its services to suit the international standards.  The work of that project has almost been completed and the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to establish the following facilities which were not included in the original project plan, was approved by the Cabinet: 

*	construction of a special laboratory for the Nucleic Acid Testing (NAT) to prevent transfusion transmissible infections such as HIV and Hepatitis.

*	construction of a special laboratory equipped with highly technological devises to perform the Human Leukocyte Antigen (HLA) Testing essentially required for the transplantations of Kidney and Bone marrow.

* 	construction of a clean room to utilize stem cell transplantation and prepare primary blood cells required for the treatment of Leukemia and other blood related disorders. 

*	establishment of a Cord Blood Bank.

title: Central Expressway Project - Selection of Contractors and Local Supervision Consultants for the construction of Section III from Pothuhera to Galagedera
decision_details: - The Section III of the Central Expressway, from Pothuhera to Galagedera consists of 32.5 km and it has been planned to complete the constructions  of that section within 36 months. The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to have the entire section constructed by local contractors, calling competitive bids, dividing it into five contract packages of equal value and consist in length of 4.5 - 7.5 km, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Record Room for the Department of Motor Traffic, in the Werahera Premises
decision_details: - By now, the Department of Motor Traffic has registered more than 60 lakhs of vehicles.  Since the space available in the Head Office premises of the said Department at Narahenpita is inadequate to safely store the transfer files which added at the time of transfer of vehicles and the original files related to registered vehicles, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to construct a new record room in the Werahera premises, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction and Modification of New Bus Stands / Terminals in Urban and Suburban Areas for the Qualitative Development of Transport Services
decision_details:
- This programme is implemented with the objective of providing necessary transport services and essential infrastructure facilities to the passengers who daily travel to the cities, by creating a qualitative development in transport services through constructing new bus terminals/stands and modifying the existing bus terminals/stands in urban and suburban areas.  Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to construct new bus terminals/stands and to modify the existing bus terminals/stands in the following cities, under the said progrmame, was approved by the Cabinet:  

	*	construction of the Jaffna bus terminal - Rs.150 	million.

	*	construction of the Hingurakgoda bus terminal - Rs.60 	million.

	*	construction of the Medirigiriya bus terminal - Rs.25 	million.

	*	modification of the existing bus terminal at Kaduruwela - Rs.40 million.

	*	modification of the existing bus terminal at Aralaganwila  - Rs.05 million.

title: Entering into an Agreement between the Department of Railways and Holcim (Lanka) Company for the Transportation of Coal Containers of Holcim (Lanka) Company by Special Trains from the Railway Station of China Harbour to Railway Station of Maho
decision_details: - Generally, the many countries in the world frequently utilize the railway for the purpose of transportation of goods.  However, at present, the income generated by the Department of Railways through the transportation of goods is relatively low when it compares with the income generated through the passenger transportation. Therefore, the Department has focused its attention towards non-conventional methods of transportation of goods, with a view to increasing the income generated from the same.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to enter into an agreement, to transport the coal imported to the Trincomalee Harbour by the Holcim (Lanka) Company, to the Railway Station of Maho, from the Railway Station of China Harbour, subject to charging fees based on the operational cost, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Secured Transactions Registry Bill
decision_details: - Secured Transaction Act, No.49 of 2009 was introduced to enable the Small and Medium scale Enterprises to obtain loans from Banks and Financial Institutions by keeping movable properties such as machinery owned by such enterprises, where the said enterprises do not have access to any immovable property such as lands, to produce as a collateral. However, it has become difficult to achieve the objectives expected to be accomplished through this Act, due to the issues arise in enforcing certain provisions of the same.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to repeal the Secured Transaction Act, No.49 of 2009 and to draft new Legislation to suit with the present needs, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Essential expenditure incurred in respect of Preparatory Work involved in launching the National Programme on Food Production (2016-2018)
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted to implement the National Programme on Food Production, during the period of 2016-2018, as a pioneer programme of the Government. The programme has been inaugurated on 2015-10-05 in Vaddakkachchi in Killinochchi District under the leadership of H.E. the President and work at District and Divisional levels, too, have commenced concurrently throughout the country. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to distribute seed paddy free of charge among farmers as a main component of the said programme, to promote traditional local production of seed paddy with a view to promoting sustainable farming free of toxic substances,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Membership for Sri Lanka in the Climate Vulnerable Forum
decision_details: - Sri Lanka, being an Island in the tropics as well as a developing country, intensely faces the adverse effects of climate change. Taking action at national level to minimize such adverse effects of climate change is not sufficient and bilateral and multilateral action, regional agreements or collective action by countries is required to address this matter. Accordingly, the states which face similar kind of climatic impacts and those which had been subject to such impacts have formed the 'Climate Vulnerable Forum' and as such, the proposal made by H.E. the President, Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to obtain the membership of that Forum, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Consultancy Agreement between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Basel Institute on Governance in Switzerland
decision_details: - The Basel Institute on Governance located in Switzerland is an independent non-profit making institution working with public and private sectors to improve processes on suppressing corruption and other financial crimes in public and private sectors around the world. This agreement is proposed as a result of seeking assistance from the Government of Switzerland for the action being taken by the Sri Lankan Government against corruption and financial crimes. By entering into this agreement, the Institute will provide the necessary advice and assistance required in regard to the activities pertaining to the recovery of funds belonging to the Government of Sri Lanka, illegally earned through corruption or other forms of abuse of power. Guidance from this institution will also be available, where necessary, for judicial activities that have to be carried out beyond the jurisdiction of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mangala Samaraweera, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, to enter into the relevant agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction the Law on "National Minimum Wage" for the Private Sector Employees
decision_details: - As per the requests made by the members of the National Labour Advisory Council as well various trade unions, the Government has decided to impose a National Minimum Wage for employees in the private sector through a separate law. The existing minimum wage has been determined considering the Minimum Monthly Poverty Line limit of Rs.4,000/- per head.  Taking into consideration the present requirements, the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, the Minister of Labour and Trade Union Relations, to draft legislation to set Rs.10,000/- as the monthly minimum wage, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Cabinet Sub-Committee on Constitutional Reforms
decision_details:
- As per the decision taken taken at the Cabinet meeting held on 2015-11-18 to appoint a Cabinet Sub-Committee chaired by the Hon. Prime Minister, to submit recommendations pertaining to the methodology to be followed and the Constitutional changes to be made in order to implement the proposal presented by H.E. the President to draft necessary Constitutional provisions to abolish the Executive Presidency and amend the Electoral System, the proposal made by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, in his capacity as the Chairman of the said Sub-Committee, to appoint the following Cabinet Ministers to the said Sub-Committee, was approved by the Cabinet. 

	* Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva
	* Hon. Lakshman Kiriella
	* Hon. Rauff Hakeem
	* Hon. Susil Premajayantha
	* Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen
	* Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka
	* Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa
	* Hon. D.M. Swaminathan
	* Hon. Mano Ganeshan
	* Hon. Malik Samarawickrama

title: Completion of the Remaining Construction Work of the District Secretariat Building, Colombo
decision_details: - With the purpose of establishing the government institutions which provide  services to the general public of Colombo district under one roof, the Colombo District Secretariat is being built with 20 storeys in the Narahenpita area, and most of its construction work has already been completed. By now, several government offices carry out their services within this building and therefore, the proposal made by Hon. Vajira Abeywardena, the Minister of Home Affairs, to take necessary steps to complete the remaining construction work expeditiously, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Supply, Installation and Commissioning of ADS-B  System in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Automatic Dependent Surveillance Broadcast (ADS-B) is an Aircraft Surveillance System used in the modern world for Air Traffic Control purposes.  The International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) has recommended the use of ADS-B under the Asia Pacific Regional Air Navigation Implementation Plans and Asian countries such as India, Maldives, Bangladesh, Singapore and Malaysia have already deployed ADS-B. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala De Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to award the contract for the Supply, Installation and Commissioning of the ADS-B network system in Sri Lanka, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Draft Bill on Right to Information to the Parliament
decision_details: - The right of access to information has been recognized as a fundamental right in terms of Article 14A of the Constitution of Sri Lanka as amended by the 19th Amendment to the Constitution. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Gayantha Karunathilaka, the Minister of Parliamentary Reforms and Mass Media, to present the draft Bill on the Right to Information in Parliament, in order to ensure the right of citizens to obtain official information of the Government and implement the principles of democracy and good governance, thereby establishing a better and responsible public service free of corruption in Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Registration of Electors (Special Provisions) Act
decision_details: - The Registration of Electors (Special Provisions) Act, No.27 of 2013, enacted to provide voting rights for the displaced families and individuals who were forced to flee from Northern Province abandoning their lands and properties and seek temporary residence and accommodation in other parts of the Island, has been in force for two (02) years with effect from 2013-06-20. Considering the need for the operation of the provisions of the Act for a further period of two (02) years for the  use of displaced citizens of Northern Province who are currently residing in Puttlam and Anuradhapura districts and anticipating their return to the Northern Province, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Justice, to draft a new Bill incorporating the provisions contained in the Registration of Electors (Special Provisions) Act, No.27 of 2013, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation  Act
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation, established under the Act, No.15 of 1968, is responsible for the conservation of water retention areas, low lands, marshy lands, barren lands, swamp land and canal reservations. Considering that various issues have to be faced in implementing the provisions of the Act, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to amend the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation  Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Recommendations for the export of Ferrous and Non-Ferrous Metal Scrap and Ingots
decision_details: - Considering the difficulties, with regard to the scarcity of raw material, faced by the local industrialists who conduct their small and medium scale industries with the use of ferrous and non-ferrous metal as raw materials, the Cabinet decided as a solution to appoint a Cabinet Sub-Committee comprising of the concerned Ministers, to recommend an appropriate methodology to enable the said industrialists to easily obtain ferrous and non-ferrous metal scrap and ingots discarded by the government departments, corporations, statutory boards, and other institutions.

title: Amendment to the Medical Ordinance (Specialist Register)
decision_details: - As there are no provisions in the Medical Ordinance to maintain a separate register for the Specialist Medical Practitioners, the specialist qualification is registered, as an additional qualification,  in the same folio where the basic M.B.B.S. qualification of the respective medical practitioner is registered. Other countries of the world maintain separate registers for different specializations and it has been considered as an essential prerequisite to ensure more secure medical treatment for the general public. Considering this aspect, with a view to maintaining the quality of patient care services, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to  take necessary action to amend the Medical Ordinance, in order to the prepare a Specialists' Register for the Medical Specialists, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reconstitution and Empowerment of the Legal and Institutional Framework for Disaster Management
decision_details: - Activities such as the minimization of disasters, early preparation, response to emergency situations and the collection of information related to disasters are being carried out through the Disaster Management Center which has been established under the Ministry of Disaster Management, while the National Disaster Relief Services Center carries out the work related to post-disaster relief, rehabilitating disaster affected people as well as reconstruction of the houses of disaster victims. Although these two institutions operate separately, both of them get directly involved in activities related to disaster management.  As such, in order to establish an efficient mechanism required for disaster management efforts, the proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadarshana Yapa, the Minister of Disaster Management, to merge the above mentioned two institutions and set up a more strengthened single institution, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointing a Committee comprising of Senior Officials of the Government to inquire into the Legality of Transactions Performed on the Tender Process for Selecting Two Companies for the Procurement of Spare Parts required for Buses of the Sri Lanka Transport Board
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to appoint a Committee comprising of senior officials of government institutions, including the General Treasury, Ministry of Transport and Civil Aviation and Sri Lanka Customs, to inquire into the process of selecting two private companies to purchase spare parts for the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) since 2011, the irregularities reported to have been committed by the said companies by utilizing the tax concessions received the time of import of spare parts, and to examine the legality of the agreements entered into between Sri Lanka Transport Board and the said companies, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Aluthgama, Mathugama and Agalawaththa Integrated Water Supply Project; Kunadasale-Haragama Water Supply Project and the  Polgahawela, Pothuhera and Alawwa Integrated Water Supply Project
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister, in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to obtain loan facilities for a sum amounting to US$ 403.01 million from the Export and Import (EXIM) Bank of India, for three projects, namely, for Aluthgama-Mathugama and Agalawaththa Integrated Water Supply Project US$164.9 million, for Kunadasale-Haragama Water Supply Project US$146.31million and for Polgahawela, Pothuheara and Alawwa Integrated Water Supply Project US$91.8 million and also to obtain a sum amounting to US$54.44 million from the General Treasury as local funds, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Microfinance Bill
decision_details: - Presently, the Microfinance Sector in Sri Lanka has achieved a considerable level of maturity. As a result, diverse types of institutions such as co‑operative societies, commercial banks, development banks, non‑governmental organizations and international non-governmental organizations have joined with small scale lending institutions. At present, the regulation and supervision of microfinance  institutions in Sri Lanka are being carried out through various government agencies which adopt different regulatory requirements and standards. Due to the complex nature of this field, if regulation and supervision are not carried out properly, it would lead to inefficiency in the microfinance sector, misuse of the methodologies followed and cause numerous hardships to low income people who benefit from small scale lending institutions. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister, in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to present the proposed Microfinance  Bill, containing provisions for the regulation and supervision of microfinance institutions in Sri Lanka, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for Mainstreaming Biodiversity Conservation and Sustainable Use for improved Human Nutrition and Well-being
decision_details: - A grant of Rs.116 million has been awarded to Sri Lanka by the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO) and Global Environmental Facility(GEF), to implement the above mentioned project.  The main objectives of this project are the use of the unique biodiversity in Sri Lanka in a sustainable manner, enhancing the livelihoods of rural people while ensuring food security, improving the nutritional levels of the people and thereby motivating them towards biodiversity conservation. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President, Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to implement this project up to the year 2017, in three pilot areas, namely, Kalawana Divisional Secretariat Division in the Ratnapura District, Ududumbara Divisional Secretariat Division in the Kandy District and Giribawa Divisional Secretariat Division in the Kurunegala District, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project on Mainstreaming Biodiversity Conservation and Use in Sri Lankan Agro-ecosystems for Livelihoods and Adaptation to Climate Changes
decision_details: - A grant of Rs.172 million has been awarded to Sri Lanka by the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) and Global Environmental Facility (GEF)  to implement the above mentioned project to adapt to climate changes. The main objective of this project is to find solutions for the adverse impact of climate changes upon the unique biodiversity existent in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E the President Maithripala Sirisena,  in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to implement the above project up to the year 2017, through three (03) special agro systems selected as pilot areas, namely, an Ovita System in the Millaniya Divisional Secretariat Division in the Kalutara District, an Upcountry Home Garden System in the Ududumbara Divisional Secretariat Division in the Kandy District and a Cascade Tank System in the Giribawa Divisional Secretariat Division in the Kurunegala District, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the establishment of Technically Qualified Search and Rescue Teams to deal with Sudden Disaster Situations
decision_details: - It has been observed that there is a high risk at present for the occurrence of natural disasters such as floods, landslides and cyclones as well as man-made disasters such as chemical hazards. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to implement the project on establishing technically qualified “Search and Rescue Teams”, to assist at times of sudden disasters, at a cost of Rs.349.2 million, during the period from 2016-2018,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Local Authorities Elections Ordinance
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe,  the Prime Minister, to amend the Local Authorities Elections Ordinance for the purposes of increasing the women's representation in Local Authorities, introducing of 'Ward System' during the elections in said institutions and the taking of necessary measures to make the electoral system more efficient and effective, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of suitable programmes to ensure the Sri Lankan Identity
decision_details: - mplementation of a programme expeditiously with a view to  sustaining peace and reconciliation among various communities living in Sri Lanka and ensuring the Sri Lankan identity in the hearts of all Sri Lankans is a timely need. The mindset of all Sri Lankans should be arranged so as to ensure the Sri Lankan identity as one Nation within the country as well as in the abroad while securing cultural and religious characteristics unique to each community. That will lead the way to build a sound Sri Lankan Nation where the future generations of the country could live peacefully and harmoniously.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickramasinghe, to appoint a Cabinet Sub-Committee to provide the necessary guidance to implement various programmes, during the year 2016, to ensure Sri Lankan identity, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Constitution for the Abolition of the Executive Presidency and transferring of powers to the Parliament and to introduce a more democratic electoral system
decision_details:
- H.E. the President stated that, in the 19th Amendment introduced to the Constitution in keeping with the Manifesto of “Maithiri Administration - Stable Country” (“Maithri Paalanayak - Sthaawara Ratak”) submitted by him at the Presidential Election 2015, as the common candidate, the powers of the Executive Presidency could not be reduced largely as expected due to the opinion expressed by the Supreme Court that such an amendment requires a Referendum.  Similarly, the proposed amendments for the Electoral System also could not be implemented since the broader consensus could not be reached at the discussions held in that regard. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President, to draft necessary legislation to abolish the Executive Presidency and to revise the Electoral System, taking into consideration the representations of concerned political groups and the public / civil society organizations, was approved by the Cabinet. 

	The Cabinet also decided to appoint a Cabinet Sub-Committee under the Chairmanship of the Hon. Prime Minister, to make recommendations pertaining to the methodology to be followed in the implementation of this proposal and on Constitutional changes that should be carried out.

title: Provision of Cash Vouchers instead of School Uniform Materials for School Children from the year 2016
decision_details: - The major challenges the Government had to face when providing school uniform materials with the school children were the timely provision of  such uniform materials to students and the supply of that materials according to the specified standard. The Government also has to incur a considerable cost for packing, storing and transportation of such uniform materials.  Having considered this situation, the proposal made by Hon. Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, the Minister of Education, to implement a programme for the provision of cash vouchers instead of providing school uniform materials to school children, from the year 2016, enabling them to purchase high quality uniform materials from any shop in the Island, as recommended by the Cabinet Committee on Economic Management, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Data Collection Project by the Airborne Gravity and Magnetic Data Survey around the Mannar Basin and Reprocessing and Imaging of the  Seismic Data
decision_details: - The expectation of the present Government is to make Sri Lanka a nation self sufficient in energy by utilizing the full potential of all indigenous energy generation sources to the optimum level.  In this endevour, the exploration activities of oil and natural gas in Sri Lanka receives an important place and the discovery of 2 natural gas reserves around the Mannar Basin in  the year 2011 is one of the milestones in that regard. Even though, 2D seismic data that can be used to acquire information on the oil fields and natural gas fields said to exist around the Mannar Basin, has been acquired during the period of 2001 - 2005 covering the Mannar Basin, they are more than 10 years old and therefore, it is important to re-process and update the said data.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Chandima Weerakkody, the Minister of Petroleum Resources Development,  to award the Contracts for the Project for Modern Re-processing and Imaging  the acquired Seismic Data and for carrying out a project on Airborne Gravity and Magnetic Survey of Mannar Basin, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee and the Project Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of 450,000 Doses of Rabies Vaccine for Field Programmes in 2015-2016
decision_details: - Rabies is a 100% fatal but yet a preventable disease.  According to the statistics of World Health Organization (WHO), Rabies kills over 55,000 people annually around the world and over 95% of the deaths occur as a result of the bites of Rabies infected dogs.  According to WHO, Rabies can be eliminated within a short period as three (03) months, if 70% of the dog population is vaccinated. The Department of Animal Production and Health has decided to launch a programme with the aim of eliminating dog-mediated Rabies in the country by the year 2020.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. P. Harison, the Minister of  Rural Economy, to procure 450,000 doses of high quality rabies vaccine for that programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Renal Units to provide specialized care to the patients of the Chronic Kidney Disease of Unknown Aetiology
decision_details:
- Chronic Kidney Disease of Unknown Aetiology (CKD/CKDu) is considered to be the biggest  challenge experienced by the health sector of Sri Lanka at present.  As of now, the total number of patients reported in the country is around 26,470 and the majority of them are reported from the districts such as Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa, Kurunegala, Badulla, Matale, Trincomalee, Ampara and Mullaitivu.  The proposal made by Hon. Dr. Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to construct Renal Units in the following hospitals with facilities for early identification of patients in the districts where the disease is prone and also to provide facilities for dialysis and kidney transplant, within the next three years from 2016 - 2018,  at a total cost of Rs.4,263 million, was approved by the Cabinet: 

*	Teaching Hospital, Jaffna 
*	Provincial General Hospital, Badulla
*	Teaching Hospital, Baticaloa
*	District General Hospital, Trincomalee 
*	District General Hospital, Hambantota

title: The Phase II of the Project for the Supply of Equipment of High Quality Radiotherapy with High Energy Radiation including the Infrastructure for Cancer Patients in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The supply of equipment of high quality radiotherapy with high energy radiation and the construction of appropriate buildings to install these equipment are carried out under this project.  Under the first phase of this project, the relevant buildings are being constructed at the National Cancer Institute - Maharagama, Teaching Hospital - Jaffna , Teaching Hospital - Karapitiya, Teaching Hospital - Kandy and the Teaching Hospital -Batticaloa.  The proposal made by Hon. Dr. Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to construct the radiation protective buildings required for the cancer centres at the hospitals of; Teaching Hospital - Anuradhapura, District General Hospital - Hambantota, General Hospital -  Badulla, Teaching Hospital - Kurunegala and the General Hospital - Ratnapura, under the Second Phase of the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Special Projects to ease the living conditions of the people in the Northern Province with particular reference to Jaffna and the surrounding Islands
decision_details: - The Jaffna Peninsula is surrounded with over 15 islands including the Delft, Pungudutivu, Nagadeepa, Analaitivu and Mandativu. Out of these, people reside in 6 islands and the total number of families currently living in these islands are about 15,000.  The main livelihood of these islanders are fisheries, agriculture, livestock and palmyrah based products etc.  Due to inefficient modes of transportation currently prevail, the people have to spare a lot of time and money for traveling to the mainland.  As such, the proposal made by Hon. D.M. Swaminathan, the Minister of Prison Reforms, Rehabilitation, Resettlement and Hindu Religious Affairs, to implement 10 projects that will help to provide efficient transport facilities and improve their living conditions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: New Housing and Housing Improvement Programme for 1,000 Displaced Families in Welioya
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to construct 500 new houses and also to improve 500 houses already constructed, for the benefit of people of the Welioya Divisional Secretariat Division in the Mullaitivu District, affected by the terrorist attacks and as well as by the threats of severe droughts and floods, for over three decades, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading the Tissamaharama Water Supply Scheme
decision_details: - The present population where the Tissamaharama Water Supply Scheme is being implemented is 46,381. The total population benefited presently from the already provided water connections is about 30,500. The people of these areas mainly engaged in agriculture for their livelihood and it appears that the symptoms of the Kidney disease prevail among them.  However, due to the existing shortcomings in the water treatment plant, it has become difficult to prevent the concentration of toxic materials and heavy metals with the drinking water which causes the long term health issues.  Therefore, in order to provide safe and quality drinking water to the people living in the areas of Tissamaharama and Kirinda, the proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to upgrade the Tissamaharama Water Supply Scheme, at an estimated cost of Rs.393 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Animal Feed Act, No.15 of 1986
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. P. Harison, the  Minister of Rural Economy, to amend the Animal Feed Act, No.15 of 1986, for the purposes of appointing a Registrar of Animal Feed to implement the relevant laws more formally, altering the composition of the Animal Feed Advisory Committee, safeguarding the rights of Animal Feed purchasers, increasing the penalties for violation of the provisions of the Act and regularizing the animal feed production and distribution in a better way, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increase of Monthly Bursary Payment provided for the University Students who are not entitled to Mahapola Scholarships, from Rs.2,500/- to Rs.4,000/-
decision_details: - The Mahapola Higher Education Scholarship Scheme was commenced in 1981 on a concept of the late Hon. Lalith Athulathmudali.  In parallel to the said Scheme, a Bursary Scheme is also implemented by the Universities, under the Treasury funds, for the students of low income families.  Approximately, 25,000 students are admitted to universities annually and nearly 12,000 of them receive Mahapola Scholarships, while nearly 7,000 students receive bursaries.  Currently, a university student who entitled to Mahapola Scholarship receives an amount of Rs.5,000/- per month and a student who entitled to bursary receives only an amount of Rs.2,500/- per month. Therefore, with a view to removing this anomaly and creating an environment for the students who gain entry into the universities to pursue their studies without financial hardships, the proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Kiriella, the Minister of Higher Education and Highways, to increase the monthly Bursary payment provided for students, from Rs.2,500/- to Rs. 4,000/-, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bi-lateral Air Service Agreement between Sri Lanka and Bulgaria
decision_details: - Considering the increasing demand in the Tourism Sector in Sri Lanka, it appears that the air service links established with other countries are essential  for the development of the Air Services and the Tourism Industry in Sri Lanka.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to sign the Air Services Agreement already signed between Sri Lanka and Builgaria at the officer level, by an accredited representative of Sri Lanka and thereafter to give effect to the said agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Statute of the South Asia Wildlife Enforcement Network (SAWEN)
decision_details: - The South Asia Wildlife Enforcement Network (SAWEN) is an inter-governmental agreement among 08 South Asian Countries, namely, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka, established with the objective of strengthening Wildlife Law Enforcement to combat wildlife crime through communication, coordination, collaboration, capacity building and cooperation.  The responsibility of coordination of SAWEN activities in Sri Lanka is mainly entrusted with the Department of Wildlife Conservation. Sri Lanka, as a country enriched with bio-diversity will benefit immensely from the regional cooperation established under the above Enforcement Network. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Gamini Jayawickrema Perera, the Minister of Sustainable Development and Wildlife  to obtain the approval for the Statute of the South Asia Wildlife Enforcement Network (SAWEN), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of an Institute for Combinatorial Advanced Research and Education for General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University (KDU-CARE)
decision_details: - The General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University (KDU) is a well-established higher education institute which conducts research and other tertiary educational activities. That University has planned to establish an Institute for Combinatorial Advanced Research and Education consisting with divisions of research and enhancement, commercial and security, for the promotion of scientific researches. This Institute will work collaboratively with other research Institutions in the country and will also work as a focal point for national security concerns adhering to the national and international norms and guidelines. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to establish an Institute for Combinatorial Advanced Research and Education in the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University (KDU-CARE), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increasing the Representation of Women in Local Authorities
decision_details: - Although the women constitute 50% - 51% of the population of Sri Lanka, their representation as elected representatives in the Parliament, Provincial Councils and Local Government Authorities is about 5% of the total representatives elected for the said Institutions. Accordingly, in keeping with the pledges given at the last Presidential Election and Parliamentary Election to reserve 25% of the representation for women, in Local Authorities and Provincial Councils, the proposal made by the Prime Minister Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, to amend the Local Authorities (Special Provisions) Act, No.21 of 2012, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Act, No. 2 of 1996
decision_details: - In order to have a responsible fishing industry, at the Cabinet meeting held on 2015-10-14, the approval was granted to amend the relevant Sections of the Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Act, No. 2 of 1996, to enable to increase the fines charged on the persons who violate the laws related to fishing activities in the international waters. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon.
