Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, to present the amended Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Financial Assistance for the Implementation of Anamaduwa Integrated Water Supply Projec
decision_details: - Most of the people living in the Puttalam District presently depend on ground water sources for their drinking and water related other requirements.  Even in normal dry weather conditions they suffer from acute shortage of water. Further, the ground water in the area also consists of high density and salinity. As a solution to this condition, it has been planned to construct a modern water plant with a capacity of 11,000 cubic meters per day and a water supply distribution network which will provide an uninterrupted supply of safe drinking water to about 81,700 people living in the Divisional Secretariat Divisions of Anamaduwa, Kotawehera, Nawagaththegama, Mahakumbukkaduwela, Mundalama, Galgamuwa, Rasnayakepura and Puttlam.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Ravi Karunanayake, the Minister of Finance to enter into loan agreements separately with the Government of Spain which provides financial assistance to implement this project and the Hatton National Bank of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Memorandum of Understanding with the United Nations Human Settlement Programme
decision_details: - The United Nations Human Settlement Programme (UN Habitat), the UN agency for the Human Settlement Development performs a significant role through providing technical assistance in the areas such as urban administration, housing, environmental management, waste management and poverty reduction.  The proposal made by Hon. Sajith Premadasa, the Minister of Housing and Construction, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the United Nations Human Settlement Programme and the Ministry of Housing and Construction of Sri Lanka, to provide facilities for mutual cooperation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Accident and Emergency Care Units
decision_details:
- The Cabinet of Ministers has already approved the Policy on Accident and Emergency Care Services in Government Hospitals.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to award the relevant consultancy services contract to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB) and the construction contract to the Central Engineering Services (Pvt) Ltd, which functions under the CECB, to enable the expeditious construction of the Accident and Emergency Care Units of the following hospitals, was approved by the Cabinet. 
  
	*	District General Hospital, Kalutara - Rs.468.84 million
	*	District General Hospital, Polonnaruwa - Rs.467.17 million
	*	Teaching Hospital, Jaffna - Rs.589.82 million
	*	Base Hospital, Kalmunei North - Rs.374.22 million.

title: Implementation of Local Bank funded Medirigiriya Water Supply  Project - Phase II
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, for the implementation of Medirigiriya Water Supply Project at a cost of Rs.1,363 million secured from local banks, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Local Bank funded Kosgama - Avissawella Water Supply Project
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, for the implementation of Kosgama - Avissawella Water Supply Project at a cost of Rs.1,062 million secured from local banks,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Local Bank Funded Etampitiya Water Supply Project
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply,  for the implementation of Etampitiya Water Supply Project at a cost of Rs.2,039 million secured from the local banks, with a Treasury Guarantee,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: ADB Assisted Greater Colombo Water & Wastewater Management Improvement Investment Programme - Project 2 - Ambathale Water Supply System Improvement and Energy Saving Project & Towns East of Colombo District Water Supply Project
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to award the consultancy contract for design review  and construction supervision pertaining to Ambathale Water Supply System Improvement and Energy Saving Project & Towns East of Colombo District Water Supply Project implemented under the Phase 2 of the ADB Assisted Greater Colombo Water & Wastewater Management Improvement Investment Programme, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Southern Provincial Development Board
decision_details: - The task of the Ministry of Southern Development is to uplift the standard of living of the people residing in the region utilizing the available economic resources in the area in a sustainable manner, coordination of regional development activities, creation of new services and investments,   generation of employment opportunities in the region through improving existing service centres and industries, and increase of economic development. In order to accomplish this task efficiently and effectively, the proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayake, the Minister of Southern Development, to establish the Southern Provincial Development Board,  and to determine Galle, Matara, Hambantota and Moneragala districts as well as Kolonna and Embilipitiya Divisional Secretariat Divisions of the Rathnapura district as areas falling under the authority of this Board for its activities, and also to draft legislation for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the Construction of New Houses in the Plantation Sector
decision_details: - Under this project, the Ministry of Hill Country New Villages, Infrastructure and Community Development has planned to construct 1,877 new houses to provide shelter for the families identified from the community associated with the Plantation Sector, making use of the loans and grants provided by the Plantation Human Development Trust.  Presently, the construction works of 1,260 houses have been completed and handed over to the beneficiaries and the construction works of another 617 houses are yet to be completed.  A house built within a 7 perches of land consists of two bed rooms, a living room, a verandah, a kitchen and an attached toilet has a floor area of 550 sq.ft. The amount of money presently allocated for each house is Rs.515,000/- of which Rs.240,000/- is a non recoverable grant while the balance of Rs.275,000/- is provided as a loan. The proposal made by Hon. Palani Digambaram, the Minister of Hill Country New Villages, Infrastructure and Community Development, to revise the amount of money presently allocated to a house as Rs.650,000/- and the grant as Rs.310,000/- and the loan as Rs.340,000/-, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revocation of Irrevocable Deeds of Gifts (Special Provisions) Act
decision_details: - Since the Court of Appeal also had upheld a judgment of a District Court that a Donor can revoke a deed of gifts without obtaining a judgment from a Court of Law, certain issues have arisen with regard to the rights of the Donees as some Donors have taken action to revoke the deeds of gifts  unilaterally. Due to this reason, the lending institutions which keep properties received through deeds of gifts as securities have also faced difficulties. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Justice, to draft legislation to make provision to revoke the deeds of gifts only on a order of a competent Court of Law, in accordance with the recommendations of the Law Commission in this regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of Tea Shakthi Fund Act, No. 47 of 2000
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Navin Dissanayake, the Minister of Plantation Industries, to take action to make appropriate amendments to the Tea Shakthi Fund Act, No. 47 of 2000, with a view to conducting the  affairs of the Tea Shakthi Fund in a more formal and effective manner, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting the land where the Akuressa Bus Stand is presently situated  with the Urban Development Authority (UDA)
decision_details: - The Urban Development Authority (UDA) has acquired an extent of about 13 acres of land owned by the Land Reform Commission to implement  the proposed  development plan for the Akuressa Town.  According to the said development plan, it is proposed to remove the bus stand from the place where it is presently situated and to establish it in a portion of the newly acquired land.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development,  to vest the land where the Akuressa bus stand presently situated with the UDA, as a free grant, to enable it to be used for commercial purposes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project to improve the capacity of the Department of Meteorology to forecast weather changes more  accurately
decision_details: - Over 90% of the natural disasters occur in Sri Lanka are weather related and every year hazards are caused in various parts of the country by floods, droughts, lightning and strong winds, etc. Therefore, taking into consideration the necessity of increasing the technological capacity of the Department of  Meteorology, to enable it to provide accurate weather information and early warning services, the proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadarshana Yapa, the Minister of Disaster Management, to implement the project for 'improving the forecasting capabilities of the Department of Meteorology to minimize the impact of frequent weather hazards', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Galagedara and Mawathagama Water Supply Project
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to implement the above project with a view to providing safe drinking water to the people of Galagedara and Mawathagama areas and also to proceed with the activities related to it, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bilateral Air Service Agreement between Sri Lanka and Serbia
decision_details: - Serbia, an upper middle income country in the Eastern Europe contributes largely to its national income through the Tourism Industry and has entered into bilateral Air Service Agreements with 13 countries of the European Union. Considering the increasing demand in the tourism sector in Sri Lanka, it appears that the aviation links that Serbia has created with other countries can also be used to develop Aviation and  Tourism industry in Sri Lanka.  Especially, by granting permission to aeroplanes of Serbia to arrive and depart from the Mattala Airport, under the proposed bilateral agreement, will pave the way for the utilization of that Airport in an effective manner. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to sign the already initialed Air Services Agreement between Sri Lanka and Serbia in officer level, by an accredited representative and thereafter, to give effect to the said agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 'Awakening Polonnaruwa' Development Project
decision_details: - Development of transport facilities connecting Polonnaruwa and the other cities situated in close proximity to Polonnaruwa has been identified as a priority under the 'Awakening Polonnaruwa' Development Project. Although there are trains run across the Polonnaruwa District currently, the trains are not popular among general public due to reasons such as taking a long time to travel and inadequate train operations. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala De Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to conduct a comprehensive feasibility study for the rehabilitation of the Railway Network from Maho to Batticaloa and from Gal-oya to Trincomalee and for the development of the Railway Stations so as to provide essential facilities with the general public, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of a Memorandum of Understanding on Technical Cooperation between Sri Lanka and Thailand for the Development of Human Resources  in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The bilateral technical cooperation between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Thailand plays a significant role in the development of Human Resources in Sri Lanka. The Thailand International Development Cooperation Agency (TICA) has prepared a five year Development Cooperation Programme in collaboration with the Government of Sri Lanka, to provide scholarships and training programmes in the areas of Agriculture, Food Technology, Rural Development and Sufficiency Economy, Tourism Management and Diplomatic Training to Sri Lanka, during the period of 2015-2019.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasingh, in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding with the Government of Thailand, to promote Technical Cooperation Programmes between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Moratuwa, Lunawa Urban Housing Project
decision_details: - the contract for the construction of above low income housing scheme consisting of 356 housing units at Lunawa situated in the coastal belt of Moratuwa has been awarded to the State Engineering Corporation.   The proposal made  by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities,  to increase the cost estimate of the project due to additional items of work included, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Moratuwa, Angulana Multi-storey Housing Scheme - First Phase and Second Phase
decision_details: - construction work of 135 housing units under the First Phase  and 153 housing units under the Second Phase of the above Multi-storied Housing Project has been completed by the Urban Settlement Development Authority to resettle the families displaced due to sea erosion and low income urban community residing within the limits of the Moratuwa Municipal Council Area.  Construction work of the First and Second Phases of the Project has been awarded to the State Engineering Corporation.  The proposals made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities,  to increase the two cost estimates of the two projects due to additional items of work included, were approved by the Cabinet.

title: Threat of Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza
decision_details: - Hon. Arumugan Thondaman, Minister of Livestock and Rural Community Development, brought to the notice of the Cabinet the prevalence of Avian Influenza (Bird Flu) in the villages of Chennithala, Aalapuzha and Kerala in South India, as reported to him.  The proposal made by the Minister to take preventive measures for its entry into Sri Lanka, specially with the importation of poultry products during this festive season, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme to strengthen Small and Medium Scale Millers and Stockists
Increase of the Monthly Allowance paid to Trainees of Traditional Handicrafts Sector under the National Crafts Council
decision_details: - the National Crafts Council has undertaken many craft training programmes to strengthen the skills and capacity of the craftsmen and provides training in the 20 craft clusters of handicrafts industry at rural level through the Master Craftsman Training Programme since 1985 and in addition, through the Handicraft Training Centres since 2009.  Handicrafts which is a traditional national heritage, provides a formidable platform to showcase the culture of our country to the world.  The proposal made by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development, to increase the monthly allowance of Rs.500/- paid to trainees undergoing training in the handicrafts field under the National Crafts Council, to Rs.1,000/- was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the proposed Sri Lanka State Audit Service as a Special Service independent of other Services
decision_details: - the functions of the Auditor General are specified in terms of Article 154 of the Constitution wherein he is required to carry out annual audit of financial statements relating to the Ministries, Departments, State Corporations, Provincial Councils, Local Authorities and Foreign funded Projects and report the position to Parliament.  The Sri Lanka Audit Service and Audit Examiners' Service assist the Auditor General in the performance and discharge of the statutory duties and functions entrusted to him.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, to proceed with the activities relating to the establishment of the proposed Sri Lanka State Audit Service as a special service, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of SAARC Cultural Centre in Navimana, Matara
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. T.B. Ekanayake, Minister of Culture and the Arts, to proceed with the activities relating to the above construction work, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Head Office Building for the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka intends to construct a new building in a block of land in close proximity to the Bandaranaike International Airport for its Head Office. The proposal made by Hon. Piyankara Jayaratne, Minister of Civil Aviation, to award the above tender as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Clean Energy & Network Efficiency Improvement Project - Package 1 - Lot B : Mannar Transmission Infrastructure - Lot - B : Construction of New Anuradhapura to Vavuniya 55 km, Double Circuit, 2xZebra, 132kV Transmission Line and Vavuniya to Mannar 70 km, Double Circuit, Single Zebra, 132 kV Transmission Line (Designed for 220kV operation)
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to award the contract for package 1 as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Augmentation of 132/33kV Grid Substation at Kiribathkumbura
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Kandy City Waste Water Management Project - Award of Contract for Design & Construction of Waste Water Treatment Plant, Main Pump House, Treated Effluent Disposal System and Supply of Operation & Maintenance Equipment
decision_details: - the objective of this project is to prevent pollution of the Kandy City water sources, Mahaweli River and the Kandy Lake by collecting and treating domestic and industrial waste water with treatment facility.  This project is to be implemented under four contract packages and this is contract package (1).   The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Flyover Across the Railway Crossing at Maho Junction
decision_details: - Nikaweratiya - Moragollagama - Siyambalangamuwa Road (B 326) crosses the Main Railway Line leading to Northern, North Central and Eastern Provinces at Maho town. Long delays to the movement of traffic on the above road are experienced due to frequent gate closures and congestion in the Maho town area. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for the purpose as recommended by the Procurement Appeal Board (PAB), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Building for the Attorney General’s Department
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, to have the construction of the new building of the Attorney General's Department carried out in two stages, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Tea Promotion Unit in the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing, China
decision_details: - the domestic consumption of black tea is increasing in China and the current import of black tea is around 15 million kg and it is estimated that it will reach 100 million kg by the year 2020.  Sri Lanka is the largest supplier of black tea to China and shares 27% of the market.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, Minister of Plantation Industries, to set up a Tea Promotion Unit at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing, China and to proceed with the related activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Holding the event of ‘CEYLON TEA EXPO 2015’ in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the Ministry of Plantation Industries in association with the Sri Lanka Tea Board is planning to organize the first ever 'Ceylon Tea Expo 2015' exhibition and a conference from 6th to 8th November 2015 at the BMICH, Colombo. This event envisages to attract international buyers, Super Market Chains, Wholesalers, Value Chain Developers, Institutions, Associations, etc. This event will also generate revenue to the country while giving adequate publicity for Ceylon Tea  throughout the World. The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, Minister of Plantation Industries, to proceed with the related activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increase of the Monthly Allowance for Food and Service Facilities of  Student Teachers in  National Colleges of Education
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education to increase the monthly allowance paid to a scholar during the academic training period by Rs.1,000/- making it Rs.3,500/- per month and during the in-service training period by Rs.1,000/-, making it Rs.4,000/- per month, in keeping with the Budget proposals for the year 2015, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: SAARC Framework Agreement for Energy Cooperation (Electricity)
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to ratify the above Agreement which has already been signed at the 18th SAARC Summit held in Kathmandu, Nepal, with the minor amendments proposed by the Government of Pakistan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Dairy Processing Plant at Badalgama
decision_details: - Milco Private Limited (Milco) which is a public enterprise engaged in milk processing industry has four main processing factories at Narahenpita, Digana, Ambewela and Polonnaruwa.  Milco factory at Narahenpita which is located in a highly urbanized area has been proposed to be relocated at Badalgama in the Gampaha District. It is proposed to establish a dairy processing plant together with all necessary infrastructure and amenities, to produce pasteurized milk, yoghurt, ice cream, butter, cheese etc. in the new factory at Badalgama.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the activities relating to funding arrangements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting of Dual Citizenship
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to adopt the proposed new Administrative Procedure for granting of dual citizenship, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of houses to resettle the affected families due to the Landslide Disaster which occurred at Meeriyabedda, Koslanda on 29.10.2014
decision_details: - an extent of approximately 02 acres of land in Malvern Division of Ampitikanda / Koslanda Estate owned by the Maskeliya Plantation Company has been allocated to construct houses for the 75 families affected due to the Landslide which occurred at Meeriyabedda, Koslanda on 29.10.2014 and the National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has recommended that the said land is suitable for the construction of houses.  The construction work will be carried out by the Urban Development Authority and the foundation laying ceremony initiating construction work is scheduled to be held on 2014?12?18.  The above information was provided to the Cabinet jointly by Hon. Arumugan Thodaman, Minister of Livestock and Rural Community Development and Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, Minister of Plantation Industries.

title: Construction of a Permanent Building and an Access Roadway for the Office of the Public Service Commission
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, to award the contract for the construction of a permanent building for the office of the Public Service Commission, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Training Centre to be constructed at Kotawilawatta, Matara in parallel to the 'Deyata Kirula' National Exhibition
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Chandrasiri Gajadeera, Minister of Rehabilitation and Prison Reforms, to construct the above training centre to be utilized as the training school for the officers of the Department of Prisons, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Fertilizer Procurement - Maha Season 2014/15
decision_details: -  supply of fertilizer under the subsidy scheme is handled by the Ceylon Fertilizer Company Limited (CFC) and Colombo Commercial Fertilizer Limited (CCF) which fall under the purview of the Ministry of Agriculture. The proposals made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, to award the contracts for the procurement of fertilizer for the Maha Season 2014/15 as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) at its meeting held on 2014?09?24, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Lakshman Kadirgamar Institute for International  Relations and Strategic Studies (LKIIRSS), Colombo and the China Institute for Contemporary International Relations (CICIR), Beijing
decision_details: - the Lakshman Kadirgamar Institute for International  Relations and Strategic Studies is a multi - disciplinary research forum dedicated to analyzing Sri Lanka's strategic interests in the realm of international relations, within the contemporary domestic and global contexts.  This institute functions as a forum for the generation of research and analysis, with a view to providing inputs to national policy formulation. The proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to enter into the above Memorandum of Understanding between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Clean Energy & Network Efficiency Improvement Project - Package 3 - 220 kv Transmission Infrastructure Project - Lot-A: Construction of New Grid Substations at Polpitiya and Padukka and Augmentation of Existing 220/132/33 kv Grid Substation at Pannipitiya
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the term of office of the National Delimitation Committee on Demarcation of Wards for Local Authorities
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. A.L.M. Athaullah, Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils, to extend the term of office of the National Delimitation Committee on Demarcation of Wards  of Local Authorities from 2014?12?31 to 2015?03?10, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding Contract for Remedial works of Victoria Dam
decision_details: - the Government has received a loan from the International Development Association (IDA) of the World Bank towards the cost of Dam Safety and Water Resources Planning Project. The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala De Silva, Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to apply a part of the funds for remedial works of the Victoria Dam and to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Major Bridges Construction Project of the National Road Network funded by Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA)
decision_details: - the Government of Sri Lanka has received a loan of JY 12,381 million from the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) towards the cost of the Major Bridges Construction Project of the National Road Network.  Thirty seven (37) bridges which are narrow or in weak condition on the National Highway Network in the Western, Southern, North Western, Northern and Sabaragamuwa Provinces have been identified for this project. The Contract Package 01 includes 10 bridges. The proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for the Contract Package 01 as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Priority Water Supply Projects with funding secured from Local Banks - Award of contract for Uragasmanhandiya,  Gonapinuwala, Dikkumbura and Weligama Water Supply Projects
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted to the proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC). The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the activities relating to the funding arrangements for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Road Improvement Project
decision_details: - the objectives of this  project are the rehabilitation of the road section between Hatton and Nuwara Eliya to improve the accessibility to the people living in the area,  eliminate traffic congestion and enhance road safety.  The project includes widening and improvement of 35.6 km long Hatton-Nuwara Eliya Road with 2 lane facility. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the activities relating to the funding arrangements for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Outer Circular Highway Project Phase III
decision_details: - the Outer Circular Highway with a total length of 29.22 km  starts from Kottawa and traverses through Kaduwela, Kadawatha and ends up at Kerawalapitiya. It will radiate from the city of Colombo and link Southern Expressway, Colombo -  Katunayake Expressway, Northern Expressway and other major National Highways. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the activities relating to the funding arrangements for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Medirigiriya Water Supply Project with Funding Secured from Local Banks with a Treasury Guarantee
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the activities relating to the funding arrangements for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.  This project is scheduled to be completed in 2016.

title: Implementation of 22 Water Supply Projects with funding secured from Local Banks for the Enhancement of Pipe Borne Water Supply Service coverage by the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) on Priority Basis
decision_details: - the Ministry of Water Supply and Drainage has drawn up an accelerated programme for the implementation of 22 water supply projects with local bank financing, covering all Provinces of the country and it is expected to provide safe drinking water to a population of 150,000 by March 2015. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the activities relating to the funding arrangements for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Head Office Building for the Excise Department of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the  Minister of Finance and Planning, to award the contract for the construction of the Head Office Building for the Excise Department of Sri Lanka at Rajagiriya, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Gazette Notification issued under the Import and Export Control Act, No.1 of 1969 to Parliament to meet the Legal Requirement
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the  Minister of Finance and Planning, to submit the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.1889/15 dated 2014?11?18 relating to rescinding of the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.1883/16 dated 2014?10?10 on suspension of the importation of potatoes, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Building for Mullaithivu Police Station
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Law and Order, to construct a new building for the Mullaithivu Police Station at a cost of Rs.209 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a two storied building for Dining Hall and a Multi Purpose Student Centre under the Relocation of the Buddhasravaka Bhikhu University of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to construct a two storied building to be used as a Dining Hall at a cost of Rs.171.6 million and a Multi Purpose Student Centre at a cost of Rs.76.4 million and to proceed with the related activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply and Installation of 10 Nos. Solar Universal Pumps and Drinking Water Treatment Plants
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, for the Supply and Installation of 10 Nos. Solar Universal Pumps and Drinking Water Treatment Plants, with the view to providing safe drinking water to the people living in areas where  the chronic kidney disease prevails, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Five Storied Office Building at the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWS&DB) Head Office Premises, Ratmalana
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to construct a Five Storied Office Building at Ratmalana for the National Water Supply and Drainage Board and to proceed with the related activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reduction of Landslide Risk of Vulnerable Communities
decision_details: - the Government has already allocated necessary financial provision in the 2015 Budget for the construction of 50,000 houses for the community living in estate related areas including the families facing landslide risks.  Under this programme, action is being taken jointly by the Urban Development Authority and the Ministry of Livestock and Rural Community Development, on priority basis, through the Plantation Human Development Trust, for the construction of houses for the estates identified as high risk zones by the National Building Research Organization (NBRO), including the estate which was subjected to the recent landslide disaster.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, Minister of Disaster Management, to proceed with the activities relating to the identification of areas which are vulnerable to landslide disasters through suitable technical methodologies and taking measures to minimize landslide risks, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Meeriyabedda Landslide - Financial assistance for funeral expenses to the  Next?of?Kin of deceased persons and, to meet medical expenses of those who were injured
decision_details:
- the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, Minister of Disaster Management, to provide relief to the victims of the above disaster as follows, was approved by the Cabinet: 

*	payment of Rs.100,000/- each on behalf of the 12 persons who had died and 20 persons who had disappeared due to the above disaster, after proper identification of the eligible recipients;



*	payment upto a maximum of Rs.50,000/- each to the five persons who were injured, taking into consideration the nature of their injuries and Rs.10,000/- to be paid as an initial installment; and

*	payment of Rs.25,000/- each to the widow / widower or the next-of-kin of the deceased persons as funeral expenses.

title: Awarding the Bachelor of Education Degree to prospective Teachers of National Colleges of Education
decision_details: - there are 19 Colleges of Education functioning at present and the annual intake for training in these colleges is around 3000 students. The proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to extend the period of study of the students in a College of Education by one more year, making the total period as four years commencing from the 2014 student intake and grant them the Bachelor of Education Degree after successful completion of the course of study, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to Employees’ Provident Fund Act, No.15 of 1958 - Introduction of Provisions on Payment of Dividend to Members and Enhancement of Employers’ Contribution
decision_details: - the Central Bank of Sri Lanka manages the Employees’ Provident Fund which has an asset base of Rs.1 trillion and the bank in recent years has invested about 10% of its assets in income earning commercial assets which has gained capital appreciation of around Rs.10 billion this year.  It is intended to distribute dividends to members of the Provident Fund who have active accounts of over ten years,  and also to increase the employer contribution  to the fund by 2% making it 14% by the employer so that each employee will have 22% saving from their salaries, in keeping with the Budget proposals for the year 2015. The proposal made by Hon. Gamini Lokuge, Minister of Labour and Labour Relations,  to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation to the Employees’ Provident Fund Act, No.15 of 1958 accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Post Office Security Fund
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Jeewan Kumaranathunga, Minister of Postal Services, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation to amend the Post Office Security Fund Ordinance to meet the present day needs, was  approved by the Cabinet.

title: Fertilizer Procurement - Maha Season 2014/15
decision_details: -  supply of fertilizer under the subsidy scheme is handled by the Ceylon Fertilizer Company Limited (CFC) and Colombo Commercial Fertilizer Limited (CCF) which fall under the purview of the Ministry of Agriculture. The proposals made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, to award the contracts for the procurement of fertilizer for the Maha Season 2014/15 as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) at its meetings held on 2014?08?29 and 2014?09?03, were approved by the Cabinet.

title: Infrastructure Development of Sri Lanka Institute of Advanced Technological Education
decision_details:
- the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to enhance the facilities at the following  Advanced Technological Institutes, to cater to the needs of the students who pass the G.C.E. (A/L) Examination but fail to gain admission to the Universities, was approved by the Cabinet: 

*	construction of a four storied building complex at the Advanced Technological Institute, Dehiwala; 

*	construction of a four storied building complex at the Advanced Technological Institute, Kegalle; and

*	construction of a four storied building complex at the Advanced Technological Institute, Jaffna.

title: Construction of Rice Trade Stalls affiliated to the Marandagahamula Rice Stores Complex
decision_details: - rice marketing activities have been in operation for over  two decades in and around the city of Marandagahamula in the Divulapitiya Divisional Secretariat Division in the Gampaha District and it has since been expanded to be the biggest rice marketing centre in the Western Province.   A Rice Stores Complex has already been constructed at Wewegodellawatte, Marandagahamula at a cost of Rs.372.18 million.  It has been found necessary to construct 115 new rice stalls at a cost of Rs.115 million adjoining the Rice Stores Complex.  The proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minister of Economic Development, to entrust the construction work to the State Engineering Corporation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the New Court Complex at Batticaloa (Phase II)
decision_details: - the  proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, Minister of Justice, to construct the new Court Complex at Batticaloa and to award the relevant contract to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Priority Water Supply Projects with funding secured from Local Banks - Award of Contract for the Towns East of Colombo District WSP Package II
decision_details: - this project includes the construction of 18,000 m3 capacity Ground Reservoir, supply and laying of 08 km length of transmission pipeline and 10 km length of distribution pipeline from Iridapola junction to Pitumpe along Waga Road.  This distribution line covers a part of four Grama Niladhari Divisions, mainly Waga West, Pinnawala South, Uggalla and Pitumpe North in the Padukka Divisional Secretariat Area.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of  Priority Water Supply Projects with funding secured from Local Banks - Award of Contract for the Laggala New Town Water Supply Project
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of Six identified Roads
Award of Contract for the Construction of Flyovers at Rajagiriya, Polgahawela and Ganemulla
decision_details: - The Road Development Authority (RDA) has identified the need to construct flyovers at Rajagiriya, Polgahawela and Ganemulla. A flyover at Rajagiriya is required to be constructed urgently to ease traffic congestion, minimize accidents and to reduce high vehicle operating costs.  Flyovers at Ganemulla and Polgahawela are especially required to avoid long delays that are being experienced  by road users due to frequent closure of railway gates at the level crossings. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for the construction of the three flyovers referred to above, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the Reconstruction of 25 Bridges funded by Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development (KFAED) - Award of Civil Works Contract for Contract Package 01
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka has received a loan amounting to 10 million Kuwaiti Dinars from Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development (KFAED) towards the cost of the project for the reconstruction of 25 bridges. 25 bridges which are narrow or in weak condition on the National Highway Network in Western, Southern, Eastern, Central, Sabaragumuwa and Northern Provinces  have been identified for reconstruction under this project. The project has been divided into 03 Contract Packages and the Contract Package 01 includes 08 bridges. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for the Contract Package 01 as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Northern Expressway Project - Award of Contracts for Consultancy Services for Construction Supervision of Contract Packages No.02 to 08
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to award the contracts for providing consultancy services for construction supervision for Contract Packages 02 to 08, for the construction of the portion of the Northern Expressway from Veyangoda to Galewela and the portion of the Link Expressway from Pothuhera to Galagedara, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultants Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Redevelopment of Tower Hill Area at Hambantota
decision_details: - according to the Zoning Plan of the Greater Hambantota Master Plan prepared by the Urban Development Authority, the 'Tower Hill Area' falls within the Coastal Tourism Zone.  Redevelopment of this area will comprise mainly of designing tourism related premises such as Museums, Exhibition Halls, Information Centres, Rest Houses etc.  and the identified archeological monuments will be rehabilitated and preserved.  The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Investment Promotion, to provide ten blocks of identified land for the purpose and to proceed with the activities relating to the allocation of blocks of land, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and People’s Republic of China on Co-operation in Plant Inspection and Quarantine
decision_details: - this Memorandum of Understanding envisages protecting production of agriculture and forestry and promoting the trade of plant production through preventing the entry and spread of pest of plants into Sri Lanka and China from other countries.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture to sign the above Memorandum of Understanding, between Sri Lanka and China, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Co-operation in Agriculture and related fields between the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries of Japan and the Ministry of Agriculture of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, for signing of the above Memorandum of Co-operation between Sri Lanka and Japan, subject to the laws and regulations of the respective countries, to promote scientific, technical and economic cooperation in the field of agriculture, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Prevention of Crimes Ordinance
decision_details: - Since the enactment of this Ordinance, many new laws have been introduced by Parliament, providing for the regularizing and control of certain criminal activities which also resulted in the introduction of new offences in order to combat the commission of such crimes. A need therefore has now arisen to enable those accused of committing some of the offences introduced by these laws, also to be fingerprinted. The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, Minister of Justice, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Dutugemunu Pilgrims Rest established at Lumbini City, Nepal
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. D.M. Jayaratne, Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs for the allocation of financial provisions of Rs.20.72 million by the General Treasury for the purchase of furniture and equipment to the Dutugemunu Pilgrims Rest at Lumbini City, Nepal for the use of visiting pilgrims, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and Republic of Korea on Recognition of Certificates issued to Seafarers
decision_details: - The International Convention on Standards of Training, Certification and Watch-keeping (STWC) 1978 has made it mandatory for a seafarer holding maritime certificates issued to him by the maritime administration of his country to obtain a similar Certificate of Recognition from the country concerned to serve on ships flying its flag. The Merchant Shipping Act, No.52 of 1971 also highlights the compliance with this requirement.  Sri Lanka has already entered into Agreements with 28 countries whereby a large number of Sri Lankan seafarers are provided with opportunities to serve on foreign vessels.  The Republic of Korea has expressed its willingness to enter into a Bilateral Agreement regarding the issuance of the said certificates which will enable Sri Lankan seafarers to serve on ships flying the Korean flag and Korean seafarers to serve on ships registered under the Sri Lankan flag.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping to sign the above Memorandum of Understanding between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the Southern Expressway Section 1 (Matara to Beliatta) Project
decision_details: - the Southern Expressway which has a total length of 227 km traverses from Kottawa to Hambantota through Galle and Matara.  It will link major economic centres such as Hambantota Sea Port and Mattala Mahinda Rajapaksa International Airport in the Southern Province with the Colombo city and the Northern part of the country through the Outer Circular Highway, Colombo - Katunayake Expressway and the proposed Northern Expressway. The Southern Expressway Extension from Matara to Hambantota with a total length of 96 km consists of four main sections namely, Section 1 (from Matara to Beliatta - 30 km), Section 2 (from Beliatta to Wetiya - 26 km), Section 3 (from Wetiya to Andarawewa - 15 km) and Section 4 (from Mattala to Hambantota via Andarawewa - 25 km).  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the activities relating to the loan arrangement for the construction of Section 1 from Matara to Beliatta - 30 km, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a South Asian Centre for Judicial Capacity Building in Environmental Rule of Law
decision_details:
- the Chief Justices and Senior Judges of the South Asian countries (Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka) have gratefully accepted the offer made by H.E. the President at the inaugural session of the South Asian Chief Justices Roundtable on Environmental Justice and Sustainable Green Development, held in Colombo from 7th to 9th August 2014, to provide  start-up funds and institutional support for the creation of a small but efficient Unit within the office of the Hon. Chief Justice of Sri Lanka, to initiate and coordinate appropriate activities for strengthening judicial capacity in the South Asian countries in the area of environmental  rule of law and sustainable green development. 

	The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) and the Asian Development Bank  (ADB) have both indicated their support for this initiative. This programme will make Sri Lanka the Centre of Excellence in the Judicial Capacity Building in legal matters relating to Environment and Sustainable Development and the Centre will work closely with UNEP, ADB, United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), the World Bank and other organizations to collectively develop and implement judicial training programmes in the region.  

	The proposal made by H.E. the President, to proceed with the activities relating to the establishment of a South Asian Centre for Judicial Capacity Building in Environmental Rule of Law, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the Construction of a New Bridge Over Kelani River - Procurement of Consulting Services
decision_details: - the Government of Sri Lanka has received a loan of JP Y35,020 mn. from the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) towards the cost of the above project.  The objective of the above project is to improve the traffic situation around the existing new Kelani Bridge.  The project includes the construction of another new Bridge over the Kelani River, Port Access Road and Interchanges at Orugodawatte, Ingurukade and Kelanitissa Junctions including improvements to roads at Orugodawatte and Kelanitissa.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for providing consultancy services for the project as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultants Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of buildings for Kandakadu Treatment and Rehabilitation Center
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Chandrasiri Gajadeera, Minister of Rehabilitation and Prison Reforms, to construct necessary buildings for the establishment of a separate centre for the rehabilitation of drug addicted persons to be useful citizens through counseling, religious and aesthetic activities, educational activities, vocational training and sports, and to entrust the project to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Southern Expressway Extension Project - Award of Contract for providing Consultancy Services for Construction Supervision
decision_details: - the Southern Expressway from Kottawa to Godagama is presently in operation and the commercial agreements for the civil works of the extension of the expressway from Godagama to Mattala with a link from Andarawewa to Hambantota consisting of four separate sections have been signed.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping to award the above contract as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultants Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Police Ordinance No.16 of 1865
decision_details: - Sri Lanka Police Force had been established in keeping with the provisions of the Police Ordinance No. 16 of 1865 and the population of Sri Lanka at that time had been 2.5 million.  The population of Sri Lanka now is nearly 21 million and the strength of the Police Force is nearly 84,000.  It has been found necessary to amend the Police Ordinance in keeping with the present day needs of the country.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Law and Order, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding  on Cooperation between the Ministry of Culture and the Arts of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri  Lanka and the State Administration of Press, Publication, Radio, Film and Television  of  the  People's  Republic  of China
decision_details: - the  proposal made by Hon. T.B. Ekanayake, Minister of Culture and the Arts, for signing of the above Memorandum of Understanding, for the enrichment and enhancement of the cultural cooperation between Sri Lanka and China, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bilateral Air Services Consultations between Sri Lanka and Poland
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Piyankara Jayaratne, Minister of Civil Aviation, to sign the above Air Services Agreement by an accredited representative of Sri Lanka and thereafter to take appropriate measures for its entry into force, was approved the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the MoU signed in respect of Youth Development between the National Youth Services Council and the Beijing Foreign Studies University in China
decision_details:
- the proposal made by Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to implement the activities relating to the above MoU which has been signed between the two countries which mainly cover the following, was approved by the Cabinet: 

*	providing education on Chinese Language to the Sri Lankan students; and

*	providing education on Sinhala Language to the students of China and establishing a Tamil Language Academic Division in the Beijing Foreign Studies University in China.

title: Establishing Offices and Official Quarters for the Forest Conservation Department in the Northern and Eastern Provinces
decision_details: - the extent of the forest land located in the Northern and Eastern Provinces of the overall forest cover in Sri Lanka is 41% and due to the conflict situation which prevailed in the past, field activities of the Forest Conservation Department in these Provinces had remained totally defunct.  The proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Environment and Renewable Energy, to proceed with the activities relating to the construction of 04 District Forest Offices in these two Provinces, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Visit of His Excellency the President to New York, USA, for the UN Climate Summit and the 69th Session of the United Nations General Assembly - September 2014
decision_details: - H.E. the President, led the Sri Lanka delegation to the UN Climate Summit 2014 and the High?Level Segment of the 69th Session of the United Nations General Assembly which were held in New York from 22nd to 27th September 2014.  The aim of the Summit which was attended by a number of world leaders including 100 Heads of State and Government and over 800 leaders from business, finance and civil society, was to raise political momentum for a meaningful universal climate agreement in Paris in 2015 and to galvanize transformative action in all countries to reduce emissions and built resilience to the adverse impacts of climate change.  Addressing the Climate Summit, H.E. the President had elaborated on the steps taken by the Government to address Climate Change and emphasized that although Sri Lanka was able to triple its per capita income within the last eight years, its per capita carbon emission is still less than 1 metric ton.  H.E. the President has had several discussions with the participants of other countries, during these meetings, and has highlighted the continuing progress made by Sri Lanka in addressing post conflict issues, emerging opportunities for trade and investment in the present economic resurgence, Sri Lanka's continuous engagement with the UN system and matters relating to Human Rights Council.  Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, who accompanied H.E. the President and provided the above information to the Cabinet, also has had fruitful discussions with the Foreign Ministers of other countries who participated at these meetings.

title: Amendment to Sri Lanka Buddhist and Pali University Act, No.37 of 1995
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation to amend the above Act to meet the present day needs of the country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bilateral Agreement between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the United Arab Emirates
decision_details: - the Treaty on Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters provides for improving the effectiveness of law enforcement of both parties in the investigation, prosecution and prevention of crime and confiscation of criminal proceeds.  The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, Minister of Justice, to submit the above Agreement to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transfer of one (01) acre of the land belonging to Sri Lanka Ports Authority at Lotus Road to the Police Department
decision_details: - the Urban Development Authority has identified the land area belonging to Sri Lanka Ports Authority at Lotus Road as the suitable area for the relocation of the Fort Police Station.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to allocate one (01) acre of identified land belonging to Sri Lanka Ports Authority at Lotus Road to the Police Department for the construction of the Fort Police Station, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Colombo National Highways Project funded by the OPEC Fund for International Development  (OFID) - Award of Contract for providing Consultancy Services for Construction Supervision
decision_details: - the Government has received a loan of US$ 50 Million from the OPEC Fund for International Development  (OFID) towards the cost of Colombo National Highways Project for upgrading 65.45 km of key highways and for the reconstruction of Bridge No. 2/1 on Narahenpita - Nawala - Nugegoda Road. The proposal made by  H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for providing consultancy services for the construction supervision of civil works under the above project as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultants Procurement Committee (CPCC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Northern Expressway Project - Award of Contract Packages 02 to 06 to Local Contractors
Obtaining 50,000 MT of Rice from the Government of Bangladesh to ensure Food Security
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to purchase 50,000 MT of rice from Bangaladesh, on Government to Government basis through Lanka Sathosa Ltd., to be sold at an affordable price to the consumers, to meet the demand during the forthcoming festive season, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Kokilai Bridge and Approaches across Kokilai Lagoon on Mullaitivu - Kokilai - Pulmudai Road
decision_details: - development of the road network which is currently underway connecting 38,000 villages will enable better access to nearly 80% of the population living in rural areas. The Mullaitivu - Kokilai - Pulmudai Road has been identified as a priority road for development with the view to providing continuous land connectivity on the coastal belt between the Eastern Province and the Northern Province. It is proposed to construct a bridge across the Kokilai Lagoon which will greatly reduce the distance between Mullaitivu and Pulmudai by about 100 km. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the activities relating to loan arrangements for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Participation at the International Monetary Fund/World Bank Annual Meetings - 2014,  held in Washington DC from 7th  to 12th  October 2014
decision_details: - a delegation led by Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, Minister (Senior) for International Monetary Co-operation and Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning, including a team of Senior Officials from the General Treasury and the Central Bank of Sri Lanka had represented Sri Lanka at the above Annual Meetings. The meetings had highlighted global economic outlook which focuses on emerging economic, political and social issues related to advance economies, emerging markets and developing countries. The delegation has had fruitful discussions with the delegates of other countries who had participated at the above meetings. The above information was provided to the Cabinet by Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, Minister (Senior) for International Monetary Co-operation and Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning.

title: Rehabilitation of Rail track from Anuradhapura to Omantai under the Indian Line of Credit
decision_details: - subsequent to the commencement of the reconstruction of the Northern railway line and Talaimannar railway line, the  construction works in sections of track from Omantai to Pallai and from Medawachchiya to  Madhu Road have been completed at present and the balance sections up to Kankesanthurai and Talaimannar are scheduled to be completed by the end of  this year. On completion of the above, trains could be operated at a maximum speed of 100 kmph between Kankesanthurai and Omantai; and Talaimannar and Medawachchiya sections. It is proposed to rehabilitate the railway track, 62 km in length between Anuradhapura and Omantai with the balance funds available under the above Line of Credit. The proposal made by Hon. Kumara Welgama, Minister of Transport, for the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) assisted by a Technical Evaluation Committee (TEC), to evaluate the technical/financial proposal submitted by the Indian company,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Clean Energy & Network Efficiency Improvement Project - Project 2: 132kV Transmission Infrastructure - Lot - C: Procurement of Plant - Lot C-1 : From Thulhiriya to Kegalle - 22.5 km, Single Zebra, from Polpitiya to New Polpitiya - 1.5 km, Twin Zebra, from Athurugiriya to Padukka - 10 km, Twin Zebra  - Lot C-2 : From Athurugiriya to Kolonnawa 15 km
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to award the above contract as recommended by Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Priority Water Supply Projects with funding secured from Local Banks
decision_details:
- at present pipe borne drinking water supply coverage in the Island is 44%. The Government intends to enhance the pipe borne water supply coverage up to 60% by the year 2020 and it is proposed to engage local contractors with local bank financing for the purpose. Cabinet approval has already been granted for the investment of Rs. 29.1 billion for 30 water supply projects and a further Rs.10.095 billion for 04 additional water supply projects.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the contracts for the following water supply projects as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet: 

		*	Medirigiriya Water Supply Project - Phase II; and 

		*	Ettampitiya Water Supply Project.

title: Kundasale - Haragama Water Supply Project
decision_details: - this Water Supply Project has been proposed to address the severe shortage in drinking water faced by the domestic and the commercial consumers in the rapidly developing and expanding areas falling under the proposed Water Supply Project. The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Culture and the Arts of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Chinese Academy of Sciences of the People's Republic of China
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. T.B. Ekanayake, Minister of Culture and the Arts, for signing of the above Memorandum of Understanding concerning the joint project in search for wreckage of Zheng He's Fleets off the coast of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Building Complex owned by the Teachers’ College, Maharagama for the Establishment of the New College of Education on Business Studies and Entrepreneurship Studies
decision_details: - with the view to commencing scheduled teaching activities at this Institution as early as possible and for the  optimum utilization of the premises, the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to entrust the renovation activities of the buildings, to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Future Programme for the Expansion of the National Grid towards Wind Power and Solar Power Electricity Generation for the Optimum use of Traditional Renewable Energy
decision_details: - Small Scale Power Generation Sector through renewable energy sources has contributed effectively to the generation of electricity in the country and, to reach the target of 20% of the power supply by the year 2020 through renewable power generation, wind power, solar power and biomass sources will have to be utilized and it will be necessary to accelerate the development activities associated with it.  The joint proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Environment and Renewable Energy and Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to appoint an Officials' Committee to be chaired jointly by the Secretaries of the two Ministries and comprising of relevant officials, to submit recommendations for the achievement of the goals with regard to renewable energy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding for the Collaboration between the Ministry of External Affairs of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Co?operation of the Kingdom of Spain
decision_details: - the proposed areas for co-operation under this Memorandum of Understanding include combating terrorism and transnational organized crime, water, sanitation and hygiene, renewable energy, agricultural and environmental policies, sustainable tourism, educational and cultural exchanges, cooperation in institution building as well as multilateral cooperation within the Framework of the United Nations. The proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to take appropriate action for the entry into force of the above Memorandum of Understanding signed between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchasing of  Euro - Lanka Hostel Building
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to purchase the land in extent of 74.5 perches and the building situated at G.H. Perera Mawatha, Boralesgamuwa, at a price valued by the Chief Government Valuer, to be developed to provide accommodation for about 1200 students of the University of Sri Jayawardenapura, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi?Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation Free Trade Area (BIMSTEC FTA)
decision_details: - BIMSTEC comprises of Bangladesh, India, Sri Lanka, Thailand, Myanmar, Nepal and Bhutan and the main objective of this regional grouping is to foster socio?economic progress of the member countries by promoting co-operation in eight priority sectors, namely, Trade and Investment, Technology, Transportation and Communication, Tourism, Fisheries, Energy, Agriculture and Human Resources Development. It provides a unique link between South Asia and Southeast Asia. The proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, Minister of Industry and Commerce, to confirm the Negative List of Sri Lanka under BIMSTEC FTA, which has been prepared in consultation with the relevant state sector authorities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rural Development Initiatives of the Ministry of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development
decision_details:
- the proposal made by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development, to proceed with the activities pertaining to the following, was approved by the Cabinet:

*	Rehabilitation and reactivation of the Elephant Pass Saltern - in 2014 the Ministry of Economic Development has provided Rs.100 mn. under the "Uthuru Wasanthaya" Programme to rehabilitate and reactivate 330 acres of Saltern as Phase I to achieve an estimated salt production of 20,000 MT per annum and development work to rehabilitate infrastructure such as sea water reservoir, evaporation pans, crystallization pans and salt platforms are currently being undertaken.  In 2015 it has been planned to  rehabilitate and reactivate an additional 447 acres as Phase II to produce a further 25,000 to 30,000 MT of salt per annum.  The estimated cost of Phase II to be initiated in 2015 is Rs.125 mn.; and 

*	Strengthening the Fishnet Factories in Weerawila and Lunuwila to support and strengthen fish production - currently the Weerawila Fishnet Factory has a production capacity of 120 MT per annum and Lunuwila Factory has a capacity of 180 MT per annum.  It is proposed to modernize these two factories at a cost of Rs.99.5 mn. in 2015.

title: Implementation of the Integrated Timetables
decision_details: - Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB|) and the private operators daily operate around 4,314 and 17,129 buses respectively to cater to six million passengers island-wide.  Non-operation of these buses on integrated timetable has caused immense difficulties to passengers. The proposal made by Hon. A.H.M. Fawzie, Minister (Senior) for Urban Affairs and the Chairman of the Cabinet Sub-Committee appointed for the purpose, to implement integrated timetables with a ratio of 60% - 40% between Private and SLTB buses respectively, in order to avoid unhealthy competition between SLTB and the private operators and to provide a better transport service to the public, with effect from 2014?01?15, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of Equipment for Mahindodaya Technological Laboratories under the Programme of Redesigning of 1000 Secondary Schools
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to purchase 6,600 computers with all accessories, 400 printers, 100 scanners and 85 laptop computers for 100 Mahindodaya Technological Laboratories, as per the recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) and the Technical Evaluation Committee (TEC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: China Aided Superior Court Complex Maintenance Project
decision_details: - the Chinese Government has agreed to undertake a project to repair and refurbish the Superior Court Complex under Chinese Aid.  The proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, Minister of Justice, to exempt the items needed for the project from the relevant taxes and levy, after the project is approved as a special project under relevant Acts, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of 92 RON Gasoline in place of 90 RON Gasoline to the Local Market
decision_details: - pursuance to an analysis conducted with regard to specifications of the appropriate gasoline grade to be marketed in Sri Lanka, the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has recommended the 92 RON gasoline which has many advantages compared to 90 RON gasoline presently used.  The proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, Minister of Petroleum Industries, to introduce 92 RON gasoline to the local market with effect from 2014?01?01, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Closing of Mahaweli Tunnel at Polgolla and New Laxapana Power Tunnel for Safety Checking
decision_details: - Polgolla tunnel and intake, one of the key trans-basin conveyances of Mahaweli System was commissioned in 1976 to divert Mahaweli water to the North Central Province.  This tunnel has been last inspected in 1986 and has been in operation for more than 20 years without any inspection.  Similarly, new Laxapana Power Tunnel has not been inspected since its commission in 1975.  Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, informed the Cabinet that his Ministry has taken action to close Polgolla and New Laxapana Tunnel temporarily for two weeks during the month of January 2014 to inspect the tunnels in order to avoid any disastrous situation that may arise due to any delay in attending to structural damages, if any, of these tunnels, and also taken steps to mitigate economic and social impact of the closure.

title: Rs.520 million (Japanese Yen 400 million) Grant for Provision of Industrial Equipment under Japanese Non Project Grant Aid
decision_details: - the Government of Japan, in addition to the Annual Yen Loan Package, provides grant assistance annually under various Grant Schemes one of which is the Non-project Grant Aid Scheme, with a view to strengthening friendship and cooperation between the two countries.  The Government of Japan has agreed to grant assistance in a sum of Japanese Yen 400 million  under this Non-project Grant Aid Scheme for the financial year 2013/2014 which is to be utilized for provision of medical equipment to Teaching Hospitals, Secondary Hospitals and Medical Research Institutes of the Ministry of Health to improve the healthcare facilities for the upliftment of health standards of Sri Lankan citizens.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to sign Exchange of Notes with the Government of Japan for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Additional Grant Assistance for Financing the Cost of Extended Consultancy Services Contract of Waste Water Disposal Project for Ratmalana / Moratuwa and Ja-Ela / Ekala Areas
decision_details: - Waste Water Disposal Project for Ratmalana / Moratuwa and Ja-Ela / Ekala Areas is implemented with the financial assistance from the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (SIDA) and the proposal made by the H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to sign an amendment to the Agreement with SIDA to finance the additional fund requirement for consultancy services of the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Additions and Alterations to the Existing Training Centre of the Sri Lanka Bureau of the Foreign Employment at Dambulla and to upgrade it as a Fully Equipped Migrant Resource Centre
decision_details: - the Migrant Resource Centre of Matale District is to be developed with additions and alterations to the existing Trainig Centre and provision of hostel facilities to 180 trainees and training facilitate to 350 trainees.  The proposal made by Hon. Dilan Perera, Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare, to proceed with the relevant renovation activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Migrant Resource Centre of Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment at Hali Ela, Badulla
decision_details: - the above proposal made by Hon. Dilan Perera, Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare, to provide better services to migrant workers, utilizing funds generated by the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Fertilizer for the Maha Season 2013/2014
decision_details: - the two proposals made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, for the award of the relevant contract for the procurement of fertilizer for the Maha Season 2013/2014 as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committees (SCAPCs) subject to the stipulations made by the General Treasury, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enhancement of Scope of Work of the Projects Implemented under ADB and JICA Loans by Utilizing the Balance Funds of Loans
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to utilize the balance funds of 03 loans provided by the Asian Development Bank (ADB) and 01 loan provided by the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA), for related activities of Grid Substations of Chunnakam, Polonnaruwa, Moneragala, Valachchenai, Maho, Naula, Puttalam, Kilinochchi, Vavuniya, Kelaniya and Kiribathkumbura, with the consent of the donor agencies and to proceed with the relevant activities, was approved by the Cabinet.
