title: Surface Water Development in Chilaw and Puttalam - ADB Assisted Dry Zone Urban Water & Sanitation Project
decision_details: - this Project is to be implemented with the assistance of the Asian Development Bank.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract to the lowest evaluated substantially responsive bidder as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Japan International Cooperation Agency Funded Major Bridges Construction Project of the National Road Network - Procurement of Consulting Services
decision_details: - the Government of Sri Lanka has received a loan of Japanese Yen 12,381 million from the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) towards the cost of Major Bridges Construction Project of the National Road Network and 37 major bridges are to be constructed under this project.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for providing consultancy services for the above project as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of 02 Ships for the Ceylon Shipping Corporation Limited under  Phase - 1 of the Project
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to purchase two (02)  Bulk Carriers for the Ceylon Shipping Corporation, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee (CANC) and to instruct the Director General of the Department of External Resources to finalize formalities of loan arrangements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Approval to lease out two Blocks of Land in the rest areas on Southern Expressway for the Establishment of Fuel Filling Stations
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to lease out two (02) plots of land identified near to the Rest Area on the Southern Expressway, for the establishment of Fuel Filling Stations to a subsidiary company of Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation Limited, on the valuation given by the Chief Government Valuer, for a period of 30 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commemoration of the National Safety Day - 2013
decision_details: - 26th of December each year has been declared as the "National Safety Day" which has been commemorated for seven years continuously since 2006, centering around Galle, Ratnapura, Kandy, Kurunegala, Jaffna, Batticaloa and Badulla Districts respectively.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, Minister of Disaster Management, to implement the programmes scheduled for the purpose for the National Safety Day 2013 in the Kalutara District, with the active participation of the relevant Ministries and Provincial Council and other stakeholders, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposal for a New Draft Bill for Soil Conservation and Preventing Land Degradation
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, to enact new Legislation in place of the existing Legislation, to deal with matters relating to soil conservation and land degradation more effectively in keeping with the accelerated development activities of the Government was referred to the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Legislation for recommendations.

title: Procurement of Plant Materials for Phase V of the "Divi Neguma" National Development Programme
decision_details: - it has been planned to distribute vegetable seeds and plants under Phase V of the Divi Neguma National Development Programme now being implemented with the objective of developing home gardens as productive economic units ensuring food and nutrition security of the people and to make the country self sufficient to a great extent in vegetables and fruits, thereby minimizing food and fruits imports.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, to procure plants required for the above programme from the nurseries of the Department of Agriculture and those registered with the Department and to proceed with the relevant activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Sales Promotion of the Products of the Disabled and the Elders Community
decision_details: -  on the proposal made by Hon. Felix Perera, Minister of Social Services, the Cabinet granted approval for the Ministry of Social Services to formulate a combined Action Plan for the promotion and sale of the products of the disabled and the elders in association with the Ministries of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development; Economic Development; and Botanical Gardens and Public Recreation and all other stake holders including public and private trade agencies.

title: Implementation of the National Action Plan for Disability
decision_details: - the National Policy on Disability promotes and protects the rights of differently able people in the spirit of social justice. They will have opportunities for enjoying a full and satisfying life and for contributing to national development, their knowledge, experience and particular skills and capabilities as equal citizens of Sri Lanka. The National Action Plan has been designed for implementation of 7 Thematic areas namely, Empowerment, Health and Rehabilitation, Education, Work and Employment, Mainstreaming and Enabling Environments, Data and Research and Social Institutional Cohesion.  Nearly Rs.65 billion has been allocated by the Government in the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2014 - 2016 for the implementation of the Government Policy Framework on empowering the differently able community and mobilizing them as an equally useful segment of the society. The proposal made by Hon. Felix Perera, Minister of Social Services, to proceed with the activities relating to the implementation of the said Action Plan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the term of Office of the National Delimitation Committee for the Demarcation of Wards under the Local Authorities Elections Ordinance (Chapter 262) for a further period of two months
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. A.L.M. Athaulla, Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils, to extend the term of office of the above Committee for a further period of three months with effect from 2013?12?07 for the completion of the work entrusted to the Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Completion of bridge work related to Nepal Lumbini Sri Lanka Vihara and renovation of Dutugamunu Pilgrims' Rest
decision_details: - on the above proposal made by Hon. D.M. Jayaratna, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs, Cabinet approval was granted for completion of the above works during the year 2014.

title: Allocation of Land at Hulftsdorp to the Attorney General's Department
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to allocate a vacant plot of land around 80 perches in extent situated at Hulftsdorp, Colombo 12, owned by the Urban Development Authority, to the Attorney General's Department, as the existing space in the buildings is inadequate to meet the present requirements of the Department, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Fifth South Asian Conference on Sanitation (SACOSAN)
decision_details: - Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, informed the Cabinet with regard to the representations made by the delegation from the Sri Lanka led by him at the above Conference which was held in Kathmandu, Nepal recently.  SACOSAN is a Government led biennial Convention held on rotation basis in each SAARC country providing a platform for interaction on sanitation.

title: The Convention on National Unity in Diversity to be held at the BMICH on 04th March 2014
decision_details: - having overcome the conflicts that constrained the development of Sri Lankan nationality based on the unity in diversity, numerous programes are being implemented by Government institutions towards strengthening the feeling of belongingness as one nation. Hon. Vasudeva Nanayakkara, Minister of National Languages and Social Integration informed the Cabinet of Ministers that his Ministry intends to convene a Convention in National Unity in Diversity at the BMICH  on March 04, 2014 with the participation of experts in various segments of the society.

title: Subsidiary Loan Agreement with National Water Supply and Drainage Board for Austrian Funded Mahiyangana Water Supply Project
decision_details: - a loan agreement has already been signed between the Government of Sri Lanka and Unicredit Bank Austria AG to finance the Mahiyangana Water Supply Project. The proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to enter into a subsidiary loan agreement with the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWS&DB) to on-lend the proceeds of the loan to NWS&DB, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Loan facility of US$ 300 million from China Development Bank Corporation to Finance the Improvement and Rehabilitation of Priority Road Project 3 (Phase I)
decision_details:
- the above project aims to rehabilitate about 270 km of priority road sections and the proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to include the under mentioned 04 road sections too under this project and to enter into a loan agreement to obtain a loan of US$ 300 million for the above project, was approved by the Cabinet:

* Narandeniya - Hakmana Road 	-   0.00 -11.95 km
* Ayagama - Egaloya Road		-   0.00 - 23 km
* Mawanella Hemmathagama Road -  0.00 - 26 km
* Hatton Maskeliya Dalhousie Road -  0.00 - 31.89 km

title: Interest Free Loan of RMB Yuan 200 million from the People’s Republic of China
decision_details: - with the view to further strengthening friendly relations and economic and technical co-operation between the two countries, the Government of the People's Republic of China has agreed to provide an interest free loan of Yuan 200 million to the Government of Sri Lanka. The loan will be utilized to implement priority projects to be agreed upon through consultations between the two Governments. The proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the  Minister of Finance and Planning, to enter  into an Agreement for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Governments of Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and People’s Republic of China in the Field of Labour
decision_details: - the objective of this Memorandum of Understanding is to strengthen the mutual relationship between the two countries and to promote bilateral exchange and co-operation in the field of labour policy.  The proposal made by Hon. Gamini Lokuge, Minister of Labour and Labour Relations, to sign the above Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Fertilizer Procurement - Maha Season 2013/2014
decision_details: - supply of fertilizer under the subsidy scheme is being handled by the Ceylon Fertilizer Company Ltd. and Colombo Commercial Fertilizer Ltd. functioning under the purview of the Ministry of Agriculture. The procurement process to procure the fertilizer requirement for Maha Season - 2013/2014 has already commenced through pre-qualified list of registered fertilizer suppliers for the year 2013.  The proposal of  Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture  to award the contracts for the supply of fertilizer to the successful bidders as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tender for Supply of 60,000 Bottles of Human Albumin Solution BP or Ph EUR 	20% in 50ML Bottles
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon.  Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of 	Health, to award the above contract to the lowest responsive bidder as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the 	Cabinet.

title: The Project funded by the Saudi Fund for Development - award of contract for the Rehabilitation and Improvements to the road section from Palapathwela to Naula  (from 32.54 km to 54.18 km ) on Kandy - Jaffna Road (A9)
decision_details: - the Government of Sri Lanka has received a loan of Saudi Riyal 225,000,000	(approximately US$ 60 million) from the Saudi Fund for Development for the rehabilitation and improvement of about 144 km of the National Road Network of Sri Lanka.  The project will also support to develop rural areas by providing connectivity through links with other parts of the existing roads enabling to enhance easy access for industries and agricultural activities. The proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Highways,Ports and Shipping to utilize a part of this loan for the rehabilitation and improvement of the road section from Palapathwela to Naula  (from 32.54 km to 54.18 km) on Kandy - Jaffna Road (A9) as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme funded by the Local Banks for the Rehabilitation of National Highways through Domestic Contractors - award of six (06) contracts under Stage 2
Re-engineering of the National Institute of Sports Science for the Development of Sports
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Mahindananda Aluthgamage, Minister of Sports, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a new Bill for the purpose, in keeping with the present day and future needs of the country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transfer of a Land for the Hostel of Mahinda Rajapaksa Model National School, Pitipana, Homagama
decision_details: - this is  the first Model National School constructed under the Programme of Developing 1000 Secondary Schools and at present, the student population of the school is 2447 and the majority of the students travel to school from distant places.  It has been observed that it is essential to provide residential facilities to students as well as teachers who travel to the school from distant places.  The proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to transfer the identified block of land owned by Lanka Salusala Ltd., to the Ministry of Education to be utilized for the fulfillment of the proposed residential requirement of the school, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Sri Lanka Resident Diplomatic Mission in Kabul, Afghanistan
decision_details: - Sri Lanka and Afghanistan have maintained close bilateral relations for several decades.  These historical relations between the two countries have been further enhanced with Afghanistan's entry into the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC) in 2007.  The proposal made by Hon. (Prof) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to proceed with the work relating to the establishment of a Sri Lanka Diplomatic Mission in Kabul, Afghanistan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Release of confiscated sand and timber to religious places of worship
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, Minister of Justice, to release sand and timber confiscated by relevant authorities at a concessionary rate to places of religious worship subject to a maximum limit of 10 cubes of sand and 100 cubic feet of timber per place of religious worship, for renovation work, on requests made by them, and the balance quantities of sand and timber to the Government construction institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of a Memorandum of Understanding among Member-States, Observers and Dialog Partners of Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO), on Creation of an Energy Club
decision_details: - the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) is a permanent inter-governmental International Organization proclaimed in June 2001 in Shanghai (China), by the Republic of Kazakhastan, the People's Republic of China, the Kyrgyz Republic, the Russian Federation, the Republic of Tajikistan and the Republic of Uzbekistan. The main purposes of the SCO are strengthening mutual trust and friendship among Member States and developing their effective cooperation in the fields of economy and trade, science and technology, culture, education, energy, transportation, environmental protection and other fields etc.. The purposes of the Energy Club are to exchange views on strategy, planning, policy and investment issues in energy area, develop co-operation and train professional personnel with a specialization in energies.  The proposal made by Hon. Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to sign the above MoU, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Cooperation Agreement between the Sri Lanka Export Development Board of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the National Centre for Marketing & Price Study of the Republic of Belarus
decision_details: - with the objective of further enhancing the existing trade and economic relations between the two countries, covering approval  of the Cabinet of Ministers was granted to the proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, Minister of Industry and Commerce for signing of the above Agreement.

title: Release of land for Sewer Treatment Plant for Kandy City Waste-water Management Project
decision_details: - a Waste-water Treatment System has been planned to serve the Kandy City Centre, Kandy Lake Round, Peradeniya - Kandy Road, William Gopallawa Mawatha and Mahaiyawa covering an area of 733 hectares. The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to release the identified block of land to the National Water Supply and Drainage Board to construct the proposed Sewer Treatment Plant for the Kandy City Waste-water Management Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Dambulla Sacred Area Development Project
decision_details: - the Urban Development Authority (UDA) has prepared the Greater Dambulla Development Plan, to facilitate the fast growing economic activities in the Dambulla Town Centre and its surrounding areas.  Considering importance and urgency, the UDA has taken action to take over the balance development work of the Sacred Area Development Plan on a priority basis.  The proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the relevant activities was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Pola Development Projects at Padukka, Delkanda and Embilipitiya
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to develop the existing Padukka Pola and the Embilipitiya Pola and to relocate the existing Delkanda Pola which is currently functioning either side of the High Level Road, at Delkanda area for the benefit of the public and the vendors, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Handing over of Beira Lake Area to Sri Lanka Land Reclamation & Development Corporation for Maintenance Purposes
decision_details: - action is being taken by the Government to develop Colombo and its suburbs as environmental friendly cities in keeping with international standards. Since the maintenance of the main canal systems in Colombo and development of new links are being carried out by the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation, the proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to hand over the Beira Lake Area with the consent of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, to the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation for maintenance works, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transfer of 01 Acre Land at Wedamulla, Kelaniya to Police Department
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to transfer 01 acre of land at Wedamulla, Kelaniya, to the Police Department, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh to train Bangladeshi Nurses and Healthcare Workers in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to enter into the above Memorandum of Understanding to provide training for Nursing Officers and Healthcare Workers of Bangladesh in selected training institutions in Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Vocational Training Centre in the Northern Province with Grant Assistance from the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany
decision_details: - a Vocational Training Centre with necessary facilities is to be established at Kilinochchi with grant assistance from the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany and the work is to be completed by 2015.   The proposed Vocational Training Centre will have the capacity to cater to 200 trainees and will offer short-term and long-term training programmes.  The Government of Germany has agreed to enhance its financial contribution for this project with an additional grant of Euro 4.4 million, to establish 8 Satellite Centres at this Vocational Training Centre at Kilinochchi and these Satellite Centres will be established in Mullaitivu, Jaffna, Kilinochchi, Vavuniya and Mannar Districts.  The project will be implemented by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Skills Development in close collaboration with the relevant line Ministries and Agencies.  The above proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Proposed University Complex of the National School of Business Management Limited (NSBM) at Homagama with Financial Assistance from Bank of Ceylon under the project financed by Local Banks
decision_details: -  H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, informed the Cabinet of Ministers that the construction work of the above project will be carried out with financial assistance from the Bank of Ceylon and that it will be implemented under the supervision of the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Skills Development and completed in 2015.

title: Award of Construction Work of the University College proposed to be Established in Batangala in Dehiowita Divisional Secretariat Division, Kegalle District to the State Engineering Corporation
decision_details: - the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Skills Development has made arrangements to establish 25 University Colleges affiliated to the University of Vocational Technology and the State Engineering Corporation has already undertaken the construction of buildings for University Colleges in Kuliyapitiya, Katubedda, Ratmalana, Matara, Jaffna and Anuradhapura.  The proposal made by Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to proceed with the project for the construction of the University College proposed to be established in the Kegalle District to coincide with the “Deyata Kirula” Development Programme - 2014, in Batangala in the Dehiowita Divisional Secretariat Division, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Direct supply of Generic Pharmaceuticals Manufactured by State Pharmaceuticals Manufacturing Corporation (SPMC) to Medical Supplies Division (MSD)
decision_details:
- the State Pharmaceuticals Manufacturing Corporation (SPMC) was established with the commitment to manufacture quality essential drugs at affordable prices.  With the view to elevating the drug manufacturing industry to a higher level by effective usage of existing resources, the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, for the SPMC to supply the undermentioned drugs (04 items) to the Medical Supplies Division as their annual requirement, on pre-agreed prices with immediate effect, without following the competitive bidding process,  was approved by the Cabinet, in addition to 26 generic pharmaceuticals already approved:

*	Amoxicillin Capsules BP 500mg
*	Cloxacillin Capsules BP 500mg
*	Gliclazide Tablets BP 80mg
*	Spironolactone Tablets USP 25mg

title: Proposal for Drafting a New Bill for Seeds and Planting Material Sector
decision_details: – the Government has observed that it has become a timely need to draft a new Bill to deal with all aspects in the field of seeds and planting material in keeping with the new trends of scientific agricultural development in the country.  The use of low quality seeds has led to various issues including low productivity and farmer disputes.  The provisions presently available under the Seed Act, No. 22 of 2003 are insufficient to address such issues and to ensure the rights of farmers.  Accordingly, it was decided to refer the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, to the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Legislation for its recommendations.

title: Construction of a New Hostel for Agriculture College of Sri Lanka, Pelvehera, Dambulla, of the Department of Agriculture
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture for the construction of a new hostel building at a total estimated cost of Rs.221.96 million, to provide better residential facilities and learning environment to the students following the two (02) year Diploma Course in Agriculture, was approved by the Cabinet.  The preliminary work of the project will be commenced in 2013 and the balance funds for the purpose will be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Frame Work 2014 - 2016.

title: Transfer of 80 P Land at Mudun Ela, Kelaniya to the National Water Supply and Drainage Board
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to allocate the above block of land through the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation to the National Water Supply and Drainage Board for the construction of the Engineer's office for Kelaniya/Peliyagoda area, with the view to providing a better service with required facilities to the people in the area, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of Blocks of Land at Pitipana, Homagama to Mahinda Rajapaksa National School
decision_details: - 09 acres of land from Pitipana, Mahenawatte, has been allocated by the Urban Development Authority, to construct the Mahinda Rajapaksa National School and the said land has already been developed and the Ministry of Education has commenced activities of the National School.  A land in extent of 05 acres located behind the School has also been developed by the Ministry of Education as the playground of the National School. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the activities relating to the vesting of the relevant lands with the Ministry of Education, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Nuwara Eliya City Beautification Programme
decision_details: - the Urban Development Authority has undertaken several projects in the Nuwara Eliya town where priority has been given for the beautification of Lake Gregory surroundings which is a significant location for tourism in the Nuwara Eliya District.  The land previously used for the cut flower project has now been developed for public recreational purposes.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the relevant development activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Investment Projects offered for CHOGM Business Forum in Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- in conjunction with the Commonwealth Heads of Governments' Meeting scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka from 15th to 17th November, 2013, the Commonwealth Business Council (CBC) in collaboration with the Government of Sri Lanka, has organized the Commonwealth Business Forum (CBF).  The CBF is to be held between 12th and 14th November, 2013 at the Hotel Cinnamon Grand, Colombo.  The key objective of the CBF is to attract foreign direct investments to Sri Lanka through potential investors from Commonwealth countries by making them aware of the vast investment opportunities available in Sri Lanka in various sectors.  The CBC jointly with the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka has identified investment opportunities which could be offered to potential foreign investors during the forthcoming CBF.  Some of the sectors of such projects are as follows:

* 	Tourism and Leisure 
* 	Higher Education and Training
* 	Agriculture and Fisheries
* 	Health
* 	Information Technology
* 	Manufacturing and Agro-processing
* 	Infrastructure including Aviation.

The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Investment Promotion to proceed with the relevant activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Contribution to Commonwealth Scholarship Endowment Fund
decision_details: - Sri Lanka has been a beneficiary of Commonwealth Scholarship and Fellowship Plan for a long period of time and a large number of University Academics of Sri Lanka have benefited from this Scholarship Scheme which has significantly contributed towards the improvement of academic standards of our universities.  From this year onwards, the Scholarship Commission in the United Kingdom has listed Sri Lanka as a Commonwealth Scholarship Awarding country providing necessary financial assistance for same.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to make a one time contribution of US $50,000 towards the Commonwealth Scholarship Endowment Fund  from the funds allocated to the University Grants Commission for 2013, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Difficulties faced by Teachers at the Zonal Education Offices
decision_details: - H.E. the President brought to the notice of the Cabinet of Ministers and also of the Chief Ministers of Provinces who attended the Cabinet meeting as invitees that, it has been brought to his notice that teachers have to undergo difficulties in attending to their establishment matters, particularly pertaining to their personal files, confirmation in service, salary increments, loan facilities, pensions and leave etc. at Zonal Education Offices.  After discussion, the Chief Ministers of Provinces were requested to take action to streamline such activities at Zonal Education Offices and make such offices as teacher friendly institutions with a dedicated staff to cater to the needs of teachers.

title: Construction of a Building for the Extension to Administration Building, University of Moratuwa
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to award the above contract to the lowest evaluated responsive bidder, as recommended by Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Northern Road Connectivity Project - Award of Four Contract Packages in Stage II
Water Cooperation for Community Development - 2013
decision_details: - the International Conference on this subject was held recently in Anuradhapura. Many distinguished dignitaries from countries in the South Asian Region such as India, Pakistan, Maldives and Bhutan and local representatives from 450 Community Based Water Supply Organizations had attended this Conference.  Several workshops had been conducted in order to share the experiences of their knowledge and best practices prevalent in the region and to promote mutual understanding and cooperation among the communities managing their water supply schemes.  The above information was furnished to the Cabinet by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage.

title: Multi-Sector Action Plan for Nutrition
decision_details: - it has been observed that the country has entered a phase of rapid growth and development and that the workforce has to be transformed into a productive human resource which is physically and mentally fit to meet the challenges.  The improvement of nutrition of all age groups and segments of the population up to the required level needs intervention not only from the health sector but also from stakeholders from other sectors such as education, agriculture, livestock etc.  Nutrition is thus identified as requiring a multi-sectoral approach.  The Multi-Sector Action Plan for nutrition comprises activities formulated by a panel of experts under the guidance of the National Nutrition Council (NNC) in keeping with globally accepted standards for nutrition.  The proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Chairman, National Nutrition Council, to proceed with the activities relating to the above, was approved by the Cabinet.

decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted for the rehabilitation and improvements to the following Sections of Roads and the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to authorize the Road Development Authority to enter into Loan Agreements with the local Bank for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet:*	Road Section from Narammala to Dankotuwa (B308) (16.03 km to 45.25 km);*	Road Section from Ambepussa to Galewala (0.00 km to 75.11 km) on Ambepussa - Kurunegala - Trincomalee Road (A6);*	Road Section from Kadawalagedara to Withikuliya having a length of 14.00 km;  *	Construction of a Two Lane Bridge across Deduru Oya at Kadigawa; and*	Kelanimulla - Mulleriyawa - Koswatta Road - Phase I - Construction of Via Duct and approach road from 0.00 km to 0.60 km.

title: Appointment of Consultants for Designing, Construction Supervision & Management Support for the Anuradhapura North Water Supply Project - Phase I
decision_details: - the above Water Supply Project is financed by the Japan International Co-operation Agency (JICA) and Government of Sri Lanka at a cost of Japanese Yen 5166 million and a contribution of Rs.2789 million by the Government of Sri Lanka.  The project consists of the following 2 phases:* 	Phase I - Mahakandarawa Water Supply Scheme which provides drinking water to Medawachchiya and Rambeawa Divisional Secretaries' Divisions; and*	Phase II - Wahalkada Water Supply Scheme which provides drinking water to Kahatagasdigiliya, Kebithigollewa, Horowpathana and Padaviya Divisional Secretaries' Divisions.The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage to award the tender for Consultancy Services for Phase I of the project as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Award of Contract for Construction of Head Works for Kaluganga Reservoir
decision_details: - Kaluganga Reservoir is proposed to be constructed across Kaluganga at a location downstream of  Pallegama town in the Laggala Electorate in Matale District.  Joint funding for the Kaluganga Reservoir will be provided by the Saudi Fund for Development (SFD), Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development (KFAED) and OPEC  Fund  for  International  Development (OFID).  The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management to award the contract to the lowest evaluated bidder as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of Galle Road and R. A. de Mel Mawatha - from Liberty Roundabout to Dharmarama Road Junction
decision_details: - the Metro Colombo Urban Development Project is a World Bank Project funded by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRB) and several development projects in the Metro Colombo Region are implemented utilizing the funds received through the World Bank Project.    Rehabilitation of the Galle Road and R. A. de Mel Mawatha from Liberty Roundabout to Dharmarama Road Junction is a part of this project.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to award the above contract to the lowest evaluated substantially responsive bidder as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Colleges of Agriculture for Producing Fully Skilled Professionals Suited for current Agricultural Needs in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, for the development of colleges of agriculture to provide opportunities for the youth of our country to follow internationally reputed training programmes and tertiary education programmes that provide internationally recognized qualifications so that the youth will be equipped to meet the demands of the global work force, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project on Promoting Sustainable Biomass Energy Production and Modern Bio-Energy Technologies in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - at present, hydro power and thermal power is generated in Sri Lanka using hydro potential, coal and fossil fuels.  In addition to the above, wind, solar and biomass are used to generate electricity in a smaller scale.  The Ministry of Environment and Renewable Energy has taken measures to obtain  Grant Funding for a five year project (2013 - 2017) with an estimated cost of US $1.9 million from the Global Environment Facility (GEF) through the intervention of the United Nations' Development Programme (UNDP)  and the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) for Promoting Sustainable Biomass Energy Production and Modern Bio Energy technologies in Sri Lanka. The proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Environment and Renewable Energy, to proceed with the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Assistance and Protection of Victims of Crime and Witnesses Bill
decision_details: - the proposed Law will create a balance in the Criminal Justice System of Sri Lanka between the rights of accused, the rights and entitlements of victims of crime and the entitlements of witnesses, and will thereby facilitate the conduct of fair trials and justice being meted out to both victims of crime and accused.  Cabinet approval was granted to refer the proposal on the above made by Hon. Rauff  Hakeem, Minister of Justice to the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Legislation for its recommendations before presenting it in Parliament.

Jayaratne Herath, Minister of Botanical Gardens and Public Recreation, to proceed with the activities relating to the rehabilitation of the above road section for the benefit of the domestic as well as foreign tourists who visit the elephant orphanage at Pinnawala in Kegalle, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the ownership of the land where the National Institute of Business Management is located.
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to transfer the section of the land where the National Institute of Business Management is located, as a free grant to the said Institute, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Legal Protection to White Cane Users
decision_details: - white cane is used by the visually impaired community for mobility, to ensure protection and to display their identity.  At present, nearly 200,000 visually impaired persons in the country use white canes but there is no specific provision in the Protection of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act No.28 of 1996 for the purpose.  Having considered the proposal submitted by Hon. Felix Perera, Minister of Social Services pertaining to this issue, the Cabinet of Ministers decided that laws should enacted to provide legal protection to all physically handicapped persons.

title: Comprehensive Mastitis Control Programme for increased milk production
decision_details: - Mastitis is the most common disease in local dairy cows that affects the production and the quality of milk.  This disease affects the udders of milking cows.  It is proposed to implement a comprehensive National Mastitis Control Programme in the country by enhancing the production capacity of locally manufactured udder infusions by the Veterinary Research Institute (VRI).  This project is to be implemented over a period of 05 years commencing from 2014.

title: Visit of His Excellency the President to New York, USA for the 68th Session of the United Nations General Assembly - September 2013
decision_details: - Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, presented the Report to the Cabinet on the above visit of His Excellency the President.  In his address to the General Assembly, His Excellency stressed inter alia, the need to protect and abide by the principle of equal treatment of countries as the bedrock of all international interactions.  H.E. the President explained the salutary accomplishments of Sri Lanka in the socio economic sphere, made despite the 2004 Tsunami, global financial meltdown and a protracted conflict.  He also called upon the United Nations to declare an International Skills Day.  He stated that the Northern Provincial Council Election was held after the lapse of almost a quarter of century and emphasized its importance in the context of political empowerment and reconciliation and stressed that it is clearly the responsibility of the international communities to assist with these efforts and ensure their success for the benefit of all the people in the country.  H.E. the President in conclusion, referred to the disproportionate emphasis on Sri Lanka and the unequal treatment through the multilateral framework while questioning the basis for this relentless pursuit despite the country's consistent engagement with the UN mechanisms and the visible progress made.  H.E. the President also took this opportunity to conduct bilateral meetings with several Heads of Governments and the Secretaries General of the United Nations and the Commonwealth.

title: Proposed Parliamentary Programme for the Appropriation Bill - 2014
decision_details: The Parliamentary Programme for the Appropriation Bill - 2014, was noted by the Cabinet.  Accordingly, the above Appropriation Bill will be presented to Parliament on 2013?10?22 and the Budget Speech will be delivered on 2013?11?21.

title: Provision of Water Supply Facilities for Deyata Kirula 2014
decision_details: -  the Deyata Kirula - 2014 Development Programme includes Kurunegala, Puttalam and Kegalle Districts and the exhibition is to be held at Kuliyapitiya in lands belonging to the Wayamba University, the Technical College and the Kuliyapitiya Central College.  It has been planned to develop drinking water supply within the North Western Province, including the exhibition areas, utilizing funds to be allocated under the Deyata Kirula - 2014 Development Programme. The proposed project will bring direct benefits to the Wayamba University, Kuliyapitiya Technical College and the residential population of the Kuliyapitiya and Kegalle towns and suburbs.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to proceed with the relevant activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Eastern Province Water Supply Development Project - Tender for laying of PE Pipes, Fittings, DI/CI Valves & Accessories for Distribution System of Koneshpuram & Dadayanthalawa Areas
decision_details: - the above project is being implemented  by  the  National  Water Supply and Drainage Board with Government of  Sri  Lanka  contribution  and  funds  provided  by  the  Japan  International  Co-operation Agency (JICA).  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above tender as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of Karagahathenna FM Transmission Station of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Keheliya Rambukwella, Minister of Mass Media and Information to upgrade the Karagahathenna FM Transmission Station of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation so that the quality of transmission in the North Central, North Western, Central and Eastern Provinces could be improved to a great extent, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of 2:5  of Chapter VI, 1:5 of Chapter XII  and 6:4 of Chapter XXVIII of the Establishments Code
decision_details: - the telegram service which was used by Public Officers as one of the modes to inform the respective Heads of Departments when they are unable to report for duty owing to an urgent matter, specially without obtaining prior approval, has been terminated with effect from 2013?10?01.  Under the circumstances, the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to make necessary arrangements to recognize the Tele-mail service which has been introduced by the Department of Posts as an alternative to the Telegram service, as a legal document for the purpose of obtaining leave for Public Officers; and to make necessary amendments to the provisions of the Establishments Code accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Resurfacing and Improvements to Baseline Road from Kelanitissa Roundabout to Kanatta Roundabout (0.00 km - 4.80 km)
decision_details: the Section of the Baseline Road from Kelanitissa Roundabout to Kanatta Roundabout (0.00 km - 4.80 km) has a dual carriageway with six traffic lanes.  This section of the road requires resurfacing urgently in order to provide a better service.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to proceed with the work relating to the above, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Two Storied Building for the Divisional Secretariat, Galewela
decision_details: - Galewela Divisional Secretary's Division consists of 59 Grama Niladhari Divisions and the total population is about 75,000.   The proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to construct a two storied building at a cost of Rs.50 million, to provide better services to the people living in the area, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of an Underground Vehicle Park at Senanayake Ground of Badulla Town
decision_details: - it has been proposed to construct an underground vehicle park and a green garden in Badulla Town for the convenience of the public.  Preliminary works of the project are to be commenced utilizing an allocation of Rs.15 million provided to the District Secretary, Badulla in the Budget Estimate for 2013.  The proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to proceed with the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Dry Zone Urban Water and Sanitation Project
decision_details: - Tender for Construction of Water Storage Structures in Mannar - the above project is being implemented by the National Water Supply and Drainage Board with Government of Sri Lanka contribution and loan funds provided by the Asian Development Bank.  There are 15 major contract packages to be awarded to implement the various components of the project in the four towns of Puttalam, Chillaw, Vavuniya and Mannar and the above is one such contract.  This contract includes two (02) ground reservoirs, an elevated tower and Chlorination System.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above tender to the lowest evaluated responsive bidder as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Workshop on Heritage Management
decision_details: - the Indian Ocean Rim Association for Regional Co-operation (IOR-ARC) was set up in 1995 and formally launched in March 1997 in Mauritius with its main focus for Regional Co-operation.  It currently comprises of 20 Member States.  The above is a two day workshop expected to be held in May 2014 and will be jointly organized by the Ministry of National Heritage and the Ministry of External Affairs.  The main objective of this workshop is to create awareness among IOR-ARC Member States regarding diversity of culture and heritage of Member States.  The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Jagath Balasooriya, Minister of National Heritage, to proceed with the relevant activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Cocoa Development Project - Uva Wellassa
decision_details: - Cocoa was introduced to Sri Lanka by the British in 1834.  Cocoa cultivation was established in Matale of the Central Hills and Uva Wellassa areas in Sri Lanka as a mixed crop with rubber and coconut.  A new rubber cultivation programme in 5000 ha. is underway in the Uva Province and this programme has created a favourable environment to commence growing cocoa as a mixed crop.   The objective of the above project is to ensure the maximum utilization of existing lands while maintaining ecological balance in the respective zone thereby increasing the extent of cocoa cultivation up to 3000 ha., and the cocoa harvest up to 5550 mt. by 2020.  On the proposal made by Hon. Reginald Cooray, Minister of Minor Export Crop Promotion, Cabinet approval was granted to proceed with the programme in close collaboration with the Ministry of Plantation Industries and the Rubber Development Department.

title: Tenth Commonwealth Women’s Affairs Ministers Conference held in Dhaka, Bangladesh
Establishment of a Resident Diplomatic Mission of Sri Lanka in Victoria, the Republic of Seychelles
decision_details: - The Republic of Seychelles is one of the internationally active countries in the African Region.  Diplomatic relations between Seychelles and Sri Lanka were established at Ambassadorial level in 1988 and at present the High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Pretoria is concurrently accredited to Seychelles.  H.E. the President of Sri Lanka undertook a State visit to Seychelles in late June this year and during the visit the two leaders expressed their strong desire to broaden and deepen economic, diplomatic  ties between the two countries.  Some of the outcomes of the visit are -*    Sri Lankan Air Lines and Mihin Lanka to commence direct air traffic between the two countries;*    Bank of Ceylon, with the concurrence of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, to establish a Bank of Ceylon Branch in Seychelles;*    The Insurance Corporation of Sri Lanka to establish a Branch Office in Seychelles; and*    Nawaloka Group of Sri Lanka is considering the establishment of a Hospital in Seychelles.The proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to establish a Resident Diplomatic Mission of Sri Lanka in Victoria, Seychelles and to proceed with the connected activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Second New Kelani Bridge - Shifting of High Voltage Transmission Lines
decision_details: - a preparatory survey on traffic improvement project around new Kelani Bridge is being carried out by the Road Development Authority (RDA), in line with the proposed construction of the second new Kelani Bridge in collaboration with Japan International Co-operation Agency (JICA) and it has been revealed that the 2 overhead high tension transmission lines should be converted to underground cables to provide the required clearance to the proposed new Bridge and associated highway network.  The proposal made by Hon. Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy to proceed with the activities relating to the shifting of the  High Voltage Transmission Lines, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tender for supply of 100,000 Vials of Dried Factor VIII Fraction BP (Dried Human Antihaemophilic Fraction) or Human Coagulation Factor VIII Ph Eur (250IU-300IU)
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to purchase 50% of the above from the previous supplier, and to call for fresh world-wide tenders to purchase one year requirement of  the above item, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), to meet the present needs, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposal to set up and operate an Integrated Resort at D.R. Wijewardene Mawatha, Colombo
decision_details: - this would include a hotel with a minimum of 400 rooms, convention facilities, restaurants and other associated facilities with a total investment of US $350 million.  The project will generate direct employment for 2600 local employees and will also create indirect employment opportunities.  The proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Investment Promotion, to proceed with the activities relating to the award of the project and matters connected thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Integrated Tourism Related Project to be set up at Glennie Street and Justice Akbar Mawatha, Colombo 02
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Lakahman Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Investment Promotion, to implement a project to set up a luxury multi / mixed use Integrated Resort consisting of the convention centre, entertainment facilities, international standard shopping mall, luxury condominiums and office space with a total investment of US $650 million, which will create direct employment opportunities for 3000-4000 persons during the construction period and in addition, 3000 direct and indirect employment on commencement of business operations, and to grant concessions under the Strategic Development Project Act, No.14 of 2008 (as amended), for the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Sri Lankan Delegation to the 9th Regional Women Ministers’ and Parliamentarian’s Conference on Gender Equity and the Post 2015 Development Agenda
decision_details: - Sri Lankan delegation headed by Hon. Tissa Karalliyadda, Minister of Child Development and Women’s Affairs and consisting of  three Deputy Ministers had attended the above Conference held in Seoul, South Korea on 15th and 16th of May 2013 which was hosted by the Asian Forum of Parliamentarians on Population and Development (AFPPD) in partnership with the Korean Parliamentary League on Children, Population and Development and Plan Population Federation of Korea with assistance from the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) and Japan Trust Fund.  The Conference was attended by 45 delegates representing more than 15 countries in the Asian Pacific Region.  Hon. Tissa Karalliyadda, in his speech, had highlighted the action taken by the Ministry of Child Development and Women’s Affairs and the Government of Sri Lanka and structural arrangements in place to eliminate all forms of violence against women and children, and towards maintaining gender equality in Sri Lanka, and also to provide education, health and employment facilities by the State to all its citizens without any discrimination based on gender, ethnicity, cast or creed.  The participants had appreciated the development goals reached by Sri Lanka, particularly the very high literacy rate and attendance of women in tertiary education, low maternity and infantile death rates, high rate of girls' attendance in primary and secondary education and the high rate of women employed in professional jobs etc. Cabinet of Ministers noted with appreciation, the above information provided by Hon. Tissa Karalliyadda, Minister of Child Development and Women’s Affairs.

title: A). Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Co-operation (BIMSTEC) Convention on Cooperation in Combating International Terrorism, Transnational Organized Crime and Illicit Drug Trafficking
decision_details: - the salient features of this Convention are -*    co-operation in sharing experiences in areas of mutual concern while enhancing co-operation between law enforcement Agencies of the Member Countries;*    sharing and exchanging of information on financing of terrorism, transnational organized crime and illicit drug trafficking; and*    co-ordinating ways and means to facilitate mutual legal assistance in criminal matters, arrest, extradition and prosecution of individuals, their associates engaged in crimes covered within the scope of the Convention. B). Memorandum of Association (MOA) among the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Co-operation (BIMSTEC) Member Countries for Establishment of BIMSTEC Energy Centre - the main objectives of this MOA are -*    to create, manage  and evaluate energy related data-base relevant to the Region;   *    to prepare and operate a framework for networking among the national level institutions in the Region; and *    to enhance co-operation for capacity building and sharing of experiences on best practices. The proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to proceed with the activities relating to the above, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchasing of a Land for Development activities of the University of Jaffna
decision_details: - the present student population at the University of Jaffna is around 5700.  The Faculties of Science, Arts (including the Division of Law), Management Studies & Commerce, and Medicine (including the Division of Allied Health Science) of the University and the Institutes of Siddha Medicine and Ramanathan Academy of Fine Arts are established in Jaffna.   It has been identified as a crucial development project to uplift the standard of the University of Jaffna and also accommodate the  increasing student population. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to purchase an identified block of land with the view to expanding the activities of the University, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Continuance of the National Online Distance Education Service (NODES) as a Division of the Ministry of Higher Education
decision_details: - NODES has facilitated local as well as foreign students to follow 35 educational courses at 26 Access Centres throughout the country, through the Distance Education System being implemented based on a computer network.  In 2012, about 8000 students of the Open University have utilized the facilities at Access Centres of the NODES.  Further, in 2012, under a partnership programme the government has formed with the private institutes, it has been possible to provide learning facilities for about 6,500 employees in the government and the private sector, using technological facilities possessed by the  NODES and it is expected to increase this number up to 9000 by the end of 2013.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to proceed with the proposed activities relating to NODES, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of International Irrigation and Water Management Training Institute of Kotmale, Sri Lanka
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to recruit trainees to the above Institute which was established in 2012, to be trained as Engineering Assistants and Technical Assistants to meet the existing shortage of Engineering Staff in the Mahaweli Authority of Sri Lanka and the Department of Irrigation and other Government Institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Deyata Kirula National Development Programme 2014
decision_details: - Village Level Public Meetings and Mobile Services - Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minster of Economic Development, informed the Members of the Cabinet that, parallel to the Deyata Kirula Exhibition 2014, community welfare services and mobile services are being implemented, covering all Grama Niladhari Divisions of the three Districts of Kurunegala, Kegalle and Puttalam.  The main objectives of this programme are:*    to identify individual and family based problems, including land, housing etc., and to provide solutions for same;*    to identify common amenities to be developed within the Grame Niladhari Divisions;*    to provide various services by Government Institutions at village level; and*    to provide mobile health clinics at village level for the benefit of the public.

title: State Visit of H.E. the President of Sri Lanka to the Republic of Belarus - 25th to 27th August 2013
decision_details: - H.E. the President paid a State Visit to the Republic of Belarus from 25-27 August 2013, at the invitation of the President of the Republic of Belarus and this was the first State Visit to Belarus by a Head of State of Sri Lanka.  Bilateral discussions between the leaders of the two countries had been conducted in an atmosphere of openness, friendship and mutual understanding and the constructive exchange of views were promising for further development and strengthening of bilateral relations as well as issues of mutual interests on the international agenda. Some of the salient outcomes of the above visit are as follows:*    establishment of a Joint Commission on Trade and Economic Cooperation for the development of economic ties between the two countries;*    a delegation from Belarus to visit Sri Lanka with the view to establishing a tractor and agricultural machinery assembling plant for which a partner from Sri Lanka will be identified for a Joint Venture;*    flexible conditions on prices for the import of fertilizer to be worked out;*    cooperation in the fields of dairy production and cattle breeding; *    education particularly in the Science and Medical fields;  *   agreement of cooperation in higher education between the Universities of the two countries; and*    enhanced exports from Belarus to Sri Lanka, for supply to South and South East Asia, taking advantage of the free port system and Free Trade Agreements of Sri Lanka.Memoranda of Understanding/Agreements on the following were signed during    the visit, to further enhance the bilateral relations:    *    Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters;*    Trade and Economic Cooperation;*    Avoidance of Double Taxation and Prevention of Fiscal Evasion with respect to Taxes on Income; and*    Cooperation in the Field of Tourism.

title: The Second Global Young Parliamentarians' Consultation on International Conference on Population and Development and Post 2015 UN Development Agenda - 3rd and 4th October 2013
decision_details: - the above International Conference sponsored by the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) New York Office and organized by the Asian Forum of Parliamentarians' on Population and Development (AFPPD) is scheduled to be held in Colombo on 3rd and 4th October 2013.  Hon. D.M. Jayaratne, the Prime Minister and Hon. Chamal Rajapakse, the Speaker of Parliament, have been invited to grace the occasion and address the delegates.  The main objective of this meeting is to review the global progress made on International Conference on Population and Development (ICPD) Programme of Action from the perspective of young Parliamentarians. The outcome expected of this meeting will be that the Young Members of Parliament are adequately briefed and prepared to make positive contributions for the ICPD beyond 2014.  All expenses towards conducting of this meeting in Sri Lanka will be met by the UNFPA New York Office.  The proposal made by Hon. Tissa Karalliyadda, Minister of Child Development and Women's Affairs, to organize and conduct this meeting in Colombo, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a permanent building and an access roadway for the Office of the Public Service Commission
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, for the construction of a permanent building for the Office of the Public Service Commission, in a block of land adjoining the premises of the Ministry of Lands and Land Development with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework and to proceed with the matters connected thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Special Education Resource and Information Centres
decision_details: - it has been observed that the teaching process that has to be adopted for the children with visual and hearing impairments, Autism etc. is more complex than that of normal students and it is essential to provide special equipment and facilities and specially trained teachers for their education. The proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to establish Resource and Information Centres for students with special needs with financial allocations to be provided under the Medium Term Expenditure Framework 2013 - 2015 and for the implementation of special education programmes with a proper co-ordination with the Ministries of Education, Health, Social Services, Vocational Training and Media, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reconstruction of the Wekanda National Housing Scheme at Stuart Street, Colombo 02.
decision_details: -  At present these housing units pose a great danger as they are in a dilapidated condition. The residents in the above Housing Scheme consisting of 114 housing units in 4, four storyed buildings constructed long ago are to be relocated as early as possible.   On the above proposal made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities, for the relocation of the residents of the above Housing Scheme, Cabinet approval was granted to allocate 114 housing units from an Urban Housing Project in Colombo being implemented by the Urban Development Authority (UDA).

title: Livelihood Development of Palmyrah Dependent 70,000 Families in the Northern Province
decision_details: - it has been observed that there are about 10 million Palmyrah trees in the Northern Province alone which has contributed to the Northern economy as a source of food and beverages, craft sector development, provision of timber and leaves for housing and shelter, projection of heritage and culture and in generating income earning opportunities for the people living in the relevant areas.  There are over 70,000 families depending on the Palmyrah Sector, directly and indirectly in the Northern Province. The Palmyrah sector contributes to the livelihood development through variety of palmyrah based value added products such as - *    Sap based products (jaggery, treacle, sweet toddy etc.); *    Fruit based products (soft drinks, panadu, jam etc.);  *    Leaf based products (handicraft, dustbins, bags, table mats etc.); *    Fibre based products (broomsticks, brushes etc.); *    Tuber based products (odial, palm posha, odial flour etc.); and *    Wood based products (timber, furniture etc.)Palmyrah based handicraft training is to be expanded in the Northern and Eastern Provinces, including Puttalam and Hambantota Districts.  The proposal made by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development, to implement the identified projects that need State intervention on a priority basis under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework through the Palmyrah Development Board in the Northern Province, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation Project for Gin Ganga Flood Regulation Scheme
decision_details: - this Scheme implemented with Chinese Government aid in the late 70's had commenced its operation in 1982 and is located in the Galle District, covering Badalgama, Bope - Poddala, Welivita, Divitura and Hikkaduwa Divisional Secretary's Division.  The main objectives of the Scheme are, to protect cultivation of 5000 ha of paddy lands in lower valley of Gin Ganga from damages caused by frequent flooding and to protect around 20,000 families living in the area from flood hazards.  Having observed that, rehabilitation of Gin Ganga Flood Regulation Scheme is a long felt need, Cabinet approval was granted to the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to implement the said rehabilitation project at a total cost of Rs.700 million, over a period of 3 years from 2014 to 2016.

title: 'Smart - Sri Lanka' - An ICT Development Strategy for Sri Lanka (e-Sri Lanka Development Initiative - Phase 2)
decision_details: - the primary objective of this initiative is to achieve national economic development by bringing the dividends of ICT   within the reach of every village and citizen of the country.  The ICT literacy rate which was less than 8% in 2005 had surpassed 35% by 2012, primarily due to the expansion of the 'Nenasala' Network in remote areas.  The above project is to be implemented over a period of 5 to 6 years, commencing in the first quarter of 2014.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, to proceed with the project, subject to stipulations laid down by the General Treasury, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Recent reports of milk powder contamination with Dicyandiamide (DCD) and Whey Protein Concentrate Contamination with Clostridium Botulinum Bacteria
decision_details: - Cabinet at its meeting held on 2013-08-15 appointed a Cabinet Sub-Committee headed by Hon. D.E.W. Gunasekara, Minister (Senior) for Human Resources and consisting of six other Ministers to examine this issue and submit a Report to the Cabinet.  Accordingly, the Report of the Committee was submitted by Hon. D.E.W. Gunasekara, Minister (Senior) for Human Resources and the following recommendations contained in the Report were approved by the Cabinet for implementation:(a)    to improve the capacity of local laboratories to meet the emerging demands including those at the Medical Research Institute and Industrial Technical Institute; (b)    to inspect the Complex and Advanced Food Manufacturing Plants in Sri Lanka by the experts under the Chief Food Authority to ensure good manufacturing practices;(c)    to launch an Island-wide programme to promote breast feeding and consumption of locally produced liquid milk by the Ministry of Health in collaboration with other relevant stakeholders;(d)    to take action to strengthen the capacity of the Food Authority in terms of staff and other facilities and to amend the Food Act to address the existing and emerging food safety issues effectually;(e)    to direct the Ministry of Health to publish a detailed news paper advertisement indicating in simple language:(i)    background of the issue; and(ii)    a system of labelling to identify the products free of DCD and Clostridium bacteria, which are safe to consume.(f)    to ensure the introduction of the new labelling system prior to publishing the above public communication;(g)    to purchase a Liquid Chromatograph Mass Spectrometer (LC/MS/MS) for the ITI;(h)    to direct the Chief Food Authority and the Consumer Affairs Authority to withdraw from the market  imported milk products suspected to be contaminated with  DCD as decided by that Authority; and(i)    to ensure close collaboration with the Ministry of Health, the Consumer Affairs Authority and the Industrial Technology Institute when addressing the issues of this nature. Action will also be taken to introduce a methodology to carry out Food Safety Hazards Tests prior to clearance of goods by the Customs, jointly by the Sri Lanka Customs, the Medical Research Institute and the Industrial Technical Institute in keeping with international standards.

title: Rehabilitation of 2x37.5 MW Samanala Power Station - Polpitiya
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to authorize the Ceylon Electricity Board to proceed with the International Competitive Bidding process to select a contractor for the rehabilitation of Samanala Power Station and with matters connected thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Defence Services College in Kurunegala for the Children of Three Forces and Police Personnel
decision_details: - the Defence Services College has been commenced in Colombo to provide educational facilities to the Children of the three Forces and the Police.  Cabinet approval has already been granted to expand such facilities to other areas of the country.  The joint proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development and Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to develop Wewagedara Junior School in Kurunegala as the 'Kurunegala Defence Services College' and to proceed with the activities thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Membership of the International Tropical Fruits Network (TFNet) by Sri Lanka
decision_details: - International Tropical Fruits Network is a Regional Development Organization established under the auspices of the World Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and is acting as a network to promote the production, productivity, processing, marketing, quality, consumption and international trade of tropical fruits.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeyewardena, Minister of Agriculture, to obtain Membership of this Organization, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding for Agricultural Co-operation to be signed between the Republic of Turkey and the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, to sign the above Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) during the visit to Sri Lanka of the Minister of Food, Agriculture and Livestock of the Republic of Turkey in October 2013, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Setting up a Formal National Program for the Common use and sharing of Spatial Data and Information
decision_details: - spatial data means geo-spatial data or information which could exactly indicate the geographic location of a natural or constructed feature on earth such as a road, river, building, and allotment of land or a boundary of land.  The proposal made by Hon. Janaka Bandara Thennakoon, Minister of Lands and Land Development, to implement the above programme through a separate unit to be established in the Survey Department under the directives of the Ministry of Lands and Land Development, and for the appointment of a Monitoring Committee consisting of representatives of the relevant Ministries and Departments, to monitor this programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 66th Independence Day falling on 04th February 2014
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to appoint a Cabinet Sub-Committee headed by Hon. D.M. Jayaratne, the Prime Minister and Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs and consisting of 07 other Ministers including the Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs and the Chief Minister, Sabaragamuwa Province and a Deputy Minister, to prepare the programme and to organize and monitor the necessary matters relevant to the 66th Independence Day Celebrations falling on 04th February 2014, and for the Secretary, Ministry of Public Administration and Home Affairs to function as the Secretary to this Cabinet Sub-Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Provincial Offices to provide services of the Ministry of National Languages and Social Integration at Provincial Level
decision_details: - on the proposal made by Hon. Vasudeva Nanayakkara, Minister of National Languages and Social Integration, to establish Provincial Offices to provide services to the Public relating to National Languages and Social Integration at Provincial Level, Cabinet approval was granted for the submission of a detailed Project Report covering all Provinces, to the Department of National Planning of the Ministry of Finance and Planning for appraisal and for the provision of funds for the purpose under the Medium Term Expenditure Framework 2014-2016. Some of the activities to be carried out by this office are -monitoring of all language classes in the Province and providing facilities to conduct classes;*    effective assistance for co-ordination and implementation of social integration activities;*    provision of translation and interpretation facilities;*    identification of challenges faced by Public Institutions in implementing the Official Languages Policy of the Government;*    matters relating to the implementation of the Official Languages Policy of the Government; *    language training and co-ordination by the National Institute for Language Education and Training.

title: Amendment to Section 431 of the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979
decision_details: - with a view to avoid unnecessary delays in disposing Court productions accumulated in Court premises, the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, Minister of Justice, to amend Section 431 of the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979, for the period of time given to a person from the date of the notification published in the Court Notice Board and two other public places, to establish a person's claim in respect of a property, the possession of which is unknown, be reduced to 02 months from 06 months, the value of such property to be increased from Rs.2500/- to Rs.25,000/-, and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 147 Housing Units located at No.210-260, Sirimavo Bandaranaike Mawatha, (former Prince of Wales Street), Colombo 14.
decision_details: - there are about 1000 residents residing in the above Housing Scheme consisting of 147 housing units in six buildings constructed long ago.  At present these housing units pose a great danger as they are in a dilapidated condition.  Since these buildings are to undergo major repairs, action is to be taken to relocate the residents in a Housing Scheme around Sirimavo Bandaranaike Mawatha, being constructed by the Urban Development Authority.  The old buildings are to be demolished and it has been proposed to implement a suitable housing project in the said premises, after taking over of the land either by the National Housing Development Authority or by the Condominium Management Authority.   The above proposal made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of Land Blocks from Regional Industrial Estates to set up Industries
decision_details: - Regional Industrial Estates Development Programme is being implemented by the Ministry of Industry and Commerce, with the objective of promoting industries at Regional Level.  The proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, Minister of Industry and Commerce, to allocate blocks of land from Industrial Estates on lease basis to prospective investors, subject to stipulations,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of National Eye Bank of Sri Lanka as a Trust
decision_details: - major causes of blindness worldwide, with the highest prevalence in Asia, are diseases affecting the Cornea.  Asia Cornea Society (ACS) has been formed by leading corneal specialists in Asian countries, contributing significantly towards developing clinical, educational and research programmes aiming at alleviating Asian and global corneal blindness. National Eye Bank of Sri Lanka is a non-profitable organization with a mission to procure and provide donated human eye tissues for sight restoring transplantation procedures as well as providing tissues for research and education.  The proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to convert the existing National Eye Bank of Sri Lanka to a Public Trust by an Act of Parliament and to proceed with matters connected thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of Biometrics (Fingerprints) to the Passport Issuance Process
