decision_details: - this project is to intended to enhance the security features of Passports by streamlining the Automated Fingerprint Identification System. The Total Estimated Cost of the Project is Rs.679.7 million of which Rs.629.7 million is to be provided as a grant by the Australian Government, through the International Organization for Migration which will be responsible for the project management and procurement process, in association with the Department of Immigration and Emigration.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strategic Cities Development Project
decision_details: - the proposed Project is to be implemented in Galle and Kandy as the initial phase of the project.  The assistance of the World Bank will be received for this urban development programme of the Government, to plan, design and develop selected cities and its surrounding areas to facilitate a guided economic transformation of such cities into one of the major regional economic centres for growth and employment generation.  The project is to be commenced in 2013 and completed within a period of three (03) years at a cost of US $200 million.  Some of the salient features of the project are as follows:*    improved urban infrastructure and services at the city centre and peripheral local authority areas of Greater Kandy and Galle cities.*    improved traffic and transport arrangements in both cities.*    improved urban road network to ease the traffic flow in both cities.*    benefits to the urban community by improving drainage facilities and solid waste management systems. Cabinet granted approval to proceed with the project submitted by H.E. the President,  in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development.

title: Bilateral Agreement and Treaty between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the Republic of Belarus
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, Minister of Justice, to sign the above Agreement and the Treaty on Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal matters between Sri Lanka and Belarus during the forthcoming visit of H.E. the President of Sri Lanka to Belarus, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The 5th South Asian Conference on Sanitation (SACOSAN-V) from 21st to 24th  October, 2013
decision_details: - this Conference is scheduled to be held from 21st to 24th  October, 2013 in Nepal and will be attended by the Ministers of Water Supply and Drainage; Health; and Education and Government Officials.  The representatives from the Civil Society, Private Sector Institutions,  Academia and School Children from the South Asian Region viz. Pakistan, India, Nepal, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Maldives, Afghanistan, including Sri Lanka are expected to participate in this International Conference.   Cabinet noted the above information provided by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of  Water Supply and Drainage in this regard.

title: Medium Term Expenditure Framework 2014-2016 and Preparation of Budget 2014
decision_details: - H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, informed the Cabinet of Ministers that the Ministry has already commenced the initial activities relating to the preparation of the Budget 2014.  His Excellency stated that, as a country with a higher economic growth and encouraging development by expanding the infrastructure facilities and strengthening the financial management, the principle target of the strategy is to raise per-capita income over US $4,000.  A large number of projects is being implemented at rural, regional and urban levels covering social, economic and environmental sectors to achieve these targets. 2014 Budget will also give priority for timely completion of such projects to ensure that expected benefits of those projects will reach the general public at the earliest.

title: Construction of Proposed University Complex of National School of Business Management Limited (NSBM) at Homagama
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted for the construction of the proposed University Complex at Homagama to be funded through a loan from the China Development Bank.  The proposal made by Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to award the construction contract of the above to the lowest bid received, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Modernization of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation (SLBC)
decision_details: - according to a concept of H.E. the President it has been proposed to modernize the SLBC under a leading project of the Government.  The objective of this project is to upgrade, while preserving the historic value of the Lanka Broadcasting Corporation, which has commenced its services as the oldest broadcasting service in South Asia in 1924.  The proposal made by Hon. Keheliya Rambukwella, Minister of Mass Media and Information, to obtain architectural consultancy services from the UDA and required funds from the Government Treasury, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Buildings for the Faculty of Management and Finance, University of Ruhuna
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to award the above contract to the next lowest evaluated responsive bidder, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of  Galle Road  and  R. A. De Mel Mawatha  Contract Package ‘A’ (from Galadari Roundabout to Kollupitiya Junction)
decision_details: - Metro Colombo Urban Development Project (MCUDP) has been established under the Ministry of Defence and Urban Development as a World Bank Project funded by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD).  As a part of this project, it has been decided to rehabilitate the above section of the Galle  Road.  The proposal made by H. E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development to award the above contract to the lowest evaluated responsive bidder, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Air Services Agreement between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and Australia
decision_details: - covering approval of the Cabinet was granted for the Amended Text of the Air Services Agreement which has already been signed between the two countries and to take necessary steps for the effective implementation of the said Agreement, as proposed by Hon. Piyankara Jayaratne, Minister of Civil Aviation.

title: Establishment of Rehabilitation Centers for Drug Addicts
decision_details: - drug addiction has become a huge calamity to the society at present. In addition to destroying the state wealth, that has turned into a mechanism of converting energetic youth generation with capabilities into patients.  In 2011, the numbers of imprisonments due to drug addiction were 10,568. 6,165 persons had been imprisoned due to the same offence for the second time and 2,073 for more than two occasions. When considering as a percentage, it amounts to 78%. Bureau of Commissioner General of Rehabilitation which possesses an experienced staff of rehabilitating and reintegrating LTTE ex-combatants will have the competency of rehabilitating drug addicts jointly with the National Dangerous Drugs Control Board.  A proposal made by Hon. Chandrasiri Gajadeera, Minister of Rehabilitation and Prison Reforms for the establishment of Rehabilitation Centers under the Bureau of Commissioner General of Rehabilitation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the Republic of Maldives on Co-operation in the Field of Education
decision_details: -  the proposed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) recognizes the importance of Education and Training in National Development as well as a means to further cultivate ties between their people.  The above proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to sign the above MoU, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Celebration of World Habitat Day 2013 - 07th of October 2013
decision_details: - the 'World Habitat Day' for this year falls on 07th of October.  A Habitat Week from 30th of September to 06th of October has been declared on account of the World Habitat Day.  The proposal made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities, to implement the Programme of events drawn up for the purpose, including development of the village at Laksirigama in the Moratuwa Divisional Secretary's Division, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Agreement between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the Republic of Belarus on Trade and Economic Co-operation
decision_details: - the objective of this Agreement is to further enhance the existing trade and economic relations between the two countries.  The proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, Minister of Industry and Commerce, to sign the above Agreement during the forthcoming visit of H.E. the President of Sri Lanka to Belarus, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Weras Ganga Storm Water Drainage & Environment Improvement Project
decision_details: this project has been formulated by the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation (SLLR&DC) based on a hydrological study carried out by JICA together with SLLR&DC for the preparation of a Master Plan to control flooding in Nugegoda, Rattanapitiya, Borelasgamuwa, Maha Ela and Ratmalana areas.  Implementation of this project will mitigate frequent flooding in Weras Ganga Basin and also promote sustainable development activities and enhance environment improvement which will promote tourism industry in the relevant areas.  The total cost of the project is estimated to be Rs.14,227 million and is scheduled to be completed within 04 years.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the activities relating to loan arrangements for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Contamination of Milk Powder with Dicyandiamide and Whey Protein Concentrate
decision_details: - based on various reports received pertaining to this matter, immediate action has been taken by the Ministry of Health to stop the release of imported milk with Whey Protein Concentrate to the market.  This action has led to many implications.  Therefore, to ensure the availability of adequate amount of milk powder including infant milk formule, increased local milk production, processing and marketing and also nutrition of the society, Cabinet approval was granted for the appointment of a Cabinet Sub-Committee comprising of relevant senior Ministers and Ministers to examine this issue and submit a report to the next meeting of the Cabinet, for consideration.

title: State Visit by H.E. President of Sri Lanka to Seychelles
decision_details: -  Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs  furnished information pertaining to the recent visit of H.E. the President to  Seychelles and covering approval was granted for the Agreements / MoUs concluded between the two countries during the visit.   the leaders of the two countries welcomed the signing of MoUs / Agreements on Bilateral Air Services, Vocational Training and Youth Development.  They also welcomed the enhanced collaboration between the two countries in a broad range of areas such as education, fisheries, trade and investment, judiciary and health.

title: Visit to Tanzania and Participation at the Global 2013 Smart Partnership Dialogue in Dar es Salaam by H.E. the President
decision_details: - in keeping with the Government policy of strengthening the relations with African countries, H.E. the President visited Tanzania and participated at the Global 2013 Smart Partnership Dialogue in Dar es Salaam.  Sri Lanka's economic partnership with African countries has developed beyond trade and investments, reaching areas like knowledge sharing, skills development and technology transfer etc.  Leaders of the two countries expressed their great interest in establishing resident Diplomatic Missions in the respective capitals.  Both leaders witnessed the conclusion of Memoranda of Understanding in the field of tourism cooperation, economic and technical cooperation, and cultural cooperation.  Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs submitted the above information and covering approval was granted by the Cabinet for the concluded Agreements / MoUs.

title: Submission of Gazette Notification issued under the Import and Export Control Act, No.01 of 1969 to Parliament
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to submit the above Gazette Notification, imposing regulations to control exportation and importation of all types of Halogenated Chlorofluorocarbon (HCFC) substances  on a quota system issued by the Ozone Division of the Ministry of Environment, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Amendment of the People’s Bank Act No. 29 of 1961, to increase its Share Capital
decision_details: - over the years, the People's Bank has expanded its branch network throughout the country with the objective of strengthening its business operations in the region.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation to increase the Share Capital of the Bank, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Amendments to the Regulation of Insurance Industry Act, No.43 of 2000
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation pertaining to the above Act, was approved by the Cabinet.  The salient feature of the proposed amendment is that, insurers who are engaged in carrying on both long term insurance business and general insurance business, under the valid license issued by the Insurance Board of Sri Lanka (IBSL), are required to segregate the two businesses within four years from the date of coming into operation of the Act, into two companies, one to carry on life insurance and the other to carry on general insurance.

title: Financial Assistance from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) for the Implementation of Greater Colombo Water Supply and Waste Water Management Improvement Programme - Tranche 2
decision_details: - ADB has agreed to provide financial assistance in a sum of US $300 for this programme which consists of 04 Tranches.  The purpose of this programme is to improve the water service efficiency in the Greater Colombo area.  Two stages of this project are expected to be implemented and completed over the period from 2012 to 2018.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Agreement between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of the Republic of Belarus for the Avoidance of Double Taxation and the Prevention of Fiscal Evasion with respect to Taxes of Income
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President,  in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to sign the above Agreement at Government level and to present it in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of Sahaspura Housing Scheme, Baseline Road, Borella and Sinhapura Flats Housing Scheme
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities, to proceed with the activities of the above at a cost of Rs. 75.96 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of Multi Storeyed Housing Schemes - Nagamu Puravara 2013
decision_details: - Rupees 1000 million has been allocated by the General Treasury to the National Housing Development Authority (NHDA) for the renovation of apartment housing complexes under the “Nagamu Puravara Programmes - 2013” and it is expected to renovate 25 housing schemes under this Programme.  Work on housing schemes up to the value of Rs.300 million has already commenced.  The proposal made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities, to award the renovation activities of 17 housing schemes located within the Colombo Municipal area to the State Engineering Corporation, utilizing the funds already allocated, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Hambantota Port Development Project
decision_details: - the Sri Lanka Ports Authority has prepared a Business Plan to identify business ventures that could be undertaken in the Hambantota Port Development Project.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to award the following business ventures to the respective bidders as recommended by the  Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee (CANC), and subject to stipulations, was approved by the Cabinet:*    Advance Surfactants India Ltd. - lease of land to establish a Plant for the manufacture of Petroleum, Petrochemicals and Chemicals;*    Laugfs Gas PLC - lease of land to establish a LPG Storage and Distribution Plant;*    Laugfs Holdings Ltd. - lease of land to establish a Lubricants Blending Plant with a capacity of 50,000 MT per annum;*    Energy World International Ltd. -  lease of land to establish an "elengee" LNG Hub Terminal; and*    Rank Container Terminal Ltd. -  lease of land to establish a Petro-chemical Storage and Transshipment Facility.

title: Awarding of Six Contracts under the Programme funded by the Local Banks for the Rehabilitation of National Highways through Domestic Contractors - Stage 2
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to award the following contracts for rehabilitation/widening/improvements to National Highways as recommended by the  Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet:*    Hasalaka - Handungamuwa - Hettipola Road (B 484) from 0.00 km to 20.00 km;*    Kelanimulla - Mulleriyawa - Koswatta Road - Phase I - construction of a viaduct and approach from 0.00 km to 0.60 km;*    Kurunegala -Narammala - Madampe Road from 22.26 km to 40.87 km;*    Seeduwa - Katunayake Road from 0.00 km to 3.90 km and Seeduwa to Udugampola from 0.00 km to 11.70 km;*    Jaffna - Ponnalai - Point Pedro Road 1.5 km between 28.5 km to 31.5 km;*    Road Network associated with development of Defence Headquarters Project at Akuregoda.

title: Declaration of the National Day for Technical, Vocational Education and Training
decision_details: - it has been observed that the enthusiasm in State and Private Sector Training Institutions as well as in the Industrial Sector for the competent work course has resulted in the socio-economic development of the country and accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to declare July 15th as the National Day for Technical, Vocational Education and Training, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Tertiary and Vocational Education Act
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to instruct the Legal Draftsman, to draft amending legislation to the Tertiary and Vocational Education Act, No.20 of 1990, as proposed in the Memorandum, subject to incorporating the amendments recommended by the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Legislation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commencing  a Government School within the Prison Premises for Young Inmates
decision_details: - on the joint proposal made by Hon. Chandrasiri Gajadheera, Minister of Rehabilitation and Prison Reforms and Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to provide education to young inmates of Prisons who have been sentenced for long periods, to enable them to be good citizens when leaving Prisons, Cabinet approval was granted to set up a school in Watareka Prison jointly by the Ministries of Rehabilitation and Prison Reforms; and Education, with a view to developing the literacy rate and vocational skills of prison inmates.

title: Implementation of the Second Health Sector Development Project funded by the World Bank
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, for the implementation of the Second Health Sector Development Project at National and Provincial levels, utilizing US $200 million to be received from the International Development Association (IDA) for a five (05) year period from 2013 to 2017, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Gazette Notification issued under the Import and Export Control Act No.1 of 1969 to Parliament
decision_details: - according to available statistics there has been a paddy surplus of 1,467,545 MT in 2012 and in addition, production of crops such as maize, green gram, cowpea, soya bean has increased and measures have been taken by the authorities concerned for the timely supply of fertilizer, seeds, water, loan facilities, new technological equipment, stores facilities etc.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to submit the Gazette Extraordinary No.1819/32 dated 2013-07-18, to repeal the Regulations laid down in the Gazette Extraordinary No.1764/9 dated  2012-06-27 to restrict exportation of rice under the Import and Export Control Act No.1 of 1969, to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the Ministry of Textiles of India and the Ministry of Industry and Commerce of Sri Lanka on Cooperation in the Development of SMEs in Handloom, Powerloom and Textiles
decision_details: - the objective of this MoU is to expand the business and cooperation in the development of Small and Medium Enterprises in handloom, powerloom and textiles.  The MoU has been jointly prepared by both parties and will remain in force for five years from the date of signing and could be renewed every five years.  The proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, Minister of Industry and Commerce, to sign the above MoU and to proceed with the relevant activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Refurbishment of Parliamentary Complex and Construction of a Residential Housing  Complex  for  Members  of  Parliament
decision_details: -  the  proposal  made  by Hon. D.M. Jayaratne, the Prime Minister, to appoint a Technical Evaluation Committee and a Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee, to evaluate proposals and negotiate costs to refurbish the Parliament Building and construct a new Housing Complex at Thalapathpitiya  with the required amenities, for Members of Parliament, and to obtain the services of  M/s. Sumitomo Mitsui Construction Co. Ltd. which constructed the Parliament Building in 1982, as approved by the Staff Advisory Committee of  Parliament,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Second Asian Productivity Organization (APO) Workshop - 2013 to be held in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Asian Productivity Organization is a Japan based International Organization which is assisting its member countries to enhance productivity in the fields of Industry and Agriculture.   At present 20 countries in the Asia Pacific Region including Sri Lanka, have obtained its membership.  Of the two workshops scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka for 2013, the first was held from 03rd to 07th June 2013.  The second workshop on Developing Farming System for Mitigating Climate Change is to be held in Sri Lanka from 26th to 30th August 2013.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, to proceed with the activities relating to the second workshop, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Roof Cover for the Maligavila Buddha Statue
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon.(Dr.) Jagath Balasuriya, Minister of National Heritage, to construct a permanent roof cover for the Maligavila Buddha Statue, located 15 km away from Buttala town, utilizing Rs.15 million provided by the Central Cultural Fund to the Ministry, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Southern Transport Development Project - Construction of South Section from Pinnaduwa to Godagama
decision_details: - Rehabilitation of National Highways Leading to Southern Expressway -  the Government has obtained a loan from China Exim Bank towards the cost for the construction of Southern Section of the Southern Expressway from Pinnaduwa to Matara.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to utilize the savings of the above loan to rehabilitate the undermentioned National Highways which lead to the Southern Expressway, was approved by the Cabinet.*    B465    -    Weligama - Kananke Road    -    9.6 km*    B466    -    Weligama - Thelijjawila Road    -    7.7 km*    B578    -    Dorape - Hiyare            -    8.7 km

title: Proposed Investment Promotion Zone (IPZ) at Suriyawewa, Hambantota set up by Board of Investment of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Investment Promotion, to lease out blocks of land to investors for Mixed Development Projects including Residential Apartment Complexes within the Master Plan of the Suriyawewa Investment Promotion Zone, subject to the laid down stipulations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Deyata Kirula National Exhibition 2014
decision_details: - Construction of E-laboratories in Kurunegala and Puttalam Districts - the Ministry of Telecommunication and Information Technology has decided to establish 75 E-laboratories in the Kurunegala District and 50 in the Puttalam District, parallel to the Deyata Kirula National Development Programme and Exhibition 2014.  Of these E-laboratories, 25 in the Kurunegala District and 15 in the Puttalam District will be constructed in 2013 and the remaining 85 in 2014. The proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, Minister of Telecommunication and Information Technology, to proceed with the above activities at a cost of Rs.168 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Suitable Land for the Establishment of the University College, Matara
decision_details: - the objective of establishing University Colleges is to expand the intake capacity for the Diploma level programmes of National Vocational Qualifications (NVQ) and produce middle level technicians to meet the industry demands of the country. The proposed University Colleges are scheduled to be commenced from January 2014. One such University College is intended to be setup in Matara in a land located at Maddewatta, Matara which belongs to the Food Department under the Ministry of Co-operatives and Internal Trade. The proposal made by Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to pursue action on this matter, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Hosting the International Conference on  ‘Better Air Quality (BAQ) – 2014’  and 8th Regional Environmentally Sustainable Transport (EST) Forum in Asia, in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - this Conference provides a platform for the largest gathering of air quality management expertise in Asia to discuss on sustainable transport, energy, industry, clean fuels and efficient vehicles, air quality and climate change with special emphasis on Government policies and measures.  In addition to the above, the Organizers of the Regional Environmentally Sustainable Transport (EST) Forum in Asia has officially announced that the 8th EST Forum in Asia will also be held in Sri Lanka from 29th September to 03rd October 2014 in parallel with the above Conference.  The proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Environment and Renewable Energy, to proceed with the relevant activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Release of Land from Palmyrah Model Farm at Weerawila for Export Production Village
decision_details: - the Palmyrah Development Board has established a Palmyrah Model Farm in a land of approximately 23 acres in the Hambantota District.  The proposal made by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development, to make available half of the extent of the land for the Export Production Village functioning under the Hambantota Development Foundation, for the cultivation of vegetables and fruits, where a large number of females from adjoining areas have been provided employment,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing Training Opportunities for the Foreign Officers at the Defence Services Command and Staff College
decision_details: - this College was inaugurated in 2007 and provides training facilities to Middle Level Officers of the three Armed Forces and the Police.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to provide opportunities to personnel of similar status in countries such as India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Maldives, Nepal, China, Malaysia, Indonesia, Rwanda, Senagal and Sudan for  training at this college, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 'Galawatta Land' Development Project at Panadura
decision_details: - Panadura town is one of the main commercial and service centres in the Kalutara District.  The Galawatta Land is located at the entrance to the Panadura Town Centre and it is proposed to develop it as a public square.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to relocate the families and 35 commercial units to be displaced, commence the project with Rs.25 million made available in 2013 and complete the project in 2014 with the balance funds amounting to Rs.40 million to be provided, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Policy and Regulatory Framework for Next Generation Networks in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Next Generation Networks (NGNs) carry all types of services, including voice, video and e-mail, on a common platform.  This 'network convergence' allows operators to save money by having to maintain only one network platform and to provide new services that combine different types of data.  NGNs are more versatile than traditional networks because they do not have to be physically upgraded to support new types of services.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, to adopt the Policy and Regulatory Framework for Next Generation Networks in Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: H.E. the President's State Visit to the People's Republic of China
decision_details:
- H.E. the President paid a State Visit to the People's Republic of China recently.  From a bilateral point of view, the visit was highly successful due to the following:   *  the leaders of the two countries agreed to strengthen co-operation in maritime security, combating piracy, search and rescue and navigation safety.  *  in the economic sphere, a major breakthrough was achieved when both leaders endorsed a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) between the two countries, which would help Sri Lanka to advance its market access to the second largest luxury market in the world with a population of more than 1.3 billion. This would also bring more benefits to Sri Lanka in the investment sector and also pave the way to enhance Chinese tourist arrivals in Sri Lanka. 

*  China extended further grant assistance in a sum of RMB Yuan 200 million which will be utilized for building an International Convention Centre in Kandy and an Arts Theatre in Anuradhapura.

*  the construction of the National School of Business Management at Homagama will also commence with the assistance of China.  

*  the leaders also agreed to promote people to people contacts, strengthen exchanges and co-operation in education, culture, religion, press, radio, television and other areas, and intensify contacts between women, civil groups and academic institutions.

*  China assured assistance for agricultural development and offered small machineries to Sri Lanka, as a means of further capacity building co-operation. 

*  the leaders also agreed to further strengthen exchanges and co-operation in the areas of aerospace co-operation, telecommunication and broadcasting, disaster management, tsunami monitoring, environmental protection and other areas to serve economic growth and social progress in both countries.

title: International Conference on Water Co-operation for Community Development - August 2013
decision_details: this Conference is to be held from 16th to 18th August 2013 in Anuradhapura under the Chairmanship of Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage. The Conference is convened to mark this years' UN declared theme 'International Year of Water Co-operation'.  The objective of this Conference is to provide a platform for sharing knowledge, strategies and best practices and to promote dialogue, mutual understanding and co-operation among communities managing their water schemes.  Sri Lanka has over 15 years of experience in promoting community organizations to provide their own water supply for drinking and sanitation facilities through community water supply and sanitation projects. Over 3500 community based organizations that were formed to implement the projects are now empowered to manage, operate and maintain these systems with the support of the National Community Water Trust (NCWT) and the National Water Supply and Drainage Board.  About 500 delegates from India, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Nepal, Bhutan, Afghanistan and Maldives are expected to participate at the Conference.   The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to proceed with the relevant activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Institute of Policy Studies of Sri Lanka (Amendment) Bill
decision_details: - the proposal made by H. E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to present the Institute of Policy Studies of Sri Lanka (Amendment) Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman, in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Building adjoining the existing building in the premises of the General Treasury
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to Construct a New Building adjoining the existing building in the premises of the General Treasury with the view to providing additional accommodation needed, to commence the construction work with the financial provision of Rs.575 million allocated in the Budget Estimate for 2013 and the balance provision to be provided in 2014 and 2015, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transit/Duty Free Shopping Area Expansion Stage II at Bandaranaike International Airport at Katunayake
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Piyankara Jayaratna, Minister of Civil Aviation, to award the above procurement, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Convention against Doping in Sports Bill
decision_details: - an International Convention against Doping in Sport has been adopted in October 2005 at the General Conference of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) and the Government of Sri Lanka has acceded to the said Convention in March 2011.   The objective of the Convention is to  promote the prevention of doping in sport, with a view to its elimination. The proposal made by Hon. Mahindananda Aluthgamage, Minister of Sports, to publish the Draft Bill, after incorporating the amendments recommended by the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Legislation, in the Gazette and to submit it to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of New Railway Line from Matara to Kataragama - Stages II and III
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted to proceed with Stage I of the Project relating to the construction of a new railway line from Matara to Beliatta.  With regard to the Second Stage of the Project from Beliatta to Kataragama, it has been proposed to shift the new railway line towards inland, to secure natural habitat in the coastal belt further and to minimize the damages to be caused to the Public  and property.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Kumara Welgama, Minister of Transport, to conduct a feasibility study and an environment impact assessment for the purpose of construction of a new railway line from Beliatta to Hambantota and Kataragama, connecting Hambantota at a suitable place covering Angunakolapelassa, Wetiya Junction, Andarawewa, Mattala and Lunugamvehera, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a four storeyed new building for the W.A. Silva Building which was damaged due to a landslide and modernization of the damaged main hall adjacent to it in Ke/St. Joseph's Balika Vidyalaya, Kegalle
decision_details: - this school has a student population of about 4500 and is situated in close proximity to the Kandy - Colombo Road.  Due to a landslide which occurred recently, W.A. Silva Hall adjacent to the side wall of the school had to be demolished and a part of the main hall had also been removed. The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) had inspected the location and submitted its recommendations on measures to be taken by the Ministry of Education. It is proposed to construct a new four storeyed building and renovate the partly damaged building.  The proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to proceed with the construction work, managing the expenditure involved for 2013 within the provisions already allocated and the balance to be sought in 2014, and to commence construction work after the retention wall of the school is constructed by the Road Development Authority in keeping with the accepted standards, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Indiscriminate usage of Chemical Fertilizer and Agro Chemicals; and the prevailing Kidney related diseases in the North Central Province
decision_details: - the use of Chemical Fertilizer and Agro Chemicals was introduced to the country with the objective of increasing crop productivity and ensuring food security and although near self sufficiency has been achieved due to the usage of same, it has been observed that the country is experiencing some adverse effects of same such as damage to bio-diversity, contamination of water and soil due to chemical substances etc., leading to various health problems, particularly such as Kidney related diseases in the North Central Province.  Recommendations on measures to be adopted in this regard were submitted by the Cabinet Sub-Committee chaired by  Hon. Athauda Seneviratne, Minister (Senior) for Rural Affairs and attended by 13 Ministers.  Secretaries to the relevant Ministries and 58 Scientists were also involved in the deliberations.  Proposals submitted in this regard by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture were also taken into consideration.  There are 19 long term measures and 10 short terms measures recommended in the relevant report. The recommendations were approved by the Cabinet for implementation, giving due consideration to the observations made in this regard by the Minister of Finance and Planning; and the Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities.  A Cabinet Sub-Committee and an Officials' Committee were appointed to monitor the implementation of the recommendations.

title: Purchase of paddy harvest of the Maha 2012/13 and Yala 2013 and selling of purchased paddy stocks
decision_details: - the estimated paddy production of Maha 2012/2013 was around 2.72 million MT, and the production has increased by 10% in Mannar and Vavuniya Districts, 42% in Hambantota District and 55% in Kurunegala District.   A sum of Rs.899 million has been released as advances to the District Secretaries of the relevant Districts for the purchase of paddy and the stock of paddy purchased as at 30th June, 2013 stands at 22,705 MT.  Harvesting of paddy of the Yala Season 2013 commences towards the end of July, 2013.  Pledge loan facilities to be provided by the State Banks to the Paddy Marketing Board to purchase paddy in Yala 2013 amounts to Rs.1650 million.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the relevant activities, and to authorize the Secretary to the Treasury to allocate Rs.1500 million for the purchase of paddy of Yala 2013 from the Revolving Fund of the General Treasury, since the anticipated paddy production of Yala 2013 is greater than that of 2012 in the Districts affected by the drought in Yala 2012, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme funded by the Local Banks for the Rehabilitation of National Highways through Domestic Contractors - Award of Contracts
decision_details: - the proposals made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, for the rehabilitation of the following highways/bridges through domestic contractors, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), with funds to be provided by the local Banks, were approved by the Cabinet:* 	Kalugamuwa - Wilakatupotha Road (B 190) from 0 - 21.180 km*	Kadawatha - Nittambuwa on Colombo - Kandy Road (A 1)  - 23.00 km*	Road Section from Nittambuwa to Kandy on Colombo - Kandy Road (A 1) - 40.54 km to 114.50 km; and Road Section from Galle to Deniyaya (A 17) - 78.20 km

title: Construction of the Nuwara-Eliya High Altitude Sports Complex
decision_details: - this project proposal includes a 400 meter and 200 meter synthetic running tracks, 400 meter natural running track, two pavilions, a cricket ground, an indoor-stadium, swimming pools, training centers and villas along with accommodation facilities for 200 persons to be built within a period of 5 years.  The total cost of the project is US $115 million.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahindananda Aluthgamage, Minister of Sports, to appoint a Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee (CANC) and a Technical Evaluation Committee (TEC) to evaluate the Project Proposal received, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Expeditious Project of constructing sixty hostels for University Students
decision_details: - there are 17 Universities, inclusive of 02 Buddhist Universities, functioning in the country and the student population at these Universities is about 92,000.  Considering the need to provide hostel facilities to a large number of students of these Universities, it has been proposed to construct 60 buildings in conformity with the modern technology, covering the 17 Universities in two stages to be completed within 02 years.  Each of these buildings will consist of 04 stories with 100 rooms so as to provide hostel facilities to 200 students, acceding 12,000 students will be benefited on completion of this Project.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to proceed with the Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Dry Zone Urban Water and Sanitation Project
decision_details: - Tender for Supply and Laying of  HDPE, DI, PVC Pipes, Specials, Fittings and Valves for Transmission Main and Distribution System in Puttalam Water Supply Scheme - this Project is being implemented by the National Water Supply and Drainage Board, with funds provided by the Asian Development Bank and the Government of Sri Lanka.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the contract for the supply of above items as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tender for Supply Auto - Disable Syringes 0.05ml, Disposable, for BCG Needle: 27G x 12mm (1,500,000 Nos), Auto - Disable Syringes 0.5ml Needle: 23G x 25mm (12,000,000 Nos), Auto - Disable Syringes for Reconstitution of BCG, 2ml Needle: 21G x 40MM (150,000 Nos), Auto - Disable Syringes 5ml for Re-constitutions Needle: 21G x 40mm (1,200,000 Nos)
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to award all items of this tender to the lowest responsive bidder as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Award of Construction Contract of Morana Reservoir in Badulla District to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB)
decision_details: - under this Project, it is proposed to construct a dam across Ulhiti Oya and divert water through a feeder canal to Rotagolla Tank and augment the irrigation supplies of the Nagadeepa  Scheme, which is a major Irrigation Scheme maintained by the Irrigation Department.  This Irrigation Scheme undergoes a severe water shortage during both seasons. The total cost of the Project is estimated to be Rs.1760 million, and an allocation of Rs.300 million has been provided in 2013 to commence the work of the Project.  The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management, to entrust the work to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB) as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Trincomalee Outer Circular Road Project
decision_details: - Proposal Submitted by the Hunan Road & Bridge Construction Group Corporation of the People’s Republic of China - Trincomalee has been identified to be developed as a Metro City in the Eastern Region and the construction of an Outer Circular Road to the city of Trincomalee is considered essential to provide proper accessibility from various directions.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Review Committee (SCARC), was approved by the Cabinet.  Preliminary work of the project is to be commenced on a priority basis with funds allocated for the year 2013 and the balance will be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2014-2016.

title: Reconstruction of Polduwa Bridge on Kollupitiya
decision_details: - Sri Jayawardenepura Road  under Regional Bridge Project -  Phase II - with Financial Assistance from the British Government  - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, award the reconstruction of the above bridge at a cost of GBP 10,739,262 as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Integrated Treasury Management Information System (ITMIS) for the Ministry of Finance and Planning.
decision_details: - the ITMIS is mainly aimed at automating key Departments of the General Treasury/Ministry of Finance and Planning and will cut across various functions of General Treasury activities ensuring proper and effective management in revenue administration and integrated treasury operations.  The ITMIS will support institutional strengthening focusing primarily on the procurement of an integrated software system to automate the treasury operations.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, for the award of the contract relating to the Software System for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet. Programme funded by the Local Banks for the Rehabilitation of National Highways through Domestic Contractors - Award of Contracts - the proposals made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, for the rehabilitation of the following highways/bridges through domestic contractors, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), with funds to be provided by the local Banks, were approved by the Cabinet:*    Kalugamuwa - Wilakatupotha Road (B 190) from 0 - 21.180 km*    Kadawatha - Nittambuwa on Colombo - Kandy Road (A 1)  - 23.00 km*    Road Section from Nittambuwa to Kandy on Colombo - Kandy Road (A 1) - 40.54 km to 114.50 km; and Road Section from Galle to Deniyaya (A 17) - 78.20 km

title: Rehabilitation of Galle Road and R.A. De Mel Mawatha from Bambalapitiya to City Limits
decision_details: - the Metro Colombo Urban Development Project has been established under the Ministry of Defence and Urban Development as a World Bank Project funded by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD).  The loan received from IBRD is expected to be utilized for various development projects in the Metro Colombo Region, and a part of it is to be utilized to rehabilitate the Galle Road and R.A. De Mel Mawatha from Bambalapitiya to City Limits.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 'Pilisaru' National Solid Waste Management Project
decision_details: - the 'Pilisaru' project has completed 5 major composting projects having capacity between 10 - 50 MT per day, which contribute immensely to the systematic management of solid waste in the respective local authority areas.  A sanitary landfill is under construction in the Dompe Divisional Secretariat area in the Gampaha District through a grant from the Republic of Korea.  The proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Environment and Renewable Energy, to obtain additional funding for the purpose; and to extend the duration of the project from January 2014 to December 2018, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting of Sri Lanka-Certificate in Information Technology (SL-CIT) Course through the National Online Distance Education Service (NODES), which is functioning under the purview of the Ministry of Higher Education
decision_details: -  action has been taken to conduct the above course through the National Online Distance Education Service (NODES) which is functioning under the purview of the Ministry of Higher Education. Opportunities have been created for Sri Lankan students throughout the Island as well as to foreign students to follow the online educational courses conducted by the NODES.  This course has been developed for self-studying in all three languages of Sinhala, Tamil and English and it is expected to conduct the course in all three languages at NODES centres and on completion of this course, measures have been taken to facilitate on line examinations which are conducted under the supervision of the NODES.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to proceed with the activities of the above, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Regulatory and Supervisory Framework for Microfinance Institutions (MFIs) in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposed Regulatory and Supervisory Framework will be applicable to Microfinance Institutions  which accepts deposits from the Public and will consist of a three tier system as follows:*    Tier I - Large MFIs to come under the direct supervision and examination by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL);*    Tier II - Small MFIs to come under the supervision and examination by CBSL approved Audit Firms;*    Tier III - Institutions falling under the Commissioner of Cooperative Development and Registrar of Cooperative Societies, Divineguma Department and Board of Management of Divineguma Community Based Bank and Banking Societies and the Commissioner General of Agrarian Development will be exempted from the CBSL regulation and will come under the regulation and supervision of the Authorities already empowered under the relevant Statutes.Some of the salient features are -*    no person other than a licensed MFI and an exempted entity can carry on microfinance business after the enactment of the proposed Act;*    provisions of the proposed Act will not apply to Banks licensed under the Banking Act, No. 30 of 1988, Finance Companies licensed under the Finance Business Act, No. 42 of 2011 and Community Based Organizations established with social objectives and engaged in microfinance business, as determined by the CBSL; and*    Registered Cooperative Societies , entities formed in terms of the Agrarian Development Act, No. 46 of 2000 and Organizations established under the Divineguma Act, No.1 of 2013 are exempted from the application of the provisions of the proposed Act.The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to present the relevant Bill in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 'Deyata Kirula' National Exhibition and Development Program - 2014
decision_details: - this programme is to be implemented covering Kurunegala, Puttalam and Kegalle Districts  and the National Exhibition will be held in the premises of Wayamba University, Technical College and Central College in Kuliyapitiya, in parallel with the  Independence Day - 2014.  The programme is implemented with the following objectives:*    implementation of projects aimed at fulfilling community needs at Family, Village and Area Levels;*    implementation of projects that can be completed within a shorter period of time, taking into consideration the people's needs;*    addressing various administrative problems and public grievances in the area by government officials;The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the programme of work in collaboration with all Ministries and Institutions under their purview, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Development of the Construction, Operation and Maintenance of a Length of 100 km on the proposed Northern Expressway for Enderamulla-Mirigama-Ambepussa Section and Mirigama - Kurunegala Section and Associated Property Development and Transport Logistic Facilities
decision_details: the Northern Expressway has been identified for implementation in the National Road Master Plan for 2007 - 2017. Phase I of this Expressway consists of four stages as follows:*    Stage  I  - Enderamulla to Ambepussa via Mirigama - 53 km*    Stage II  - Mirigama to Pellendeniya (Kurunegala)    - 39 km*    Stage III - Ambepussa to Kandy  - 46 km*     Stage IV - Pellendeniya to Dambulla        - 62 kmThe Project is to be fully funded by China Merchants Holdings (International) Company Limited and China Merchants Huajian Highway Investment Company Limited.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, for the appointment of a Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee (CANC) and a Project Committee (PC) to evaluate the Project Proposals, for the planning, designing, financing, construction and operation of the Stages I and II of the above project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Financial  assistance  from  the  Asian  Development  Bank (ADB) for  the implementation of the Southern Road Connectivity Project
decision_details: a loan of US$ 75 million (approximately 9.6 billion) is to be obtained from the Asian Development Bank for the improvements of 5 access roads to the Southern Expressway.  In addition 33.5 km of the following 5 National Highways linking to 3 interchanges of the Southern Expressway are to be improved under this project:*    Moratuwa - Piliyandala - 2.5 km*     Ratmalana - Mirihana   - 2.1 km*    Southern Expressway  - Mathugama - 12.4 km*    Kirulapona - Homagama - 2.1 km*    Kesbewa - Pokunuwita  -  14.4 kmThe above proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a roof cover for the ancient Aukana Buddha Statue
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Jagath Balasuriya, Minister of National Heritage, to construct a permanent roof cover for the long term conservation of the ancient Aukana Buddha Statue, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Deyata Kirula National Exhibition 2014
decision_details: this exhibition which is to be commenced on 4th February 2014, will be held at the premises of Wayamba University, Technical College and Central College of Kuliyapitiya. Permanent buildings to suit the needs of the exhibition and which could be used by these educational institutions after the exhibition, are to be constructed in these premises.  The proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, Minister of Telecommunication and Information Technology, to proceed with the relevant activities in association with other government institutions involved, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of 81 Nos. Small Buses for Rural Areas on Repeat Order Basis
decision_details: the Ministry of Transport has already purchased 200 Nos. 33 seater buses as per the Cabinet decision of 2013-01-17, to be used for rural areas.  The proposal made by Hon. Kumara Welgama, Minister of Transport, to award the above procurement to M/s. Lanka Ashok Leyland PLC as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entrusting the Printing of Required School Text Books to Private Printing Institutions to be Distributed for the year - 2014
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to entrust the printing of 27,611,500 copies of 315 Textbook categories to 21 Printing Institutions at a cost of Rs.1,587,958,705.00, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC),  for distribution among school children and student monks   for the year 2014, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Elephant Pass Station in the name of "Senehasaka Thotupala" with the contribution of students and teachers of Government Schools
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to construct  the  Elephant Pass Railway Station, comprising of a passenger terminal, rest rooms for passengers, restaurant etc., with the concurrence of the Ministry of Transport, utilizing funds amounting to Rs.15.5 million being contributions made by the  teachers and students under the purview of the Ministry of Education, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Hambantota Waste Water Disposal Project
decision_details: considering the need of a proper sewerage infrastructure which is a prime requisite for Hambantota due to the large scale development activities taking place in the area, the proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage,  to award the contract  for the above project, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tender for Supply 170,000 Vials of Meropenem for Injection - BP/USP, 1G Vial
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to award the above tender to the lowest responsive bidder as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Asian Development Bank funded Northern Road Connectivity Project
decision_details: the Government of Sri Lanka has received a loan of US $98 million from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) towards the cost of rehabilitation and improvement of around 120 km of national highways under the Northern Road Connectivity Project.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, for the rehabilitation of the following road sections as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet:*    Vavunia - Horowupathana Road (A 29) -  24.00 km to 34.95 km*    Medawachchiya - Road (B 283) - 0 to 12.6 km*    Medawachchiya - Kebithigollewa Road (B 283) - 12.6 km to 25.4km*    Kebithigollewa - Padaviya Road (B 211) - 0 to 15.5 km*    Kebithigollewa - Padaviya Road (B211)-  15.5km - 31.345 km

title: Programme funded by the Local Banks for the Rehabilitation of National Highways through Domestic Contractors - Award of Contracts
decision_details: the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, for the rehabilitation of the following highways/bridges through domestic contractors, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), with funds to be provided by the local Banks, was approved by the Cabinet:*    Mirijjawila - Sooriyawewa Road  - 23.3 km and Outer Circular Road - 6.6 km of Hambantota Hub Development Project;*    Lunugamvehera - Kataragama Road - 13.82 km*    Kurunegala - Narammala - Madampe Road - 40.87 km to 64.77 km*    Construction of  a two lane bridge across Deduru Oya at Kadigawa*    Kadawalagedara - Withikuliya Road - 14 km

title: Town Centre Development at Kegalle
decision_details: Relocation of SLTB Bus Depot and Development of Central Bus Stand - the existing bus stands are located in 03 locations creating traffic congestion in the Kegalle town.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to shift the existing bus depot to the land identified in Paragammana and the proposed bus stand to be developed in the existing depot land, to provide better facilities to the general public in Kegalle town and to allocate funds for the purpose, from 2013 to 2016, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Act, No. 2 of 1996
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Rajitha Senaratne, Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, to submit the Fisheries and Aquatic Resources (Amendment) Bill to Parliament, after incorporating the amendments recommended by the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Legislation, and obtaining the clearance of the Attorney General for same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of 04 New National Schools in Kilinochchi and Mullaitivu Districts
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to grant the status of National Schools to Kilinochchi M.M.V. and Mulangavil M.M.V. in the Kilinochchi District and Vidiyananda College and M/Mallavi M.M.V. in the Mullaitivu District and to develop them through absorbing into the 1000 Secondary Schools Development Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Existing Regulations on Standards of Training, Certification and Watch Keeping for Seafarers (STCW) with Manila Amendment - 2010
decision_details: the Training  Certification and Watch Keeping for Seafarers (STCW) is being carried out in accordance with the International Convention on Standards of Training, Certification and Watch Keeping for Seafarers.  These Regulations have since been amended and the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to publish the new Regulations under the Merchant Shipping Act No.52 of 1971, in the Government Gazette and enforce such Regulations with effect from 2013-07-01, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of a Land at Hyde Park Corner, Colombo 02 to the People’s Property Development Company Ltd.
decision_details: A Subsidiary Company of People’s Bank for Office Complex and Staff Training Centre - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to lease out the block of land referred to above belonging to the Urban Development Authority, to the People’s Property Development Company Ltd., to construct a multi-storeyed building complex to house their Staff Training Centre and for the Office of People's Leasing Company, subject to stipulations made by the General Treasury, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Recommendations of the Finance Commission for the Financial Year 2013
decision_details: the proposal made by H.E. the President, to give effect to the recommendations of the Finance Commission on the apportionment of funds to Provinces allocated by the Annual Budget and setting out other administrative measures that need to be adopted; and to present the said recommendations to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Export of excess paddy stocks of the Paddy Marketing Board
decision_details: the Paddy Marketing Board expects to purchase around 75,000 to 100,000 MT. of paddy from the total harvest of Yala Season towards end of July, 2013.  With the view to make available the storage facilities required for the purpose, the proposal made by Hon. Johnston Fernando, Minister of Co-operatives and Internal Trade, to convert 50,000 MT. of paddy available in stores, to rice and sell them to foreign countries, after retaining a buffer stock of 50,000 MT. of paddy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Mid Year Fiscal Position Report - 2013
decision_details: the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning to submit the Mid Year Fiscal Position Report 2013 to Parliament, in terms of the provisions of the Fiscal Management (Responsibility) Act, No.3 of 2003, was approved by the Cabinet.  This Report includes information on government revenue, expenditure, cash flow activities and borrowings within the first four (04) months of 2013 and also contains data on macro economic performance, foreign financing, government debt and external sector performance.

title: The Annual Performance Report, 2012 of the Ministry of Economic Development
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minister of Economic Development, to present the above Annual Performance Report to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.  Some of the salient features are as follows:*    'Divi Neguma' National Programme - this programme was implemented under the Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries and Enterprise Development Sectors and a sum of Rs.2912.98 million had been spent in 2012 for the entire programme.*    Agricultural Sector - a sum of Rs.1559.81 million had been spent in 2012 for the supply of inputs such as, seeds and plants etc. for this sector.*    Livestock Sector - a sum of Rs.365 million had been spent in 2012 for this sector.*    Social Security - Samurdhi Programme - a sum of Rs.10,553 million had been distributed among 1,549,107 families in 2012 for the upliftment of living standards of low income groups.*    Programmes have also been implemented under the 'Gama Neguma' and 'Pura Neguma' Projects in 2012.*    Development and renovation works in the Northern and Easter Provinces - a sum of Rs.3310.93 million had been invested for the development of roads in the Northern Province, and Rs.1,149.83 million for such works in the Eastern Province.  Rs.717.24 million was spent for the supply of electricity in the Districts of Jaffna, Kilinochchi and Mullaitivu.

title: Local Authorities Filling of Vacancies (Special Provisions) Bill
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. A.L.M. Athaullah, Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils, to submit the above Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.  This amendment is for the purpose of filling of vacancies in the Office of Mayor, Deputy Mayor or a Member, elected to any Local Authority under the provisions of the Local Authorities Elections Ordinance (Chapter 262).

title: Construction of a Four Storied Resource Center and an Auditorium for the Ministry of Public Administration and Home Affairs
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to proceed with the construction of the above project at an estimated cost of Rs.271.7 million with funds to be made available under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2014 - 2016 and to select a contractor for the purpose through limited competitive bidding process, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Kirama - Katuwana Integrated Water Supply Project
decision_details: this project area is situated in the Hambantota District and it covers 34 Grama Niladhari Divisions of the Katuwana and Walasmulla Divisional Secretaries' Divisions.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract for a sum of Euro11,139,931.64 as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Review Committee (SCARC) and to request the General Treasury to allocate funds to meet the local funding requirement,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Project for completion of the new Maternity Hospital Galle with the financial assistance of Euro 28 Million from the KfW Bank (Kreditanstalt fur Weideraufbau) of Germany - The Helmut Kohl
decision_details: Galle Maternity Hospital Foundation initiated for the construction of a new Maternity Hospital in the city of Galle in the South-West Coast of Sri Lanka, after the Tsunami which occurred in December, 2004.  The proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health to proceed with the above project with financial assistance in a sum of Euro 28 million to be provided by  KfW Bank of  Germany, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Shopping Complex at Badulla - Phase II
decision_details: Phase I of the Project consisting of 103 Vegetable Stalls, 05 Fish Stalls, 03 Meat Stalls and Public Parking facilities  is nearing completion.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to award the contract of Phase II of the Project, on Design and Build basis, to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB), subject to the rates of the estimate being approved by the Standing Technical Committee of the Ministry of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Air Services Agreement (ASA) between Sri Lanka and Seychelles
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Piyankara Jayaratne, Minister of Civil Aviation, to sign and ratify an Air Services Agreement between Sri Lanka and Seychelles, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Second Phase of providing of loan facilities for self-employment in respect of persons rehabilitated and re-integrated into the society
decision_details: the number of persons rehabilitated and re-integrated into the society after the conflict situation which prevailed in the Northern and Eastern Provinces, stands at 11573.  Steps were initiated to provide a sum of Rs.300 million in the form of loans  to 1549 beneficiaries from the Northern and Eastern Provinces, through State Banks for self-employment purposes.  The proposal made by Hon. Chandrasiri Gajadeera, Minister of Rehabilitation and Prison Reforms, to provide a sum of Rs.525 million to provide loans to a further 4724 rehabilitated persons, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation, Upgrading  and Modernization of Small and Medium Industrial Estates
decision_details: there are 265 small and medium industrial firms engaged in manufacturing in the 18 Industrial Estates and these establishments provide direct employment to over 6,900 persons.  The project components include the renovation of internal road networks, peripheral security fencing, water supply and sewerage improvements, internal street lighting, fire protection systems and worker welfare facilities.  The proposal made by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development, to proceed with the project at a total cost of Rs.305.5 million, with funds to be provided from 2013 to 2015, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Migration Health Policy of Sri Lanka
decision_details: the Sri Lanka National Migration Health Policy aims to engage all relevant sectors and agencies that are responsible to ensure the health of migrants throughout the migration process.  Sri Lanka has recognized that outbound, internal and inbound migrants and the families left behind by outbound migrants are the key groups considered in this policy.  The above proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, was approved by the Cabinet.  Salient features of this Policy are - Outbound migrants and families left behind *    ensure the health and social well being of all migrants by guaranteeing their access to decent and productive employment in conditions of freedom, equity, security and human dignity;*    ensure health protection for Sri Lankan migrant workers by entering into Bilateral Agreements and Memoranda of Understanding with countries that employ Sri Lankan migrant workers; and*    develop and implement a coordinated plan to address the welfare needs of single parent families where the single parent migrates for employment. Internal migrants*    develop a National Programme that addresses specific nutritional issues of vulnerable internal migrant population; and*    ensure access to primary health care for internal migrant population, in partnership with private sector health care providers.Inbound migrants*    ensure that the migration process does not endanger the health of the migrant or the host population;*    identify and address conditions of public health concern in order to mitigate the impact of the migrants; disease burden on national health or social services; and*    promote Sri Lanka as a country with high health standards.

title: Recommendations of the Commission of Inquiry on Lessons Learnt and Reconciliation (LLRC) not incorporated in the National Plan of Action
decision_details: the proposal made by H.E. the President, to integrate the additional 53 recommendations that were not included in the National Plan of Action at the initial stage, majority of which overlap with other recommendations or form part of the recommendations contained in the National Human Rights Action Plan, in order to fully represent the recommendations stated in the Report of the LLRC, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the time period of the National Delimitation Committee and District Delimitation Committees established for the Demarcation of Wards under the Local Authorities Elections Ordinance (Chapter 262)
decision_details: Cabinet approval has already been granted for the appointment of the above Delimitation Committees, in order to demarcate of wards for the election of Members of Local Authorities under the ward system.  The proposal made by Hon. A.L.M. Athaullah, Minister Local Government and Provincial Councils, to extend the period of time granted to the above Committees by a further six (06) months from 2013 06 07, so that the final Report on this matter could be prepared and submitted, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transfer of Lands to Foreigners
decision_details:
the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation to impose restrictions on transfer of lands to Foreigners, was approved by the Cabinet.  The salient features are -
(i)	transfer of State or Private land by way of a sale, donation, gift or by any other disposition will be prohibited, to a person who is not a Citizen of Sri Lanka, or to a Company incorporated in Sri Lanka, where any foreign shareholding in such Company is 50% or above to a Foreign Company, unless exemption is granted in terms of the proposed Act; (ii)	State or Private lands could be leased out to persons referred to at (i) above, for a maximum period of 99 years, instead of outright sale, subject to stipulations.

title: Construction of a new three storied building for the District Secretariat, Rathnapura
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to commence initial works of the project utilizing funds allocated for 2013 and carry out the remaining works with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2014 - 2016 and to award the contract on competitive bidding basis,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction Building Blocks - A, D & E for the Faculty of Management Studies and Commerce of the University of Jaffna
decision_details: the 2 proposals made by Hon.S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education,  to award the 2 contracts of the University of Jaffna to the State Engineering Corporation, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), were approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Priority Water Supply Projects with funding secured from Local Banks engaging local contractors
decision_details: at present pipe borne water supply coverage in the island is 44% and it is expected to increase it to 60% by the year 2020.  The Government intends to engage local contractors with local Bank financing for capital investment in the sector and to significantly reduce the capital cost involved. The local contractors over the past few years have gained considerable experience in water supply projects, either working as Joint Venture Partners or Sub Contractors with Foreign Contractors.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to proceed with the programme by implementing 30 water supply projects at an estimated cost of Rs.29 billion, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improving Efficiency of Supplying Drugs to Government Hospitals
decision_details: discussions have been held to purchase essential drugs for Government Hospitals from Bangladesh, where a well established pharmaceutical industry exists which is one of the largest in the South Asian Region. The proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to proceed with the activities to purchase essential drugs from Bangladesh through a Government to Government mechanism; and to appoint the State Pharmaceuticals Corporation as the local agent for these procurements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of 01 No. 1.5 Tesla MRI System for Military Hospital at Narahenpita
decision_details: the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to purchase the above MRI system and other related accessories for the 10 storied hospital building of the Sri Lanka Army at Narahenpita, for an approximate total cost of Rs.192,821,590.00, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), to provide better facilities for personnel in the Army Forces, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Report of the Officials’ Committee appointed by the Cabinet of Ministers to conduct a study and make recommendations pertaining to the acquisition of Official Languages Proficiency by Public Officers
decision_details: an Officials' Committee headed by the Secretary to the Cabinet and consisting of senior officials which looked into the difficulties encountered by Public Officers in achieving bilingual proficiency (i.e. in Sinhala or Tamil as applicable), in keeping with the Official Languages Policy of the Government, has proposed a number of short term, medium term and long term measures, in consultation with a group of leading academics engaged in language education and other relevant authorities.
