After deliberations, Cabinet approved the recommendations specified in the Report. Some of the salient proposals are as follows: (i)	the syllabi which were more of an academic nature have now been reformulated in a practical manner to suit the needs of the Public Officers; (ii)	preparation of self study packs for new courses; (iii)	instead of an ordinary pass in the native language (as a core subject), at G.C.E. (O/L)  which is presently considered as an alternative qualification to evaluate the  second language proficiency of certain higher grade officers, it has now been proposed to accept an ordinary pass in the second  language at G.C.E. (O/L); (iv)	it has been made mandatory to provide a basic knowledge in the second language at the induction training programme when new recruitments are made to the Public Service;  (v)	a transfer policy to be formulated to enable public officers to achieve a working knowledge of the second language;  (vi)	officers who have already obtained second language proficiency in keeping with the stipulations in Service Minute are to be exempted from the requirement of obtaining the second language proficiency; (vii)	opportunities have been provided for the new recruits to professions like Medicine, Engineering, Veterinary Science etc. as well as certain technical grades, to follow an Official Language Training Course of 150 hours during their induction trainings to complete the official languages proficiency requirement; (viii)	restructuring of the Translators' Service; (ix)	graduate trainees who possess a basic knowledge in Sinhala/Tamil, to be selected to undergo a special training in languages; (x)	students entering Universities to be provided with a basic knowledge of Sinhala and Tamil languages during induction training programmes; (xi)	to make the requirement of obtaining official languages proficiency  applicable to new recruits to State Corporations, Statutory Boards, State Banks and fully Government Owned Companies  (to be achieved within 05 years from the date of joining); (xii)	to make it mandatory to possess proficiency in both Sinhala and Tamil languages when recruitments are made to the Public Service from 2019 onwards.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the National Zoological Gardens of Sri Lanka and the Pretoria Zoological Gardens in the Republic of South Africa
decision_details: the intention of this MoU is to lay a foundation for collaboration, exchange of ideas and support in the fields of animal husbandry, public presentation of zoological species, related research, veterinary and keeper  training. The proposal made by Hon. Jayaratne Herath, Minister of Botanical Gardens and Public Recreation, to enter into the above Memorandum of Understanding between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposal to set up a Mixed Development Project with Luxury Hotel with a Foreign direct investment of US$170 million by EoN Resorts Group Pvt Limited of the Republic of Maldives
SAARC Agreement on Rapid Response to Natural Disasters
decision_details: this Agreement will strengthen the unilateral and bilateral relationships between Regional countries and will assist in restoring normalcy in disaster stricken countries within a minimum period.  Covering approval of the Cabinet was granted for the above Agreement submitted by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, Minister of Disaster Management, which has been signed at the 17th SAARC Summit held in Maldives in 2011.

title: Regulating of International Schools and Private Schools
decision_details: a number of International Schools are presently functioning in the country and they have been registered as business ventures under the Board of Investment or Companies Act. It has been found necessary to bring in amendments to existing rules and regulations for the effective functioning of the International Schools and Private Schools  in keeping with the needs of the country.  The proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to proceed with the proposed arrangements for the formulation of a legal framework and a mechanism  to regularize these schools to be in line with the national educational policies,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: G.C.E. (O/L) Examination - 2012 - Analysis of Examination Results
Construction of a new three storied building for the Divisional Secretariat, Bulathsinhala
decision_details: this Divisional Secretary's Division consists of 54 Grama Niladhari Divisions and the total population is 69,902. The proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, for the construction of a three storied building at a total cost of Rs.79.9 million, with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2014 - 2016, to provide sufficient facilities for the people in the area and the staff, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening the Small and Medium Industrial Estates
decision_details: the Ministry of  Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development has facilitated the Small and Medium Scale Enterprises/Industries spread out across the country through the establishment, operation and servicing of 18 Industrial Estates which are managed by the Industrial Development Board.  The proposal made by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development to adapt and adopt the lease rental policy recommendations to the Small and Medium Industrial Estates operated by the Industrial Development Board, to provide relief to all small and medium industrialists  with effect from 2011 06 01, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Amendment to the Regulation of Insurance Industry Act No. 43 of 2000
decision_details: provisions of the Regulation of Insurance Industry Act require insurers registered with the Insurance Board of Sri Lanka (IBSL) prior to 2011 02 11 to list themselves on a licensed Stock Exchange within a period of 5 years from the date of enforcement of the Amendment Act and such Insurance Companies are required to comply with this requirement on or before 2016 02 11.  Those insurers registered on or after 2011 02 11 are required to be listed on a licensed Stock Exchange within a period of 03 years.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation, to exempt the Insurance Companies registered under the Insurance Board of Sri Lanka prior to 2011 02 11 from the requirement of registering under a licensed Stock Exchange, subject to stipulations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of land at Kamburupitiya to the National Housing Development Authority
decision_details: the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development to allocate the block of land at the Kamburupitiya 'Gam Udawa' site utilized for the relocation of families displaced due to the Gam Udawa -1991, to the National Housing Development Authority (NHDA) by the Urban Development Authority (UDA), to execute the individual deeds of transfer to the displaced occupants, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Weras Ganga Storm Water Drainage and Environmental Improvement Project
decision_details: preliminary works of the above Project have commenced  and the implementation of the Project will improve the environmental system of Colombo and its suburbs, particularly flood control in the relevant areas.  The Project is to be implemented under 02 phases. Phase I will consist of, improvement of Nugegoda - Raththanapitiya watercourse, improvement of canals within the North and South Sub-Zone of Boralesgamuwa, development of Maha Ela, and Weras Ganga by dredging, conservation of marshy lands and improvement of drainage system in Bolgoda area and its surroundings. The estimated cost of the Project is Rs.13,000 million.  Measures will be taken to provide relief to the families to be displaced due to the implementation of the above Project.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to grant relief to those to be affected, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Lease of land situated bordering D.R. Wijewardena Mawatha and Sir Chiththampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 02 to M/s Lake Leisure Holdings (Pvt) Ltd for a Mixed Development Project
decision_details: the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to lease out the above land to implement a mixed development project in keeping with the ongoing tourism related development plan of the Urban Development Authority (UDA) for Beira Lake surrounding areas, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Review Committee (SCARC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of Relief to the Fishermen who were affected by the cyclone on 2013-06-08
decision_details: Cabinet of Ministers having considered the severe damages caused to life and property of the fishing community in the affected areas due to the cyclone which occurred on 2013-06-08, decided to grant relief to them in the following manner: (i) payment of Rs.100,000/- to the next-of-kin of each deceased /disappeared  fisherman;(ii) to procure and supply Fishing Craft and equipment in lieu of those fully damaged and not having insurance cover; and(iii) to grant a relief payment of 50% of the cost incurred to attend to the repairs of partially damaged Fishing Craft and equipment.

title: Export of Cinnamon
decision_details: Sri Lanka exports about 13,000 MT of cinnamon per year.  With the view to preventing the export of low quality cinnamon and enhancing the production of cinnamon in the country and sustaining the livelihood of more than 350,000 families engaged in this industry, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, Minister (Senior) for International Monetary Co-operation, to make it mandatory to adhere to the specifications for Sri Lanka standard for exporting of   cinnamon and to submit the Gazette Extraordinary No.1813/15 dated 2013-06-05 to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Encouraging the Domestic Industries within the government Policy Framework
decision_details: the need for identification of priority areas for which foreign direct investment should be mobilized while protecting the interest of the local investors was considered by the Cabinet.  It was decided that processing and value addition of spices, animal husbandry and poultry farming are the sectors for which foreign investments need to be limited, with the intention of import substitution. Foreign investment on assembling of vehicles, refining of petroleum products, manufacturing of boats for export market should be encouraged.  In order to protect the local investors, it was decided that foreign investment should not be encouraged in small scale agricultural industries, retail trade, manufacturing of steel and cement and beauty care related products.  A Ministerial Committee under the Chairmanship of Hon. Minister (Senior) for International Monetary Co-operation and consisting of other Ministers, was appointed to revise the current regulations and to make proposals to the Cabinet.

title: The Proposed Teaching Hospital for General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University
decision_details: with the intention of addressing the shortage of trained Medical Officers in Military Hospitals, this University has commenced a Degree Programme in Medical Science, and the construction works of the proposed Teaching Hospital has to be expedited to provide facilities for the Medical Students who are supposed to obtain Clinical Appointments by August 2013. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to obtain a loan of US $201,629,000 (approximately Rs.26 billion) from a State Bank for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Cultural Co-operation between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan
decision_details: approval of the Cabinet was granted to the proposal made by Hon. T.B. Ekanayake, Minister of Culture and the Arts, to enter into the above Memorandum of Understanding between the two countries.  This MoU will further promote the friendly relations existing between the two countries and re-affirm the   need for cultivating and developing closer and stronger cultural relations between the two countries.

title: Commonwealth Youth Forum
decision_details: arrangements have been made to conduct the Commonwealth Youth Forum from 10th-14th November at the Hambantota International Conference Hall to coincide with the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) scheduled to be held in Colombo from 15th to 17th November, 2013.   54 Commonwealth Member Countries are scheduled to participate in this Forum and around 1500 local and foreign representatives will also participate in the inaugural ceremony.  The proposal made by Hon. Dallas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to proceed with the programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a new Subject Stream of Technology scheduled for the G.C.E. (A/L) Examination in 200 selected Secondary Schools equipped with Mahindodaya Technological Laboratories
decision_details: arrangements are underway to introduce a new subject stream of Technology for the G.C.E. (A/L) in 200 selected Secondary Schools equipped with Mahindodaya Technological Laboratories, with the consent of the relevant Institutions such as the National Education Commission, the Ministry of Higher Education, the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Skills Development and the University Grants Commission. The schools have been selected so as to have at least one such school for each electorate.  The joint proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education and Hon. Dallas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to proceed with the relevant activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to Regulations made under the Employees' Provident Fund Act, No.15 of 1958
decision_details: consequent to the amendments introduced to the Employees' Provident Fund Scheme recently by the Government by Act, No.2 of 2012, introduction of new amendments to the relevant Regulations are to be made to grant benefits to the workers.  The Commissioner General of Labour is to introduce the National Identity Card Number in lieu of the existing employer centric number and every employee under the new regulations is required to register his or her finger print marks of the left thumb and the right thumb in the form of electronic record with the Department of Labour. The proposal made by Hon. Gamini Lokuge, Minister of Labour and Labour Relations, to submit the Gazette Notification No.1810/20 dated 2013-05-13 to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Scientific and Technological Co-operation between the Ministry of Technology, Research  and Atomic Energy, Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Science and Technology, Thailand
decision_details: this MoU recognizes the importance of science and technology in the development of the respective national economies and the value of cooperation between the two countries to serve common interests in contributing to the enhancement of science and technology. Approval of the Cabinet was granted to the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, Minister of Technology, Research and Atomic Energy for signing of the above MoU between the two countries.

title: Hosting of the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting in Sri Lanka in 2013 (CHOGM)
decision_details: this would be the largest international event to be hosted by Sri Lanka since 1976 when Sri Lanka hosted the 5th Non-Aligned Movement Summit. Extensive preparatory arrangements are underway to host this event and the proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris for the appointment of the following Committees for policy decision making at Ministerial level, was approved by the Cabinet:*    Committee on the Commonwealth Business Forum, under the Chairmanship of Hon.  Basil Rajapakse, Minister of Economic Development.*    Committee on the Commonwealth Youth Forum, under the Chairmanship of Hon. Dallas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development.*    Committee on Media and Public Relations, under the Chairmanship of Hon. Keheliya Rambukwella, Minister of Mass Media and Information.

title: Social Integration Week -  July 15 - July 21, 2013
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Vasudeva Nanayakkara, Minister of National Languages and Social Integration, to declare 15th to 21st July 2013 as the “Social Integration Week”, was approved by the Cabinet. Many activities and programmes have been identified for the purpose, to be carried out to promote social integration in the country.

title: Allocation of Land at D.M. Colombage Mawatha, Kirulapone to the persons displaced due to the Baseline Road Widening Project
decision_details: the Road Development Authority (RDA) has utilized a land in an extent of about 3 acres belonging to the Urban Development Authority (UDA), to re-locate the families who were displaced due to the Baseline Road Widening Project. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to allocate the said land to the RDA, to enable it to execute the transfer of deeds in favour of the allottees who were displaced due to the Baseline Road Widening Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of Land at Vauxhall Street, Colombo 02 to Lanka Mahila Samithi as Provision of Alternative Accommodation
decision_details: the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development to allocate a land at Vauxhall Street, Colombo 02, to the Lanka Mahila Samithi on 30 year lease basis, for the construction of its Office and Sales Outlet, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Japanese Human Resources Development Scholarship Programme - 2013
decision_details: The Government of Japan has agreed to provide grant assistance in a sum of Japanese Yen 192 million (Approximately Rs.245 million) to Sri Lanka for the above programme to be implemented in 2013.  The objective of this programme is to support human resources development by providing opportunities to government officials to follow higher educational programmes in reputed Japanese Universities, to enable them to contribute to the social and economic development of the country in a productive manner.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to enter into a Grant Agreement for the purpose with the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between China Development Bank Corporation and the Government of Sri Lanka
decision_details: China Development Bank Corporation is to extend financial assistance in a sum of US $580 million in 2013 for development projects of Sri Lanka.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to sign the above Memorandum of Understanding between China Development Bank Corporation and the Ministry of Finance and Planning of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commemoration of the World Environment Day 2013
decision_details: all State parties including Sri Lanka which signed the environmental conventions in 1992 at the World Earth Summit in Brazil are required to commemorate the World Environment Day on 05th June.  Accordingly, arrangements have been made to implement a programme covering the whole Island on the World Environment Day that falls on 05th June 2013, under the patronage of H.E. the President, and in association with all Local Authorities and Government Institutions at District level.  5000 school children will also participate in this programme.  The proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Environment and Renewable Energy, to proceed with the above programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Agreement between the Republic of Poland and the Government of Sri Lanka on Cooperation in the Field of Tourism
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minister of Economic Development, to sign and ratify the above Agreement on cooperation in the field of tourism between the Government of the Republic of Poland and the Government of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Two Storied Building for Divisional Secretariat, Udubaddawa
decision_details: this Divisional Secretary's Division  consists of 43 Grama Niladhari Divisions and the total population is 13,859.  The proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to proceed with the above project at a cost of Rs.23.37 million with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Expenditure Frame Work - 2014, to provide better facilities for the people living in the area, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Two Storied Official Quarters for District Secretary, Hambanthota
decision_details: Hambanthota District consists of 12 Divisional Secretary's Divisions and 576 Grama Niladhari Divisions.  The total population is 596,617.  The Cabinet granted approval to the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to proceed with the above project, if part of the cost can be met from the budgetary provisions made available for the year 2013, failing which, the provisions have to be met in the Budget for 2014.

title: Construction of Proposed Building for Computer Unit of the Department of Computer Science, University of Ruhuna  (Phase II )
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to revise the total cost of the above project from Rs.263 million to Rs.291 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation and improvement of Hulandawa Left - Kahambana Road (UVMMC803) Uva Province - Provincial Roads Project funded by the World Bank
decision_details: the World Bank has allocated US $105 million for the rehabilitation and upgrading of Provincial roads in Uva, Eastern and Northern Provinces and the proposal made by Hon. A.L.M. Athaullah, Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils, to award the above contract as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), utilizing a part of the proceeds of the above loan for the rehabilitation and improvement of Hulandawa Left - Kahambana Road, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Road Sector Assistance Project funded by the World Bank
The Proposed Teaching Hospital of General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University
decision_details: the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University has commenced a new Degree programme in Medicine for Military Medical Cadets who could fulfill the requirement of the military medical services of the country and functioning of the proposed Teaching Hospital of the above University, as early as possible, is essential for the training of Military Medical Cadets who are to commence their professorial clinical appointments by August 2013.  The hospital will also cater to foreign patients and also provide ultra modern facilities for medical check-ups for which Sri Lankan patients opt to go abroad spending large amount of foreign exchange.  It will also cater to advanced rehabilitation and physiotherapy for disabled soldiers. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the project at a cost of US $201.6 million (approximately Rs.26 billion), with funds to be provided by a State Bank, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Contribution of Sri Lanka towards the construction works of Sri Parvatharama (Buddhavanam) Buddhist Theme Park in Andra Pradesh, India
decision_details: the prime objective of this enormous project which has been initiated by the Ministry of Tourism, Media and Culture in Andra Pradesh is to establish a Cultural Centre of international level depicting historical events that took place in different countries and masterpieces of religious creations belonging to those countries. The proposal made by Hon. T.B. Ekanayaka, Minister of Culture and the Arts, to proceed with the project at a cost of Rs.7.9 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Youth Park in Matara
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to construct a Youth Park in Eliyakanda, Matara at a cost of Rs. 80 million, utilizing the financial allocations provided to the National Youth Services Council for the year 2013, with the view to developing infrastructure facilities for Sri Lankan Youth to spend their leisure time productively in a more eco-friendly environment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Functions of the Sub-committee on Media and Publicity of the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting 2013
decision_details:
following functions of the Sub-Committee on Media and Publicity of the task force, appointed to organize the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka in November 2013, devolve on the Ministry of Mass Media and Information:
 

launching of the official logo of the Conference and designing and maintaining the official website of the Conference; 
designing and maintaining the Official Media Centre of this Conference to facilitate 1200 local and foreign journalists; and
raising public awareness while uplifting the image of Sri Lanka, nationally and internationally.

The proposal made by Hon. Keheliya Rambukwella, Minister of Mass Media and Information to proceed with the programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion of Vocational Training Centre at Thelambuyaya
decision_details:
there are 05 Vocational Training Centres in the country providing vocational training for the disabled and Thelambuyaya Training Centre in the Hambantota District is one such Institution which provides two year training courses in Agriculture, Tailoring, Bakery Products, Electronics and Carpentry.  The proposal made by Hon. Felix Perera, Minister of Social Services, to award the above contract, which includes the following,  to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB) at an estimated cost of Rs.174,820,800.00, subject to approval of rates in the estimate by the Technical Committee of the Ministry of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities and completion of work within the stipulated time frame, was approved by the Cabinet:
 

construction of a boys hostel for 100 trainees;
construction of a girls hostel for 100 trainees; and
construction of a kitchen and dining hall for 300 trainees.

title: Report on the Local Manufactures of School Uniform Material
decision_details: the quantity of clothing material required for distribution annually as school uniforms is 11.7 million meters.  The short term recommendation made by Hon. Ratnasiri Wickramanayake, Minister (Senior) for Good Governance and Infrastructure, and the Chairman of the Ministerial Committee appointed for the purpose, to accord the opportunity to supply 80% of the school uniform material requirements for 2014 to local manufacturers and the balance 20% to be imported as Grey cloth to be finished locally by local Grey fabric processors, failing which only, to import the said quantity of 20%, was approved by the Cabinet.  Action is to be taken by the Authorities concerned to ensure that the total requirement of school uniform materials will be procured from local manufacturers, from 2015 onwards.

title: Project to Formulate a Chemical Accidents Prevention and Preparedness Programme for Sri Lanka
decision_details: according to an industrial census conducted, there are nearly 1000 large, medium and small scale chemical industries in the country. It has been found that preparedness measures have to be formulated to prevent or mitigate accidents caused by these chemical industries and activities.  The Secretariat for the Strategic Approach to International Chemicals Management (SAICM) under United Nations Environmental Programme has offered to provide a sum of US $224,834.00 as a grant to Sri Lanka, for  such a programme to be implemented. The proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Environment and Renewable Energy, to proceed with the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Sri Lanka Inventors Incentives Act, No.53 of 1979
decision_details: the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, Minister of Technology, Research and Atomic Energy, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare necessary amending legislation for the above Act in keeping with the present needs, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Production of High Quality Heifers for Dairy Industry
decision_details: the above project was prepared to be implemented from 2008 to 2015 at a total cost of Rs.1,442.00 million and  a sum of Rs.93.0 million was allocated for the purpose in 2008 and Rs.1,349.0 million for the rest of the 7 year period from 2009 to 2015, with Cabinet approval. The objective of this project is to produce high quality heifer calves which are born from the artificial breeding programme implemented by the Department of Animal Production and Health. The proposal made by Hon. title: Search and Rescue Services for Aircraft in Distress - Search & Rescue arrangements between Sri Lanka and neighbouring countries such as Australia,  India, Indonesia and Maldives
decision_details: it is obligatory on the part of Sri Lanka, being a party to the Convention on International Civil Aviation (Chicago Convention – 1944), to make arrangements for the effective implementation of the International Standards and Recommended Practices contained in the said Convention.  It is a requirement that every State enters into arrangements with neighbouring States to strengthen her ability to provide  Search and Rescue Services in mutual cooperation and coordination with each other when the need for search and rescue arises.  The proposal made by Hon. Piyankara Jayaratna, Minister of Civil Aviation, for the Government of Sri Lanka, to enter into such arrangements with the relevant authorities of Australia,  India, Indonesia and Maldives for the above purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Inter-sectoral Participation in Eradicating Mosquito Breeding Places for the Control of Dengue Disease
decision_details:
the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, for the need to strengthen the 
actions taken by the Ministries mainly on the following for the prevention of the spread of Dengue 
disease, was approved by the Cabinet. 
 Ministry of Defence and Urban Development
 
*	regular participation of Officials of the Police Department in inter-sectoral meetings at District and Divisional levels.
 
*	assisting health and other authorities in cleaning up campaigns in high risk Grama Niladhari Divisions.
 

 
Ministry of Health
 
*	coordinating and facilitating of other sectors;
 
*	early diagnosis and management of epidemics; 
 
*	formation of village committees together with other relevant sectors.
 

 
 Ministry of Environment and Renewable Energy
 
*	introduction of waste recycling system in all Local Authority areas.
 

 
Ministry of Local Government and Provincial Councils (through Local Authorities)
 
*  	proper disposal of waste; and
 
*  	conduct of Dengue Review Meetings at Local Authority level.
 

 
Ministry of Public Administration and Home Affairs (through District and Divisional Secretaries) 
*	formation of mosquito prevention committees in every Grama Niladhari Division; and
 
*	conduct of regular inter-sectoral meetings at District and Divisional levels.
 

 Ministry of Education
 
*	regular cleaning up of school premises.

title: Presidential Task Force for Resettlement, Development and Security - Northern Province - Report of the Presidential Task Force - 2009-2012 - "From Conflict to Stability?
decision_details:
- contents in the above Report submitted to the Cabinet by Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minister of  Economic Development, were noted.  Cabinet observed that an Action Programme has been formulated through a consultative process enlisting the cooperation from line Ministries, Provincial Councils, the Armed Forces, UN Agencies and INGOs.  Many Police Stations have now been re-opened and civil security is looked after by the Police.  Elections to local authorities in the Northern Province were held in July 2011 and 378 Members to 32 Pradeshiya Sabhas in all 5 Districts of the Northern Province were elected.  Provincial Council elections to the Eastern Province were also held.  Already 142,230 families have been resettled in all the Districts of the Northern Province. Some of the projects undertaken in the Northern Province are as follows:
*  	Restoration of Health Services	- major hospitals in all the Districts have been renovated.  At present, 161 preventive care institutions and 102 curative care institutions are functioning.  Total expenditure for healthcare services from 2009 to 2011 amounts to Rs.2135 million and an investment of Rs.9254 million has been allocated for ongoing and future projects.
*  	Revival of the Education Sector - out of the 1020 schools in the twelve educational zones in the Northern Province, 990 schools have been renovated and are functioning.  
 *  	Housing - for successful implementation of resettlement programme 78,144 permanent houses are scheduled to be constructed, out of which 27,983 houses have already been completed.
*  	Rehabilitation of Roads and Railway -  all major highways are being rehabilitated with a total investment of Rs.75,071 million.  In addition, rehabilitation of the Northern Railway Network is underway with assistance in a sum of US $650 million from the Government of India.
*  	Water Supply and Sanitation -  this work has been given high priority and already Rs.29.9 billion has been invested to improve water supply and sanitation in this Province.  A major water supply and sanitation project to relieve the water problems in Jaffna is underway at a cost of Rs.25 billion.
*  	Restoration of Electricity -  rehabilitation of the electricity network is underway, covering Vavuniya, Kilinochchi, Chunnakam etc.
*  	Revival of Agriculture - 90% of the 180,000 acres of  abandoned paddy lands have been brought under cultivation.  Seeds paddy and subsidized fertilizer have been provided.  A production of 212,722 MT of paddy was recorded during this period.
*  	Rehabilitation of Irrigation Network -  a total commitment of Rs.6333.9 million has been made by the Government for the rehabilitation of the entire irrigation network in the Province.
*  	Fisheries Sector - the total fishing fleet has now been increased to 11,225 and the fish production in the Northern Province has risen from 15,250 MT in 2007, up to 48,520 MT in 2011.
*  	Banking Sector - 20 State and Private Banks are operating in the Northern Region.  Loans amounting to about Rs.4,614 million have been granted to 36,000 beneficiaries under different credit lines by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka up to the end of 2011.
*  	Private Sector Investment - private sector has already begun to move to the regions in the Northern Province.   There are 23 projects approved by the BOI for a total investment of Rs.68,268 million.  In addition, 9 hotel projects consisting of 328 rooms have been approved for construction at an investment of  Rs.2217 million.

title: Extension of the Existing Term Contract between Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) and PV Oil Singapore Private Ltd. (a Company owned by the Government of Vietnam)
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Petroleum Industries, on the basis of the recommendation of the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee to extend the above term contract for a further period of 12 months with effect from 2012?12?01 for the purchase of 2 cargoes of  Gas Oil of 40,000 Mt. each per month, on stipulated conditions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commemoration of the National Safety Day - 2012
decision_details: -  the objective of this event is to increase awareness of disasters among the public and the manner in which they should  prepare themselves, particularly in response to disasters such as the Tsunami that took place on the 26th of December 2004.  Commemorative ceremonies have been held continuously for the past 6 years in Galle, Ratnapura, Kandy, Kurunegala, Jaffna and Batticaloa Districts respectively.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, Minister of Disaster Management, to commemorate the National Safety Day - 2012 centered around Badulla District, in association with the relevant Ministries and Institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Multi Faceted Hotel Complex in Colombo
decision_details: the proposed Multi Faceted Hotel Complex will consist of  30 floors, 475 rooms and 90 service apartments, and the total investment would be around US $159 million.  The proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minister of Economic Development, to seek approval from Parliament to treat this as a Strategic Development Project in terms of the provisions of the Strategic Development Project Act, No.14 of 2008, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Health Week - 2012
decision_details: -  the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to declare the period from 10th to 17th December 2012 as the ?National Health Week - 2012?, with the participation of the health workforce consisting of more than one hundred thousand employees of different categories and with the involvement of the political authority, religious leaders, public and the private sectors, social entities, so as to make the public aware of the healthcare facilities provided by the health services in the country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Action Plan for Procurement of Pharmaceuticals
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to implement an Action Plan for the Procurement of Pharmaceuticals, prepared in consultation with the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Planning Committee for Pharmaceuticals (SCAPPC), so as to eliminate the shortcomings occurring in the process of Procurement of Pharmaceuticals, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Leasing of Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) Land for Yacht / Leisure Craft Repair and Ship Building Facility in the  Port of Galle
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to lease out land for the above purpose in line with Land Alienation Policy of the Government, on a 30 year lease basis, on a lease rental to be determined by the Chief Government Valuer, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Review Committee (SCARC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a Revenue Administration Management Information System (RAMIS) for the Inland Revenue Department
decision_details: - The Ministry of Finance and Planing, with facilitation of the Asian Development Bank (ADB), has been engaged in continuous fiscal and revenue related reforms through fiscal management efficiency improvement projects and much progress has been made in the area of capacity development, English Language training, IT training etc. The automation of the Inland Revenue Department will improve efficiency and accountability of the revenue administration and the ultimate objective is to integrate the automated systems of the  Inland Revenue Department, Sri Lanka Customs and the Ministry of Finance and Planning to optimize revenue and fiscal efficiency and accountability. The proposal made by H. E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to authorize the Secretary to the Treasury to conduct negotiations with the Government of Singapore to assist  in the above project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of Contract - Consultancy Services for Habarana-Veyangoda Transmission Line Project - Bid No:PD/TCO/FST/8/11
decision_details: - the construction of 220 KV Transmission Line between Habarana and Veyangoda is one of the priority projects of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to transmit power that will be generated by the Trincomalee Sampur Coal Power Plant.   The Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) has agreed to provide funding assistance of Japanese Yen 9573 million with GOSL counterpart funding of Rs.2434 million to implement the project very early.  The proposal made by Hon.  Patali Champika Ranawaka, Minister of Power and Energy, to authorize CEB to award the consultancy services contract as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultancy Procurement Committee (CACPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Slave Island Re-development Project - Stage II, Colombo 02
decision_details: - the Urban Development Authority (UDA) has launched several projects in the city of Colombo and the ongoing housing programme to resettle 65,000 families living in under-served settlement is one such project.  An extent of 3 acres of land in Slave Island has been identified by the UDA for the purpose and the families occupying the said premises are to be provided  housing apartments with all facilities on completion of the project, and until such time, they will be paid monthly rentals by the investor for the project, for which arrangement the occupants have consented. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the Stage II work of the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Project for the supply of equipment of High Quality Radiotherapy with high energy radiation including the infrastructure for Cancer Patients in Sri Lanka under Foreign Assistance
decision_details: - it has been observed that Cancer is a major disease prevailing in Sri Lanka at the moment and necessary radiotherapy treatment is provided to the needy patients with limited available facilities. The proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to proceed with the work relating to the award of the relevant 2 contracts for US $ 24,129,998.88 and US $ 29,251,703.02 with the view to provide additional healthcare facilities to the Cancer patients, was approved by the Cabinet.

*	Avittawa - Lewwanduwa Road - from 9.83 Km to 27.2 Km

* 	Maradankadawela - Jayanthipura Road - 59.90 Km.  - additional Cost Rs.631,405,871.75
* 	Jayanthipura - Tirikkondiadimadu Road - 68.86 Km.  - additional Cost Rs.883,702,749.78
