title: Widening and Improvements to Airport Runway and Apron at Ampara Airport
decision_details: -  the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to award the above contract to the lowest evaluated responsive bid for a contract price of Rs.749,336,167.05, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet. The work is intended to be carried out in line with the activities of 'Deyata Kirula, 2013 National Exhibition'.

title: Construction of a five storied Building Complex for the Faculty of Social Sciences - University of Kelaniya
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayaka, Minister of Higher Education, for the construction of the above building complex at a total cost of Rs.45 million, with the view to providing enhanced accommodation for the increased intake of students for the University in 2013 and to award the construction work to the State Engineering Corporation, was approved by the Cabinet.  Cabinet also decided to provide 25% of the total cost estimate from the Consolidated Fund as a token of appreciation of the endeavours to develop the University from the income generated by the|University itself.

title: Construction of the Six (06) Storeyed Building for National Agricultural Information and Communication Center, Department of Agriculture, Gannoruwa, Kandy
decision_details: - on a joint proposal made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities; and Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, Cabinet decided to select a suitable contractor through open bidding from among construction contractors registered with ICTAD including State Institutions to entrust the above construction work.

title: Dry Zone Urban Water and Sanitation Project - Sri Lanka - ADB Loan No.2477SRI (SF) - Tender for Supply and Laying of HDPE, DI, PVC Pipes, Specials, Fittings and Valves for Transmission main and Distribution System in Mannar Water Supply Scheme
decision_details: - the above project is being implemented by the National Water Supply and Drainage Board with funds provided by the Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the Government of Sri Lanka.  The project includes the supply and laying of 6.5 km. of water transmission mains and 102 km. of distribution network pipes.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract, on the recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) for a total bid price of US $557,454.51 plus LKR 281,844,055.48, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Surgical Ward Complex and Quarters for Consultants & Medical Officers at District General Hospital (DGH) - Mulaitivu
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, for the implementation of the project for the construction of a Surgical Ward Complex and Quarters for Consultants and Medical Officers at the premises of the District General Hospital (DGH), Mulaitivu, at a cost of Rs.130,000,000.00, with financial assistance of AmeriCares, a Non-Governmental Organization, which has expressed its willingness to assist the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Paediatric Eye Unit (Stage II) - Construction of the Neuro and Kidney Unit and Orthopedic Ward - Lady Ridgeway Hospital - Colombo
decision_details: - construction work of the ground floor and the 1st floor under Stage I of the project has been completed and the proposal of Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to proceed with the work relating  to the construction of the 2nd and 3rd floors of the building under Stage II of the project consisting of the Neuro and Kidney Units (2nd floor) and the  Orthopedic Ward (3rd floor), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of National Highways with concrete surfacing through Domestic Contractors - balance and urgent improvement works on the Road Section from Nugegoda to Homagama from 1.00 Km. to 15.36 Km. on Colombo-Ratnapura Road (A4)
decision_details: - on the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to carry out the balance and urgent improvement works that are required for the above road section, Cabinet approval was granted to include the above project in the Annual Programme of the Road Development Authority.

title: Draft Bill for the Control and Regulation of the use of Prohibited Drugs
decision_details: - an International Convention against Doping in Sport has been adopted in October 2005 at the General Conference of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) and the Government of Sri Lanka has acceded to the said Convention in February 2011.   The objective of the Convention is to  promote the prevention of doping in sport, with a view to its elimination. On the above proposal made by Hon. Mahindananda Aluthgamage, Minister of Sports, Cabinet decided to refer the relevant Bill to the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Legislation for recommendations in the first instance.

title: Establishment of Sri Lanka Consulate General in Dammam, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
decision_details: - the joint proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs and Hon. Dilan Perera, Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare, to establish a Sri Lanka Consulate General in Dammam, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, was approved by the Cabinet.  It is estimated that around 75,000 Sri Lankans are presently employed in Damam, the Eastern Province of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

title: Proposals to encourage Returnee Migrant Workers to Invest on New Businesses
decision_details: - it has been observed that there has been an upward trend in foreign exchange earnings from migrant workers which has reached nearly US $5.2 billion (about Rs.692 billion) in 2011.  The proposal made by Hon. Dilan Perera, Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare, to grant relevant tax exemptions for importation of machinery and equipment for returnee migrant workers to invest on new businesses; and for State Banks to provide special loan schemes for these workers under stipulated conditions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Health Laboratory Services in the Country
decision_details: - the proposal addresses the areas of laboratory standards, scope of laboratory, safety measures, staff welfare, quality assurance etc. and will ensure the timely availability of reliable and valid diagnostic and analytical laboratory support necessary to protect and promote the healthcare and well being of the people through the state as well as the private sector.   On the above proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, Cabinet approval was granted to incorporate necessary provisions in the Private Medical Institutions (Registration) Act, No.21 of 2006 so as to regulate the activities of the Health Laboratory Services in the country.

title:
Cabinet Paper No.12/1534/558/041-I (2012-11-14) 
Appeals made against the Disciplinary Orders issued by the Cabinet of Ministers on behalf of the Public Service Commission during the period between 2009?04?09 and 2011?05?12 when the Commission was non-functional
decision_details:
- (Cabinet decision dated 2012?10?18 - Item 41 refers) Cabinet of Ministers having considered the facts enumerated in the above Report, decided that action should be taken in the following manner in order to ensure administrative fairness: 
 
(a)	to grant approval as a matter of policy in terms of Sub-Article 55(1) of the Constitution, to deem it appropriate for the Public Service Commission (PSC) to consider petitions submitted to the Commission by officers aggrieved by the decisions taken by the Cabinet of Ministers in respect of the disciplinary matters that would have otherwise come within the purview of the PSC if not for it being non-functional from 2009?04?09 to 2011?05?12, under the special circumstances set out below:

(i)	petitions, requesting the consideration of a fact or facts that should have been considered during the formal disciplinary inquiry or during the deliberations of the Cabinet of Ministers, but had not been so considered;


(ii)	petitions, regarding any procedural impropriety which has occurred from the time of the commencement of the formal disciplinary inquiry to the issuance of the formal disciplinary order that has resulted in prejudice to the accused;

(iii)	petitions indicating that the punishment stipulated by the Cabinet of Ministers in the course of carrying out the functions of the disciplinary authority was excessively severe having regard to the comparable precedents.


(b)	For the PSC to receive petitions under the aforesaid grounds during a period specified by it. The PSC shall decide and convey its decisions to the administrative authority and the petitioner within a time frame determined by it.

	The Cabinet of Ministers also observed that the rationale of the above arrangement is to enable Public Officers who had been aggrieved by the disciplinary orders issued by the Cabinet of Ministers during the period in which the PSC was non-functional, to petition the PSC as would otherwise have been the case, and if aggrieved by the decision of the PSC to make available therefrom an appeal to the Administrative Appeals Tribunal within four (04) weeks of the receipt of the order or decision by the PSC.

title: Implementing a mechanism to protect the river bank of Mahaweli, which is facing erosion at present, with the view to ensuring the safety of Mahinda Rajapaksa ICT Centre, the Provincial Library and surrounding buildings at Gatambe
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Sarath Ekanayaka, Chief Minister, Central Province, to construct a 477 meter long retaining wall along Mahaweli river bank to protect the river bank close to which several key state buildings are located, at a cost of Rs.242 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of grant assistance of US $1.5 Million to the Government of Uganda for Establishment of Sri Lanka - Uganda Friendship Vocational and Technical Training Centre in Uganda
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to provide grant assistance in a sum of US $1.5 million to the government of Uganda for the above purpose, was approved by the Cabinet. The grant assistance will be utilized for upgrading and strengthening the Masulita Vocational and Technical Training Centre in Uganda.  The construction work is to be entrusted to a Sri Lanka contractor presently engaged in construction works in Uganda and Sri Lankan skilled labour will be used for the construction work. The Ministry of Youth Affairs and Skills Development will execute the project on behalf of the government of Sri Lanka.

title: Agreement between Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan and the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka on Cooperation in the field of Tourism
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minister of Economic Development to sign and ratify an Agreement on Co-operation in the field of tourism between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.  The proposed Agreement will enhance the bilateral relationship between the two countries and strengthen the tourism flow into Sri Lanka and open new avenues for trade and investments.

title: Seeking  Observer Status in the Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia (CICA)
decision_details: - the objective of this Conference is to enhance cooperation towards promoting peace, security and stability in Asia.  The Organization presently has 24 member countries of Central Asia, Middle East, East Asia and South Asia and India and Pakistan are also among the member states.  The proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to seek observer status in the Conference, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project to be Implemented by the Bank of Ceylon covering the Grand Oriental Hotel and the adjoining lands owned by the Police Department, etc.
decision_details: - the Bank of Ceylon has prepared a comprehensive redevelopment project proposal covering the above area.  The project is to be implemented in three (3) stages and the total investment would be around US $1 billion.  The project will be completed by 2018.  The overall development will benefit tourism in particular with the addition of around 500 - 700 new hotel rooms, restaurants and shops etc.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the above project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Deyata Kirula National Exhibition 2013 - Construction of Permanent Buildings at the Hardy Advanced Technological Institute, Ampara
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, Minister of Telecommunication and Information Technology to award the construction of the above, to the State Engineering Corporation and the State Development and Construction Corporation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of an Emergency Service Centre at the Batticaloa Teaching Hospital with funds to be provided under the Foundation Supporting  a National Trauma Service in Sri Lanka, in the State of Victoria, Australia and the Ministry of Health
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to develop emergency and accident service facilities at the Batticaloa Teaching Hospital at a cost of Rs.760 million, consisting of a contribution of US $02 million (Rs.260 million) in cash and kind by the Foundation Supporting  a National Trauma Service in Sri Lanka, in the State of Victoria, Australia, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commencing of a Tourist Information Centre and a sales outlet under the 'Divinaguma' Programme and to be operated by the Laksala of Sri Lanka Handicrafts Board
decision_details: -  the proposal made by Hon. Dayasritha Tissera, Minister of State Resources and Enterprise Development, to vest the Unawatuna Branch of Lanka Salusala with the  Sri Lanka Handicrafts Board, so as to develop it as a Tourist Information Centre and a sales outlet under the 'Divinaguma' Programme for the benefit of local as well as foreign tourists, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Membership of the International Sugar Organization
decision_details:
- this is an Inter-Governmental Organization based in London which was established by the International Sugar Agreement of 1968 and its membership consists of the European Union and 59 other countries.  Some of its objectives are -

* 	to ensure enhanced international co-operation in connection with world sugar matters and related issues;

*	to provide a forum for inter-governmental consultations on this subject.

The proposal made by Hon. Reginold Cooray, Minister of Minor Export Crop Promotion, to obtain membership of the above organization, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the period of the National Post Consumer Plastic Waste Management Project from 2013 to 2015
decision_details: - the National Post Consumer Plastic Waste Management Project has been launched with the objective of minimizing the damage caused to the environment by plastic and is implemented under the guidance of the Ministry of Environment and the supervision of the Central Environment Authority.  The project activities were initially implemented in the Colombo and Gampaha Districts and were subsequently expanded to the Districts of Kandy, Galle, Anuradhapura and Nuwara-Eliya in 2008 and thereafter to all areas of the country in 2009.  Based on the proposal submitted by Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, Minister of Environment, approval was granted to continue the said project for a further period of one (01) year.

title: Land for the Construction of the Secretariat and Residence of the Director General of the South Asia Co-operative Environment Programme (SACEP)
decision_details: - South Asia Co-operative Environment Programme (SACEP) is an inter- governmental organization established in 1982 under an Articles of Association by the governments of South Asia, to promote and support protection, management and enhancement of the environment in the region and its present membership comprises of the governments of Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.  SACEP Secretariat is being hosted by the Government of Sri Lanka and is located in Colombo.  The proposal made by Hon. Anura Pridharshana Yapa, Minister of Environment, for the allocation of a block of land by the Urban Development Authority in an around Battaramulla, for the said Secretariat and the residence of the Director General and for the allocation of Rs.50.0 million for the Ministry of Environment in the year 2013, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: License to Import Bitumen - Grade 60/70
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction Engineering, Housing and Common Amenities, to grant a license to the State Development and Construction Corporation (SD&CC) to import 10,000 mt. of Bitumen for the rehabilitation of 370 km. of Provincial Roads in Kegalle and Polonnaruwa Districts,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of a 4000 m3 Trailing Suction Hopper Dredger
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to appoint a Technical Evaluation Committee (TEC) to assist the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) for the purpose, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Review Committee (SCARC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Special Flood Mitigation Projects implemented by the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation (SLLR&DC)
decision_details: - Colombo Metropolitan Region is highly vulnerable to the effects of floods and on the direction of the Ministry of Defence and Urban Development, the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation has initiated several urgent short term measures such as, cleaning of existing canal system, dredging of flood retention areas, creating water retention lakes and controlling haphazard filling of low lying lands etc. Medium Term flood mitigatory measures have also been identified and implementation of these measures will be carried out under the Metro Colombo Urban Development Project and the Weras Ganga Flood Control Project.  The proposal made by H.E the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the special flood control work programme initiated by the SLLR&DC for the year 2013, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of a Property for the Chancery of the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington DC
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to purchase the identified property at No.3025, Whitehaven Street, MW Washington DC to establish the new Chancery of the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington DC, was approved by the Cabinet.  The Official Residence and the present premises of the Embassy were purchased in 1948 and the local government laws of the district of Columbia do not permit further expansion of the present building of the Chancery as the structure of the existing building does not comply with the local government standards for such expansion.

title: Appropriation Bill / Budget - 2013 - Committee Stage Programme
decision_details: - the Committee Stage Programme for the above which will commence on 2012?11?19 and conclude on 2012?12?08, submitted by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management and Leader of the House of Parliament, was noted by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of 26.65 km. of Thoppuwa-Dankotuwa-Nattandiya-Madampe Road with Financial Assistance from Hatton National Bank under rehabilitation of Priority Roads with Financial Assistance from Local Banks
decision_details: -  the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to permit the Road Development Authority to enter into a loan agreement with the Hatton National Bank to borrow a loan of Rs.2,060,849,267.84  for the above project and for the General Treasury to issue Treasury Guarantees for same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of 24.14 km of Matara-Hakmana Road with Financial Assistance from Commercial Bank and DFCC Bank under Rehabilitation of Priority Roads with financial assistance from Local Banks
decision_details: -  the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to permit the Road Development Authority to enter into two loan agreements with the Commercial Bank and DFCC Bank to borrow two loans amounting to Rs.1,400,000,000/- and Rs.577,376,618/- respectively for the above project and for the General Treasury to issue Treasury Guarantees for same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Progress of the Accelerated Development Programme up to 15th October 2012, on providing Relief Assistance and uplifting the livelihood of the drought affected people
decision_details: - this programme was implemented under four major projects as indicated below for the drought affected people in Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa, Kurunegala and Puttalam Districts and the Government has spent an amount of Rs.4,606.62 million on these activities:*	increasing the water retention capacity by de-silting 972 reservoirs and tanks at a cost of Rs.3,444.61 million.*	labour contribution by drought affected farmers for the above work and also for development of agricultural roads and cleaning of canals for which payment in cash amounting to Rs.1,113.95 million was made to the farmers.*	reconstruction of 2,553 Agro Wells at a cost of Rs.24.78 million*	provision of drinking water for the people in the drought affected areas at a cost of Rs.23.28 million.The above information was provided to the Cabinet of Ministers by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning.

title: Construction of a New building for the Trincomalee District Office of Department of Motor Traffic
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Kumara Welgama, Minister of Transport, to entrust the construction of the above to a contractor selected by calling for competitive bids from three contractors registered at the Institute of Construction Training and Development (ICTAD), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Two storied Building with a Lecture Hall and an Assembly Hall at the Peradeniya National College of Education
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to entrust the 2nd stage of the above project to a State Institution engaged in construction work on limited competitive bidding basis, at a cost of Rs.80 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Constructing a New Building at Sangamitta Girls' College, Galle for the continuation of Grade 1 Classes
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education, to construct the ground floor and the first floor of the proposed 3 storeyed building for the above school, utilizing Rs.15 million to be provided by the School Development Society and to entrust the construction and related activities to a State Institution engaged in construction work on limited competitive bidding basis, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of National Highways with Concrete Surfacing through Domestic Contractors with funds to be provided by local Banks - Improvements to the section of Road from 33.50 to 44.00 km and the section of Road from 57.00 to 59.00 km on Naula - Elahera - Laggala - Pallegama - Hettipola Road (B312) and the section of Road from 20.00 to 45.00 km on Hasalaka - Handungamuwa Road (B484)
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to award the contract for the rehabilitation of the above sections of roads, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of National Highways with Concrete Surfacing through Domestic Contractors with funds to be provided by local Banks - Rehabilitation and upgrading of  Ampara-Uhana-Mahaoya Road (A027) from 13.00 to 30.00 km
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted for the rehabilitation of additional roads having a total length of 328.77 km under the above programme and the section of road from 13.00 - 30.00 km on the Ampara - Uhana - Mahaoya Road is one such project. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to award the contact of this project, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Investment Promotion Zone (IPZ) at Suriyawewa, Hambantota set up by Board of Investment of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - a Master Plan has been prepared for the development of the Suriyawewa area as an Investment Promotion Zone (IPZ) covering approximately 230 ha., which will consist of a Multi Sports Complex, Cycling Stadium, Hockey Stadium, an International Aquatic Centre, a Media Centre, Information and Technology Park, Convention Centre, Educational Park, Hotels and Residencies etc.  The proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minsiter of Economic Development, to proceed with the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Alienation of land at Uchchimunai Island in Kalpitiya Tourism Zone to be developed as an integrated Luxury Hotel Complex
decision_details: - Kalpitiya Tourism Zone has been planned to be developed as a special tourism destination in Sri Lanka.  Under this project, Uchchimunai Island (Northern Part) in Kalpitiya is to be given on a 99 year lease to an investor recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Review Committee.  Hotels, Resorts, Water Villas, Spas, Golf Courses etc. are to be constructed and other leisure and recreation facilities provided to meet the present day needs of tourists.  The proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minister of Economic Development, to proceed with the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of Land Blocks from Regional Industrial Estates to set up Industries
decision_details: - the objective of this programme is to promote industrial development at regional level.  There are 26 Industrial Estates established in the Districts.  The proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, Minister of Industry and Commerce, to allocate blocks of land to 24 prospective investors, as recommended by Regional Industry Service Committees, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of Canal Layout of Moragahakanda-Kaluganga Project
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Development, for the revision of the canal layout of Moragahakanda - Kaluganga Project with the construction of the Upper Elehera Canal in place of the Second Bowathenna Tunnel and upgrading of the existing Huruluwewa Feeder Canal, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Policy on Antenna Structures
decision_details: - the modern telecommunication infrastructure is an essential requirement for rapid economic and social development of the country and at present 9 Public Switched Telecommunication Net-work Operators are providing telecommunication services in Sri Lanka and more than 2900 antenna structures have been installed to facilitate the provision of such services.  Considering the environmental and health related public concerns for human safety issues that arise when engaged in the construction of antenna structures and installation of net-works in public places, the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka has established a Technical Advisory Committee to assist the regulatory process on construction of antenna structures.  The proposal made by H.E. the President to implement the National Policy on Antenna Structures prepared by the said Committee and to issue guidelines in this regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Usage of Chemical Fertilizer and Agro Chemicals
decision_details: - Cabinet of Ministers decided to appoint a Ministerial Committee comprising of relevant Ministers, to be assisted by an Officials' Committee, to examine the issues arising from the  utilization of these chemicals and make recommendations to the Cabinet on measures to be taken to mitigate adverse effects of these to the environment and to the people.

title: Regulations made under the Regulation of Insurance Industry Act, No.43 of 2000
decision_details: - the proposal made by  H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to submit the Gazette Extraordinary No.1746/4 dated 2012?02?21 pertaining to the above in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of nine storied Building Complex (Phase IV) for the Faculty of Medical Sciences, University of Sri Jayewardenepura -
decision_details: - the objective of the proposed construction project is to provide adequate space for the increasing number of student intake to the Faculty of Medical Sciences, as well as for the improvement of facilities and infrastructure for teaching and research activities.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, for the construction of the above with approved funds under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework, to commence the project in 2012 and complete it in 2018, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Dry Zone Urban Water and Sanitation Project - Sri Lanka - ADB Loan No:L2477SRI (SF) - Tender for Supply and Laying of HDPE, DI & PVC Pipes, Specials, Fittings and Valves for Transmission main and Distribution System in Chilaw WSS - Stage II
decision_details: - this project is being implemented by the National Water Supply and  Drainage Board with funds provided by the Asian Development Bank and the Government of Sri Lanka.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract, on the recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC) to the lowest responsive offer for  a total bid price of US $2,310,021.00 plus LKR 289,261,568.65, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of 02 Nos. Top Heavy Lift Trucks (40 Ton) for Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, for the procurement of the above on the recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, at a total cost of Rs.168,167,649.59,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Repealing the National Museum Ordinance No.31 of 1942 and formulating a new Act in keeping with the present and future needs of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Jagath Balasuriya, Minister of National Heritage, to present the National Museums Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman, incorporating  the amendments recommended by the the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Legislation, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conversion of Sri Lanka Driving Licenses issued Prior to 2009 to New  Smart Card Driving Licenses
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Kumara Welgama, Minister of Transport,  to convert the remaining number of Old Driving Licenses of approximately 1.2 million, issued prior to 2009, to the New Smart Card Driving License System and to complete the task within a period of two years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 'Deyata Sevana' National Tree Planting Programme - 15th November 2012
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadharashana Yapa, Minister of Environment, to conduct this year's National Ceremony of the Deyata Sevana National Tree Planting Programme on 15th November 2012, with the participation of all Ministries, Departments, Corporations, Statutory Boards, Provincial Councils, District and Divisional Administration, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Prevention of Mosquito Breeding - Amendments to the relevant Act
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to bring in  amendments to the existing Act, No.11 of 2007, as recommended by the Cabinet Sub-Committee on Legislation, to enhance the powers of the relevant Authorities in the prevention of mosquito breeding, so as to curb the spreading of the dangerous dengue disease which has reached epidemic proportions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Slave Island Area Redevelopment Project, Colombo 02
decision_details: - the Urban Development Authority is presently engaged in the implementation of several projects in the city of Colombo to create more opportunities for urban investments and the housing development programme to resettle 65,000 low income families living in under-served settlements in the city of Colombo, is one such project to liberate prime lands for urban development.  The occupants in the relevant lands will be provided with decent houses with all facilities within a period of two years in lieu of their individual properties and the relevant families have agreed to renounce their rights to claim compensation for the respective land plots.  The total cost for providing alternate housing/commercial units including rental payments for temporary accommodation of the families is estimated to be about SLR 5874 million.  The proposal made by H.E. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Special Flood Mitigation Projects implemented by the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation (SLLR&DC)
decision_details: - Colombo Metropolitan Region is highly vulnerable to the effects of  floods and on the direction of the Ministry of Defence and Urban Development, the Sri Lanaka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation has initiated several urgent short term measures such as, cleaning of existing canal system, dredging of flood retention areas, creating water retention lakes and controlling haphazard filling of low lying lands etc.  Medium Term flood mitigatory measures have also been identified and implementation of these measures will be carried out under the Metro Colombo Urban Development Project and the Weras Ganga Flood Control Project.  The proposal made by H. E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to proceed with the special flood control work programme initiated by the SLLR&DC for the year 2012, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of  Kandy Lake -
decision_details: work on the development of the city of Kandy is now underway and the proposal by H.E. the President, to entrust the development of the Kandy Lake and the wall surrounding it as well as the pavement, to the Ministry of Defence and Urban Development, with the view to preserve its historical value and to promote the scenic beauty of the city of Kandy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Financial Assistance from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) for the Completion of the Original Scope of the Dry Zone Urban Water and Sanitation Project -
decision_details: this project will cover the construction of three new water treatment plants in Chillaw, Puttalam and Vavuniya and improvement of sanitation facilities in Chillaw, Puttalam, Vavuniya and Mannar.  This project, on completion, will provide safe drinking water to more than 453,000 people  living in the relevant areas.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of  Finance and Planning,  to negotiate with the Asian Development Bank to obtain  Special Drawing Rights (SDR) equivalent to US$ 40 million as additional financing for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment  of a Sri Lanka Consulate General in Melbourne, Australia
decision_details: - Melbourne has the largest Sri Lankan community concentration in Australia with a presence of nearly 80,000 to 100,000 Sri Lankans engaged in multiple fields including employment, education, trade, investment etc. The proposal made by Hon.(Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, for the establishment of a Consulate General in Melbourne which would cover the States of Victoria, South Australia and Tasmania, for which the concurrence of the Australian government has been received, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Revision to Convention on the Suppression of Terrorist Financing Act No.25 of 2005
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to amend the Convention on the Suppression of Terrorist Financing Act No.25 of 2005 and to submit the relevant amending Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: World Habitat Day - 2012 - Housing and Settlement Development Program in Colombo and other Urban areas -
Supply, Delivery,  Installation  and Maintenance of 02 Nos. of 3 Tesla MRI Scanner Machines for Kandy and Karapitiya Teaching Hospitals -
decision_details: with the view to providing better health care services to the people living in the relevant areas, the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health to award the above tender to the lowest responsive bidder, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, at a cost of US $4,054,495.00, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reconstruction of Janakala premises at Battaramulla to promote Tourism
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Jagath Balasooriya, Minister of National Heritage to utilize about two acres of Janakala Premises at Battaramulla to be developed as a model traditional village for the benefit of foreign as well as local tourists, was approved in principle by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment  of  ?Uruma Aruna Fund?
Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of Philippines and the Government of Sri Lanka for Co-operation on Agriculture and Related fields
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, to sign the above Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of Philippines and the Government of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Joint Task Force for Promotion of Commercial Relations between Sri Lanka and India
decision_details: - the annual value of two way trade between Sri Lanka and India has now reached nearly US$ 5.0 billion.  Sri Lanka's exports to India stands over US $500 million, while its imports from India have been closer to US $4.5 billion in 2011. With the view to promoting mutual trade between the two countries and also to promote Indian investments in several key sectors including pharmaceuticals, textiles and auto accessories etc. it is intended to establish a Joint Task Force representing different line authorities and private sector agencies.  The above information was furnished  by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, Minister of Industry and Commerce, for the information of the Cabinet of Ministers.

title: United States Agency for International Development (USAID) - First Amendments to Assistance Agreements on Strengthening of Social Integration Programme and the Programme for Equitable Economic Growth in Developing Regions
decision_details: - two assistance agreements have already been signed by the Government with USAID for the above and a USAID has agreed to enhance its contribution in a sum of US $1,400,000 and US $3,700,000 respectively, for above two programmes.

title: Tax Week - from November 01st to 08th 2012
Establishment of Wild Elephant Holding Grounds to Minimize Damages Caused by Wild Elephants
decision_details: - the proposal to establish two Wild Elephant Holding Grounds at Horowpathana and Lunugamwehera, in the first instance, with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Frame Work 2013 - 2015, to minimize human  elephant conflict, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Priority Projects 2012 - Bandaranaike International Airport and Hambantota  International Airport
decision_details:
- the proposal made by Hon. Piyankara Jayaratne, Minister of Civil Aviation,  to call for sealed bids for the above projects from the reputed contractors as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Review Committee (SCARC), was approved by the Cabinet.  The following are to be implemented under these projects:
Bandaranaike International Airport

		*	VVIP Building
		*	Transit Area	Expansion
		*	Domestic Terminal Building
		*	Refurbishment of Walkways - Departure / Arrival Terminals
		*	Immigration Area Expansion
Hambantota International Airport

*	50 Nos. Housing Units

title: Construction of three storied three (03) Building units for the Expansion of Students Hostel at Sarasaviuyana, University of Peradeniya
decision_details: - with the view to enhancing the accommodation facilities at the University of Peradeniya to cater to the increasing number of students entering the University, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education to construct three (03) storied building units at the Peradeniya University at a total cost of Rs.89.53 million and to commence this project in 2012 and complete it within three years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bunkering facility and Tank Farm Project Hambantota - Increase of Estimated Total Contract Price
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, for the Sri Lanka Ports Authority to enter into a loan agreement with the Bank of Ceylon for a sum of US $20,879,037.00, to meet the additional cost involved due to the addition of the second oil jetty to the scope of the work and also for the provision of other related facilities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of National Highways with concrete surfacing through  domestic contractors - rehabilitation and improvement of Haputale - Boralanda - Keppettipola Road (B353) from  0 to 27 Km and Meepe - Ingiriya Road (B285) from 0 to 18.13 Km
decision_details: ? Cabinet approval has already been granted to rehabilitate 662.04 km of roads with concrete surfacing through domestic contractors to be financed by local banks.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Posts and Highways, to include the above two roads also in the above programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the construction of the proposed Ten Storeyed Building for the Army Hospital
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to construct a 10 storeyed building with modern facilities for the Army Hospital at a total cost of Rs.4105 million with financial provision to be provided between 2013 - 2015, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expeditious solution for prevention of occurrence of Forest Fires
Multi Faceted Mixed Use Development Project in Colombo - ITC Ltd., India (Welcome Hotels Lanka Pvt. Ltd.)
decision_details: - ITC Limited, India intends to set up a multi faceted mixed use development project with an investment of US $140 million on a section of the property of former Army Headquarters premises in Colombo 03.  ITC Limited, India is the second largest hotel chain in India with over 100 hotels.  The above project includes luxury hotels, high quality residencies and shopping malls.  The proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, Minister of Economic Development, to recognize this project as a Strategic Development Project under Act No.14 of 2008, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Promotion Day for Grass Growing in respect of Milk Production
decision_details: - presently the country producers nearly 40% of its milk requirement and the Government has adopted several measures to increase the production of milk.  There are about 2000 farmer - managed - dairy societies in the country with a membership of nearly 70,000 dairy farmers.  The proposal made by Hon. Arumugan Thondaman, Minister of Livestock and Rural Community Development, to declare October 30th as a Promotion Day for grass growing, so as to create awareness among the farmers, of the value of natural resources for increased milk production, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of uniforms and other clothing materials for the Army, Air Force, Police, Special Task Force, Department of Civil Security and National Cadet Crops - 2012
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, for the purchase of uniform material required for the above services for the year 2012, from domestic manufactures, on the recommendations of the Technical Evaluation Committee, at a total cost of Rs.2,034,031,720/-, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of Financial Provisions to supply necessary facilities for the commencement of Immigration and Emigration duties at the Mattala International Airport
decision_details: - the proposal made by H. E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to purchase the necessary equipments and make other arrangements to provide an effective and efficient service in accordance with international standards to passengers passing through Mattala Airport once it is commissioned, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Lease of Land at Warakapola Town Center to M/s Cargills Ceylon PLC for a Shopping Mall or Super Market
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to lease out a block of land owned by the Urban Development Authority, for a Shopping Mall / Super Market under the Warakapola Town Development Project, to M/s. Cargills Ceylon PLC, which has quoted the highest bid value during selection, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting / Acquisition of Lands for resettlement of families living in  Under-served Settlements in the City of Colombo
decision_details: -  the Urban Development Authority has planned to construct 65,000 Housing Units for resettlement of shanty dwellers living in under-served settlements in the City of Colombo.  It is expected to construct high rise apartments with all common amenities to resettle the families and to free those sites for commercial and mixed development projects, in keeping with the City of Colombo Development Plan.  The Urban Development Authority has already awarded contracts to build 9,781 Housing Units under 11 projects within the City of Colombo, where the work is in progress and is intended to complete construction within the next 2 years.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development to vest the identified blocks of state land to be utilized for the purpose, as Free Grants with the Urban Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 65th Independence Day Celebrations - 04th February 2013
decision_details:
the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to appoint a Ministerial Committee consisting of the following to make necessary arrangements for the 65th Independence Day Celebrations, was approved by the Cabinet:
Ministerial Committee
