		*	Hon. Wijaya Dahanayaka,
			Deputy Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs.

	Secretary, Ministry of Public Administration and Home Affairs will function as the Secretary to this Committee.

title: Shilpa 2012 Craft and Small  Medium Industry Exhibition and Trade Fair
decision_details: - this Exhibition and Trade Fair will be held for 4 days from 27th December 2012 at the BMICH.  This event plays a pivotal role in supporting handicraftsmen and small and medium scale entrepreneurs to strengthen and develop their craft skills and marketing channels.  The National Crafts Council, the National Design Centre, Industrial Development Board and Palmyrah Development Board will be associated in making necessary arrangements for this Exhibition and Trade Fair.  The proposal made by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development, to proceed with the programme was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme for Strengthening the Samurdhi / Divineguma families in the Anuradhapura District concurrently with the 'Deyata Kirula' Exhibition
decision_details: - housing facilities of Samurdhi / Divineguma low income families are to be improved during the above period  and 31,931 household units have been identified for development under this programme.   The total quantity of tiles required for the District has been estimated to be 27,821,836.  The above proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapakse, Minister of Economic Development, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: ADB Loan for 2011 - Lot C - Second Circuit Stringing of Kotmale - New Anuradhapura 220KV, 163 Km Long Transmission Line
decision_details: ? Asian Development Bank has agreed to provide funding assistance to implement six power sector projects and one such project is the Eastern (North and East) Transmission Development Project. Lot C above is estimated to cost US $8.8 million (equivalent to LKR 1008.04 million). The proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, Minister of Power and Energy, to proceed with the above project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Investment Opportunities under the Second International Airport at Mattala
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Piyankara Jayaratne, Minister of Civil Aviation, to call for request for proposals for various investment opportunities relating to aviation services, to be associated with the Mattala Airport, in addition to passenger handling and cargo operations, was approved by the Cabinet. Blocks of land are to be leased out for the investors selected to launch their projects.

title: Iranamadu Irrigation Development Project - Kilinochchi District
decision_details:
- on the initiative of H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning,  Loan Negotiations have been concluded with the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) to obtain a loan of Special Drawing Rights (SDR) 14,350,000 (approximately US$ 22,231,000) to finance the above project.  The project will cover 8455 hectares and will benefit the farmers living around the tank area.  The project includes the following:

*	Infrastructure Development - it is proposed to rehabilitate down-stream canal system of this tank which provides irrigation water to 8455 hectares.  This includes rehabilitation of 30km of 2 main canals, 135km of branch and distribution canals, 123km of field canals and 95km of drainage canals.  Farm roads will also be improved. The project will support around 2000 families experiencing water shortages.

*	Production and Marketing - the project will support and strengthen water management activities for women groups and youth to engage in non-paddy crop cultivation and off-farm income generation activities, agricultural processing and organic fertilizer production.  

The loan will have a 40 year re-payment period including a grace period of 10 years. The proposal made by H.E. the President to enter into a loan agreement with the IFAD for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Payment of Bonus to the Employees of  Government Corporations and Fully Owned Government companies for the Year 2011
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, for the payment of bonus to the employees of  Government Corporations and Fully Owned Government companies for the Year 2011, as was paid in the year 2010, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Annual Report and Accounts for the year 2009 of Paddy  Marketing Board to the Parliament
decision_details: - during the year under review the Paddy Marketing Board had purchased 57,469 MT of paddy from farmers throughout the Island and was able to generate Rs.150 million as profit from this operation.  The Board was also able to maintain a buffer stock of 180,000 MT of paddy.  The above Annual Report submitted by Hon. Johnston Fernando, Minister of Cooperatives and Internal Trade, was approved for presentation in Parliament.

title: Construction of the SAARC Cultural Centre at Naawimana in Matara
decision_details:
- the proposal made by Hon. T.B. Ekanayaka, Minister of Culture and the Arts, for the construction of the SAARC Cultural Centre at a cost of Rs.500 million and for the work to be completed within the first quarter of 2013, was approved by the Cabinet.  The objectives of the Centre are:

*	Strengthening regional cultural relations through the Cultural Centre.

*	Protecting and promoting regional heritage and traditional diversities.

* Providing opportunities for traditional teachings, studies, explorations and research in the region.

title: Procurement of 25 Nos. Super Luxury Buses on Easy Credit Basis to Sri Lanka Transport Board
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Kumara Welgama, Minister of Transport, to procure 25 super luxury buses to the Sri Lanka Transport Board, in order to minimize the traffic congestion on approach roads to Colombo city, such as Galle Road, Kandy Road, High Level Road, Negombo Road, Kaduwela Road, Horana Road  and to provide better facilities to commuters, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Repairing the Building complex with class rooms and the old Boarding House at the Visakha National School, Colombo 04
decision_details: - the proposal by Hon. Bandula Gunawardane, Minister of Education, to award the contract for repair and modernization, planning and supervision of the three storied building complex and the Boarding House building on a competitive bidding basis, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of four storied Administration Building for Gampaha Wickramarachchi Ayurveda Institute, University of Kelaniya
decision_details: - this Institute offers Bachelor of Ayurveda Medicine and Surgery Degree (BAMS) and has over 400 students and it has increased the annual intake of students for this Degree programme from 80 to 120 per year.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to construct a four storied building at a total cost of Rs.134 million, was approved by the Cabinet.  The initial work of the project will be commenced utilizing the financial provision allocated for construction work in 2012 and the balance will be completed with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2013 - 2015.

title: Commemoration of the National Safety Day - 2011
decision_details: - 26th of December each year has been declared as the National Safety Day. The objective of this declaration is to create awareness among the people on natural and other disasters and particularly to enhance proper disaster response capacity to encounter situations such as the Tsunami which occurred on 26th December 2004. The National Safety Day has been held annually since 2006 and it has been decided to commemorate this event in 2011 in Kattankudy Town, Batticaloa. The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, Minister of Disaster Management to implement a series of programmes for the purpose with the active participation of the relevant Government institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Approval for implementation of Project Facilitating Initiatives for Social cohesion and Transformation
decision_details: - this project stems from the bilateral agreement between the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany and the Government of Sri Lanka. This programme contributes to initiatives towards a socially integrated, harmonious and peaceful Sri Lanka that promotes equality and diversity. The project would help to build institutional capabilities of Community Based Organizations to take up local responsibilities. The proposal made by Hon. Wasudewa Nanayakkara, Minister of National Languages and Social Integration to implement all programmes pertaining to social cohesion and transformation in the five Districts of Ampara, Puttalam, Mullaitivu, Badulla and Galle at a total cost of Euro 3 million (Rs.474 million), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Dikkumbura Water Supply System
decision_details: - Dikkumbura is located in the Galle District about 6 Km. away from Ahangama. This area lies within the  administrative area of the Imaduwa Pradeshiya Sabha. The objective of the proposal is to supply safe drinking water facilities to the people living in the area. The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage to implement this project at a total cost of Rs.317 million with funds to be provided during 2013 and 2014 , was approved by the Cabinet.

title: A Credit of United States Dollars 11 million (approximately Special Drawing Rights 7 million ) from the International Development Association of the World Bank as an Additional Financing for E- Sri Lanka Development Project
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted to enter into a Loan Agreement with the International Development Association (IDA) of the World Bank to borrow US$ 53 million for the implementation of the above project. The World Bank has agreed to provide a further amount of US$ 11 million as additional financing for the development of this project and the proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to conduct loan negotiations with IDA of the World Bank and enter into a Financing Arrangement for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Sand 	feeding in the Marawila Coastal Region for protection against coastal erosion
decision_details: - it has been identified that one of the main reasons for coastal erosion in the Negombo-Chilaw Coastal Zone is excessive sand mining and the most appropriate solution to arrest this situation in the Marawila coastal region is sand feeding by means of sand mined from deep sea and construction of a few off shore break waters. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, for the appointment of a Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee and a Technical Evaluation Committee to proceed with the work, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Re-development Programme of Colombo City and its? Surroundings
Agreement on Economic and Technical Cooperation between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the People?s Republic of China
decision_details: - the Government of the Peoples Republic of China has agreed to provide a grant in a sum of Renminbi Yuan 100 million to Sri Lanka and the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to enter into an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement between the two countries in December 2011, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Grant Assistance of Euro 11,500,000 from the Government of Federal Republic of Germany
decision_details:
- the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany has agreed to provide grant assistance in a sum of Euro 11,500,000 for the implementation of  the following development projects in the Northern and Eastern Provinces of Sri Lanka:

*	Vocational Training Centre in the Northern Province  - it is proposed to establish a complete Vocational Training Centre at Kilinochchi.  This Centre will have a capacity of about 400 students and both short term and long term training programmes will be conducted in the fields of Metal Technology, Electronics, Automotive Sector, IT Sector, Agriculture and Food Security.  In addition to the above grant, a loan of 3 million Euro from KfW of Germany, will also be obtained for the construction of building.

*	Small and Medium Sector Development Project - this programme will include Textile, Agribusiness, Food and Beverages, Tourism related industry, Livestock etc.

*	Performance Improvement Project for Development Actors in the Northern and Eastern Provinces - this project is focused on human resource development in the Northern and Eastern Provincial Councils and capacity development for local government institutions.

title: Institute of Construction Training & Development (ICTAD) - Annual Report for the Year 2010
decision_details: - the main objective of ICTAD is to promote the contribution of the construction industry in meeting national demand in development objectives.  Currently nearly 2500 construction contractors are registered with ICTAD and this information is now available on the Web site.   The Operator Training Unit provides training on construction equipment such as crawler tractors, loaders, excavators etc.  The training programmes consist of institutional training and on-the-job training.  During the year under review, ICTAD has conducted vocational training courses for early school leavers to help to solve the unemployment problem of the youth.  This three year Basic Mechanical Training Programme is conducted in collaboration with the National Apprenticeship & Industrial Training Authority (NAITA).   The above Annual Report submitted by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities, was approved for presentation in Parliament.

title: Tender for the purchase of New Buses to Sri Lanka Transport Board
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Kumara Welgama, Minister of Transport, to award the tender, on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, for the procurement of 54 seater buses at a unit price of Rs.4,740,940.00, to Lanka Ashok Layland PLC., utilizing Rs.500 million allocated for the year 2011, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting an Airborne Magnetic and Gamma Ray Spectrometer Survey Covering Entire Sri Lanka including the Fringe of the Continental Shelf
decision_details: - this survey is vital to gather essential geo-information required for systematic mineral exploration of the country and hence, would be a key factor in attracting investors for mineral sector development. This would assist to identify areas for detailed ground surveys in the mineral sector.  It was not possible to conduct a survey of this nature covering the entire Island for the last three decades due to the conflict situation which prevailed in the North and the East. The proposal made by Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, Minister of Environment, to award the above contract, on the recommendations of the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee and the Project Committee,  for a total cost of  US $16.4 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a new building for the Institute of Fundamental Studies
decision_details: - the principal mandate of this Institute is to initiate, promote and conduct research and investigations in fundamental studies in general with particular emphasis on mathematics, physical and chemical sciences, life sciences and philosophy.  The proposal made by Hon. Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Technology and Research, for the construction of a new building for this Institute and to purchase necessary equipment at a total cost of Rs.2,00,000,000.00, was approved by the Cabinet.  The initial work of the project will be commenced utilizing the financial provision allocated for construction work in 2012 and the balance will be completed with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2013.

title: Construction of New Building for the Department of Management Studies - Faculty of Arts, University of Peradeniya - Revision of Total Cost Estimate
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted for the construction of a new building for the above, to commence Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) programme with an intake of 100 students per year, the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to revise the Total Cost Estimate of the construction of the two storied building from Rs.42.11 million to Rs.78.5 million, due to increase in construction costs, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of stage I of the seven storied building for the Faculty of Graduate Studies, University of Colombo using Generated funds
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted for the construction of  a seven storied building for the above Faculty of the University of Colombo at a total cost of 405 million.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to construct first two floors of the above under Stage I of the project with an amount of Rs.152 million from the generated funds of the Faculty of Graduate Studies, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of four storied Administration Building for Gampaha Wickramarachchi Ayurveda Institute, University of Kelaniya
decision_details: - this Institute offers Bachelor of Ayurveda Medicine and Surgery Degree (BAMS) and has over 400 students and it has increased the annual intake of students for this Degree programme from 80 to 120 per year.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, to construct a four storied building at a total cost of Rs.79 million, was approved by the Cabinet.  The initial work of the project will be commenced utilizing the financial provision allocated for construction work in 2012 and the balance will be completed with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2013 - 2014.

title: Supply & Delivery of Materials for Sustainable Power Sector Support Project (Expansion of Rural Electrification & Distribution System Improvement Ampara and Uva)
decision_details: - the Government has received a loan from the Asian Development Bank towards the cost of Sustainable Power Sector Support Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of the loan for expansion of Rural Electrification and Distribution System Improvement in Ampara and Uva.  The proposal made by Hon. Patali Chanpika Ranawaka, Minister of Power and Energy, to award four relevant contracts, on the recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of Electricity Supply - Jaffna Region Transmission Project Kilinochchi - Chunnakam Transmission Line - Lot C-B : Earth Wire replacement with OPGW
Regional Bridge Project Phase - 2 with Financial assistance from United Kingdom
decision_details: - there are over 4500 bridges on the National Highway Network in Sri Lanka and about 160 bridges have been identified for replacement with new bridges on a priority basis.  Mabey Bridge Limited, UK is presently involved in the Regional Bridge Project implemented by the Road Development Authority with UK funding.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to award the contract for the construction of single and two lane steel bridges throughout Sri Lanka, on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, to Mabey Bridge Limited, UK, at a cost of GBP 45 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of National Highways with concrete surfacing through domestic contractors - Approval to Implement the proposal submitted by M/S Nawaloka Construction Company(Pvt) Ltd. for the rehabilitation of Galigamuwa - Ruwanwella - Karawanella Road from 0 to 29.21 km
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted to rehabilitate 662.04 km. of roads by the Road Development Authority through domestic contractors by obtaining the required funds amounting to around US $500 million from local Banks.  The above is one such road approved for rehabilitation under this programme.  The proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to award the contract of the above at the negotiated sum of Rs.2,472,357,070.33 was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project to construct a 350 meter high Multifunctional TV and Telecommunication Tower along with a Leisure Park in Colombo
decision_details: - with the present rate of growth in the TV and Telecommunication Sectors in the country, Cabinet approval has already been granted to construct a multifunctional TV and Telecommunication Tower approximately 350 meters in height  which could be used by 50 telecasting services, 10 telecommunication services and 50 radio broadcasting services.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, to rename the project as "Colombo Lotus Tower Project" and to explore the possibility of shifting the project to a central tourist zone in Colombo with the view to proceed with the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the National Human Rights Action Plan (NHRAP)
decision_details: - this action plan for the protection and promotion of human rights was approved by the Cabinet at its meeting held on 07th September 2011. The Government considers it important to implement the above Action Plan to enable our successful engagement with several international human rights organizations, especially the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHCR). The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, Minister of Plantation Industries, to undertake initial work for Sri Lanka's participation in the second cycle of the Universal Periodic Review in October 2012, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Policy on the Establishment of a Health Assessment for Resident Visa Applicants to Sri Lanka
decision_details: - with the increased development activities taking place in the country after the conflict situation which prevailed some time  back, it has been observed that quite a large number of foreigners obtain resident visas to Sri Lanka to participate in these activities.  It has been found necessary to protect the public health needs of the Sri Lankan community and also the physical, mental and social needs of migrants.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, for the implementation of a policy to conduct a health assessment for the resident visa applicants, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Agreement on Economic, Commercial and Technical Cooperation between the Government of the State of Qatar and the Government  of the Democratic  Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka
decision_details: -  the proposal made by Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, Minister of Industry and Commerce, to sign the above Agreement between the State of Qatar and the Government of Sri Lanka to enhance economic relations between the  two countries and to promote and facilitate export and import of industrial and agricultural raw material and value added products, was approved by the Cabinet.  The proposed Agreement will promote and develop cooperation between the two countries in economic, commercial and technical fields.

title: Financial Assistance of Euro 22 million from the Government of France for Widening and Reconstruction of Bridges on National Road Network
decision_details: - the Government of France has agreed to provide Euro 22 million for the reconstruction of 46 bridges on the National Road Network.  These bridges have been selected from Western, Southern, Uva, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North Western Provinces on priority basis.  The bridges located close to towns will be given high priority to eliminate traffic congestion.  The project will be implemented by the Road Development Authority under the supervision of the Ministry of Ports and Highways.  The proposal made by H.E. the President to enter into a Loan Agreement for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on the Establishment of a High Joint Committee between the Government of the State of Qatar and the Government  of the Democratic  Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka
decision_details: -  the proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to sign the above Agreement between the State of Qatar and the Government of Sri Lanka, to strengthen bi-lateral relations in the economic, commercial, cultural, scientific, technical, education and information sectors and to develop trade, investment and tourism between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.  The MoU will be signed during the visit of the Hon. Prime Minister and Foreign Minister of the State of Qatar to Sri Lanka from 12th to 13th December 2011.

title: Signing of the Agreement of Co-operation in the field of Culture between the government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the State of Qatar
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. T.B. Ekanyake, Minister of Culture and the Arts, to enter into the above Agreement with the view to  enhancing the cultural cooperation between the State of Qatar and the Government of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.   This will promote and develop co-operation between the two countries in the fields of culture, publications and similar areas.

title: Construction of 50m, 8 lane Swimming Pool with diving facilities at Piliyandala Central Collage
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Mahindananda Aluthgama, Minister of Sports to construct a swimming pool at the Piliyandala Central College at a total revised contract sum of Rs.43,882,660.00 was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of National Highways with concrete surfacing through domestic contractors - Rehabilitation and Improvement of the Polonnaruwa - Tambala - Sungawila - Somawathiya Road (33.0 km)
decision_details: - Cabinet has granted approval for the rehabilitation of 662.04 Km. of roads through domestic contractors by obtaining the required funds amounting to around US $ 500 million from local Banks. The above road  having a length of 33.0 Km. is one of the roads approved for rehabilitation under this programme. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to award the above contract on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee and the Technical Evaluation Committee, for a sum of Rs. 2,750, 000,000.00, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Youth Corps Authority
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development, to repeal the Youth Corps Act No. 21 of 2002 and to establish a new statutory institution named Youth Corps Authority and to draft legislation for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet. The proposed Bill will focus on youth development, leadership training, conducting job oriented vocational courses etc.

title: Amendments to the National Film Corporation Act No.47 of 1971 as amended by Act No.45 of 1980
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Keheliya Rambukwella, Minister of Mass Media and Information, to introduce necessary amendments to the above Act  in keeping with the recommendations of the Cabinet Sub-Committee  on Legislation and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare amending legislation for the purpose,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Vessel Monitoring System (VMS)
decision_details: - at present about 3000 multi-day fishing vessels owned by Sri Lankan fishermen are being operated in the deep sea and in international waters in the Indian Ocean.  Sri Lanka, as a member and a contracting party of the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission is required to establish and operate a Vessel Monitoring System (VMS) for the vessels operating in the high seas.  This will immensely benefit the country to combat illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing practices in the region.  The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, to appoint a Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee and a Technical Evaluation Committee to evaluate the proposal received in this regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Apartment Housing Ownership Act No.11 of 1973 and the Condominium Management Authority Act No.10 of 1973"
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities, for the appointment of a Committee of Experts consisting of representatives of the relevant institutions, to examine  the amendments necessary for the above two Acts and make recommendations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Road Project Preparatory Facility funded by Asian Development Bank
decision_details: - under the Asian Development Bank funded Road Development Preparatory Facility, a consultancy contract to undertake a feasibility study  and detailed engineering design of 400 Km. of Provincial Roads in Kilinochchi and Mullaitivu Districts, has already been awarded to a company in France by the Ministry of Local Government and Provincial Councils. The proposal made by Hon. A.L.M. Athaullah, Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils, on the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Consultant Procurement Committee, to assign the responsibility of completing the preparatory works of additional roads of the National Highways too to the same company of France, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Restoration and Development of Defunct Elephant Pass Saltern
decision_details: - the proposal by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development, for action to be taken by the Ministry to recommence operation of the Elephant Pass Saltern which is in a defunct state due to the conflict situation which prevailed in the Northern Province for nearly three decades, was approved by the Cabinet. This will generate employment opportunities in the Northern Province and will also help the Government to save foreign exchange spent on import of salt and salt base products. A suitable local investor is to be selected for the purpose through formal procedure and the relevant land and other assets will be leased out to the investor.

title: Allocation of land at Pannipitiya to the Ministry of Education of the Western Province
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President,  in his  capacity  as  Minister of Defence and Urban Development to allocate a block of land over one acre in extent, situated at Depanama, Pannipitiya to the Ministry of Education of the Western Province, to be used for expansion of school premises of the Depanama Dharmapala Junior School, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Flagship Investment in the City of Colombo by M/S International TC Limited (ITCL) of India Franchisee of  Sheraton Group of USA
decision_details: - Colombo is to be developed as a Middle Income City in terms of the long term development framework of the Government.   This includes housing for shanty dwellers presently living within the city, so as to ensure better living conditions and to provide them opportunities for urban employment and livelihood activities.  The new plan will also protect the green belt areas, waterway reservations etc. M/s. ITC Limited of India, 'Franchisee of SHERATON GROUP of USA' has expressed its interest to invest in a sum of US $300 million, in a luxury hotel and mixed development in Colombo.   Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Basil Rajapakse, Minister of Economic Development, to provide a block of land on lease in Colombo, on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Review Committee (SCARC), was approved by the Cabinet. The proposal was also supported by the Indian High Commission in Colombo and Indian Senior Government Officials, as a reputed investments that would be beneficial for Sri Lanka's tourism industry.

title: Construction of a Building Complex for the Faculty of Agriculture of the University of Rajarata
decision_details: - the Rajarata University which was established in 2001 at Puliyankulama, has 5 Faculties including the Faculty of Agriculture. The student population of the Faculty of Agriculture is over 400 and it is expected to increase the intake with the expansion of infrastructure facilities.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education to construct a three storied building complex for this Faculty at a total cost of Rs.143 million and to award the consultancy services to the State Engineering Corporation, was approved by the Cabinet.  The initial work of the project will be commenced with funds provided in 2011 and the balance construction work  with funds provided from 2012 to 2014.

title: Rehabilitation of Electricity Supply - Jaffna Region Transmission Project Kilinochchi - Chunnakam Transmission Line - Lot C-A : Protection Panel Replacement Works
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, Minister of Power and Energy to award the above contract, on the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, to the lowest evaluated bidder, M/s. Siemens Ltd., India for a total price of Euro 4,147,128.68 plus LKR 74,560,345.00, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Sterilized Surgical Gloves and Examination Gloves to the Government Hospitals under the Ministry of Health
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health for the purchase of a total quantity 18,259,500 surgical gloves and examination gloves at a total cost of Rs.202,386,000.00, from the relevant suppliers indicated in the Memorandum, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tender for the Supply of 650,000 of Deferasirox Tablets 400mg
decision_details: - the  proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health to award the tender for the purchase of the above, to the lowest responsive bidder, on the recommendation of Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, for a total cost of US $1,199,220.00 (LKR131,644,013.60), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of 2 Nos. Top Heavy Lift Trucks (40 Ton) for Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - the volume of domestic cargo handled in the Port of Colombo continues to increase with the steady economic growth in the country and it has been found necessary to commence procurement activities for the purchase of the above mentioned cargo handling equipment. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to appoint a Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee  to handle the procurement of the above, and also to  appoint a Technical Evaluation Committee for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Road sector assistance project funded by the International Development Association - Selection of a consultant for the consultancy services for design review, construction supervision and contract administration for the rehabilitation and improvement of the road section from Ambepussa to Dambulla (90.5 km) on the Ambepussa - Kurunegala - Trincomalee Road (A6 Road)
decision_details: - the Government of Sri Lanka has received a loan of US $100 million from the International Development Association (IDA) and a part of the proceeds of this loan is to be utilized for the rehabilitation and improvement of the section of the above road. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways to award the contract for Consultancy Services of the above project for a sum of US $723,000 and LKR 178,009,500/-, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Cost Revision and Regularizing the appointment of Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB) as a Consultant & Construction Contractor for four construction projects of the Eastern University, Sri Lanka
Re-Construction of four Hospitals in Killinochchi & Mullaitivu Districts
decision_details:
-	expeditious action is being taken by the Government to strengthen the Health Services in 	the Northern Province which were not functioning well during the last three decades due 	to the conflict situation which prevailed in the areas. Mullaitivu District has 05	Divisional Secretariat Divisions consisting of 127 Grama Niladhari Divisions and	Kilinochchi District has 04 Divisional Secretariat Divisions consisting of 95 Grama	Niladhari Divisions. With the resettlement of the Internally Displaced Persons in these	areas, it has been found necessary to improve the Health Services in these areas very	early.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health  	for the development  of the following hospitals, with grant assistance in a sum of Rs.190  	million from the United States Pacific Command and in a sum of Rs.23 million from	Domestic Funds, was approved by the Cabinet: 

			Mullaitivu District 

		* 	Divisional Hospital, Oddusudan 

			
			Kilinochchi District
	 	
    * 	Base Hospital , Mullankavil
    *	 Divisional Hospital, Poonakary
    *	 Divisional Hospital, Pallai

title: Hambantota Port Development Project ? Commencement of Business Ventures
decision_details:
- Cabinet approval has already been granted for the commencement of the undermentioned 3 business ventures under the Hambantota Port Development Project by the respective successful bidders: 

*	M/s. Shree Renuka Sugar Ltd - India for operation of a Sugar 	Refinery Plant;
*	M/s. Peak Energy (Pvt.) Ltd.- Singapore for operation of Petro Chemical 	Plants (PET Resin Plant); and,
*	M/s. Haleys Advantis Ltd for Fertilizer Storage / Processing / Bagging Plant.

	The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and 	Highways, on the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee to 	award the contract for the Cement Grinding Plant to M/s. Thatta Cement Co. of 	Pakistan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of a block of land at Medabowala, Kandy to the National Water Supply 	& Drainage Board for Kandy City Waste Water Disposal Project
decision_details: - the proposal 	made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban	Development, to lease out a block of land situated at William Gopallawa Mawatha,	Kandy, to the National Water Supply and Drainage Board for the establishment of the	Kandy City Waster Water Disposal Pump House, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revival of Underperforming Enterprises And Underutilized Assets
Annual Report of the Hector Kobbekaduwa Agrarian Research and Training Institute for the year 2010
decision_details: - during the year under review, the Institute had carried out 17 research studies which were identified in consultation with the stakeholders.  In addition to the research work, the Institute had conducted 43 training programmes and 3573 persons, including farmers had been trained.  The Institute also organized International Training Programmes in collaboration with foreign agencies.  The above Annual Report submitted by Hon.Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of  Agriculture, was approved for presentation in Parliament.

title: Annual Report of the Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board for the year 2010
decision_details: - during the year under review, attention was paid by the Board to popularize the Social Security Schemes such as the Farmers' Pension and Social Security Benefits Scheme and the Fishermen's Social Security Benefits Scheme, both operating under this Board.  The Board was also successful in earning its highest income during the year. Special training programmes were held during the year for the officers of the Board in the Northern and Eastern Provinces, where the Board's Insurance Schemes had remained inactive for a long time due to the conflict situation, but have now been revived.  The above Annual Report submitted by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, was approved for presentation in Parliament.

title: Construction of  Building Complex for the University of  Vocational Technology
decision_details: -  Cabinet approval has already been granted to construct a Learning Resource Development Centre in the premises of the University of Vocational Technology at a cost of Rs.17.9 million.  In addition to the above, the proposal made by Hon. Dallas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development to construct a four storied classroom complex for this University at a cost of Rs.342 million and to entrust the construction work to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB), which is a government concern, was approved by the Cabinet. Initial work of the project will be commenced with funds available for 2011, and the balance work with funds from 2012 to 2014.

title: Awarding the Contract of Conducting Pre-Feasibility Studies for the Proposed Badulla-Bibila-Wellawaya New Railroad to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB)
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Kumara Welgama, Minister of Transport to conduct a per-feasibility study of the above project as well as two other alternatives, in the first instance and to entrust the work to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau (CECB), which is a government concern, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Building for the Bhikku Hostel under Relocation of the Buddhasravaka Bhikku University, Anuradhapura
decision_details: - the University has been relocated and the construction of the administration building has been completed.  The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education to construct a four storied building at a cost of Rs.118 million to provide residential facilities for Bhikku students and to award the construction contract and consultancy services of this Project, to the State Engineering Corporation, by prioritizing the project and with funds from the Medium Term Budgetary Framework,was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tender for the Supply of the Normal Immunoglobulin for Intravenous Use BP 5G-6G 9000 vials
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to award the above tender to the lowest responsive bidder, on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee,  at a total cost of US$ 1,980,000.00 (LKR 216,788,616.00), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 15.	Cabinet Memorandum for Establishment of Korean Project for International Agriculture (KOPIA) Centre in Sri Lanka
Implementation of a Strategic Plan for the Promotion of Ceylon Tea
2012-2021 Ten Year Plan for a Trilingual Sri Lanka
decision_details: - it has been observed that one of the far-seeing initiatives that needs to be taken to prevent the resurgence of terrorism which ravaged the country for over three decades is to encourage the people of Sri Lanka to communicate effectively in all three languages. In recognition of this need, a Ten Year Plan formulated as the basis for a National Programme to motivate the people to acquire trilingual skills, presented to the Cabinet by H.E. the President, was approved for implementation. A Co-ordinating Unit for the purpose will be established at the Presidential Secretariat.  According to this Plan, the Year 2012 is to be declared as the Year for a Trilingual Sri Lanka.

title: Awarding the Contract for the Construction of the Proposed Building for the Department of Census and Statistics - Phase 2
decision_details: - the Department of Census and Statistics is housed in 06 locations in Colombo at present and it has been decided to construct a new building for this Department to house all the divisions in one building.  Stage I of the Project was implemented with funds from the World Bank and the Government of Sri Lanka. The proposal made by H.E. the President, on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, to award the contract for Phase II of the Project  for a total contract  sum of Rs.727,529,015.16 with funds to be provided by the Government, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 17th SAARC Summit held in Addu City, Maldives
decision_details:
- the 17th SAARC Summit was held in Maldives from 10 - 11 November 2011 and was attended by Heads of States of  Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.  H.E. the President in his address stated that the Region of  South Asia consists of a large, creative and talented pool of young human resource base reflecting an increasingly promising future for the Region of SAARC and that the Region should take necessary courses of action to realize the potential of such unprecedented human resource base.  He also stated that the other challenges the Region confronts are food and energy security, environmental degradation, upgrading of infrastructure and protection of our societies from terrorism.  During the Summit, the following four (04) crucial Agreements were signed:

*	Agreement of Multilateral Arrangement for Recognition of Conformity Assessment,

*	Agreement on Implementation of Regional Standards,

*	Agreement on Establishing SAARC Seed Bank,

*	Agreement on Rapid Response to Natural Disaster.

	H.E. the President also held discussions with other Heads of States and dignitaries.  At his meeting with the Prime Minister of  India, the President appreciated the contribution made by India for the reconstruction and development of the Northern Province and elaborated on the measures the government is taking on re-settlement, rehabilitation and re-integration, including that of former LTTE combatants.

title: Credit Facility of US$ 33 million from the EXIM Bank of China to finance Lighting Sri Lanka Eastern Province Project
decision_details: - the Government of China has agreed to provide a credit facility through the Export Import Bank of China for the above project, the total cost of which is US $ 33,335,280 and LKR 544,184,780. Accordingly, 85% of the cost will be financed by the EXIM Bank of China and the  balance 15% will be provided by the government of Sri Lanka. The objective of the project is to electrify 268 villages in the Trincomalee and Batticaloa Districts.  The project is expected to serve the increasing needs of the people in rural areas in the Province and will enhance the economic potential in the area by increasing productivity, creating new employment opportunities and improving the living standards of the community.  The above proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Annual Report and Statement of Accounts of the Palmyrah Development Board for the year 2009 in Parliament
decision_details: - this is the only state institution engaged in  the Palmyrah Industry and during the year under review 2,268,120 seeds have been planted in the Districts of Jaffna, Mannar, Vavuniya, Kilinochchi, Mullaithevu, Batticaloa, Trincomalee, Ampara, Puttlam, Hambantota and Moneragala with the view to increase Palmyrah vegetation in the country.  The Palmyrah Development Board is also involved in conducting vocational training programmes in Handicraft, Fibre production and Jaggery  production.  Handicraft Training Programme is for a period of six months and the other two for a period of three months each. The above Annual Report  submitted by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development, was approved for presentation in Parliament.

title: Secondary Towns and Rural Community Based Water Supply & Sanitation Project - Sri Lanka - ADB Loan No. 2757 SRI /2758 SRI (SF) - Muttur Water Supply Project -Contract for the Construction and Completion of Head Works, Raw Water Transmission Main and Treatment Plant (Plant and Design-build)
decision_details: -  the proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage  to award the above contract on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee for a sum of US$ 4,214,369.03 plus Sri Lanka Rs.1,213,378,199.31, to be implemented from 2011 to 2014, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation and Improvement of the Section of Road from Narammala to Giriulla (16.03 km) on the Narammala - Dankotuwa Road (B308)
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted to rehabilitate 662.04 km. of roads with concrete surfacing through domestic contractors by obtaining the required funds amounting to around US$500 million from local Banks.  The Section of Road from Narammala to Giriulla, which is 16.03 km. in length is one of the roads included in the above project.   The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to implement the project with funds to be provided  by the Peoples' Bank as a loan, was approved the the Cabinet.

title: National Sports Policy of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Mahindananda Aluthgamage, Minister of Sports for a National Sports Policy of Sri Lanka, for the creation of a healthy younger generation to ensure national unity, peace and development  through proper development of sports in Sri Lanka and proper scientific and technical training for the younger generation and for the formulation of National Sports Policy in association with the relevant Line Ministries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Relocation of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs)
decision_details: - in keeping with the government policy to ensure a dignified resettlement to all IDPs, the Ministry of Resettlement has already resettled almost 97% of the IDPs who were displaced soon after the humanitarian operation, in their native villages by October 2011. The proposal made by  Hon. Gunaratne Weerakoon, Minister of Resettlement, for the relocation of 1687 families in the Mullaitivu District, 1272 families in Muttur in the Trincomalee District and 166 families in the Mannar District, with the assistance of the Security Forces in the North and East, was approved in principle by the Cabinet.

title: Cabinet Memorandum for Agreement on Establishment of the SAARC Seed Bank in Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- the objectives of setting up of the Seed Bank, as agreed upon by SAARC countries, are -

*	to provide regional support to National Seed Security efforts; address regional seed shortages through collective actions and foster inter-country partnership;

*	to promote increase of Seed Replacement Rate with appropriate varieties at a faster rate as far as possible so that the use of quality seeds for crop production can be ensured; and,

		*	to act as a Regional Seed Security reserve for the Member States. 

	The proposal made Hon. Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena, Minister of Agriculture, to sign the above Agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparation of a National Policy Framework and Action Plan on Consumer Welfare
decision_details: - it has been observed that the country needs a more comprehensive and coordinated effort to have a National Policy Framework and Action Plan on Consumer Welfare in which all government Ministries will work under one umbrella to facilitate and coordinate the process of building a developed society where consumer welfare is part and parcel of the society. The proposal made by Hon. S.B. Navinna, Minister (Senior) for Consumer Welfare,  to conduct discussions with stakeholders etc. and to prepare  a National Policy and Programme for the purpose, in association with the Ministry of Co-operatives and Internal Trade, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation of Bitumen by the Road Development Authority for the Implementation of Road Construction and Maintenance Works
decision_details: - road works that are being handled by the Road Development Authority has increased by many folds over the recent years and the government has observed that the present demand for bitumen is very high. At present the entire requirement of bitumen for road construction and maintenance works is supplied by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation which appears to be inadequate to meet the increased demand. This has caused delays in the implementation of Road Development Works. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways,  for the Road Development Authority to import bitumen on the recommendation of the Ministry of Petroleum Industries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Annual Report and Accounts of the Sri Lanka Social Security Board for the year 2010
decision_details: - By the end of the year 2010 the number enrolled for Pension and Social Security Benefit Scheme stood at 400,047. Those in self employment, employees of the private sector, business enterprises, foreign employment and Ayurvedic Medical Practitioners and Physicians and Arts and Craftsmen could enter this scheme. Membership  could be obtained through Grama Niladhari officers, Samurdhi Development Officers, Divisional Secretariats, District Secretariats and the Sri Lanka Social Security Board Head office. Members are entitled to a monthly pension, partial and complete incapacitation benefits as well as death donations. Those between the age of 18-59 are entitled to obtain membership of these pension schemes. The above Annual Report presented by H.E. the President, in his capacity as Minister of Finance and Planning, was approved for presentation in Parliament.

title: Annual Report of the Sri Lanka Foundation for the year 2009 to Parliament
decision_details: - during the year under review, the Sri Lanka Foundation Institute has concentrated mainly on capacity building of public sector organizations, community leaders, law enforcement officers and other public and cooperate sector employees. During 2009 the institute has conducted 123 programmes earning a sum of  Rs.7,345,457.25 as income from fee-levying courses and externally funded education training programme.  Under the Language Training Programme, it has  conducted a certificate course in spoken Tamil, for the participants to gain ability to speak in simple Tamil, to develop day to day communication skills in Tamil etc. and a certificate course in Spoken English.  The above Annual Report presented by H.E. the President, was approved for presentation in Parliament.

title: Construction of a Building for the Rubber Research Institute of Sri Lanka, Agalawatta
decision_details: - Rubber growers and related personnel in the rubber industries as well as students of Universities, Technical Institutions and schools visit this institute located at Agalawatte regularly to acquire research and technical know-how pertaining to rubber cultivation and manufacturing of rubber finished products. Due to inadequate accommodation facilities available at the present building of this institute, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, Minister of Plantation Industries, to construct a new building at Agalawatta at a total cost of Rs.34 million with funds to be provided in 2011 and 2012, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a new Bridge Replacing the Existing Bridge No.6/2 near Polduwa Junction on Kollupitiya - Sri Jayawardenepura Road
decision_details: - on a proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Ports and Highways, to invite Bids and to appoint a Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC) and a Technical Evaluation Committee (TEC) for the construction of a new bridge replacing the existing bridge, to provide adequate vertical clearance under the bridge for navigation purposes, which would help promote tourism etc., was approved by the Cabinet.  The estimated cost of the proposed bridge is about Rs.800 million and the project is to be implemented over a period of two years, with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2013-2015.

title: "Deyata Kirula" Programme -  2012  - Archaeological Conservation Work
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Jagath Balasuriya, Minister of National Heritage, to commence archaeological conservation work at a number of places in the Anuradhapura District, including Mihintale and Thanthirimale, in parallel with the "Deyata Kirula" National Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Madola Water Extension of Avissawella Water Supply Scheme Approval for the Cost Estimate
decision_details: -  the objective of this project is to provide safe drinking water to the people in Madola Grama Niladhari Division in the Kegalle District about 5 km. away from Avissawella Town. The expected population to be served in the area is around 4500.  The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of  Water Supply and Drainage, to implement this project with funds to be provided under the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2013 - 2015 at an estimated cost of Rs.80.86 million, was approved by the Cabinet. A sum of Rs.33 billion is to be provided for Capital Expenditure of Water Supply and Drainage Projects under the Budget estimates for 2012.

title: Community Water Supply & Sanitation Project (CWSSP)
decision_details: - these projects are implemented in stages with community participation.  In addition to sharing a part of the cost of these projects, the communities carry out physical construction of facilities through Community Based Organizations formed within the community under the direction and support of the Ministry of Water Supply and Drainage.   There are about 3500 Community Based Organizations covering approximately 600,000 families formed under this Scheme.  Most of the sub projects under this scheme have been successfully completed and the completed facilities are to be handed over to the respective  Community Based Organizations, for them to manage, maintain and sustain those. The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of  Water Supply and Drainage to create a Water Supply and Sanitation Trust for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing Uniform Material to School Children - 2012 Decisions of the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education to import  school uniform materials, through State Trading Corporation spending Rs.1,054,222,500.00 to ensure timely delivery of school uniform material for the year 2012, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: H.E. the President?s visit to Perth, Australia for the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) 2011 - Report to the Cabinet of Ministers by the Minister of External Affairs
decision_details: - the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) was held in Perth, Australia from 28 - 30 October 2011. During the meeting, Sri Lanka led by H.E. the President was able to secure its position as the CHOGM venue for the year of 2013, amidst the campaigns against it. During the final executive session of the meeting , H.E. the President invited the Heads of State and their delegations for CHOGM 2013 to Sri Lanka, which was followed by visual presentation of the conference facilities and the variety of facets of the country. H.E. the President also participated in the Business Forum and delivered the keynote address at the session on "Indian Ocean and the Pacific Rim: Fast Growing Markets", in which he highlighted the economic growth prospects in Sri Lanka. Having 'pull-aside' meetings with the counterparts of Australia, Singapore, Mauritius, Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Uganda, Zambia, Kenya, Nigeria , Malaysia and Ghana, H.E. the President was able to effectively exchange views regarding Sri Lanka's progress on post conflict reconstruction,  rehabilitation, reconciliation and economic development. Meanwhile, Hon. G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs has briefed the international media about the success achieved in post conflict developments in Sri Lanka. Cabinet of Ministers noted the details enumerated in the Note and congratulated H.E. the President, Hon. Minister of External Affairs and the other Members of the delegation on the achievements made in improving international relations.

title: Report on Sri Lanka?s Participation at the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) 18th Session - 12th to 30th September 2011
decision_details: - The 18th Session of the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) was held from 12th to 30th September 2011 in Geneva. Cabinet noted that the Sri Lankan delegation led by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, Minister of Plantation Industries has been successful in precluding an  attempt by certain western countries to prejudge the national reconciliation process pursuant to the hearings and forthcoming conclusions of the Lessons Learnt and Reconciliation Commission (LLRC), at the next UN Human Rights Council (HRC) in March 2012. Cabinet further noted that the delegation has enlightened the representatives of Council Member States of the progress made in postwar reconstruction and initiatives to bring about reconciliations in the country.   Cabinet also noted that the position of Sri Lanka had been strengthened by the interactions of H.E. the President at the UN General Assembly in New York with several Heads of States and Government at which the current situation in the country was extensively discussed.

title: National Institute of Business Management - Annual Report - 2009
decision_details: - the National Institute of Business Management is presently functioning under the purview of the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Skills Development as a statutory institution. It offers degrees approved by the University Grants Commission. In 2009, it followed methodologies such as opening on weekends and Government holidays in order to cater to the needs of the present labour market. In the same year, the productivity and management development sector earned Rs.132 million whereas it was Rs.96 million in the previous year. Besides the expansion of library facilities, the NIBM administration also took steps to establish two new Centres in Kurunegala and Kandy as Regional Centres.  The proposal made by Hon. Dallas Alahapperuma, Minister of Youth Affairs and Skills Development to present the Annual Report of the National Institute of Business Management for the year 2009 in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Annual Report and Accounts of the Sri Lanka Insurance Board  - 2010
decision_details: - the total fund of the share holders of the Insurance Companies as at 31st December 2010 was Rs.42,326.9 million. It was a growth of 45.6% compared to the previous year. Also the total assets of all the Insurance Companies by the end of 2010 was Rs.222,242 million. It shows a growth of 22.7% compared to Rs.181,044 in the previous year. The Sri Lanka Insurance Board has also been able to acquire an accumulated premium income of Rs.68,493 million from Insurance activities within the year 2010.   The proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning to present the Annual Report and Accounts of Sri Lanka Insurance Board for the year 2010 in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Annual Report and Accounts of the Development Lotteries Board - 2010
decision_details: -  during the year under review the Development Lotteries Board has earned an income of Rs.5.67 billion.  Compared to its income in 2009 which stood at Rs.5.22 billion, this is a growth of 8.62%.  Also, Rs.3406 million has been given out as awards and a surplus income of Rs.937.9 million has been earned in the year 2010. It shows a growth of 70% compared to Rs.551.7 million earned as a surplus income in the year 2009. In addition, the Development Lotteries Board has also paid Rs.799.5 million to the President's Fund in 2010.  The proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning to present the Annual Report and Accounts of the Development Lotteries Board for the year 2010 in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Hambantota Heritage Museum
decision_details: - the establishment of heritage museum at Hambantota is based on the concept of preserving and maintaining the unique cultural and historical heritage of Ruhuna carried forward over a long period of time by the people of Southern Province. By the proposed museum, it is envisaged to present Ruhunu cultural heritage to the local and foreign travelers visiting the south via new Hambantota port and the proposed International Airport. The museum will also be a tourist  destination while providing a highly valuable educational opportunity to the local students.  The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Jagath Balasuriya, Minister of National Heritage, to establish the above museum in the old Kachcheri building complex at Hambantota, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tender for the Supply of Rabies Vaccine BP/USP (Human Use) (1ml /0.5ml) 356,000 vials MSD/P/12/2012 - DHS/C/P/278/ 2012 - SR  No. 060026
decision_details: - this vaccine is recommended by Doctors as an essential life saving item against dog bites. The proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to award the tender for the purchase of 356,000 vials of this vaccine to a company in Germany at a  total cost of Rs.198,802,204.96 (US$ 1,815,600.00) as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Relocation of the Ministry of External Affairs
decision_details: - due to the expansion of the functions and responsibilities of the Ministry of External Affairs, the number of operational divisions and staff has increased fourfold over the past two decades. The Consular Affairs Division alone caters to over 1000 members of the public on daily basis. Despite the rented additional space, the Ministry continues to lack adequate space and facilities for the members of the staff, to carry out their functions effectively.  The Republic Building where the Ministry of External Affairs is located requires extensive repairs and maintenance which would not be cost effective in the long run.  Thus, the proposal made by Hon. G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, to relocate the Ministry of External Affairs at Battaramulla and to proceed with the formalities for the new building complex for the Ministry of External Affairs, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project of Relocation and Development of Institute of Technology, University of Moratuwa at Diyagama, Homagama
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has already been granted  for the purchase of a land for the relocation and development of the Institute of Technology,  University of Moratuwa. This project has been identified as an important priority project and financing for the project will be provided as a suppliers credit of Exim Bank of China.  Approval was granted to the proposal made by Hon. S.B. Dissanayake, Minister of Higher Education, on the basis of the recommendations of the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee to enter into a commercial contract amounting to US $89.55 million with China National Aero Technology Import and Export Corporation (CATIC) for the implementation of the project.

title: Augmentation of Baddegama Water Supply Scheme - Approval of Total Cost Estimate (TCE)
decision_details: -  the present water supply scheme at Baddegama is inadequate to meet the current demand  for water in the area and therefore Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage proposes to implement the aforesaid project as an extension to Baddegama Group Water Supply Scheme. In order to implement the proposal an allocation of Rs.440.46 million within the Medium Term Budgetary Framework for 2013-2015, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Gonapinuwala Water Supply Scheme - Approval of Total Cost Estimate (TCE)
decision_details: - with the implementation of Gonapinuwala Water Supply Scheme, it is expected to distribute drinking water to the people in Gonapinuwala town and its suburbs and considerably enhance the living standards of residents in the area. The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to implement the above project with an allocation of Rs.349 million within the Medium Term Budgetary Framework of 2013-2015 , was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amalgamation of State Pharmaceutical Corporation and State Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Corporation
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Maithripala Sirisena, Minister of Health, to amalgamate the above two Corporations with the view to provide better services to the public and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening District Administration to suit the necessity of the Government Development Programmes
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. W.D.J. Seneviratne, Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs, to present the Transfer of Powers (Special Provisions) Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman, in Parliament, was discussed by the Cabinet.  This Bill has been prepared to strengthen the District Administration to suit the requirements of the Government's Development Programmes.  The provisions of this Bill will strengthen the hands of the District Secretaries in their role of giving guidance to Divisional Secretaries and supervising their activities.

title: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations with the Republic of Mali
decision_details: - Mali is located in the interior of Western Africa, South West of Algeria.  The country is highly dependent on gold mining and agricultural exports for revenue.  The proposal made by Hon. (Prof.) G.L. Peiris, Minister of External Affairs, for the establishment of Diplomatic Relations with the Republic of Mali, was approved by the Cabinet.  It was observed that out of 54 African Countries, Sri Lanka has diplomatic relations only with 32 States.

title: Development of the Pharmaceutical Industry
decision_details: - the annual consumption of Pharmaceutical Products by the Government is around Rs.15 billion and it represents well over 35% of the domestic consumption.  The Government intends to introduce a system to procure government pharmaceutical requirements from local manufacturers by the Ministry of Health to promote the local pharmaceutical industry.  Steps have been taken by the Ministry of Industry and Commerce to provide laboratory facilities in collaboration with the University of Colombo to facilitate testing of products and also to assist the industry to obtain required short term technical training overseas.  On a proposal made Hon. Rishad Bathiudeen, Minister of Industry and Commerce, a Dedicated Industrial Zone for life sciences is to be established to promote local production.  At the moment over 10 reputed pharmaceutical manufacturers have expressed their willingness to invest in this industry.  The above proposal made by the Minister, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement Process for Supply and Installation of Hydro Meteorological Information System - Dam Safety and Water Resources Planning Project
decision_details:
- Dam  Safety and Water Resources Planning Project is implemented with the objective of establishing long term sustainable arrangements for operation and maintenance of large dams and improving water resources planning, which is funded by the World Bank. The project  includes the following main components:  

*	Improvement of dam safety and operational efficiency; under this component, 32 major dams will be rehabilitated and basic safety facilities will be provided to a further 48 major dams;
	
*	Modernization and improvement of hydro-meteorological information system; and,

*	Multi-sector water resources planning which will produce a Master Plan and detailed river basin Management plans for Mahaweli and Mundeni Aru river basins.

	The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management to follow the Two Stage Bidding Procurement Process to select a suitable contractor for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.
